Name: Abul Hussain
Description: He was killed in an encounter with RAB and Police.

Name: Touhidul Islam
Description: He was killed in a shootout with Police.

Name: Nowab Ali
Description: Police claimed that he jumped into the river in fear of police and his deadbody was recovered after 2 days but his family claimed that he was tortured to death and dropped in the river.

Name: Abdul Kadir alias Bara Miah alias Shaheen
Description: He was surrounded by RAB10 and later killed in crossfire. In the incident his wife Shahanara (25), Farid (22), Yamin (2), Nurjahan (50) and an officer of RAB was injured.

Name: Alfaz Ali Sarkar
Description: It was alleged that he was killed in a gunfight while robbing a rice truck. 2 more cohorts and one ASI Sadequl Islam was also injured in the incident.

Name: Alauddin alias Kalu
Description: He was killed in a crossfire between Police and 'Alauddin Bahini'.

Name: Julhash alias Kana Julhash
Description: He was killed in a gunfight with RAB-2.

Name: Habibur Rahman
Description: He was severely beaten in the police custody and sent to the court. When he fell ill in the court custody, he was taken to the hospital where the doctor declared him dead.

Name: Shagor
Description: He was tortured severely under custody of Bhoirob Railway Station by OC Shohidullah from .

Name: Monjur Alom
Description: He came to the forest to visit his brother's garden and the forest guard shot him dead suspecting that he was a timber thief.

Name: Samsul Ali alias Robin
Description: It is alleged that DB police found him taking extortion money.  Then they locked into a gunfight. He was killed in  a crossfire.

Name: Mobarok Hossain
Identity: BDR Lance Nayek of 14 Rifles Battalion
Description: He was working in  Cox' Bazar 14 Battalion.He came to Dhaka to join BDR week.  After BDR mutiny he fled away from BDR HQ and on 1st March he came for reporting. He was brought to RAB custody for interrogation. His family claimed  he was tortured in RAB  custody which caused his death.In the inquest report it was said that Mobarak's  hands and body were bruised.

Name: Nasir Ahmed Sumon alias Koshai Nasir
Description: He was arrested on 09.04.09 afternoon. At night of the same day, he was taken to a place to recover firearms and  he died in encounter.

Name: Dulal Sarder
Description: His family claimed police forcibly taken him  from a hospital , tortured and before sending him to jail , he died. His family claimed he died due to police torture.

Name: Md. Siddiqque Mondol alias Biplob
Identity: Regional Leader of Purbo  Banglar Communist Party (Janojuddho)
Description: Police and RAB jointly involved in the operation to hold Biplob and his acomplice as they were alleged to abduct a business man. According to  the law enforcemnet agencysensing the presence of the law enforcement agencies Biplob and his cohorts opened fire forcing them to retaliate . After the gunfight , Biplob found dead.

Name: Chan alias Lal Chan
Description: Acting Officer in Charge of  Daulatpur police station said that he came to knoe some miscreants  were holding meeting.  RAB 12 and they jointly sorrounded the placeand sensing thepresence of RAB -police they fired on thm forcing RAB-police to retaliate. After the gunfight RAB-police found them dead.

Name: Kazi Saidur Rahman
Description: It is stated that he  was in Pilkhana BDR HQ and died. Marks of injuries found in different parts of his body.

Name: Totamia
Description: According to RAB  acting on a tip off RAB reached in the spot and by the sensing on the presence of  RAB the alleged robbers opened fire on them which triggerred a gunfight between the group and RAB.

Name: Hasanul Haq Hapu
Description: According to RAB 8 , he was killed in shootout.

Name: Mohiuddin
Description: He was allegedly tortured to death while in custody

Name: Saidur Rahman
Description: He was killed in 'crossfire'.

Name: Bashanta Chakma alias Agaman
Description: According to Army acting on a tip off, a team of Army Sadar Zone led by Maj Sheikh Jillur Rahman cordoned off the hideout at 4.00 a.m. Sensing the presenceof Army, UPDF men opened fire forcing them to retaliate, which caused them to death in gunfight

Name: Sohel
Description: According to RAB while they were checking vehicles, a microbus tried to pass violating checking , so they chased and from the microbus 'criminals' opened fire forcing them to retaliate. After 10/15 minutes gunfight both of them were killed. However,  local people said they were arrested before they were killed. In a press conference Babu's father  told that his son was killed due to previous enmity and coloured the killing as a name of 'crossfire'.

Name: Jalal Akand
Identity: Expelled Jubo League  (Youth wing of AL) Activist
Description: He was killed in 'crossfire'.

Name: Abdul Karim
Description: He was shot dead

Name: Manik alias chikna Manik
Description: He was killed in 'gunfight'.

Name: Mokhtar Hossain
Description: According to RAB, a patrol team found some people gathering on the spot. When the team approached them they started firing on them , forcing them to retaliate and after the gunfight Mokhtar  found dead. However his brother  Monir said  that RAB personnel picked him up on 17 May and since then he was missing.

Name: Zakir Hossain Bhuiyan
Description: BDR authority said he committed suicide, however his family claimed he was  tortured to death while under custody of BDR.

Name: Rafiqul Islam Azad alias Sumon
Identity: Alleged criminal of gangster group gangchil bahini
Description: Major Mohammad Sarwar of RAB 4 said they chased  him and his gang during the robbery at NR filling station and sensing the presence of RAB they opened fire prompting them to retaliate and after the gunfight they found sumon's  bullet riddled body. However the owner of NR filling station Ramesh Chandra Ghosh said  he heard gunshots in the area but no incidents of robbery or shooting took place at his refuelling station on that night.

Name: Taher alias Panku Liton
Description: He was killed in  encounter

Name: Mohsin Sheikh
Identity: fouth year student of electrical engineering department ofTejgaon Polytechnic Institute
Description: According to RAB they fired on RAB forcing them  to retaliate. After the  shootout they found them dead. However  those two students family claimed that they were not engaged in any criminal activity. Family claimed that they were killed.

Name: Mohammad Ali Jinnah
Identity: 3rd Year student of Mechanical Engineering Department of Tejgaon Polytechnic Institute

Name: Mongol Miah alias Mukul Sarkar
Description: According to RAB, he and his cohorts were preparing for robbery. When RAB challanged them, they started firing and he died in encounter.

Name: Akhter Hossain Kalu
Description: According to police, he was killed in a gunfight while he and his cohorts were in a meeting.

Name: Unnamed
Description: According to police, he was killed in a gunfight when he and his cohorts attcked a house.

Name: Hamid
Description: He was kicked and punched to death by ASI Harun Ur Rashid of DSB Police and two others. The locals grabbed him and handed him over to the OC of Dimla police Station. They tortured him for not giving bribe to them. ASI Harun was suspended.

Name: Mozammel Hossain
Description: He was an accused of a murder case. He was arrested on 06.06.09.and  on 16 June found hanged in  bathroom. His family claimed that he was tortured to death.

Name: Jagadish Chakma alias Tarun Chakma
Identity: Pahari Chatra Parisad (PCP), Student front of PCJSS
Description: He was shot dead in a gunfight with army.

Name: Al Amin
Description: He was shot and injured in a clash with ansar. He was declared dead when he reached hospital.

Name: Unidentified
Description: He was shot and injured in a clash with Police. He was declared dead when he reached hospital.

Name: Rana alias Amin
Description: He was killed in a gunfight with the police.

Name: Tapan
Description: He was killed in a encounter with the RAB.

Name: Abdus Salam alias Topu
Description: They were killed in a shootout with RAB-Police.

Name: Mozam Ali
Description: He was killed in a shootout with RAB-Police.

Name: Jahangir Alam
Identity: A regional leader of Purbo Banglar Communist Party (ML- Janajuddho)
Description: According to police, they were killed in a shootout while he and his cohorts were in a meeting.As police reached the place, Janajuddho men opened fire forcing them to retaliate. The shootout ended when the cadres stopped firing and fled the scene.

Name: Yarul Islam
Description: According to police, they were killed in a shootout while he and his cohorts were in a meeting.As police reached the place, Janajuddho men opened fire forcing them to retaliate. The shootout ended when the cadres stopped firing and fled the scene.

Name: Taiyab
Description: It is alleged that a  gang of muggers shot a housewife to snatch her money.On hearing the gunshots police also shootout on the muggers and killed one,

Name: Roman
Location: Faridabad under Shyam Bazaar Police Station
Description: He was killed in a gunfight with the police.

Name: Rafiqul Islam alias Kamal alias Panku Rafiq
Description: According to RAB source, a RAB team arrested Rafiq and, following his confessional statement, when the RAB team went to the Agargaon area to recover hidden arms, his armed associates fired at the RAB team, forcing them to retaliate. Rafiq was allegedly caught in the firing and died on the spot while trying to escape.

Name: Lutfar Rahman
Description: As claimed by the police, when a team of police raided the village Chhoygharia upon information that Lutfar and his associates were holding a secret meeting there, there was a gunfight between the police and the underground operatives and Lutfar was killed in the encounter.

Name: Naharul Islam
Identity: A regional leader of Purbo Banglar Communist Party (ML- Janajuddho)
Description: He was killed in an encounter with,police as claimed by the police.

Name: Lalchand
Description: He was reportedly killed  an encounter with a joint team of RAB and police

Name: Mohammad Masud Hasan
Description: According to RAB sources, when a team of RAB conducted a drive upon the information that a gang of criminals was preparing to commit a crime, the gang opened fire on the RAB members, leading to a shootout.

Name: Atiqul Islam
Identity: A leader of an outlawed organisation called 'Bahini'
Description: According to police, Atiqul was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot during a gunfight between RAB-police and members of the Bahini.

Name: Shahinur Rahman Dablu
Description: According to police, there was gunfight between a gang led by Shahinur and the police and he was killed during the shootout.

Name: Tabibur Rahman alias Tota
Description: As claimed by police, when a joint team of RAB and police raided a field where Tota and his cohorts were allegedly holding a secret meeting, Tota opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. According to police, Tota was killed during the shootout.

Name: Akhil
Description: According to police, when a joint team of RAB and police conducted an operation upon a tip off, a gang of miscreans opened fire at them, forcing them to retaliate. After the gunfight, the law enforcers found the dead bodies of Akhil and Nayon on the spot.

Name: Nayon
Description: According to police, when a joint team of RAB and police conducted an operation upon a tip off, a gang of miscreans opened fire at them, forcing them to retaliate. After the gunfight, the law enforcers found the dead bodies of Akhil and Nayon on the spot.

Name: Rahat Khan alias Nipu alias Zia
Description: He was allegedly injured during a gunfight betwee his cohorts and the police and after the gunfight ended the law enforcers took him to the hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Sumon Hossain
Description: According to police, a gunfight ensued between the PBCP-ML and the GMF and when a police team rushed to the spot, the outlaws opened fired at the law enforcers, triggering a gunfight with the police firing back. When the outlaws fled the scene, the police found the abandoned bodies of Sohel and Sumon, as the police claimed.

Name: Sohel
Description: According to police, a gunfight ensued between the PBCP-ML and the GMF and when a police team rushed to the spot, the outlaws opened fired at the law enforcers, triggering a gunfight with the police firing back. When the outlaws fled the scene, the police found the abandoned bodies of Sohel and Sumon, as the police claimed.

Name: Sanjit Kumar Biswas
Description: According to RAB, Sanjit was killed in a gunfight between the law enforcers and his gang.

Name: Baul Joardar alias Baul Member
Description: According to a statement of law enforcers, when a joint team of RAB and police approached a gathering at around 4.30 am, they faced a hail of bullets and when the law enforcers retaliated, Baul died while others managed to escape.

Name: Ahsan Kabir Hasan
Description: Ahsan kabir Hasan and Mizanur Rahman were reportedly arrested in Dhaka on Sept. 2 and was taken to Jessore. According to RAB, a battle took place when the law enforcers went to Jessore with the two brothers to recover firearms based on their confession. As soon as the RAB and Jessore police reached the spot, the cohorts of  the arrestees opened fire at the law enforcers forcing them to fire back. Aasan and Mizanur were caught in the line of fire when they tried to escape and died on the spot.

Name: Mizanur Rahman
Description: Ahsan kabir Hasan and Mizanur Rahman were reportedly arrested in Dhaka on Sept. 2 and was taken to Jessore. According to RAB, a battle took place when the law enforcers went to Jessore with the two brothers to recover firearms based on their confession. As soon as the RAB and Jessore police reached the spot, the cohorts of  the arrestees opened fire at the law enforcers forcing them to fire back. Aasan and Mizanur were caught in the line of fire when they tried to escape and died on the spot.

Name: Arifur Alam Akkas
Description: According to police, after the RAB arrested Akkas, a joint team or RAB and police took him to an abondoned hospital in a village to recover arms based on his confessional statement and when the law enforcers reached the village, the cohorts of Akkas opened fire at the law enforcers, triggering a gunfight. Akkas was caught in the line of fire while trying to escape during the 'shootout'.

Name: Murad Hossain alias Bhola
Description: According to police, when a team of police aided a place based on a tip off that a group of Gono Bahini men were holding a meeting there, the outlaws opened fire at the police, prompting a retaliation. After the shootout between the police and the outlaws ended, police found Murad's body lying on the ground.

Name: Hasan Ali alias Hasan Kosai
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight between the police and a group of Janajuddha men when police raided an area where the Janajuddha men were allegedly holding a meeting.

Name: Abdul Hannan alias Hanu
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight between the police and a group of Gono Bahini men when police raided a brickfield where the Gono Bahini men were allegedly holding a meeting.

Name: Tofazzal Hossain alias Topu Khan
Description: He was killed in a gunfight between a gang of robbers and the RAB.

Name: Ashraful Islam alias Asha
Description: He was allegedly killed in crossfire during a gunfight between RAB and miscreants.

Name: Anowar Hossen Anu
Description: According to RAB, when a team of RAB went to recover arms with Anu in their custody following a confessional statement made by him, miscreants opened fire on the RAB members, forcing RAB to retaliate. Anu's body was found at the place of the incident after the gunfight ended, as claimed by the RAB.

Name: Kaiser MahmudBappi
Description: It is reported that  RAB killed him as  'criminal' Kamrul Islam Bappi. Later it was revealed that he was not  Kamrul Islam Bappi whom RAB looked for. He was Kaiser Mahmud Bappi whom RAB killed and cooked a story of 'gunfight'.
Follow-up: RAB is probing crossfire killing of Bappi
Sources: Daily Star 11.09.09, Prothom Alo, 20.10.09, New Age, 22.10.09

Name: Sohel Hasan alias Tukun
Description: When a joint team of RAB and police raided a bazaar, the outlaws allegedly opend fire on them, triggering a gunfight. Tuku was reportedly found dead after his accomplices managed to escape.

Name: Nasim
Description: According to RAB, Nasim was arrested on Sept 10 and when a team of RAB members, upon his confessional statement, went to recover arms, his cohorts opended fire on the RAB members, forcing them to retaliate. Nasim was killed in the gunfight, as claimed by RAB.

Name: Ziko Parvez Samrat
Identity: Gonomukti Fouz (Military front of the Sromjibi Mukti Andolon)
Description: As claimed by police, he was killed in a gunfight that ensued when a joint team of RAB and police conducted an operation upon information that Gonomukti Fouz operatives were organising a secret meeting.

Name: Shahar Ali alias Ali
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight between RAB and miscreants.

Name: Farouque Khan
Description: According to police, Farouque was killed in a shootout between police and Farouque and his cohorts, which ensued when a team of police conducted an operation upon the information that Farouque and his accomplices were preparing to commit a robbery.

Name: Marfat Hossain
Description: According to police, a gunfight ensued when a team of police raided a meeting of Gono Bahini cadres led by Marfat. Marfat's body was reportedly found after his accomplices escaped at one point of the gunfight.

Name: Biplob
Description: He was killed in a gunfight that ensued when a team of police raided a place upon information that Gono Mukti Fouz operatives were holding a meeting there. Biplob's body was found at the place of the incident after the gunfight ended.

Name: Abu Bakkar Roni alias Lal Roni
Description: Roni was allegedly killed in a gunfight between criminals and a RAB team when the RAB team conducted a drive to arrest the criminals.

Name: Samir Uddin
Description: According to police, a gunfight ensued when a group of miscreatns opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate. Samir's body was reportedly found dead on the spot after the incident.

Name: Babul Sarder
Description: According to police, a joint team of RAB and police came under an attack from miscreants led by Babul Sarder when the law enforcers were on their way a place to conduct a drive. A gunfight ensued as they retaliated in self-defence and Babul was killed during the incident.

Name: Masubar Halder
Description: He was allegedly killed in a shootout between miscreants and police as police raided a place upon the information that New Biplobi Communist Party men were holding a meeting there.

Name: Mohammad Ali
Description: RAB claimed that when a team of RAB 4 conducted a drive upon the information that a group of miscreants were holding a meeting at a stadium, the miscreants opened fire on the law enforcers, triggering a gunfight that killed Mohammad Ali.

Name: Arabinda Mandol
Description: He was allegedly beaten to death though police claimed that he died of cardiac arrest while fleeing his home to escape arrest.

Name: Shukur Ali
Description: According to police, a team of police raided a place, based on a tip off that a group of Janajuddho men were holding a meeting. When the miscreants sensed the presence of the police, they allegedly opened fire on the police, prompting a retaliation. Shukur was allegedly killed during the gunfight.

Name: Amzad Hossain
Identity: Habilder of 19 Rifles Battallion of Comilla
Description: BDR Authority claimed he died on brain hemmorrage, however a relative of Amzad hossain said that he was interrogated after BDR mutiny and tortured severely which might caused his death.

Name: Rashedul Islam
Description: According to police, when members of RAB and police conducted an operation in a field on information that Rashedul and his associates were holding a secret meeting there, Rashedul and his associates opened fire on the police, forcing police and RAB to retaliate. Rashedul's body was allegedly found on the spot after the gunfight ended.

Name: Aslam Byapari
Identity: An under-trial prisoner at Faridpur Jail
Description: According to Aslam's mother, he was tortured to death in jail while the jail authority claimed that he was moved to hospital when he felt heart problems and died there.

Name: Abul Kalam Azad alias Rana
Description: Kalam's wife alleged that he was beaten to death in RAB custody while RAB stated that he fell ill after being arrested  and was moved to a hospital from where he was shifted to another hospital when his condition worsened and was declared dead by the doctor.

Name: Idu Mia
Description: According to police, a team of Mirpur Police Station, conducted a drive on information that Idu and his cohorts were organising a secret meeting in a field and when they reached to the place, miscreants opened fire on the law enforcers, triggering a gunfight. When the 'shootout' ended police found Idu's bullet-hit body on the spot.

Name: Aroj Ali
Description: Police stated that a team of Kushtia Sadar Police Station, conducted a drive on information that Aroj Ali and his associates were holding a secret meeting in a field and when they reached the place, miscreants opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. When the 'shootout' ended police found Aroj's bullet-hit body on the spot.

Name: Obaidullah
Description: He was arrested  as an accused in a case filed in connection with the death of a CID constable who was injured in a land-related clash and later died in hospital. Obaidullah's family alleged that he was tortured in custody which caused his death.

Name: Johny alias Pathan Johny
Description: As claimed by police, he was hit with bullet in a shootout with police and when the police took him to hospital, he was declared dead.

Name: Mahan Malitha
Identity: Purbo Banglar Communist Party (ML- Lal Pataka)
Description: According to RAB, based on a tip off, when a team of RAB conducted a drive, 'extremists' opened fire on them, forcing RAB to retaliate. After the gunfight ended, RAB found the bullet-hit body of Mahan Malitha on the spot.

Name: Fassiar Rahman alias Shanu
Description: Police stated that a team of police from the Mongla Police Station conducted a drive on information that Shanu and his accomplices were preparing for a robbery. When police reached there, the miscreats allegedly opened fire on the police, triggering a retaliation. When the miscreants retreated, the law enforcers found Shanu with bullet injuries and moved him to hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Tamidul alias Zahid
Identity: Purbo Banglar Communist Party (ML - Lal Pataka)
Description: Police stated that when a team of Damurhuda Police, raided a garden upon a tip off that a gang of 'extremists' were holding a meeting, the alleged extremists opened fire on the police, forcing them to fire back. Zahid was allegedly shot dead on the spot.

Name: Asha Ghosh
Description: According to RAB, when a team of RAB, upon a tip off, raided a roadside garment where some criminals were holding a meeting, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting to retaliate. Asha died on the spot during the gunfight while his cohorts managed to flee.

Name: Sheikh Reazul Haq Masud alias Biri Masud
Identity: second in command of Purbo Banglar Communist Party (Janajuddho)
Description: According to Police Super of Bagerhaat Miizanur Rahman said they  came to know that  alleged 'criminals' were holding a meeting . Sensing the presence of RAB - police  the alleged criminals fired on  them forcing them to retaliate . After gunfight Masud found dead.

Name: Abdur Rashid Mollah alias Mollah Rashid
Identity: Regional Leader of Purbo Banglar Communist Party (People's War)
Description: According to Police a team of police raided Bujukgargai brick field where Rashid and his accomplices were holding a meeting. Sensing the presence of police they opened fire on  police  which let them to retaliate. At one stage  Rashid Monnah was gunned down.

Name: Abu Sayeed Sarker alias Ranga Sayeed
Description: According to Police a team of police raided Ambhita Play ground where Abu Sayeed and his accomplices were holding a meeting. Sensing the presence of police they opened fire on  police  which let them to retaliate. At one stage Abu Sayeed was hit by bullet and in the health complex doctors declared him dead.

Name: Jane Alam Janu alias Sohel
Description: According to police he was arrested and  was interrogated in Sutrapur police station. After the interrogation he was taken to Dholaikhal to nab his accomplice. As soon as they reached the place the gangster opened fire on them forcing them to retaliate. As one stage Sohel was caught in line of fire and died on the spot.

Name: Mohammad Saijuddin Saju
Description: As per RAB the team raided a field near Namapara slum to catch  'criminals' who were gathering there. Sensing the presence of RAB the' criminals' opened fire on them forcing them to retaliate which caused Saju to death.  However, family of Saju said that RAB arrested Saju on october 1 and demanded Taka 10 lakh for  his release.

Name: Pichi Abul alias Babul
Description: According to RAB,  criminals opened fire to them sensing their presence which retaliated RAB to open fire.Abul sustained bullet injuries and died

Name: Mohammad Labhlu Bepari
Identity: Purbo Banglar Communist party ( People's War)
Description: According to RAB Labhlu was killed in  gunfight

Name: Korban Ali
Description: He was killed  by police during gunfight

Name: Hedayat Ullah alias Julhas
Description: It is stated that Julhas was killed in a gunfight  between his associates and Rapid Action Battallion

Name: Sunnat Ali
Description: He was killed  in police encounter

Name: Moktar Hossain
Description: He was killed in RAB encounter

Name: Sakmol
Description: According to law enforcement agency  law enforcers  sorrounded the area & told the cadres to surrender. The cadres opened fire at the lawmen forcing them to retaliate. At one stage the outlawed fled and Sakmol was found dead.

Name: Delwar Hossain Delu alias Apu
Description: According to police as soon as police reached the spot the gang opened fire to them forcing them to retaliate. After gun fight Apu found dead.

Name: Aslam Khan
Description: He was killed in police shootout

Name: Amirul Islam Khan
Description: According to police he was killed in a  'shootout' between Amirul and Police.

Name: Nirapada Boiragi
Description: He was killed in 'shootout' between his associate & police
Actions Taken: He was cremated with state honour as he was a freedom fighter.

Name: Maznu Mandol alias Abdullah
Description: He was killed in 'shootout' between his associate & police

Name: Lilu Mia
Description: After arrest he  was interrogated in jail gate on 10 October and at the same day he died. His family claimed  he died  due to torture as marks of clotted blood found on his body.

Name: Azbahar Hossain
Description: He was killed in 'shootout' between his associate & police. He was accused in the murder case of AL leader Jamil Hasan Bacchu

Name: Farid
Description: He was killed in 'shootout' between his associate & RAB- Police

Name: Jinnah Chowdhury alias Ratul
Description: He was killed in 'gunfight' between his accomplices and  RAB

Name: Kala Badsha
Description: He was injured in 'gunfight' between his accomplice and police and  later  died in a hospital .

Name: Babul Mia
Description: Police said he died due to take excessive amount of alcohol. However, his wife claimed that he was tortured to death

Name: Jamal Uddin
Identity: Regional Leader of Purbo Banglar Communist Party (JanoJuddho)
Description: It is stated that JamalUddin  was killed in a gunfight  between Police and his associates.

Name: Tofazzal Hossain Shikder
Description: Family members claimed that RAB has arrested Tofazzzal and he was killed in 'crossfire"

Name: Titu alias Hridoy
Description: It is reported that he was killed in gunfight.

Name: Altaf Hossain
Description: It is alleged that they were killed during 'shootout' between their accomplice and police

Name: Nuruzzaman
Description: It was reported that he was arrested by sub inspector of Pirgaccha police station Mr. Nazrul and tortured brutally  and brought into the police station.He died with in 1/2 an hour after bringing to the police station.

Name: Saidul alias Saidul Sarder
Description: Saidul's family claimed that he was arrested and beaten severely by RAB and RAB broke his legs and took him to an unknown place and gunned down him. However, police said he was injured in crossfire with RAB and brought in the hospital where he died.

Name: Amir Ali
Description: RAB stated that he was a top leader of gangster group 'Taj Bahini'. and died in gunfight with RAB. However, his family members claimed that he was never involved with any criminal activity , rather he was a shopkeeper.

Name: Mojibor Rahman Babu
Description: He was killed in  shootout.

Name: Zakir
Description: He was beaten to death by coast guard

Name: Sarajit Ghosh
Description: He was killed in  shootout.

Name: Kamruzzaman Oli
Description: Police claimed that he was a leader of Purbo Banglar Communist party and was killed in crossfire.

Name: Ilias Hossain Mamun
Description: Police stated that he was killed in a 'shootout' between police and his cohorts.His family arranged a press conference on 15 November and said he was not involved with any criminal activities. Police took him, confined him for 11 days and demanded money, As family could not pay the money to police he was killed

Name: Lutfor Khalashi
Description: According to RAB  patrol team of RAB 8 suddenly came under gun attack by a gang of extremists when they were patrolling the area. At one stage Lutfor and Khairul were caught in the line of gunshots and died on the spot.Bablu Khalashi, son of Lutfor earlier hold a press conference on 14 November stated that Lutfor and Khairul were arrested and might be killed in 'crossfire' as his father Lutfor contested a union parishad election.

Name: Mohammad Hasan alias Boma Hasan
Identity: Purbo Banglar Communist Party (ML- People's War)
Description: He was killed in 'crossfire'

Name: Hazrat Ali alias Daku Hazrat
Identity: A leader of inter district dacoit gang
Description: It is reported that a patrol team of police cordoned off Salabahara bus stand where a gang of robbers were preparing to commit a robbery by felling trees on Dhaka Khulna highway. Sensing the presence of police the dacoits opened fire on police prompting them to fire  back that  left Hazrat dead on the spot.

Name: Tajmul alias Taju
Identity: Regional Leader of New Biplobi Communist Party
Description: It is reported that police cordoned off an area near to Mir Mosharraf Hossain bridge over Gorai river where some NBCP  men were preparing to holding a meeting led  by Taju.  Sensing the presence of police  they opened fire on police prompting them to retaliate. After the gun fight Taju found dead.

Name: Chand Ali alias Boma Chand
Description: He was killed in crossfire

Name: Jamal alias Robi alias Nuruzaaman Shumon
Identity: General Secretary of Purbo Banglar Communist Party  PBCP-ML)

Identity: Purbo Banglar Communist Party ( PBCP-Red Flag)

Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire and blasted a bomb forcing them to retaliate. After the gunfight  Monwar found critically injured and was rushed to the Chuadanga hospital where the attending physician declared him dead.

Identity: A leader of Purbo Banglar communist Party (Janojuddho)

Description: SI Liakat said Delwar and his gang open fire on a police patrol prompting them to retaliate. After the gunfight police found Liakat dead.

Description: He was arrested in connection with the extortion case. Family claimed he was  not produced before the court with in 24 hours of his arrest and family claimed he was killed in police beating.

Name: Osman Gani
Description: According to RAB-7 a joint team of RAB and police conducted a drive to capture Osman.  Sazzad Hossain in RAB 7 said the gang fired into them when they reached the area and they fired back. He said Osman was injured after being caught in the firing and he was pronounced dead when he was taken to the Upazila health complex.

Name: Mohiuddin Arif
Description: An  employee of Apollo Hospital who was detained in prison for suspected link of two roberries was allegedly tortured to death  by RAB. However, RAB denied the allegation of torturing Mohiuddin Arif. Executive Magistrate in the investigative report said that marks of torture found on different parts of his body. He was arrested from his Pallabi residence and were  in the central jail and brought to the DMCH where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Manik Mia alias Lutfor
Description: He was allegedly tortured to death in custody.  But police said he committed suicide.
Actions Taken: A murder case was filed against the incumbant officer in charge Md. Asaduzzaman, Sub Inspector Zahidur Rahman and Assistant Sub Inspector Harun- Ur Rashid

Name: Habibar alias Habi Kabiraj
Identity: Alleged Criminal of local gang Panna Bahini
Description: He was killed in 'crossfire'

Name: Shaheen
Identity: Leader of Jamaat Student Wing , Shibir
Description: Police came to know that  Shaheen, accused of the killing of Faruk Hossain of AL student wing  was hiding in the house of Jamaat leader Toufizul Islam Tanu.  Police besiezed the house and from the house they  opened fire towards police  which let them to retaliate. After the gunfight police found Shaheen dead.
Follow-up: Local Jaamat leader  Mofizul Islam filed a case with Judicial Magistrat's Court against a superintendent of police and 12 other police men of Shibgonhj police station for killing of Shaheen. ( Source: The Daily Star, 16.3.10)

Name: #REF!
Location: Muktijoddha Cooperative Market of Mirpur-13, Dhaka
Description: According to an official of RAB 4 it is  stated that a patrol team  of RAB found a gang of 7/8 were quarrling inside the Muktijoddha Market around 3.00 am. When they tried to  get inside the market, the  alleged criminals opened fire on them prompting them to retaliate. After the gunfight they found Parvez dead. RAB claimed that constable Badsha Mia also was injured.

Name: Abdus Samad
Description: According to RAB, he was killed in crossfire when he was in a secret meeting with his cohorts.

Sensing presence of  RAB they fired on them forcing them to retaliate.After gunfight Monir found dead.  But Banu Begum, wife of deceased Monir Hossain  said RAB picked up Monir  on 7.3.10 midnight from home after he came back from Dubai.

Name: Zakir Hossain
Description: Zakir  was allegedly tortured to death by police while in remand.under the custody of Ramna police station  However, police said  that he died on chest pain and breathing problem. During the arrest when his  8 years old son embraced his father, Zakir,  police also beaten him  which caused his leg broken.
Follow-up: Zakir's wife Shilpi Begum filed a homicide  case in the chief judicial magistrate against the  OC Shibli Noman and ASI  MA Aziz.

Name: Deen Islam alias Deena
Description: He was allegedly killed in  encounter with RAB
Follow-up: Father of deceased Deena,  Roustam Ali filed a case  with the Chief Judicial Magistrate against  18  persons including the OC of Shiddirganj police station.

Name: Asaduzzaman Rubel

Name: Jahangir

After the gunfight  RAB found them dead.  RAB said two members  of RAB were injured in this incident. But locals said they were picked up and killed by RAB

Sensing the presence of RAB the men of Ansar fired on RAB forcing them to retaliate. At one point Ansar was killed after being caught in firing. Family claimed that he was  killed by RAB after taking him to the brick field.

His family members said Safayera Begum wife of Nazrul's younger brother Sofrul Islam, lodged a written complaint with Rampal police station against Sofrul and police went to his house on 24.9.11. Not finding Sofrul at home, police took Nazrul to the police station and beat him severely, marking him sick. Police took him Rampal Jhanjhania health complex. Denying the allegation of torture on Nazrul, Rampal police station OC Shahidul Islam said,Nazrul Islam was injured on road accident and local people took him to Jhanjhania health complex.

His wife Selina said DB police arrested him from his residence on 11.8.11 on charges of assaulting police and obstructing them from discharging duties on the Supreme Court premises on August 2 and 4, 2011. Selina claimed that DB police tortured him and tie him up with a rope and later they gave an electric shock in his left hand, leaving him unconscious. Deputy commissioner of DB police Monirul Islam denied allegations of tortureing MU Ahemd or giving him electric shocks.
Actions Taken: Safiqul's wife Tahmina Akter   filed a case against nine people including 6 RAB members with a Dhaka Court on 25.4.11. (Source: Prothom Alo and New Age 28.4.11)

Description: They were killed in a shootout with RAB.

Name: Sarwar Hossain Sano
Description: They were killed in a shootout with RAB.

Name: Zakir Hossain alias Meghna Zakir
Description: They were killed in a shootout with RAB.

Name: Unidentified
Description: He died in a gunfight between police and dacoits.

Name: Akida Khatun alias Begum
Description: Police arrested Begum on 2 May 2011. Her mother claimed that police torture her and forcibly put some drugs into her mouth. Later police admitted her to Jessore hospital, where she died on 3rd May.

Name: Nayeem Mia
Description: Nayeem's brother claimed that Nayeem died due to  inhuman torture by police in their custody.But police said Nayeem died due to mob beating.

Name: Mohammad Mohsin
Description: The victim's family alleged that Mohsin was wounded in police firing when he was passing by a checkpoint on a motorbike on April 28,2011. Mohsin's mother Ashiya Khatun, alleged that some of her relatives had provoked police to kill Mohsin over a land dispute.Police claimed that Moshin was wounded in a gunfight after the youth opened fire on the police after being challenged. Mohsin died on May 12,2011.

Name: Quddus Fakir
Description: Two pirates were killed in a gun battle with a joint team of RAB-8 and Coast Guard.

Name: Jahangir
Description: Two pirates were killed in a gun battle with a joint team of RAB-8 and Coast Guard.

Name: Abdullah Al Mamun
Description: Mamun's family claimed that Mamun killed allegedly in the DB police custody, alleged that Mamun had been tortured to death as the body had multiple marks of injuries. Family members of the victim alleged that the Mamun's father-in-laws family conspired with the DB police to have him killed in custody. DB police said Mamun had been arrested for possession of drugs following information gathered by the DB branch and claimed that Mamun had committed suicide by gulping raw heroin.
Sources: New Age, Prothom Alo and Daily Star 28.5.11 and 29.5.11

Name: Md. Hamid Ali Khorshed
Description: Police arrsted Hamid on 18 May 2011 as allegation of drug and theft cases. The court sent him to jail on May 19 .Jailer of Naokhali jail Mahabubul Alam said, Hamid was rushed to the hospital as he felt  sick on 26 May, where the attending doctor declared him dead. Hamid's family claimed that  Hamid  died due to torture by police.

Name: Shafiqul Islam
Identity: Former union parishad chairman and sand trader
Description: Shafiq's wife Tahmina Begum claimed he was picked up by RAB on 3.4.11 afternoon after he had gone to the  Dhaka High Court to seek bail in a muder case.The RAB-11 clamied that on a tip-off thay had raided Gopaldi Dakshinpara area where a gang of 'robbers' where taking preparations to commit a robbery.RAB said Shafiqul was died in gunfight.
Actions Taken: SI Mosharaf Hossain and ASI Sajahan Miah were arrested after the victim's elder brother filed a murder case accusing them of having killed Rubel.

Name: Moniruzzaman Rubel
Description: Rubel died in police custody allegedly due to heavy beating during intterrogation.

Name: Shafiqul Islam Raja
Identity: An employee of a cloth store
Description: Raja died in jail custody while undergoing treatment at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. Raja's family members alleged that he died due to torture in police remand. His family said Raja had feud over a land with his maternal uncles, they bribed police to detain Raja. Family members also claimed that police pick him up before filing any case and then showed him arrested in pending muder case. Later he was remanded for three days and tortured inhumanly.

Name: Tikka Khan
Description: Tikka Khan was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and police.

Name: Ziarul Rahman
Description: He died in crossfire allegedly by RAB.

Name: Raisuddin
Identity: Regional leader of the Gono Bahini
Description: He was killed  in gunfight with RAB

Name: Minu Parvez alias Tonu alias Dadabhai
Description: He was killed  in gunfight with RAB

Name: Russel Ahmed alias Bhutto
Description: According to the law enforcers, a team of RAB-10 went to Zindabahar around 3:00am when Russel and his cohorts opened fire on RAB members, prompting them to retaliate. Russel was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. However, Russel family claimed that RAB had picked him up from the capital's Moghbazar on March 3,2011.

Name: Rekha Begum
Description: The victim's family alleged that Rekha was tortured to death by the jail authorities. Jailer Nazrul Islam clamied that she died due to heart attack in the jail hospital.

Name: Faisal Ahmed alias Roni
Description: Faisal arrested on suspicion of being a mugger allegedly died of torture in police custody. Refuting the allegation, police said Faisal succumbed to his injuries from a mob beating during the arrest from Dhanmondi area.The hospital morgue sources said the body bore several marks of injury.

Name: Gopal Chandra Shil
Description: Gopal's father alleged that the law enforcers had picked his son from Dhaka court premises on 22.3.11 when he was coming out after appearing in the court in a case. The kadamtali OC Kazi Ayubur Rahman , said a partrol team of RAB-10 challenged Gopal and his associates when they were holding a meeting near the WASA tank at Shyampur. The group then fired into the battalion personnel, who fired back, leading to a 'gun-fight'. Gopal died on the spot.

Name: Faruk Miah
Description: District jail Super said  police arrested Faruk in a drug case on March 22, 2011. The court sent him to jail on March 25 when he was produced before it after two days of remand in custody. Faruk's wife Selina Begum claimed that her husband died due to torture while police took him on remand. Jailer Dewan Tarikul Islam said, Faruk was rushed to the hospital as he felt severe pain in his chest where the attending doctor declared him dead.

Name: Rashedul Islam
Description: Rashedul's family ,how ever, said that the battalion personnel in plainclothes had picked him up from a place behind the Sharif Market on March 29, 2011 when he was chatting with some of his friends. Rashedul's wife Iti, also said that law enforcers had picked him, she along with others of family went to the nearby police station and the battalion camp to know of Rashed whereabouts.'But none could give any information on him.' The RAB-4 claimed that their patrol team had challenged Rashedul and his associates when they were holding meeting.The group then fired into the battalion personnel, who fired back, leading to a 'gun-fight'. Rashed died on the spot.

Name: Azgar Ali
Description: He was killed by RAB in gunfight. The victim's elder sister said that her brother had been picked up by the plainclothesmen from the house of his sister-in-law in Narsigndi about 5:00pm on 31 January 2011. She also said,   'We suspect that the killing might have taken place after a verdict on the land dispute in our favour.' However, the battalion in a release said three RAB-4 tems challenged a group, the group fired and leading to a  gunfight. The critically injured Azgar was taken to DMCH where he was pronounced dead.
Actions Taken: A case had been filed in this connection.

Name: Hafizul Islam Reza
Identity: An operative of Purbo Banglar Communist Party (Janajuddho)
Description: Reza was killed in a gunfight with RAB.

Name: Abdul Hamid alias Thosha Hamid
Identity: Regional leader of Purba Banglar Communist Party (Red Flag)
Description: He was killed in a gunfight with the police.

Name: Nurul Islam Sumon
Location: National Botanical Garden in Mirpur, Dhaka
Description: On 4.2.11 police captured Sumon, when Sumon and others were roaming around suspiciously about Proshika Bhaban. Based on Sumon's statement ,the police raided a place in the Botanical Garden where some of his associates were holding a meeting. When police reached the spot Sumon's associates fired into the law enforcers,who fired back, leading to a gunfight. Sumon was killed in the gunfight.
Actions Taken: Two cases were filed with the Shah Ali police in this connection.

Name: Hazrat Belal alias Haj Belal
Description: He was killed in a gunfight with the joint operation of Police and RAB.

Name: Md. Azibor Rahman
Identity: Regional commander of Purba Banglar Communist Party(ML Lal Pataka)
Description: He was killed in a shootout between his cohorts and police.Police said, they raided Megharpara village at about 3.30am following a tip-off that two factions of PBCP were locked in a gunfight there. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the outlaws opened fire on them starting a gunfight between the criminals and police.

Name: Maksudul Haq Khan
Description: Maksudul Haq was allegedly beaten to death by police
Actions Taken: His son Hanif Khan case filed against SI Monir Hossain and Maksudul Haq's brothers Ziaul Haq Khan and Faruk Khan.

Name: Mohammad Shahid
Description: Shahid's wife Rabeya Khatun said that RAB had picked up Shahid at Ashulia in the evening of February 7 and he had been missing since then. According to RAB, RAB-4 officials challenged Shahid and his associates as they were holding a meeting at Bhashantek. Shahid  died in the gunfight.

Name: Waliur Rahman alias Krishna
Location: Baleshwar river in Patharghata upazila of Barguna
Description: He was killed in a shootout with RAB.

Name: Dulal Bepari
Description: They were killed in a shootout with joint operation of RAB-6 and Police.

Name: Mashiur Rahman
Description: They were killed in a shootout with joint operation of RAB-6 and Police.

Name: Md.Hasan Ali
Description: On 1.2.11 Hasan kidnapped a 5 year old child and demanded ransom money from child's father,however Hasan was caught by locals and handed over to Faridpur police. Hasan was found dead  on 14.2.11 night. SP Jahangir Hossain said, they were not sure how Hasan died. He also said a rope was found nearby, which indicating he may have strangled himself. Hasan's father Ansar Ali claimed that the police tortured his son to death. He said his son's health was good when police took him to the station.
Follow-up: Hasan Ali's maternal uncle Md. Abdul Mannan has filed a murder case with Judicial Magistrate's Court-2 in Pabna against OC Md. Abu Jafar,Sub inspector(SI) Md. Akhter Hossain and constable Golam Mostafa.
Actions Taken: Duty officer SI Md Akhter Hossain and  constable Golam Mosta were temporary suspended.
Sources: Daily Star and Kaler Kantho 16.2.11       Followup: Daily Star 22.2.11

Name: Azizul Islam
Description: He was killed  in gunfight with police

Name: Motaleb
Identity: Ringleader of a pirate group 'Motaleb Bahini'
Location: Tagra ferryghat area, Zianagar upazila, Pirozpur
Description: He  died on  a shootout between pirates and RAB.

Name: Kamrul Islam
Description: He was killed in gunfight with RAB

Name: Unidentified
Description: They were killed in shootout by RAB

Name: Unidentified
Description: They were killed in shootout by RAB

Name: Imtiaz Hossain Abir
Identity: First Year commerce student of Northern College
Description: Family said that Abir was a first year student of Northern college and was murdered by police. However,  Pallabi  police claimed that a team of plain clothed men challenged 'a gang of robbers' at Balurmath about 9.00 pm  and when team challenged the gang, the gang members opened fire forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. No case  was filed for this incident.  His father said he will not file a case as he has no courage to file case against police. If he files a case his family could face consequence.
Follow-up: Police started investigation  regarding his killings (Protjhom Alo, 13.1.110;However, his parents said they do not want to file case about the death of abir due to the harrassment of police, which is usual in Bangladesh( 19.1.11/ Prothom Alo)

Name: Humayun Kabir Biplob
Identity: Member of 33 ALward Unit and joint secretary of T&T unit AL
Description: According to RAB-3 he was in a motorbike and  was with two persons. When  RAB was chasing them, he shot and compelled RAB to retaliate. After the gunfight  Biplob found dead. But his  family claimed he was picked up from his house on January 11,2011  about 10.45 pm

Name: Sheikh Shah Alam Apu
Location: Near Chitra Cinema hall , at Bangsal , Dhaka
Description: He was killed  in gunfight with RAB

Name: Shaymol Bepari
Description: According to police the alleged criminals fired on them forcing them to retaliate, after the gunfight Shaymol found dead.  Police said along with Shaymol there was Anik. However, Anik said , he didn't know Shaymol and sawd him in the custody  for the first time as police picked them up and told them to handover arms. As they said they did not have any, police shot them  and Shaymol died and Anik injured.

Name: Jewel
Description: According to RAB he was killed in shootout

Name: Nabir Hossain Dabir
Description: They were killed by  RAB shootout

Name: Md. Nizam Uddin
Description: Md. Nizam Uddin was killed by the Rapid Action Battalion in a 'cross-fire', claimed by the battalion at Subarnachar upazila in Noakhali on December 20, 2012. Nizam was also accused in 15 cases, including murders and extortions, filed with Char Jabbar and Hatia police stations, the police said.

Name: Shah Alam
Description: Shah Alam was killed by the police in 'crossfire' at Pallabi. The 25-year-old youth Shah Alam, sustained bullet injuries after an alleged 'gunfight' with the police near Pallabi Plaza on Post Office lane at about 8.15 pm.He died on the way to the Dhaka Medical  College Hospital.

Name: Ershad Ali
Description: On November 12, 2012 police of Joypurhat Sadar Police Station arrested Ershad without any case. Police claimed 10,000 taka from Ershad and tortured him. He was pressed to the wall as a result he felt a chest pain and also beat up in legs and waist. Later on December 10, 2012 he died at the Joypurhat Jail Hospital.

Name: Shoilendro Nath Biswash alias Shoilen
Identity: Leader of New Biplopi Communist Party (Mrinal group)
Description: Shoilendro Nath Biswash Shoilen killed in a gunfight with RAB on November 3, 2012.

Name: Foysal
Description: Two alleged pirates were killed in a 'gunfight' with the RAB and the police at Harintana in Sundarbans in Shoronkhola upazila on November 18, 2012. Lieutenant Colonel Farid, commander of Barisal RAB-8, told the news agency that they received secret information that 12 to 14 pirates of the gang were preparing to commit robbery in Sundarbans.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Two alleged pirates were killed in a 'gunfight' with the RAB and the police at Harintana in Sundarbans in Shoronkhola upazila on November 18, 2012. Lieutenant Colonel Farid, commander of Barisal RAB-8, told the news agency that they received secret information that 12 to 14 pirates of the gang were preparing to commit robbery in Sundarbans.

Name: Lal Mia
Description: Four plainclothes policemen of Basail Police Station went to the village and chased a few villagers who were playing cards on October 2, 2012. At one stage, the law enforcers caught one Lal Mia of the village, who was standing on a nearby road. They beat up Lal Mia and dunked him into a pond. The villagers encircled the cops, rescued Lal Mia and sent to the upazila health complex where the doctors declared him dead.
Follow-up: A murder case was filed accusing five police officers in this incident. Police arrested ASI Suruzzaman and Jahangir Alam, Constable Sarwar and Shamim. They were sent to Jail after arrest. Source: Samakal 05.10.2012
Actions Taken: The four policemen Assistant sub-inspectors Jahangir Hossain and Shamim Reza were closed to the district police lines on October 3, 2012.

Name: Nurul Islam
Description: On September 27, 2012 police asked for money from Nurul's Shop. Nurul denied to give it. Thus ASI Towhidul Islam of Jatrabari Police outpost beat him mercilessly and took him to the Jatrabari Police Station. There he detained Nurul Islam. Nurul Islam's wife gave 4,500 taka to the officer to free her husband. Later on October 3, 2012 he died at Al Baraka Diagonistic Center.

Name: Rony Mia
Identity: 2nd year student in commrce division of Mirpur Bangla College
Description: A team of DB police of Dhaka district carried out a mission for arresting miscreants in different places of Ashulia. There they found a microbus running fast in the road. They gave signal to stop the microbus but the microbus did not stop rather opened fire to them. In a reply they also opened fire. A miscreant was shot to injured and later died at Savar Enam Medical College Hospital.
Follow-up: One Kafil Uddin alleged that some persons for previous enmity over land conflict tried to murder her daughter Nurunnahar by police. However, Rony was shot dead instead of Nurunnahar as she was not at the microbus which the police opened fire.Local people said that,there was no gunfight. Only police opened fire at the microbus. Source:Prothom Alo 15.10.2012

Name: Jamal Hossain alias Boro Jamal
Description: An alleged criminal was killed in a 'cross-fire' between his accomplices and Rab members in Kachua upazila of Chandpur on October 24, 2012. The OC said on a tip-off that Jamal and his gang were preparing to commit a robbery, a team of Rab-11 of Narayanganj, conducted a raid at Bachaiya village in the upazila around 2.00 am. Sensing presence of the elite force, the gang opened fire on them, forcing the Rab to retaliate. After around a half an hour-long gunbattle, Jamal's bullet-ridden body was found.
Sources: Information gathered from website of Rab and Daily Star 25.10.2012

Name: Abdul Jalil
Identity: A regional leader of outlawed , a faction of Purbo Banglar Communist Party (Lal Pataka)
Description: A regional leader of outlawed, a faction of Purbo Banglar Communist Party( Lal Pataka), was killed in a "shootout" between police and his cohorts in Mirpur upazila of Kushtia on September 4, 2012.

Name: Nurul Islam
Identity: Alleged Forest Bandits of notorious Mortuza Bahini
Description: Two forest bandits were killed in a 'gunfight' with the Rapid Action Battalion-8 in Sundarban in Sharankhola upazila of Bagerhat on September 8, 2012.
Sources: New Age/Daily Star/Prothom Alo/ Kaler Kantho 09.09.2012

Name: Unidentified
Identity: Alleged Forest Bandits of notorious Mortuza Bahini
Description: Two forest bandits were killed in a 'gunfight' with the Rapid Action Battalion-8 in Sundarban in Sharankhola upazila of Bagerhat on September 8, 2012.
Sources: New Age/Daily Star/Prothom Alo/ Kaler Kantho 09.09.2012

Name: Tofazzal Hossain alias Tofa Mollah
Identity: Leader of Sramajibi Gono Mukti Fauj
Description: RAB officials claimed that the 'gunfight' took place on Padma River at about 5.15 am. RAB-12 personnel claimed that they had prior information that a group of 'extremists' was holding a secret meeting in a place between Charsadipur and Kheyaghat in Shilaidah to commmit 'sabotage'. On receiving information, a unit of the RAB from Pabna and Kushtia went to the place and raided a boat on Padma River. The extremists, sensing the presence of law enforcers, opened fire on them, claimed the RAB.

Name: Iqbal Hossain
Description: Iqbal Hossain, was killed in a 'shootout' with the Rapid Action battalion-1 at Khejurbagan in Ashulia of Dhaka on September 12, 2012. RAB official said that they fired into the crime suspects after they had fired into the lawmen.

Name: Rahat Ali
Identity: Leader of Purbo Bangla Communist Party (ML Red Flag)
Description: Rahat Ali was shot to death by police in a gunfight at 2.30 am on September 17, 2012 at Mirpur, Kushtia.

Name: Mohammad Bhikhu
Description: An accused in a drug case died at Adhunik Sadar Hospital in the town on August 25, 2012. Golam Mortuza, officer in-charge (OC) of Sadar Police Station said, a police team arrested Bhikhu from PTI area on charge of taking drug on August 24, 2012 at around 8.00 pm. His family alleged that, Bhikhu was tortured at Chapainawabganj Sadar Police Station and he  died due to torture.

Name: Shahid
Description: "Dakat Shahid" and one of his accomplices were killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion at Laxmibazar in old Dhaka. RAB indentified the second victim as Kalu. RAB's Legal and Media Wing Director Commander M Sohail  said that Rab personnel chased their bikes and managed to catch Shahid and Kalu from the spot.  The alleged criminals opened fire as the Rab members approached them, prompting the force to fire back. It is to be noted that no information from the family was found.

Name: Kalu
Description: "Dakat Shahid" and one of his accomplices were killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion at Laxmibazar in old Dhaka. RAB indentified the second victim as Kalu. RAB's Legal and Media Wing Director Commander M Sohail  said that Rab personnel chased their bikes and managed to catch Shahid and Kalu from the spot.  The alleged criminals opened fire as the Rab members approached them, prompting the force to fire back. It is to be noted that no information from the family was found.

Name: Mintu Hossain
Location: Akij Bidi Factory, Daulatpur upazila, Kushtia
Description: The Ansar personnel shot at a demonstration of Akij Bidi Factory workers who were demanding a rise in their pay at Daulatpur in Kushtia on July 15, 2012. Two workers died in the spot and another worker named Kala critically injured who died on July 17, 2012.

Name: Rokibul Islam
Location: Akij Bidi Factory, Daulatpur upazila, Kushtia
Description: The Ansar personnel shot at a demonstration of Akij Bidi Factory workers who were demanding a rise in their pay at Daulatpur in Kushtia on July 15, 2012. Two workers died in the spot and another worker named Kala critically injured who died on July 17, 2012.

Name: Kala
Location: Akij Bidi Factory, Daulatpur upazila, Kushtia
Description: The Ansar personnel shot at a demonstration of Akij Bidi Factory workers who were demanding a rise in their pay at Daulatpur in Kushtia on July 15, 2012. Two workers died in the spot and another worker named Kala critically injured who died on July 17, 2012.

Name: Mohammad Sumon
Description: Sumon was killed in a "shoot-out" with Rab in Dhaka. After the shoot-out, the Rab personnel found bullet-hit Sumon lying dead on the ground.

Name: Abdul Wahab
Description: A man was killed in police fire as villagers tried to resist the law enforcers from arresting him in Jhenidah on 10.06.2012. Wahab was known as an honest figure in the area, locals said.

Name: Abdul Malik
Description: Abdul Malik was tortured in the Jokiganj Police Station in the night of June 12, 2012. Next day on June 13, 2012 he was sent to the Court in the case under section 54. Later on June 18, 2012 the Court granted him bail so he came back home ont that day. He was very sick due to torture. Later he died on June 23, 2012.
Follow-up: A case was filed in the Court as police did not record the case in the Police Station. The case was filed against Sub Inspector  Golam Mostafa with 10 others. Source: Ittefaq, 28.06.2012.

Name: Nobokumar Halder
Location: Sharankhola upazila in Bagerhat of Sundarban.
Description: Three alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with Rab personnel in the Sundarbans at Sharankhola upazila in Bagerhat. The deceased were members of a gang locally known as Akash Bahini, said Major Sabbir Rahman Osmani, Deputy commanding officer of Rab-8.He said on secret information, they raided a den of the robbers on the bank of Shapla canal around 10 am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on them prompting the Rab officials to fire back, Osmani said. After the robbers fled the scene, Rab officials recovered the three bullet-riddled bodies, he added.

Name: Mihir Roy
Location: Sharankhola upazila in Bagerhat of Sundarban.
Description: Three alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with Rab personnel in the Sundarbans at Sharankhola upazila in Bagerhat. The deceased were members of a gang locally known as Akash Bahini, said Major Sabbir Rahman Osmani, Deputy commanding officer of Rab-8.He said on secret information, they raided a den of the robbers on the bank of Shapla canal around 10 am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on them prompting the Rab officials to fire back, Osmani said. After the robbers fled the scene, Rab officials recovered the three bullet-riddled bodies, he added.

Name: Fakhrul Sheikh
Location: Sharankhola upazila in Bagerhat of Sundarban.
Description: Three alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with Rab personnel in the Sundarbans at Sharankhola upazila in Bagerhat. The deceased were members of a gang locally known as Akash Bahini, said Major Sabbir Rahman Osmani, Deputy commanding officer of Rab-8.He said on secret information, they raided a den of the robbers on the bank of Shapla canal around 10 am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on them prompting the Rab officials to fire back, Osmani said. After the robbers fled the scene, Rab officials recovered the three bullet-riddled bodies, he added.

Name: Anwar Hossain
Description: It was alleged that a gang of armed muggers had snatched Tk 40,000 from a businessman at Narsingdi bus stand.Businessman informed it to RAB. Then RAB chased the muggers and  killed six people in an encounter when they tried to flee after mugging.The family of the killed persons claimed that they were innocent.

Name: Mosharraf Hossain
Description: It was alleged that a gang of armed muggers had snatched Tk 40,000 from a businessman at Narsingdi bus stand.Businessman informed it to RAB. Then RAB chased the muggers and  killed six people in an encounter when they tried to flee after mugging.The family of the killed persons claimed that they were innocent.

Name: Saidur Rahman
Description: It was alleged that a gang of armed muggers had snatched Tk 40,000 from a businessman at Narsingdi bus stand.Businessman informed it to RAB. Then RAB chased the muggers and  killed six people in an encounter when they tried to flee after mugging.The family of the killed persons claimed that they were innocent.

Name: Masud Afridi
Description: It was alleged that a gang of armed muggers had snatched Tk 40,000 from a businessman at Narsingdi bus stand.Businessman informed it to RAB. Then RAB chased the muggers and  killed six people in an encounter when they tried to flee after mugging.The family of the killed persons claimed that they were innocent.

Name: Arif
Description: It was alleged that a gang of armed muggers had snatched Tk 40,000 from a businessman at Narsingdi bus stand.Businessman informed it to RAB. Then RAB chased the muggers and  killed six people in an encounter when they tried to flee after mugging.The family of the killed persons claimed that they were innocent.

Name: Jamal
Description: It was alleged that a gang of armed muggers had snatched Tk 40,000 from a businessman at Narsingdi bus stand.Businessman informed it to RAB. Then RAB chased the muggers and  killed six people in an encounter when they tried to flee after mugging.The family of the killed persons claimed that they were innocent.

Name: Md. Momin
Description: RAB killed Momin in a gunfight.Momin's family claimed that Momin was picked up by RAB men in plain-clothes in front of his house in Purba Charail, Keraniganj at around 3.00pm on 01.04.2012. He was shot dead in another incident of 'crossfire' with the RAB in a narrow street in Mirpur area on 2nd April.

Name: Masud Rana Tushar
Description: RAB killed Masud Rana Tushar in a gunfight.On 13th April  a patrol team of RAB signalled a speeding microbus to stop at the check post near Bashundhara City at around 4.20 am.But, the microbus (Dhaka-Metro-Cha-14-0267) denied to stop and try to escape.RAB chase the micro-bus while they opened fire from the micro-bus. RAB also opened fire and at that time Masud Rana Tushar was killed.It was claimed by the family members of the deceased that he was a Fruits Vendor. But, RAB claimed that he was a carjacker.

Name: Abul Basar
Description: According to police, police chased Basar in the time of snatching. Later, Basar opened fire targeting SI Mohammad Asaduzzaman and Asaduzzaman opened fire to protect himself  as a reply. Basar died due  to fire. But, the wife of Basar claimed that police shot him death in front of the home.

Name: M Giasuddin
Description: A suspected robber namely M Giasuddin was killed and four policemen were injured in a gunfight in Moheshkhali upazila of Cox's Bazar on 22nd April, the police claimed.Giasuddin was the alleged ringleader of a robbery gang, said Ranjit Kumar Barua, officer-in-charge of Moheshkhali Police Station. On information, police raided the house of Giasuddin around 2am when a gang of bandits were holding a meeting there for committing a robbery on a trawler, the OC said.Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire forcing them to fire back that triggered the gunfight, the OC said. There the alleged found bullet-hit.

Name: Shahed Miah
Description: Shahed was tortured by BGB (Border Guard Bangladesh). BGB had taken him to the Transit camp and beaten him. As a result,he suffered for 4 months and then died on 30.04.2012.

Name: Abdur Rahim Sheikh
Description: Abdur Rahim Sheikh was arrested on charge of taking drug on 29th February. He was produced before a mobile Court on 1.3.2012 . The court sentenced him to one year imprisonment.. He was sent to jail in the afternoon on the day. He was taken to Rangpur Medical college and hospital as he fell sick on 02.03.2012.His family alleged that he died due to torture when he was in the custody at the police station.

Name: Mohammad Mintu
Description: The RAB,claimed that the man was killed in a 'gun fight' during their 'combing operation'

Name: Jihad
Description: Five alleged dacoits including two ringleaders of robbery gangs were killed in a "shootout" with Rapid Action Battilion personnel in Morabhola canal of the Sundarbans.

Name: Sohag Farazi
Description: Five alleged dacoits including two ringleaders of robbery gangs were killed in a "shootout" with Rapid Action Battilion personnel in Morabhola canal of the Sundarbans.

Name: Al-Amin
Description: Five alleged dacoits including two ringleaders of robbery gangs were killed in a "shootout" with Rapid Action Battilion personnel in Morabhola canal of the Sundarbans.

Name: Asadul Boyati
Description: Five alleged dacoits including two ringleaders of robbery gangs were killed in a "shootout" with Rapid Action Battilion personnel in Morabhola canal of the Sundarbans.

Name: Belal
Description: Five alleged dacoits including two ringleaders of robbery gangs were killed in a "shootout" with Rapid Action Battilion personnel in Morabhola canal of the Sundarbans.

Name: Nazrul Islam
Description: The law enforcers(the team of Mohammadpur police, Detective Branch and the Rapid Action Battalion) in separate releases claimed that they fired after the 'carjackers' who were in a car having no number plate and were headed for the bridge without heeding a signal to pull over, had fired into them.Nazrul died at the incident. It was  claimed that Nazrul  was the carjacker of the DIG of police.Nazrul's family, however, alleged that he along with Mithu and Swapan had been arrested by the plainclothesmen at Karwan Bazar on 14.03.2012and the police demanded Tk 10 lakh for his release.

Name: Mostafizur Rahman
Description: .RAB said Mostafizur had been a close aide to the executed leader of Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh, Siddiqul Islam alias Bangla Bhai, who had spread Islamic militancy in the country under the banned organisation.

Name: Mokaddes Moka
Description: Police killed Julfikar Ali Gama in a gun fight.

Name: Masud
Description: Police shot him to death in front of an under-construction building.The reason is not clear for the shot out.His family claimed that Masud was innocent.There was no case or complaint against him.It was alleged that the rival group of his brother's bussiness bribe police  to kill him.
Follow-up: A Dhaka court ordered a judicial inquiry after four policemen and seven others were sued on charges of killing Masud  . The accused in the case are officer-in-charge of Shah Ali Police Station Anisur Rahman, Sub-inspector Mohammad Zahid, assistant sub-inspectors Moshiur Rahman and Moazzem Hossain, and jhut (garment by-products) traders Nantu, Ayub Ali, Kuddus, Sentu, Bulu alias Ripon, Shamim and Sakir. Source:The Daily Star 2.04.2012
Sources: The Daily Star 26.03.2012 and Ittefaq 28.03.2012 and Odihkar fact finding 27.03.2012

Name: Bidhan Chandra Biswas alias Montu
Description: Iqbal Bahar Chowdhury, OC of Jhenaidah Police Station said that the RAB informed the police about the presence of the group and launched a joint drive with police in the village where the ultra-left operatives were holding a 'clandestine' meeting.Sensing their presence, the 'outlaws' opened fire on the law enforcers prompting them to return fire triggering an 'encounter'.
Sources: Jugantor, New Age and Daily Star 01.04.2012

Name: Tabibur Rahman Tota
Description: Tabibur was killed in a crossfire with RAB.

Name: Alamgir
Description: He was killed in a crossfire with police.

Name: Joynal Abedin
Description: They were killed in  gunfight between their cohorts and a joint team of RAB-11 and Coast Guard.

Name: Jafar
Description: They were killed in  gunfight between their cohorts and a joint team of RAB-11 and Coast Guard.

Name: Samsul Alam Maji
Description: They were killed in  gunfight between their cohorts and a joint team of RAB-11 and Coast Guard.

Name: Shohrab Hossain Hawlader
Description: Shohrab Hossain killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Ibrahim Hossain
Description: Ibrahim's father Abdur Rahman alleged that his son might have died of torture in the jail as he saw  blood in head and nose on his son's body.

Name: Bachchu
Description: They were killed in a gunfight between their cohorts and RAB-8.

Name: Jamal
Description: They were killed in a gunfight between their cohorts and RAB-8.

Name: Montu
Description: They were killed in a gunfight between their cohorts and RAB-8.

Name: Unidentified
Description: They were killed in a gunfight between their cohorts and RAB-8.

Name: Ranga Miah
Description: Ranga was killed in a crossfire in the RAB custody. RAB identified the Ranga a trader of illegal firearms, whereas Ranga's family claimed that Ranga was not a arms trader, he worked as an assistant to the driver of a school bus.

Name: Faruk Hossain alias Kamal
Description: Faruk's sister said some plaincloth police led by SI Nuruzzaman arrested him from in a tea stall infornt of his house on 19.2.12. She claimed that Faruk died due to police torture  in Kafrul Police Station and later police send him at  the Dhaka Central Jail.
Follow-up: 4 cops sued are sued. The accused are OC Mohammad Abdul Latif, three sub-inspectors- Mohammad Nuruzzaman, Reazul Karim Patwary and Mohammad Afazuddin.

Name: Motaleb Hossain
Description: He was killed during gunfight between his team and RAB.

Name: Didarul Alam alias Dilder
Description: Didarul was killed in gunfight with RAB.

Name: Kalam Hossain
Location: Datbhanga bil, Sadar upazila, Satkhira border
Description: He was shot to death allegedly by BGB members.

Name: Asif Ahmed alias Sajib
Description: He was killed in gunfight with RAB.

Name: Kibria Fakir
Identity: A member of a pirate gang Jihad Bahini
Description: A pirate was killed in an encounter with the joint force of RAB-Coast Guard.

Name: Abdullah Mia
Description: He was killed during  gunfight between his team and RAB.

Name: Shariful Islam Russel
Description: Shariful Islam Russel died when members of Sitakunda Police Station opened fire to disperse blockaders who were vandalising vehicles.

Name: Hossain Ali
Location: Kaliganj highway, Satkhira, Garanbaria area, Satkhira
Description: Hossain Ali and Arizul Islam were killed when police and BGB members opened fire on blockaders to clear the blockades. 20 Jamaat activists were injured in this incident.

Name: Arizul Islam
Location: Kaliganj highway, Satkhira, Garanbaria area, Satkhira
Description: Hossain Ali and Arizul Islam were killed when police and BGB members opened fire on blockaders to clear the blockades. 20 Jamaat activists were injured in this incident.

Name: Siam Mastan
Identity: Student of class VIII of Al-Amin School and College, Chandpur
Description: In Chandpur, a class-VIII student and an activist of student wing of BNP were killed and at least five more bullet-hit in a clash with police at Kalibari around 10:30 am on December 4, 2013. The dead were Siam Mastan(14) and Tajul Islam Ratan.

Name: Tajul Islam Ratan
Identity: A master's student of Chandpur Govt College and an activist of student wing of BNP
Description: In Chandpur, a class-VIII student and an activist of student wing of BNP were killed and at least five more bullet-hit in a clash with police at Kalibari around 10:30 am on December 4, 2013. The dead were Siam Mastan(14) and Tajul Islam Ratan.

Name: Harunur Rashid
Identity: Activist of youth wing of BNP
Description: Youth wing of BNP activist Harunur Rashid had died and 30 other people were injured in the clash with the police.

Name: Mafizur Rahman
Description: The rickshaw-puller Mafizur Rahman, who became wounded with a bullet in a clash between the police and student wing of Jamaat at Daganbhuiyan in Feni, died from his injuries at Chittagong Medical College Hospital.

Name: Shofikul Islam
Description: Shofikul Islam an alleged mugger killed in a gunfight with RAB-3 at Mogbazaar, Dhaka. RAB-3 said that on 6 December 2013 early in the morning, Shofikul along with Abdul Kadir (30), Rajib (22) and Haji Mamun (43) in a car tried to snatch valuables from a couple in front of Mogbazaar camp. At that time, RAB members approached to the muggers while they opened fire to RAB. RAB also opened fire in self defense. Later, the car with the muggers escaped from the place and clashed with an electric poll. Thus they left the car there and took Shofikul to Square Hospital as he was bullet wounded. Later, RAB members arrested the three with the dead body of Shofikul from Square Hospital. The family alleged that Shofikul was innocent.

Name: Alamgir Rahman Sumon
Description: A 10-year-old schoolboy, Alamgir Rahman Sumon, was caught in the crossfire and killed during a gunfight between the police and activists of the BNP and Jamaat-e-Islami. The BNP-Jamaat men bomb-throwing fought running battles with the police in Bohuli Bazar area forcing the police fire rubber bullets and tear gas, which cuased Alamgir dead.

Name: Abdus Salam Mia
Identity: Driver of a CNG vehicle/ CNG runned three wheeler
Location: In front of a Saheed Minar near the way to Chagalnaiya from Shuvopur, Dhaka-Chittagong highway, Feni
Description: On 10 December 2013, Acting Company Commander Nayek Subedar Imtiajur Rahman of Modhugram BGB shot two rounds of bullet at Abdus Salam's upper and lower part of the knee in front of a Saheed Minar near the way to Chagalnaiya from Shuvopur, Dhaka-Chittagong highway, Feni. Subedar Imtiajur Rahman suspected him as a smuggler and chased the motorcycle with two others of Abdus Salam and stopped him. Later the BGB member shot him at a stage of altercation. The locals rescued the bullet wounded Abdus Salam and took him to the hospital while he died on the way.

Name: Hafej Abdullah Al Salman
Identity: Leader of Student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: After hearing the news of execution of Kader Molla's death penalty Jamaat and student wing of Jamaat men rushed to the road and staged protest. At one stage of protest police fired to them. In this incident Hafej Abdullah Al Salman, an student wing of Jamaat leader was shot dead.

Name: Anwar
Identity: Activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: A student wing of Jamaat activist died when the police attacked a procession. The clash continued for about half an hour leaving 30 student wing of Jamaat men injured with bullets. Of the injured Anwar was pronounced dead after he was taken to DMCH.

Name: Shihab
Identity: Three were from Student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami, BNP and one unidentified
Description: Goons accompanying a RAB team began firing indiscriminately after entering the house of Sahabuddin Sabu, General Secretary of the District unit BNP and burnt three cars parked in the yard. The battalion took away Shahabuddin, who was hit with a bullet, BNP leader Azizul Karim Bachchu and two of their caretakers. As the news spread in the town, youth wing of BNP activists brought out a procession in front of Adarsha Samad High School and as it reached Chawkbazar and exploded some crude bombs, the battalion fired into the procession leaving many people injured. Shihab, Mahbubur and Suman died on their way to hospital. The identity of the other deceased could not be found. The district BNP claimed that youth wing of BNP leader Iqbal Mahmud Jewel had died in police firing.

Name: Mahbubur
Identity: Three were from Student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami, BNP and one unidentified
Description: Goons accompanying a RAB team began firing indiscriminately after entering the house of Sahabuddin Sabu, General Secretary of the District unit BNP and burnt three cars parked in the yard. Name: Nayeem
Identity: Activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: One was killed as police opened fire to disperse violent student wing of Jamaat-e-ISlami activists who attacked a police outpost. The deceased was identified as Nayeem.

Name: Khorshed Alam
Description: Street vendor Khorshed Alam was shot dead as opposition activists clashed with RAB and the ruling party men.

Name: Fayej Ahmed
Identity: Nayeb-e-Amir of District Jamaat-e-Islami of North Temuhoni of Lokkhipur; doctor
Description: On 13 December 2013, the family alleged that a group of RAB members broke the gate of the house of Fayej Ahmed and took him on the roof of the building. Later, they shot him and fell him to the ground. As a result he died.

Name: Abdul Aziz alias Raihan
Identity: Activists of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: Police shot dead eight activists of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami at Companiganj in Noakhali on 14 December 2013 during a clash between the activists of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami and police. On that day, activists of Jamaat-e-Islami brought out a procession. Police tried to obstruct the procession,while the activists clashed with the policemen. At one stage, police opened fire, which caused eight of the activists killed.
Sources: Jugantor 16.12.2013, Odhikar contacted with Anowar Toha,reporter of a local vernacular, cell no:01819847546 to confirm the incident.
