Description: Police nabbed Rokonuzzaman (45), a real estate businessman, from his residence in the city's Bakalia around 1:20 am on June 19 in connection with a rape case filed with Panchlaish Police Station. On the way to the police station, Rokon fell ill and police rushed him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead, police sources said. Rokon's family alleged that he was beaten to death in police custody.

Name: Ramzan Ali
Description: Two alleged muggers were killed in a gunfight with DB police in Motijheel on June 29, 2014. In the words of the detectives, the criminals started firing at police and the law enforcers retaliated. Ramzan and Aqmal were killed by the criminals' gunfire during the shootout.However, sources at Dhaka Medical College morgue said the two had been shot in the head and chest from the front at close range, not from behind. They said the duo were shot 10 times and five of the bullets fired from two guns were still lodged in the bodies. Ramzan's wife Nusrat Jahan Jharna told The Daily Star at their Rayerbagh home that she suspected that her husband had been picked up the evening before and then murdered.

Name: Mowlana Ashraful Islam Morol
Identity: Kushulia union Jamaat Secretary and super of Sadpur Dakhil Madrasah
Description: Satkhira district Jamaat publicity secretary Mawlana Azizur Rahman said police caught Ashraful from his residence on May 7, 2014 and fired at him, leaving him dead at Bhodrokhali High school premises. However, Kaliganj Thana Officer-in-Charge Golam Rahman said 'Jamaat leader Mawlana Ashraful Islam had fled and was living for a long time in India.Returning from India on May 6, 2014 he took part in a secret meeting at Bhodrokhali High school premises. Being tipped-off, police carried out a drive there. Some Jamaat activists exploded bombs targeting the police. In response, the police fired five rounds of bullets, leaving the Jamaat leader dead on the spot',said Rahman.'He had been accussed in many cases at Kaliganj Thana,including an attack on the Thana,' he added.

Name: Mohammad Shahinur Alam
Location: Bhoirab RAB camp under RAB-14 unit
Description: Victim family members alleged that  Mohammad Shahinur Alam was  tortured to death by Major Sakib Siddiqui, Head of Bhoirab RAB camp, Under RAB 14 Unit. On May 20, 2014, the younger brother of the deceased, Maulana Mehedi Hassan organised a press conference at the National Press Club and stated that on April 29, 2014 at noon his brother was arrested by member of RAB-14 from Boghdohor village under Nabinagar Upazila. In the night of that day, he was beaten on different parts of his body, in particular, on his heap,feet and elbow for more than two hours. On April 30, 2014 RAB forced Abu Taher, a resident of Nabinagar Pashchimpara, to file a case against his brother Shahinur Alam. Later his brother was sent to jail when he was produced before the court.His brother was first admitted to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital and later on shifted to Comilla Medical College Hospital when he became ill. But on May 6 in the evening, his brother died in hospital while under treatment.

Name: Anwar Hossain
Description: Two alleged robbers Anwar and Khalil were killed in a "shootout" with police in the district's Ramu upazila on May 5, 2014.Saykul Ahmed Bhuiyan, OC of Ramu Police Station, said a team of patrol police took position in Toyangakata area around 2.30 am, acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers was planning to commit a robbery on Ramu-Marichya road.Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire. Police also returned fire,triggering a "gunfight" between the law enforcers and the robbers,said the police official.During the gunfight Anwar and Khalil were hit by bullets.The others managed to escape.Police took the duo to Ramu Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

Name: Ruhul Amin
Description: The family of the deceased claimed that police of Boalia Model Police Station tortured to death  Ruhul Amin (22) in Rajshahi..Sirajul Islam, elder brother of the deceased Ruhul Amin, alleged that on May 16, 2014 at night some plain clothed policemen led by Sub Inspector Bajro Gopal of Boalia Police Station arrested Ruhul Amin with 250 grams of Ganja from Namobhodra area of Rajshahi city. Later police tortured to death Ruhul Amin in connection with a top drug peddler of Namobhodra area. Police claimed that Ruhul Amin committed suicide by hanging himself with tearing part of a blanket on ventilator in the toilet.
Sources: Contact person, Rofiqul Islam, brother of Ruhul Amin, cell no- 01197142899

Name: Ripon Sikdar
Description: The police beat up and killed a tea vendor at Nabinagar of Savar on the outskirts of the capital Dhaka on May 21, 2014, the family alleged. The family alleged that a police patrol team, led by sub Inspector Anwar, had picked up Ripon from the Nabinagar bus stand and beaten him up,causing the death.Ripon's brother Mohammad Jewel told reporters at the Dhaka Medical College morgue on May 21, 2014 that Ripon was waiting for his wife, coming from Sayedabad in a bus, at the bus-stand about 10.30 pm. After his wife had arrived, they started for their home in the Niribili Residential area.The police at this point stopped them and frisked Ripon. They also started beating him, the wife alleged. After a few minutes, the policemen took him in their van and asked his wife to arrange money for his release.As his wife Sathi was trying to arrange money from her family, the victim made called his friend Raja and sought his help. The mobile had been switched off since then.Ripon's friend Kabir later called the family about midnight and asked them to visit the hospital. Later,Jewel found the body of his brother in the hospital.

Name: Abdul Gaffar alias Tushar
Identity: Divisional Commander of Purba Bangla Communist Party(ML) of Khulna
Description: On May 27, 2014 Abdul Gaffar alias Tushar was allegedly killed in a gunfigh with policet at Tengra,Tala upazila,Satkhira.

Name: Abu Taher
Description: An alleged drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" between police and drug peddlers in Jessore Sadar upazila on May 30, 2014. The dead, Abu Taher (40) was son of late Sona Ullah of Jhumjhumpur of the upazila,said Rafiqul Islam, Officer-in-charge (investigation) of Kotwali Police Station. Taher was running drug business in Jhumjhumpur area, the police official said. Police said they conducted a drive at Moilakhana of Jhumjhumpur around 3.30 am, acting on a tip-off that a gang of drug peddlers was holding a secret meeting there. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the gang started firing and throwing crude bombs at police. Police returned fire, triggering a "gun battle,'' said Rafiqul. Taher recieved bullets during the "gunfight" and others managed to flee the scene.Taher was rushed to Jessore Medical College Hospital where he died later.

Name: Abdul Hamid alias Hamej
Identity: Second in Command of Sarbahara party
Description: Abdul Hamid alias Hamej was killed in a gunfight with police at Ishwardi, Pabna.Abdul Hamid was the Second in Command of Sarbahara party.

Name: Shahadat Hossain Jasu
Location: Urirchor,Chor Elahi Union, Companiganj Upazila, Noakhali
Description: According to RAB, RAB went in an operation at ward no. 6, Chorbalua village, Urirchar, Chorelahi union,Companiganj, Noakhali.Sensing the presence of RAB opened fire in retaliation. In this gunfight Shahadat Hossain Jasu was killed.

Name: Mohammad Jabed
Description: Mohammad Jabed and Mohammad Sumon, accomplice of Shahadat Hossain Jasu were killed by RAB in gunfight on April 5, 2014. Major Shahed Hasan,deputy director of RAB-11, said a Rab team surrounded Urirchor forest around 4.30 am, acting on information that a gang of robbers was hiding in the forest.The robbers started firing at the Rab men who also fired back.

Name: Mohammad Sumon
Description: Mohammad Jabed and Mohammad Sumon, accomplice of Shahadat Hossain Jasu were killed by RAB in gunfight on April 5, 2014. Major Shahed Hasan,deputy director of RAB-11, said a Rab team surrounded Urirchor forest around 4.30 am, acting on information that a gang of robbers was hiding in the forest.The robbers started firing at the Rab men who also fired back.

Name: Badsha Mia
Description: Badsha Mia was shot to death by police allged by his wife Rubina.On the other hand, police claimed that Badsha was killed in a gunfight.

Name: Abul Kalam Azad
Identity: A Jamaat leader of Elangi union and a UP member.
Description: Abul Kalam Azad was detained by Sub Inspector Mizan in plainclothes with other police of Kotchandpur at around 11 am on April 18, 2014 from his own house at Kotchandpur,Jhinaidah. After that, police denied about the detention. As a result panic spread in the area. Later, a negotiation was going on to release Abul Kalam Azad between the family and police. Abul Kalam's wife Hasina Begum alleged that, after the detention of Abul Kalam Azad he was brought to Gurpara police camp and tortured there. Later, after hearing his screaming local people went there and police charged batons on them to disperse the crowd. Later, he was moved to another place in a white microbus numbered Dhaka-metro-ga-11-2231.Later, SI Abul Kalam negotiated the money with the family to release him. As she failed to give the amount police shot him dead . His bullet wounded dead body found in Mamunshira village, Bokultola on April 21, 2014.

Name: Foridul Alam
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a 'gunfight' with the law enforcers at Ramu-Naikhongchhari Road in Ramu upazila of Cox's Bazaar by police on April 22, 2014. A gang of robbers fired shots at a police team around 9.30 pm, leaving Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) Milton Dey bullet-hit, said Appela Raju Naha, OC of Ramu Police Station. Police fired back and Foridul Alam was killed on the spot

Name: Saiful Islam Shikari
Identity: A member of New Biplobi Communist Party
Description: Saiful Islam Shikari was detained by police from Shonkorpasha village,Abhoynagar upazila, Jessore on April 22, 2014. Police claimed that after detaining him, they went for an operation along with Saiful but there his accomplices opened fire targeting police. Later, police in retaliation opened fire. In this gunfight, Saiful Islam was killed..

Name: Nurul Amin Majhi
Description: They were killed in a 'gunfight' between Coast Guard members and an alleged gang of smugglers in Teknaf on April 25, 2014. Lt Shahid Al Ahsan, Coast Guard commander of St Martin's Island Station, had claimed that a gunfight began when patrol team challenged a trawler  carrying the 'smugglers' on the Naf river.  At one stage, the trawler fled into Myanmar, he said, claiming that the 'gang' had been trying to smuggle contraband Yaba from Myanmar. On April 25, 2014 evening, police recovered three bullet -riddled bodies of the alleged gang members raiding reportedly the same trawler anchored at the Bakkhali river in Cox's Bazar.

Name: Mohammad Jahid Hossain Jakku
Description: Both of them killed in a gunfight in a checkpost while they were given signal to stop the car but they opened fire without stopping the car. Later, BGB-RAB opened fire in retaliation. In this incident two of them killed.
Sources: Osman Jahangir,HRD from press briefing of BGB, 28.04.2014

Name: Mohammad Foridul Alam
Description: Both of them killed in a gunfight in a checkpost while they were given signal to stop the car but they opened fire without stopping the car. Later, BGB-RAB opened fire in retaliation. In this incident two of them killed.
Sources: Osman Jahangir,HRD from press briefing of BGB, 28.04.2014

Name: Aminur Rahman
Identity: Secretary of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami of Satkhira
Description: Aminur Rahman was shot dead by police on April 27,2014.Secretary General Atikur Rahman of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami alleged that in a monthly reporting meeting police had suddenly attacked and opened fire. There Secretary of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami of Satkhira Aminur Rahman was shot dead and seven others were injured.

Name: AL Kamal
Description: A college student was shot dead as the police opened fire to disperse agitated people in Atapara-Chandali intersection in Sirajganj municipal area on April 27, 2014 at evening.Locals of Atapara and Chandali have been locked in series of clashes over gambling for the last one week.The fresh clash erupted on April 27, 2014. Soon the clash broke out, two teams of police led by officer-in charge Habibul Islam and sub-Inspector Ashfaqul Islam went to the area and opened fire to disperse the people where AL Kamal died.

Name: Sirajul Islam
Description: Sirajul Islam was killed in a gunfight with police at Debhata upazila, Satkhira. OC Jalaluddin of Debhata Police Station stated in the newspaper that, activists and leaders of Jamaat-e-Islami was conducting a secret meeting to plan for a sabotage at Keuratola,Debhata . After recieving such news police went there.A gunfight ensuded there where Sirajul Islam died.

Name: Dholu
Location: Chandpai Range, Bhodra Station,Poshur Channel, East part of Sundarban
Description: The Lieutenant  Colonel Foridul Alam of RAB-08 stated that, on April 29, 2014 members of  RAB saw a boat in the channel of Poshur river and gave signal to stop them. But, a group present in the boat opened fire insted of stopping the boat. RAB also opened fire in retaliation.In this incident, Dholu and Bacchu were killed.

Name: Unidentified
Description: An alleged dacoit was killed in a gunfight at Daudkandi upazila, Comilla at Dhaka-Chittagong highway, Hasanpur,Daudkandi, Comilla. OC Salam stated in the media that, a group of dacoits attacked a car for dacoity. The owner of the car tried to escape from the place to go in a safe place.Dacoit opened fire. While police tried to obstruct the dacoit.Then a gunfight ensued where the dacoit was killed.

Name: Rajib Biswas alias Raju
Description: A young man accused of stealing a police weapon who was arrested on March 1, 2014 killed in a 'shootout' of the police at Shalikha in Magura on March 2, 2014.

Name: Shah Alam Mullah
Identity: Stuff reporter of weekly Aparadh Daman
Location: West Police Station of Uttara, Dhaka
Description: On March 2nd staff reporter Shah Alam Mullah of Weekly Aparadh Daman was killed in the custody of West Police Station of Uttara. Shah Alams wife alleged that her husband was tortured to death in police custody.

Name: Mohammad Wasim
Location: Alambahg Madina Mosque, Kodomtali, Postogola, Dhaka
Description: RAB claimed that Mohammad Wasim and Sangram Chowdhury were killed in a gunfight while RAB went to a house at Kadomtoli to rescue four kidnapped persons. Where they opened fire targeting the RAB and RAB also retaliated while the two killed in the gunfight. On the other hand, Wasim's wife Sonia Akhter alleged that members of RAB entered the house and broke the door of the bathroom  and shot dead him.  Sangram tried to escape by rolling down from the pipe of the building while RAB shot dead him.  Mohammad Wasim was a contractor of taking toll of Postogola Bridge while Sangram was an assistant of Wasim.

Name: Unnamed
Description: Sub-Inspector Rofiqul Islam with other police members went to Ramchandrapur, Dhaka-Aricha highway of Savar after getting information that a preparation is going on for dacoity on March 3, 2014.After reaching there the alleged dacoits hurled cocktail targeting the vehicle of police. Police chased the dacoits. Then police charged batons. The rest members of the dacoit group opened fire to police then police retaliated with fire. At that time, the dacoit got bullet wounded and died.

Name: Abul Kashem
Description: Abul Kashem was killed in a gunfight with police at Damurhuda, Chuadanga. Officer-in-Charge of Damurhuda Police Station Ahsan Habib stated that Abul Kashem was an accused of an abduction case of Akbar Ali. OC also stated that there was also allegation of extortion and bombing against Abul Kashem. On T5 March police conducted a raid at Kanai Babu's Mango orchard (Ambagan) where sensing the presence of police miscreants hurled bombs targeting police. In self defense police opened five shot of bullet while the group also retaliated. Later police found a bullet wounded dead body identified as Abul Kashem. On the other hand, Robiul Islam, elder brother of the victim alleged that on March 4, 2014 police detained Abul Kashem from his in laws house Mathpara, Kuralgachi village at around 9.30 pm and shot dead Kashem later.

Name: Ripon Majhi
Description: Police had fired gunshots to stop a group of miscreants snatching ballot boxes from the polling centre set up at the Bhumkhara Government Primary School. The police, however, brushed aside Ripon being killed in police shooting

Name: Abdul Kader
Description: Three piracy suspects were killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion at Tambulbunia under Sharankhola range of the Sundarban in Bagerhat on March 6, 2014. Two of the deceased were identified as Abdul Kader and Kalyan while the identity of thethird person could not be established. RAB-8 Deputy Commander Major Anowarul Kabir said that the three belonged to Shirsha Bahini, a gang of pirates, of the Sundarban. Anowarul claimed that acting on a tip-off, a battalion team raided hide-out of the pirates at Tambulbunia, where they were planning criminal operation. Sensing presence of battalion personnel, the pirates opened fire at them and the battalion personnel also retaliated triggering the gunfight at about 9.30 am.
Sources: New Age  and Janakantha (Janakantha is taking as a source only for include the ages of the victims)  19.03.2014

Name: Nur Mohammad
Description: Nur Mohammad (45) of Paschim Leda village under Lilla union was killed in a "gunfight" with the members of Rapid Action battalion in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazaar on March 20, 2014. On information that a contingent of yaba was coming from Myanmar, a team of Rab went to Jaillayadiya shrimp enclosure area around 4.00 pm. Sensing Rab presence, the smugglers fired on the law enforcers prompting them to fire back. After the gunfight, Rab men rescued bullet-hit Nur Mohammad and recovered a long-barrel gun, two bullets, a pistol and 3,000 yaba tablets from the spot. Upon receiving information, police rushed there and took Nur Mohammad to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where, the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Lucky
Identity: Wife of Abdul Mannan, a rebel chairman candidate of BNP in Gazaria upazila, Munshiganj
Description: Lucky, wife of Abdul Mannan, a rebel chairman candidate of BNP in Gazaria upazila, suffered bullet wounds when army personnel deployed to the polling centre opened fire on Mannan's supporters Lucky was hit by bullets as she got in the line of fire, Mannan said. She was taken to Apollo Hospitals in Dhaka where she died on March 27, 2014.

Name: Selim Patwari
Identity: Activist of Youth wing of AL
Description: On 23.3.14 fourth phase of upazila election was held. During election, supporters of AL backed candidate trying to snatch ballot boxes from the poll centre. Police fired 36 round bullets to bring the situation under control. In this incident Selim Patwari, Vice-President of 9 no. ward youth wing of AL unit was bullet wounded. On 28.3.14 he  died at hospital

Name: Hadis Mia
Description: Hadis Mia, a local leader of youth wing of BNP was killed when BGB opened fire to disperse feuding supporters of BNP and AL in Akhaura over capture of polling station. The clashes broke out when AL men tried to capture Taragan primary school centre

Name: Mohosin Mia
Description: Mohosin Mia tortured to death in the room of the Officer in Charge of Shibpur Model Police Station.The family alleged that police demanded Taka 50,000 from them to free Mohosin. As they could not pay the money police tortured Mohosin to death on February 3, 2014.

Name: Jony
Description: Police arrested Jony following a clash in the Bihari Camp area between two groups of Non-Bengali people on February 9, 2014. The victim's relatives alleged that the police had tortured him after arrest. Jony, a driver, was among five persons who were arrested by Pallabi police after a clash between two groups of Irani Camp and Rahmat Camp.

Name: Faruk Ahmed alias Panama Faruk
Identity: An activist of youth wing of Awami League
Description: He  was killed in 'gunfight' with RAB at Chawak Bazar in the Barisal city on February 10, 2014. The Battalion claimed that they found dead the ruling party leader, Faruk Ahmed alias Panama Faruk, after the gunfight. However,human rights defender Shaheen Aziz stated according to the allegation of the victim family that Faruk was returned from Dhaka and at Barisal Lonch terminal in front of Ebadullah mosque police shot dead Faruk.
Sources: New Age and Ittefaq 11.02.2014, HRD Shaheen Aziz, cell no- 01711262221

Name: Mohammad Rubel
Description: A gunfight was ensued on February 4, 2014 between police and pirates in the Mehgna River. Later, on February 12, 2014 the bullet wounded dead body of Rubel was recovered from the Mehgna River.

Name: Mohammad Jasim Uddin
Identity: Activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: Police claimed that Jasim was bullet wounded in a gunfight and died at Chittagong Medical College Hospital. Meanwhile, acting Amir of Chittagong South District Jamaat-e-Islami claimed that police shot him dead ..NTV news reporter Babor said that Jasim was shot dead by police while he was crossing the road beside keuchiya Union Sodakeuchi School.
Sources: The Daily Star 13.02.2014, Reporter of NTV Babor,cell no- 01819180280

Name: Ekramullah Babu
Description: Officer in Charge of Satkhira Sadar Police Station described that on February 11, 2014 a car of Sanjana Jerin, wife of Colonel Omor Faruk was snatched from Kochukhet, Dhaka. Police tracked the car which was driven to Satkhira. At around 2.00 am on February 12, 2014 police gave signal to stop the car at Chaltetola area. At that moment, they opened fire targeting police while police retaliated. In this incident, However,local human rights defender said that police arrested Ekramullah after snatching  the car and later shot him dead

Name: Mezbaur Rahman Mezbah
Description: Mezbaur Rahman Mezbah was the prime accused of the murder case of Choitonno Kumar Mondol alias Modhu (48), a leader of Awami League.He was killed in a gunfight with RAB-6 at Chapatola, Jessore on February 14, 2014.

Name: Salahuddin
Description: Two people were killed in a 'gunfight' with the police in the capital's Jatrabari area on February 15, 2014. The deceased were identified as Salahuddin (28) and Jewel (30). The police claimed that the deceased were robbers and they wounded in gunfight with police. They were taken to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital,but they succumbed to their injuries on the way.The police said that they had chased three accused persons including Salahuddin and Jewel at Kajla around 4.00 pm. Salahuddin and Jewel were detained in that drive,however, their associates managed to flee. Later, the police carried out another drive along with the two arrested robbers in the Sutir Khalpar Balur Math area to recover their associate managed to flee.Later, the police carried out another drive along with the two arrested robbers in the Sutir Khalpar Balur Math area to recover their illegal firearms around 5.00 pm.As the police reached the area, some other associates of Salahuddin and Jewel opened fire on them.

Name: Siraj Shikdar
Description: The leader of Siraj Bahini (group) Siraj Shikdar was killed in a gunfight with police at Koromjal, Mongla. On February 14, 2014 at around 4.00 am police arrested Siraj from Tujulpur village. Later on 3.00 pm police went to Koromjol to rescue arms according to the information gathered from Siraj. However, a gunfight was ensued there as the associates of Siraj opened fire to police and police also retaliated.Later the bullet-hit Siraj died in the gunfight.

Name: Kala Rajab
Description: Police arrested Rajab from a place in Jhikargacha upazila around 11.15 pm on February 15, 2014. The OC of Jhikargacha said during preliminary interrogation, Rajab divulged details about his arms den.On information extracted from Rajab, a police team took him to his village home in Keshabpur to recover firearms around 1.45 am. When the law enforcers arrived near a bamboo cluster of the village, Rajab's associates  fired at them. A gunfight ensued when the policemen fired back. At one stage, Rajab tried to flee the clutches of the law and came in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries.Police rushed him to Keshabpur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Babul
Description: Police raided a rubber garden in Kulaura upazila around 2:00 am following a tip-off that a gang led by Babul was taking preparations to commit a robbery there.The associates of Babul sprayed bullets on the law enforcers when they approached the garden.In retaliation, police fired back, triggering a "gunfight", said Alamgir Hossain, assistant superintendent of police (ASP) of Moulvibazar. Police found Babul's body lying in a pool of blood.Meanwhile, family members of Babul alleged that law enforcers had picked them up and shot them dead.

Name: Kiran Bepari
Identity: A member of Purba Banglar Sarbahara Party
Description: A member of Purba Banglar Sarbahara Party was killed in a 'gunfight' with police at village Bagmara under Shibchar in Madaripur on February 19, 2014. The deceased was identified as Kiran Bepari (29). Police arrested him on February 19, 2014. Later, at around 1.15 am police along with KIran started another drive at village Baghmara to recover arms.Sensing presence of law enforcers, associates of Kiran started fire on them triggering a gunfight that critically injured Kiran.Later Kiron was taken to Shibchar upazila where doctor declared him dead.
Sources: The New Age and Prothom Alo 20.02.2014

Name: Ashraf Hossain
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between police and his cohorts in Shyamnagar upazila, Satkhira on February 23, 2014.Police carried out an operation in the area, adjacent to the Sundarbans, around 12.30 am following information that Ashraf was holding a meeting with his associates there. When the law enforcers reached there on a speedboat around 4.00 am, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers forcing them to fire back.After a 15-minute gunfight, police recovered Ashraf's bullet-hit body but his associates managed to escape by a trawler.

Name: Raquibul Hasan alias Hafiz Mahmud
Description: Condemned militant Raquibul Hasan alias Hafiz Mahmud, who was recaptured six hours after he, along with two other convicted militants of Jamaat-ul Mujahideen Bangladesh, was snacthed away ambushing a prison van, was killed in an alleged 'gunfight' with police in Tangail on February 24, 2014.

Name: Saddam Hossain
Identity: Activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: Saddam Hossain was killed as police opened fire to quell a fighting between the activists of Awami League and BNP-Jamaat after AL men had allegedly captured Nandia Degree College polling station.

Name: Sarder Niamat Hossain
Description: 15 people including two BGB members and chairman candidate, were injured in a clash with supporters of a chairman candidate backed by the AL on February 27, 2014. On 18.3.14 critically injured by BGB, AL backed chairman candidate Sarder Niamat Hossain, 56 was died at DMCH. He was beaten by BGB.Ref: Ittefaq 19.3.14

Name: Faruk Patwary
Identity: An activist of youth wing of BNP
Description: An activist of youth wing of BNP was shot dead in a clash between blockaders and BGB personnel in Chandpur on January 1, 2014.

Name: Jamshed Alam
Identity: An activist of youth wing of BNP
Description: Juba Dal leader Jamshed Alam was killed in police firing when opposition activists attacked Uttar Char Chandia primary school centre in Sonagazi of Feni around 10:30am on January 5, 2014. Chhatra Dal leader Shahidullah, who suffered injuries in the same incident, died at hospital, said Sonagazi police chief Subhash Chandra Pal.

Name: Shahidullah
Identity: An activist of student wing of BNP

Name: Joynal
Description: Joynal, 30, and Harun, 40, of village Khagrabari were killed in police firing  when opposition men attacked polling stations at Basudevpur Government Primary School polling centre around noon on January 5, 2014.
Sources: The daily New Age and the Daily Star 06.01.2014

Name: Masud Raihan
Identity: An activist of Jatiya Ganatantrik Party
Location: Manmathpur Cooperative High School centre, Dinajpur
Description: Masud Raihan, an activist of Jatiya Ganatantrik Party, died in local hospital after being hit by a bullet in a clash with the police when opposition activists attacked Manmathpur Cooperative High School centre around 12:30pm on January 5, 2014.

Name: Enamul Haque
Identity: An activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: In Chittagong, Shibir activist Enamul Haque, 26, of Adur Para in Lohagara, was killed when police opened fire on Jamaat men after they tried to snatch ballot boxes from Bhabanipur polling centre at about 3:30pm on January 5, 2014.

Name: Babul Hossain
Description: BNP activist Babul Hossain died in Rajshahi Medical College Hospital after being hit by a bullet at Ramnagar under Manda in Naogaon around 11:00am. Manda police officer-in-charge Abdullahel Baqui said joint forces were forced to open fire after the opposition men attacked them with bows and arrows.
Sources: The daily New Age 06.01.2014 and the Daily Star 06.01.2014

Name: Sirajul Islam Siraj
Identity: An activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: Sirajul Islam Siraj (24)   and Hadiuzzaman Hadi (25) activists of Jamaat-e-Islamis student wing Islami Chhatra Shibir, were killed in police firing at Dewti School and College polling centre in Pirgachha under Rangpur 4 constituency around 3:00am on January 5, 2014.

Name: Hadiuzzaman Hadi
Identity: An activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami

Name: Jahangir Alam
Identity: An activist of Jamaat-e-Islami /a lecturer at Khalisa Chhotokhata Fazil Madrassah at Khalisa Chapani of Dimla
Description: Jamaat activist Jahangir Alam (32), a lecturer at Khalisa Chhotokhata Fazil Madrassah at Khalisa Chapani of Dimla, was killed when police opened fire on Jamaat-Shibir men who allegedly attacked Beparitala Alim Madrassah centre around 2:30am on  January 5,2014

Name: Momtaz Uddin
Identity: An activist of Jamaat-e-Islami /A teacher of Barabhita Dakhil Madrassah in Kishoreganj
Description: Jamaat man Momtaz Uddin,50, a teacher of Barabhita Dakhil Madrassah in Kishoreganj, was killed when police opened fire on Jamaat supporters after  they allegedly  attacked Balapara Kachari Girls High School polling centre in Koimari union under of Jaldhaka at about 10:00am on January 5, 2014.

Name: Mohammad Rubel
Identity: An activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: In Laksmipur, Shibir activist Mohammad Rubel was killed  as police opened fire on opposition activists at Machhimpur High School centre in Ramganj upazila. Ramganj police officer-in-charge Rezaul Karim confirmed the death of Rubel.

Name: Matiar Rahman
Description: Jamaat activist Matiar Rahman was shot dead as joint forces opened fire to disperse attackers at Bajitpur centre in Monirampur of Jessore and 30 more, including three presiding officers, sustained injuries in widespread violence in Monirampur that forced the Election Commission to suspend polling at 47 centres.

Name: Md Ismail Rajib
Identity: Two accused of a cop killing
Description: A day after the killing of a cop, two accused were killed in a "gunfight" between their associates and law enforcers in Halishahar Beribandh area of Chittagong city on January 15, 2014.

Name: Md Nasir Uddin
Identity: Two accused of a cop killing
Description: A day after the killing of a cop, two accused were killed in a "gunfight" between their associates and law enforcers in Halishahar Beribandh area of Chittagong city on January 15, 2014.

Name: Anwarul Islam
Description: A Jamaat activist was killed and five cops were injured in a gunfight between Jamaat-Shibir men and the joint force at Ghonapara of Debhata upazila on January 14,2014.

Name: Choton
Identity: An activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: Choton was shot dead in the operation of the joint force on January 18, 2014.

Name: Mossharof Hossain
Identity: An activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: Police found a bullet wounded dead body of Mossharof Hossain on January 19, 2014 from Baroiyardhala,Terial,Sitakunda.Family alleged that on January 17, 2014 he went to visit his sister's house at Mothbariya, Mithachora, Mirshorai. On January 18 a group of 10-12 plainclothes people addressed themselves as RAB picked up him from the house. The family attempted to arrange a press conference after finding no trace of him at Rab office on January 20 while they got the information that police found the bullet wounded dead body of Mossahrof at about 12 noon on the same day. The general secretary of student wing of Jamaat of Chittagong Robiul Hossain also alleged that Rab picked up Mossharof and killed him.

Name: Tarique Mohammad Saiful Islam
Identity: Assistant Secretary General of Meherpur unit of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: Tarique Mohammad Saiful Islam,the Assistant Secretary General of Meherpur unit of Jamaat-e-Islami,who was in police custody,was killed during a "gunfight" between Jamaat-Shibir men and law enforcers on January 20, 2014.

Name: Shahinur Rahman Shohag
Identity: An activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: A Shibir activist, who sustained bullet wounds during January 19, 2014 clash with joint froces in Gaibandha, succumbed to his injuries at a hospital in Bogra on January 21, 2014.The activists of Jamaat-e-Islami and its student wing ambushed a police team while the law enforcers were raiding Kadamtala and Khanabari villagers, known to be Jamaat-Shibir strongholds, in Sundarganj to arrest the people wanted in the cases filed in connection with the February 2013 violence in the district.On information, members of the joint forces rushed to the areas to rescue the police team.The Jamaat men also attacked the joint forces, forcing the law enforcers to fire teargas shells and rubber bullets to disperse the unruly activists.

Name: Shohidar Rahman
Description: Shohidar Rahman was beaten to death by a member of BGB. On January 17, 2014 Shohidar went to attend an invitation to a relative's house. On his way, a BGB member Lance Nayek Jalal of detective branch stopped him and altercating with Shahidar that he was carrying Gaza (drugs) with him.  At one stage, Jalal started to beat him. As a result Shohidar lost consciousness and Jalal escaped from there. He was admitted Rangpur Medical College Hospital and died there. Naodanga Union Parishad Chairman Musabber Ali Musa alleged that Shohidar was beaten by the BGB member.

Name: Didarul Alam Didar
Description: An 'ring leader of criminals' was killed allegedly in a gun battle with RAB at Kamarhat in Sadar upazila of Laxmipur district on January 23, 2014.Didar's wife Momtaz Begum said,RAB picked up her husband at night and the body was found on January 23, 2014.However RAB claimed it as a "gunfight".
Sources: The Daily Star and Kaler Kantha 24.01.2013

Name: Golam Rabbani
Description: On December 15, 2013 at least 18 people in RAB uniforms raided the house at Panchagarh where he was staying and picked up Golam Rabbani as family alleged.Later on January 18, 2014 he was found dead in a bush beside Nilphamari Domar road on January 18, 2014.He was accused of attacking motorcade of cultural activist-turned Awami League leader Asaduzzaman Noor.

Name: Atikur Rahman
Identity: Tupamari union Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal joint secretary
Description: The body Tupamari union Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal joint secretary Atikur Rahman, 26, was recovered from Dhola Gachha Nariya Khamba area of Saidpur bypass road on January 20, 2014.On January 14 night, at least six people, who introduced them as the members of the Detective Branch of police, stormed into the house and picked up Atikur from Tangail,family alleged. Later he was found dead.He was accused of attacking motorcade of cultural activist-turned Awami League leader Asaduzzaman Noor.

Name: Mohammad Sumon
Description: Sumon was killed in a gunfight with the police at Pallabi in the capital Dhaka on January 25, 2014 night.Sumon was an accused in a number of murder and arms cases, was also an associate of the slain Dakat Shahid.

Name: Enamul Haque Biswas
Identity: An activist of Jamaat-e-Islami/a teacher of Balarampur High School
Description: During gunfights between joint forces and Jamaat-Shibir men in Jhenidah and Satkhira on January 26,2014 two Jamaat leaders and an Islami Chhatra Shibir activists were killed and six policemen were reportedly injured. During the 20-minute gunfight with the joint forces, Enamul, a teacher of Balarampur High School and also an activist of Jamaat, was hit. He died on the spot in Jhenaidah.

Name: Abul Kalam
Identity: General Secretary of Debhata upazila of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: Police arrested Kalam and Maruf at their village Kulia in Debhata around 9:00pm on January 25, 2014. Joint forces raided several places in Debhata upazila to recover arms and arrest other accused of violence and murder. When the joint forces entered Narkeli village Jamaat-Shibir men surrounded the law enforcers, the OC claimed. Then in the gunfight two of them were killed.

Name: Maruf Chhoto
Description: Police arrested Kalam and Maruf at their village Kulia in Debhata around 9:00pm on January 25, 2014. Joint forces raided several places in Debhata upazila to recover arms and arrest other accused of violence and murder. When the joint forces entered Narkeli village Jamaat-Shibir men surrounded the law enforcers, the OC claimed. Then in the gunfight two of them were killed.

Name: Azharul Islam
Identity: An activist of student wing of BNP
Description: A leader of Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal, the Bangladesh Nationalist Party-backed student organisation, Azharul Islam (35) was killed by joint forces in a 'gunfight' in Magura Kheyaghat area of Tala upazila in Satkhira on January 27, 2014.

Name: Touhidul Islam Shabuj
Description:
An operative of the outlawed Purbo Banglar Communist Party (ML)  was killed in encounters with law enforcers in Khulna on January 28, 2014. Touhidul was killed in a shootout between
his group and police on January 28,2014 at village Satiani under Phultala upazila of the district.

Name: Rabiul Islam
Description: An alleged gangster  was killed in encounters with law enforcers in Jessore on January 28, 2014.. Rabiul Islam, a suspect in the murder of Awami League leader Chaitanya Kumar Mandal murder, had sustained bullet wounds in a shootout between the members of joint forces and his gang in a bamboo cluster at Ziadanga village early Tuesday. He was declared dead after being taken to the upazila health complex.

Name: Javed Hossain
Description: An alleged mugger, who received bullet wounds in police firing at Pallabi in Dhaka, died at National Institution of Traumatology and Orthopaedic Rehabilitation on January 29, 2014.

Name: Bablu Molla
Identity: An accused of a murder case
Description: Bablu Miah was an accused in a murder case of Awami League leader named Saiful Islam. Rab carried out an operation after getting information that a planning for sabotage was going to be happened by a group of miscreants near Jamuna River. Sensing the presence of the law enforcement agencies the miscreants opened fire. Rab also retaliated. In this incident Bablu Miah was killed.

Name: Golam Sarwar
Identity: An activist of youth wing of BNP
Description: Golam Sarwar was killed in a gunfight with Joint Force.

Name: Towhid
Description: Rab arrested Towhid from High Court area and handed over him to Paltan Police Station on January 28, 2014. Sonaimuri police brought him from there and took him to his village home at Vodrogaon.Police resued local arms from there.Later when police returned with Towhid, Towhid's accomplices threw brick bats and opened fire. He was killed on the spot.

Name: Ripon Islam alias Ripon
Description: Three alleged robbers were killed in a 'shootout' with the police at Baldipukur in Mithapukur upazila on Dhaka-Rangpur highway on January 31, 2014. Of the three deceased, Ripon Islam alias Ripon (35) and Jahangir Hossain Anwar (35) died on the spot while the third, Ahmed Ali (35) died at Rangpur Medical College and Hospital at about 1:30 pm, the police and hospital sources said. Police said the three were member of an inter-district gang of robbers.

Name: Mojiruddin
Description: A BNP leader was shot dead when BNP men clashed with police. Mojiruddin was the BNP ward unit vice-president of Maria union in Charghat upazila. He died on the spot after being shot in the head by police.

Name: Jamshed
Description: A BNP leader was killed when BNP men clashed with police. Deceased Jamshed Ali, was the president of district unit BNP.

Name: Md. Rubel
Identity: Activist of Jubo Dol (Youth wing of BNP)
Description: Blockade supporters were rampaging through Chaumuhuni Rail Gate area in Begumganj upazila. When police reached the spot, the blockaders started pelting the policemen with brick chunks and stones, forcing the law enforcers to open fire. The injured were taken to Abdul Malek Ukil Medical College Hospital and doctors declared Rubel and Mohsin  dead.

Name: Sagir
Location: Shimanarkhal, East range of Sundarban, Mongla, Bagerhat
Description: A gunfight was ensued on January 9, 2015 between RAB and forest robbers at Shimanarkhal, East range of Sundarban, Mongla, Bagerhat. Later, two dead bodies of Sagir and another were rescued from incident place. However, the identity of other person could not be known.

Name: Amir Hossain Ranga
Description: A joint force arrested Ranga from Haridhali area under Paikgacha  and as per his confession the team took him to Kumkhali area to recover illegal arms and ammunitions and to arrest his cohorts. As they reached the area at around 2:30am, Ranga's cohorts, sensing presence of law enforcers, opened fire at them and police also retaliated by firings. Ranga became seriously injured and taken to Paikgacha Upazila Health Complex where on duty doctor declared him dead.

Name: Abdur Rashid alias Kala Rashid
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between police and his cohorts in Howanok Bazaar, Moheshkhali, Cox Bazar on January 13, 2015 at around 7:30pm. When the law enforcers reached there , the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers forcing them to fire back. Police recovered Abdur Rashid''s bullet-hit body.

Name: Motiur Rahman
Identity: A union-level pro BNP Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal activist
Description: A RAB team took Motiur to a mango orchard in Kansat for arresting his accompanies and recovering arms and explosives around 3:00am, on January 16, 2015. Then Motiur's accomplices started firing indiscriminately and throwing homemade bombs at the RAB team forcing the RAB men to retaliate and sparking a 20-minutes gunfight. Motiur sustained bullet injuries while trying to flee and had died on the spot. He was arrested on January 15, 2015.

Name: Mohan Bepari Molla
Identity: Sechchasebak Dal leader and under trial prisoner
Description: On January 16, 2015 Sechchasebak Dal leader, Mohan Bepari Molla died in Dhaka Medical College Hospital during treatment, under the supervision of the jail authority. The brother-in-law of the deceased, Mohammad Alamin claimed that on January 12, 2015 police of Shah Ali Police Station arrested Mohan under a criminal case and beat him in the police van. Mohan was tortured the whole night in the police station. After he was produced before the court, the court sent him to jail. However, his physical condition did not improve and he was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital by the jail authorities on January 16, where he died.

Name: Nuruzzaman Jhony
Identity: General Secretary of Chhatra Dal of Khilgaon thana unit
Description: Yakub Ali, father of Nuruzzaman told that on January 19, 2015 at around 1:00pm Nuruzzaman along with his friend Moin and 3/4 others went to Dhaka Central Jail to meet with his younger brother Hira. On the way back a white private car stopped in front of them. 2/3 men came out of the car and identified themselves as DB police. Then they arrested Nuruzzaman and Moin. Since then, he was missing. Later on, family found the body at Dhaka Medical College Morgue. DB deputy commissioner Krishnapada Roy said that police detained him from Nazimuddin Road on January 19, 2015 at afternoon and took him to Jorapukur field of Tilpapara to arrest the other gangsters on January 20.1.15. After that, he admitted his involvement in the attack on police van. A shoot out took place in the area and Nuruzzaman was caught in the line of fire. Later police recovered the bullet riddled body of Nuruzzaman.

Name: Solaiman Uddin Jisan
Description: Anamul Haque, Sub-Inspector of Daudkandi polce station said, on January 23, 2015 at around 1:45am, a patrol team of RAB- 11 signaled Jisan to stop at Jigatola on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway when he was returning to Laxmipur from Dhaka by motorcycle. As he did not stop, another team of the RAB tried to intercept Jisan. He then fired two shots at RAB. The RAB men were compelled to fire back. Jisan was hit by bullets and died on the spot around 4:00am.

Name: Abul Kalam Azad
Description: Lt. Colonel Khandakar Golam Sarowar, Director of RAB- 3 told that on January 25, 2015 at around 2:30am a team of RAB- 3 was patrolling in Banashri area. RAB signaled a car to stop. Then the car stopped and suddenly, a man from the car fired at the RAB and ran away. Another man of the car followed the previous one. Then RAB chased them and fired at them. The men got bullet injury and RAB brought them to DMCH. The duty doctor declared them dead.

Name: Mahbubur Rahman Mahbub
Description: Police said, acting on a tip-off, a police team raided Bagaritala around 3:00am after Mahbub along with his aides had blocked Jessore-Monirampur road with logs to commit a robbery. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the criminals opened fire. Police also fired back, triggering a gunfight, Mahbub was hit by bullets and died on the spot.

Name: Rafikul Islam
Description: A police team arrested Rafikul Islam on January 27, 2015 at afternoon and police took Rafikul for arresting his accompanies and recovering arms and explosives around 3:00am, on January 28, 2015. Then Rafikul's accomplices started firing indiscriminately at the police team forcing the police men to retaliate and sparking a 20-minutes gunfight. Rafikul sustained bullet injuries while trying to flee and had died at Satkhira Sadar Hospital.

Name: Nurul Islam Shahin
Identity: Leader of Jamaat-e-Islami and Teacher of Binodepur Islamia College
Description: A police team arrested Nurul Islam on January 27, 2015 at around 9:00pm and police took Nurul for arresting his accompanies and recovering arms and explosives around 2:00am, on January 28, 2015. Then Nurul's accomplices started firing indiscriminately at the police team forcing the police men to retaliate. Nurul Islam sustained bullet injuries while trying to flee and had died.

Name: Mainuddun Bhuiyan alias Biplob
Description: Family of Mainuddin alleged that Mainuddin was beaten to death by RAB. He was beaten when RAB arrested him. There was a mark of injury on the left side of Mainuddin's head. But RAB said that on January 29, 2015 at around 10:00pm, RAB arrested Mainuddin and Jakir from a tin shed house at Mogbazar while they were taking yaba. However RAB said that, after arrest, Mainuddin had a heart attack and became senseless. Then RAB took him to a private clinic and the duty doctor declared him dead.

Name: Ariful Islam
Identity: Student of law at a private university named Bangladesh Islami University and activist of student wing of BNP
Description: On January 29, 2015 at evening Ariful Islam was detained by a group of people identified themselves as members of DB from Kornofuli-4 steamer headed to 'Chorfashion'.Later police claimed that they found a dead body on that day at around 11.15 pm.

Name: Emdad Ullah
Identity: First year honours student of Dhaka College and a ward unit president of Islami Chattra Shibir
Description: An opposition activist was allegedly killed in an encounter,  with a team of the Mirpur police station, in the capitals Rupnagor area on February 2, 2015. The victim, Emdad Ullah, 18, of Jamalpur, was first year honours student of Dhaka College and a ward unit president of Islami Chattra Shibir. The Mirpur police station officer-in-charge Salauddin Khan said miscreants hurled petrol bombs and used fire arms when a police team, along with the arrested man, went to Ena Properties to arrest more miscreants. The youth was shot dead from shots fired by the miscreants, police said. The student political organisation, however, alleged policemen picked up the victim in front of his house at Section-6 in Mirpur, at about 7:00pm on January 31, 2015.

Name: Saidur Rahman
Identity: General Secretary of Ullapara upazila Jamaat-e-Islam unit
Description: Police alleged that, on February 1, 2015 at noon miscreants attacked by bomb in a CNG run three wheeler. In this incident they arrested Mohammad Ali. According to Mohammad Alis statement police went to Bakua village for an operation to arrest other miscreants. After reaching the place miscreants threw petrol bomb targeting the police. Police fired back while Saidur got injured. On the other hand, Moulana Shahinur Alam, Amir of Sirajganj District Jamaat-e-Islami denied the statement of police. He claimed that, Saidur was picked up by the police from a ceremony of death ritual (Kulkhani) and shot him in his leg in the road. He was injured and later on February 2, 2015 at midnight he died at Trauma Center of Sadar Hospital.

Name: M Yusuf
Identity: Activists of youth wing of BNP
Description: Two activists of youth wing of BNP were knocked down and killed by a truck as they were trying to throw petrol bombs at the vehicle in Jessore on February 3, 2015, the police said. The victims were identified as M Yusuf of Taherpur and Mohammad Liton of Durgapur under Monirampur upazila. Their families and associates, however, cliamed that the two were found dead on February 3, 2015 at morning after being picked up by the police on February 2, 2015 at night. Monirampur upazila unit BNP president Shahid Iqbal alleged that the police had killed them and staged the drama of a road accident.

Name: Shakhawat Hossain
Description: Two youths were killed in a gunfight with RAB in the capital's Jatrabari early on February 4, 2015. Commanding Officer Zamil Ahmad of Rapid Action Battalion-10 said a team of RAB-10 was patrolling in Matuail area of Jatrabari around 2:15am. All of a sudden, brick chunks were hurled at the RAB vehicle. Several crude bombs went off on the road and gun shots were fired at the team, forcing the law enforcers to open fire on the thugs. Failing to hold out against the RAB members, the criminals left the scene a little later. An additional force then joined the RAB team and launched a search in the area. They found two bullet-hit people lying in a pool of blood there, mentioned Zamil Ahmad. He added: Law enforcers later sent the two injured to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.
Sources: The Daily Star 05.02.2015 and Prothom Alo 06.02.2015

Name: Monir Hossain
Description: Police alleged that a youth on February 5, 2015 at around 3.15 am threw two petrol bombs targeting police in front of LDCL at Senpara Porbota, Rokeya Soroni. Then police fired back and found a bullet hit dead body.

Name: Shahbuddin
Identity: Information affairs secretary of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islam of Rajshahi University unit
Description: Police went to conduct an operation to Shomsadipur area. At that time, activists of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami hurled hand made bombs at the Police's vehicle. Police fired back and Shahbuddin bullet wounds. Later, he was taken to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where he died

Name: Shahab Uddin Patwary
Identity: President of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: On February 6, 2015 police patrolling in the Dhaka-Chittagong highway while at Shamuksha area a group of miscreants hurled petrol bombs to create disruption. Police fired back while Shahab got bullet wounds. He was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctor declared him dead. However, victims brother alleged that his brother was picked up by plainclothes police from his house at Chandishkora, Chouddogram, Comilla on February 5, 2015,

Name: Shahidul Islam
Description: Shahidul was killed in a gunfight and Abdul Majid, another one was left injured allegedly by police February 6, 2015. Jessore Additional Superintendent of Police  KM Ariful Haque said a gunfight took place in front of Khanika Picnic Spot of sadar upazila around 1:45am. Police challenged a gang of miscreants who were heading towards Jessore in a microbus. They started firing while police also retaliated. The gunfight left one bullet injured, claimed Ariful. The injured was declared dead at Jessore Medical College and Hospital.

Name: Bachchu
Identity: An activist of the student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: Bachchu was trying to create anarchy in the upazila by throwing petrol bombs at different points of the upazila. Police arrested him with two petrol bombs around 11:00pm on February 6, 2015 from the upazila town. As per his statement during preliminary interrogation, a police team along with Bachchu went for recovering more petrol bombs. When the team reached Nesarabad bus terminal area around 2:30am on February 7,2015 accomplices of Bachchu opened fire on police. The law enforcers also returned fire, triggering a gunfight with Bachchu's men. Bachchu was hit by bullets and died on the spot, the police official said.

Name: Swapan
Description: Swapan was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight at around 1.30 am on February 8, 2015. He was arrested by Kotowali Model Police Station and handed over to Sadar South Model Police Station at around 1.00 am. Then a police team of Sadar South Model Police Station conducted a drive to recover arms with him to his village Rampur. However, on the way to Vatpara Swapan's accomplice attacked the police. Police also fired back.  Swapan was bullet hit. Later, he was taken to the Comilla Medical College Hospital, where the doctor pronounced him dead.

Name: Mehedi Hasan alias Raju
Description: On February 7, 2015, RAB arrested Mehedi from his house at around 9 pm. Then RAB took him to a brick field for recovering arms at Kazipur late night on February 8, 2015. Then a group of miscreants fired to RAB and RAB also fired back. However, Mehedi got bullet wounds. He was taken to Jessore General Hospital where doctor declared him dead.

Name: Jasim Uddin
Identity: Activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami and Student of Kazipara Siddiquia Senior Fajil Madrasa
Description: Madrasa student Jasim Uddin, 26, was killed in a "shootout" with police in the capital's Taltola around 4:00am. A statement, signed by Officer-in-Charge Ganesh Gopal Biswas of Sher-e-Bangla Nagar Police Station, said police picked up six alleged Shibir men including Jasim on February 8, 2015 following an attack on traffic sergeant Golam Mawla at Shishu Mela crossing near Shyamoli. After obtaining information from Jasim, a police team took him to Taltola to arrest Shibir leader Delwar and his accomplices. As the team reached the area around 3:45am, Delwar and his accomplices hurled crude bombs at and opened fire on police. At one point, they snatched Jasim away from the police custody. Police too opened fire on the criminals. Although the Shibir men managed to flee, Jasim's bullet-hit body was found later. However, the victim's brother Anisur Rahman claimed his brother was innocent and had been killed in a pre-planned way. 'Police picked him up from Agargaon on 7th February afternoon. He had been missing since then," said Anisur at Dhaka Medical College morgue, where the body was sent for an autopsy. Jasim was badly wounded in the chest, said the brother.
Sources: Prothom alo 09.02.2015 and The Daily Star 09.02.2015 http://www.thedailystar.net/3-more-killed-in-shootouts-63876

Name: Mohammad Nahid
Description: On February 2, 2015 a civil team of Pallabi police station which led by SI Touhidul Islam picked up Nahid in front of Proshika Bhaban, Mirpur, Dhaka. Family members got information about Nahid from a source of Pallabi police station. Meanwhile,family members also talked with Nahid over phone. At a time, they also talked with SI Touhidul Islam Arefin and SI Subroto while the police officers asked for money (5 lacs tk) from them. As they didn't provide the said money, on February 5 , 2015 they found the bullet wounds dead body of Nahid at Dhaka Medical College Morgue.

Name: Rasel Sarder
Identity: An employee of mobile servicing centre
Description:
Police said a patrol team of Detectives  Branch of Police came under attack in the area at 3:30am on February 9, 2015 when some pickets hurled bombs and fired at them.Police retaliated by firing back and at one point Rasel was hit by bullets. He was rushed to DMCH where doctors declared him dead at around 5:00am, said DMP Deputy Commissioner (media and public relation) Masudur Rahman. However, Rasels brother Akash Sarder claimed his brother was innocent and had no link to any political party. He went missing on February 5 after getting out of the shop around 12:00pm.
He said they had been searching for him at different police stations in Dhaka and Narayanganj, but no one could tell them about his whereabouts.We came to know through television news that a body was kept at DMCH morgue after gunfight at Jatrabari. We went to DMCH and found the body, said Akash.

Name: Arif
Identity: Joint secretary of Pashchim Lalanagar ward unit youth wing of BNP
Description: Arif  (22) was killed in a police encounter with alleged blockaders in Sitakunda of Chittagong on February 14, 2015. Arif was declared dead on arrival at CMCH at around 11:30pm. Saiful Islam, Assistant Superintendent of Police of Chittagong, claimed that a group of criminals hurled a crude bomb at a police petrol team in Nonachhara area around 9:30pm. The group then opened fire on the team, forcing the police to retaliate, the ASP claimed.

Name: Md. Mozammel
Identity: An alleged leader of the robber gang
Description: Md. Mozammel, an alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police in Amtali upazila of Barguna early on February 14, 2015. On information, a police team conducted a drive at a deserted house when the robbers were taking preparation there, for committing a robbery, said Sukumar Roy, officer-in-charge of Amtali Police Station. The gang first fired bullets targeting the law enforcers who then retaliated by firing shots, informs the OC. Later, Mozammels body was found lying on the spot which was then sent to Barguna General Hospital morgue for autopsy..

Name: Moshiur Rahman
Identity: Organising secretary of Chhoighoria ward BNP in Magura
Description: On February 17, 2015 Moshiur's son Kazi Nayon Hossain said that locals had seen police chase his father and six other people who were chatting at a tea stall in Chhoigharia Bazar. At one point, they [locals] heard gunshots and after some time we learned my father was shot, he said. Another bullet-hit, Rafiqul Patwari, was picked up by police, locals claimed. Law enforcers, however, refuted the claim. Police said a patrol team led by Biplob Kumar Nath, officer-in-charge of Shalikha Police Station, came under attack at Chhoighoria village around 6:45pm. As the law enforcers were crossing the Hazambari intersection by a van, they saw four to five men sitting there. When we asked them about their whereabouts, the group opened fire and threw a bomb on the police van, prompting us to return fire,  Moshiur was taken to Magura Sadar hospital where doctors pronounced him dead, said police.
Sources: The Daily Star 16.02.2015 and Prothom Alo 16.02.2015

Name: Motiar Rahman
Identity: President of Shibir's Nashratpur union unit in Dinajpur
Description: He was shot during a raid by a team of police and BGB personnel at Ranirbandar of Dinajpur on February 17, 2015 at night. Police and locals said that during the raid around 8:30pm police arrested BNP activist Khoda Bakhs, an accused in several arson cases. As the team was taking him out of the area, Jamaat-Shibir and BNP men exploded several crude bombs and surrounded the team in a bid to snatch the arrestee. Police fired rubber bullets and then the BGB men fired seven shots. Motiar, Bakhs' elder brother, who led the attack, was hit by three bullets, said Anisur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Chirirbandar Police Station. Law enforcers took Motiar, son of Abdur Rahman of Dakkhin Nashratpur, to Dinajpur Medical College Hospital. Later, he was moved to the capital, said Dinajpur Superintendent of Police Ruhul Amin. Police took Motiar's body to Dhaka Medical College morgue from NICD around 4:00pm, but none came for his body as of 12:15 am today, said morgue sources.

Name: Liton Miah
Description: Liton Miah, an alleged mugger was killed in police firing while a gang was fleeing after snatching valuables from a man in Mymensingh town on February 15, 2015. Police said some four to five muggers took away a mobile phone set and TK 2,800 in cash from one Abdul Wahab at Balashpur around 3.00 am. He was returning home from his workshop in the towns Mashkanda area. Hearing his screams, a police team patrolling the area chased the muggers, said Abu Mohammad Fazlul Karim, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the gang tried to attack the police team with sharp weapons. Police opened fire to retaliate. Liton was hit by bullets and died on the spot. The others fled, the police official said.

Name: Abu Sayeed
Description: Sayeed and Bajlu were detained by the police of Monirampur Police Station at evening on February 17, 2015. Then at around 3.00 am  they were taken to Begaritola for rescuing arms while accomplices attcked on police. Police retaliated and opened fire. In this incident, Sayeed and Bajlu were killed

Name: Mostafa Manjil
Identity: A Jamaat activist and former president of Gaibandha Sadar unit of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: Mostafa Manjil (32), a Jamaat activist and former president of Gaibandha Sadar unit Islami Chhatra Shibir, the student wing of the party the prime accused of the February 6, Gaibandha bus arson, was killed in a "shootout" with the RAB in the district on February 17, 2015.

Name: Rafique Uddin alias Chhoto Tareque
Identity: Regional leader of Purba Banglar Communist Party
Location: Bishoykhali Bazar under Jhenidah Sadar upazila, Jhenaidah
Description: Rafique Uddin alias Chhoto Tareque, 40, was a resident of a cluster village in Bishoykhali Bazar under Jhenaidah Sadar Upazila. According to the RAB, he was the regional leader of Purba Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-Janajuddah). But his family claimed that he was an activist of Jubo League, a pro-ruling Awami League youth organisation, and RABb men picked him up the day before. Two villagers said they saw a Rab team detain him on February 16, 2015.

Name: Tipu Hawlader
Identity: Sports secretary of student wing of BNP of Agailjhara upazila unit
Description: Two of them were killed in a 'shootout' with police in Agailjhara of Barisal on February 21, 2015. They stood accused in a case for firebombing a fruit-laden pick-up on February 9, in Agailjhara and had been absconding since then, said Monirul Islam, officer-in-charge of Agailjhara Police Station. OC Monirul said a team of Agailjhara police with the help of DB police  in Dhaka caught Kabir from his relative's house in Ashulia around 4.00 am on February 21, 2015. Around an hour later, the same team arrested TIpu from Keraniganj, on the outskirts of the capital. Around midnight the two were taken to Agailjhara to hunt down other accused in the arson case. As the law enforcers reached Jobarpar, they came under a firebomb attack around 2.10 am on February 22, 2015, he claimed. They also opened fire on police, forcing them to retaliate with gunfire, said the OC. After the gunfight, police found the bullet-riddled bodies of Tipu and Kabir on the ground.

Name: Kabir Molla
Identity: An activist of youth wing of BNP

Name: Asadul Hawlader
Description: A group of police led by SI Mukul and Russel of Bhanga Police Station came to Miapara village on February 21, 2015 and detained Asadul and Johor Ali while they were working in the field. Johor escaped and jump to the pond. On the other hand police dragged Asadul with a chain from his throat. As a result he died.

Name: Hossen Ahmad
Description: Hossen Ahmad was allegedly killed by BGB in a gunfight at Teknaf, Cox'sbazar on February 18, 2015. On that day a group of yaba traders from Myanmer were waiting by the side of River. After receiving information BGB went to the place and a gunfight ensued. As a result, Hossen Ahmad killed in the gunfight.

Name: Rafiqul Islam alias Khokon
Description: On February 19, 2015 Rafiqul Islam was killed in a gunfight. However, eye-witnesses Abdul Kadir, Jalal Uddin, Shamim and Babul Mia informed that he was arrested by the police before the gunfight.

Name: Abdul Odud
Identity: Activist of Sramik Dal( worker's wing of BNP)
Description: Abdul Odud was arrested in the morning then at night he was taken to Kalayanpur Housing for rescuing arms.At that time, his accomplices opened fire while police also retaliated. In this incident he was killed.

Name: Shaheen
Description: Shaheen was killed in a gunfight with police in Sreenagar upazila on February 25, 2015. Sheikh Mahbubur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Sreenagar Police Station, said a police team launched a drive at Rudrapara village around 1:30pm acting on intelligence that a group of armed thugs gathered there to commit criminal activities. Sensing the presence of cops, criminals opened fire on law enforcers, leaving one Al Amin injured. On information, an additional police force went to the spot and cordoned off the area. Criminals at that time again opened fire on cops, prompting retaliatory police fire that left Shaheen dead on the spot. The other criminals managed to flee the scene.

Name: Daud Ali
Location: Chhoto-Khalimpur village in Magura sadar upazila, Magura
Description: The head of the outlaws' gang 'Daud Bahini' Daud was killed in a gunfight between police and his cohorts at Chhoto-Khalimpur village in Magura sadar upazila early hours on February 25, 2015.

Name: Rezawanul
Identity: Local leader of youth wing of BNP
Description: Rezawanul was shot dead by police while there was a clash ensued between police and local people regarding the arrest of Habibur Rahman, a leader of BNP and father of Rezawanul.

Name: Saddam Mollah
Description: Lt Col Faridul Alam, Commanding Officer of RAB-8, said they had information that some members of Sagar-Saikat Bahini had set up a den at Katleswar Khal, locally known as Katlar Khal, under the Sharankhola range and had been holed up there. A RAB-8 team led by Maj Adnan Kabir reached the area, around 45 kilometres south of Sharankhola, around 7:00am. Sensing the presence of RAB, the robbers opened fire prompting the RAB men to retaliate, said the RAB-8 CO. After around a half-an-hour-long "gunfight", the robbers retreated and the RAB men found three bullet-riddled bodies lying on the ground, he said.

Name: Mohammad Monsur Ali
Description: On February 28, 2015 Mohammad Monsur Ali was shot dead by a group of police. The agitated fishermen went to catch fish in river while the powerful lessee called the police to obstruct the general fishermen. Those lessees filed a case before one week against the general fishermen thus they were in a panic of arrest. As a result they started to agitate and went there to catch fish.

Name: Arif Hossain
Identity: A leader of youth wing of BNP
Description: On March 1, 2015 Arif and Mainuddin were received bullet injury in a gunfight with police. Later Arif succumbed to his  injuries on March 11, 2015.
Sources: Jugantor, Prothom Alo and Bangladesh Protidin 12.03.2015

Name: Nazmul Huda Lablu
Identity: President of Shramik Kalyan Federation and ex-president of Islami Chhatra Shibir
Description: Nazmul Huda Lablu, President of Shramik Kalyan Federation and ex-president of Islami Chhatra Shibir was killed in a clash between police at Mithapukur in Rangpur. Police informed that on March 9, 2015 at around 3:30 am, a group of criminals were cutting trees at Baldipukur area in Rangpur-Dhaka Highway. At that time criminals threw cocktails and petrol bombs at police when police put barrier. Criminals fled when police opened fire in self defense. Later Nazmul Huda Lablu was rescued with bullet wounds and taken to Rangpur Medical College Hospital where the doctors on duty declared him dead. Brother-in-law of the deceased ialleged that  on March 8 at around 7:00 pm, Lablu was picked up by some men in plain clothes identifying them as members of law enforcement agency at gun point from Shanerhat Kalanur Shahpur village under Pirganj Upazila. On March 9 at noon, police informed them to bring the body. Deceaseds father Nurunnabi Shah said that police staged a drama of gunfight after killing my son.

Name: Mohammad Apu
Description: Family alleged that, Mohammad Apu was  picked up by DB police on March 10, 2015. Later, his dead body was found on March 11, 2015. Police claimed that they found the dead body at 11 am and sent to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital for post mortem. They claimed that  he was an alleged mugger.

Name: Hasan Ali Sana
Description: An alleged leader of a robber gang was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Hongshu Rajerchar area of the Sundarbans on March 12, 2015.Acting on a tip-off, law enforcers conducted a drive in Dabura area of Shyamnagar upazila in Satkhira on March 11, 2015 and arrested Sana. He was handed over to Koyra police around 11.00 pm. After gleaning information from Sana, a police team taking him along with them launched a drive in Hongshu Rajerchar area around 2.00 am to recover arms. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Sana's cohorts opened fire in a bid to snatch him, forcing the police members to retaliate by firing.As a result Sana died in the gunfight.

Name: Md. Israfil
Identity: Joint Convener of youth wing of BNP's Bashikpur Union
Description: The family alleged that plainclothes police had killed him after picking him up.

Name: Yunus Ali
Description: A robber was allegedly killed in a 'gunfight' with police in Panchbaria area on the Jessore-Magura Highway in the district on March 17, 2015. Receiving information that a gang of robbers was taking preparations for looting night coaches and good-laden trucks on the highway by felling a tree, a police team went to the spot at around 4.00 am, said Akkas Ali, OC of Jessore Kotwali Police Station.Sensing the presence of the team, the robbers exploded crude bombs and opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate.Yunus Ali sustained bullet wounds and died on the spot while his accomplices managed to flee, the OC said.

Name: Mukter Hossain
Description: A suspected robber was killed and four of his aides were injured in a 'gunfight' with police at Joydevpur area under Alfadanga upazilla  in Faridpur on March 16, 2015.

Name: Iqbal Hossain
Description: Iqbal was killed in a 'gunfight' between his cohorts and police in Kaliganj Kanchatala Bazar area undre Kaliganj upazila of the district on March 21, 2015. The deceased was Iqbal Hossain (28), son of Abul Kashem of Arpara village.

Name: Jahangir Hossain
Description: On March 19, 2015 Jahangir was arrested by police from Chakbazaar of Old Dhaka as a suspect of a dacoity case. Police produced him in the court and appealed for remand. In the remand period on March 20, 2015 police claimed that Jahangir hanged himself to death.However, family alleged that he died due to torture by police.There were marks of torture in his body.

Name: Mobarok Ullah Monti
Identity: An accussed of a murder case
Description: Mobarok was killed in a shootout with Rapid Action Battalion in the capitals TT Para slum area on March 22, 2015. He was identified as Mobarok Ullah Monti, 45, an accused in the recent murder of one Sumi Akter in Motijheel area, said the battalion officials.

Name: Al Amin Hossain
Location: Jhapjhopiar char in the district's Koyra upazila, Khulna
Description: T M Rokunuzzaman, OC of Khulna district Detective Branch (DB) of police, said acting on a tip off, a joint team of DB and Koyra police arrested Al Amin from Chandkhali in Koyra around 10:15 pm on March 29,2015. After gleaning information from Al Amin, police raided Jhapjhopiarchar area, which is adjacent to the Sundarbans, in search of his den and arms. The law enforcers took him along with them at that time. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, other gang members in the area opened fire on police, triggering a gunfight that lasted for almost an hour. Al Amin was found dead when the shooting ended. However, his cohorts managed to escape.

Name: Lokman Hossain
Identity: Supporter of Chairman Cadidate Abdul Matin
Description: Lokman Hossain was shot to death by police during a  clash occurred regarding the UP election for counting votes in Rangpur. At Chowdhurypara Madrassa vote centre while presiding officer announced Sohel Rana won then the other contestant Abdul Matin protested it. A clash ensued there. As a result , police opened fire while Lokman recived bullet injuries and died after sometimes.
Sources: Jugantor 30.03.2015 and Majhabul Mannan, correspondent of daily Manabzamin, cell no- 01712111419

Name: Kamrul Sheikh
Location: Katakhali, Perikhali union, Rampal upazila, Bagerhat
Description: He was allegedly killed by Rab in a gunfight on April 1, 2015.

Name: Bellal Hossain
Description: Bellal was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police on April 6, 2015 at Panirghat, Sharankhola, Bagerhat.

Name: Omar Faruk
Description: A procession is brought out at Maizdi while police opened fire. In the incident, Omar received bullet injury and died.

Name: Shahidul Islam
Identity: Activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami and employee of Rajshahi Islami Bank Medical College Hospital
Description: On April 12, 2015 at around 3.00 am Shahidul Islam was detained by DB police  from Rajshahi Islami Bank Medical College Hospital while he was on duty at that time. However, Secretary Raihanul Islam of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami claimed that  police took him to Noudpara near police station and shot him dead.

Name: Anisur Rahman Anis
Identity: Student of Sirajganj Maulana Bhasani Degree College and an activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: Police alleged that on April 12, 2015  Anis blasted a two cocktails in front of police station. He was arrested by the police. Later he died in crossfire while his accoplices came to rescue him.

Name: Unidentified
Description: In Keraniganj, an alleged unidentified robber, aged around 28, was killed in a 'gunfight' between his cohorts and police at Prohori Bita in Keraniganj.

Name: Milon Ahmed
Description: The chief of an inter-district robber gang was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Mirpur upazila on April 21, 2015. The dead, Milon  was the son of Abdus Sattar of Laxmidhardia village in the upazila.Milon's family alleged that two officials of the police station- Sub-Inspector Abdul Halim and Assistant Sub-Inspector Atiqur Rahman- picked up Milon on April 18, 2015 night and cooked up the "gunfight" story.

Name: Uzzal
Description: Uzzal was allegedly killed by the police in a gunfight on April 21, 2015.

Name: Sohel Rana
Description: Sohel Rana was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight on April 25,2015.

Name: Al Mamun
Description: An alleged  robber was killed  in a 'gunfight' with police in Khulna city on May 5, 2015 . A special team, led by Officer-in-Charge Sukumer Biswas, went to Bagmara Burir Bagan area in the city along with the two robbers to arrest their cohorts and recover firearms at around 8.30 pm, said Assistant Commissioner of Khulna Metropolitan Police, Ziauddin Ahmed. Sensing the presence of the policemen, the cohorts of the robbers opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. At one stage, the robbers retreated. Police found Al Mamun dead .

Name: Abdus Salam
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with police. Acting on a tip-off, around 3:00am, a joint-team of Joypurhat DB and Panchbibi police raided Bhutgari village where some seven to eight robbers were preparing for committing a robbery, according to police. As soon as the law enforcers reached the spot, the criminals started firing on them. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering a gunfight, said Abu Hena Mostafa Kamal, officer-in-charge of Panchbibi Police Station. After the gunfight, police found two bodies on the spot and those were sent to Joypurhat Modern Hospital for autopsy.

Name: Babu Mia
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with police. Acting on a tip-off, around 3:00am, a joint-team of Joypurhat DB and Panchbibi police raided Bhutgari village where some seven to eight robbers were preparing for committing a robbery, according to police. As soon as the law enforcers reached the spot, the criminals started firing on them. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering a gunfight, said Abu Hena Mostafa Kamal, officer-in-charge of Panchbibi Police Station. After the gunfight, police found two bodies on the spot and those were sent to Joypurhat Modern Hospital for autopsy.

Name: Dholu Hossain
Description: Three alleged human traffickers were killed in a gunfight with police in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar on May 8, 2015. Acting on a tip-off, a team of police conducted a raid at Hatchery Beach area in Teknaf around 3:30am, said Ataur Rahman Khandakar, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the human traffickers opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate that triggered a 30-minute gunfight, he said. The gunfight left the three traffickers dead on the spot.

Name: Jahangir Alam
Description: Three alleged human traffickers were killed in a gunfight with police in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar on May 8, 2015. Acting on a tip-off, a team of police conducted a raid at Hatchery Beach area in Teknaf around 3:30am, said Ataur Rahman Khandakar, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the human traffickers opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate that triggered a 30-minute gunfight, he said. The gunfight left the three traffickers dead on the spot.

Name: Zafar Alam
Description: Three alleged human traffickers were killed in a gunfight with police in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar on May 8, 2015. Acting on a tip-off, a team of police conducted a raid at Hatchery Beach area in Teknaf around 3:30am, said Ataur Rahman Khandakar, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the human traffickers opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate that triggered a 30-minute gunfight, he said. The gunfight left the three traffickers dead on the spot.

Name: Belal Hossain
Location: Meherghona village under Coxs Bazar Sadar Upazila
