Description: A human trafficking suspect was killed by the police in a reported gunfight in Coxs Bazar while an anti-human trafficking team of the Coast Guard and the Navy detained 116 Malaysia-bound job seekers from Bay of Bengal near St Martins Island. Human trafficking suspect Belal Hossain, 38, of Kawarpara village under Khoroskhool union of Coxs Bazar was in a gunfight at Meherghona village under Coxs Bazar sadar upazila at about 5:00am, the police claimed.

Name: Sultan alias Khokon
Description: Sultan alias  Khokonl was allegedly killed in a shootout with police in Meherpur Sadar upazila. Ahsan Habib, officer-in-charge of Meherpur Sadar Police Station, said acting on a tip-off, police raided Sultan's hideout at College intersection of Meherpur district town and arrested Sultan. As per Sultan's statement, a police team took him to Rajnagar village in Meherpur Sadar upazila around 5:00am to recover arms and arrest his accomplices. As soon as the law enforcers reached near a bridge in the village, the aides of Sultan opened fire on them. Police returned fire, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, Sultan tried to flee but was caught in the line of fire. He died on the spot.

Name: Imam Hossain
Description: He was arrested by police on May 6, 2015 from Purba Shakpura village, Boyalkhali. On May 7, 2015 he fall sick  before producing court. Then he was taken to Upazila Govt Hospital and later he was refered to Chittagong Medical College Hospital. On May 11, 2015 he died in the hospital. Family alleged that he died due to torture.

Name: Saiyan Islam
Description: Saiyan Islam was stabbed to death by the BGB members at Hilli border in Dinajpur.

Name: Jafar Majhi
Description: He was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight on May 5, 2015 at Sonarpara, Ukhiya.

Name: Alamgir
Location: Nandabala Canal in the Sunderbans under Mongla in Bagerhat, Sundarban
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in gunfight with RAB-8 on May 10, 2015 at Nandabala Canal in the Sunderbans under Mongla in Bagerhat.

Name: Hazrat Ali
Description: An alleged highway robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Joypurhat's Khetlal upazila on May 20, 2015 night.

Name: Sohel
Description: Sohel was allegedly shot by police while he was snatching. Later he died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

Name: Altaf Hossain Sagar
Description: He was allegedly killed by RAB in a gunfight on May 28, 2015 at Motijheel.

Name: Rezaul Karim
Description: Rezaul was arrested and beaten up with chain  on May 14, 2015 at around 11.30 am .At that time, Rezaul fall in the ground and he was taken to a car at that condition by the police. He was given treatment but died.

Name: Ishaq Miah
Identity: A security guard of a private firm
Description: The police claimed that the suspect, Ishaq Miah, 45, had committed suicide in a toilet at the police station while the family alleged that the police were bribed to kill him.He was died in the custody of Kotwali Police Station in Chittagong.

Name: Mohammad Jasim Uddin
Description: Mohammad Jasim Uddin was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight.

Name: Selim Sheikh
Description: Selim Sheikh was allegedly killed in a 'gunfight' with police at Kanaipur in Sadar upazila on June 13, 2015. Receiving information that a gang of robbers was taking preparation to commit robbery in the area, a team of police conducted a drive in the area around 3.30 am. Sensing the presence of the team, the robbers opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate.At one stage, Selim recieved bullets and died on the spot while others managed to flee.

Name: Mohammad Jamal alias Shah Jamal
Description: Shah Jamal was allegedly killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB-08 at Shoronkhola.

Name: Nazmul Islam Sagar
Description: Nazmul Islam Sagar was allegedly killed in a 'gunfight' between police and his cohorts at Katlamari under Mirpur upazila on June 19, 2015. Mirpur police officer-in-charge Jalal Uddin said they had information that 10-12 robbers were preparing to commit robbery on the Kushtia-Meherpur road. A police team conducted a drive in the area around 2:15 am, he said. Sensing the presence of the police, the robbers opened fire on police prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, triggering a gunfight.

Name: Mamun Mia
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a "gunfight" between RAB and his cohorts in Hidarabad area of Gazipur on June 23, 2015. Muhith Kabir, operation officer of RAB-1, said a gang of robbers intercepted a patrol microbus of the elite force at Haidarabad on Tongi-Kaliganj road around 3.30 am.When another microbus of RAB reached the spot, the gang opened fire on the law enforcers, reports our Gazipur correspondent."The RAB members fired back in retaliation, which triggered a gunfight, he said, adding that they recovered the bullet-hit body of Mamun from the spot his cohorts managed to flee.

Name: Shahin
Description: Two people were killed in firing by BGB men at Birampur in Dinajpur on June 30, 2015 afternoon. OC Md Amiruzzaman said that  a BGB team seized Indian smuggled clothes from Birampur Railway Station around 4.00 pm and left the station.Immediately after the seizure, the smugglers gathered in the area and tortured a BGB source, he said.On hearing it, the BGB members came to the area again when the 'smugglers' swooped on them.He, quoting the BGB members, said the BGB team opened fire in their self-defence, leaving Shahin and Sultan dead on the spot.Locals, however, claimed that Shahin and Sultan were 'common people' and used to run shops in the area.As the news spread in the area, locals blocked the Birampur-Dinajpur highway by felling tree logs and keeping the bodies on the road, police and locals said.

Name: Md. Yusuf
Description: Md. Yusuf was shot dead by police in the capital's Hatirjheel area on June 30, 2015, although the deceased's family members said that he was picked up by police on June 28, 2015. The deceased's wife Ruksana Begum said that Tejgaon Industrial police picked Yusuf on June 28, 2015 night and they saw him in police station on June 29 at afternoon.Yusuf told his family members that police demanded Tk 50000 for his release. The police station officer-in-Charge Mizanur Rahman , however, brushed aside allegation and said that Yusuf was shot during a gunfight.

Name: Shamim Ahmed
Description: Shamim Ahmed was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Purano Paltan area of the capital.

Name: Mohammad Jony
Description: An undertrial prisoner named Mohammad Jony died in Rajshahi Central jail as a result of torture by police in custody. However police claimed that Jony committed suicide by hanging himself with a local towel ( gamcha). The victim's family alleged that Jony was arrested by police being a suspect of thief, tortured to death in Rajshahi police line custody.

Name: Najim Uddin
Description: Najim Uddin was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police on July 7, 2015.

Name: Yasin Sarkar Rajon
Identity: Alleged mugger/A sanitary worker and also Juba League activist
Description: A sanitary worker and also Juba League activist was shot dead by RAB at Taltola in Agargaon after he was abducted allegedly by the force on July 12, said the victim's family members. The deceased was identified as Yasin Sarker Rajon,32. However,RAB claimed, deceased was a mugger and accused in several cases, including murder, claimed RAB.RAB-2 Commanding Officer SM Masud Rana claimed that their petrol team challenged a gang of muggers in the area around 2.30 am when they were trying to flee.RAB team chased the gang, at that time, the gang opened fire.RAB  men retaliated and Rajon sustained bullet injuries.Later, Rajon was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead. The victim's brother Nazmul Haque Panna, however, said that Rajon was going to his relative's house on that night when four to five motorbikes intercepted him and he was picked up into a microbus.

Name: Suman
Description: In Rangpur, two brothers were killed in a 'gunfight' with the RAB personnel in the city's Dhap area. Two RAB men-Sub-Inspector Saiful Islam and Constable Imran were also injured during the 'gunfight' and admitted to Rangpur Medical College Hospital. .According to the RAB, a team of RAB-13 challenged the duo around 3.00 am.They tried to escape the scene opening fire to the RAB men that prompting them to retaliate that triggered the 'gunfight' leaving the duo dead on the spot, claimed the RAB officials.The victims were identified as Suman,26 and Manik, 25, sons of Abdul Malek, residents of Khaliphatari in the city.

Name: Palash Malitha
Identity: A regional leader of Purbo Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-ML)
Location: Bhangabottala village of the upazila, Kushtia
Description: Acting on a tip-off that a group of robbers was preparing for committing a highway robbery in Bhangabottala village of the upazila, a police team raided the area around 2.30 am said Kazi Jalal Uddin, OC of Mirpur Police Station.When the law enforcers reached the spot, the criminals opened fire on police, prompting them to return fire that triggered a "gunfight".

Name: Md Abu Zafar
Description: An alleged drug peddler was killed in an encounter with Rapid Action Battalion at Patenga Sea beach in  Chittagong city on July 26, 2015.RAB lLegal and Media Wing Assistant Director Major Maksudul Alam said Zafar, ayaba lord of South Chittagong zone, was killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB 7 officials.

Name: Tarikul Islam Taru
Description: Taru was reportedly killed in a 'gunfight' with the members of Rapid Action battalion-8 in Majhgram area of the district town on July 27, 2015.Taru went missing on July 17, according to a general diary filed with Sadar police station by his wife Rekha Begum.

Name: Miarul Islam
Description: An alleged ringleader was killed in a gunfight with police.A team arrested Miarul, accused in 10 cases including two for murder, from Nurpur village on August 1, 2015, said Ahsan Habib, OC of Meherpur Police Station.Then while he was taken to recover fire arms in the mean time his cohorts came and a gunfight ensued. which caused him dead.

Name: Abdus Salam
Description: Salam's mother Rawshanara Begum alleged that police killed her son after taking bribe from his rivals. She admitted her son was accussed in several cases and was detained in prison several years ago.The house owner said Salam rented the room a month ago and had been living there with his wife, Ruby, and their two-and-a-half-years old child.According to them, police first entered the building and asked residents not to move and then stormed Salam's room.A few minutes later, the tenants heard three to four gun-shots.About one and a half hours later police took away an unconscious Salam, who was bleeding, neighbours said.

Name: Farhad
Description: An alleged forest robber was killed in a 'gunfight' with members of Rapid Action Battalion in Alki of the Sunderbans in Koyra of Khulna on August 4, 2015 night.Khulna RAB-6 Commanding Officer Khalikuzzaman said on a tip-off that the forest robber gang was preparing to commit robbery in the area, a team of the elite force launched a drive there at about 7.30 pm. Sensing the presence of RAB members, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight.Farhad was caught in the line of fire and seriously injured while other members of the gang managed to flee the spot.Farhad was rushed to Koyra Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead at about 9.30 pm.

Name: Abdus Sobhan
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and police at Burumaria in Pangsha of Rajbari on August 7, 2015.Abu Samad Md Hayat, officer-in-charge of Pangsha Police Station, said police arrested the robber from Charkalimohar at around 10.00 pm on August 6, 2015 .Later a team of police along with Sobhan conducted a drive at a mango orchard of Akter Master in Burumaria around 1.30 am to recover firearms.Sensing the presence of the lawenforcers, associates of Sobhan opened fire to the police, prompting the police force to retaliate, triggering a gunfight.Sobhan was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

Name: Siddiq Sana
Description: Six alleged tiger poachers were killed in a 'gunfight' with police in the Sundarbans on August 9, 2015. Police claimed that all the six are 'tiger poachers' and members of a Sundarbans-based robber gang. Acting on a tip-off that some 'tiger poachers' were in Alki Mandarbaria area of the West Sundarbans in Koyra upazila, a police team raided the area at around 3.45 pm, said Harendranath Sarkar, OC of Koyra Police Station. The victim's family and locals alleged that they were detained by the police day before gunfight.
Sources: The Daily Star 10.08.2015 and Prothom Alo 12.08.2015

Name: Sardar Abdur Rob
Description: On August 10, 2015 a gunfight was ensued when Sardar Abdur Rob was allegedly killed by police.

Name: Zahidul Islam Alo
Description: An alleged yaba trader was killed on August 17, 2015 in what RAB claimed was a gunfight, but the victim's family claimed he was murdered. Major Shahid Sarwar of RAB-7 said the incident occurred when a RAB team was patrolling the Dhaka-Chittagong highway and came across a pick-up van on Port-Bhatiary link road at 2.45 am.They saw two people in the van and asked them to stop as they were trying to drive  away.At that time the two men opened fire at the RAB team,and a gunfight followed. The pick up managed to flee after a while.Later, RAB members found Zahidul's bullet-riddled body.He was rushed to Chittagong Medical College Hospital only to be declared dead on arrival.Family members refuted the Rab statement, calling it a cooked-up story.Yasmin Akhter, wife of the deceased, said her husband was abducted by  7-8 people  in plainclothes from a friend's house in Dhaka at around 8.00 am on August 15, 2015.

Name: Arzu Miah
Description: Arzu Miah killed in a gunfight between his associates  and RAB members in the capital's Hazaribagh area on August 18, 2015 around 12 hours after he and his friends allegedly beat a teenage boy to death.Police and locals said Hazaribagh BCL President Arzu Miah,28, and a couple of his friends beat a boy, Raja Miah, in Hazaribagh on August 17, 2015 allegedly for stealing mobile phones and a laptop.Several hours after Raja's death, Arzu was picked up by RAB-2 personnel from Hazaribagh park area, said Arzu's  brother Masud Mia .Ferdawsi Rahman, Assistant Director of RAB-2, said members of the elite force took Arzu, the main suspect in the Raja murder case, to Baroikhali area of Hazaribagh to arrest the others involved in the murder.His cohorts opened fire on the Rab members at 2.35 am on August 18, 2015.Wounded, Arzu was found lying there after the gunfight. He was later taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctorspronounced him dead around .

Name: Mehedi Hasan Ajibor
Identity: Former Executive Member of Magura Municipality Student Wing of Awami League
Description: A joint team of Detective and police gunned down Ajibor . Ajibor, the third accused in the case over shooting a man dead and injuring a pregnant woman in Magura, was a former executive member of Magura municipality BCL.
Sources: The Daily Star  and Prothom Alo 19.08.2015

Name: Zakir Hossain
Identity: An activist of the Awami League affiliated body Swechchhasebak League
Description: A ruling party activist who was allegedly involved in the August infighting that left one dead in Kushtia was killed in a 'gunfight' with police in the district town on August 19, 2015. Sabbir Ul Alam, officer-in-charge of Detective Branch of Police , said the "gunfight" took place at Jagati area of Kushtia Sadar upazila at around 1.30 am.Police conducted a drive in the area after being tipped off that a gang of criminals was holding a secret meeting there. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the gang opened fire on them, forcing police to fire back triggering a gun battle..Zakir was found lying on the spot while the others managed to flee the scene. He was taken to Kushtia General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Md Mozibur Rahman Sheikh
Description: Mozibur Rahman was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB at Shamarghat under Sadar upazila in Tangail in the early hours on August 21, 2015.The victim was identified as Md Mozibur Rahman Sheikh,son of late Sona Mondol of Kashinagar village under Sadar upazila in the district.Company Commander of RAB-12, Additional Police Super Muhammed Mohiuddin Faruki said they raided the Shamarghat area on a tip off that two gangs of ultra left extremists had gathered there.Suspecting the presence of the law enforcers, the 'extremist' groups opened fire, triggering a gun battle with RAB.Faruki said the criminals had fled away at one stage while Mozibur was found bullet-hit in a Mehegini tree garden with a 7.65 foreign pistol and two rounds of bullets after the exchange of fire between them and the law enforcers.Mozibur was immediately taken to Tangail Medical College Hospital where the duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Saidul Islam
Description: Police said Jubo League ward leader Saidul Islam was killed in a "shootout" between his cohorts and members of Detective Branch of Police at Salna in Gazipur on August 21, 2015.Inspector of Gazipur DB Amir Hossain said police arrested Saidul, an alleged criminal, on August 21, 2015 and took him to Salna area to arrest his associates and recover firearms around 12.00 am on August 22, 2015.Sensing the presence of police, the associates of Saidul opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate..At one stage, Saidul was caught in the line of fire, added the officer.Saidul was taken to Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Yusuf Akhter
Description: Yusuf Akhter was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight. Family allged that, he was arrested before the gunfight and later a drama staged to sort out arms while Yusuf died in gunfight.

Name: Khalilur Rahman
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a 'gunfight' with members of Rapid Action Battalion on August 31, 2015 at Darjarkhal in the Sundarban under Sharankhola of Bagerhat district.The Commanding Officer of RAB-8, Faridul Alam, said the gunfight took place when his forces went to Darajarkhal on a tip-off  that a group of thugs were planning for robbery there.Cohorts of slain robber opened fires on the forces of RAB-8, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. The body was sent to Bagerhat General Hospital for post mortem examination.

Name: Mohammad Sumon alias Jira Sumon
Description: On September 1, 2015 Sumon was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight at Sadar upazila, Comilla.

Name: Kamal Hossain
Description: Two leaders of an outlawed party were killed in a "gunfight" with police in Rajbari's Pangsha upazila on September 4, 2015. The deceased Kamal Hossain and Omar Kha were from Shantikhola and Borochoubaria villages of the upazila.Kamal was the prime accused in a case filed in connectionwith the murder of Mizanur Rahman, a former OC of Pangsha Police Station.Omar, one of Kamal's accomplices, was also the ringleader of an inter-district robber gang, claimed police.They were arrested before the gunfight and police brought them to recover arms then a gunfight ensued.

Name: Arman Hazari
Description: On September 5, 2015 Arman Hazar was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight at Chittagong.

Name: Akash alias Ferdous
Description: On September 6, 2015 Akhash alias Ferdouse (30) was allegedly killed in police firing at Wari in old Dhaka .Wari police Sub-Inspector Shariful Islam took Akash to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where he succubbed to his injuries at about 5.15 pm, said sub-inspector Sentu Chandra Das posted at the hospital.

Name: Faruk Hossain
Description: Three people were killed as police opened fire at local people who clashed with the police during their protests against an alleged sexual harassment at Kalihati upazila in Tangail on September 18, 2015. Witnesses said that the locals of Kalihati and Ghatail were staging protests at about 4:30pm on September 18, 2015 on Tangail-Mymensingh Highway against the alleged sexual harassment of a local woman in front of her son on September 15. Police charged baton on the protesters to disperse them from the highway triggering clashes between the cops and the protesters

Name: Rubel
Description: Rubel was injured when police opened fire at local people who clashed with the police during their protests against an alleged sexual harassment at Kalihati upazila in Tangail on September 18, 2015. later he was admitted in Dhaka Medical College Hospital. on September 20, 2015 Rubel succumed to his injuries.

Name: Alal Gazi
Description: Alal and Shahidur were allegedly killed in a reported gunfight with the police on the bank of Kholpetua river under Shyamnagar upazila in Satkhira on September 28, 2015.

Name: Abu Jaher Ahmad
Description: Abu Jaher was allegedly killed in a reported gunfight with the police at west Latifpur under Lakhsmipur district on September 29, 2015 .

Name: Akkas alias Rahim
Description: Akkas was allegedly killed in a reported gunfight with the police on the bank of Shela river under Amgachiya area in Bagerhat on September 30, 2015.

Name: Omar Siraj
Description: He was arrested by RAB on September 18, 2015 from UGC office, Agargaon, Dhaka for leaking questions of medical college and university admission exams. Then he was taken to RAB custody for interrogation. On October 1, 2015 he fell sick and he was taken to National heart disease Institute. On that day, he died in the hospital. Family alleged that he died due to torture.

Name: Toufiqul Islam alias Jabed
Description: He was arrested by police on October 4, 2015 as an alleged member of a militant group. Then he was taken to custody for interrogation. Police said that on October 6, 2015 he was taken to Ananna residential area of the city to recover grenades. Once police reached there, Jabed's  associates hurled grenade at police. Then Jabed died. Therefore he was under the custody of police and found dead and no information found from the family.

Name: Asadul Islam
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the RAB in Sirajganj Sadar upazila on October 9, 2015.The dead is Asadul Islam,35, of Guttara village in Tangail's Bhuapur upazila.According to RAB acting on information that some robbers, including Asadul,were preparing to commit a robbery in Chinabandh area, a team of RAB-12 went there to conduct a drive around 4.00 am,said Hasibul Hasan, Commander of Sirajganj RAB camp.Sensing the presence of the team, the robbers opened fire on the elite froce members,said Hasibul, also assistant superintendent of police.The Rab members then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight".After the gun battle,Asadul was found dead on the spot.

Name: Mohklesur Rahman
Description: Two police members allegedly beat a man to death in Bogra's Gabtoli upazila on October 15, 2015. The victim was Mokhlesur Rahman (45) of Daripara village in the upazila.Two cops were suspended in this connection.They are ASI Abdus Sabur and Constable Abdur Rahman of Gabtoli Model Police Station. Following his death, locals and family members confined Sabur and Rahman, who allegedly beat Moklesur to death.The two had to be rescued by additional police force.Police sources said victim's younger brother filed an allegation against him over some family feud on October 14,2015.Following this, the two cops in question went to investigate the allegation and they beat and kicked Mokhlesur after they caught him.He died instantly,family alleged.
Sources: Prothom Alo and The Daily Star 16.10.2015

Name: Rezaul
Description: On October 16,2015 Rezaul was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight at Joypurhat.

Name: Akbar Hossain
Identity: Members of Puba Banglar Communist Party
Location: village Maisha of Hugra union in Tangail
Description: Two members of Puba Banglar Communist Party were killed and three others injured in a gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion at  Maisha village of Hugra union in Tangail on October 21, 2015.Sensing the presence of the RAB members,the party men opened fire on RAB forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight.

Name: Manu Miah
Identity: Members of Puba Banglar Communist Party
Location: village Maisha of Hugra union in Tangail
Description: Two members of Puba Banglar Communist Party were killed and three others injured in a gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion at  Maisha village of Hugra union in Tangail on October 21, 2015.Sensing the presence of the RAB members,the party men opened fire on RAB forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight.

Name: Enamul Haque
Description: Jessore police picked up Enamul Haque and Mahmud Hasan from their house at Ichali village under Sadar upazila, Jessore on October 9,2015.Later,Enamul's  body was found from Jhenaidah Barobazaar Rail crossing.Enamul's family alleged that he died due to torture by police.

Name: Johirul Islam Bijoy
Description: On October 22,2015 Johirul was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB-1 at Adorshonagar,Badda, Dhaka.

Name: Habibur Rahman Habib
Description: Habibur Rahman Habib was allegedly killed in a 'gunfight' with DB police in Faridpur town on October 23, 2015 night.Acting on a tip off that Habib was making a deal with his buyers to sell firearms, a team of DB police raided East Khaspur Launch ghat area around 11.30 pm,said Mohammad Kamruzzaman,Additional Superintendent of Faridpur police.Sensing the law enforcers' presence,Habib and his aides attacked police with sharp weapons.Police then opened fire on them,triggering a gunfight between police and criminals.At one stage, the criminals fled the scene, and police found the bullet-hit body of Habib on the spot.

Name: Abdur Rahim
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the police in Laxmipur Sadar upazila on October 22,2015.

Name: Arshad Ali Bepari
Description: An alleged inter-district robber gang leader was killed in a 'gunfight' with police in Rajbari's Goalando on October 26,2015.Police said the dead,Arshad Ali Bepari.was an accused in seven cases, including murder and robbery.

Name: Shipon
Description: An alleged robber was reportedly killed in a 'gunfight'with Rapid Action Battalion members at Mrigamari canal of Chadpai in Mongla upazila of Bagerhat on October 28,2015.

Name: Rajib Hasan
Description: Rajib Hasan was killed in an alleged 'gunfight' with police in the capital's Uttarkhan on November 2,2015.Police said Rajib was a wanted criminal and died in a 'gunfight' between the police and some robbers who were his cohorts.The OC of Uttarkhan police station, Yunus Ali said that Kotwali and Uttarkhan police jointly conducted a drive at Shahid Nagar Balur Math area on a tip-off that some robbers were preparing for committing robbery in the wee hours there.Sensing the presence of police, the robbers opened fire on the police,prompting the lawmen to retaliate,he said.As the robbers fled, bullet-hit Rajib was found dead there, the OC said.His body was taken to Dhaka Medical College and Hospital morgue for a post mortem examination.

Name: Kamal Hossain
Description: The deceased was identified as Kamal Hossain,28, of Lebutala under Jessore Sadar district.Jhenaidah RAB camp commander Major Mohammad Suruj Mia said that  RAB had signalled a motor-biker to stop at Koroitala area on Jhenaidah-Jessore highway around 2.30 am on November 2, 2015.The bike had two more pillions.The biker did not comply and,instead, the pillions targeting the RAB men opened fire, prompting RAB to retaliate.Two of the pillions managed to flee.Bullet-wound Kamal was caught by the RAB men who took him to Kaliganj Upazila Health Complex,where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Rafiqul Islam Rafiq
Description: RAB-1 Operation Officer Akramul Hasan said they acting on a tip-off that a group of miscreants gathered at Bangoan Kumarkhada and raided the area around 1.30 am on November 2, 2015.Sensing presence of RAB members, the miscreants opened fire at them.prompting RAB members to strike back, that led to a 'gunfight'.Rafiq caught in the line of fire while his associates were able to run away, Akramul said.

Name: Razib
Description: He was accused in a dacoity case where he looted 25 lacs taka from a jewelary shop.Police arrested him on November 1, 2015 and brought him to Shahidnagar area near Turag River for searching his cohorts. At that time,a gunfight ensued and he was found bullet wounded. Later he died.

Name: Sentu alias Picchi Sentu
Description: Sentu alias Picchi Sentu was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight on November 5, 2015. He was arrested and took to Kathadiya for recovering arms.At that time, a gunfight ensued where he was killed by police

Name: Shohag Mridha alias Ilias
Description: Shohag was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight on November 5, 2015.

Name: Towhidul Islam alias Picchi Shahin
Description: Towhidul was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight on November 5,2015. He was arrested before the gunfight. When police took him to rescover arms, his cohorts came to rescue him and a gunfight ensued. In this gunfight he was killed.

Name: Rashid Ahmmad
Description: An accused in an abduction case was killed in a 'gunfight' with police on Eidgaon-Eidgarh road at Panerphara Dhala in Sadar upazila on November 16, 2015. The deceased was identified as Rashid Ahammad.Tipped off, a team of police conducted a drive in Ramu upazila and arrested Rashid at about 3.30 am,said sub-inspector Minhaz, in-charge of Eidgaon Police Camp.When the law enforcers along with Rashid reached Panerphara Dhala on Eid-gaon- Eidgarh road in Sadar upazila,Rashid's cohorts opened fire at police,forcing them to fire back which triggered a gunfight.Rashid was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while his other associates managed to flee.

Name: Sakib Mia alias Malu Mia
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Kosba , Brahmanbariya.

Name: Mahfuz alias Shahadat alias Albani alias Abdullah Baki alias Rezaul alias Huzzat
Identity: An alleged member of Jamatul Mujahidin Bangladesh
Description: On November 25,2015 he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Dipnagar,Gabtoli.He was a suspect of throwing bomb in the incident of attacking Hossaini Dalan in old Dhaka.

Name: Ramjan Ali
Identity: BNP leader of Pirojpur union unit
Description: Ramjan was allegedly killed by police in a gunfight on November 29,2015. He was arrested before the gunfight. When police took him to rescue arms, his cohorts came to rescue him and a gunfight ensued. In this gunfight, he was killed.

Name: Md. Monir Khalifa
Location: Urubariar Khal, Chandpai range, Purba Sundarban
Description: They were allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB-8 at Urubariar Khal, Chandpai range, Purba Sundarban.

Name: Covered van driver
Description: Armed Police Battalion members got information that some people were smuggling arms and illegal goods by a covered van. Then APBn men chased the covered van. At one stage they barricated the road by a micro bus and motorcycle and signaled the car to stop but the van did not stop . The APBn men shot at the covered van for their defence. That time the covered van driver was shot dead.

Name: Unidentified
Description: The man was allegedly killed in a gunfight by police while he and his cohorts were preparing for a dacoity.

Name: Unidentified
Description: A suspected robber was killed in an alleged gunfight between police and robbers at East Gunagori under Banshkhali in Chittagong on December 7, 2015. The body was sent to Chittagong Medical College Hospital morgue for autopsy. OC of Banshkhali police station said that a gang of armed robbers entered the house of Belal Master around 1:30 am. As the family members tried to resist, the robbers opened fire on them and hacked with sharp weapons, leaving four of them injured. On information, police rushed to the spot and encircled the house of one Belal around 1:45 am. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on police, prompting them to retaliate triggering a gunfight, that left one of the robbers bullet-hit.

Name: Mohammad Osman Goni
Identity: Activist of Sitakunda upazila unit Jamaat-e-Islami
Description: Mohammad Osman Goni was allegedly shot dead by police.  At around 2.30 pm on December 15, 2015 he was having his lunch at his house. In the mean time, a police team in plainclothes came there in a black microbus. After getting the news about police Osman tried to escape from the back door of the house. Police chased him and shot him in his waist. He died there.

Name: Abdur Rashid
Description: Rashid, an alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and police at Dharanti village in Sarail upazila on December 6, 2015.Receiving information that a gang of 10-12 robbers was taking preparation to commit a robbery at the village, a police team conducted a drive there around 3.00 am, said Ali Arshad, OC of Sarail Police Station. Sensing the presence of the police team, robbers opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. Rashid was shot and died on the spot while the rest of t Police recovered Bashir's body and sent it to Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy.

Name: Abu Sayeed
Description: On December 14, 2015 Abu Sayeed, an alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police at Tala upazila, Satkhira.

Name: Sagir Bhandari
Description: On December 23, 2015 the ringleader of a robber gang of Sundarbans East Zone was killed in a 'gunfight' with members of Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in Panighat area under Sarankhola upazila of the district on December 23, 2015.Recieving information that members of 'Nayan Bahini' gathered at Panighat, the RAB in association with DB police took position in the area around 7.30 am, said Harun-or-Rashid, Assistant Director of RAB-6.Sensing the presence of the RAB men, the gang opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he said. After 15 minutes of gunfight, members of the gang retreated, said Harun, also a senior assistant police superintend. Later, RAB members found bullet-hit Sagir in the area. He was rushed to Sarankhola Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctor declared him dead.

Name: Omar
Identity: Activist of Purba Banglar Communist Party
Description: Three suspected activists of Purba Banglar Communist Party were killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB at Omarpur in Tangail on December 24, 2015. Additional Superintendent of Police Mohiuddin Faruki, commander of Crime Prevention Company 3 of RAB-12, said a team of the battalion conducted a drive at Omarpur around 4.00 am to arrest the PBCP men as they gathered there for a meeting. Sensing their presence, the PBCP men opened fire on RAB personnel prompting them to retaliate that triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the extremists retreated from the spot leaving three of their associates-Omar, Kashem and Saddam-bullet wounded. They were  taken to Tangail Medical College Hospital where physicians declared them dead.

Name: Kashem
Identity: Activist of Purba Banglar Communist Party

Name: Saddam
Identity: Activist of Purba Banglar Communist Party

Name: Unidentified
Description: Two JMB suspects were killed when a Rapid Action Battalion team raided an abandoned house in Vogra of Gazipur on December 28,2015.Acting on a tip-off,RAB raided the house beside a high way around at 11.00 pm and JMB suspects hiding in the house hurled homemade bombs injuring a RAB-1 member,claimed RAB Deputy Director Major Maksudul Alam.The RAB-1 team retaliated with gunfire and cordoned off the area.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Two JMB suspects were killed when a Rapid Action Battalion team raided an abandoned house in Vogra of Gazipur on December 28,2015.Acting on a tip-off,RAB raided the house beside a high way around at 11.00 pm and JMB suspects hiding in the house hurled homemade bombs injuring a RAB-1 member,claimed RAB Deputy Director Major Maksudul Alam.The RAB-1 team retaliated with gunfire and cordoned off the area.

Name: Abul Kashem alias Akash
Description: Two suspected robbers were allegdly killed in 'gunfight' with forces of RAB-08 on December 28, 2015.

Name: Al Amin Jony
Identity: Aspirant Secretary candidate of Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal (student wing of BNP)
Description: Al Amin Jony was picked up from his house on December 29, 2015 and killed during a 'gunfight' with RAB in the capital's Mirpur area on January 3, 2016.The RupnagarJCD unit aspirant secretary candidate, Al Amin Jony,30, was wanted in atleast 13 cases, including those for murder and extortion,filed mostly with Pallabi police station while family said most of the cases were politically motivated.The family also alleged AlAmin was picked up from their house in early hours on December 29, 2015 by breaking their door and keeping locked the doors of their neighbours in the six-story building in Rupnagor area.They also alleged nearly a dozen people intorducing them as 'men from administration' broke the door open and tied up his mother and wife and took him away blindfolded.

Name: Mohammad Mintu
Description: On January 3, 2016 police arrested Mintu in front of the Khulna Shopping Complex. At that time, police rescued a motorcycle that was stolen from the Khulna Sonali Bank Corporate. Family alleged that he was tortured to death in the police compound.

Name: Mohammad Mostafa
Description: On January 4, 2016 Mostofa was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB at Magurata under Tangail Sadar upazila.

Name: Monir Khan
Description: An alleged drug peddler was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Gazipur Sadar upazila on January 5, 2016.

Name: Abdullah alias Noman
Identity: Member of Alleged banned militant outfit of JMB
Description: Two alleged operatives of banned militant outfit JMB were killed in an "encounter" with law enforcers in the capital's Hazaribagh. Hiran was an accused in a case filed over the killing of a police constable in an attack on a checkpoint in Ashulia in November last year,said Sanwar Hossain, Additional Deputy commissioner (DB) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police, He said a team of DB police raided a house at Kamrangirchar and arrested three militants around 10.30 pm.Acting on the information of the arrestees,DB police conducted a drive near ZH Sikder Women's Medical College around at around 11:30 pm.As they were carrying out a search, militants on two motorbikes threw handmade grenades at the DB team, prompting the DB to open fire. Two of the militants were wounded,and two more fled the scene on a bike..The injured were taken to Dhaka Medical Hospital where doctors pronounced them dead around 12.45 am.

Name: Rofiqul Islam
Description: Members of Border Guard Bangladesh opened fire on a group of cattle traders along Jaluli border in Maheshpur upazila during a clash on January 30, 2016. Local people informed that members of BGB searched for a cattle trader. However they started to beat up the villagers who were sitting at the crossing of the road at Matila village by not finding the cattle trader. On the other hand, in protest the villagers went to the BGB camp.At that time, BGB members opened fire from inside the camp. As a result Rofiqul Islam died on the spot and Feroz Hossain, 28, succumbed to his wounds at Jhenidah Upazila Health Complex later.

Name: Moshiur Rahman
Description: Moshiur Rahman was allegedly killed by RAB in a gunfight at Sundarban.

Name: Shahabul Islam
Description: Mohammad Ali,brother of Shahabul Islam told that on January 16,2016 at around 1:30 am  SI Abul Kalam arrested Shahabul from his house and beat  him up there. He was then again beaten up at the bus Station at Choykuro intersection. At one stage, SI Abul Kalam took 9,000 tk from Mohammad Ali for not torturing his brother. Shahabul was taken to Satkhira Police Station.Later he was taken to court and court granted one day remand. He was sent to jail then. On February 24, 2016 he was died in Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

Name: Motahar Hossain
Description: The prime accused in Keraniganj school boy Mohammad Abdullah murder case killed in a gunfight with RAB in Chitakhola area of South Keraniganj. RAB said, a patrol team of the battalion challenged some motor bikers in Chitakhola at around 4:00am. Being challanged, the bikers opened fire on the batallion men that triggered a gunfight. One of the offenders was caught in the line of fire and became bullet-hurt. RAB members held the injured man and sent him to Mitford Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Arif
Description: An alleged criminal was killed in a gunfight between DB Police and his cohorts in Madhabdi. The deceased was identified as Arif, son of Md Haklim of Birampur area in the upazila. Delwar Hossain, Officer in Charge of the DB , said law enforcers, being informed about a mugging, went to Saikadi  area and saw three youths with a motorbike. Sensing the presence of the DBs, the youths started shooting at them, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate, the OC said. Arif was shot during the shootout while two others managed to flee. Arif was taken to Narsingdi General Hospital and died while being shifted to DMCH.

Name: Akam Uddin Hia
Identity: Member of Gana Mukti Fouz Party
Description: Two alleged outlaws were killed in a gunfight with RAB in Kushtia. The dead Akam Uddin Hia and Liakat Ali were top cadres of banned Gana Mukti Fouz, according to RAB. our cases, including two for murder, while Liakat in eight cases including three for murder. RAB-12 commanding officer Major Mosaddek Ibne Mujib said acting on a tip-off, a team of the elite force raided Swastipur area around 3:00am when a secret meeting of the party was going on  there. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire on the RAB members, forcing them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight the RAB official said. At one stage, Akam and Liakat were hit by bullets. The two were taken to kushtia General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

Name: Liakat Ali
Identity: Member of Gana Mukti Fouz Party

Name: Ratan Miah
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and police in Baddapara. Ali Arshad, OC of Sarail Police Station said, acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers were taking preparation to commit a robbery in the area, a police team conducted drive there at around 4:10am. Sensing the presence of police, the robbers opened fire and hurled brick chips at them, forcing the law enforcers to return fire, triggering the gunfight the police official said. At one stage, Ratan was caught in the line of fire, while his other associates managed to flee. Ratan was admitted to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital where he died later.

Name: Kamal Hossain alias Jewel
Description: Kamal Hossain alias Jewel was allegedly killed by RAB in a gunfight.

Name: Mohammad Masuk
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with members of Rapid Action Battalion as the special force claimed to have foiled a robbery attempt at a Sonali Bank branch in Dhamrai of Dhaka on February 19, 2016. Mohammad Masuk was a motor-cycle mechanic in the capital's Dholaikhal area and lived with his family in Bangshal, said his family members.

Name: Chantu Mia
Description: Chantu Mia, a murder accused was killed in a gunfight with police at Moheshpur in Jhenaidah on February 23, 2016.He was accused in a case of killing one Akimul of village Samanta, the police said.Moheshpur police officer-in-charge Aminul Islam Biplab said they had arrested Chantu from Kushtia on February 23, 2016.According to his statement, the police launched a drive to recover arms and ammunition on February 23, 2016.Around 3:30 am when they approached Balidapara area, the associates of Chantu opened fire on the law enforcers prompting them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight.At one stage of the gunfight, his cohorts retreated from the spot and bullet-hit Chantu was found dead .

Name: Bachchu Miah
Description: An accused in the Habiganj four-kid murder case was killed in a "gunfight" with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in the district's Chunarughat upazila on February 25, 2016 eight days after law enforcers allegedly picked him up. The dead, Bachchu Mia, was a CNG-run auto-rickshaw driver who had been traceless since being detained by plainclothes officials on February 17, according to his family members. The family has been making this allegation since the day after his detention. Bachchu was one of the accused in the case filed with Bahubal Police Station in connection with the killing of the four schoolboys.  Kazi Moniruzzaman, Company Commander of RAB-9, claimed that they had detained Shaheed, one of the accomplices of Bacchu.  A team of the elite force conducted a drive in Dawargachh area to arrest Bacchu as Shaheed informed them that he was preparing to flee to India. Sensing the presence of RAB members, Bachchu along with his accomplices opened fire on them. The RAB team fired back, triggering the gunfight, the official said.Later, the bullet-hit body of Bachchu was found and sent to Chunarughat Upazila Health Complex for autopsy. But the family members turned down the Rab version."My husband never touched a gun, let alone operate it. How come he engaged in gunfight?" said Bachchu's wife Rina Akther in a tearful voice.She alleged that two men in plainclothes on the afternoon of February 17 came to their house at Sundrateki village of the district looking for her husband."After talking to them outside the house, my husband came back and told me that police asked him to meet them for some reasons. He did not tell me the reasons and went away,"  After a while, she called her husband on his mobile phone, but he was not picking it up. At one stage, she found the phone switched off, Rina said. Contacted repeatedly, police could not provide any information on him, she added. Bachchu's mother Elai Bibi alleged that it was the RAB that picked up her son and killed him."My son was not involved in the killings. Even if he had been involved in the murders, court was there to try him. Why did he have to die without trial?" she said.

Name: Babul Matubbar
Location: Gudaraghat area, Mirpur, Shahali Police Station, Dhaka
Description: On February 3, 2016 at around 9:30 pm, a patrol team of Shahali Police Station of Dhaka, along with their informer Delwar went to Gudaraghat area and demanded extortion form a tea staler Babul Matubbar. As Babul Matubbar did not give money, police hit on the kerosene stove with stick and police informer Delwar pushed Babul onto the stove, which caught fire to Babul. Police left the scene leaving Babul in serious condition. Soon after the incident, Babuls relatives took him to the burn unit of the Dhaka Medical College Hospital. On February 4, Babul Matubbar died in the hospital. Sub-Inspectors Mominur Rahman Khan, Sreedham Chandra Hawlader, Niazuddin Molla, Assistant Sub-Inspector Debendra Nath and Constable Jasimuddin were temporarily suspended due to this incident. An inquiry committee was set up to investigate into this incident. On February 7, 2016 the inquiry committee submitted its report to the Dhaka Metropolitan Police Commissioner. In the inquiry report, four police personnel of Shah Ali Police Station were recommended to be given departmental punishment. But the committee did not mention about extortion in the report. However, Babul Matubbar was accused as a drug peddler and the police informer Delwar and his five associates had been accused for his death.
Sources:
The daily Jugantor [05-02-2016], 
The daily Jugantor [08-02-2016]

Name: Anwar Hossain Mahbub
Description: On February 16, 2016 Anwar Hossain Mahbub ( Joint Secretary of Dhaka South City Corporations 23 numbered ward unit BNP, who was detained in jail, died in Dhaka Medical College Hospital. His relatives claimed that Anwar was severely tortured by police during remand after being arrested under a politically motivated case on January 15, 2016. His younger brother Maksud said that  that Anwar Hossain Mahbub had not any physical problems or illness.  His brother was severely beaten by police on the street while police were taking him to the police station after arrested Anwar. Hundreds people witnessed this incident. Later he was tortured in custody after taking him into remand.

Name: Golam Mawla Mridha
Description: An alleged Yaba trader was killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion in Patuakhali town on February  29, 2016 . The deceased was identified as Golam Mawla Mridha\son of Nurul Haque Mridha of Kalikapur area in the town.He was an accused in a number of cases including an arms case, kM Tariqul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Patuakhali Police Station said.The 'shootout' took place in Hatalia area of Kaliakpur village at 4.00 am,. After the 'gunfight' police recovered the bullet-hit body of Mawla and send it to Patuakhali General Hospital morgue for autopsy, the police official said..

Name: Zahirul Islam
Location: Nagoriakandi in Narsingdi municipality area, Narsingdi, Dhaka
Description: Two accused in a double murder case were killed and another was injured in a 'gunfight' with police at Nagoriakandi in Narsingdi municipality area on March 3, 2016.The deceased were Zahirul Islam 25,of Nagoriakandi area and Md Rakib, 24, of Tongi in Gazipur. The Officer-in-Charge of Narsingdi sadar police Mostafa Hossain said that the 'gunfight' took place in the area at around 4.00 am when the police conducted a raid to detain the murder accused.During the 'gunfight', Zahirul, Rakib and Hossain Ali were injured, he OC said. They were taken to Narsindi General Hospital where the on-duty doctors pronounced Zahirul dead and referred Rakib and Hossain to Dhaka Medical College and Hospital, the police said.Rakib died on the way to DMCH while Rakib was admitted to DMCH.

Name: Md Rakib
Location: Nagoriakandi in Narsingdi municipality area, Narsingdi, Dhaka

Name: Pias
Description: A suspected military wing commander of banned militant outfit Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh was killed in a 'gunfight' with the Detective Branch of Police in the capital's Khilgaon on March 8, 2016. Pias  was the JMB's military wing chief in Dhaka region, DB claimed.DB Deputy Commissioner of Dhaka Metropolitan police Mashrukur Rahman Khaled said that Pias opened fire at the DB personnel when they conducted a drive at the rail tracks near Khidmah Hospital in Khilgaon at around 3.30 am on March 8, 2016.In retaliation, police fired back that left Pias injured.He was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Monir
Location: Kachikhali-Chandeshwar area of Sharankhola range, Sundarbans, Khulna
Description: Four suspected robbers of the notorious Nayan Bahini of the Sunderbans were killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB-08 and Coastguards forces at 6.30 am on March 10, 2016 at Kachikhali-Chandeshwar area of Sharankhola range under east wing of Sundarban forest division.

Name: Enam
Location: Kachikhali-Chandeshwar area of Sharankhola range, Sundarbans, Khulna
Description: Four suspected robbers of the notorious Nayan Bahini of the Sunderbans were killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB-08 and Coastguards forces at 6.30 am on March 10, 2016 at Kachikhali-Chandeshwar area of Sharankhola range under east wing of Sundarban forest division.

Name: Hasan
Location: Kachikhali-Chandeshwar area of Sharankhola range, Sundarbans, Khulna
Description: Four suspected robbers of the notorious Nayan Bahini of the Sunderbans were killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB-08 and Coastguards forces at 6.30 am on March 10, 2016 at Kachikhali-Chandeshwar area of Sharankhola range under east wing of Sundarban forest division.

Name: Gias
Location: Kachikhali-Chandeshwar area of Sharankhola range, Sundarbans, Khulna
Description: Four suspected robbers of the notorious Nayan Bahini of the Sunderbans were killed in a 'gunfight' with RAB-08 and Coastguards forces at 6.30 am on March 10, 2016 at Kachikhali-Chandeshwar area of Sharankhola range under east wing of Sundarban forest division.

Name: Aminul Islam
Description: Aminul Islam was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Kasundi area, Magura.

Name: Obaidur Rahman
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Shalikha upazila of Magura on March 17, 2016. The dead is Obaidur Rahman of Hatbaria village in the upazila.According to police, Obaidur stood accussed in four robbery cases filed with different police stations in Magura and Jessore. He was the chief of an inter-district robber gang. Abu Jihad Fakhrul Alam Khan, OC of Shalikha Police Station, said that around eight to 10 robbers blocked Jessore-Magura highway near Ramkantopur bridge by placing logs for committing a robbery. As soon as police reached the spot, the criminal opened fire on them. The law enforcers then returned fire, triggering the gunfight. After the gun battle, police found Obaidur lying on the spot, while others fled. He was rushed to Shalikha Upazila Health  Complex  where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Delwar Hossain Delu
Description: A suspected criminal was killed in gunfight with police at Tongi

Name: Jasim Molla
Description: On March 8, 2016 Police arrested Jasim Molla in a gunfight. During the gunfight, he got bullet wounded.Later on March 10, 2016 he died at the Pongu Hospital during operation.

Name: Fazlu
Description: Two alleged members of an outlawed were killed in a gunfight with members of RAB at Jugni Haat in Tangail on April 7, 2016. The dead are identified as Fazlu and his associate Uzzal. An incident of robbery took place in the area, a few days ago, locals said.On information that a gang of criminals was making preparation for committing another robbery in the area, a RAB team raided the village around 1:00 am, said Mohiuddin Faruqe, Rab-12 Company Commander in Tangail.Sensing the presence of theRAB members, criminals opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate.

Name: Uzzal
Description: Two alleged members of an outlawed were killed in a gunfight with members of RAB at Jugni Haat in Tangail on April 7, 2016. The dead are identified as Fazlu and his associate Uzzal. An incident of robbery took place in the area, a few days ago, locals said.On information that a gang of criminals was making preparation for committing another robbery in the area, a RAB team raided the village around 1:00 am, said Mohiuddin Faruqe, Rab-12 Company Commander in Tangail.Sensing the presence of theRAB members, criminals opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate.

Name: Kamrul Hasan
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Mirsarai upazila of Chittagong on April 18, 2016.The dead are Kamrul Hasan of West Shewrapara in the capital, and Yakub Ali of Mothbaria upazila in Pirojpur. The deceased were involved in the robbery of Shamim Jwellery shop in Baroiarhat Bazar of the upazila on February 26, said Lt Col Miftah Uddin Ahmed, commanding officer of Rab-7 .

Name: Yakub Ali
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in Mirsarai upazila of Chittagong on April 18, 2016.The dead are Kamrul Hasan of West Shewrapara in the capital, and Yakub Ali of Mothbaria upazila in Pirojpur. The deceased were involved in the robbery of Shamim Jwellery shop in Baroiarhat Bazar of the upazila on February 26, said Lt Col Miftah Uddin Ahmed, commanding officer of Rab-7 .

Name: Anowarul Islam alias Angur
Location: Gondamara Village of Banshkhali Upazilla in Chittagong
Description: Bangladesh police have once again killed protestors. This time four out of a few hundred villagers who protested on 4 April 2016 have been killed. The farmers were protesting against acquisition of their agricultural lands without consent or adequate compensation, for the purpose of establishing a coal-fired power plant at Gondamara Village of Banshkhali Upazilla in Chittagong District.The murdered victims have been identified as Anowarul Islam alias Angur (60), his brother Mortuza Ali (50), and Mortuza's son-in-law Zager Ahmed (35), as well as Zaker Hossain (50). According to the villagers, around 30 people, including women and children, have suffered injuries in the police shooting spree. The police have also gone and arrested the bullet-riddled victims being treated in the hospitals, as well as relatives of deceased victims.

Name: Mortuza Ali
Location: Gondamara Village of Banshkhali Upazilla in Chittagong
Description: Bangladesh police have once again killed protestors. This time four out of a few hundred villagers who protested on 4 April 2016 have been killed. The farmers were protesting against acquisition of their agricultural lands without consent or adequate compensation, for the purpose of establishing a coal-fired power plant at Gondamara Village of Banshkhali Upazilla in Chittagong District.The murdered victims have been identified as Anowarul Islam alias Angur (60), his brother Mortuza Ali (50), and Mortuza's son-in-law Zager Ahmed (35), as well as Zaker Hossain (50). According to the villagers, around 30 people, including women and children, have suffered injuries in the police shooting spree. The police have also gone and arrested the bullet-riddled victims being treated in the hospitals, as well as relatives of deceased victims.

Name: Zager Ahmed
Location: Gondamara Village of Banshkhali Upazilla in Chittagong
Description: Bangladesh police have once again killed protestors. This time four out of a few hundred villagers who protested on 4 April 2016 have been killed. The farmers were protesting against acquisition of their agricultural lands without consent or adequate compensation, for the purpose of establishing a coal-fired power plant at Gondamara Village of Banshkhali Upazilla in Chittagong District.The murdered victims have been identified as Anowarul Islam alias Angur (60), his brother Mortuza Ali (50), and Mortuza's son-in-law Zager Ahmed (35), as well as Zaker Hossain (50). According to the villagers, around 30 people, including women and children, have suffered injuries in the police shooting spree. The police have also gone and arrested the bullet-riddled victims being treated in the hospitals, as well as relatives of deceased victims.

Name: Zaker Hossain
Location: Gondamara Village of Banshkhali Upazilla in Chittagong
Description: Bangladesh police have once again killed protestors. This time four out of a few hundred villagers who protested on 4 April 2016 have been killed. The farmers were protesting against acquisition of their agricultural lands without consent or adequate compensation, for the purpose of establishing a coal-fired power plant at Gondamara Village of Banshkhali Upazilla in Chittagong District.The murdered victims have been identified as Anowarul Islam alias Angur (60), his brother Mortuza Ali (50), and Mortuza's son-in-law Zager Ahmed (35), as well as Zaker Hossain (50). According to the villagers, around 30 people, including women and children, have suffered injuries in the police shooting spree. The police have also gone and arrested the bullet-riddled victims being treated in the hospitals, as well as relatives of deceased victims.

Name: Kausar
Description: Family members of Kausar alleged that DB police arrested Kausar from Laxmipur regional passport office on April 6.When the family went to DB office, the DB officisls  they denied that they detained Kausar. Later, on April 7 they found Kausar's dead body in a  hospital. Police said that police arrested Kausar on April 6 and went to conduct an operation to recover arms.There Kausar's cohorts tried to snatch him. As a result a gunfight ensued where Kausar was killed.

Name: Amirul Islam
Location: Housing Mondal Filing Station area, Kushtia
Description: A regional leader of the outlawed party Ganobahini was killed in a reported gunfight with police in Housing Mondal Filing Station area in Kushtia town on April 27, 2016. The deceased was identified as Amirul Islam, son of Jaber, a resident of village Sonaidanga under the Islamic University police station.Four policemen were injured during the gunfight.

Name: Abdul Kadir
Location: Suhilpur area, Brahmanbaria sadar upazila, Brahmanbaria,
Description: An alleged robber was killed and four policemen were injured in a 'gunfight' in Suhilpur area of the Brahmanbaria sadar upazila on April 26, 2016. The deceased was identified as Abdul Kadir, 35 son of Nowab Mia of village Kalikacho of Sarail Upazila.Brahmanbaria sadar model Police Station OC Mainur Rahman said that acting on a tip-off, a patrol team of the police went to the area while the robbers were being prepared for committing a robbery. Sensing presence of the police, the miscreants started firing at them and in retaliation the police also opened fire on the miscreants..Abdul Kadir, an accused in six robbery cases, died on the spot during the gunfight.

Name: Alam Khan
Description: An alleged robber gang leader was killed in a 'gunfight' between his cohorts and RAB in Chandpai range of the Sundarbans at East Zone on May 6, 2016.

Name: Asadul Fakir
Description: On May 9, 2016 he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Mohobbat Kha
Description: Mohobbat Kha was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Shoshoi village, Bijaynagar upazila, Brahmanbariya on May 25, 2016.

Name: Din Islam
Description: Family alleged that, DB police went to Din Islam's house. From there, they arrested him and later he was allegedly tortured to death,Earlier police asked for 5 lacs taka and told the family members to go to DB office.Family members went to DB police but they could not enter into the office.Later they got information that Din Islam died at Narsingdhi Sadar Hospital on May 19, 2016.

Name: Abul Hashem
Description: Abul Hashem was accused of a murder case. He allegedly killed his wife in demand of dowry. On May 29, 2016 police arrested him from Gulshan area of Dhaka and then took him to Sorishabari Police Station. The next day at around 4.30 am he died. Police claimed that he committed suicide whereas family members alleged that he died due to torture.
Unit: Police members of Sorishabari Police Station

Name: Tariqul Islam
Description: An alleged drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with the joint force of police and Border Guard Bangladesh at Panchbibi in Jaipurhat on June 2, 2016. Meanwhile, Guljan Begum mother of the deceased,Tariqul Islam of village Ratanpur, claimed BGB personnel picked up her son on June 1, 2016 night before the death news reached her . She said  that four BGB men picked up Tariqul around 10:00pm while he was playing carrom in front of the house. He was released from jail after getting bail in a case and came home on June 1, 2016. Police said Tariqul was accused of more than 11 cases related to narcotics filed with different police stations including Panchbib. Panchbibi police officer-in-charge Ashraful Islam said the joint force conducted drive at Ratanpur responding to a tip-off that drug peddlers were smuggling narcotics through the area. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the drug peddlers carried out attack on them with local weapons and opened fire. The law enforcers also retaliated that left Tariqul injured critically. His accomplices managed to flee.

Name: Unidentified
Location: near the office of multinational pesticide company Syngenta at Panchbaria on Jessore-Magura Road, Jessore, Khulna
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a 'gunfight' between his associates and police near the office of multinational pesticide company Syngenta at Panchbaria on Jessore-Magura Road on June 8, 2016. Police could not confirm his identity .Ilias Hossain , the Officer in Charge of Kotwli Police station said that the unidentified 'robber', aged between 45 and 50, died on the spot in a 'gunfight' between his cohorts and a police team while the gang was committing robbery on Jessore-Magura Road under Kotwali police station.'At around 2:40 am, when a patrol team of police reached the spot and a gunfight ensued, leaving the robber dead on the spot'..The police recovered the body and took it to Jessore Medical College Hospital for post-mortem .

Name: Kawsar
Identity: Member of Alleged banned militant outfit of JMB
Description: A suspected member of the banned militant outfit, Jamaat-ul Mujahideen Bangladesh, who was allegedly involved in the attack on a Shia mosque in Bogra, was killed in a gunfight with police at Haripur of Shibganj in Bogra on June 8, 2016, police said. The deceased was identified as Kawsar,son of Amir Ali of Kamargram in Jaipurhat.

Name: Nazrul Islam
Location: at a checkpoint in Prottasha bridge area under Turag Police Station, Dhaka
Description: An alleged leader of a doping gang, Nazrul Islam, was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and members of the Rapid Action Battalion at a checkpoint in Prottasha bridge area under Turag Police Station at around 1:45am, said Lt Commander Md Shoaib, Deputy Director of RAB-1.

Name: Kamal Parvez
Description: A suspected mugger was killed in a gunfight with RAB in capital's Rampura.  Abdul Karim, operation officer of RAB-3.said that Parvez was held with a gold bangle about 3.00 pm on June 8, 2016 after he along with his three accomplices had mugged a woman at Taltola in Khilgaon. A team of RAB-03 then took him to Balurmath area to arrest his accomplices in the middle of the night. Sensing RAB's presence, criminals opened fire. Law enforcers fired shots in retaliation, leaving Parvez injured. He was declared dead at Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

Name: Tuhin alias Arif
Identity: Member of alleged banned militant outfit of JMB
Description: A man was shot dead in a "gunfight" between police and his cohorts at Malancha village in Gobindaganj upazila of Gaibandha at around 2:00 am. The incident happened as a team of police went to raid one Jahangir Hossain's house, being informed that JMB men had gathered there, said Mozammel Huq, OC of Gobindaganj Police Station. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, JMB men opened fire at them. Police retaliated with gunshots.. Within half an hour, members of the outlawed group fled the scene. Police later recovered a body, one detonator and explosives from the spot, he added.Law enforcers claimed that the dead was a JMB man but could not give his identity. The OC said the house owner, Jahangir, was an active member of the JMB man but could not give his identity.The OC said the house owner, Jahangir, was an active member of the JMB, who is on the run now.

Name: Rakib
Location: Dighalia, Dokkhinpara village, Lohagara upazila, Narail
Description: A suspected robber was killed in an alleged "gunfight" between his cohorts and police at Dighalia Dokkhinpara village in Lohagora upazila on June 11, 2016. The victim was identified as Rakib, son of Mokles Hossain, a resident of Chanchai village under the upazila.The OC of Lohagora police station, Biplop Kumar Saha, said that they responded to a tip that a gang of robbers were taking preparation to commit robbery in the vicinities.It was when a team of police launched a drive there at around 2:30 am.  As the robbers sensed police presence, they opened gunshots prompting, police to strike back. A gunfight then broke out which left Rakib injured with bullets.He was rushed to Lohagora upazila health complex where doctors declared him dead. Other associates of the band managed to flee the scene.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Rajarhat-Chuknagar Road at Kamalpur under Kotwali Police Station, Jessore
Description: In an incident at Kamalpur, a robbery suspect was killed in 'gunfight' between the robbers and police around 2.30 am. The incident took place while the gang was committing robbery on Rajarhat-Chuknagar Road at Kamalpur under Kotwali Police Station, said Ilias Hossain, OC, Kotwali Police Station.Yusuf Ali, Medical Officer, Jessore Medical College Hospital, said the bullet-hit youth was brought to the hospital dead around 3:00 am on  June 16, 2016.

Name: Rubel Hossain
Description: A youth, accused of killing a police officer, was killed in a 'gunfight' after his arrest on June 15, 2016 at Pakshey Natunpara under Ishwardi upazila. The deceased, identified as Rubel Hossain, son of Idris Ali of village Diar Baghoil, was the prime suspect in the killing of Assistant town Sub-Inspector (ASI) Sujaul Islam.. Assistant town sub-inspector Md Sujaul Islam of Pakshey police camp was killed at a turmeric field near the Pakshey Rail Station area on October 4, 2015 when he was on duty in the area. The body was recovered from the spot on October 5 and a case was filed with the incident.

Name: Jibon Mia
Location: Dhaka-Sylhet highway  near Bariura Bridge at Sarail in Brahmanbaria
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a 'shootout' between his cohorts and police on Dhaka-Sylhet highway  near Bariura Bridge at Sarail in Brahmanbaria on June 15, 2016. A police team conducted a drive in the area around 2:00 am, said Rupak Kumar Saha, OC of Sarail Police Station.Sensing presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on police, prompting them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight. Jibon Mia, 32, son of Mahram Ali of Shahbazpur village, was caught in the line of fire while others managed to flee.Police took injured Jibon to Sarail Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Sohel Rana
Description: Two people allegedly involved in the killing of AK Azad, a newly elected Union Parishad chairman , were killed in a "shootout" with police in Joypurhat on June 14, 2016. The deceased are: Sohel Rana, son Nurul Islam of Sawalpara, and Munir Hossain,son of Lutfur Rahman of Kuchkuri village under Joypurhat Sadar upazila. The "gunfight", which took place at around 4:00 am, also left three law enforcers injured, police claimed. Mollah Nazrul Islam, Superintendent of Police of Joypurhat, said on information that criminals had gathered in Gopalpur to attack the house of slain AK Azad, law enforcers raided the village.Sensing the presence of police, the criminals opened fire on them and also swooped on them with sticks and sharp weapons.The law enforcers retaliated with gunfire, leaving the two dead on the spot, claimed the district police.The bodies were sent to Joypurhat General Hospital for autopsy.

Name: Munir Hossain
Description: Two people allegedly involved in the killing of AK Azad, a newly elected Union Parishad chairman , were killed in a "shootout" with police in Joypurhat on June 14, 2016. The deceased are: Sohel Rana, son Nurul Islam of Sawalpara, and Munir Hossain,son of Lutfur Rahman of Kuchkuri village under Joypurhat Sadar upazila. The "gunfight", which took place at around 4:00 am, also left three law enforcers injured, police claimed. Mollah Nazrul Islam, Superintendent of Police of Joypurhat, said on information that criminals had gathered in Gopalpur to attack the house of slain AK Azad, law enforcers raided the village.Sensing the presence of police, the criminals opened fire on them and also swooped on them with sticks and sharp weapons.The law enforcers retaliated with gunfire, leaving the two dead on the spot, claimed the district police.The bodies were sent to Joypurhat General Hospital for autopsy.

Name: Mozaffar Sana
Identity: Member of Purba Banglar Communist Party
Location: Chara Battala, Tala upazila, Satkhira, Khulna
Description: Mozaffar Sana, believed to have connection with ultra-left party, was killed in 'gunfight' with police at Chara Battala of Tala upazila in Satkhira on June 10, 2016. The police said Mozaffar Sana was a regional leader of outlawed Purba Banglar Communist Party and accused in at least 18 cases. He was  son of Gaffar Sana of village Dohar in the upazila. Satkhira police said during a special drive, a team of police, led by OC of Tala police station Sagir Mia, signaled a Jethuya Bazaar-bound motorcycle carrying Sana to stop in the area around 2.30 am. In response, three motorcycle riders blasted two crude bombs and opened fire at police, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. Two of the three managed to flee leaving behind injured Sana, who was declared dead at upazila health complex.

Name: Aidul alias Mama Sagor
Description: A "criminal" was killed in an alleged shootout between his cohorts and the Rapid Action Battalion at Agargaon in the capital on June 17, 2016. The dead, Aidul alias Mama Sagor, 25, was an "extortionists" in Karwan Bazar area and accused in several arms cases, claimed the elite force. The "gunfight" took place around 1:45 am after a RAB patrol team approached a group of criminals near the Sher-e-Bangla Agricultural University, said Lt Col Mohiuddin Ahmed, commanding officer of the RAB-2. Instantly, the criminals opened fire at the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate with gunshots. At one point, all the attackers except Aidul, who was shot in the incident, fled. The RAB members rescued and took him to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital where he was pronounced dead.

Name: Salim Howlader
Location: Amanatganj Bazaar of  Baliatali village of Muladi upazila in Barisal
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with the police at Amanatganj Bazaar of village Baliatali of Muladi upazila in Barisal on June 1, 2016. The deceased was resident of Safipur union of Muladi; he was the leader of so called Salim Bahini, a robber gang.  Muladi police station officer-in-charge Matiur Rahman said that  they arrested Salim on May 31, 2016 afternoon as he was accused in 11 cases including 4 murder cases. The gunfight took place as Salims associates attacked the police and tried to snatch Salim from them while they were going to recover arms along with the miscreant, the OC said. Salim was shot dead during the gunfight, he said, adding that the body was sent to Barisal Sher-E-Bangla Medical College Hospital for post-mortem examinations.

Name: Tarek Hossain Milu alias Osman
Identity: Member of alleged banned militant outfit of JMB
Description: Dhaka Metropolitan Polices Detective Branch Deputy Commissioner Mashrukur Rahman Khaled said two JMB members  were killed in a gunfight at Pallabi in Dhaka early on June 7, 2016. Tarek was involved in the killing of Rajshahi University English professor AFM Rezaul Karim Siddiquee and Sultan was involved in the Bogra Shia mosque attack, he claimed. DMP Additional Commissioner and Counter-Terrorism unit head Monirul Islam at a press conference at its office said that  the two were northern-district-based JMB leaders. He said police had information that some JMB men were heading for Dhaka. They encountered a police team near Lohar Bridge at Kalshi in Pallabi with firing gunshots. Police retaliate with firing which triggered a gunfight, leaving the two injured, he said. Pallabi Police Station Sub-Inspector Anwar Hossain said that the gunfight took place at some time between 2:30am and 3:00am where the duo received bullet wounds. They were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where duty physicians declared them dead around 6:00am.

Name: Sultan Mahmud alias Rana alias Kamal
Identity: Member of alleged banned militant outfit of JMB
Description:
Dhaka Metropolitan Polices Detective Branch Deputy Commissioner Mashrukur Rahman Khaled said two JMB members  were killed in a gunfight at Pallabi in Dhaka early on June 7, 2016. Tarek was involved in the killing of Rajshahi University English professor AFM Rezaul Karim Siddiquee and Sultan was involved in the Bogra Shia mosque attack, he claimed.
DMP Additional Commissioner and Counter-Terrorism unit head Monirul Islam at a press conference at its office said that  the two were northern-district-based JMB leaders. He said police had information that some JMB men were heading for Dhaka. They encountered a police team near Lohar Bridge at Kalshi in Pallabi with firing gunshots. Police retaliate with firing which triggered a gunfight, leaving the two injured, he said. Pallabi Police Station Sub-Inspector Anwar Hossain said that the gunfight took place at some time between 2:30am and 3:00am where the duo received bullet wounds. They were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where duty physicians declared them dead around 6:00am.

Name: Jamal Uddin
Identity: Member of Alleged banned militant outfit of JMB
Description: In Rajshahi, a JMB operative, who allegedly supplied bomb in the suicidal attack on an Ahmadiyya mosque at Baghmara in Rajshahi, was killed in a gunfight with police at Godagari in the district early June 7, 2016. The deceased was a resident of Shibganj in Chapainawabganj. Godagari police officer-in-charge SM Abu Forhad said Jamal was the accomplice of Tarek Rahman,who caused explosions at a mosque of Ahmadiyya Muslims on December 25 last year and he himself died on the spot. Police arrested Jamal in Babu Dying area of Chapainawabganj around 11:00pm on June 6, 2016. Upon his information, police conducted a drive to arrest another accomplice at Farajpur in Godagari in the early hours of June 7, 2016. Accomplices of Jamal opened fire on police at that time, the OC claimed, when the law enforcers also retaliated triggering a gunfight. Jamal died on the spot during the gunfight. The body was sent to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital morgue for autopsy, No information found from the family of jamal Uddin

Name: Rubel
Description: Abdul Kader, Officer-in-Charge of Nasirnagar Police Station, claimed that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit a robbery in Tullahpara village.Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire.Police fired back triggering a gunfight. Seriously injured Rubel was taken to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead

Name: Golam Faizullah Fahim
Description: Golam Faizullah Fahim was killed in a shootout with police on June 18, 2016. Police claimed miscreants sensing their presence opened fire. Police fired back, triggering a gunfight. After a while, police found Faizullah lying on the ground with bullet wounds. Taken to Madaripur Sadar Hospital, he was pronounced dead. However, Locals captured the youth while he along with two others was trying to flee after hacking Ripon Chakraborty, a lecturer at Government Nazimuddin University College, on June 14, 2016. He was placed on a 10-day remand in an attempted murder case filed by police on June 17, 2016. Earlier on June 16, the Madaripur police chief said that during interrogation Faizullah claimed to be a member of Hizb-ut Tahrir, an outfit banned in October 2009 for public security.

Name: Kamal Hossain Sarder
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police in Magura Sadar upazila on June 19, 2016. After the gunfight, police recovered the body of Kamal Hossain Sarder, 40, a leader of the district-based inter-district robber gang, from Moghirdhal area on Kushtia-Khulna highway. Locals later helped the law enforcers to identify the deceased. Kamal, son of Afsar Hossain of Shawladanga in Magura Sadar upazila was accused in five robbery cases filed with different police stations of the district, reports quoting police. Azmol Huda, officer-in-charge (OC) of Magura Sadar Police station said that they had information that a group of robbers was taking preparation for a robbery by blocking the highway with logs. The robbers opened fire on the law enforcers when a patrol team of the Sadar Police Station raided the area around 3:30am. The gunfight took place between police and the robbers when the law enforcers retaliated.. At one stage Kamal Hossain Sarder found dead

Name: Shariful alias Sakib alias Sharif alias Saleh alias Arif alias Mukul Rana
Identity: Member of banned militant group Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT)
