Description: The prime suspect in bloggers -- Avijit Roy and Niladri Chattopadhyay Niloy -- murders was killed in a gunfight at Meradiya Banshpotti around 2:00am with DB police in Khilgaon of Dhaka on June 19, 2016. Hailing from Khulna, deceased Shariful  was a top organiser of banned militant group Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT), said Masudur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner (Media) of DMP. Police announced Tk 5 lakh bounty on him earlier when they found evidence of his presence at the crime scene at TSC in Dhaka University where Avijit was hacked to death on February 26 last year 2015, according to the Dhaka Metropolitan Police website. His direct involvement was found in a number of killings including blogger Avijit and Niladri Niloy.

Name: Abdus Sattar
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between police and his cohorts in Sarail upazila of Brahmanbaria on June 21, 2016.  The dead is Abdus Sattar of College Para village in the upazila. Rupok Kumar Saha, Officer-in-Charge of Sarail Police Station, said acting on a tip-off that some robbers, including Sattar, were preparing to commit robbery in Gonara village, police raided the village around 1:30am. Sensing the presence of police, the robbers opened fire on them. The law enforcers then returned fire, triggering the gunfight, the police official added. Sattar was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. Others managed to flee.

Name: Mohammad Dulal Mridha
Description: On June 23, 2016 Mohammad Dulal Mridha was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Banaripara upazila, Barisal.

Name: Masud
Location: Char Chandina union, Sonagazi upazila, Feni
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with members of Rapid Action Battalion in Char Chandia union of Sonagazi upazila on June 25, 2016.Shafayet Ahmed Fahim, camp commander of RAB-7 said, on secret information that a gang of robbers was preparing for committing robbery, a team of the elite  force conducted a drive in the union around 2:00 am.Sensing the presence of RAB, the robbers opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. Masud was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

Name: Pranto Chandra Dey
Description: Kamrul Islam, Officer in Chrage of Mymensingh Police Station claimed that  Pranto Chandra Dey of Mymensingh town's Golpukurpar area, died after suffering a heart attack. Pranto's family members and neighbours, however, said he was innocent and might have been tortured to death.

Name: Faruk Hossain
Description: A man, who was allegedly abducted on July 1, 2016, was killed in a 'gunfight' with police in Jessore on July 2, 2016. The deceased is farmer Faruk Hossain, 42, son of Abu Bakar of Daulatdihi village under Kotwali Police Station, said family sources. Ilias Hossain, Officer-in-Charge, said an unidentified 'robber' died at Khulna Medical College Hospital after he was shot in a 'gunfight' between his cohorts and the law enforcers. The incident took place when a gang was committing robbery at Kanaitala on Rajarhat-Chuknagar road around 2:30 am, the OC said, adding that Faruk was killed in firing by the robbers.

Name: Ibnul Islam Parvej
Identity: Activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islam
Description: An Islami Chhatra Shibir activist was killed in a "gunfight" between police and his cohorts in Uttar-Kastasagra village of Jhenidah Sadar upazila on July 2, 2016. The dead, Ibnul Islam Parvej, 27, was the son of Jahangir Hossain of Bananipara in the district town. Parvej was the former president of Jhenidah Sadar unit Shibir, pro-Jamaat-e-Islami student body.  Hasan Hafizur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Jhenidah Sadar Police Station, said a police team was patrolling Porahati village. When their van reached near the Madhupur graveyard, some criminals opened fire.  The law enforcers then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". At one stage, Parvej was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. Parvej's father Jahangir Hossain said some plainclothes men picked up his son from a house of Mohammadia Housing Society in the capital's Mohammadpur area on June 16. Jahangir claimed that a week ago, he gave Tk 5 lakh to police as bribe for his son's release. But they did not free his son. Instead, they killed him. Jahangir, however, declined to say who took the bribe. Contacted, OC Hasan said they would look into the matter if Jahangir told them the name. Lutfar Rahman, grandfather of the victim, claimed that Parvej was not involved in any subversive activity. He was not facing any case.

Name: Nurul Islam alias Rashed
Description: Two suspects in the Mitu murder case have been killed in a gunfight with police in Rangunia upazila of Chittagong. The dead are Nurul Islam alias Rashed, 27, of Islampur and Mohammad Nurunnabi alias Nabi, 28, of the upazila's Rajanagar area. However, Rashed's family alleged that police had picked up both of them on 23 June, 2016 and cooked up the shootout story after murdering them. Recently on June 29,2016 the law enforcement agency had issued a ban on the two leaving the country. Officer-in-Charge Humayun Kabir of Rangunia Police Station said acting on a tip off, the Detective Branch (DB) of Chittagong Metropolitan Police (CMP) raided Ranirhat around 3:10am on July 5, 2016 to arrest the killers of Mitu, wife of SP Babul Akter. When the police reached Thandachhari area, criminals, who were hiding, opened fire and swooped on the law enforcers with sharp weapons. Police retaliated with gunfire, triggering the gunfight, said the OC. The incident left Rashed and Nabi injured. They were declared dead on arrival at a local health complex, said DB Assistant Commissioner Md Kamruzzaman, who is also the investigation officer of the Mitu murder case.

Name: Abdul Bari
Description:
A freedom fighter was allegedly beaten to death by some railway police personnel after he had locked into an altercation with them over detaining his nephew in a block raid at Jamalpur railway station, on July 11, 2016. The victim, Abdul Bari, 68, was a resident of Hatchandra vicinity of Jamalpur municipality. He was a veteran freedom fighter and a retired member of Bangladesh Army, said Md Safiqul Islam, commander of Jamalpur Zila Muktijoddha Sangsad. Victims family and witnesses said Bari went to General Railway Police station in Jamalpur after being informed that the police had detained his nephew, Majaharul Islam Babu, an MBA student of Rajshahi University, for travelling without a ticket.
The officer-in-charge of Jamalpur railway police station, Goura Chandra Majumdar, said that Babu was detained by railway authority as he boarded a Bangabandhu Bridge-bound train from Chittagong, without a ticket. Bari was trying to get his nephew freed from the police custody.
At one stage of hot altercation, Bari punched one Tapon Barua, a constable of the police station, witnesses said. The constable then indiscriminately punched on the face of the FF, causing him to bleed severely from his nose and mouth, said FF Haider Ali, the commander of Jamalpur sadar upazila muktijodha command, quoting some witnesses. Bari fell on the floor, according to the witnesses.
He was rushed to Jamalpur General Hospital and then was moved to the Combined Military Hospital in Mymensingh, as his condition deteriorated, around 12.00pm. There were injury marks on his face and considering his critical condition, he was referred to CMH of Mymensingh, said Mushair-ul Islam, Civil Surgeon of Jamalpur. The FF succumbed to his injuries around 2:45pm, said FF Haider Ali.
Actions Taken:
The authorities have withdrawn eight policemen, including the officer-in-charge of the police station immediately and that a probe body is formed to investigate into the death, sources said.
The deputy commissioner of Jamalpur district, Shahabuddin Khan, formed a five-member probe committee headed by Russel Sabrin, additional deputy commissioner (general) to investigate into the matter. The probe body has been asked to submit its report within seven working days, The DC said.
Quoting senior officials of railway police, he said eight policemen including the OC were withdrawn immediately.

Name: Jasim Uddin Khokon
Description: Jasim Uddin Khokon was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Ramu upazila, Cox's Bazar.

Name: Lokman Miah
Location: Mirpukurpar in Brahmanbarias Kasba upazila, Brahmanbaria
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and police at Mirpukurpar in Brahmanbarias Kasba upazila on July 16, 2016. The deceased was Lokman Miah, 32, of the upazila.

Name: Tareq Hossain
Location: Makardhos village in Sadar upazila, Lakshmipur
Description: An alleged criminal was killed in a 'gunfight' between police and his cohorts at Makardhos village in Sadar upazila of Laxmipur on July 17, 2016.The deceased was identified as Tareq Hssain, 32, a member of criminal gang 'Bashar Bahini' and son of Abdur Shukur alias Siraj Miah, a resident of the same village.

Name: Saiful Islam
Description: A suspected robber was killed in an alleged gunfight with police at Akhaura in Brahmanbaria, early on July 18, 2016. The deceased was identified as Saiful Islam, son of Idris Mia, of Jangal. He was wanted in six cases, including, five for robbery, police said. The officer-in-charge of Akhaura police, Md Mosharraf Hussain, said that police responded to a tip as a gang of robbers was taking preparation to commit robbery near Tanmandal bridge. A team of Akhaura police conducted a drive there, he said. As police approached the spot around 2:15am, the robbers, sensing police presence, opened gunshots on them prompting police to retaliate, triggering a gunfight, Mosharraf added. At one stage, a number of robbers jumped into the adjacent canal and fled, Mosharraf said. Police then found the body of Saiful on the scene.

Name: Abdul Karim
Description: An under trial prisoner of Munshiganj jail has died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital on July 22, 2016. The family of the deceased Abdul Karim alleged that he was tortured by the complainant before being handed over to the police, who also beat him in jail afterwards. Karim, 35, of Adhariatola village under Munshiganj Sadra upazila, was sent to DMCH for treatment from Munshiganj jail on July 21, 2016 due to a severe chest pain, said Farid Uddin Rubel, jailer of Munshiganj jail. He claimed that when Karim was sent to the jail from the police station on July 11, he was already physically sick. Karim was first admitted to Munshiganj General Hospital for treatment and later sent to DMCH, the jailer added. Karim's wife Moyna Begum said a house was being built by their neighbour Md Shamim; Karim along with others wanted some money from him for arranging a picnic earlier this month. Later, Shamim and his relative Khorshed Alam took Karim to Shamim's office at Adhariatola and beat him mercilessly and handed him to the cops on July 10, she alleged. She also alleged that a sub-inspector of Munshiganj Sadar Police Station tortured Karim at the station and damaged a part of his ear. Shamim also filed an extortion case against Karim the same day and police sent him to Munshiganj jail on July 11, she said.  Moyna alleged that Karim's younger brother Abdus Salam Khan, who was also detained in Munshiganj jail in another case, told her Karim was groaning due to stomach pain on July 22, but when they called a doctor from the local hospital he said that Karim had no problem. Sonjoy Kumar Poddar, a doctor of Munshiganj General Hospital, said as Karim was seriously sick, he was sent to DMCH for better treatment. When asked about the reason behind his sickness, the doctor said that they did not perform any test on Karim before sending him to DMCH. Yunus Ali, officer-in-charge of Munshiganj Sadar Police Statiion, refuted the allegation, saying that police did not torture him.

Name: Mizan Ali alias Mizan Kazi
Description: An alleged inter-district robber gang leader was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Kalia upazila of Narail on July 24, 2016. The dead is Mizan Ali alias Mizan Kazi, 38, of Bagudanga village in the upazila. According to police, Mizan was leading the robber gang. He stood accused in at least a dozen cases, including murder, rape and robbery, with different police stations in Narail and Bagerhat. Mahabubur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Naragati Police Station in Kalia, said a team of Naragati police, led by Sub-inspector Mohiuddin, with the help of Gopalganj police arrested Mizan from his hideout in Gopalganj on July 23, 2016 evening. As per Mizan's statement, the team with him was going to his village home in Bagudanga to recover firearms at night. Around 2:30am, accomplices of Mizan attacked the police van to snatch Mizan when it reached near Balurmath in Pohordanga, the OC added. The criminals opened fire. The law enforcers then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". At one stage, Mizan was caught in the line of fire when he tried to flee from police custody. Others managed to escape, the police official told this correspondent over the phone.

Name: Oliullah Mollah
Location: Ganghati area of the Shyamnagar upazila , Satkhira
Description: A BNP man was killed in a so-called gunfight with police in Satkhira July 10, 2016. The dead, Oliullah Mollah, 40, was the general secretary of Kashimari Union BNP in Shyamnagar upazila, said his brother Habibullah Mollah. The alleged shootout took place in Ganghati area of the upazila around 3:30am. Sub-inspector (SI) Kamal Hossain of Satkhira SP office said a police team, led by SI Sudhangshu Kumar Mondal, was patrolling Ganghati Chorakhali Culvert area. During the time, a number of people were speeding through the area on bikes. Police asked them to pull over but they did not stop. Rather, they started to hurl bombs and open fire on the law enforcers. When policemen retaliated with gunshots, one of the attackers was shot and fell on the ground. Others fled, said the police official. The bullet-hit man was taken to Shyamnagar hospital where on duty doctors declared him dead. However, Oliullah's elder brother Habibullah said the man was innocent. Oliullah had been working as a supervisor at a garments factory in Dhaka for long. He left home for Dhaka at 6:00pm on July 9, 2016.  He was travelling by a bus bound for Dhaka from Kaliganj. Habibullah claimed that police picked up Oliullah from the bus in Devhata Parulia area. Later, he came to know that his brother had been killed in police firing, he added. Police denied the allegation.

Name: Bagha Jewel
Description: Tongi police claimed that an accused of several cases including murder, robbery and extortion succumbed to gunshot wounds getting caught in a crossfire right after his arrest on July 21, 2016. Bagha Jewel, 25, son of late Sentu Ahmed of Brahmanbaria's Bancharampur upazila, was arrested at Duttapara-Bonomala road in Tongi of Gazipur during a raid around 3:45am following a tip-off, claimed Tongi Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Firoz Talukder. His accomplices right afterwards shot at police, who retaliated, leading to a gunfight, he alleged, adding that the accomplices fled and Jewel was sent to Tongi Sadar Hospital and shifted to the National Institute Of Traumatology and Orthopaedic Rehabilitation where he succumbed to his injuries.

Name: Johurul Islam
Location: Punkharua village in Ullapara upazila of Sirajganj
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a shootout with the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) at Salimpur village in Ishwardi upazila on July 29, 2016.The deceased was identified as Johurul Islam, 30, son of Borat Ali Mondol of Punkharua village in Ullapara upazila of Sirajganj. He was allegedly the ringleader of a gang of robbers in Sirajganj and also the regional chief of Johurul Gang, RAB said.

Name: Ramzan Ali
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the law enforcers in Moheshpur upazila of the district on July 30, 2016. The deceased, Ramzan Ali, 45, was son of Kuran Mondal of Krishnapur village in the upazila.However, Ramzan's sister Sumita Khatun told that her brother used to live in a rented house at Khoiyertola area of Jessore Sadar. On July 28, 2016 a group of people in plainclothes introduced themselves as police blindfolded and handcuffed him and took him away with them.

Name: Unidentified
Description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" between his accomplices and police during an anti-militancy drive in the district's Bagmara upazila on August 7, 2016. The identity of the deceased, aged around 34, could not be known immediately, said Moazzem Hossain Bhuiyan, superintendent of police in Rajshahi, while addressing a press briefing. Moazzem said acting on a tip-off that some criminals gathered in a mango orchard of one Mohammad Sumon in Jhikra Joan Bhatpara village around 3:30am, a joint team of Detective Branch of Rajshahi district police and Bagmara police raided the orchard. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the criminals exploded several crude bombs and opened fire. Police also returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the gun battle, police found the man lying in a pool of blood. He was declared dead after being taken to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital (RMCH), the police official added. Other criminals managed to flee.

Name: Nazrul Islam alias Hasan
Description: Nazrul Islam alias Hasan alias was killed in a gunfight with police in Rajshahi city. He was an alleged member of banned militant outfit of Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) .

Name: Shafiul Islam
Location: Near a brickfield at Dangrigoshpala area under Chandipasha union, some three to four kilometres east of Nandail upazila headquarters, Mymensingh
Description: Two militants, including Shafiul Islam who was among the Sholakia attackers, were killed in a gunfight between RAB and Shafiul's associates in Mymensingh, RAB and police claimed. Identity of the second victim could not be known immediately. But Commanding Officer of RAB-14 Lt Col Shariful Islam claimed he was an associate of Shafiul and was among those who attacked the RAB convoy. The RAB official said Shafiul, also known as Saiful, had been undergoing treatment at Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH) under Rab custody since he was caught from the attack scene in Kishoreganj on the Eid day. After doctors released him August 4, 2016 he was being taken to Kishoreganj to be handed over to the police, he said. They came under attack at a place in Nandail when the attackers tried to snatch away Shafiul by hurling bombs and opening fires, he claimed. A gun battle ensued when RAB fired back, leaving the two hit by bullets, he added. Nandail police said the gunfight happened around 11:00pm near a brickfield at Dangrigoshpala area under Chandipasha union, some three to four kilometres east of Nandail upazila headquarters. Arif Mohammad Ziauddin, emergency medical officer at Nandail Upazila Health Complex, told that the two were taken dead around midnight. Shafiul is originally from Dinajpur.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Two militants, including Shafiul Islam who was among the Sholakia attackers, were killed in a gunfight between RAB and Shafiul's associates in Mymensingh, RAB and police claimed. Identity of the second victim could not be known immediately. But Commanding Officer of RAB-14 Lt Col Shariful Islam claimed he was an associate of Shafiul and was among those who attacked the RAB convoy. The RAB official said Shafiul, also known as Saiful, had been undergoing treatment at Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH) under Rab custody since he was caught from the attack scene in Kishoreganj on the Eid day. After doctors released him August 4, 2016 he was being taken to Kishoreganj to be handed over to the police, he said. They came under attack at a place in Nandail when the attackers tried to snatch away Shafiul by hurling bombs and opening fires, he claimed. A gun battle ensued when RAB fired back, leaving the two hit by bullets, he added. Nandail police said the gunfight happened around 11:00pm near a brickfield at Dangrigoshpala area under Chandipasha union, some three to four kilometres east of Nandail upazila headquarters. Arif Mohammad Ziauddin, emergency medical officer at Nandail Upazila Health Complex, told that the two were taken dead around midnight. Shafiul is originally from Dinajpur.

Name: Delwar Hossain Liton
Description: In Dhaka, the gunfight took place between a group of seven to eight alleged drug peddlers and Rapid Action Battalion members at Postogola in Kadamtoli area around 4:15am on August 12, 2016. Delwar Hossain Liton was found lying on the spot after the incident, said Jahangir Hossain Matubbar, commanding officer of RAB-10. He was taken to Mitford Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead, the RAB official added. Delwar's wife Rozina told that her husband's name is Liton Miah, 26, and he was a local drug peddler. But he never had any arms in his possession, she claimed. Someone called her husband and took him away from Chittagong Road area on August 11, 2016 evening and since then, he was missing, she added. Delwar's body was sent to Sir Salimullah Medical College morgue for an autopsy.

Name: Shahidul Islam Pancha
Location: Falsi Battala in Jhenidah's Harinakundo upazila
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with RAB members at Falsi Battala in Jhenidah's Harinakundo upazila on August 12, 2016. The deceased is Shahidul Islam Pancha, 42, of Pardakhalpur village in the upazila. Jhenidah RAB-6 Commander Monir Ahmed said a RAB patrol team had gone to Falsi Battala area after being informed that a gang of robbers was planning to commit a robbery there. As the RAB team reached the area, the robbers opened fire, prompting the elite force members to retaliate. Shahidul was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. The other robbers, however, managed to flee.

Name: Anarul Sana
Description: Anarul Sana, an alleged robber, was killed in Koyra upazila in a gunfight with police on August 12, 2016. He stood accused in 10 cases, including robbery, said police. Anarul was arrested from Koyra Bazar area around 2:35pm on August 11, 2016 said Sheikh Shamsher Ali, officer-in-charge of Koyra Police Station. Later, based on information he provided during questioning, police took him along with them on a raid in Kharkharia river area inside the Sundarbans to recover firearms, the OC said. As soon as law enforcers reached there, Anarul's cohorts opened fire, triggering a gunfight that left Anarul and three policemen injured, he said. Anarul was taken to Koyra Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, Shamsher added. The injured police members were undergoing treatment at the hospital.

Name: Sadir Miah
Description: A sub-inspector was closed over allegation of police beating up an old man to death in Moulvibazar on August 11, 2016. The victim is Sadir Miah, 60, of Kalenga village in Kamalganj upazila of the district. His son Shipon Miah is an accused in a case filed with Kamalganj Police Station, said Mullah Md Sahin, assistant superintendent of police of Moulvibazar. Police went to raid Sadir Miah's house to nab Shipon, he said. Sadir's wife Safina Begum said a police team carried out the raid around 4:00am on August 11, 2016. Not seeing Shipon at home at the time, the law enforcers dragged his father out and beat him up.  Having been beaten severely, her husband died on the spot, Safina added. Local people brought out a procession and held a rally in the area to protest the incident. Holding police responsible for the killing, they issued a 24-hour ultimatum for suspension of Sub-inspector Nazrul Islam.

Name: Unidentified
Location: In a mango orchard of one Mohammad Sumon in Jhikra Joan Bhatpara village, Rajshahi
Description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" between his accomplices and police during an anti-militancy drive in the district's Bagmara upazila on August 7, 2016. The identity of the deceased, aged around 34, could not be known immediately, said Moazzem Hossain Bhuiyan, superintendent of police in Rajshahi, while addressing a press briefing on August 7, 2016 noon. Moazzem said acting on a tip-off that some criminals gathered in a mango orchard of one Mohammad Sumon in Jhikra Joan Bhatpara village around 3:30am, a joint team of Detective Branch of Rajshahi district police and Bagmara police raided the orchard. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the criminals exploded several crude bombs and opened fire. Police also returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the gun battle, police found the man lying in a pool of blood. He was declared dead after being taken to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital (RMCH), the police official added. Other criminals managed to flee. Six policemen were injured in the "gunfight" and they took first aid at the RMCH, claimed the SP. Police also claimed to have recovered a pistol, three bullets, 13 crude bombs, several sharp weapons and some jihadi books from the spot.

Name: Abdur Rashid Biswas
Description: On August 13, 2016 Abdur Rashid Biswas was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.However, family members of Abdur Rashid claimed that he was picked up by plain clothes men claiming to be members of police  at around 9.30 pm on August 12, 2016.

Name: Mohammad Shamim alias Fokir
Description: On August 15, 2016 Mohammad Shamim alias Fokir was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Rahis Miah
Description: An alleged drug smuggler was killed in a reported gunfight between his cohorts and police at Konabari in Kosba on August 24, 2016.The deceased was identified as Rahis Miah, 48, son of late Sawdagor Ali Fakir, of Pathariatek village in Akhaura upazila.Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Kosba police station Mohiuddin Ahammed said tipped off, a team of police conducted a drive in the area when a gang of drug smugglers, including Rahis, was staying there at about 1.30 am.

Name: Mukul Munshi
Description: On August 27, 2016 Mukul Munshi aged 40 was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB-12.

Name: Abu Bakar
Description: A suspected ringleader of a Sunderban-based robbery gang was killed in a gunfight between robbers and Rapid Action Battalion members in the forest in Khulna on August 26, 2016 morning. The deceased was identified as Abu Bakar, 40, suspected chief of Saijya Bahini in the Sunderban, RAB said. Tipped off that a gang of robbers gathered in Phultala area to commit robbery, a RAB team raided the area around 7:30am, Khulna RAB-6 operation officer Zahid Hossain said. Sensing RAB members presence, the criminals opened fire on the battalion personnel, who retaliated. At one stage, the robbers fled the scene and searching the spot, RAB men found a bullet-hit body,

Name: Sanwar Hossain Sanu
Location: Ankutia village in Pabna's Chatmohar, Pabna
Description: Two alleged criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with Rapid Action Battalion in Kamarkhand upazila of Sirajganj on August 25, 2016.  They are Sanwar Hossain Sanu, 32, of Bharanga village of the upazila, and Lutful Ali, 55, of Ankutia village in Pabna's Chatmohar. The two stood accused in eight criminal cases with different police stations, RAB said. Shahabuddin Khan, commander of RAB-12 in Sirajganj, said RAB members arrested Farhad Ali, one of the prime accused in Awami League leader Mahbub Alam Milton murder case, on August 9. On June 19 this year, Milton, also an UP member in Kamarkhand, was hacked to death by criminals. A case was filed with Kamarkhand Police Station in this connection. The elite force later took over the charge of the case, sources said. During interrogation, Farhad mentioned some names, including Sanwar and Lutful, saying that they were involved in the murder, RAB commander said in a press release. Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB from Sirajganj camp went to Jamtoil station around 3:00am on August 25, 2016 where Milon murder suspects were hiding to nab them, he said.   When the team reached the spot, the criminals opened fire. The RAB men then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". During the gun battle, Sanwar and Lutful were hit by bullets. They were taken to Sirajganj General Hospital where the doctors declared them dead.

Name: Lutful Ali
Description: Two alleged criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with Rapid Action Battalion in Kamarkhand upazila of Sirajganj on August 25, 2016.  They are Sanwar Hossain Sanu, 32, of Bharanga village of the upazila, and Lutful Ali, 55, of Ankutia village in Pabna's Chatmohar. The two stood accused in eight criminal cases with different police stations, RAB said. Shahabuddin Khan, commander of RAB-12 in Sirajganj, said RAB members arrested Farhad Ali, one of the prime accused in Awami League leader Mahbub Alam Milton murder case, on August 9. On June 19 this year, Milton, also an UP member in Kamarkhand, was hacked to death by criminals. A case was filed with Kamarkhand Police Station in this connection. The elite force later took over the charge of the case, sources said. During interrogation, Farhad mentioned some names, including Sanwar and Lutful, saying that they were involved in the murder, RAB commander said in a press release. Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB from Sirajganj camp went to Jamtoil station around 3:00am on August 25, 2016 where Milon murder suspects were hiding to nab them, he said.   When the team reached the spot, the criminals opened fire. The RAB men then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". During the gun battle, Sanwar and Lutful were hit by bullets. They were taken to Sirajganj General Hospital where the doctors declared them dead.

Name: Khaled Hasan alias Badar Mama
Identity: Member of Alleged banned militant outfit of JMB
Description: A suspected top leader of Neo JMB and another key operative of the organisation were killed in a gunfight with police in Bogra's Sherpur upazila on August 29, 2016. The deceased militants were identified as Khaled Hasan, 30, alias Badar Mama, and Ripon, 29, alias Golam Tareque alias Abu Ibrahim. They were allegedly involved in several militant attacks in the country's northern region last year. Khaled, a military commander of the northern region, masterminded the attack on Italian physician Piero Parolari, the bomb attack at Kantaji Mandir, the attack on Iskcon temple and looting of a petrol pump in Dinajpur in November and December last year, said Gaziur Rahman, senior assistant superintendent of police in Bogra.

Name: Ripon alias Golam Tareque alias Abu Ibrahim
Identity: Member of Alleged banned militant outfit of JMB

Name: Nurunnabi
Location: Golzars house at Birbhodra Balahati village of Mahiganj in Rangpur
Description: On August 19, 2016 at midnight, a group of police led by the two Sub-Inspectors of Kotwali Police Station, Tareq and Tofazzal raided Golzars house at Birbhodra Balahati village of Mahiganj in Rangpur town and arrested him under a motorbike stealing case. Later two police officers demanded one hundred twenty thousand taka bribe to Golzars family. At one stage, his family gave the police eighty thousand taka and they informed the police that rest of the money would be given the next day. But this was not acceptable to Golzars elder brother Nurunnabi and he entangled in an altercation with police in this regard. This enraged the police and apprehended Nurunnabi in allegation of stealing. Police also demanded money for him. He was severely beaten by police as he was unable to pay. At once, Nurunnabi fell on the ground and died on the spot.

Name: Sagar
Description: An alleged snatcher was killed and another sustained bullet wounds in police firing in the capital's Dhanmondi on September 6, 2016. Law enforcers also nabbed their accomplice Bashar when he was trying to flee the spot. Police said the dead is Sagar, 26, a listed snatcher. The injured is Hazrat Ali, 28. The trio in a private car attempted snatch valuables from a rickshaw passenger near Matsya Bhaban intersectionn around 6.00 am, said Maruf Hossain Sorder, Deputy Commissioner (Ramna division) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police. He said on information, a patrol team of Shahbagh police chased them to Road-3 in Dhanmondi. At one stage, the criminals stopped the car there as police put a barricade on the road. Abu Bakar Siddique, OC of Shahbagh Police Station, said when the criminals were trying to flee the scene, police opened fire, injuring Sagar, Hazrat and Bashar caught from the spot. Sagar and Hazrat were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared Sagar dead.

Name: Ali Mia
Description: An alleged snatcher was killed and another sustained bullet wounds in police firing in the capital's Dhanmondi on September 6, 2016. Law enforcers also nabbed their accomplice Bashar when he was trying to flee the spot. Police said the dead is Sagar, 26, a listed snatcher. The injured is Hazrat Ali, 28. The trio in a private car attempted snatch valuables from a rickshaw passenger near Matsya Bhaban intersectionn around 6.00 am, said Maruf Hossain Sorder, Deputy Commissioner (Ramna division) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police. He said on information, a patrol team of Shahbagh police chased them to Road-3 in Dhanmondi. At one stage, the criminals stopped the car there as police put a barricade on the road. Abu Bakar Siddique, OC of Shahbagh Police Station, said when the criminals were trying to flee the scene, police opened fire, injuring Sagar, Hazrat and Bashar caught from the spot. Sagar and Hazrat were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared Sagar dead.

Name: Lal Mia
Description: On September 2, 2016 Lal Mia was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police. However, family members claimed that he was picked up by police before the gunfight on September 01, 2016.

Name: Fadur Ali alias Ripon
Description: A man, accused in several murders cases, was killed in a "gunfight" between his cohorts and police in Bajitpur upazila on September 15, 2016. The deceased, Fadur Ali alias RIpon, 35, was son of late Morshed Mia of Dari Ghaghatia village in the upazila. Police arrested Fadur from Narsingdi's Belabo upazila on September 14, 2016. Later, police along with Fadur raided Satirchar village to recover firearms around 3:00 am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Fadur's associates opened fire on the policemen prompting them to retaliate, triggering a "gunfight". Fadur was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, police added.

Name: Al Amin
Description: An alleged leader of a gang of robbers group was allegedly killed in a "gunfight" in Hatirjheel area on September 12, 2016. The deceased was identified Al Amin, 28, who had several cases.

Name: Anwar
Description: The "gunfight" took place when the robbers were planning to commit a robbery in Shreekhondia village, said Mohoshinul Quadir, OC of Ashulia police. when a police patrol team reached the spot around 4:30 am, the suspected robbers opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to fire back and thus triggering a gunfight between them, the OC said.Anward died instantly, he mentioned, adding that Anwar was accused in at least five cases including of murder and robbery.

Name: Humayun Kabir
Description: An alleged abductor was killed in a gunfight with policemen in Pirganj upazila of Rangpur on September 20, 2016. The deceased was identified as Humayun Kabir, 27, son of Abdus Sattar of Dhefulia village under Barisal Sadar upazila. A police team arrested five people including Humayun Kabir from Chandipur village on charge of abducting a trader on September 19, 2016 evening, said Rezaul Karim, officer in charge (OC) of Pirganj Police Station in Rangpur. "Later police went to Chandipur village taking Humayun with them to recover arms as per his statement. "As police arrived there, Humayun's cohorts snatched him away, firing several gunshots. Police also fired back, leaving Humayun dead on the spot. "

Name: Rakibul Islam
Description: A union parishad member, who is also the prime accused in the abduction and killing of schoolboy Mahfuz Alam Sajib, was killed in a 'gunfight' with the Rapid Action Battalion members in a mango orchard at Gobindapur under Damurhuda in Chuadanga on September 18, 2016. The killed was identified as Rakibul Islam aged 28, son of Iman Ali of village Alukdia under Chuadanga Sadar. He was a member of Alukdia union parishad and went in hiding after the abduction and killing of Sajib.

Name: Farid alias Khokon
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Mohammad Ali
Location: Matialpara area under Belabo Upazila in Norshingdi
Description: On September 7, 2016 Sub Inspector of the Detective Branch (DB) of Police at Norshingdi, Khokon Chandra Sarkar conducted a raid at Mohammad Alis grocery shop on suspicion over the selling of drugs in the shop, in Matialpara area under Belabo Upazila in Norshingdi District. During the raid, Mohammad Ali was beaten with an iron rod and also hit with bricks when he denied the allegation of selling drugs. Later he was taken to Belabo Police Station and a case was filed against him after police confiscated 100 Yaba. Witnesses and the family members of Mohammad Ali said that at around 3:00 pm Mohammad Ali was brought to Norshingdi District Hospital with severe injuries and he died there in the evening. The Officer-in-Charge of Detective Branch of Police (DB) in Norshingdi, Saidur Rahman said that Mohammad Ali was in good health when he was arrested. Later he was taken to the hospital when he became sick and as a result he died while was under treatment.

Name: Abul Bashar
Identity: Activist of student wing of Jamaat-e-Islam
Description: A JAMAAT-E-ISLAMI activist was killed in a reported gunfight between his cohorts and police at Satkania upazila in Chittagong on October 16, 2016 morning. The deceased, identified as Abul Bashar,40, son of the late Dudu Mia of Kanchana area of the upazila, was involved with Jamaat-e-Islami, police said. According to them, eight police personnel were also injured in the gunfight and they had been given primary treatment at the local health complex.  Farid Uddin Khandakar, Officer-in-Charge of Satkania Police Station, said a police team arrested Bashar at Banshkhali upazila October 15, 2016 evening. After primary interrogation, police conducted a drive along with the arrestee in Chhonkhola area of Eochia union around 6.30 am on October 16, 2016, when sensing their presence, his cohorts opened fire at the police force, he said. Police also fired back triggering a gunfight and at one point Bashar was injured with bullet, he added. Police sent him to Satkania Upazila Health Complex where duty doctor declared him dead.

Name: Unidentified
Identity: Member of United People's Democratic Front (UPDF)
Description: An armed member of United People's Democratic Front (UPDF) was killed in a gunfight with a team of joint forces in Khagrachhari Sadar upazila on October 14, 2016 evening. However, the identity of the victim could not be known immediately. Lt. Col Mohammad Rashidul Hasan, director of ISPR, told that the forces came to know that some 15-20 armed members of UPDF were in a  secret meeting with their party chief at Kutukchhari. They were planning to commit subversive activities in different areas. After the meeting, they returned to their den, the ISPR said in a statement. A team of the forces went to Datkupia and Bhuachhari areas around 6:00 pm, found the den and surrounded it, the statement added. Sensing the presence of the forces members, the criminals opened fire. The joint forces then returned fire, triggering the gunfight. During the gunfight, a member of the UPDF was killed. The others managed to flee, the statement said.

Name: Manik Mia
Description: On October 13, 2016 he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police after 26 hours of his arrest.

Name: Delwar Hossain
Description: Family alleged that, a group of plainclothes men picked up Delwar Hossain on Octobr 9 at around 11.00 pm from a road near to his house. The next day, he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at early in the morning. Police said that he was  killed in a gunfight.

Name: Shah Alam Nayan
Identity: Leader of youth wing of BNP
Description: Shah Alam Nayan aged  42, organising secretary of Savar municipality unit Jubo Dal was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police. SM Kamruzzaman, OC of Savar Police Station, said a team picked him up from Mohammadpur in the capital and took him to a nursery of Krishibid Foundation in Birulia area around 2:30 am to recover firearms. Sensing presence of law enforcers, criminals opened fire on the police, who also retaliated. At one stage, Nayan was shot, police said. He was whisked off to Savar Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead. Police claimed he used to run a drug racket in Savar, Ashulia and Amin Bazar on the outskirts of the capital. His family members, however, alleged that police "shot him dead" for his political affiliation with the BNP and also for money and then cooked up a story.

Name: Nizam
Description: A robber was killed and three policemen were injured in a "gunfight" with police at Bibirhat of Ramgati upazila of Lakshmipur on October 1, 2016. The dead was identified as Nizam, 28, son of Abdus Salam of Char Jabbar in Noakhali district. Iqbal Hossain, Officer-in-Charge of Ramgati Police Station, said Nizam was arrested in Boyar Char area in Ramgati on September 30, 2016 night. Based on his information, police took him to Bibirhat area to arrest his accomplices, who opened fire on the law enforcers. The police retaliated with gunshots and Nizam was killed in "crossfire".

Name: Sabuj Hossain
Description: Two  accused in a schoolboy murder case were killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion in Damurhuda upazila of Chuadanga on October 20, 2016. The dead are Sabuj Hossain, 23, of C&B area in Chuadanga town and Shakil Hossain, 21, of Darshana town in the district. The two were accused in the murder case of Mahfuz Alam Sajib. Major Monir Ahmmed, Deputy Director of RAB-6 in Jhenaidah, said a RAB team launched a drive in Shantipara area of the upazila around 2:45 am on information that a group of criminals were holding a meeting there. Sensing the presence of RAB members, criminals opened fire on RAB men, forcing them to fire retaliatory shots. At one stage, the criminals fled the scene. The RAB team later searched the area and found the bodies of Sabuj and Shakil.

Name: Shakil Hossain
Description: Two  accused in a schoolboy murder case were killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion in Damurhuda upazila of Chuadanga on October 20, 2016. The dead are Sabuj Hossain, 23, of C&B area in Chuadanga town and Shakil Hossain, 21, of Darshana town in the district. The two were accused in the murder case of Mahfuz Alam Sajib. Major Monir Ahmmed, Deputy Director of RAB-6 in Jhenaidah, said a RAB team launched a drive in Shantipara area of the upazila around 2:45 am on information that a group of criminals were holding a meeting there. Sensing the presence of RAB members, criminals opened fire on RAB men, forcing them to fire retaliatory shots. At one stage, the criminals fled the scene. The RAB team later searched the area and found the bodies of Sabuj and Shakil.

Name: Rasel Dewan
Description: A suspected miscreant was killed in a 'gunfight' with police in Kurgaon area under Ashulia police station in Dhaka on October 23, 2016. The deceased was identified as Rasel Dewan aged 32, son of Piyar Ali of Niribili area of Ashulia.  Ashulia police officer-in-charge Mohsinul Quadir said that acting on a tip-off, a team of the Ashulia police arrested Rasel on October 22, 2016 night. Later, the police team, along with Rasel, went to Kurgaon area to recover illegal firearms and arrest his accomplices. The OC claimed that miscreants opened fire at them after they reached in the area at about 3.30 am and the gunfight took place as the police retaliated.Rasel recieved bullet injuries in the clash while his accomplices managed to escape. The OC said that they took him at first to Ganosasthya Kendra and later, to Savar Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Nizampur of Mirsarai on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway, Chittagong
Description: On October 29, 2016 three alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with the members of RAB-7. The dead, though not identified yet, have been branded as robbers by law enforcers.  According to the RAB, a microbus carrying members of RAB-7 came under attack by robbers around 2:30am at Nizampur of Mirsarai on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway. The law enforcers were patrolling the area in plain clothes at the time.The robbers put up barricades and fired at the vehicle, said Chandan Debnath, Assistant Director of RAB-7. The Rab personnel retaliated. Minutes later when the gunfight stopped, three of the attackers were found bullet-hit, Chandan said. The injured were taken to Mirsarai Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Nizampur of Mirsarai on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway, Chittagong
Description: On October 29, 2016 three alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with the members of RAB-7. The dead, though not identified yet, have been branded as robbers by law enforcers.  According to the RAB, a microbus carrying members of RAB-7 came under attack by robbers around 2:30am at Nizampur of Mirsarai on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway. The law enforcers were patrolling the area in plain clothes at the time.The robbers put up barricades and fired at the vehicle, said Chandan Debnath, Assistant Director of RAB-7. The Rab personnel retaliated. Minutes later when the gunfight stopped, three of the attackers were found bullet-hit, Chandan said. The injured were taken to Mirsarai Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Nizampur of Mirsarai on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway, Chittagong
Description: On October 29, 2016 three alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with the members of RAB-7. The dead, though not identified yet, have been branded as robbers by law enforcers.  According to the RAB, a microbus carrying members of RAB-7 came under attack by robbers around 2:30am at Nizampur of Mirsarai on the Dhaka-Chittagong highway. The law enforcers were patrolling the area in plain clothes at the time.The robbers put up barricades and fired at the vehicle, said Chandan Debnath, Assistant Director of RAB-7. The Rab personnel retaliated. Minutes later when the gunfight stopped, three of the attackers were found bullet-hit, Chandan said. The injured were taken to Mirsarai Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Unidentified
Description: On October 29, 2016 two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with policeat Gobindgunia on the Kushtia-Pabna highway, Kushtia. In Kushtia, police h aving been tipped-off conducted a drive at Gobindgunia on the Kushtia-Pabna highway. A gang of 8-10 men were preparing to commit a robbery around 1:00am, said Kazi Jalal Uddin, officer-in-charge of Mirpur Police Station. Seeing law enforcers, they opened fire and threw several crude bombs. Police fired back triggering a gunfight, the OC said.  The incident left two robbers dead on the spot while their associates fled.

Name: Unidentified
Description: On October 29, 2016 two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with policeat Gobindgunia on the Kushtia-Pabna highway, Kushtia. In Kushtia, police h aving been tipped-off conducted a drive at Gobindgunia on the Kushtia-Pabna highway. A gang of 8-10 men were preparing to commit a robbery around 1:00am, said Kazi Jalal Uddin, officer-in-charge of Mirpur Police Station. Seeing law enforcers, they opened fire and threw several crude bombs. Police fired back triggering a gunfight, the OC said.  The incident left two robbers dead on the spot while their associates fled.

Name: Biplob Kumar Bepary allias Bipul
Identity: Member of the outlawed Nakshal Bahini
Location: Goyeshbari area under Ataikula in Santhia upazila, Pabna
Description: Two alleged members of the outlawed Nakshal Bahini were killed in a shootout with Rapid Action Battalion on October 28, 2016 claimed Rab. The incident took place at Goyeshbari area under Ataikula in Santhia upazila. One of the killed was identified as Biplob Kumar Bepary allias Bipul 28, son of Abdul Pramanik from Bil Shalangi village and the other was Moyen Uddin, 27, son of Motaleb Hossain from Paiksha village under Ataikula of Santhia upazila in the district, RAB said. On a tipoff that members of the outlawed party were holding a secret meeting near Goyeshbari Government Primary School, a RAB team was sent there, Bina Rani Das, commander of RAB12 in Pabna said. The RAB team was shot at when they raided the place around 4:00am. The RAB team fired back.

Name: Moyen Uddin
Identity: Member of the outlawed Nakshal Bahini

Name: Delwar Hossain alias master Delu
Description: On October 20, 2016 he was allegedly killed in a gunfight by the members of RAB-11 at Siddhirganj, Narayanganj.

Name: Nurun Nabi
Description: An alleged criminal was killed in a gunfight with members of RAB in Tangail on October 3,2016. The deceased is Nurun Nabi alias Munshi aged 35 of Thanapara area in the town.

Name: Kulu Mollah
Description: A suspected member of banned extremist outfit Jamaatul Mujahideen Bangladesh was killed in a 'gunfight' with police at Kaburhat in Kushtia on October 31, 2016, police said. The deceased was Kulu Mollah aged 30, a resident of Khajanagar under sadar upazila and a regional commander of JMB, said Detective Branch of Kushtia police.

Name: Alal Miah
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a 'gunfight' with police in Habiganj on November 9, 2016. The deceased was identified as Alal Miah, 25, son of Rahmat Ali of village Sultansi of Habiganj sadar upazila. Habiganj sadar police officer-in-charge Yasinul Haque said that a gang of suspected robbers made a sudden attack on a patrol team of the police at about 3:00 am while the lawmen patrolling in Machhulia area near the River Khoai, leaving for policemen injured. The gunfight took place as the police retaliated by firing, the OC said. Later, the body of Alal, which received bullet injuries, was recovered from the spot, he said, adding that it was sent to Habiganj Sadar Hospital morgue for post mortem examinations.

Name: Mahbub Alam
Description: On November 10, 2016 Mahbub Alam was allegedly killed in a gunfight by police at Dhaka- Mymensingh highway.

Name: Billal Hossain
Description: A suspected leader of outlawed Biplobi Communist Party was killed in a 'gunfight' between police and the party operatives at a bamboo grove at Garakhula under Phultala in Khulna on November 8, 2016. The deceased was identified as Billal Hossain, 35, of Jugnipasha village of Phultala. ASI Md Asmot Ali,  said that a team of Phultala police, on secret information, conducted a raid at Garakhola area. As soon as the police team reached near a bamboo grove in the area, the out-laws opened fired on police at about 1:30 am, he said. He said that police also retaliated by firing. The police officer said that after the gunfight, police searched the area and found bullet-hit Billal left abandoned. Police took him to the hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Shawkat
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a 'gunfight' with police on Magura-Jhenaidah highway in Pashchim Ramnagar area of sadar upazila on November 7, 2016. The deceased was identified as Shawkat, 38, son of Moyen Uddin, a resident of Komorpur village in Mashukhali upazila of Faridpur district.  On information that a robber gang was preparing to commit robbery by placing logs on the highway, a team of the law enforcers conducted a drive in the area around 2:00 am, said Azmal Huda, OC of sadar police station. Sensing the presence of police, the gang opened fire at them, prompting them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight. The gunfight left Shawkat dead on the spot, added the OC.

Name: Anisur Rahman
Description: Anisur,a Sramik Dal leader was killed on November 2, 2016. His brother Azizur Rahman claimed that police picked up Anisur on October 30 and took him to DB office. Police demanded Tk 10 lakh bribe for his release but Anisur was killed as they couldn't pay the money . Police  claimed that he was killed in a reported gunfight between two groups of criminals at Begaritala in Manirampur upazila

Name: Unidentified
Description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a reported gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion in Lalpole area. Identities of the two could not be known. Squadron leader Safaat Jamil Fahim of RAB-7 said that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit robbery in the area on Dhaka-Chittagong Highway a team of the battalion conducted a drive there around 2:45 am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on the battalion personnel prompting them to retaliate that triggered a 30-minute gunfight. Two robbers recieved bullet injuries during the gun-fight. They were taken to Feni General Hospital where on duty physician declared them dead.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a reported gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion in Lalpole area. Identities of the two could not be known. Squadron leader Safaat Jamil Fahim of RAB-7 said that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit robbery in the area on Dhaka-Chittagong Highway a team of the battalion conducted a drive there around 2:45 am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on the battalion personnel prompting them to retaliate that triggered a 30-minute gunfight. Two robbers recieved bullet injuries during the gun-fight. They were taken to Feni General Hospital where on duty physician declared them dead.

Name: Manik
Description: Three people were shot dead by police during triangular clashes  on November 14, 2016 between two local grous of ruling Awami League and the police in four contiguous villages in Nilokhiya union, Raipura, Narsingdi. Relatives of deceased alleged that Manik, Khokon and Mamun were killed in police firing.

Name: Khokon
Description: Three people were shot dead by police during triangular clashes  on November 14, 2016 between two local grous of ruling Awami League and the police in four contiguous villages in Nilokhiya union, Raipura, Narsingdi. Relatives of deceased alleged that Manik, Khokon and Mamun were killed in police firing.

Name: Mamun
Description: Three people were shot dead by police during triangular clashes  on November 14, 2016 between two local grous of ruling Awami League and the police in four contiguous villages in Nilokhiya union, Raipura, Narsingdi. Relatives of deceased alleged that Manik, Khokon and Mamun were killed in police firing.

Name: Md Abdul Jabbar
Description: A suspected ringleader of a robber gang was killed in a said gunfight between his cohorts and police at village Kalagachhia under Amtoli upazila in Barguna on November 24, 2016. The deceased was identified as Md Abdul Jabbar, 45, son of Amjed Hawlader, a resident of the village.. Amtoli Police Station sub-inspector Shah Alam said on a tip-off a team of Amtoli police raided the village while the gang of robbers were preparing to commit robbery in the area.Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the suspected robbers opened fire on them around 3.00 am prompting the police to retaliate that triggered a gun battle. At one stage, Jabbar sustained gunshot wounds while his cohorts fled the scene, Alam said. Jabbar was taken to Amtoli Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctor pronounced him dead.

Name: Dalim
Description: On November 12, 2016 a group of robbers near Srimoddi area of Homna preparing for robbery in the Mehgna river. At that time, a group of police conducted an operation in the River. At that time, police arrested two of the robbers and going back. In the meantime, robbers chased them and opened fire. As a result police retaliated. A robber recieved bullet injury later died in the hospital.

Name: Unidentified
Identity: Member of Alleged banned militant outfit of JMB
Location: Rasulpur Bridge area, Bagerhat Sadar upazila , Bagerhat
Description: An alleged member of outlawed militant outfit Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) was killed in a gunfight with police in Bagerhat Sadar upazila on November 27, 2016. Acting on a tip off, a joint team of DB police and Bagerhat Model Thana police raided Rasulpur Bridge area around 1:00am, said Pankaj Chandra Roy, Superintendent of Police in Bagerhat. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, miscreants opened fire and hurled crude bombs at the police vehicle, triggering a gunfight, he added. At one stage, the attackers fled the scene leaving one of their cohorts with bullet wounds, he informed. The unidentified injured JMB suspect was whisked off to Khulna Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Rustom Ali
Description: Four suspected robbers were "killed in gunfight" with RAB in Pabna November 25, 2016. According to Rapid Action Battalion, the four "robbers" died of bullet injuries they sustained during exchange of fires as the RAB confronted and chased a gang of 15 to 20 robbers while the criminals were robbing the rice mill at Joynagar of Ishwardi around 3:00am. Three other suspected robbers, injured during the said gunfight, were undergoing treatment at Pabna Medical College Hospital. Before succumbing to his injuries, one of the deceased "robbers", aged 30, identified himself as Rustom Ali, RAB said.  The other three deceased -- Badsha Miah, 32, Shafikul Islam, 35 and Monjurul Islam, 36, from Mymensingh and Chandpur -- were identified by their wounded associates apprehended by the RAB.

Name: Badsha Miah
Description: Four suspected robbers were "killed in gunfight" with RAB in Pabna November 25, 2016. According to Rapid Action Battalion, the four "robbers" died of bullet injuries they sustained during exchange of fires as the RAB confronted and chased a gang of 15 to 20 robbers while the criminals were robbing the rice mill at Joynagar of Ishwardi around 3:00am. Three other suspected robbers, injured during the said gunfight, were undergoing treatment at Pabna Medical College Hospital. Before succumbing to his injuries, one of the deceased "robbers", aged 30, identified himself as Rustom Ali, RAB said.  The other three deceased -- Badsha Miah, 32, Shafikul Islam, 35 and Monjurul Islam, 36, from Mymensingh and Chandpur -- were identified by their wounded associates apprehended by the RAB.

Name: Shafikul Islam
Description: Four suspected robbers were "killed in gunfight" with RAB in Pabna November 25, 2016. According to Rapid Action Battalion, the four "robbers" died of bullet injuries they sustained during exchange of fires as the RAB confronted and chased a gang of 15 to 20 robbers while the criminals were robbing the rice mill at Joynagar of Ishwardi around 3:00am. Three other suspected robbers, injured during the said gunfight, were undergoing treatment at Pabna Medical College Hospital. Before succumbing to his injuries, one of the deceased "robbers", aged 30, identified himself as Rustom Ali, RAB said.  The other three deceased -- Badsha Miah, 32, Shafikul Islam, 35 and Monjurul Islam, 36, from Mymensingh and Chandpur -- were identified by their wounded associates apprehended by the RAB.

Name: Monjurul Islam
Description: Four suspected robbers were "killed in gunfight" with RAB in Pabna November 25, 2016. According to Rapid Action Battalion, the four "robbers" died of bullet injuries they sustained during exchange of fires as the RAB confronted and chased a gang of 15 to 20 robbers while the criminals were robbing the rice mill at Joynagar of Ishwardi around 3:00am. Three other suspected robbers, injured during the said gunfight, were undergoing treatment at Pabna Medical College Hospital. Before succumbing to his injuries, one of the deceased "robbers", aged 30, identified himself as Rustom Ali, RAB said.  The other three deceased -- Badsha Miah, 32, Shafikul Islam, 35 and Monjurul Islam, 36, from Mymensingh and Chandpur -- were identified by their wounded associates apprehended by the RAB.

Name: Jahangir Alam
Location: Uttorpara village, Shantola Sadar upazila, Jessore
Description: Police claimed that a youth named Jahangir Alam (30), was killed in a gunfight between two groups of criminals. The victims family alleged that police picked up two brothers, Jahangir Alam (30) and Abid Hasan (27), from their house and shot Jahangir dead. There was no information of the whereabouts of Abid. Abdur Rahman, an uncle of Jahangir Alam, said that on November 18, 2016 at around 1:30 am, some policemen came to their house with three vans and picked up Jahangir and Abid. Later, Jahangirs family searched for them but no trace was found. The next day, Abdur Rahman phoned one of his relatives who works at the Jessore General Hospital and found that police had left Jahangirs body in the hospital at around 3:00 am. Jahangir was involved in politics with one group of the Jessore Awami League unit.

Name: Probitra Samaddar
Description: Two alleged criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion at Rampura in the capital on November 30, 2016. The Rab identified the dead as Probitra Samaddar, 28, son of Notobor Samaddar from Jhalakathi and Mohammad Ali Swapan, 30, son of Siraj Mia from Shariatpur.  The firefight took place around 2:00am when a team of RAB raided Balur Math area of Rampura with information that a gang of criminals would commit robbery at the spot, Lt Col Khandakar Golam Sarwar, Commanding Officer of RAB-3, told.  The criminals, sensing RAB's presence, started firing shots at the law enforcers in their attempt to flee the scene. The RAB also returned fire, leaving two of the gang members injured. Other members of the gang managed to escape by the time the shootout was over, the RAB CO added. The RAB with the help of local police transported the injured to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Ali Swapan
Description: Two alleged criminals were killed in a "gunfight" with members of the Rapid Action Battalion at Rampura in the capital on November 30, 2016. The Rab identified the dead as Probitra Samaddar, 28, son of Notobor Samaddar from Jhalakathi and Mohammad Ali Swapan, 30, son of Siraj Mia from Shariatpur.  The firefight took place around 2:00am when a team of RAB raided Balur Math area of Rampura with information that a gang of criminals would commit robbery at the spot, Lt Col Khandakar Golam Sarwar, Commanding Officer of RAB-3, told.  The criminals, sensing RAB's presence, started firing shots at the law enforcers in their attempt to flee the scene. The RAB also returned fire, leaving two of the gang members injured. Other members of the gang managed to escape by the time the shootout was over, the RAB CO added. The RAB with the help of local police transported the injured to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Dulal Hossain
Location: Jhaoil area near the Bangabandhu Bridge, Sirajganj
Description: An alleged ringleader of a robbery gang was killed in "gunfight" with the RAB  when the law enforcers raided a hideout of the criminals at Jhaoil area near the Bangabandhu Bridge in Sirajganj. The alleged robber -- Dulal Hossain, 45, son of Afzal Hossain from Shamsherpur village under Belkuchi upazila -- died of bullet injuries after he was taken to Sirajganj General Hospital, claimed Hasibul Hasan, commander of RAB-12 at Sirajganj camp.

Name: Abu Hanif
Location: Deonai area of Dhamrai in Dhaka
Description: A 40-year-old man was killed in a 'gunfight' between police and suspected criminals in the Deonai area of Dhamrai in Dhaka on December 5, 2016. The deceased was Abu Hanif, son of the late Shamsul Huq, of Kamrangirchar Jaloapara area in the capital.

Name: Al Amin
Description: Two alleged bandits were killed on December 7, 2016 during a "gunfight" between an unspecified number of bandits and the Rapid Action Battalion in the eastern Sundarbans under Sharankhola range. Major Adnan Kabir, Deputy Commander of RAB-8, quoting local fishermen identified the two killed as Al Amin, 45, and Hossain Mollah, 30, who belong to bandit group "Shamsu Bahini".

Name: Hossain Mollah
Description: Two alleged bandits were killed on December 7, 2016 during a "gunfight" between an unspecified number of bandits and the Rapid Action Battalion in the eastern Sundarbans under Sharankhola range. Major Adnan Kabir, Deputy Commander of RAB-8, quoting local fishermen identified the two killed as Al Amin, 45, and Hossain Mollah, 30, who belong to bandit group "Shamsu Bahini".

Name: Tajmul Hossain
Description: Three suspected robbers were killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Gangni of Meherpur on December 6, 2016. The deceased were identified as Tajmul Hossain, 25, and Mahidul Islam, 22, of village Manikdia and Tuhin Hossain, 28, of village Bholadanga, all under Gangni upazila. According to the police officer, unidentified miscreants opened fire at a police patrol as they reached near a brick kiln. The police retaliated by firing. Following the gunfight, the police with the help of locals searched the area and found three bullet-hit bodies, he added. The police sent the bodies to Gangni Upazila Health Complex for post-mortem examination.

Name: Mahidul Islam
Description: Three suspected robbers were killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Gangni of Meherpur on December 6, 2016. The deceased were identified as Tajmul Hossain, 25, and Mahidul Islam, 22, of village Manikdia and Tuhin Hossain, 28, of village Bholadanga, all under Gangni upazila. According to the police officer, unidentified miscreants opened fire at a police patrol as they reached near a brick kiln. The police retaliated by firing. Following the gunfight, the police with the help of locals searched the area and found three bullet-hit bodies, he added. The police sent the bodies to Gangni Upazila Health Complex for post-mortem examination.

Name: Tuhin Hossain
Description: Three suspected robbers were killed in a 'gunfight' with the police at Gangni of Meherpur on December 6, 2016. The deceased were identified as Tajmul Hossain, 25, and Mahidul Islam, 22, of village Manikdia and Tuhin Hossain, 28, of village Bholadanga, all under Gangni upazila. According to the police officer, unidentified miscreants opened fire at a police patrol as they reached near a brick kiln. The police retaliated by firing. Following the gunfight, the police with the help of locals searched the area and found three bullet-hit bodies, he added. The police sent the bodies to Gangni Upazila Health Complex for post-mortem examination.

Name: Yusuf
Description: Police claimed that on December 11,2016  at midnight Yusuf injured in a gunfight between two group of miscreants later he died in the morning at Jessore General Hospital during treatment. However. family claimed that on December 9, 2016 he was picked up from Chachra intersection of the city. Then police demanded 5 lacs taka from the family members. As they did not give the money to police,police shot in the leg of Yusuf.Later,he died in the hospital.

Name: Abdus Salam
Description: On December 11, 2016 Abdus Salam was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB

Name: Dulal Matubbor
Description: On December 24, 2016 Dulal Matubbor killed in a gunfight with police at Kashiyani, Gopalganj.

Name: Shahadat Sheikh
Description: Family members alleged that Shahadat Sheikh aged 33 along with his nephew Shariful Islam aged 24 were picked up by members of police from their house at Lakkhipur village, Kanaipur union,Faridpur on December 21, 2016. Later,on December 22, 2016 dead body of Shahadat Sheikh was found at brick field at Lakkhipur village, Kanaipur union,Faridpur.

Name: Sharif Mia
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Ashuganj, Brahmanbariya on December 25,2016.

Name: Sohel Rana
Description: A 30 year old man died in custody of Melandah police in Jamalpur a few hours after his arrest at his house of Paharipatol under Melandah upazila on December 18, 2016.  Around 7:30 pm, the Sohel fell sick after complaining of severe chest pain while in the custody. He was rushed to Melandah Upazila Health Complex. As the on duty physicians could not read his pulse, they referred him to Jamalpur General Hospital,said police and upazila health complex officials. But, he  was brought dead to Jamalpur General Hospital around 8.45 pm, said Ferdous Hassan, Resident Medical Officer. On December 19, 2016 noon, police sent the body to the hospital's morgue for post-mortem examination after preparing an inquest report in presence of executive magistrate Mohammad Imranul Haque,said Mazharul Karim,OC of the police station. The executive magistrate said no injury mark was found on the body of the deceased. Meanwhile,the victim's family members alleged that Sohel was tortured to death by police while he was under their custody,said local union parishad chairman, Mominul Haque Babu,quoting a member of his family. 'They (family members) claimed that Sohel was quite well when he was arrested,' he said. Melandah police denied the allegation.

Name: Kashem Khalifa
Description: On December 25,2016 around 4.00 pm a group of police went to Kashem Khalifa's house at Madrassa para, Kushtia. They dragged Kashem from the house to the vehicle. At that time, they beat up him. The women family members tried to stop the police but police also assaulted them. Those police members tortured Kashem after taking him at the vehicle. In the afternoon they received news that he died.Family alleged that, police killed him in exchange of money from neighbor Angel.

Name: Ripon Hossain Gazi
Location: Panchbariya in Jessore-Magura High way, Jessore
Description: Ripons maternal Uncle Habibur Rahman Gazi allged that on November 30, 2016 plainclothes men introducing themselves as members of police picked up Ripon from Choto Achra intersection. He alleged that police shot Ripon to death. However, OC of Kotowali Police Station told that at around 1.00 am on December 1, 2016 two groups of miscreants were exchanging of fire at Panchbariya in Jessore-Magura High way. While police went there miscreants left the place. Police found the bullet wounded body of Ripon Hossain Gazi aged 28.

Name: Dulal Hossain
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with members of RAB at Jhaul,Kamarkhand,Sirajganj on December 1, 2016.

Name: Montajul Islam
Description: On December 7,2016 both of them were killed in a gunfight with police at Keraniganj,Dhaka. The deceased in the Keraniganj incident were identified as Montajul Islam, 35, and Sabuj, 34. Shah Mizan Shafiur Rahman, superintendent of police in Dhaka, said they apprehended Montajul and Sabuj from Mawa Road on December 7, 2016 .Based on the information gleaned from the two, police took them along to Porahati area of Ruhitpur in search of illegal arms. Associates of Montaj and Sabuj at one stage opened fire on the police and police also returned fire,the SP said, adding that the two detainees sustained bullet injuries during the shootout. After they were shifted to Mitford Hospital, the doctors on duty declared them dead at around 3.00 pm.

Name: Sabuj
Description: On December 7,2016 both of them were killed in a gunfight with police at Keraniganj,Dhaka. The deceased in the Keraniganj incident were identified as Montajul Islam, 35, and Sabuj, 34. Shah Mizan Shafiur Rahman, superintendent of police in Dhaka, said they apprehended Montajul and Sabuj from Mawa Road on December 7, 2016 .Based on the information gleaned from the two, police took them along to Porahati area of Ruhitpur in search of illegal arms. Associates of Montaj and Sabuj at one stage opened fire on the police and police also returned fire,the SP said, adding that the two detainees sustained bullet injuries during the shootout. After they were shifted to Mitford Hospital, the doctors on duty declared them dead at around 3.00 pm.

Name: Md Abdul Khaleque Biswas
Description: A man was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police on the Rajbari-Kushtia highway at Kalibari point in Rajbari on December 29,2016,claimed the police.The deceased was Md Abdul Khaleque Biswas,55,of Dhekipara under Pangsha in the district. Rajbari police Officer-in-Charge Abul Bashar Mia said that they had been tipped-off about a planned robbery on the highway by felling trees. According to the police, as they reached the spot,the robbers opened fire on them.and they fired back about 3:30 am. The police later found Biswas critically wounded and took him to Rajbari Sadar hospital where he was pronounced dead.

Name: Abul Bashar
Description: A suspected criminal was killed in a 'gunfight' with the police on December 31, 2016 morning. The victim was Abdul Bashar, a resident of the village Sonapur under the district's Sadar upazila. According to the police, the 'gunfight' broke out as the police reached Kajjalipur area under Sadar upazila to prevent a robbery attempt. The robbers opened fire as they sensed the presence of the police.

Name: Badu Monir
Description: An alleged criminal was killed in a "gunfight" with the Detective Branch (DB) of police at Noljani in Gazipur on January 1, 2017. Badu Monir, 30, a resident of Tin-Shed colony area in BARC and an accused in 17 cases, was declared dead at Shahid Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital, said detectives. Police claimed that sensing presence of DB police, Badu and his men opened fire forcing the law enforcers to fire back in T&T colony area of Segun Bagan.

Name: Ruhel Ahmed
Location: Berirpar area in Moulvibazar town , Moulvibazar
Description: An alleged yaba trader was killed in police firing during a clash between police and drug traders in Berirpar area in Moulvibazar town on January 4, 2017. The deceased was identified as Ruhel Ahmed, son of Shayesta Miah of village Ghorghor of Sadar upazila. Mohammad Shah Jalal, superintendent of police, at a press briefing at 1.00 pm on January 5, 2017, said tipped off a team of police conducted a drive in the area around 11:30 pm. At one stage, police opened fire on Ruhel that left him bullet injured. He was later taken to Sadar Hospital where attending doctors pronounced him dead.

Name: Rafiqul Islam
Description: A suspected cattle thief was killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion at Majlishpur in Gazipur city on January 5, 2017, RAB claimed. Additional Superintendent of police Mohiul Islam of RAB-1, Gazipur, said on a tip-off that the cattle thieves were running away with cattle riding a truck, the battalion personnel set up a check post at Dakkhin Salna in the city. At about 3:30 am, the RAB personnel signaled a truck loaded with cows to stop but the driver, violating the signal, tried to flee prompting the RAB personnel to chase the vehicle. As they entered into the village road and reached near Majlishpur High School, about two kilometers away from the check post, they got stuck. The suspected thieves then opened fire on the law enforcers and RAB personnel also retaliated by firing. At one stage, the suspects managed to flee from the truck. The battalion members detained bullet-hit  Rafiqul from the spot.

Name: Delwar Hossain
Description: A suspected robber died at Rangpur Medical College Hospital on January 26, 2017 , three days after he got injured in a police firing at village Magurmari under Panchagarah Sadar. He was undergoing treatment in the hospital in police custody. The dead was Delwar Hossain,41,of village Magurmari. Delwar died at RMCH around 7:30 am on January 26, 2017,said Bhajanpur high way police officer-in-charge Enamul Huq. On January 23,the police officer claimed,the highway police had signaled a motorcycle without a number plate to stop while checking documents of vehicles at Magurmari. The rider, instead of stopping,crossed the police check post .Enamul added that Delwar later returned with his associates and as they tried to attack the police with sharp weapons, the police personnel opened fire and one of the bullets hit his waist. Then he was rescued and taken to RMCH and died there.

Name: Amirul Islam
Description: An alleged cadre of outlawed Gono Bahini (GB) was killed in a gunfight with police in Alampur under Sadar upazila of the district on January 19, 2017. The victim was Amirul Islam, 45, of Ambaria village in Mirpur upzila. Police said the deceased was a listed robber and second-in-command of notorious GB leader Serajul Islams Seraj Bahini.

Name: Abul Kalam
Description: On January 20,2017 he was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB.

Name: Sharif Hossain
Description: A man,who stood accused in shooting two policemen, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Atghoria upazila of Pabna on January 29,2017. The dead, Sharif Hossain,30,of Gaspara village in Pabna Sadar upazila,was one of the key accused of shooting two on-duty policemen in Dangergram area in Atghoria upazila.

Name: Anwar Hossain Anar
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with the RAB in Kaundia area of Savar on January 11, 2017. The dead is Anwar Hossain Anar, 40,of Kaundia.He was the ringleader of the robber gang named "Gangchil Bahini", said RAB  sources. Members of RAB-3 raided the house of late Liakot Mia in Kaundia Melartek area around 4:45 am, acting on a tip-off that some robbers were staying there, said Lt Col Khandker Golam Sarwar,Commanding Officer of RAB 3. Sensing presence of the elite force,the criminals opened fire. The RAB  members then retaliated, triggering the "gunfight", the RAB  official said. After the gun battle, the RAB  members found Anar injured. But others managed to flee the scene,said Sarwar,adding that Anwar was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Russel alias Roni
Location: Chougacha City Corporation area, Sadar upazila, Jessore
Description: According to his family, at midnight on January 10, 2017, Mohammad Rashel was shot dead by police, in Jessore. The Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Jessore Kotwali Police Station, Ilias Hossain claimed that a gunfight had taken place between two groups of robbers at night in Joghati area; and Rashel was shot dead due to that. Meanwhile Rashels aunt Saniya Khatun said that police picked Rashel up and shot him in his neck. There were a few cases filed against Rashel. The deceased mother isaid that some police came to their house to search for Rashel, about 10-12 days before he was killed. She believes that police took her son from somewhere and shot him dead.

Name: Abdur Razzak
Description: A "top outlawed" was killed in an alleged shootout with Rapid Action Battalion in Santhia upazila of Pabna on January 16, 2017. Abdur Razzak, 42, of Bilshalangi village in the upazila, was a regional leader of a faction of outlawed Purba Bangla Communist Party, according to RAB . Bina Rani Das,Commander of RAB -12 (Pabna camp), said acting on a tip off that Razzak and his accomplices were preparing for a robbery, a RAB  team raided Haludgar Bazar area around 4:00 am on January 16, 2017. Sensing RAB  presence,the criminals opened fire on them,prompting the law enforcers to retaliate by firing back, leading to a gunfight, Bina said. Razzak died after being shot but the accomplices escaped. His body was sent to Pabna Medical College morgue for autopsy.

Name: Nurul Islam Marzan
Identity: Member of Alleged banned militant outfit of JMB
Description: Both of them were alleged member of Neo-JMB and they were allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Saddam Hossain
Identity: Member of Alleged banned militant outfit of JMB
Description: Both of them were alleged member of Neo-JMB and they were allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Rahat Hossain
