Description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Mithapukur upazila of Rangpur on January 2, 2017. The dead is Rahat Hossain, 32, of Bujruk-Shontoshpur village in the upazila. Humayun Kabir, Officer-in-Charge of Mithapukur Police Station,said on information, police arrested Rahat at his home around 10:30 pm on January 1, 2017. Based on information gleaned from Rahat,police went to recover firearms. They took Rahat with them. When the police van reached near a bridge of Bheluarmor around 5:00 am, some robbers opened fire to snatch him. Police then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". At one stage,Rahat was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

Name: Mojid
Description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with police at Dugbi village under Matlab Uttar Upazila of Chandpur district. The deceased are Mojid, of Matlab Uttar Upazila and Habu of Laksmipur district.

Name: Habu
Description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with police at Dugbi village under Matlab Uttar Upazila of Chandpur district. The deceased are Mojid, of Matlab Uttar Upazila and Habu of Laksmipur district.

Name: Jalal Uddin
Description: On January 15, 2017,Jalal Uddin was allegedly shot to death by police in Narsigdi.

Name: Moshiur Rahman
Location: Lengtisera Bridge, Dinajpur-Rangpur Highway, Taraganj upazila, Rangpur
Description: In Rangpur, two "robbers" identified as Moshiur Rahman, 37, from Alampur under Taraganj upazila and Bijoy Chandra,32, from Kursha-Boloram under Rangpur Sadar upazila-died during a "gun battle" that took place near Lengtisera Bridge on Dinajpur-Rangpur highway in Taraganj upazila. According to police, they dispatched a team to the spot on information that a 10-member gang of highway robbers, including Moshiur and Bijoy, were getting ready to rob passengers in vehicles on the highway. As soon as they arrived at the scene around 3:00 am, the gang started  to retreat while firing gunshots at the law enforcers. The two "robbers" died on the spot as police also returned fire, said Abdul Latif, officer-in-charge of Taraganj Police Station.

Name: Bijoy Chandra
Location: Lengtisera Bridge, Dinajpur-Rangpur Highway, Taraganj upazila, Rangpur
Description: In Rangpur, two "robbers" identified as Moshiur Rahman, 37, from Alampur under Taraganj upazila and Bijoy Chandra,32, from Kursha-Boloram under Rangpur Sadar upazila-died during a "gun battle" that took place near Lengtisera Bridge on Dinajpur-Rangpur highway in Taraganj upazila. According to police, they dispatched a team to the spot on information that a 10-member gang of highway robbers, including Moshiur and Bijoy, were getting ready to rob passengers in vehicles on the highway. As soon as they arrived at the scene around 3:00 am, the gang started  to retreat while firing gunshots at the law enforcers. The two "robbers" died on the spot as police also returned fire, said Abdul Latif, officer-in-charge of Taraganj Police Station.

Name: Juban Ali
Description: In Magura, a "drug dealer" died on the spot during a "gunfight' between their gang and the police, reports our Jhenidah correspondent. The deceased was identified as Juban Ali, 50, son of Sohrab Hossain from Thalahara village under Magura Sadar upazila. Ajmal Huda, Officer-in-Charge of Magura Sadar Police Station, said, a police patrol unit was fired upon when it raided a "drug dealers" meeting being held in Thalahara village under Magura Sadar upazila at around 3:00 am. Juban sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot as the police returned fire in self defence, the OC said.

Name: Shamsu Sheikh
Location: Mrigmari, Shyela river, Mongla, Sundorban, Khulna
Description: Shamsu Sheikh, an alleged pirate killed in a gunfight with RAB on February 7, 2017.

Name: Kamal Sheikh alias Dulal
Description: On February 7, 2017 both of them allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Fakirpara area .

Name: Ibrahim Ali
Description: On February 7, 2017 both of them allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Fakirpara area .

Name: Shahjalal Miji
Description: An alleged criminal was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and law enforcers in Munshiganj town on February 13, 2017.The dead is Shahjalal Miji, 33, of Dakkhin Courtgaon area in the town.  Jayedul Alam, superintendent of Munshiganj police, said Shahjalal was arrested in Dakkhin Courtgaon area at around 5:00pm on February 12, 2017.  Based on information gleaned from Shahjalal, a team of the Detective Branch of police and local police was going to Baikhar area in the town to recover firearms, said police. Shahjalal was with the law enforcers. When they reached Parulpara area around 2:30am, some 10 to 12 accomplices of Shahjalal suddenly opened fire and tried to snatch Shahjalal from them, said police.  Police then returned fire, triggering a "gunfight".  After the gun battle, police found the bullet-hit body of Shahjalal. They took him to Munshiganj General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Unidentified
Identity: Member of Parbatya Chattagram Jana Sanghati Samiti (PCJSS)
Location: Naikkhong Mukh Para in the district's Lama upazila , Bandarban
Description: A "criminal "was killed  in a gunfight between criminals and an army patrol in Naikkhong Mukh Para in the district's Lama upazila February 13, 2017. The identity of the dead could not be known as of filing of this report.. Major Mustafizur Rahman, acting commander of Alikadom zone, said the dead, a member of Parbatya Chattagram Jana Sanghati Samiti (PCJSS), was in army uniform. The army patrol cordoned off Naikkhong Mukh Para area around 4:00pm on information that an armed gang was there. Shortly afterwards criminals opened fire on the troops. The army men retaliated, firing shots. The two sides fired at least 50 shots during the gunfight that lasted for around 10-15 minutes, added the acting zone commander.

Name: Sagar
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Abu Musa alias Abujar alias Abu Talha alias Samiul
Identity: Member of Alleged banned militant outfit of JMB
Description: The dead, Abu Musa alias Abujar alias Abu Talha alias Samiul, 32, was the chief of Pabna, Kushtia, Natore and Sirajganj region of "Neo JMB".  Musa also stood accused in cases filed in connection with killing homeopath Mir Sanaullah in Kushtia Sadar upazila and shopkeeper Shunil Gomez at Bonpara Bazaar in Natore, police said. Nur-e-Alam Siddiki, officer-in-charge of Kahaloo Police Station, said some criminals suddenly opened fire targeting their van when they reached Patonja village around 2:45am February 14, 2017. He along with his team was returning to the police station after a patrol.  Police then returned fire, triggering a "gunfight". After the "gun battle", they found the body of Musa lying on the spot. The others fled.

Name: Abdus Sattar alias Sabbir
Location: Kerontoli area of Moheshkhali upazila, Cox's Bazar, Chittagong
Description: In Cox's Bazar, an alleged criminal was killed in a shootout with police in Kerontoli area of Moheshkhali upazila. Deceased Abdus Sattar alias Sabbir, 52, was from Majher Para village of the upazila. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Moheshkhali Police Station, said police as part of their regular patrol went to the spot around 4:00am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, some criminals opened fire. Police then fired back, triggering the "gunfight". Sattar was hit by bullets during the "gun battle". Doctors of Moheshkhali Upazila Health Complex declared him dead when he was taken there, the police official said.

Name: Nizam Uddin alias Nistar
Description: An outlawed party operative was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Bera upazila of Pabna on February 15, 2017, said police. The dead, Nizam Uddin alias Nistar, 40, of Kathulia village in Sadar upazila, was a leader of outlawed Sarbahara Party, said Tazul Huda, officer-in-charge of Aminpur Police Station. Nizam used to run "Nistar Bahini" which was involved in various criminal activities, including robbery. Nizam was the Secretary of recently dissolved committee of Jatiya Samajtantrik Dal (JSD-Inu) of Sadar upazila unit, said Kanu Shannal, vice-president of the district unit JSD. Amirul Islam Ranga, president of the JSD unit, said Nizam was not involved with their organisation now. OC Tazul said police went to Dobirchar area around 3:00am, acting on information that two gangs -- "Nistar Bahini" and "Julhas Bahini" -- were locked in a gun battle. At one stage, police opened fire to disperse the criminals and nab them. Nizam was hit by bullets and died on the spot. The others managed to flee, the police official said.

Name: Moazzem Fakir
Description: An alleged outlaw was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Rajbari's Pangsha.  The man killed in Pangsha upazila was Moazzem Fakir, 32, a "member outlawed Sarbahara Party",  sid police.Moazzem, of Modyapatta village in the upazila, was also the second-in-command of "Bipul Bahini" which is involved in different criminal activities like extortion, said police.  Mofazzel Hossain, officer-in-charge of Pangsha Police Station, said they had arrested Moazzem in Ashulia in Dhaka. Later, he was taken to Rajbari. As per Moazzem's statement, police along with him went to Noura Bongram village to recover firearms and bullets.  When the law enforcers reached the village around 2:30am, cohorts of Moazzem opened fire. Police then retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". Moazzem was hit by bullets as he tried to flee from police custody, the police official said. He was rushed to Pangsha Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mukhter Hossain
Description: Two people were killed in a gunfight with Detective Branch of police at Fatulla in Narayanganj on February 22, 2017. The dead were Mukhter Hossain  and his cohort Md Manik, both aged between 25 and 30, said Narayanganj DB police officer-in-charge Ahmedul Islam.The OC said that a team of Narayanganj DB launched a drive at Amtali area to arrest the duo around 5:50pm. Sensing their presence, the two and their cohorts opened fire on police and police also retaliated by firing. Police later found seriously injured Mukhter and Manik and took them to Narayanganj Sadar Hospital where doctors declared the duo dead.

Name: Md Manik
Description: Two people were killed in a gunfight with Detective Branch of police at Fatulla in Narayanganj on February 22, 2017. The dead were Mukhter Hossain  and his cohort Md Manik, both aged between 25 and 30, said Narayanganj DB police officer-in-charge Ahmedul Islam.The OC said that a team of Narayanganj DB launched a drive at Amtali area to arrest the duo around 5:50pm. Sensing their presence, the two and their cohorts opened fire on police and police also retaliated by firing. Police later found seriously injured Mukhter and Manik and took them to Narayanganj Sadar Hospital where doctors declared the duo dead.

Name: Al Amin
Location: Medda Sishu Paribar in Brahmanbaria municipality area , Brahmanbaria
Description:
The police recovered the bullet-hit body of a young man, who was allegedly picked-up by plainclothes police, from a field near Medda Sishu Paribar in Brahmanbaria municipality area early February 7, 2017. The deceased was named Al Amin, 28, son of Zilu Mia of Kandipara area. On information that a gunfight took place in the area, a team of police went to the spot and found Al Amin lying in a pool of blood, said Narayan Chandra Das, sub-inspector of Sadar Model police station. Later he was sent to local hospital where the doctors declared him dead.
TTanjina Begum, wife of the deceased, alleged that a team of plainclothes police picked up Al Amin from his residence around 4pm on February 6, 2017 and shot him to death. She demanded punishment of 'responsible policemen' for the death. However, additional superintendent of police Iqbal Hossain denied the allegation of picking up Al Amin by law enforcers.

Name: Zia Sana
Identity: Member of New Biplobi Communist Party (Mrinal Bahini)
Description:
Zia Sana was killed in a gunfight between police and miscreants in Khulna about 12 hours after his family claimed that police picked him up from a court premises. The OC claimed that he was second-in-command of New Biplobi Communist Party (Mrinal Bahini) and was a drug trader.
A press release issued by Khulna Metropolitan Police claimed that they had information about Zia, Jony Biswas, 34, Sagar Kazi, 30, Pabitra, 36, and an unidentified man, 30, and other five or six people preparing for robbery at South Bangla Residential Project under the metropolitan police. A team of Harintana police raided the area around 2:15am on February 24, 2017. The suspects, sensing presence of police, opened fire on police and police also retaliated by firing, the release read. Zia received bullets in the head and belly during the exchange of shots, it said, adding that police with the help of locals took him to Khulna Medical College Hospital, where he was declared dead around 4:30am.  Zias elder brother Abdur Rahim Sana at a press conference at Khulna Press Club alleged that a uniformed and two or three plainclothes police personnel picked his brother from the corridor of Khulna chief metropolitan magistrate court around 10:50am and took him to an unknown place by a car.

Name: Amijul alias Al Amin Rony
Description:
A suspected neo-JMB member was killed in a reported gunfight with police at Jamnagar in Sherpur upazila on March 2, 2017. The deceased was identified as Amijul alias Al Amin Rony, chief of neo-JMB of northern region and son of Nurul Islam, a resident of Bujrum Radharampur village in Godagari upazila of Rajshahi. Tipped off, a police team conducted a drive in the area when Amijul along with his associates had been there around 3:00am, said Sonatan Chakrabarty, Additional Superintendent of police. Sensing the law enforcers presence, they opened fire on them, forcing the police to fire back that triggered a gunfight. Amijul was caught in the line of fire and injured while his associates managed to flee the scene. Amijul was taken to Bogra Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.
Police sent the body to the hospital morgue for autopsy.

Name: Billal Mir alias Kana Billal
Description: A member of a "robber gang" was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB in the Sundarbans. The dead, Billal Mir alias Kana Billal, was the second-in-command of "Shamsu Bahini", according to RAB. Deputy Commander of RAB-8 Maj Adnan Kabir said a RAB team was on a regular patrol in the Sundarbans on March 2, 2017 morning when some robbers opened fire on the team in Sukhparar Char area under the Chandpai range of the Sundarbans East Zone. The RAB men retaliated which led to the "gunfight". After the "gunbattle", the body of Billal was found on the spot. The others fled, the RAB  official claimed.

Name: Bulbul Islam
Description: A "gunfight" between "robbers" and Detective Branch of Police (DB ) police took place at Khetabari in the upazila around 3:30am.Robber Bulbul Islam alias "Builla" of Kalisima village in the upazila was found dead after the shootout, said Ali Arshad, officer-in-charge of Bijoynagar Police Station.Police said Bulbul stood accused in five cases.

Name: Prakash Nuru
Description: An alleged drug dealer, Nurul Islam alias "Prakash Nuru" of Nalgaria village was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Mirasani area around 4:30am, the police official said. Police claimed to have recovered a firearm and several sharp weapons from the spot.

Name: Syedur Rahman Prakash
Description: Syedur Rahman Prakash,a fugitive convicted gunsmith was found dead with a bullet wound to the chest following a gunfight during a police raid on an uninhabited hill in Cox's Bazar's Maheshkhali upazila on March 3, 2017. The body of Syedur Rahman , son of Azam Ullah of Boro Maheshkhali union, was sent to the district hospital for an autopsy.  A team of 50 policemen on a tip-off surrounded Keruntol  hill was fired upon around 11:00am and retaliated with some 40 shots before reaching the camp said a police official.

Name: Mohammad Mostafa
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police on March 7, 2017.

Name: Mintu Hossain
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police on March 9, 2017

Name: Bidyut Kumar Bachhar
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with police in Tala upazila of Satkhira on March 12, 2017. They are Bidyut Kumar Bachhar, 46, of Maguradanga village, and Talha Sheikh, 26, of Sujanshah village in the upazila. Hasan Hafizur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Tala Police Station, said a police team, led by sub-inspectors Mozaffar Hossain and Nazmul Haque, was on a regular patrol on March 11, Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with police in Tala upazila of Satkhira on March 12, 2017. They are Bidyut Kumar Bachhar, 46, of Maguradanga village, and Talha Sheikh, 26, of Sujanshah village in the upazila. Hasan Hafizur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Tala Police Station, said a police team, led by sub-inspectors Mozaffar Hossain and Nazmul Haque, was on a regular patrol on March 11, 2017 night.  During the patrol, the team came to know that some robbers were in a mango orchard in Rahimabad village for committing a robbery. When the law enforcers reached near the spot around 3:15am, the criminals opened fire. Police then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the "gunbattle", police found the bodies of Bidyut and Talha lying on the spot. The others managed to flee, the police official said.

Name: Talha Sheikh
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with police in Tala upazila of Satkhira on March 12, 2017. They are Bidyut Kumar Bachhar, 46, of Maguradanga village, and Talha Sheikh, 26, of Sujanshah village in the upazila. Hasan Hafizur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Tala Police Station, said a police team, led by sub-inspectors Mozaffar Hossain and Nazmul Haque, was on a regular patrol on March 11, Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with police in Tala upazila of Satkhira on March 12, 2017. They are Bidyut Kumar Bachhar, 46, of Maguradanga village, and Talha Sheikh, 26, of Sujanshah village in the upazila. Hasan Hafizur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Tala Police Station, said a police team, led by sub-inspectors Mozaffar Hossain and Nazmul Haque, was on a regular patrol on March 11, 2017 night.  During the patrol, the team came to know that some robbers were in a mango orchard in Rahimabad village for committing a robbery. When the law enforcers reached near the spot around 3:15am, the criminals opened fire. Police then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the "gunbattle", police found the bodies of Bidyut and Talha lying on the spot. The others managed to flee, the police official said.

Name: Afzal Hossain
Location: Dashmari area, Motihar Police Station, Rajshahi
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Sabuj Malitha
Description: The four people who were killed in what the police called a gunfight in Meherpur on March 14, 2017 were actually arrested earlier, according to the police. The police arrested two of them from Dhaka on March 13, 2017 for their alleged involvement in the killing of two people of Meherpurs Sonapur village. The double murder took place a week back. The two, who were arrested and killed, are identified as Sabuj Malitha, 25, son of Mashiur Malitha and Rashomoy Karmakers son Ramesh Karmaker, 22. Both of them were residents of Sonapur village of Meherpur sadar upazila. Barely 24 hours after their arrest, the duo along with two others - Shohag Islam, 27, son of Monirul Islam and Kamruzzaman Kanon, 25, son of Abul Kalam - of nearby Pirojpur village were killed in police 'gunfight' in the wee hours of March 14, 2017. The police said all of them used to carry out terrorist activities and extortion. But their family members outright denied the allegation and claimed that they were just construction workers in Dhaka. Family members also said the duo was used to live in Dhaka from much before the double murder.

Name: Ramesh Karmaker
Description: The four people who were killed in what the police called a gunfight in Meherpur on March 14, 2017 were actually arrested earlier, according to the police. The police arrested two of them from Dhaka on March 13, 2017 for their alleged involvement in the killing of two people of Meherpurs Sonapur village. The double murder took place a week back. The two, who were arrested and killed, are identified as Sabuj Malitha, 25, son of Mashiur Malitha and Rashomoy Karmakers son Ramesh Karmaker, 22. Family members also said the duo was used to live in Dhaka from much before the double murder.

Family members also said the duo was used to live in Dhaka from much before the double murder.

Name: Tajul Islam Mahmud
Description: An alleged member of Harkat-ul-Jihad-al-Islami (Huji) was killed in police firing during a raid in Brahmanbaria's Kasba upazila on March 16, 2017. Deceased Tajul Islam Mahmud 45, is a resident of Sadullapur village in Habiganj's Nabiganj upazila.

Name: Abdus Selim
Location: Adabaria village in Kushtia's Daulatpur upazila , Kushtia
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police at Adabaria village in Kushtia's Daulatpur upazila on March 17, 2017.The deceased, Abdus Selim, 40, was from Modhugari in the upazila. Police claimed.Sabbirul Alam, officer-in-charge of Detective Branch (DB) of Kushtia police, said a joint team of DB and Daulatpur police conducted a raid around 3:00am at Shialia field after being tipped off that Selim and his seven to eight accomplices were holding a secret meeting there to commit a robbery. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire. The gunfight ensued when police retaliated with fire, the OC said. With bullet injuries, Selim was taken to Daulatpur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, he said. The body was sent to Kushtia General Hospital for an autopsy.

Name: Zahirul Islam
Description: An alleged robber killed in a gunfight with police in Brahmanbaria. The deceased robber was identified as Zahirul Islam, 35, of Kayempur village under Kashba Upazila in Brahmanbaria. A team of police launched a drive at Kayempur village in Kasba Upazila around 4:00am on March 18, 2017 after they came to know that robbers were preparing for a robbery there, Mahiuddin Ahammed, officer-in-charge (OC) of Kasba Police Station said. Sensing police's presence, the gang members opened fire on them prompting the police personnel to retaliate which triggered a gunfight, the OC said. At one stage, Zahirul was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while his associates managed to flee the scene, Ahammed said adding that police later recovered his body and sent it to Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy.

Name: Fakir Ahmad
Description: In Feni, a suspected drug peddler Fakir Ahmad was killed during a police raid on their den in Sonagazi upazila of Feni on March 18, 2017 police said. The gang members opened fire on the police forcing them to shoot in retaliation. Six police personnel were injured during the incident, Humayun Kabir, officer-in-charge of Sonagazi Model Police Station, said. The deceased Fakir Ahmad, 35, hailed from Chharait Kandi village under Sonagazi upazila in Feni

Name: Kawsar Bhuiyan
Description: An alleged drug dealer was killed in an alleged gunfight with the Detective Branch of police in Bhatshala area of the district, amid an anti-narcotics crackdown that began two months ago. The dead is Kawsar Bhuiyan, 45, son of Abdul Razzak of the town's Kandipara area. "He was carrying drugs in a pick-up van and started firing on us after we asked to stop him, forcing us retaliate as well," DB Officer-in-Charge Md Mafiz Uddin said in the evening. Two of his cohorts managed to escape.

Name: Nurul Amin
Description: A 55 year old person  died allegedly after being tortured and given electric shocks in police custody in Feni. Police refuted the allegation raised by the victim's family, claiming that Nurul Amin had suffered a stroke. Feni model police Officer-in-Charge Rashed Khan Chowdhury claimed that they had arrested Amin as a warranted criminal from the towns Pagla Mia Road on March 23, 2017. Later at night he suffered a stroke and was taken to a local hospital, the OC said, adding: Amin finally was shifted to Chittagong Medical College Hospital for better treatment where he died on March 24, 2017 morning. Amins son Nurul Afsar Manik alleged that his father had been beaten up and then electrocuted at the police station. He said that the case in which the police had shown him arrested was filed by a local over previous enmity. The complainant bribed the police to arrest and torture him, he claimed. Manik said that they would file a case against the police.

Name: Abdul Halim
Description: Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) claimed to have found the body of Abdul Halim following a gunfight with robbers in Sirajganj's Kamarkhand upazila on April 12, 2017.  Rab-12 Commander Maj Safayet Ahmed said that a RAB team raided a spot near Jhaoil Bridge at Shahbazpur Uttarpara area around 2:00am on a tip-off that criminals were preparing to commit robbery. The criminals shot at the RAB team, leading to the gunfight for a few minutes and Halim died on the spot .The body was sent to the Sirajganj General Hospital morgue for an autopsy.

Name: Shipan Hossain
Description: Two suspected miscreants were killed in a gunfight with the police at Gangni in Meherpur on April 14, 2017 police officials said.  The deceased were identified as Shipan Hossain, 25, son of Madar Ali, of village Dulalnagar, and Alamgir Hossain, 29, son of Abed Ali, of village Chandpur under Gangni upazila. Tipped-off that a group of miscreants had gathered at Haridaho field to commit crimes, a team of Gangni police conducted a drive there around 3:00am, claimed Anwar Hossain, officer-in-charge of the police station. Sensing the presence of police, the miscreants opened fire on police personnel, prompting them to retaliate by firing, Anwar claimed. The duo received bullet-wounds during the gunfight and died on the spot while their associates managed to flee.

Name: Alamgir Hossain
Description: Two suspected miscreants were killed in a gunfight with the police at Gangni in Meherpur on April 14, 2017 police officials said.  The deceased were identified as Shipan Hossain, 25, son of Madar Ali, of village Dulalnagar, and Alamgir Hossain, 29, son of Abed Ali, of village Chandpur under Gangni upazila. Tipped-off that a group of miscreants had gathered at Haridaho field to commit crimes, a team of Gangni police conducted a drive there around 3:00am, claimed Anwar Hossain, officer-in-charge of the police station. Sensing the presence of police, the miscreants opened fire on police personnel, prompting them to retaliate by firing, Anwar claimed. The duo received bullet-wounds during the gunfight and died on the spot while their associates managed to flee.

Name: Sohel Sheikh
Description: Sohel Sheikh was killed in a gunfight with DB police in the city's Bhashantek area on April 17, 2017 four days after he was called out from his Ashulia house allegedly by a criminal gang.. Sohel's family members alleged that suspected criminal DSP Babu called him out from his home on April 13, 2017 to talk about the gun attack on Chiku. Sohel phoned his sister Minara Akter on April 14, 2017 to inform her that he was in the custody of the Detective Branch of Dhaka Metropolitan Police. My brother called from his mobile phone and asked us not to worry about him. The conversation lasted for only a few seconds, Minara told. Talking to this correspondent at his house at Bhashantek slum, Sohel's father Manju Sheikh alleged that DB officials cooked up the story of shootout after killing his son in custody.

Name: Yunus Hossain
Description: On April 20, 2017 Yunus Hossain,40,  was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at  Keshobpur in Jessore. Ashashuni, Satkhira.  The deceased was a son of Mokbul Hossain and was a resident of Ashahuni in Satkhira.

Name: Forhad Hossain
Description: On April 23, 2017 Forhad Hossain allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Noyapara, Khutakhali, Chokoriya, Chittagong- Cox's Bazaar highway.

Name: Jalal Uddin
Description: On April 10, 2017 Jalal Uddin was allegedly beaten to death by police when police went to an operation to arrest a  criminal at Parkasunda village, Atrai, Naogaon. Police went to one Askan's house to arrest Mostafa aged 25, an alleged criminal. There, they did not find Mostafa. At one stage, Askan's nephew Jalal Uddin involved in the altercation with Police. As a result, police beat  him up and he eventually died in the place of incident.

Name: Mohammad Rajib
Description: In Jessore district, a youth was allegedly killed in a ' gunfight ' by police after picking  up. Mohammad Rajib (35), the deceaseds family alleged that police arrested him from his house in the afternoon of April 5, 2017 . Later, police told that Rajib escaped from police by unlocking the handcuff. After that police searched for him but did not find. Later,the family  got information that Rajib's  body was in the morgue of the hospital. Officer-in-charge (OC) of Jessore Kotowali Police Station, A K M Ajmal Huda told that on April 5, 2017 Sub Inspector (SI) Jamil and Mokhles conducted an operation in plain cloth and arrested Rajib. But on the way to Police Station, Rajib escaped from police by unlocking the handcuff. At around 3:00 am, police got information that firing between the two miscreants groups was going on at Kholadanga area of the town. The miscreants started firing at patrol police when they reached the incident place. Then, police also reply them with firing. Later, the miscreants left the place and police found injured Rajib who was shot in his head. On the way to hospital, Rajib died. OC A K M Ajmal Huda also told that gunfight incidents are going on all over the country. It was also that kind of incident. He did not want to bring your own danger by saying more about the incident.

Name: Mohammad Rahim
Description: He was allegedly killed in gunfight with Khualna Sadar Police on April 28, 2017.

Name: Romel Chakma
Identity: General Secretary of Naniarchar unit Pahari Chhatra Parishad in Rangamati
Description: There was an allegation that a college student had died due to torture by the military in Rangamati Hill District. The victim-family alleged that on April 5, 2017 members of the Army took Romel Chakma to their camp. Romel Chakma was a Higher Secondary School Certificate (HSC) examinee of Naniyarchar Degree College and was also General Secretary of Naniarchar unit Pahari Chhatra Parishad in Rangamati. Later, Romel was handed over to police. On April 19, 2017 Romel died in Chittagong Medical College Hospital. On April 21, the Army allegedly cremated his body without following any religious custom.

Name: Lalon Hossain
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Gangni on May 18, 2017.

Name: Raju Ahmed
Description:
A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight with police in Paschim Tutpara area of Khulna city on May 20, 2017.
The deceased was identified as Raju Ahmed, 27, son of Siddiqur Rahman. Tipped-off that a gang of robbers numbering 10 to 12 were taking preparation to commit robbery in the area, a team of police conducted a drive there around 3:00am, said Mizanur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Kotwali police station. Sensing presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on them, prompting police to retaliate, leaving Raju bullet-wounds. Later, he was rushed to Khulna Medical College and Hospital where he succumbed to his injuries around 4:00am.

Name: Russell
Location: Dattopara in Lakshmipur Sadar upazila , Lakshmipur
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a gunfight with police at Dattopara in Lakshmipur Sadar upazila on May 19, 2017. The deceased was identified as Russell, 30, son of Abdul Karim of Chhayani Togba village of Chatkhil upazila in Noakhali.Russell along with his associate Babul was arrested with a gun at an abandoned house at Kabirajbari of North Joypur village, said Officer-in-Charge of Chandraganj police Mokhtar Hossain. Based on information given by him, the police took him to Dattapara in Binodpur on a drive to recover more firearms. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, Russell's associates opened fire on them, prompting the police to retaliate and triggering a gunfight, the OC claimed. Russell was wounded during the gunfight and was rushed to Lakshmipur Sadar Hospital where on duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Ashrafuddin Dhol
Location: Ragaichati village in Mymensingh's Gafargoan upazila , Mymensingh
Description: An alleged robber was killed in what police claims was a gunfight in Trishal upazila of Mymensingh on May 24, 2017. The deceased, Ashrafuddin Dhol, 28, of Ragaichati village in Mymensingh's Gafargoan upazila was detained from Kishoreganj around 9:00pm on May 23, 2017 night, said Additional Superintendent of Mymensingh police (South) Mohammad Noor-e-Alam. A team led by Imarat Hossain Gazi, officer-in-charge of Detective Branch of Mymensingh police took along Ashraful Dhol when they raided a den of robbers at Bhaga village in adjacent Trishal upazila around 3:00am the same night. The robbers started firing at the police prompting them to retaliate, Noor-e-Alam said. Ashraful suffered bullet injuries in the gunfight and was declared dead after being rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital, the police official said.

Name: Muktar Hossain Mukti
Description: An alleged drug trader was killed in a reported gun-fight between his cohorts and police at Birulia area in Savar, on the outskirts of the capital on May 26, 2017. Police said they arrested Muktar Hossain Mukti, 45, a presumed drug trader on May 25, 2017.Later, police along with Muktar conducted a drive in the area to arrest his associates, said SM Kamruzzaman, Officer-in-Charge, of Savar Model Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire towards police, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight between them around 3.30 am. At one stage, Muktar was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while his cohorts managed to flee, he said.

Name: Sobuj Uddin Sobuj
Description: Sajeda Begum, mother of Sobuj Uddin Sobuj alleged that her son was killed by police in a gunfight .

Name: Bappi
Identity: Member of Purba Banglar Communist Party (red flag)
Location: Rakhalgachhi area of Goalonda upazila , Rajbari
Description: Two regional leaders of the Purba Banglar Communist Party were killed in a reported gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion in Rakhalgachhi area of Goalonda upazila on May 13, 2017. The deceased were identified as Bappi, chief of Lal Potaka Bahini and his associate Lalon. Rois Uddin, Additional Superintendent of Police, and also company commander of RAB Faridpur camp, said that on secret information a team of RAB conducted a drive in the area around 3:00am. Sensing the presence of elite force, the outlaw leaders opened fire on them, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate that triggered a gunfight. The gunfight left the duo dead on the spot.

Name: Lalon
Identity: Member of Purba Banglar Communist Party (red flag)
Location: Rakhalgachhi area of Goalonda upazila , Rajbari
Description: Two regional leaders of the Purba Banglar Communist Party were killed in a reported gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion in Rakhalgachhi area of Goalonda upazila on May 13, 2017. The deceased were identified as Bappi, chief of Lal Potaka Bahini and his associate Lalon. Rois Uddin, Additional Superintendent of Police, and also company commander of RAB Faridpur camp, said that on secret information a team of RAB conducted a drive in the area around 3:00am. Sensing the presence of elite force, the outlaw leaders opened fire on them, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate that triggered a gunfight. The gunfight left the duo dead on the spot.

Name: Nazrul Islam Babu
Description: Nazrul Islam Babu, 32, a Class IV employee of Jaintapur Upazila Administration office and son of the late freedom fighter Abdul Zalil of village Kohaigar under the upazila, found dead in a detention cell hours after he was arrested, the police said. His Family alleged that he was tortured to dead by police.on May 20, 2017.

Name: Firatul Islam
Location: Nurpur village in Meherpur Sadar upazila , Meherpur
Description:
A man was killed in a reported gunfight with police at Nurpur village in Meherpur Sadar upazila on June 6, 2017. The deceased was identified as Firatul Islam, 48, son of Ayub Ali, a resident of Pirojpur village in the upazila. Acting on tip-off, a team of police conducted a drive at a jackfruit orchard in the area around 2:00am while Firatul along with his associates was preparing to commit robbery, said  Ahsan Habib, Assistant Superintendent of police of Meherpur. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, they opened fire on police, prompting police to retaliate  that triggered a gunfight, he said.
After the gunfight, Firatul was found dead on the spot while his associates managed to flee the scene, the ASP added.

Name: Ibrahim Miah
Location: village Chandidwar of Kosba upazila, Brahmanbaria
Description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with police at village Chandidwar of Kosba upazila in Brahmanbaria on June 6, 2017. The deceased was identified as Ibrahim Miah, 34, son of late Samraj Miah, a resident of village Latuamora of the upazila. Kosba police Officer-in-charge Mohammad Mohiuddin said that a police team, led by Sub Inspector Rafiqul Islam, conducted a drive at village Latuamora and arrested Ibrahims  wife Renua with six kilograms of hemp at about 10:00pm. While the law enforcers reached village Chandiwar on their way to police station with Renua, Ibrahim along with his associates carried out an attack on the policemen. Ibrahim and his cohorts opened fire to police personnel, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, triggering the gunfight.

Name: Oltu Mondol
Description: He was allegedly killed by the members of RAB in a gunfight.

Name: Kadam Ali alias Kadam
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Mojjammel Haque
Description: Both of them were killed in a gunfight with police on June 7, 2017.

Name: Sujon
Description: Both of them were killed in a gunfight with police on June 7, 2017.

Name: Ismail Hossain
Location: Shyampur village in Birulia, Savar, Dhaka, Dhaka
Description: Police shot dead  Ismail Hossain, 32, son of Shahidul Islam of Shyampur village in Birulia as he and others attacked the law enforcers to snatch a listed criminal named Al-Amin Hossain at Birulia in Savar on the outskirts of the capital on June 8, 2017.  Senior Assistant Superintendent of Police Mahbubur Rahman said four policemen led by Sub-Inspector Toriqul Islam raided Shyampur area to arrest Al-Amin Hossain, at around 11:00pm. The police arrested him at his rest house but came under attack as Al-Amin, who sensed the presence of law enforcers, had already announced in a loudspeaker that robbers entered his house, added Mahbubur. At one stage, family members of Al-Amin including his sister, brother and others managed to snatch Al-Amin from the police. The law enforcers in self-defence opened fire on the attackers, the official said. On information, additional force from Savar rushed to the spot and brought the situation under control. Ismail who was the main aide of Al-Amin received a bullet and died on way to Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

Name: Rabiul
Location: Hadda khal area of Sundarbans, Khulna
Description: An alleged robber was killed during a 'gunfight' with Rapid Action Battalion in Hadda khal area of Sundarbans  on June 10, 2017. The dead man, Rabiul, 30, was the gang leader of Rabiul bahani according to RAB-6. He hailed from Burigoalini village under Munshiganj upazila of Satkhira district. Khondokar Rafiqul Islam, commanding officer of RAB-6, said that after receiving information a RAB team went to patrol the Sundarbans with the help of local police at around 1:00 pm. Sensing the presence of law enforcers Rabiul opened fire on them and law enforcers fired back in retaliation. At one stage of the fire exchange, law enforcers found Rabiul's dead body.

Name: Kamal Hossain
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Alia Bhulu
Description: Alia Bhulu, an alleged drug peddeler was arrested by police in the afternoon on June 16, 2017. Later, police took Pakshi Rail Station to rescue drugs. Their his cohorts came into motorbikes and a gunfight ensued. In the gunfight he died.

Name: Selim Mia
Description: In Brahmanbaria, an alleged robber was killed in a 'gunfight' between his cohorts and police in Sarail upazila on June 19, 2017. The deceased, Selim Mia, 32, was son of Tajul Islam of Malihata village. OC of Sarail Police Station Rupok Kumar Saha said Selim was arrested while he along with his cohorts was preparing to commit robbery at Bertola village. Later, Selim's cohorts opened fire targeting the policemen to free him, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. At one stage, Selim was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, the OC said.

Name: Sabbir Hossain
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police on June 19, 2017.

Name: Joban Ali
Description: On June 29, 2017 police arrested Joban Ali and his wife Maleka Begum, son Arif aged 10, daughter China Khatun aged 12 from Sorishabari railway station.After that, they were taken to Sorishabari Police Station. Family members alleged that he died due to torture.

Name: Rabiul alias Badsha
Location: Madrasa road of Chuknagar under Dumuria upazila of Khulna
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police and members of his gang on July 1, 2017 at Madrasa road of Chuknagar under Dumuria upazila of Khulna. The dead man was identified as 35-year-old Rabiul alias Badsha, son of Jaffar Sheikh from village Malotia under Dumuria  upazila of the district. According to police, he was the leader of a band of robbers. Sukumar Biswas, Officer-in-Charge of Dumuria Police Station said that Rabiul was arrested on June 30, 2017. He confessed to possessing illegal firearms and based on information extracted from him police raided the area in the early hours of July 1, 2017. Sensing the presence of law enforcers Rabuil's cohorts opened fire on the police and they retaliated and Rabiul was shot dead.

Name: Sohel
Identity: An alleged criminal and an  accused for the murder of Fulgazi upazila chairman Ekramul
Description: Sohel , 35, an alleged criminal and an  accused for the murder of Fulgazi upazila chairman Ekramul was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the members of RAB on July 3, 2017. RAB members raided Birinchi area in Feni town around 4:30am, acting on information that some criminals were taking preparation for committing a robbery, said Squadron Leader Shafayet Jamil Fahim, commander of RAB-7.  Sensing the presence of RAB, the robbers opened fire. In retaliation, RAB returned fire, triggering a gunfight. During the gun battle, Sohel was hit by bullets and died on the spot, Fahim added.

Name: Idris Ali
Description: An alleged robber, Idris Ali, 32, was killed in an alleged gunfight with police in Rangpur's Mithapukur upazila on July 3, 2017. Mozammel Haq, officer-in-charge of the police station said that police arrested Idris on July 2, 2017 while he was preparing for committing a robbery.  Gleaning information from Idris, police along with him went to recover firearms. When their vehicle reached near Joyrampur village around 3:00am, cohorts of Idris opened fire and snatched Idris, the OC said. Police then fired back, triggering the "gunfight". After the gun battle, police found the body of Idris lying on the ground, while his aides managed to flee.

Name: Nazmul Sheikh
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Berpasha, Jhalkathi on July 4, 2017.

Name: Faisal
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with RAB at Dhaka-Chittagong highway, Lemua, Fenion July 11, 2017.

Name: Alamgir Hossain
Description: A suspected mugger was killed  in a reported gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion at Dhakeshwari, near the capitals Lalbag on July 13, 2017 afternoon. The deceased was identified as Alamgir Hossain, 35,  Major AH Mohiuddin, Second-in-Command of RAB-10, said two members of a motorcycle patrol team of the elite force chased a private car after witnessing a snatching in front of Board of Intermediate and Secondary Education around 4:30pm. At one stage, Alamgir was killed.

Name: Babu alias Guddu Babu
Description: Both of them were killed in a gunfight with police in railway station area in Khulna Sadar on July 17, 2017.

Name: Md Al Mahmud
Description: Both of them were killed in a gunfight with police in railway station area in Khulna Sadar on July 17, 2017.

Name: Abul Kalam
Description: Abdul Kalam, an  alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with Rapid Action Battalion in Pologround area of Chittagong city on July 19, 2017.  A team of Rab-7 raided Pologround area around 3:00am, acting on a tip-off that some arms dealers were trading firearms there, said Mimtanur Rahman, Assistant Director of RAB-7. He said when the RAB team reached the spot, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members then returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". After the gun battle, the RAB team found a bullet-hit man and took him to a hospital where he was pronounced dead on arrival.  Victim's family, however, said Kalam went outside his rented house in Baizid area on July 18 morning, saying he was going to work. But he did not return home at night.  Md Ripon, the elder brother of Kalam's wife, said, "In the morning, we came to know about his [Kalam] death from TV news. Family members of Kalam asked me to see whether Kalam was alright. I came to the hospital and identified his body." "My sister's husband [Kalam] used to catch fish and look after their cattle in his village in Feni. He came here [Chittagong city] around six months ago. He used to work as a daily labourer. On July 18 morning, he told my sister that he was going to work in a vehicle as a helper," Ripon said. But the claim of exchanging fire between Kalam and RAB was not true as he had no firearm, he added.

Name: Mosharraf
Description: Two suspected muggers, who allegedly used to pose as DB police and rob people, were shot in a gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion in the capital's Azimpur on July 25, 2017 afternoon. Mosharraf, 39, and Monir Hossein, 35, suffered bullet wounds in their right and left thighs. They were undergoing treatment at Dhaka Medical College Hospital, RAB said. The alleged gunfight took place between a group of muggers and a team of Rab-10 after the law enforcers, acting on a tip-off, went there to nab them. The duo was injured during their fire exchange, Shahabuddin Khan, commanding officer of Rab-10, told.

Name: Monir Hossein
Description: Two suspected muggers, who allegedly used to pose as DB police and rob people, were shot in a gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion in the capital's Azimpur on July 25, 2017 afternoon. Mosharraf, 39, and Monir Hossein, 35, suffered bullet wounds in their right and left thighs. They were undergoing treatment at Dhaka Medical College Hospital, RAB said. The alleged gunfight took place between a group of muggers and a team of Rab-10 after the law enforcers, acting on a tip-off, went there to nab them. The duo was injured during their fire exchange, Shahabuddin Khan, commanding officer of Rab-10, told.

Name: Sobhan Ali
Description: In Kushtia, an alleged robber, Sobhan Ali, 35, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Sadar upazila and another alleged robber, Hasanuzzaman Lalon, 40, killed in a similar incident in Bheramara upazila.

Name: Hasanuzzaman Lalon
Description: In Kushtia, an alleged robber, Sobhan Ali, 35, was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Sadar upazila and another alleged robber, Hasanuzzaman Lalon, 40, killed in a similar incident in Bheramara upazila.

Name: Rukon Mia
Description: Rukun Mia was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Sorail, Brahmanbaria

Name: Yousuf Mia
Description: Yousuf Mia was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Kosba, Brahmanbariya.

Name: Unidentified
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Keraniganj, Dhaka.

Name: Mahfuzur Rahman
Description: Family alleged that Mahfuzur Rahman was tortured by the police in the custody of Nachol Police Station. However, police demanded that he committed suicide.for the death of his brother in police custody. Followup: Six policemen, including the officer-in-charge of Nachole Police Station, were sued on August 6, 2017 as a murder case. The policemen are OC Anwar Hossain, sub-inspectors Abdul Barik, Ahsan Habib, Johrul Islam, ASI Md Shamsul and constable Chan Jarul of the police station. Shahinur Alam, brother of deceased Mahfuzur Rahman, filed a complaint to the cognisance court of the senior judicial magistrate demanding justice

Name: Abdur Rouf alias Rofuj
Description: He was allegedly killed by RAB in a gunfight.

Name: Hossain Shikder Victor
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the members of RAB-06 at Mollahat upazila, Bagerhat.

Name: Amir
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Mirerbagh, Dakkhin Keraniganj, Dhaka.

Name: Saiful Islam Jhilki
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police at Baniyachong upazila, Habiganj.

Name: Imran
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight  with RAB at Kadamati area of Dhaka

Name: Jalal Uddin alias Bodu
Description: A suspected drug paddler was killed in a gunfight with police at Akhaura in Brahmanbaria on August 5, 2017.  The deceased was identified as Jalal Uddin alias Budo, 45, son of Dharo Miah of village Bawtala under Akhaura upazila in the district.  Jalals family members, however, claimed that the police killed him in custody in a staged crossfire incident.  Md Mosharaf Hossain, office-in-charge of Akhaura police, said that Jalal Miah was a listed drug paddler and locals detained him and handed him over to the police on August 4, 2017 .  The police officer added that Jalal had confessed to the police of possessing illegal firearms and drugs. Later, the police along with Jalal conducted a raid based on his information at Nurpur area around 2:00am on August 5, 2017.  Sensing the presence of law enforcers, his associates opened fire on the police and the police retaliated by firing.  Jalal Mia received bullets and died on the spot during the gunfight, Mosharaf said. Jalals wife Halima Begum claimed that the police arrested her husband and she met him in police custody on Friday morning and afternoon.  She claimed that police murdered her husband in custody in a staged gunfight.

Name: Mamun Mia
Description: Mamun Mia was arrested on August 9, 2017 at Nabinagar upazila of Brahmanbaria. Later police took him to Deura village for rescuing arms. There he was allegedly killied in a gunfight with police.

Name: Enamul Haq
Description: A key accused in a college student abduction case was killed in a gunfight with police in Shibpur village of Kushtia Sadar on August 22, 2017. Enamul Haq, 33, was accused of abducting and  killing college student Sagar Saha. Sagar, 19, son of Pradeep Saha, was abducted on  August 16, 2017. Police recovered Sagars  body in an abandoned toilet at Harinarayanpur village on August 19, 2017. Ratan Seikh, officer-in-charge of Islamic University Police Station, said they arrested Enamul on August 20, 2017. In primary interrogation, Enamul told police that his partner in the crime was a villager named Shipon Ali. According to the OC, police teams taking Enamul with them, went to Shibpur village to hunt for Shipon. On the way, the police teams were attacked near a banana orchard. They shot at police to snatch Enamul. A gunfight ensued. Enamul, handcuffed, was shot dead when he tried to escape from the police van, Ratan claimed.

Name: Mamun
Description: A man, allegedly involved in a shooting incident on August 12 which left a DB police injured, was killed during a gunfight in capital's Jurain on August 22, 2017 with police. The deceased was identified as Mamun, 30.

Name: Arman Ali
Identity: Alleged member of Jamaatul Mujahideen Bangladesh
Location: Village Boalia of Daulatpur in Kushtia
Description: A suspected member of Jamaatul Mujahideen Bangladesh was reportedly killed in a gunfight between his associates and police at village Boalia of Daulatpur in Kushtia on August 25, 2017 police claimed.  Deceased Arman Ali, 42, was the son of Ahsan Ali, a resident of village Thakur Soulatpur in Bheramara upazila. Officer-in-charge of Daulatpur police station Shah Dara Khan said on secret information a police team conducted a drive in the area while Arman and his associates were holding a secret meeting at about 3:30am.  Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the JMB members opened fire on policemen forcing the police to fire back that triggered a gunfight, the police officer said.  After the reported gunfight, police found Arman dead with bullet wounds while his associates managed to flee.  Later, police took Arman to Daulatpur Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors confirmed his death.

Name: Masudul Haque Pintu
Identity: president of BNPs Ashekpur UP unit in Shahjahanpur upazila of Bogra
Description: A  BNP leader was allegedly tortured to death by police in Bogra on August 22, 2017 following a family feud over who had the right to fish in a local pond, the deceaseds family has claimed. Family members alleged that Kaigari police outpost in-charge, Inspector Anisur Rahman, and three other officers picked up Pintu from his home without any arrest of warrant on August 22 . The police pulled out my father from the bathroom and hit him with their rifle butt on his head, chest, neck and other places before taking him away on a CNG-run auto rickshaw, Pintus daughter, Meherunnesa said..She also said that family members rushed to the police station, but her father was not there. Police informed us that he had died at the hospital.  According to the family, Pintu was severely tortured with rifle butts while in custody and later succumbed to his injuries at Shahid Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital.

Name: Robbani
Description: Syed Nurul Islam, Superintendent of Mymensingh police said a patrol team of Mymensingh DB police, led by its officer-in-charge Ashiqur Rahman, went to Boilor area around 3:30am, acting on information that eight-10 robbers were there to commit a robbery. The team found a gathering of some 200 people at Boilor where the gang attempted to commit the robbery. But chased by locals, the gang members fled in two pickups. Locals caught one of them while fleeing and beat him up, killing him on the spot, the SP said. Hearing the news, the police team went after the gang and came to know that the criminals were staying in Jhitka area. When the law enforcers reached near the spot, the gang members opened fire. In retaliation, police returned fire, triggering a "gunfight". During the "gun battle", Robbani was hit by bullets and died on the spot, said police. However, other members of the gang managed to flee.

Name: Mojaharul Islam
Description: Mojaharul Islam, died in the custody of RAB on 9/9/2017 hours after members of the RAB arrested him at Naogaon. He was declared dead at Rajshahi Medical College Hospital at 4:37am, said the hospital and police officials. Executive Magistrate Rohima Sultana Bushra prepared an inquest report at RMCH morgue mentioning marks of injuries in parts of his body.  Swollen marks of hits were seen on the back of his head, forehead, throat, both hands, legs, left waist, and on his back.The family member of Mojaharul Islam told reporters there that Mojahar was tortured to death.

Name: Maulana Saidur Rahman
Identity: Superintendent of Hothatganj Madrassa, Kolaroa, Satkhira
Description: Maulana Saidur was tortured to death by the members of Satkhira Sadar Police on 16.9.17. SI Asaduzzaman and his team of Satkhira Sadar Police Station, had arrested Saidur from his house. Police claimed that he was arrested in two sabotage cases. Later, police brought him to Kathonda Bazar. During the time, police beat him mercilessly. At this time, his nephew Muttasim Billah asked for release of 5000 taka and left the uncle. But the police demanded one lakh taka. Saidur was brought to Satkhira Police Station due to not being able to pay this money. Police also tortured him brutally there. After taking him to the Court, the authorities refused to accept Saidur after seeing his illness. Later, the police took him back to Satkhira hospital. After recovering his illness, police brought Saidur to the Court again at around 5pm. In the afternoon, Saidur sent the Court to Satkhira jail. Superintendent of Satkhira Prison said that when he fell sick that night he was taken in the prison hospital. Then he was transferred to Satkhira Sadar Hospital in midnight and his treatment was going on '.  Dr. Farhad Jamil, residential medical officer of Satkhira Hospital said, 'after being brought to the hospital, he was being treated. He died in early morning. The post mortem will be investigated ' He also said that the marks of torture in the body of the madrassa teacher Moulana Saidur were found.

Name: Miraz Hasan Teny
Location: Pipulbaria-Baliadanga field at Daulatpur in Kushtia
Description: A suspected criminal was killed in a gunfight with police in Pipulbaria-Baliadanga field at Daulatpur in Kushtia . The deceased was identified as Teny, 27, son of Alam Mandal, a resident of village Chatardara in Aria union of the upazila . Shah Dara Than, Officer-in-Charge of Daulatpur Police Station, said that on a tip-off, a team of police led by sub-inspector Rahim conducted a drive in the area around 03:45am. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, members of the  opened fire on police, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. Later, police rescued bullet-hit Teny from the spot. He was rushed to Daulatpur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Sohagh
Location: Bhairab Bridge area in Bhairab upazila of Kishoreganj
Description:
A suspected robber was killed during a shootout with police at Bhairab Bridge area in Bhairab upazila of Kishoreganj. The victim was identified as Md Sohagh, 23, son of Mohammad Ali of village Bhairab Dakhhinpara. On information that a gang of robbers in Bhairab Bridge area were preparing to commit a robbery, a police team led by officer-in-charge of Bhairab Police Station Muklesur Rahman raided the area around 3.30am, said Mohammad Ali Zinnah, officer-in-charge (Investigation) of Bhairab Police
Station. Sensing police presence the alleged robbers fired some 30 round of bullets on the police team, the OC said, and the police retaliated with 20 rounds of gunshots. After the gunfight police found a wounded Sohagh and rushed him to Bhairab Upazila Health Complex where the doctors declared him dead.
Actions Taken: A case has been lodged in this regard with the local police station.

Name: Saidur Rahman
Description: Nuruzzaman Chowdhury, Officer-in-Charge of Kalai Police Station, said a team of law enforcers raided Harunza village  to arrest Md Shapla Hossain, an accused in a case filed under Women and Children Repression Prevention Act by one Shyamoli Akhter of the same village. Witness Ruma Khatun alleged that the police were in an angry mood during the raid and were assaulting villagers irrespective of their gender. At one stage, Saidur Rahman stepped forward and protested their actions. The policemen locked in an altercation with Saidur and later started beating him up in front of the villagers. As he collapsed on the ground unconscious, the policemen took him away, alleged Nadira Begum, Saidur's wife. The police took him to Kalai Upazila Health Complex where he died of his injuries around 8:30am. Police refused to record a case over the death of a man in police torture at Kalai in Jaipurhat, alleged the father of the victim.
Actions Taken:
Four policemen including two sub-inspectors have been suspended after they allegedly beat up a man to death during a raid in Kalai. The suspended police officials are sub-inspectors Rafiqul Islam and Md Asaduzzaman and constables Rashedul Islam and Selim Reza of Kalai Police
Station.

Name: Didarul Alam Chowdhury Sohel
Description: Mimtanur Rahman, Assistant Director of the media wing at RAB 7, said a Rab team went to Durgapur beside Dhaka-Chittagong highway around 3:30am, acting on information that some criminals were carrying a consignment of phensidyl to Chittagong in microbuses from Dhaka. Five to six criminals came out of two microbuses and opened fire on the RAB  men after they were intercepted at a checkpoint, forcing them to return fire. Didar was hit by bullets, said Squadron Leader Safayat Jamil Fahim, Company Commander of RAB -7, who led the drive. Didar was declared dead when he was taken to Mirsarai Upazila Health Complex.

Name: Modon Mia alias Mozammel
Location: Daragaon Tea Garden area in Bahubal upazila of Habiganj
Description: Mazharul Islam, officer-in-charge of Bahubal Police Station, said Modon stood accused in seven cases, including the ones related to arms, robbery and murder. Police arrested him  and took him to the tea garden area to arrest his associates around 3:30am as per his statement, the police official said. Sensing the presence of police, Modon's associates opened fire. In retaliation, police fired back, triggering the gunfight. Modon was caught in the line of fire when he was trying to flee from police custody. He was pronounced dead after being taken to Habiganj Sadar Hospital.

Name: Moniruzzaman Shahin
Description: Moniruzzaman was killed during a gunfight with DB police around 4:30am. The "gunfight" took place when a team of the Detective Branch of police raided a drug den at Galachipa in Narayanganj city, said Md Sharifuddin, Additional Superintendent of police in the district.

Name: Shahinur Rahman
Description: Kushtia Detective Branch of police Officer-in-Charge Sabbirul Islam said that they arrested Shahin and went to Silaidah Kasba Ghat under Kumarkhali in Kushtia along with the accused to arrest another accused wanted in the case of murdering an expatriate. Sensing the law enforcers presence, a group of criminals opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight, he said. When the gunfight was over, bullet-hit Shahin was rescued and taken to Kushtia General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead, Sabbirul said.

Name: Mohammad Mokhter Molla
Identity:
Alleged robber; second-in-command of forest
robber gang - Liton Bahini
Location:
Shaila canal area of
Sarankhola range of the Sunderbans east division, Bagerhat
Description: Abdul Jalil, the OC of Sarankhola police station said a team of RAB-8 on secret information conducted a raid in the area in the morning while the members of Liton Bahini took position in Shaila canal area of the Sunderbans. He said that the robbers, sensing presence of RAB members, opened fire on them and RAB also retaliated by firing, triggering a gunfight. As the gunfight was over, the OC said, the RAB members searched the area and found a bullet-hit body. .

Name: Mohammad Selim
Description: Major Ruhul Amin, Company Commander of Cox's Bazar RAB-7, said that  they arrested Selim from New Fishery Ghat area . Getting information from him, a RAB team conducted a drive in Kurushkul area around 2:00am to arrest his associates and recover firearms. Sensing the presence of RAB officials, his associates opened fire on the elite force, prompting them to retaliate, the officer said, claiming, Selim died on the spot receiving a bullet fired by his associates. Selim's associates, however, managed to escape, said Major Ruhul.

Name: Mohammad Faruk
Description: A suspected drug trader was killed in a gunfight with the members of RAB at Barisal Colony in Chittagong city. The deceased was Mohammad Faruk. Mimtanur Rahman, senior Assistant Director (media) of RAB-7, said that that a team of RAB members conducted a drive at Barisal Colony to recover drugs around 2:00am. Sensing their presence, Mimtanur claimed, drug peddlers opened fire on the RAB members, forcing them to retaliate, triggering the gunfight. During the gunfight,

Name: Unidentified
Description: A youth was killed in a gunfight with the police personnel at Tighria village of Binauti union of Kosba upazila. The identity of the deceased could not be ascertained immediately. Police claimed that he was a robber. Mohammad Mohiuddin, officer-in-charge of Kosba Police Station said that they conducted a drive after received an information from the local people. A group of 15 to 20 robbers with arms attacked at Tighria village for robbery. Sensing their presence, robbers opened fire on the police members. During the time, police counter fire to them for their self defence. Later, they were escaped from the place. Police rescued bullet wounded an unknown person's body from the place.
Actions Taken: A case was filed in this connection

Name: Bishwa Chandra Dey
Description: On October 1, S I Suman of Nalitabari Police Station, detained Bishwa with 60gram Ganja and took him to the police station. During the time, they beat him mercilessly, leaving him critically injured. However, police released him. Later, he succumbed to his injuries at around 2:00am. Bishwa's sister Sheuly Dey alleged that he was killed by police torture.

Name: Majom Ali
Description: Majom Ali's family alleged that members of BGB picked up him and tortured, leaving him dead. Robiul Islam, UP member of 6 no. ward of Boroshoshi union, told BGB members tortured Majom infront of him

Name: Anwar Hossain
Description: An accused in the case filed over the murder of Malaysia expatriate Rafiqul Islam, was killed in a gunfight with police in Kushtia's Kumarkhali. Abdul Khalek, OC of Kumarkhali police station, said a joint team of Kumarkhali police and Detective Branch of Police in Kushtia raided Joynabad village around 2:30am, acting on information that some criminals were holding a meeting there. Cordoning off the spot, police asked the criminals to surrender. Instead of listening to the law enforcers, they opened fire, the OC said. In retaliation, police returned fire, triggering the gunfight that lasted for half an hour, the police official said, adding that they found the body of Anwar on the spot after the gunfight.

Name: Rashel
Description: A businessman named Rashel (25) was allegedly tortured to death by the Detective Branch (DB) of Police for one hundred thousand taka at Kaunias Haldibari area under Rangpur District. Reshels younger sister Sohana alleged that on October 28, 2017 at around 10:00 pm, a group of DB police led by Sub Inspector Shafi arrested her brother from Haldibari Bazaar. Later at around 1:00 am, SI Shafi went to their home and demanded one hundred thousand taka bribe for releasing Rashel. When they said that they did not have the capacity to pay this amount SI Shafi threatened her father and brother to be accused in criminal case. Later DB police inflicted torture on his brother. Due to torture in custody, DB police admitted Rashel to Rangpur Medical College Hospital. On October 29, her brother died in hospital while he was under treatment.

Name: Afajuddin
Description: A robber was killed in a gunfight with police while his gang preparing to commit a robbery in Gazipur city. The dead is Afajuddin of Pachahar village at Pagla of Mymensingh.  Acting on a tip off, police raided the area and sensing their presence the robbers opened fire on them, triggering the gunfight, said Sakhawat Hossain, Additional SP (Gazipur Sadar-Tongi Circle).

Name: Nannu Molla
Description: A leader of a forest robber gang was killed in a reported gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion at Chunkuri canal in Satkhira range of Sundarban west division. Local fishermen identified the deceased as Nannu Molla, 47, the second-in-command of a robber gang who went by the name of Zonab Bahini in the area, said ANM Zahidul Kabir, the Crime Prevention Company-1 Commander of RAB-6. Being tipped off, a RAB team raided a canal located about five kilometers away from the mainland around 9:30am, he said. Sensing the presence of the elite force, the robbers opened fire on them and prompted the RAB team to retaliate. Nannu was shot in the ensuing gunfight which lasted for half an hour while the other members of the gang fled the scene, claimed the commander.

Name: Yusuf Fakir
Location: Katlar Khal of the Baleshwar River under Swarankhola range of the Sunderbans, Bagerhat
Description: Two suspected forest robbers were killed in a reported gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion in Katlar Khal of the Baleshwar River under Swarankhola range of the Sunderbans. The deceased were identified as Yusuf Fakir, Second-in-Command of the robber gang and Ruhul Amin, a gang member who was assigned to kill people. Based on information that members of a robber gang, Abbas Bahini, were staying in the area, a team of the elite force carried out a drive in the Baleshwar River, said Hasan Emon Al Rajib, wing commander of RAB-8. Several gunshots were traded between the gang and the RAB members during the  gun battle. Yusuf and Ruhul were caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, the RAB officials said

Name: Ruhul Amin
Location: Katlar Khal of the Baleshwar River under Swarankhola range of the Sunderbans, Bagerhat
Description: Two suspected forest robbers were killed in a reported gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion in Katlar Khal of the Baleshwar River under Swarankhola range of the Sunderbans. The deceased were identified as Yusuf Fakir, Second-in-Command of the robber gang and Ruhul Amin, a gang member who was assigned to kill people. Based on information that members of a robber gang, Abbas Bahini, were staying in the area, a team of the elite force carried out a drive in the Baleshwar River, said Hasan Emon Al Rajib, wing commander of RAB-8. Several gunshots were traded between the gang and the RAB members during the  gun battle. Yusuf and Ruhul were caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, the RAB officials said

Name: Al Amin alias Akash
Description: Al Amin alias Akash, 32,was killed in what police claimed was a crossfire between DB police and his armed cohorts in South Keraniganj.  He was killed hours after police picked him up in Munshiganj. Dipok Chandra Saha, Officer-in-Charge of Dhaka District Police's Detective Branch (South), said a team of police, taking Al Amin along, went in a drive in Khejurbagan area to recover arms and drugs around 2:30am. But when armed gang men started shooting at police in an attempt to free him, he got shot and died.

Name: Mokarram Hossain
Description: A "top robber" enlisted by the Home Ministry was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and RAB in Cox's Bazar. Deceased Mokarram Hossain, 38, led local gang Jambu Bahini, said RAB. Maj Ruhul Amin, Commander of RAB-7 in Cox's Bazar camp claimed that they were tipped off that a gang was preparing to conduct a robbery in the sea. For this they took position with firearms in Kutubjom. Sensing their presence, the gang opened fire on them, and the force retaliated in self-defence, he claimed. After a 30-minute encounter, the gang fled and the criminal was found bullet-hit. He was declared dead in a local hospital, he said.

Name: Saiful Islam
Description: Two suspected robbers  Saiful Islam and Safiq Mollah  were killed in a gunfight with RAB members at Chatlar Ghat under Hatia in Noakhali. Saiful, wanted in nine cases for murders, robbery and abduction, was the alleged ringleader of the notorious pirate gang Saiful Bahini while Safiq was one of his cohorts, RAB claimed. RAB-11 Senior Assistant Superintendent of police Jasim Uddin said that they, on information that the Saiful gang members were staying at Chatlar Ghat, conducted a drive in the area around 4:00am. Sensing the presence of RAB, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers and RAB members also retaliated by firing, triggering a gunfight that left the two robbers dead on the spot.

Name: Safiq Mollah
Description: Two suspected robbers  Saiful Islam and Safiq Mollah  were killed in a gunfight with RAB members at Chatlar Ghat under Hatia in Noakhali. Saiful, wanted in nine cases for murders, robbery and abduction, was the alleged ringleader of the notorious pirate gang Saiful Bahini while Safiq was one of his cohorts, RAB claimed. RAB-11 Senior Assistant Superintendent of police Jasim Uddin said that they, on information that the Saiful gang members were staying at Chatlar Ghat, conducted a drive in the area around 4:00am. Sensing the presence of RAB, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers and RAB members also retaliated by firing, triggering a gunfight that left the two robbers dead on the spot.

Name: Palash Mandol
Description: Palash Mandol, Second in Command of Munna robber gang, was killed in gunfight with police at Bhayenar Khal of Sunderban, said Koira police officer-in-charge Enamul Haq. Sensing the presence of police, robber started firing triggering a fight which left Palash dead, said Enamul.

Name: Billal Hossain Selim
Description: An alleged robber was killed in police claimed was a shootout between police and his armed cohorts in the capital's Khilgaon area. Billal Hossain Selim, 45, son of Syed Ali of Tangail, was killed hours after police had picked him up from Demra in Dhaka. He was suspected to be a leader of an inter-district robbery gang and was accused in at least 10 cases, police said. Anwar Hossain, deputy commissioner (Motijheel) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police, said a team of Khilgaon police took Billal on a drive in Mostafa Majhir area to arrest his cohorts and recover firearms around 2:00am. As the police reached there, an armed group opened fire on them in an attempt to free Billal. The law enforcers claimed they returned fire and Billal was shot at one point. He was declared dead upon arriving at DMCH, the DC said at a press conference at his office.

Name: Shah Alam
Identity: Businessman; owners of FM Leather Complex
Description: Shah Alam died in police custody after he was picked up with his two sons and two nephews from their house at Hazaribagh over a robbery case filed by one of their neighbours. He fell sick during a court hearing. He was first taken to nearby National Medical College Hospital, but doctors referred him to DMCH as his condition deteriorated. DMCH doctors declared him dead. Victims daughter Umme Kulsum said that the police arrested her father, two brotherOsman Gani and Murad Hossain, and two of their cousins from their house at Hazaribagh without any warrant. "They were kept in the police custody, tortured, and we were not told the reason for what they were arrested, said Umme Kulsum.

Name: Abbas Sarder alias Khokon
Identity: Member of Purba Bangla Communist Party
Location: Kalitola Kheyaghat area of Beninagar village, Rajbari Sadar
Description: An alleged member of Purba Bangla Communist Party was killed in a gunfight with police at Kalitola Kheyaghat area of Beninagar village under Rajbari Sadar. The deceased was Abbas Sarder alias Khokon (46). Tarik Kamal, Officer-in-Charge of Rajbari Sadar Police Station said a team of Sadar Police Station and DB Police drive in Kalitola area at  around 3:30am. As the police reached there, an armed group opened fire on them. The law enforcers claimed they returned fire and Khokon was shot at one point. He was declared dead upon arriving at Sadar Hospital. Police recovered a Kata Rifel, thee cartridge and one shooter gun from that place.

Name: Mohimuddin alias Mohin
Description: An alleged cadre of student wing of  Jamaat was killed in a shootout between RAB and his cohorts in Chittagong. According to RAB, Mohin was known to be an operative of notorious student wing of Jamaat cadre Sazzad. The shootout took place in Rajganj area of Panchlaish around 4:00am, said Ashequr Rahman, Lt Commander, deputy director of RAB7. Acting on information that a group of armed criminals, led by Mohin, gathered at Rajganj, a RAB team from Chandgaon camp went to the spot to arrest them. Sensing the presence of RAB members, the criminals opened fire on law enforcers. As the RAB team fired retaliatory shots, the thugs fled the area, leaving bullet-hit Mohin behind. Law enforcers later recovered Mohin's body from the spot.

Name: Abdullah
Description: An alleged criminal was killed in a gunfight with police in the capital's Tejgaon area. Abdullah, 30, from Kishoreganj, was a wanted criminal, said Mohammad Rasheduzzaman, an inspector of Tejgaon Industrial Area Police Station. He said police raided the BG Press field around 3:30am on information that some criminals gathered there to commit a robbery. Sensing the presence of police, the criminals opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". When the criminals fled, police found the bullet-hit body of Abdullah lying on the spot, the police official said. Abdullah was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, he added.

Name: Mohammad Russel
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a shootout during a police raid in Debidwar, Comilla. The deceased were identified as Russel and Omar Faruk. According to Comilla DB police, a shootout ensued when a police team led by Additional Police Super Abdullah Al Mamun arrived in Hatimara area of Debidwar. They were acting on a tip-off that a team of 10-15 robbers was preparing for a robbery there. The robbers opened fire after sensing the lawmen's presence triggering a response from the police. Two robbers were killed on the spot and five policemen were injured. Police arrested five members of the gang and seized a firearm along with ammunition and lethal weapons from the spot

Name: Mohammad Omar Faruk
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a shootout during a police raid in Debidwar, Comilla. The deceased were identified as Russel and Omar Faruk. According to Comilla DB police, a shootout ensued when a police team led by Additional Police Super Abdullah Al Mamun arrived in Hatimara area of Debidwar. They were acting on a tip-off that a team of 10-15 robbers was preparing for a robbery there. The robbers opened fire after sensing the lawmen's presence triggering a response from the police. Two robbers were killed on the spot and five policemen were injured. Police arrested five members of the gang and seized a firearm along with ammunition and lethal weapons from the spot

Name: Anu Ahmed alias Alam
Description: Kushtia Detective Branch of police  Acting Officer-in-Charge Sabbirul Islam, reported that a team of DB and Sadar police launched a drive at about 4:00pm on information that a group of robbers were taking preparation to rob on the Rajbari-Kushtia Highway. When the law enforcers turned up, the suspected robbers started shooting at them, who in response had to return shots. After the gunfight, a man with bullet wounds was found, however his associates managed to flee, police said. Later, police sent the body to Kushtia General Hospital where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Habibur Rahman
Description: Assistant Superintendent of Police (Kanaighat circle) Aminul Islam Sarker said a team of the police led by sub-inspector Bashir raided Habiburs house at village Charipara as he was wanted in many robbery cases to arrest him.
