Sensing the presence of police, Habibur opened fire to police while his family members attacked the police with knives. Police fired back that injured at least 8 persons including Habibur and four cops, Aminul said. Habibur was sent to the SOMCH in a critical condition after his recovery from the spot, but he died on his way to the hospital, the police officer said.

Name: Kohinur Rahman alias Ketu
Identity: Member of Purba Banglar Communist Party (ML Janajuddho)
Description: A top cadre of outlawed Purba Banglar Communist Party (ML Janajuddho) faction was killed in a shootout with police in Sadar upazila of Chuadanga.  Police arrested Ketu from a hideout of Keraniganj in Dhaka and he was later brought to Chuadanga Sadar Police Station in the evening. During interrogation, Ketu admitted about his firearms at Bhalipur village in the district, said Amir Abbas, Officer-in-Charge (OC-operation) of Chuadanga Sadar Police Station. Police started with Ketu to recover the hidden firearms. As soon as the law enforcers reached the spot on Chuadanga-Jhenidah highway, Ketu's aides opened fire, triggering a gunfight between them and police, he said. Ketu was killed in a line of fire when he tried to flee from police custody with handcuff.

Name: Riad Sharif
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a gunfight with the DB Police in Rupganj. Riad, was accused in several robbery cases, said police. On information that a gang was planning to commit robbery in Kanchan bridge area, detectives conducted a raid there. But, sensing the presence of police, the gang opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to return fire, said Narayanganj district DB. They also recovered a foreign pistol, four bullets, a machete and a large knife from the spot.

Name: Shamim
Description:
The Detective Branch of police in Comilla said that a suspected robber was killed in a gunfight between the DB police  and a group of robbers at Chandina. DB sub-inspector Shah Kamal Akand said that the gunfight occurred while a DB police team was patrolling different areas of Chandina. When we reached Chhaygharia on the Dhaka-Chittagong Highway around 2:40am, the robbers intercepted our microbus with local weapons and rod bars in an attempt to rob the vehicle, not realising that we were law enforcers, he said.
The DB members chased the robbers who in return opened fire on the law enforcers, triggering a gunfight which left Shamim critically injured. The other robbers managed to escape but the detectives recovered one locally made gun and sharp weapons from the spot.
Later, Shamim was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead, the SI added. Shamims family members, however, alleged that Shahim was picked up by some men in plainclothes from his village home on Saturday.

Name: Yunus Mia
Identity: Former councilor and Vice-President of youth wing of BNP of Chunarughat
Description: Yunus Mia was allegedly killed in a gunfight with police while police went to conduct an operation to catch miscreants at Dimagurunda village, Chunarughat, Hobiganj at around 11.30 pm on December 31,2017. Police claimed that Yunus attacked them and in retaliation they opened fire. As a result, Yunus Mia had died. On the other hand, Yunuss wife Kazi Shahana Akhter informed that police picked up Yunus Mia in the evening.

Name: Anowar Hossain
Description: He was allegedly killed in a gunfight with the members of RAB at Dharmapur, Sadar upazila, Feni on December 31, 2017.

Name: Sirazul Islam
Identity: An accused of killing Sadia Akhter
Description: Police arrested Sirazul, an accused of Sadia killing, who was killed after being raped, on 4th December 2017. On next day, he was produced before the Court and admits about the incident. On 8 December, suddenly he felt sick at Barisal Central Jail. Later, he rushed to the Sher-E-Bangla Medical College Hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries. On the basis of prescription and information of the doctors, he felt sick for torture and then died

Name: Anwar Hossain Raju
Description: A person was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Feni. The deceased was Anwar Hossain Raju, son of Jahangir Alam of Dharmapur in Feni Sadar. Anwars father Jahangir Alam alleged that his son, who was released on bail only 10 days earlier, was picked up by RAB personnel from the house around 4:00 am and then they heard that his son was killed in a gunfight. Feni Camp Commander of RAB-7, Squadron Leader Shafayat Jamil Fahim claimed that on a tip-off that a gang of drug traders gathered at Dharmapur, a team of the battalion raided the area. The drug traders opened fire on RAB personnel, prompting them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight. Anwar received bullet-wounds during the gunfight. He was taken to Feni General Hospital where on-duty physicians declared him dead.

Name: Lutfar Rahman alias Ripul
Description:
Mohanganj Police Station Officer-in-Charge Ansari Jinnat Ali said that Lutfar was arrested  and the police launched a drive at night with Lutfar at Noapara to recover illegal arms.
During the drive, Lutfars accomplices fired gunshots on the police and the police retaliated, triggering the gunfight. Lutfar sustained bullet wound during the exchange of fire and was taken to Mohanganj Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Farid
Location: Katiarkhal in Sunderbans east division under Sarankhola in Bagerhat
Description: A suspected forest robber was killed in what police claimed a gunfight between a team of river police and suspected robbers at Katiarkhal in Sunderbans east division under Sarankhola in Bagerhat. Sarankhola Police Station Officer-in-Charge Md Kabirul Islam said a team of river polices Dhansagar outpost, on tip-off that the members of forest robber gang Chhoto Bahini had abducted six fishermen for ransom, conducted a drive at Katiarkhal in the Sunderbans at about 2:30am. He said the team, on suspicion, signaled a boat to stop but the boat violated the signal and the suspected robbers from the boat opened fire on police, prompting them to retaliate by firing. The OC claimed that Farid was shot and died on the spot and his associates managed to get away by jumping into the river and swimming ashore.

Name: Babu
Identity: Main accused in Awami League activist Abbas Mollah murder case
Description: Babu, the main accused in Awami League activist Abbas Mollah murder case, was  killed during a gunfight with a Rapid Action Battalion. Major Zia, Commander, Jessore camp, RAB-6 said acting on a tip-off that a group of criminals had gathered for a meeting in Mirzapur village, a RAB team went to the area around 4:00am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the gang fired at them triggering a gunfight.

Name: Solaiman
Identity: An alleged kidnapper of a child
Description: An alleged kidnapper of a child was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Ashuganj. Police arrested Solaiman, on charge of kidnapping Rifat (7), son of Bahar Mia of Khariala village of the upazila. Following his statement given during primary interrogation, a team of police raided abandoned Ankhi Trading and Boiler House in Bahadurpur area to arrest prime suspect Mizan of the case, said Officer-in-Charge of Ashuganj Police Station Badrul Alam Talukder. Sensing the presence of police, Solaiman's accomplices opened fire on them.  As the police returned fire, a gunfight ensued and a bullet fired by his cohorts hit Solaiman. He was pronounced dead upon arrival at Brahmanbaria Sadar Hospital.

Name: Abu Taher
Location: Amtoli area near the Gumti river of Comilla Sadar
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with Comilla DB Police in Amtoli area near the Gumti river of Comilla Sadar around 1:30am. Officer-in-Charge Monjur Alam of Comilla DB police said that the DB police was conducting a special drive near the Gumti in Amtoli. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fired on the policemen resulting in a gunfight. Taher was shot dead on the spot.

Name: Mohammad Zakaria Sardar
Location: Sukhparar Char of Sarankhola range in Sunderbans east division, Bagerhat
Description: Three suspected forest robbers were killed in what the Rapid Action Battalion claimed a gunfight between a team of RAB and a gang of suspected robbers at Sukhparar Char of Sarankhola range in Sunderbans east division. RAB-8 Deputy Commander Sohel Rana Prince said a team of RAB, on a tip-off that the members of forest robber gang Sumon Bahini had been staying at Sukhparar Char area in the Sunderbans, conducted a drive there. Sensing presence of RAB, suspected robbers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate by firing. As the gunfight ended after about 40 minutes and the suspected robbers fled away, the RAB official claimed, the RAB men searched the area and found bullet-hit bodies of three people whom the fishermen later identified as members of Sumon Bahini.

Name: Mohammad Julfikar Sheikh
Location: Sukhparar Char of Sarankhola range in Sunderbans east division, Bagerhat
Description: Three suspected forest robbers were killed in what the Rapid Action Battalion claimed a gunfight between a team of RAB and a gang of suspected robbers at Sukhparar Char of Sarankhola range in Sunderbans east division. RAB-8 Deputy Commander Sohel Rana Prince said a team of RAB, on a tip-off that the members of forest robber gang Sumon Bahini had been staying at Sukhparar Char area in the Sunderbans, conducted a drive there. Sensing presence of RAB, suspected robbers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate by firing. As the gunfight ended after about 40 minutes and the suspected robbers fled away, the RAB official claimed, the RAB men searched the area and found bullet-hit bodies of three people whom the fishermen later identified as members of Sumon Bahini.

Name: Mohammad Khokon Mia
Location: Sukhparar Char of Sarankhola range in Sunderbans east division, Bagerhat
Description: Three suspected forest robbers were killed in what the Rapid Action Battalion claimed a gunfight between a team of RAB and a gang of suspected robbers at Sukhparar Char of Sarankhola range in Sunderbans east division. RAB-8 Deputy Commander Sohel Rana Prince said a team of RAB, on a tip-off that the members of forest robber gang Sumon Bahini had been staying at Sukhparar Char area in the Sunderbans, conducted a drive there. Sensing presence of RAB, suspected robbers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate by firing. As the gunfight ended after about 40 minutes and the suspected robbers fled away, the RAB official claimed, the RAB men searched the area and found bullet-hit bodies of three people whom the fishermen later identified as members of Sumon Bahini.

Name: Bashar Mia
Description: In Brahmanbaria, two suspected robbers, who were arrested, were killed in a gunfight in Sarail upazila. Mofijul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Sarail Police Station, said, Police went to recover firearms as per the information of the two. When the police team reached Shahbazpur-Deora regional road of Sarail upazila around 2:45am, their accomplices attacked police to snatch the two." The "criminals" opened fire and police retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". Wahab and Bashar died on the spot.

Name: Abdul Wahab
Description: In Brahmanbaria, two suspected robbers, who were arrested, were killed in a gunfight in Sarail upazila. Mofijul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Sarail Police Station, said, Police went to recover firearms as per the information of the two. When the police team reached Shahbazpur-Deora regional road of Sarail upazila around 2:45am, their accomplices attacked police to snatch the two." The "criminals" opened fire and police retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". Wahab and Bashar died on the spot.

Name: Razaz Ali
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Rangpur city. Saifur Rahman, Additional Superintendent of Police in Rangpur, said on being tipped off that a gang of robbers was preparing for a robbery in Dharmadash area near the Rice Research Institute, a police team was sent there. When the law enforcers reached the area around 4:00am, the gang opened fire at them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. A member of the gang was killed in the "gunfight" that ensued. Others managed to flee the spot. They recovered the dead body and sent it to Rangpur Medical College Hospital for autopsy.

Name: Saiful Islam
Description: A man was killed and two others were injured in a clash between police and a group of villagers in Sitakunda upazila of Chittagong. The dead was Saiful Islam, 22, son of Shamsul Alam of Telipara village under Bhatiari union. A team of plainclothes policemen went to the village to detain some criminals around 9:00pm. The clash broke out as the villagers tried to stop the law enforcers from making the arrests, said locals. Suddenly, the criminals tried to escape. At one point, police opened fire, leaving one dead and two injured," said Nazim Uddin, chairman of Bhatiari Union Parishad. Later, the villagers blocked the Dhaka-Chittagong highway near the village for an hour in protest. They left after the chairman assured them of justice.
Actions Taken: A case was filed against a sub-inspector of Sitakunda Police Station and four other unknown people yesterday for killing a man in police firing. SI Nazmul, constable Abul Kashem and Ansar member Ismail were taken to police custody and kept at Chittagong Police Lines Ref: Daily Star 27.1.18

Name: Swapan Pyada
Location: Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila, Barguna
Description: In Barguna, three "robbers" of a gang were killed in a gunfight with RAB in Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila. Officials of RAB-8 said the gang, locally known as Munna Bahini, was involved in abducting fishermen and honey collectors from the Bay of Bengal and the Sundarbans for ransom. Acting on a tip-off, the RAB men raided Majherchar area around 5:30am. When the RAB team reached the area, the robbers opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the "gunfight", said Hasan Al Rajib, Company Commander of RAB-8 in Patuakhali. Three bodies were found on the spot after the "gun battle".

Name: Liton Khondokar
Location: Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila, Barguna
Description: In Barguna, three "robbers" of a gang were killed in a gunfight with RAB in Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila. Officials of RAB-8 said the gang, locally known as Munna Bahini, was involved in abducting fishermen and honey collectors from the Bay of Bengal and the Sundarbans for ransom. Acting on a tip-off, the RAB men raided Majherchar area around 5:30am. When the RAB team reached the area, the robbers opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the "gunfight", said Hasan Al Rajib, Company Commander of RAB-8 in Patuakhali. Three bodies were found on the spot after the "gun battle".

Name: Sagor Khan
Location: Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila, Barguna
Description: In Barguna, three "robbers" of a gang were killed in a gunfight with RAB in Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila. Officials of RAB-8 said the gang, locally known as Munna Bahini, was involved in abducting fishermen and honey collectors from the Bay of Bengal and the Sundarbans for ransom. Acting on a tip-off, the RAB men raided Majherchar area around 5:30am. When the RAB team reached the area, the robbers opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the "gunfight", said Hasan Al Rajib, Company Commander of RAB-8 in Patuakhali. Three bodies were found on the spot after the "gun battle".

Name: Iman Ali
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a shootout with police in Chuadanga. Ahsan Habib, Assistant superintendent of police in Chuadanga, said a police team, led by him, raided the village around 1:30am on information that some robbers were preparing to commit robbery on the highway. Sensing their presence, the robbers opened fire. Police returned fire, triggering the "gunfight". During the "gun battle", Iman was hit and he died on the spot, while others fled, the police official said.

Name: Mohammad Naim
Location: Balashpur Balurchar area in Mymensingh town
Description: A suspected snatcher was killed in an alleged incident that police claimed was a gunfight between police and suspected snatchers at Balashpur Balurchar area. The deceased, Md Naim, 22, of Krishtapur area of the town, was the prime suspect for the murder of Ananda Mohan College HSC student Ibrahim Khalil who was stabbed to death by suspected snatchers in the towns Patgudam area on January 15, police said.  Mymensingh Kotwali Police Station officer-in-charge Khandaker Saker Ahmed said a team of Detective Branch of Police, upon receiving information that a group of snatchers including Naim were staying at Balshpur, conducted a drive in the area to arrest the suspects of Ibrahim Khalil killing. Sensing the presence of police, the snatchers opened fire forcing the cops to shoot back. Naim sustained bullet injuries while his accomplices managed to flee. Police took him to the Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Julhash Mondol
Identity: A leader of outlawed Purba Banglar Communist Party Red Flag
Description: An alleged top leader of an outlawed party was killed in a "gunfight" with police in Dhalarchar area of Pabna's Bera upazila during a drive for recovering illegal firearms. Pabna Police Superintendent Jihadul Kabir said Julhas was a listed criminal and had been in hiding for some time. A team from Dhaka Metropolitan Police (DMP) had arrested Julhas in the capital's New Market area and then handed him over to Pabna police. Acting on information obtained from him, Aminpur police took Julhash along with them during a raid to recover a cache of arms in Dourir Char of Bera upazila. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, his cohorts fired shots at the police near Balaz Member intersection in Dhalar Char area around 1:00am, prompting police to retaliate and thus triggering a "gunfight". At one point of the "gunfight", Julhash's cohorts fled leaving Julhash's body behind, Sukumar Mohonto, Officer in Charge of Aminpur police station, said.

Name: Nazim Uddin Shikder
Description: Police said cardiac arrest. But the deceased family members alleged that he was tortured to death by DB Police.He subseqiently died in Jamalpur General Hospital.
Sources: 14.1.18 Jugantor and Daily Star and Manabzamin

Name: Nazrul Islam
Location: Fuldee village of Sonargaon Upazila, Narayanganj
Description: In Narayanganj, a suspected robber was killed in what police said in a "shootout" in Fuldee village of Sonargaon upazila. The deceased was Nazrul Islam, 36, of Dudkhatha village in the Upazila. A police team was patrolling Fuldee area where a local had announced through a mosque loudspeaker that 10-12 robbers inside a bush were preparing for committing a robbery, said Morshed Alam,Officer-in-Charge of Sonargaon Police Station. When the team went there around 4:00am, the criminals opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the gunfight. After the "gun battle", police found the bullet-riddled body of Nazrul on the scene, while others fled.

Name: Rinku Dewan
Description: Officer-in-Charge of Munshiganj Sadar Police Station Alamgir Hossain said acting on a tip-off, police went to Charbeherpara area to arrest Rinku around 12:00noon. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Rinku opened fire at them. Sub-Inspector Sanjay was shot in the leg. Police opened fire in retaliation and at one stage, Rinku was shot and killed. Police recovered his body and a firearm from the spot. Superintendent of Police Mohammad Jayedul Alam claimed that Rinku was a notorious criminal and involved in various offences.

Name: Mohammad Sujan
Description: An activist of AL was shot dead and 50 others, including five cops, were injuries in a clash between its two factions at Kanchan Bridge area of Rupganj. Police and locals said two AL factions  one loyal to Kayetpara union council chairman Rafiqul Islam and another loyal to local MP Gazi Golam Dastagir  took positions on a bridge at about 11:00am to inhibit BNP leaders and activists from taking to the streets and tackle any possible unrest over the verdict on a corruption case against BNP chairperson and five others. But at one stage, members of the factions locked into an altercation and start fighting. To bring the situation under control, police opened fire and shot tear gas canisters. At least six persons, including Sujon, got shot at that time. Later, the injured were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared Sujon dead at about 1:30pm, Said sub-Inspector Bacchu Miah, in-charge of DMCH police outpost.

Name: Sohorab Hossain Sourav
Description: A suspected robber was killed in what police claimed a gunfight between police and suspected robbers at Pathannagar under Chhagalnaia in Feni. Family members of the deceased, Sohorab Hossain Sourav, 30, son of Mohammad Amin of village Pathannagar under Chhagalnaia upazila, alleged that police shot Sohorab to death after picking him from their residence. Chhagalnaia Police Station Officer-in-Charge MM Morshed said they arrested Sohorab for his alleged involvement in a recent incident of robbery, which saw a Saudi expatriate was killed at Pathannagar. On the basis of his information, police said, they had conducted a raid at Pathannagar  when suspected robbers, also associates of the deceased, opened fire on police personnel sensing their presence. Police claimed it prompted the law enforcers to retaliate triggering a gunfight. He said that Sohorab received a bullet during the gunfight and police rushed him to Feni Sadar Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Nurul Islam Nura
Identity:
A suspected of killing Abul Bashar Badsha, an
alleged police source
Description: Nurul Islam Nura, a suspected of committing Merul Badda murder was killed in a reported gunfight with the polices Detective Branch (DB) near Baddas Satarkul area in Dhaka. The OC said Nura was sent to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) for treatment after he was detained. A DB team took him on a drive late at night. Upon reaching Satarkul, the DB team was allegedly fired upon by Nuras alleged associates. An allegedly stray bullet hit Nura who was taken back to DMCH, where doctors pronounced him dead.

Name: Anwar Hossain Anu
Identity: An accused of raping a fourth grader
Description: Major Ruhul Amin, Company Commander of RAB-7, said that RAB conducted an operation, acting on a tip-off, around 4:00am to arrest Anwar. After the presence of law enforcers was sensed by some criminals, a gunfight ensued between them and the RAB officials. At one stage, the criminals fled the scene. RAB recovered Anwar's bullet-hit body and took it to Chakaria Upazila Heath Complex, where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Selim
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Boro Kumira area in Chittagong. Around 3:30am, a group of six armed robbers waylaid a Laksham-bound pickup in Boro Kumira area on Dhaka-Chittagong highway, said Lt Col Miftah Uddin Ahmad, Commanding Officer of RAB-7.  The vehicle, coming from Hathazari upazila, was carrying 21 people, including children and women, and wedding gifts for a bridegroom. The criminals beat up the people and looted valuables, including gold ornaments, and cash from them. The victims informed a RAB patrol team of the matter. After a short search, the RAB personnel found the robbers under a bridge where they were distributing the looted valuables among themselves. Sensing the presence of RAB, the robbers opened fire, forcing the RAB men to retaliate.  After the gun battle, the RAB team found a bullet-hit man on the spot and the looted valuables. The others managed to flee. He was declared dead after being taken to Sitakunda Upazila Health Complex.

Name: Jabed Mia
Location: Kaitala village under Nabinagar Upazila, Brahmanbaria
Description: An alleged robber was killed in what police claimed a gunfight between his cohorts and police in Kaitala village under Nabinagar Upazila. Chittaranjan Paul, Additional Police Superintendent of Nabinagar circle said that he was arrested for involvement in a theft case. Acting on information that a cache of arms was hidden near Bhanga Bridge, a team of police took him to the spot. When we took him to Bhanga bridge of local Moheshpur road around 3:15am, his associates opened fire and tried to snatch him away from us, the police official said. As the law enforcers retaliated, a gunfight ensued and Jabed got shot by his associates. Jabed was rushed to Nabinagar Upazila Health Complex where duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila, Barguna
Description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion in Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila. The deceased were the members of notorious gang 'Hasan Bahini', Hasan Al Rajib, Wing Commander of RAB-8 was quoted as saying. The identities of the deceased could not be ascertained. When a patrol team of RAB-8 chased a trawler in the Bhaleshwar river around 6:00am the gang members took shelter in Majherchar. When the RAB members reached the spot, the robbers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila, Barguna
Description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion in Majherchar area of Patharghata Upazila. The deceased were the members of notorious gang 'Hasan Bahini', Hasan Al Rajib, Wing Commander of RAB-8 was quoted as saying. The identities of the deceased could not be ascertained. When a patrol team of RAB-8 chased a trawler in the Bhaleshwar river around 6:00am the gang members took shelter in Majherchar. When the RAB members reached the spot, the robbers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight.

Name: Abdur Rab Hawladar
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight between his cohorts and police at Patka in Sreepur upazila around 3:30am. The deceased was Abdur Rab Hawladar, 35, hailing from Goshairhat upazila in Shariatpur. Around 3:00am, a team of police was patrolling the area when the robbers shot at their vehicle. The team fired back, resulting in the gunfight, said Joynal Abedin, Assistant Sub-Inspector of Sreepur Police Station. At one stage, Abdur Rab sustained injuries after being hit by a bullet, fired by one of his cohorts, claimed police. He was declared dead at Sreepur Upazila Health Complex.  The body was sent to Gazipur Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College morgue for an autopsy.

Name: Mohammad Prince
Location:
Keramatia Government School in Munsipara area
under Rangpur city
Description: A suspected robber was killed and another hurt in a shootout with police. The deceased was Md Prince, 28, and the injured, Golap Hossain Bappi, 27, of Amubari village of Madaripur. Bappi was being treated at Rangpur Medical College Hospital. On information that a gang of robbers was preparing for a heist near Keramatia Government School in Munsipara area under Rangpur city, police raided the area, said Abdul Aziz, Inspector (Investigation) of Rangpur Sadar Police Station. Sensing their presence, the gang attacked the law enforcers and they retaliated. The other gang members fled the scene. The body was sent to Rangpur Medical College morgue for an autopsy.

Name: Rubel
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between police and a gang in Savar. The deceased was identified as Rubel, 26, from Tangail. Abul Kalam Azad, Sub-Inspector of Ashulia Police Station, said police were on the lookout for the gang since a highway robbery on the night of February 12.  DB police arrested Rubel, prime accused in the robbery case, from Kobirpur area around 9:30pm. Based on Rubel's confessional statement, a team of Ashulia Police Station and Detective Branch of Police (Dhaka north) jointly launched a drive in Ashulia's Tongabari area around 3:00am to arrest the other gang members. They took Rubel along with them. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the robbers opened fire, prompting the law enforcers to retaliate. Rubel was caught in the line of fire. The other gang members managed to flee. He was taken to Savar Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Zillur Rahman
Location: Dhaleshwari River in Alirtek area of Narayanganj Sadar
Description: In Narayanganj, alleged robbers -- Zillur Rahman, 35, and an unidentified man -- were shot dead in a gunfight with RAB on Dhaleshwari River in Alirtek area. Lt Col Kamrul Hasan, Commanding Officer of RAB-11, said the gunfight ensued when a RAB team raided the area where around eight to ten robbers were preparing to loot ships.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Dhaleshwari River in Alirtek area of Narayanganj Sadar
Description: In Narayanganj, alleged robbers -- Zillur Rahman, 35, and an unidentified man -- were shot dead in a gunfight with RAB on Dhaleshwari River in Alirtek area. Lt Col Kamrul Hasan, Commanding Officer of RAB-11, said the gunfight ensued when a RAB team raided the area where around eight to ten robbers were preparing to loot ships.

Name: Jahangir
Location:
Jampur Mirerbag area of Sonargaon
Upazila, Narayanganj
Description: Jahangir, 38, was shot dead in a gunfight with police in Jampur Mirerbag area of Sonargaon upazila. Narayanganj police said a gang of around eight robbers was preparing for robbery on a road. When police rushed to the spot, the robbers started firing bullets, ensuing the "gunfight".

Name: Sabedul Haque alias Kalu
Location:
Jangal
Salimpur area of Sitakunda Upazila, Chittagong
Description: A team of RAB, on secret information, conducted a raid at remote hilly Jungle Salimpur, Sitakunda, to recover illegal firearms and suspected robbers at about 12 noon, quotted RAB-7 Deputy Commander Ashiqur Rahman. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on RAB men, prompting them to retaliate. The RAB official said Kalu died on the spot hit by bullets during the ``gunfight and that his body had been sent to Chittagong Medical College Hospital for post mortem.

Name: Ibrahim Majhi
Location: Char Elahi under Companiganj Upazila in Noakhali
Description: A suspected robber was killed in what RAB claimed, a gunfight between suspected robbers and RAB at Char Elahi under Companiganj Upazila in Noakhali. The deceased was Ibrahim Majhi, from Sandwip upazila in Chittagong. His name was on the list of robbers prepared by the Home Ministry. Additional Superintendent of Noakhali police AKM Zahirul Haq said that a team of RAB-7 from Chittagong conducted a drive in the area and sensing the presence of the elite force, the robbers opened fire on RAB members, prompting them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight. At one stage, Ibrahim was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while others managed to flee the scene.

Name: Quazi Md Emran Hossain Saiful
Location: GM Hat area at Phulgazi in Feni
Description: Saiful was killed in police custody in what police claimed as gunfight between police and suspected robbers at GM Hat area at Phulgazi in Feni. The victims family, however, claimed that the man was picked up by police and was shot in his head and killed for enmity with some local influential people over his soil business. Phulgazi Police Station Officer-in-Charge Md Humayun Kabir said they conducted a raid at GM Hat area to arrest Saiful, but he managed to flee by attacking police when Constable Abul Khayer, 45, received serious injuries. Later at night, police lodged a case with the Phulgazi police station and arrested Saiful at his residence at night. He said police later conducted a raid at GM Hat area with Saiful and when the team reached near GM Hat Brickfield, Saifuls cohorts opened fire on police. Police also retaliated by firing when three suspected robbers, including Saiful were shot during the gunfight. All the injured people were rushed to Feni Sadar Hospital where doctors declared Saiful dead.

Name: Abdur Rashid
Description: Abdur Rashid was shot dead in a gunfight with police at Kadamtoli in Dhaka. Police demanded that he was a robber. Police conducted a raid after receiving an information and when the team reached near at Wasapur area the robbers opened fire on police. Police also retaliated by firing when Rashid was shot. Critical injured Rashid succumbed to his injuries at DMCH

Name: Badsha
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion in the capital's Gabtoli area. The gunfight took place when a RAB team signalled a truck, carrying a group of robbers, to stop around 3:30am, said RAB-10 Deputy Director Major Jamshedur Rahman. He added the elite force had put up checkpoints at several spots including Gabtoli, Mirpur-10 and Airport Road on information that a gang was heading towards Dhaka to commit a robbery. In Gabtoli, one of the RAB teams signalled a mini-truck to stop at the checkpoint, but the driver tried to speed away. When another team stationed ahead intercepted the truck, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, said Muhammed Mohiduddin Faruqe, Company Commander of RAB-10. At one stage, the robbers tried to escape without the vehicle when two of them received bullets and were left behind. Badsha was declared dead upon arrival at Dhaka Medical College Hospital, while Hanif succumbed to his injuries around 2:30pm.

Name: Hanif alias Hamid
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion in the capital's Gabtoli area. The gunfight took place when a RAB team signalled a truck, carrying a group of robbers, to stop around 3:30am, said RAB-10 Deputy Director Major Jamshedur Rahman. He added the elite force had put up checkpoints at several spots including Gabtoli, Mirpur-10 and Airport Road on information that a gang was heading towards Dhaka to commit a robbery. In Gabtoli, one of the RAB teams signalled a mini-truck to stop at the checkpoint, but the driver tried to speed away. When another team stationed ahead intercepted the truck, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, said Muhammed Mohiduddin Faruqe, Company Commander of RAB-10. At one stage, the robbers tried to escape without the vehicle when two of them received bullets and were left behind. Badsha was declared dead upon arrival at Dhaka Medical College Hospital, while Hanif succumbed to his injuries around 2:30pm.

Name: Hasan Ali
Description: A man suspected to be the key accused in the murder of Dhaka Metropolitan Polices Detective Branch Inspector Jalaluddin was killed in what police called a gunfight between DB men and suspected miscreants at Pirerbagh. The photograph of Hasan Ali, key suspect in Jalaluddin murder, matches with the man who was killed in gunfight. Metropolitan Police Detective Branch (West Division) Deputy Commissioner Mohammed Mokhlesur Rahman said, acting on a tip-off, a DB team conducted a drive at Bhanga Bridge area of Pirerbagh around 2:30am to arrest the suspects of Jalal murder and recover firearms. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, miscreants opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate by firing. An unidentified young man, aged about 25 years, was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries while the others managed to flee the scene. Later, the policemen rescued the critically injured man, took him to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Jahirul Islam
Description: Dakkhinkhan Police said that a robber was killed in 'gunfight' with police in Dibrabari. They said local people caught five robbers during robbery at a house in Mollartek area of Dakkhinkhan Police Station. Among the five robbers, police launched a drive with Jahirul Islam in Diabari area around 3:00am. Sensing the police presence, the robbers opened fire, prompting them to retaliate, leaving Jahirul bullet shot, Tapan Kumar Saha Dakkhana Police Station Officer-in-Charge claimed. The OC further demand that, after being rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, the duty doctor declared him dead at around 5am.

Name: Jakir Hossain Milon
Identity: Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dals Tejgaon unit Acting President and also the Vice-President of Chhatra Dals Dhaka Metropolitan North unit
Description: A Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal leader died in custody just six days after his arrest while he was returning from a demonstration organised by Bangladesh Nationalist Party in the capital. A prison official said that the inmate complained of "health problem" at the jail hospital in Keraniganj about 7:40am and was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where he died about 8:40am. Family said Ramna police picked Zakir Hossain, from somewhere between Press Club and Naya Paltan, and handed him over to Shahbagh Police Station. His uncle BM Waliullah said they came to know from different sources that Zakir fell ill and was taken to hospital. Dakkhinkhan police said that a robber was killed in 'gunfight' with police in Dibrabari. They said local people caught five robbers during robbery at a house in Mollartek area of Dakkhinkhan Police Station. Among the five robbers, police launched a drive with Jahirul Islam in Diabari area around 3:00am. Sensing the police presence, the robbers opened fire, prompting them to retaliate, leaving Jahirul bullet shot, Tapan Kumar Saha Dakkhana Police Station Officer-in-Charge claimed. The OC further claimed that, after being rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, the duty doctor declared him dead. The family alleged that he was tortured in custody that caused his death.

Name: Abdur Rahim
Identity: An accused of raping a girl
Location: Ulubunia of Dulahazra under Chakaria Upazila, Cox's Bazar
Description: Abdur Rahim, 20, accused of raping the girl at Chakaria upazila on March 26 was killed in a gunfight with RAB. The incident occurred in Ulubania area adjacent to Katakhali Bridge under Dulahazara union around 12:30am. Company Commander Maj Md Ruhul Amin of RAB's Cox's Bazar camp said criminals opened fire on a patrol team of the elite force. The crime busters returned the fire and drove away the criminals. The RAB team recovered bullet-hit body of Rahim from the spot.

Name: Haider Ali
Description: Mimtanur Rahman, Media Officer of RAB-7, said that acting on a tip-off, RAB conducted a raid around 12:30am to arrest miscreants. After some criminals sensed the presence of law enforcers, a gunfight ensued between them and the RAB members. At one stage, the criminals fled the scene, he said adding that they recovered Haiders bullet-hit body from the spot.

Name: Unidentified
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight between a gang of robbers and police at Thakurgaon-Dinajpur Highway Road at Dawan night. The deceased person's identity could not found. Officer-in-Charge of Thakurgaon Police said that police conducted a raid after received information about robbery. Sensing the police presence, the robbers opened fire, prompting them to retaliate, leaving one bullet shot. After being rushed to Thakurgaon Sadar Hospital, the duty doctor declared him dead.

Name: Nazrul Islam
Description: In 2 April 2018, a group of 10-12 smuggler entering Bangladesh from India with Indian Sharee. During the time, BGB members of Kakdanga camp of BGB, challenged them. Then the smuggler opened fire to them, prompting them to retaliate in self-defence, leaving one bullet shot and wounded. Local people rushed to Khulna's Gazi Clinic where he died.

Name: Uzzal Mia
Identity: The main suspect accused in stabbing a police officer
Description: The main suspect in stabbing a police officer was killed in what police claimed a gunfight between Detective Branch of Police and suspected drug traders at Saheb Kachhari area. The deceased was Uzzal Mia, 26, son of Samor Ali of Jailkhana Road area in Gouripur municipality in Mymensingh. Mymensingh district Detective Branch Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman claimed that a team of district DB, on secret information, conducted a drive at Saheb Kachhari area at about 2:00am to arrest Uzzal. He said Uzzwal and his cohorts, sensing the police presence, opened fire on the law enforcers prompting them to retaliate by firing. The police officer said when the gunfight was over, they found seriously injured Uzzal and rushed him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Abdul Kuddus alias Sagar
Identity: Regional leader of Purbo Banglar Communist Party's Lal Pataka faction
Description: An outlawed party leader was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Kushtia's Kumarkhali upazila. The dead, Abdul Kuddus alias Sagar, 47, of Urakandi village in Rajbari Sadar upazila, was the regional leader of Purbo Banglar Communist Party's Lal Pataka faction. A RAB team cordoned off the spot around 3:30am and asked the criminals to surrender. Instead of complying, the criminals opened fire, the RAB official said. The RAB members then returned fire, triggering the gunfight. After an hour- long battle, the criminals fled and the RAB team found a body on the spot.

Name: Rakib Howlader
Location: Toyenbee Circular Road at Wari in Dhaka
Description: A 15-year-old film actor was killed in an alleged gunfight between mugging suspects and police on Toyenbee Circular Road at Wari in Dhaka. The family, however, alleged that the boy, Rakib Howlader, a school dropout who played the role of a child character in a movie was picked up on April 4 and killed in custody. Wari Police Station Officer-in-Charge Rafiqul Islam, however, claimed that Rakib was 22-year-old and was the prime suspect in killing of Daffodil University student Khandaker Abu Talha in October 2017. Police officials said that he was earlier arrested on October 10, 2017 just two days after the killing of Talha. Wari police station sub-inspector Shah Alam claimed that a group of eight or nine suspected muggers opened fire on a police patrol team behind Bangladesh Homeopathic Medical College Hospital at about 3:20am. Police also retaliated by firing triggering a gunfight. After the gunfight the police found bullet-hit Rakib. He was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Al Amin alias Babu
Identity: An accused of raping a girl
Description: The main accused in a case filed for raping an eight-year-old girl was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Jessore town. Major Ziaur Rahman, Commander of RAB-6 in Jessore, said around 3:45am, a RAB team raided Kholadanga Mandalgati area on information that some criminals were holding a secret meeting there. Sensing the RAB members' presence, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members then returned fire, triggering the gunfight. After the gun battle, RAB members found bullet-hit Al Amin lying on the spot. He was rushed to Jessore Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Zamshed Ali
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a gunfight with police. The deceased was identified as Zamshed Ali, 43, son of Osman Ali of Kosba village in the upazila. Harendranath Sarker, Officer-in-Charge of Gangni Police Station, said they raided a banana orchard at Hemayetpur village on information that robbers were holding a secret meeting there to rob vehicles on Hemayetpur-Amtola road. The police team cordoned off the orchard around 3:30am, asked the alleged criminals to surrender and came under fire. The team retaliated, forcing the criminals to flee the scene after an hour-long gunfight. The law enforcers claimed to have found bullet-hit Zamshed on the spot. They took him to Gangni Upazila Health Complex where on duty doctor Ali Reza declared him dead.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Dhaka-Aricha Highway at Keliya, Dhamrai, Dhaka
Description: Three people were killed on Dhaka-Aricha Highway at Keliya about 4:30pm in an exchange of bullets with RAB, police said. The identities of the three could not be known. The Battalion-2 Second in Command Major Mohammad Ali said based on information they launched a drive in the area as some highway robbers were planning to commit robbery in Keliya area. Sensing presence of the battalion members, the robbers fired gunshots on them forcing them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the gang members fled the scene and three bodies were found lying in the area.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Dhaka-Aricha Highway at Keliya, Dhamrai, Dhaka
Description: Three people were killed on Dhaka-Aricha Highway at Keliya about 4:30pm in an exchange of bullets with RAB, police said. The identities of the three could not be known. The Battalion-2 Second in Command Major Mohammad Ali said based on information they launched a drive in the area as some highway robbers were planning to commit robbery in Keliya area. Sensing presence of the battalion members, the robbers fired gunshots on them forcing them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the gang members fled the scene and three bodies were found lying in the area.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Dhaka-Aricha Highway at Keliya, Dhamrai, Dhaka
Description: Three people were killed on Dhaka-Aricha Highway at Keliya about 4:30pm in an exchange of bullets with RAB, police said. The identities of the three could not be known. The Battalion-2 Second in Command Major Mohammad Ali said based on information they launched a drive in the area as some highway robbers were planning to commit robbery in Keliya area. Sensing presence of the battalion members, the robbers fired gunshots on them forcing them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the gang members fled the scene and three bodies were found lying in the area.

Name: Saidul
Identity: Regional commander of Maubadi Bolshevik Organisation Movement (MBRM)
Location: Jakura Balurghat at Sadar upazila, Rajbari
Description: A suspected member of an underground party was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and police at Jakura Balurghat at Sadar upazila in the district. Rajbari Police Superintendent Asma Siddiqa Mili in a press briefing said that the law enforcers conducted a drive when the underground operatives were holding a meeting at Jakura Balurghat around 2:30am. Sensing presence of police, they fired gunshot on them forcing police to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, Saidul sustained bullet wounds while his cohorts fled the scene. Later, police took Saidul to hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Khokan Sutradhar
Description: A man was killed in gunfight with police at Akhaura hours after his arrest. Khokon Sutrdhar was the son of Ramesh Sutradhar, resident of Singarbil of Bijoynagar upazila in the district. Local people caught him when he was trying to snatch money from one Makib Deb, a Manager of a tobacco company distributor at Lalbazar road. Locals caught him and handed him over to police. His brother Makhon Sutradhar alleged it was murder. Akhaura Police Station Officer-in-Charge Mosharaf Hossain said the police conducted a raid taking Khokan with them to arrest his associates. Around 2:45am, when police reached near Akhaura Titas Bridge, Khokans associates opened fire, forcing police to retaliate in self-defence. Khokan was injured from a bullet from his friends, the police officer claimed. Later, police claimed, they took him to Akhaura Health Complex where the doctor declared him dead.

Name: Krishnapod Das
Description: A farmer allegedly been killed at police custody in Bhola. The deceased name was Krishnapod Das. Police said he was died due to cardiac arrest. The deceased wife Chatur Rani and son Sujan Das told Jony (Roni), son of UP member Monzu Matobbar, handed Krishnapod to police. Police tortured him in the custoday. After deteriorating his condition, police took him to the hospital, where duty doctor declared him died.

Name: Babul Hossain
Location: Raipur area of Daudkandi in Comilla
Description: A suspected robber was killed in police custody in a reported gunfight between police and suspected robbers in Raipur area. The deceased, Babul Hossain, 35, son of Iman Ali of Purcherchar area under Madhabdi upazila in Narsingdi district. Daudkandi Police Station Officer-in-Charge Mizanur Rahman said police arrested two  Babul and Maruf Hossain Lablu of Shibchar in Madaripur  from Uttara area in Dhaka in a case of hijacking a covered van lodged with his police station on April 11 and recovered the booty from Dhaka as per their information. They were brought to Daudkandi Police Station and a team of police went to Raipur area on Dhaka-Chittagong highway to catch the cohorts of Babul and Maruf. As the team reached Raipur at about 3:00am, the detainees cohorts, sensing police presence, opened fire on police and tried to snatch the detainees. Police retaliated by firing on the suspects.  The OC claimed that as the gunfight was over, they found critically injured Babul and took him to Comilla Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Abdul Halim
Description: Abdul Halim, a suspected robber, was killed in DB Police at Kongshonagar area. Police said based on information they launched a drive in the area as some robbers were planning to commit robbery in Comilla-Sylhet Highway Road. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the robbers fired gunshots and threw brick bats on them forcing them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the gang members fled the scene and one body was found found lying in the area and two robbers were detained. They took him to Comilla Medical College Hospital where on duty doctor declared him dead.

Name: Abdur Razzaq
Identity: An accused of murdering an autorickshaw driver
Location: Gudaria area of Phulpur Upazila in Mymensingh
Description: A man accused of murdering an autorickshaw driver was killed in a gunfight with police in Gudaria area. According to AKM Mahbub Alam, Officer-in-Charge of Phulpur Police Station, Razzaq is an accused in the auto-rickshaw driver Alim Uddin murder case filed with the police station. A team of DB police led by its Officer-in-Charge Md Ashiqur Rahman raided Gudaria area on Mymensingh- Sherpur road to arrest Razzaq around 4:30am. Sensing police presence, the accused and his cohorts fired several gun shots at the police team prompting the police to shoot back. Razzaq was hit in the chest during the exchange. He was rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where he succumbed to his injuries.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Amberia area near Shala river, Sharakhola, Bagerhat
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Amberia area. The identity of the deceased could not be known but locals confirmed that he was a member of Sattar Bahini, said RAB-8 Patuakhali Company Commander Additional Superintendent of Police Surat Ali. Seeing a patrol team of RAB-8, a gang of robbers opened fire, triggering a gunfight. Later, a bullet-hit body was found in the area.

Name: Abdul Hakim Mintu
Identity: An accused in a child rape
Description: Abdul Hakim Mintu, an accused in a child rape case was killed in a gunfight with RAB-7 at Banshkhali. The gunfight took place at a border line area between Banshkhali and Pekuya thana area when a team of RAB went there to arrest the alleged rapist, said Deputy Director of RAB-7 Lt Com Ashequr Rahman. On receiving a tip off, a team of RAB carried out a raid to arrest Mintu. Mintu and his associates opened fire at the RAB personnel and RAB also shot back in retaliation. The bullet-riddled body of Mintu was recovered from Toitong area under Pekuya union after the gunfight ended. Mintu was rushed to the Pekuya Health Complex where the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Atikul Islam Atik
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with RAB in Kuicchagara area. Sources said a gang of highway robbers put up a barricade on Kuicchagara-Argara road around 12:15 am to rob vehicles when a regular patrol team of RAB-5 from Chapainawabganj camp arrived on the scene. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the gang opened fire on the RAB team, who also retaliated, after some time, the gang retreated, leaving behind two bullet hit members. The RAB took them to Gomostapur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Rajib
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with RAB in Kuicchagara area. Sources said a gang of highway robbers put up a barricade on Kuicchagara-Argara road around 12:15 am to rob vehicles when a regular patrol team of RAB-5 from Chapainawabganj camp arrived on the scene. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the gang opened fire on the RAB team, who also retaliated, after some time, the gang retreated, leaving behind two bullet hit members. The RAB took them to Gomostapur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Al Amin
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police in Muradnagar. Manzur Alam, Officer-in-Charge of Muradnagar Police Station, said that on information that robbers had taken position along the road, a team led by Additional Superintendents of Police Shakhawat Hossain (North) and Mohammad Jahangir Alam (Muradnagar circle) raided Shushunda area on Eliotganj-Muradnagar road around 1:30am. Sensing the presence of police, the gang opened fire on them. The police also returned fire, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, the robbers left the spot, leaving wounded Al Amin behind. He was pronounced dead upon arrival at Comilla Medical College Hospital.

Name: Sohag Hossain
Identity: An accused in a child rape
Description: An alleged rapist has been killed in a gunfight with police at Kolaroa. Officer-In-Charge of Kolaroa Police Station Biplob Kumar Nath said Sohag raped a nine year old student of a primary school in Keragacchi union. The victim's maternal grandmother filed a case against Sohag with the police station. On the basis of the information, a police team, led by Sub-Inspector Solaiman, went to the area to arrest Sohag. When police were passing by Hizoldi field, some miscreants shot at police and also hurled brickbats at them. Police fired back in retaliation. After exchange of gun shots for about 20 minutes, the criminals fled. One person was found bullet hit and lying on the spot. Police rushed him to Kolaroa Health Complex, where the on-duty emergency doctor declared him dead.

Name: Saiful Islam Arif
Description: A suspected drug trader was killed in gunfight with police at Char Haydrabad. Munshiganj Police Station Officer-in-Charge Md Alamgir Hossain said they arrested Saiful in possession with 110 pieces of contraband yaba tablets. He said that they extracted information from Saiful about illegal drugs and at about 1:30am, a team of police along with Saiful went to recover the drugs. The OC said that when the team reached the Char Haydrabad area, Saifuls accomplices opened fire on police. As Saiful tried to run away he got shot. The police rushed bullet-hit Saiful to Munshiganj General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Nurul Alam alias Nuru
Description: The Chandraganj Police Station Inspector (Investigation) Md Zafar Ahmed, reported that Nuru was killed in a gunfight with police at Chandraganj Ganipur. He claimed that a team of police, on secret information that a group of robbers gathered at Ganipur area for committing robbery, conducted a drive in the area at about 3:30am. Sensing the presence of police, the robbers opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate triggering a gunfight. At one stage of the gunfight, Nuru received bullets and died on the spot.

Name: Raihan Sardar
Location: Bagha-Charghat road at Hajirdhalan area under Charghat, Rajshahi
Description: Raihan was killed in a gunfight between a team of RAB-5 and suspected robbers by the side of Bagha-Charghat road at Hajirdhalan area. RAB-5 Deputy Commander AM Ashraful Islam claimed that a patrol team of RAB-5, while patrolling at Charghat came to know that a group of robbers had gathered at Hajirdhalan area at about 12:30am and conducted a raid there. He claimed that when the RAB-5 patrol team reached near Hajirdhalan area, the suspected robbers opened fire on them and RAB also retaliated by firing. As the gunfight was over and the suspected robbers fled the scene, they searched the area and found bullet-hit Raihan and rushed him to Charghat Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctors declared him dead. Victims wife Beauty Begum said that her husband left the house and did not return home while the people of Hazir Dhalan Beel area said that they did not hear any fighting in the area at night.

Name: Abdus Salam
Description: A suspected criminal was killed in a gunfight with DB police in Mymensingh town, barely half an hour after his arrest.  A team of Detective Branch (DB) of police arrested Salam with 50 yaba pills in Rally Mour area of the town around 1:45am, said Md Ashikur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of DB, Mymensingh, who led the drive. The shooting incident took place around 2:15am when the DB team took Salam along and went to Mymensingh town's Alia Madrasa Road area to arrest Siraj Uddin, an alleged drug trader. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, Siraj and his cohorts opened fire at the DB police, forcing police to retaliate, triggering the "gunfight". Salam was hit by a bullet on his chest. The critically injured Salam was rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH) where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Nabab Ali Mollah
Location: Abaderhat area under Agordari union of sadar upazila in Satkhira
Description: An alleged criminal was killed in a gunfight with police in Abaderhat area. The deceased was identified as Nabab Ali Mollah. Satkhira Sadar Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Maruf Ahmed, said Patkelghata police arrested fugitive Nabab Ali from Patkelghata. He was handed over to Satkhira Police Station as he was accused in several cases with them. During interrogation Nabab Ali confessed the possession of arms. A police team took Ali along to Abaderhat area around 4:00am. About 200 yards from the spot, members of Ali's gang started shooting at the police team from an abandoned house trigerring a gunfight. The injured were taken to Satkhira Sadar Hospital where doctors at emergency department declared Nabab Ali dead.

Name: Mohammad Ashraful Mia alias Aslam
Identity: A suspect in the abduction of a youth
Description: Aslam picked up by the DB (west) of the DMP for interrogation died at DMCH. Aslam, of Gazipur was a suspect in the abduction of a youth of Shah Ali area of Dhaka, police officials said. DB Inspector Md Mahbub, who brought Aslam to the hospital, said that he brought Aslam to Rajarbagh Police Lines Hospital from where he was sent to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital at about 10:30am and the doctors advised some laboratory tests. He said that he heard that doctors declared Aslam dead at about 5:45pm, when he returned after getting the tests done. Metropolitan police Additional Commissioner (Detective Branch) Devdas Bhattacharya said that a team of DB police picked up Aslam in an abduction case and he complained pain in the abdomen and he fell sick on the way to Detective Branch office.

Name: Altab Hossain
Description: An alleged mugger was killed in a gunfight with police in Daulatpur upazila. The deceased was Altab Hossain, son of Golam Mostofa of Boalia in the upazila, said Sabbirul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Detective Branch (DB) of police in Kushtia.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Dakatir Khal area under Sharankhola range of Sunderban East Division
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight between a gang of forest robbers and RAB in Dakatir Khal area. The identity of the deceased could not be known. RAB-8 Deputy Commending Officer said a RAB patrol team was patrolling in the area at about 6:30am when a suspected forest robber gang opened fire targeting RAB men and RAB also retaliated by firing. The gunfight continued for about half an hour and the suspected robbers fled away. Later, the RAB team searched the area and found the body of a 25-year old suspected forest robber whom fishermen identified as a member of the "Gariber Bandhu robber gang".

Name: Lelin
Description: In Dhaka, an alleged criminal identified as Lelin, 35, of Shreenagar upazila in Munshiganj, was killed in a gunfight with detectives in Khilgaon Nandipara area, Deputy Commissioner (Media) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police Masudur Rahman said. Rahman said police conducted a drive in the area around 3:15am after receiving information that a gang of criminals had gathered there to commit a crime. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the gang opened fire on police, prompting them to retaliate. Lelin got injured during the gunfight, while his accomplices managed to escape. He was declared dead after police took him to Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

Name: Raju Prodhan
Location: 300 feet road area in Rupganj, Narayanganj
Description: Maj Manjur Mahede, a Company Commander of RAB-1, said a RAB team went to 300 feet road area in Rupganj area after receiving information that a gang of muggers had gathered there. Sensing the presence of the RAB team, the muggers opened fire. The RAB team retaliated for self defence. After the fire exchange stopped, RAB informed local police who took Raju to Rupnagar Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Shafayat Tamrin alias Tanveer
Description: One of the three persons detained following the murder of a Jubo League activist in Badda was killed in a shootout between DB police and criminals in the capital's Aftabnagar area. At around 9:30pm, Shafayat along with two aides allegedly entered Badda Jagoroni Club premises and shot dead Abdur Razzak alias Babu, 30, the owner of cable TV service provider Max Cable, and an activist of Badda Jubo League. The two accomplicesOvi and Helalescaped arrest after mingling with the general public on that night, said Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner (North Division) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police. Mashiur said the gunfight that left Shafayat dead took place around 4:00am in Aftabnagar when a team of the Detective Branch took him along on a drive to arrest the other killers including Ovi and Helal. He said the criminals opened fire on DB officials, and they retaliated. As Shafayat tried to flee, he got injured with a bullet during the gunfight. Doctors declared him dead after police took him to Dhaka Medical College Hospital.

Name: Mirajul Islam alias Mira Mondol
Identity: A leader of outlawed Purba Banglar Communist Party Red Flag faction
Location: Gobindohuda village in Damurhuda upazila of Chuadanga
Description: Mirajul Islam, a leader of outlawed PBCP Red Flag faction, was killed in a 'gunfight' with police at Gobindohuda village in Damurhuda upazila. Akram Hossain, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Damurhuda Police Station said that a team from the police station arrested Mirajul with a firearm at his village home. Following information obtained from him, police took him with them in a raid to recover a cache of arms at a hideout of Gobindohuda of the upazila. His cohorts fired at the police near Gobindohuda Eidgah ground around 2:00am, prompting police to retaliate. At one stage of the gunfight, Mirajul's cohorts fled, leaving his body behind.

Name: Mohammad Alamgir Hossain
Description: An officer of Mymensingh district Detective Branch of Police said that they arrested Alamgir, the prime accused in the case of February 2 murder of Abul Kashem at Jaybanglabazar under Sadar upazila, from Gopalganj area of Mymensingh town. Later, he claimed, they conducted a raid at Jaybanglabazar at about 3:00 am when Alamgirs cohorts threw brickbats and opened fire on police, prompting police to retaliate by firing. Alamgir received bullets when he had been trying to flee the scene. DB police took Alamgir to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Sirejul Islam
Description: Kotwali Police Station Inspector (Investigation) Khondor Shaker Ahmed said they arrested Sirajul, accused in the case of mugging and hacking a school teacher. Later police raided SA Sarkar Road to nab his cohorts. But sensing the presence of police, Sirajuls cohorts opened fire on police and police also fired back. Sirajul was caught in the line of fire and was rushed to MMCH where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Zakair Sana
Description: Two suspected robbers in the Sunderbans were arrested after a gunfight between suspected robbers and Coast Guard west zone members at Kalabagi canal. A team of Coast Guards West Zone at Mongla launched a special drive in the Sunderbans. When the team entered Kalabagi canal, robbers of Asaful Bahini opened fire on the raiding team and the Coast Guard men also retaliated by firing. Coast Guard official claimed that they arrested Tajel and Zakir from the area when the gang had been trying to flee the area.

Name: Tajel Gazi
Description: Two suspected robbers in the Sunderbans were arrested after a gunfight between suspected robbers and Coast Guard west zone members at Kalabagi canal. A team of Coast Guards West Zone at Mongla launched a special drive in the Sunderbans. When the team entered Kalabagi canal, robbers of Asaful Bahini opened fire on the raiding team and the Coast Guard men also retaliated by firing. Coast Guard official claimed that they arrested Tajel and Zakir from the area when the gang had been trying to flee the area.

Name: Hamidul Islam
Description: In Kushtia, alleged criminal Hamidul Islam, 47, was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Milpara area of town, Mohaiminur Rashid, Commander of RAB-12 said that he was the top leader of Hamidul-Rashul Bahini and wanted by Kushtia police. Mohaiminur said a RAB team raided the Milpara area around 4:00am on information that a group of drug dealers were holding a meeting there. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire forcing them to retaliate, which resulted in a gun battle. At one stage, the suspects fled the scene. RAB found a body. It was later identified as Hamidul.

Name: Rikhon Hossain
Description: Rikhon Hossain, 36, of Meherpur was killed in a gunfight in Narayanganj. Lt Col Kamrul Hasan, Commanding Officer of RAB-11, said around 4:30am following a tip-off, RAB set up two checkpoints at Siddhirganj on Dhaka-Chittagong highway to seize a consignment of yaba pills arriving from Chittagong on a truck. As RAB intercepted the truck, three people got out of the truck and one started firing at RAB. RAB retaliated, resulting in a gunfight that lasted for seven minutes. Rikhon was found injured. He was taken to Narayanganj General Hospital where he was declared dead.

Name: Musa Alam Masud
Description: Daganbhuiyan Police Station Officer-in-Charge Abul Kalam Azad said that they arrested Musa and interrogated him. Later, based on information extracted from him, police raided Khushipur area under Daganbhuiyan in Feni along with Musa at about 2:00am to arrest Musas accomplices and to seize illegal firearms. As they turned up in the spot, Musas accomplices opened fire on the law-enforcers and Musa was shot. As the gunfight ended and his accomplices fled away, Musa was rushed to Daganbhuiyan Upazila Health complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Azizul Islam
Description: The district Detective Branch Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman said that a 29-year-old suspected robber was killed in a gunfight between DB police and robbers on a road in front of Baroihati Battala Araj Ali High School under Gaforgaon in the district at about 3:00am. The OC said the DB police raided the area on information that the robbers were robbing vehicles and passers-by by felling tree logs on the road.

Name: Parvez
Description: Md Shahjalal, Inspector (Investigation) of Fatullah Police Station, said that hearing the news that two gangs of muggers were exchanging bullets in Dapa Al-Amin Nagar area around 2:30am, a team rushed there to intervene. Both the gangs opened fire on the police, who also retaliated. When the gangs retreated, Parvez was found with bullet injuries and was later declared dead at Narayanganj General Hospital.

Name: Habibur Rahman
Identity: Vegetable trader and alleged drug dealer
Description: Two people were killed in a gunfight between alleged drug dealers and Rapid Action Battalion personnel in Chittagong city's Barishal Colony around 11:40pm. Deputy Director Ashequr Rahman of RAB-7 said that when RAB started a drive in the colony under Sadarghat Police Station following a tip-off, the gunfight ensued. After the gunfight, RAB found two bullet-riddled bodies on the spot, said RAB-7's Media Wing Senior Assistant Director Mimtanur Rahman.
Sources: 18.5.18 Daily Star; https://www.thedailystar.net/backpage/2-killed-shootout-rab-ctg-1578136 and 19.5.18 Newage and Daily Observer 20.5.18; http://observerbd.com/details.php?id=138675

Name: Mohammad Mosharaf
Identity: Vegetable trader and alleged drug dealer
Description: Two people were killed in a gunfight between alleged drug dealers and Rapid Action Battalion personnel in Chittagong city's Barishal Colony around 11:40pm. Deputy Director Ashequr Rahman of RAB-7 said that when RAB started a drive in the colony under Sadarghat Police Station following a tip-off, the gunfight ensued. After the gunfight, RAB found two bullet-riddled bodies on the spot, said RAB-7's Media Wing Senior Assistant Director Mimtanur Rahman.
Sources: 18.5.18 Daily Star; https://www.thedailystar.net/backpage/2-killed-shootout-rab-ctg-1578136 and 19.5.18 Newage and Daily Observer 20.5.18; http://observerbd.com/details.php?id=138675

Name: Abul Hasan
Location: Purba Noboganga area, Kashiadanga Thana, Rajshahi city
Description: Abul Hasan was killed in a gunfight between alleged drug dealers and RAB in Purba Noboganga area. Deputy Captain of RAB-5 SM Ashraful Islam said that RAB drove at Purba Noboganga area after received a secret information that a consignment of phensedyl arriving from India. Sensing their presence the criminals opened fire and RAB also retaliated by firing. After the gunfight, RAB found one bullet-riddled body on the spot. Abul Hasan was rushed to the Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Abdul Alim
Description: A suspected drug dealer was killed in a gunfight with RAB at Tantipara ghat in Shibganj. Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB-5 from Chapainawabganj camp went to Tantipara ghat area for an anti-drug drive around 1:50am, said Abul Khayer, an official of the RAB camp. Sensing presence of RAB personnel, the criminals opened fire. RAB members returned fire, triggering the gunfight. After the gun battle, the RAB men found Alim bullet-wounded. He was taken to Chapainawabganj Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead. However, Alim's wife Motiara Khatun said that RAB members picked up her husband from a tea stall at Ghora Stand of Sadar upazila. Motiara said she came to know it from locals and found her husband's body at the hospital morgue. Contacted, the RAB official denied the allegation of picking up Alim.

Name: Habibur Rahman Sheikh
Location: Bagdah Madhyapara under Abhaynagar Upazila, Jashore
Description: Habibur, Abdul Kalam and Milon were killed in a reported gunfight with RAB-6 at Bagdah Madhyapara under Abhaynagar upazila on Nawapara-Paira Road at about 2:45am. RAB-6 Company Commander Lieutenant Commander Jahid said that a battalion patrol team stopped a motorcycle-rider at the place at about 2:30am and after sometimes another Nawapara-bound motorcycle started firing to the battalion personnel as they saw the searching of the biker from 20-30 metres back. In response, the battalion personnel fired back and found the three wounded as the gunfight was over. They rushed the wounded to Abhaynagar Upazila Health Complex where the attending doctor declared them dead. Ibrahim Sheikh, elder brother of Habibur,said that his brother and two other victims were picked up by plainclothes men from their respective houses.

Name: Abdul Kalam
Location: Bagdah Madhyapara under Abhaynagar Upazila, Jashore
Description: Habibur, Abdul Kalam and Milon were killed in a reported gunfight with RAB-6 at Bagdah Madhyapara under Abhaynagar upazila on Nawapara-Paira Road at about 2:45am. RAB-6 Company Commander Lieutenant Commander Jahid said that a battalion patrol team stopped a motorcycle-rider at the place at about 2:30am and after sometimes another Nawapara-bound motorcycle started firing to the battalion personnel as they saw the searching of the biker from 20-30 metres back. In response, the battalion personnel fired back and found the three wounded as the gunfight was over. They rushed the wounded to Abhaynagar Upazila Health Complex where the attending doctor declared them dead. Ibrahim Sheikh, elder brother of Habibur,said that his brother and two other victims were picked up by plainclothes men from their respective houses.

Name: Milon Kashari
Location: Bagdah Madhyapara under Abhaynagar Upazila, Jashore
Description: Habibur, Abdul Kalam and Milon were killed in a reported gunfight with RAB-6 at Bagdah Madhyapara under Abhaynagar upazila on Nawapara-Paira Road at about 2:45am. RAB-6 Company Commander Lieutenant Commander Jahid said that a battalion patrol team stopped a motorcycle-rider at the place at about 2:30am and after sometimes another Nawapara-bound motorcycle started firing to the battalion personnel as they saw the searching of the biker from 20-30 metres back. In response, the battalion personnel fired back and found the three wounded as the gunfight was over. They rushed the wounded to Abhaynagar Upazila Health Complex where the attending doctor declared them dead. Ibrahim Sheikh, elder brother of Habibur,said that his brother and two other victims were picked up by plainclothes men from their respective houses.

Name: Mohammad Emon
Identity: The prime accused of a murder case
Description: The district Detective Branch of Police Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman said that Emon arrested for killing of auto-rickshaw driver Md Rana, 15, at Nandail, was killed in a gunfight between DB police and crime suspects at about 2:30am. Ashiqur said that they went to the area with Emon to arrest his cohorts and the gunfight occurred when Emons cohorts opened fire on them and they retaliated by firing. Emon received bullet injury as he tried to flee the scene, he said, adding that they rushed him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Abul Quasem
Description: Abul Quasem of Shripur village at Mehendiganj upazila in the district was killed in a gunfight with the Detective Branch of Barisal Metropolitan Police at village Charaicha under Barisal sadar upazila. Metropolitan police Assistant Commissioner (Detective Branch) Nasiruddin Mallick said that a DB patrol team challenged a suspected gathering at Bottola of Charachia at about 2:40am, when the robbery suspects opened fire on police and police also retaliated by firing triggering the gunfight.

Name: Dalim Hossain
Description: A suspected drug dealer Dalim Hossain, 35, of Jessore Railgate Pashchimpara of the district town, was killed in a gunfight on Jessore-Chhutipur Road at Sujalpur, on the outskirts of Jessore town, at about 4:00am. Kotwali Police Station Officer-in-Charge AKM Azmal Huda said that Dalim was declared dead by the attending doctor at Jessore General Hospital after he was rushed there.

Name: Alamgir Hossain
Description: Alamgir Hossain, 33, of Paschim Pathangar village under Chhagalnaiya upazila,  was killed in a reported gunfight with police at Pathangar of Chhagalnaiya. The gunfight occurred as drug peddlers opened fire on police and police retaliated by firing when they raided a den of drugs at Pathangarh village, said Chhagalnaiya Police Station Officer-in-Charge MM Murshed.

Name: Raziul Hasan Biplap
Description: A suspected drugs dealer Raziul Hasan Biplap, 45, of the district town was killed in a gunfight with DB policde at Mashkanda Gonshar Mor of the divisional town. District Detective Branch of Police officer Ashikur Rahman said that the gunfight occurred when a DB team raided the area at about 2:00am.

Name: Mohammad Emon
Location: Pustakamuri village under Mirzapur upazila, Tangail
Description: A mugging suspect Md Emon, 22, of Pustakamuri village under Mirzapur upazila was killed in a gunfight with police on Mirzapur-Balia road at Pustokamuri Dakkhinpara Bridge point under the upazila. Mirzapur Police Station Officer-in-Charge AKM Mizanul Haq said that the gunfight occurred when they, being tipped off that a group of muggers was mugging halting buses on the road, raided the area at about 2:00am.

Name: Babu
Description: A suspected drugs trader Babu, 45, of Teghora Narayanpur village of Biral upazila in Dinajpur, was killed in a reported gunfight with police at Sardarpara of Biral upazila, said Biral Police Station Officer-in-Charge Abdul Majid. Al Amin, son of Babu said that his father was picked up by DB police but Additional Police Super Mahfuz Zaman Ashraf denied his allegation.

Name: Momtazur Rahman Munna
Location: Kholadanga and Mandalgati villages and at Taraf Nawapara, both under Kotwali police station, in Jashore
Description: Three former drug peddlers were killed in gunfights at a place between Kholadanga and Mandalgati villages and at Taraf Nawapara, both under Kotwali police station, in Jessore. The police claimed that the three were killed in gunfights between gang members of drug peddlers although the families alleged that they were once involved in drug peddling and turned into innocents. Momtazurs brother Sohrab Hossain said that his brother was picked up and the body was found later. Sirajuls son Ripon Hossain said that his father was an innocent farmer and law enforcers picked him up. The families and local people said that the three had given up drug peddling and were leading normal life.

Name: Sirajul Islam Dukhey
Location: Kholadanga and Mandalgati villages and at Taraf Nawapara, both under Kotwali police station, in Jashore
Description: Three former drug peddlers were killed in gunfights at a place between Kholadanga and Mandalgati villages and at Taraf Nawapara, both under Kotwali police station, in Jessore. The police claimed that the three were killed in gunfights between gang members of drug peddlers although the families alleged that they were once involved in drug peddling and turned into innocents. Momtazurs brother Sohrab Hossain said that his brother was picked up and the body was found later. Sirajuls son Ripon Hossain said that his father was an innocent farmer and law enforcers picked him up. The families and local people said that the three had given up drug peddling and were leading normal life.

Name: Shafiqul Islam Shafi
Location: Kholadanga and Mandalgati villages and at Taraf Nawapara, both under Kotwali police station, in Jashore
Description: Three former drug peddlers were killed in gunfights at a place between Kholadanga and Mandalgati villages and at Taraf Nawapara, both under Kotwali police station, in Jessore. The police claimed that the three were killed in gunfights between gang members of drug peddlers although the families alleged that they were once involved in drug peddling and turned into innocents. Momtazurs brother Sohrab Hossain said that his brother was picked up and the body was found later. Sirajuls son Ripon Hossain said that his father was an innocent farmer and law enforcers picked him up. The families and local people said that the three had given up drug peddling and were leading normal life.

Name: Sabdul Mondol
Location: Narendrapur under Kaliganj upazila in Jhenaidah
