Description: Sabdul Mondol, 42, son of Mohammad Ali Mondol of Narendrapur village was killed in a 'gunfihgt' with RAB. Golam Morshed, Company Commander of RAB-6, said that the gunfight that left Sabdul dead ensued when RAB team was signalled to stop a motorcycle on information that a consignment of drug would pass through the area around 1:30am. Abdul Mannan, a neighbour, however, said some plainclothes men picked up Sabdul around 5:00pm when he and Sabdul were working in their crop fields.

Name: Liakat Ali Mondol
Description: The man who was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Puthia of Rajshahi was identified as Liakat Ali Mondol, 45, son of freedom fighter Zakkar Ali Mondol, of Namajgram village in the upazila. The incident took place after a RAB team went to a mango orchard at Jamira village for an anti-drug drive. Liakat's daughter Sharmin Akhter Hashi said that her father had been missing since Sunday afternoon when two persons, Feroz and Momin, who identified themselves as RAB members, took him away from home. Liakat's wife Neher Banu said he was earlier engaged in drug trade but quit it early this year and started raising cattle. She filed a general diary with Puthia Police Station stating that he went missing.

Name: Abul Kalam Azad
Description: In the Deulabari area of Tangail, when a suspected drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with members of the RAB at around 12:30am. Tangail RAB-12, CPC-3 Company Commander Rabiul Islam said that "acting on a tip-off, we went to the area to arrest the drug traders (but) sensing our presence, they opened fire at us. In retaliation, the elite force members fired back, fatally injuring Abul Kalam Azad, 45, of east Pakutia area. The other suspects managed to flee the scene, but Azad was taken to Tangail General Hospital, where he was pronounced dead.

Name: Iman Ali
Location: Ghorashal toll plaza under Palash upazila in Narsingdi
Description: In Narsingdi, wanted drug peddler Iman Ali of Kauriapara of the district town, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB at Ghorashal toll plaza under Palash upazila in Narsingdi at about 4:00am, said RAB-11 Company Commander Jasim Uddin.

Name: Jonab Ali
Location: Uthli village under Jibonnagar upazila, Chuadanga
Description: In Chuadanga, suspected drug peddler Jonab Ali, 32, of Uthali village under Jibannagar upazila was killed in a gunfight with police at about 12:45am, said Jibannagar Police Station Officer-in-Charge Mahmud Hossain.

Name: Rezaul Islam alias Rony
Description: In Tongi, Gazipur, suspected drug trader Rezaul Islam alias Rony was killed in a reported gunfight with police at around 3:00am. Kamal Hossain, Officer-in-Charge of Tongi Model Police Station, said a team of police were conducting a drive in the area following a tip-off. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the drug traders opened fire on us, forcing us to retaliate, triggering the gunfight. Rony was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot. He was picked up by DB police around 2:00am on Saturday.

Name: Sharif
Location: Bibir Bazar under Cumilla Sadar Upazila
Description: Kotwali Police Station Officer-in-Charge Mohammad Abu Salam Mia said that suspected drug traders Sharif, 26, of village Moheshpur and Peer Ali, 28, of village Shuvapur under Sadar upazila were killed in a gunfight with police at Bibir Bazar under Sadar upazila around 1:30am on Tuesday.

Name: Peer Ali
Location: Bibir Bazar under Cumilla Sadar Upazila
Description: Kotwali Police Station Officer-in-Charge Mohammad Abu Salam Mia said that suspected drug traders Sharif, 26, of village Moheshpur and Peer Ali, 28, of village Shuvapur under Sadar upazila were killed in a gunfight with police at Bibir Bazar under Sadar upazila around 1:30am on Tuesday.

Name: Mohammad Bachchu
Location: Dhaka-Sylhet highway at Shimultali under Araihazar, Narayanganj
Description: Rapid Action Battalion-11 Company Commander Anwar Hossain said that suspected drug trader Mohammad Bachchu of Dakhkhinkhan area in Dhaka was killed in a gunfight with RAB members on Dhaka-Sylhet highway at Shimultali under Araihazar in the district around 5:00am.

Name: Mohammad Probal Hossain
Location: Manirampur playground of Birampur Municipality, Dinajpur
Description: In Dinajpur, suspected drug trader Md Probal Hossain, 35, of village Damodorpur under Birampur was killed in a gunfight with police at Manirampur playground of Birampur municipality early Tuesday, said Birampur Police Station OC Abdus Sabur.

Name: Shukkur Ali
Description: In Chattogram, Shukkur Ali, 45, was killed in a reported gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) in Debarpara area at around 2:30am. Assistant Superintendent of Police Mimtanur Rahman of RAB 7 said acting on a tip-off, a team of the elite force conducted a drive in the area. Sensing presence of RAB, a gang of drug traders opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate, triggering the gun battle, which left Shukkur dead on the spot.

Name: Kamruzzaman Sadu
Description: In Chuadanga, Kamruzzaman Sadu, 38, of village Hardi under Alamdanga upazila was killed in a gunfight with police near Alamdanga Police Station around 1:30am, claimed Alamdanga Police Station OC Abu Zihad Fakhrul Alam Khan.

Name: Shahin
Description: Two suspected drug peddlers, Shahin, 28, and Jalil, 32, of Nichu Colony of Saidpur Municipality were killed in a reported gunfight with police at Badhyabhumi under Saidpur early Tuesday, said Saidpur Police Sattion OC Golam Pasha.

Name: Jalil
Description: Two suspected drug peddlers, Shahin, 28, and Jalil, 32, of Nichu Colony of Saidpur Municipality were killed in a reported gunfight with police at Badhyabhumi under Saidpur early Tuesday, said Saidpur Police Sattion OC Golam Pasha.

Name: Amzad Hossain
Description: In Netrakona, Amzad Hossain, 32, of Paschim Nagra Gainpara in the district town, was killed in a reported gunfight between police and suspected drug traders at Boroari under Sadar upazila early Tuesday, said Sadar Police Station officer-in-charge Md Borhan Uddin. District BNP's Organising secretary S M Moniruzzaman Dudu said Amzad Hossain was active student wing of BNP's activist.

Name: Dhon Mia
Description: In Brahmanbaria, drug trader Dhon Mia, 35, of village Morichakandi of Bancharampur in the district was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB-10 members at Sonarampur of Bancharampur early Tuesday.

Name: Mohammad Faruk
Location: Daudpul area and Lemua area, Feni Sadar
Description: RAB said that drug trader Mohammad Faruk, 35, was killed in a gunfight during an operation of RAB 7 in Daudpul area under Feni Sadar around 11:10pm. RAB-7 Company Commander Shafayat Jamil Fahim said that drug trader Manjurul Alam Manju, 49, of Satkania in Chittagong was killed in a gunfight with RAB at Lemua under Sadar upazila early Tuesday.

Name: Manjurul Alam Manju
Location: Daudpul area and Lemua area, Feni Sadar
Description: RAB said that drug trader Mohammad Faruk, 35, was killed in a gunfight during an operation of RAB 7 in Daudpul area under Feni Sadar around 11:10pm. RAB-7 Company Commander Shafayat Jamil Fahim said that drug trader Manjurul Alam Manju, 49, of Satkania in Chittagong was killed in a gunfight with RAB at Lemua under Sadar upazila early Tuesday.

Name: Oltu
Description: Oltu was killed in a gunfight between Gang group members and RAB in Khaskorra village. Commander Major Monir Ahmed of RAB-6 said that RAB took position at Khaskorra field after received a secret information. Sensing their presence the criminals opened fire and RAB also retaliated by firing. After the gunfight, RAB found one bullet-riddled body on the spot.

Name: Fotik alias Gaffar
Description: In Kushtia, two suspected drug traders were killed in separate gunfights with police in Bheramara and Kumarkhali upazilas in the early hours of the day. Kushtia Superintendent of Police (SP) SM Mehedi Hasan said, The incident took place when police conducted a drive in Haowakhali brick field and near a bridge in Lahini Para.

Name: Liton Sheikh
Description: In Kushtia, two suspected drug traders were killed in separate gunfights with police in Bheramara and Kumarkhali upazilas in the early hours of the day. Kushtia Superintendent of Police (SP) SM Mehedi Hasan said, The incident took place when police conducted a drive in Haowakhali brick field and near a bridge in Lahini Para.

Name: Aktaful
Description: In Thakurgaon, alleged drug trader Aktaful of Baliadangi upazila was killed in a gunfight with police in Pirganj upazila's Banbari village early yesterday, hours after he was picked up by law enforcers. Thakurgaon SP Farhad Ahemd said the gunfight took place around 4:00am when a police team took Aktaful to Banbari to arrest his associates.

Name: Nurul Absar
Location: Tikkar Char Bridge area near the Gumti embankment, Cumilla
Description: In Cumilla, alleged drug trader Nurul Absar Isa was killed in a shootout in Tikkar Char Bridge area near the Gumti embankment early yesterday. Tanveer Salehin Emon, Additional SP of Comilla said that police picked up Nurul on Tuesday afternoon from his house in Gazipur village. The gunfight took place around 12:45am when the law enforcers took him near the embankment to recover phensidyl.

Name: Mosharaf Hossain Bidyut
Location: Chhankanda Madrassah Ghat under Jamalpur sadar
Description: Jamalpur District Superintendent of Police Delwar Hossain said that suspected drug peddler Mosharaf Hossain Bidyut, 39, of Bogabaid Boardghar Bazar area, on the outskirts of Jamalpur town, was killed in a shootout by police at Chhankanda Madrassah Ghat under Jamalpur sadar upazila early Wednesday. The deceaseds wife Shilpi Begum alleged that police killed her husband by staging a so-called gunfight. Three police officials including sub-inspector Mehedi Hasan had visited my house on three occasions since Monday afternoon to early Tuesday and the officials took out my husband from the house saying that they would need his help to perform a job, Shilpi said, adding that the police officials used to visit her house often.

Name: Shahinur Rahman
Description: Kotowali Police Station Officer-in-Charge Babul Miah said that suspected ''drug peddler" Shahinur Rahman, 30, of Suchanchowki area in Rangpur city was killed in a gunfight at Hazirhat on the outskirts of the city early Wednesday.  Family alleged that before killed he was picked up four days ago from his house. Ref: Ittefaq 26.5.18

Name: Raju Miah
Description: In Gaibandha, suspected drug peddler Raju Miah of Raigram under Palashbari upazila in the district was killed in a reported gunfight with the RAB at village Bisramgachhi under the upazila early Tuesday.  The deceased's wife Rokhsana Begum alleged that her husband was picked up at Fakirhat Bazar on Tuesday evening.

Name: Nure Alam Eshar
Description: Lalmonirhat District Supreintendent of Police SM Rashidul Huq said that suspected drug pedller Nure Alam Eshar was killed in a gunfight with police at Char Kulaghat under Sadar upazila early Wednesday.

Name: Shamit Hossain Shamim
Description: Feni's Phulgazi Police Station Officer-in-Charge Humayun Kabir said that suspected drug peddlers Sahmit Hossain Shamim, 25, of Maij village and Majnu Mia alias Manir of Mantala village under Phulgazi upazila were killed in a reported gunfight with police at Jammura at the upazila at about 3:30am.  Shahmits mother Anwara Begum alleged that Phulgazi police station sub-inspector Shafique picked up her son from a land adjacent to her house where he had been collecting grass for their cows. She alleged that police demanded Tk 2 lakh from them and his son was shot dead by police as she failed to pay the money. Majnus sister Rejina Begum alleged that DB police in plain clothes had picked up him from her house in Feni district town and later demanded Tk 1.5 lakh. We went to the district superintendent of police office from where we were driven away. She said that her brother was an activist of Jatiyatabadi Chattra Dal and police lodged a number of false cases against him. Rejina alleged that her brother was killed as her family could not pay money.

Name: Majnu Mia alias Manir
Description: Feni's Phulgazi Police Station Officer-in-Charge Humayun Kabir said that suspected drug peddlers Sahmit Hossain Shamim, 25, of Maij village and Majnu Mia alias Manir of Mantala village under Phulgazi upazila were killed in a reported gunfight with police at Jammura at the upazila at about 3:30am.  Shahmits mother Anwara Begum alleged that Phulgazi police station sub-inspector Shafique picked up her son from a land adjacent to her house where he had been collecting grass for their cows. She alleged that police demanded Tk 2 lakh from them and his son was shot dead by police as she failed to pay the money. Majnus sister Rejina Begum alleged that DB police in plain clothes had picked up him from her house in Feni district town and later demanded Tk 1.5 lakh. We went to the district superintendent of police office from where we were driven away. She said that her brother was an activist of Jatiyatabadi Chattra Dal and police lodged a number of false cases against him. Rejina alleged that her brother was killed as her family could not pay money.

Name: Babul Mahi
Location: Dhaka-Chittagong Highway at Chouddagram of Sadar South upazila, Cumilla
Description: The Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Model Police Station (Investigation) Salauddin Ahmed said that suspected drug peddlers Babul Mahi,35,  son of Hafiz Ahmad of Bidderkhil village of Chouddagram and Rajib,38, son of Shah Alam at Sadar South upazila, were killed in a shootout by police on Dhaka-Chittagong Highway at Chouddagram of Sadar South upazila around 2:15am.

Name: Rajib
Location: Dhaka-Chittagong Highway at Chouddagram of Sadar South upazila, Cumilla
Description: The Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Model Police Station (Investigation) Salauddin Ahmed said that suspected drug peddlers Babul Mahi,35,  son of Hafiz Ahmad of Bidderkhil village of Chouddagram and Rajib,38, son of Shah Alam at Sadar South upazila, were killed in a shootout by police on Dhaka-Chittagong Highway at Chouddagram of Sadar South upazila around 2:15am.

Name: Mizanur Rahman Kalu
Description: Assistant Superintendent of Police Md Chhoyruddin said that suspected drug peddlers Mizanur Rahman Kalu, 43 of Bhayana village and Ayub Hossain, 50, of Niznanduali village in Sadar upazila were killed in a reported gunfight in Parnanduali Housing Project area in the district town early Thursday. The police said that acting on information that two drug-paddling gangs were exchanging gunfights between them over establishing supremacy, a team of police went to the Parnanduali Housing Project area around 1:00am and recovered the bullet hits body of two alleged drug peddlers. Family of the deceased alleged that some plainclothes armed people picked them up from their house. Ref: Prothom Alo 25.5.18

Name: Ayub Hossain
Description: Assistant Superintendent of Police Md Chhoyruddin said that suspected drug peddlers Mizanur Rahman Kalu, 43 of Bhayana village and Ayub Hossain, 50, of Niznanduali village in Sadar upazila were killed in a reported gunfight in Parnanduali Housing Project area in the district town early Thursday. The police said that acting on information that two drug-paddling gangs were exchanging gunfights between them over establishing supremacy, a team of police went to the Parnanduali Housing Project area around 1:00am and recovered the bullet hits body of two alleged drug peddlers. Family of the deceased alleged that some plainclothes armed people picked them up from their house. Ref: Prothom Alo 25.5.19

Name: Amir Kha
Description: The Officer-in-Charge of Akhaura Police Station Mosharaf Hossain said that suspected drug peddler Amir Kha, 40, son of Late Suroj Kha of village Chanpur under north union of Akhaura, was killed in a gunfight with police in Akhaura around 2:00am.  Amir kha's daughter said that on 21 May, some people came to their house and told they have arrest warrant against him and picked Amir up at dawn. Ref: Prothom Alo 25.5.18

Name: Mohammad Shamim
Location: WAPDA math under Kaliganj upazila, Jhenaidah
Description: In Jhenaidah, suspected drug peddler Md Shamim, 40, was killed in a gunfight with police at WAPDA math under Kaliganj upazila at about 11:00pm, said Kaliganj Police Station Officer-in-Charge Md Mizanur Rahman Khan.

Name: Mohammad Hasan
Description:
In Cox's Bazar, cops recovered the bullet-hit body of alleged yaba trader Md Hasan from Uttaran residential area around 3:30am yesterday. Farid Uddin Ahmed, Officer-in-Charge of Cox's Bazar Police Station, said 35-year-old Hasan was killed in a gunfight between two groups of yaba traders. 
But Hasan's brother Shohor Mulluk said a group of plainclothes men picked up his brother from his house early on Tuesday.

Name: Abdul Aziz
Description: Satkhira police claimed to have recovered the bullet-hit body of Abdul Aziz from Choubaria village in Kaliganj upazila around 6:00am yesterday.  Aziz's wife Ayesha Khatun said a group unidentified men picked up her husband after iftar on Wednesday. She heard about his death yesterday morning.

Name: Selim
Location: Maghmara area of Siddhirganj upazila, Narayanganj
Description: In Narayanganj, alleged drug peddler Selim was killed in a shootout with police in Maghmara area of Siddhirganj upazila early yesterday, said Abdus Sattar, Officer-in-Charge of Siddhirganj Police Station.

Name: Mohammad Mostak
Location: Munsir Dail Pahartoli area, Moheshkhali, Cox's Bazar
Description: Mohammad Mostak Ahmed, an alleged drug trader, was killed in a gunfight with police at Munsir Dail Pahartoli area. said Pradeep Kumar Dash, Officer-in-Charge of Moheshkhali Police Station.

Name: Kamrul Islam
Description: In the capital, Kamrul Islam was killed in a shootout with RAB in Tejgaon industrial area early yesterday. His wife Taslima Begum said her husband used to peddle drugs around 10 years back. He quit the trade after their first daughter was born. Kamrul was accused in two cases, Taslima added. Sathi Begum, sister-in-law of the deceased, said Kamrul went to her house in Dakshinpara area on Tuesday and took iftar there. He left the house for his hotel around 7:30pm. Around 8:00pm, a few people picked him up from in front of the hotel, Sathi said, adding that Kamrul's phone had been found switched off since then.

Name: Osman Goni
Description: In Netrakona, two alleged drug traders were killed in a gunfight with police in the town's Monag area. One of the dead is Osman Goni from Cox's Bazar, said Md Borhan Uddin, Officer-in-Charge of Netrakona Police Station. The identity of the other man could not be confirmed.

Name: Unidentified
Description: In Netrakona, two alleged drug traders were killed in a gunfight with police in the town's Monag area. One of the dead is Osman Goni from Cox's Bazar, said Md Borhan Uddin, Officer-in-Charge of Netrakona Police Station. The identity of the other man could not be confirmed.

Name: Rajon Mia
Description: In Mymensingh, alleged drug peddler Rajon Mia, aged about 32, was killed in a gunfight with police in the city's Purohitpara area yesterday, said Kandaker Shaker Ahmed, Inspector (Investigation) of Mymensingh Sadar Police Station. Rajon's father Harun said his son used to take drugs previously, but he was not involved in drug trade. He was accused in two cases. Harun, security officer of a private organisation, also said his son had been traceless since police picked him up from his house early on Tuesday.

Name: Azad
Description: Azad, 28, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a gunfight with police in Satpakia area of the districts Sadar upazila early on Friday. Sherpur Sadar Circles Additional Superintendent of Police Md Aminul Islam said the incident took place around 3:00am when a team of police conducted a drive in the area. However, Azads family members claimed that police had picked up Azad from home Thursday morning and since then they could not find him.

Name: Jewel Mia
Description: In Gaibandha, alleged drug trafficker Jewel Mia, 35, was shot dead in a shootout with police in Falia bridge area, about seven kilometres away from the district town, said Khan Mohammed Shaharier, OC of Gaibandha Sadar Police Station. Jewel's wife Rozi Begum said her husband remained traceless after police arrested him from Bridge Road area. Next day in the morning, she heard the news.

Name: Younus Ali
Description: In Satkhira, alleged drug peddler Younus Ali was killed in a gunfight between two groups of drug traders in Sonabaria village of Kolaroa upazila, said Biplob Kumar Nath, OC of Kolaroa Police Station. Younus's wife Rabeya Khatun said police picked up her husband around 9:30pm on Thursday after he had returned home attending Taraweeh prayers.

Name: Mohammad Kamal
Description: Burichang Police Station Officer-in-Charge Manoj Kumar Dey saifd that suspected drug peddler Md Kamal, 51, of Rajmangalpur area of Sadar upazila in the district, was killed in a gunfight with police at Mahismara under Burichang upazila at about 2.00am.  Kamals relative Abu Taher alleged that cops chased and caught him from his house Thursday night and then demanded Tk 1.5 lakh from the family. The family failed to pay the money and we heard the news of his death Friday morning. Monoj denied the allegations.

Name: Akter Kamal
Identity: A member of Sabrang Union Parishad in Teknaf and drug dealer
Location: Cox's Bazar-Teknaf Marine Drive road in Darianagar area, Cox's Bazar
Description: The body of Akter Kamal, a member of Sabrang Union Parishad in Teknaf, was found lying beside Cox's Bazar-Teknaf Marine Drive road in Darianagar area, said Monirul Islam, in-charge of Himchhari Police Outpost.  The police official said Kamal, a listed yaba dealer, died from bullets wounds he sustained during a gunfight. His relatives said some plainclothes men had picked him up from Sabrang area on Thursday evening.

Name: Russel Mia
Identity: Night guard at City Centre branch of Shahjalal Islami Bank
Description: The victim's mother Amena Begum and brother Rubel Mia said Russel was working as a night guard at City Centre branch of Shahjalal Islami Bank. In the early hours of Monday, a theft was committed in a shop at the 3rd floor of the market, where the bank is also located. Police took away Russel for questioning on Monday afternoon. Claiming that Russel was tortured in police custody, his relatives alleged that the youth was thrown off the 3rd floor of a building. Russel, who suffered critical injuries after the reported torture, breathed his last while undergoing treatment at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. Ref: Daily Star 25.5.18.

Name: Babul
Description: In Cumilla, alleged drug traders Babul, 40, and Almas, 35, were killed in a gunfight with police in Brahmanpara upazila early yesterday, said Syed Abu Mohammad Shajahan Kabir, Officer-in-Charge of Brahmanpara Police Station.  Almas's wife Taslima Begum said her husband worked as a day labourer and was the only earning member of her family. He was picked up by police from his village home on Friday.

Name: Almas
Description: In Cumilla, alleged drug traders Babul, 40, and Almas, 35, were killed in a gunfight with police in Brahmanpara upazila early yesterday, said Syed Abu Mohammad Shajahan Kabir, Officer-in-Charge of Brahmanpara Police Station.  Almas's wife Taslima Begum said her husband worked as a day labourer and was the only earning member of her family. He was picked up by police from his village home on Friday.

Name: Abdur Rahman
Description: In a gunfight between police and drug peddlers, alleged drug trader Abdur Rahman was killed in Pabna's Mohendrapur area. A resident of the district's Kabirpur village, the 45-year-old man was arrested in the village on Friday noon. The gun battle broke out after police had taken him to the area to arrest his associates, said Goutam Kumar Bishwas, Additional Superintendent of Police in Pabna.

Name: Ibrahim Hossain
Description: Bhurungamari Police Station Officer-in-Charge Emteaz Kabir said that drug peddler Ibrahim Hossain, 37, of Naodor Uttarpara village under the upazila was killed in a gunfight with police at South Bashjani village of the upazila at about 4:30am.

Name: Mohammad Shahjahan
Description: Mymensingh District Detective Branch of Police Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman said that suspected drug peddler Md Shahjahan, 30, was killed in a gunfight with police at Atharobari under Ishwarganj at about 1:30am.

Name: Rentu Mia
Description: RAB-5 Camp Commander Shamim Hossain said that suspected drug peddler Rentu Mia, 40, of Uttargopalpur under Panchbibi upazila was killed in a gunfight with the battalion members at a brick kiln at Bhimpur under the upazila.

Name: Saddarul
Location: Basudevpur village, Birganj upazila and Pashchimpara, Sadar upazila, Dinajpur
Description: In Dinajpur, suspected drug traders Saddarul, of Nandail village, and Abdus Salam, of Mohorarpur of sadar upazila were killed in gunfights with police and the battalion. RAB-13 Crimes Prevention company commander Talukder Najmus Sakib said that Saddarul was killed in a gunfight with the battalion at Basudebpur of the upazila. Mohammad Raju, son of Sabdarul, said his father had been traceless since Friday evening and his phone was found switched off. Besides, suspected drug peddler Abdus Salam was killed in a gunfight with police at Paschimpara under sadar upazila, said Redwanur Rahim, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station.

Name: Abdus Salam
Location: Basudevpur village, Birganj upazila and Pashchimpara, Sadar upazila, Dinajpur
Description: In Dinajpur, suspected drug traders Saddarul, of Nandail village, and Abdus Salam, of Mohorarpur of sadar upazila were killed in gunfights with police and the battalion. RAB-13 Crimes Prevention company commander Talukder Najmus Sakib said that Saddarul was killed in a gunfight with the battalion at Basudebpur of the upazila. Mohammad Raju, son of Sabdarul, said his father had been traceless since Friday evening and his phone was found switched off. Besides, suspected drug peddler Abdus Salam was killed in a gunfight with police at Paschimpara under sadar upazila, said Redwanur Rahim, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station.

Name: Mobarak Hossain
Description: In Thakurgaon, alleged drug trader Mobarak Hossain was killed in a gunfight with police in Pashchim Begunbari village early yesterday, said Abdul Latif, OC of Thakurgaon Police Station.  His wife Monowara Begum, 35, admitted that her husband was involved in drug trade. She alleged that police picked up her husband from their house on Tuesday evening. However, the OC denied allegation of picking up Mobarak.

Name: Sagir Khan
Description: In Barguna, police recovered the body of a suspected drug trader named Sagir Khan from Jakirtabak area. According to locals, Sagir was killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Ekramul Haque
Identity: A ward Councillor of Teknaf Municipality and local Awami League leader/ Alleged drug trader
Location: Noakhalipara under Teknaf Upazila, Cox's Bazar
Description: Ekramul Haque, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB at Noakhalipara under Teknaf upazila early Sunday. Major Ruhul Amin, Rapid Action Battalion-7 Company Commander in Cox's Bazar, said, Ekramul was at the top of the list prepared by the Department of Narcotics Control [DNC] and the home ministry.   Ekramul's brother Ehsanul Haque Bahadur said that some plainclothes men from "an intelligence agency" picked up his brother from their house around 9:30pm on Saturday, saying they would talk to him over the purchase of a plot of land. My brother was never involved in yaba trade. He had no links to it whatsoever. Ekramul's wife Ayesha Begum Ashu said the RAB claim that her husband was a drug dealer is totally false.

Name: Rafikul Islam
Identity: Youth wing of BNP and alleged drug peddler
Description: In Jhenidah, Shailkupa police claimed suspected drug dealer Rafikul Islam, 36, was shot dead during an exchange of fire between two groups of drug peddlers near Jhenidah-Kushtia highway early yesterday. However, Rubel Hossain, brother-in-law of Rafikul, said several plainclothes men picked Rafikul up on Friday night from his home.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Mymensingh District Detective Branch of Police Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman said that an unidentified drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with police at Morakhola of the city at about 1:30am.

Name: Mohammad Rihan Prakash
Location: Guliakhali Sandwip ferry ghat area, Sitakunda, Chattogram
Description: In Chittagong, suspected drug peddler Md Rihan Prakash, 27, of Golabaria of Sitakunda upazila was killed in a reported gunfight with police in Guliakhali Sandwip ferry ghat area at about 12:45am, said Sitakunda Police Station Officer-in-Charge Mozammel Haque.

Name: Abul Kalam
Location: Barakpur Siddiqpasa ferry jetty area under Dighalia upazila, Khulna
Description: In Khulna, suspected drug peddler Abul Kalam of Ichhamati under Abhoynagar upazila in Jessore was killed in a gunfight with police in Barakpur Siddiqpasa ferry jetty area under Dighalia upazila at about 3:00am, said Khulna District Superintendent of Police SM Shafiullah.

Name: Mitul Biswas
Description: In Bagerhat, suspected drug peddler Mitul Biswas, 45, of Chingguri village under Chitalmari upazila was killed in a reported gunfight with police in an orchard at the village at about 3:15am, said Chitalmari Police Station Officer-in-Charge Anukul Chandra Sarker.

Name: Hasan Mia
Description: Noakhali District Additional Superintendent of Police AKM Zahirul Islam said that suspected drug peddler Hasan Mia of Banoai village under Sonaimuri upazila was killed in a gunfight with police at Bogadia under the upazila at about 3:00am. Mohammad Humayun, elder brother of Hasan said that some police personnel detained his brother from Sonaimuri Bazar on Saturday. Ref: Prothom Alo 28.5.18

Name: Halim Mandal
Description: In Kushtia, suspected drug peddler Halim Mandal, 35, of Baria village under sadar upazila, was killed in a gunfight with police in housing D-block field area in the district town at about 1:30am, said Kushtia Model Police Station Officer-in-Charge Nasir Uddin.

Name: Rafiqul Islam
Description: In Thakurgaon, suspected drug peddler Rafiqul Islam, 55, of Bhornia village under Ranisankail upazila, was killed in a reported gunfight with police at Miradangi under Ranisankail upazila early Sunday, said Thakurgaon Superintendent of Police Farhat Ahmed.

Name: Selim Mia
Location: Hazirdon under Matlab south upazila, Chandpur
Description: In Chandpur, suspected drug paddler Selim Mia, 35, of Upadhi village, was killed in a reported gunfight at Hazirdon under Matlab south upazila at about 2:50am, said Matlab Police Station Officer-in-Charge Kutub Uddin.

Name: Hafizul Islam Hafi
Description: In Meherpur, suspected drug dealer, Hafizul Islam Hafi, 45, was killed in a gunfight with police at Gangni, said Gangni Police Station OC Harendra Nath Sarkar.

Name: Nazrul Islam alias Nazu Sardar
Description: In Dhaka, suspected drug peddler Nazrul Islam alias Nazu Sardar, 42, of Rupnagar, was killed in a reported gunfight with the Detective Branch of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police at an under-construction building at a staff quarter of Public Works Department at Rupnagar at about 2:30am.

Name: Enamul Haq Dolan
Description: Two suspected drug dealers  Enamul Haq Dolan, 35, of Bhinglabari Mirzanagar under Debidwar and Nuru, 55, of Kalikapur under sadar upazila  were killed in gunfights with police at Debidwar and Sadar South upazilas respectively. Nuru, was killed in a gunfight at Golia-Lakshmipur village at about 2:00am, said Comilla Assistant Superintendent of Police Golam Ambia Mahmud.

Name: Nuru
Description: Two suspected drug dealers  Enamul Haq Dolan, 35, of Bhinglabari Mirzanagar under Debidwar and Nuru, 55, of Kalikapur under sadar upazila  were killed in gunfights with police at Debidwar and Sadar South upazilas respectively. Nuru, was killed in a gunfight at Golia-Lakshmipur village at about 2:00am, said Comilla Assistant Superintendent of Police Golam Ambia Mahmud.

Name: Wahiduzzaman Ohid
Location: Kourikhara village and Gotichara village under Mathbaria, Pirojpur
Description: In Pirojpur, suspected drug peddler Wahiduzzaman Ohid, 50, of Nesarabad upazila, was killed in a reported gunfight with police at village Kourikhara under sadar upazila at about 2:00am, said Pirojpur Additional Superintendent of Police GM Abul Kalam Azad. Suspected drug peddler Mizanur Rahman, 35, was killed in a gunfight with cops at village Gotichara under Mathbaria upazila at about 1:30am, Abul Kalam said.

Name: Mizanur Rahman
Location: Kourikhara village and Gotichara village under Mathbaria, Pirojpur
Description: In Pirojpur, suspected drug peddler Wahiduzzaman Ohid, 50, of Nesarabad upazila, was killed in a reported gunfight with police at village Kourikhara under sadar upazila at about 2:00am, said Pirojpur Additional Superintendent of Police GM Abul Kalam Azad. Suspected drug peddler Mizanur Rahman, 35, was killed in a gunfight with cops at village Gotichara under Mathbaria upazila at about 1:30am, Abul Kalam said.

Name: Emdadul Huq
Description: Satkhira Sadar Police Station Sub-Inspector Prabir Kumar Das said that two drug peddlers  Emdadul Huq of Modhumollardangi of the district town and Khalilur Rahman of Lakshmidari village under sadar upazila  were killed in a gunfight between two groups of drug peddlers at Bankal-Agunpur under sadar upazila. Emdaduls elder brother Mafijul Islam Mafi alleged that his brother was killed four days after he was picked up from their house by people who identified themselves as cops. There is no case, even a general diary against him with any police station. Ajgar Ali, father of Khalilur Rahman alleged that Khalilur was picked up by DB Police in front of the Court premises around 1:00pm on Sunday when he went to Satkhira Judge Court to appear in a case.

Name: Khalilur Rahman
Description: Satkhira Sadar Police Station Sub-Inspector Prabir Kumar Das said that two drug peddlers  Emdadul Huq of Modhumollardangi of the district town and Khalilur Rahman of Lakshmidari village under sadar upazila  were killed in a gunfight between two groups of drug peddlers at Bankal-Agunpur under sadar upazila. Emdaduls elder brother Mafijul Islam Mafi alleged that his brother was killed four days after he was picked up from their house by people who identified themselves as cops. There is no case, even a general diary against him with any police station. Ajgar Ali, father of Khalilur Rahman alleged that Khalilur was picked up by DB Police in front of the Court premises around 1:00pm on Sunday when he went to Satkhira Judge Court to appear in a case.

Name: Abdul Khaleque
Description: In Natore's Singra upazila, RAB said suspected drug dealer Abdul Khaleque, 45, was killed in a shootout with members of the elite force, said Assistant Superintendent of RAB-5 Azman Khan.

Name: Ejjat Ali Pramanik
Location: Brishali village of Bera municipal area, Pabna
Description: Pabna District Superintendent of Police Zahidul Kabir said that suspected drug peddler Ejjat Ali Pramanik, 28, of village Haturia under Bera upazila, was killed in a gunfight with cops at village Brishali of Bera municipal area at about 1.00am.

Name: Abu Sayeed Badsha alias Lal Badsha
Description: In Chandpur, suspected drug peddler Abu Sayeed Badsha alias Lal Badsha, 45, of village Purba Gobindopur under Faridganj upazila, was killed in a gunfight with cops at Boichatoli of the upazila at about 2:00am, said Faridganj Police Station Officer-in-Charge Shah Alam.

Name: Liton
Location: In front of a brick kiln near Gomti Protection Dam at Gunjor under Muradnagar, Cumilla
Description:
Muradnagar Police Station Officer-in-Charge AKM Manjur Alam said that drug peddlers Liton, 44, of Paiyapathar village and Baten, 35, of Bakhranagar village under Muradnagar upazila were killed in a gunfight with police in front of a brick kiln near Gomti Protection Dam at Gunjor under the upazila.
Batens father Shaheed Mia said that people in plainclothes picked up his son sometimes after iftar on Monday and asked them to contact the police station. Litons sister Momtaj Begum said that they had good relation with cops who often used to visit their house. Police called him from home and took him away after iftar on Monday.

Name: Baten
Location: In front of a brick kiln near Gomti Protection Dam at Gunjor under Muradnagar, Cumilla
Description:
Muradnagar Police Station Officer-in-Charge AKM Manjur Alam said that drug peddlers Liton, 44, of Paiyapathar village and Baten, 35, of Bakhranagar village under Muradnagar upazila were killed in a gunfight with police in front of a brick kiln near Gomti Protection Dam at Gunjor under the upazila.
Batens father Shaheed Mia said that people in plainclothes picked up his son sometimes after iftar on Monday and asked them to contact the police station. Litons sister Momtaj Begum said that they had good relation with cops who often used to visit their house. Police called him from home and took him away after iftar on Monday.

Name: Mohammad Sumon Mia
Description: In Dhaka, suspected drug peddler Mohammad Sumon Mia, 42, of Dakhkhinkhan was killed in a gunfight with police at Asian City Park at about 12:15am, claimed Dakhkhinkhan Police Station Officer-in-Charge Tapan Chandra Saha.

Name: Mukaddes Ali
Location: Shehala field of Daulatpur Upazila, Kushtia
Description: In Kushtia, suspected drug peddlers Mukaddes Ali, 36, of Munshiganj and Fazlur Rahman, 35, of Pragpur under Daulatpur upazila were killed in a gunfight with police at Shehala field of Daulatpur upazila at about 3:30am, said Daulatpur Police Station Officer-in-Charge Azgar Ali.

Name: Fazlur Rahman
Location: Shehala field of Daulatpur Upazila, Kushtia
Description: In Kushtia, suspected drug peddlers Mukaddes Ali, 36, of Munshiganj and Fazlur Rahman, 35, of Pragpur under Daulatpur upazila were killed in a gunfight with police at Shehala field of Daulatpur upazila at about 3:30am, said Daulatpur Police Station Officer-in-Charge Azgar Ali.

Name: Mizan
Description: Mymensing District Detective Branch of Police Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman said that suspected drug peddler Mizan, 45, of village Dakhkhin Kachina under Bhaluka upazila was killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Anisur Rahman
Description: Kalaroa Police Station Officer-in-Charge Biplab Kumar Nath said that suspected drug peddler Anisur Rahman, 40, of village Pakuria of Kalaroa upazila, was killed in a gunfight with police at Pilapul field under the upazila at about 2:00am. Anisurs wife Nazma Begum claimed that a team of police in plainclothes detained her husband Monday morning.

Name: Firoz Mridha
Description: In Barguna, suspected drug peddler Firoz Mridha, 45, of Betagi municipal area,  was killed in a gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion at village Kumrakhali under Betagi upazila, said a message sent to media by the battalion.

Name: Harun
Description: In Thakurgaon, suspected drug peddler Harun, 45, of village Shitalpur under Haripur upazila was killed in a reported gunfight with police at his village, said Harirampur Police Station Officer-in-Charge Ruhul Quddus.

Name: Jony Mia
Identity: Activist associated with student wing of BNP and alleged drug peddler
Description:
Brahmanbaria police claimed that alleged drug dealer Jony Mia, 30, was killed in gunfight between two groups of drug peddlers in Khalajora area.
Jony's wife Jotsna Akter, however, said eight to 10 men in plainclothes went to their home on May 21, handcuffed her husband and took him along with them. She said her husband was never a drug trader.

Name: Sumon
Description: Sumon was killed in a gunfight with police at Shantir Bazar. Morshed Alam, Officer-in-Charge of Sonargaon Police Station said the deceased was member of robbery team. He was from Atadi village under Araihazar upazila.

Name: Ataur Rahman
Description: In the capital's Bhashantek Dewanpara area, an exchange of fire took place between members of RAB-4 and drug peddlers in which Ataur Rahman, 46, Mostafa Hawlader, 52, and Faruq Islam, 37, were killed, according to the RAB. Jony, son of Ataur said that his father was allegedly picked up from their Savar's house by a group of people who give them their identity as administration's people on May 28. Jony did not know about his father was drug trader or not. Sujan Hawlader, son of Mostafa said that his father was picked up from their house by administration's people on May 22. Ref: Prothom Alo 31.5.18

Name: Mostafa Hawlader
Description: In the capital's Bhashantek Dewanpara area, an exchange of fire took place between members of RAB-4 and drug peddlers in which Ataur Rahman, 46, Mostafa Hawlader, 52, and Faruq Islam, 37, were killed, according to the RAB. Jony, son of Ataur said that his father was allegedly picked up from their Savar's house by a group of people who give them their identity as administration's people on May 28. Jony did not know about his father was drug trader or not. Sujan Hawlader, son of Mostafa said that his father was picked up from their house by administration's people on May 22. Ref: Prothom Alo 31.5.18

Name: Faruq Islam
Description: In the capital's Bhashantek Dewanpara area, an exchange of fire took place between members of RAB-4 and drug peddlers in which Ataur Rahman, 46, Mostafa Hawlader, 52, and Faruq Islam, 37, were killed, according to the RAB. Jony, son of Ataur said that his father was allegedly picked up from their Savar's house by a group of people who give them their identity as administration's people on May 28. Jony did not know about his father was drug trader or not. Sujan Hawlader, son of Mostafa said that his father was picked up from their house by administration's people on May 22. Ref: Prothom Alo 31.5.18

Name: Majibur Rahman
Location: Near Kabitachattar point sea beach area, Cox's Bazar
Description: In Cox's Bazar, Majibur Rahman, 42, was killed in a gunfight with RAB near Kabitachattar point sea beach area around 12:00am. RAB-7 Company Commander in Cox's Bazar Maj Ruhul Amin said Mujibur was a top-listed drug dealer in Netrakona.

Name: Mohammad Ishaq
Description: In Chittagong, Md Ishaq, 35, was killed in a shootout between RAB and a group of drug dealers in Pologround area around 1:30am, said RAB-7 Deputy Director Ashequr Rahman.

Name: Rosmat Ali
Description: In Cumilla, Burichang Police Station Officer-in-Charge Manoj Kumar Dey said that suspected drug peddler Rosmat Ali, 40, of village Choygram under Burirchang, was killed in a gunfight with police at Laribagh under the upazila early Wednesday.

Name: Sajib
Description: In Narail, suspected drug peddler Sajib, 27, of village Duttapara under Sadar upazila was killed in a gunfight with police at Malibagh under the upazila about 2:30am, said Sadar Police Station Officer-in-Charge Anwar Hossain.

Name: Tanjil Hossain
Description: In Chuadanga, Tanjil Hossain, 40, was killed in a gunfight with police at Satgari Natunpara in the municipality area around 3:00am, said Abdul Khalek, Officer-in-Charge of Sadar Police Station. Tanjil's cousin Akram Hossain, however, said they heard Tanjil was arrested by plainclothes men on Monday night from Bostapatti area of Chuadanga town. Since then, we had no communication with him, he said.

Name: Ahsan Habib
Description: In Sirajganj, alleged drug peddler Ahsan Habib, 45, was killed in Kamarkhand upazila, said Md Sakibul Islam, Commander of RAB-2, Sirajganj camp.

Name: Shan Ahmed
Description: On 15 May, Chuadanga police recovered a bullet-hit body of a youth named Shan Ahmed, son of Helal Hossain, from Belgachhi Gongachara field under Chuadanga Municipality. There were two gunshots in the left hand and rights rib of the deceased. His mouth was wrapped with scotch tape and blindfoled. Shan's aunt Kausari Begum said that Shan was at her home in the evening of 14 May. Five plainclothed police of Chuadanga Outpost came to her house in the afternoon to look for Shan. Shan fled sencing the presence of police. At that time police threatened her that if Shan was caught, he will be killed in crossfire.

Name: Unidentified
Description: In Ashulia, an alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police at Moragang area of Ashulia. The incident took place at around 3:00am Baipail-Tongi highway under Ashulia.  According to the police statement's, a gang of robbers starting threw brickbats to the running cars at Abdullahpur-Baipail highway. Police seen the incident. However, the robbers opened fire on them and they retaliated by firing, leaving a robber dead.

Name: Bacchu Chopdar
Description: In Magura, three alleged drug dealers were killed in gunfight at Batikadanga in Sadar upazila at around 2:00am, said Magura Sadar Police Station Officer-in-Chanrge Ilias Hossain.

Name: Raihan Dhali
Description: In Magura, three alleged drug dealers were killed in gunfight at Batikadanga in Sadar upazila at around 2:00am, said Magura Sadar Police Station Officer-in-Chanrge Ilias Hossain.

Name: Kishore Odhikari
Description: In Magura, three alleged drug dealers were killed in gunfight at Batikadanga in Sadar upazila at around 2:00am, said Magura Sadar Police Station Officer-in-Chanrge Ilias Hossain.

Name: Liton Hossain
Location: Boro Archa area of Benapole, Jashore
Description: Two alleged drug peddlers -- Liton Hassan (35) and Rabiul Islam (40) -- were killed in a 'gunfihgt' in Boro Archa area of Benapole around 3:00am, said Apurba Hasan, OC of Benapole Port Police Station. However, the victim-families claimed that the deceased were innocent. They were picked up by police and killed in a planned way.

Name: Rabiul Islam
Location: Boro Archa area of Benapole, Jashore
Description: Two alleged drug peddlers -- Liton Hassan (35) and Rabiul Islam (40) -- were killed in a 'gunfihgt' in Boro Archa area of Benapole around 3:00am, said Apurba Hasan, OC of Benapole Port Police Station. However, the victim-families claimed that the deceased were innocent. They were picked up by police and killed in a planned way.

Name: Ashraf Uddin Hridoy
Description: An alleged rorobber named Ashraf Uddin Hridoy was killed in reported 'gunfight' with police in Ashulia, Savar. The incident took place at  around 3:00am in Moragung area of Tongi-Ashulia-EPZ road. Deceased Ashrah, son of Hazrat Ali, was a resident of Dour Sumoner area under Turag Police Station in Dhaka.

Name: Asir Ali
Description: Jessore Kotwali Police Station Officer-in-Charge AKM Azmal Huda said that suspected drug peddlers Asir Ali, 56, of Mondolgati village and Malik, 26, of Raipara of the district town were killed in a gunfight in Chanchra Raipara area at about 3:00am.

Name: Malik
Description: Jessore Kotwali Police Station Officer-in-Charge AKM Azmal Huda said that suspected drug peddlers Asir Ali, 56, of Mondolgati village and Malik, 26, of Raipara of the district town were killed in a gunfight in Chanchra Raipara area at about 3:00am.

Name: Sarfan Islam Babu
Description: Sarfan Islam Babu, an accused in a case filed for the murder of electrician Peu Babu, was killed in a so-called gunfight between law enforcers and criminals in Mymensingh city on 14 May. According to DB police Babu was arrested in Dhaka on Sunday. Later he was taken to Mymensingh city's Teenkona Pukurpar area to arrest other accused in the murder case, said Ashikur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Detective Branch of Police. Sensing presence of police, accomplices of Sarfan opened fire on the law enforcers around 2:30am, triggering a gunfight. Sarfan, who was in handcuffs, was shot in the chest and back when he tried to flee. He was taken to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Muktar Ali
Description: Alleged robber Moktar Ali, son of Habibur Rahman Habib, a resident of Ratandia Village under Monirampur Upazila in Jashore was killed despite of being detained in jail. Police recovered his body from a field in his area. Muktar's parents said that thoir son was in jail for seven months. His wife met him in jail the day before he was killed. Meanwhile Jailer Abu Taleb of Jashore Central Jail said that Muktar was released from jail on 8 May in the evening after being bailed by the court.

Name: Islam Uddin alias Islam Ali
Description: An alleged robber was killed during a gunfight with police in Kulaura upazila of Moulvibazar early today. The deceased was identified as Islam Uddin alias Islam Ali, 45, son of Motsin Ali from Kamalganj upazila. Shamim Musa, Officer-in-Charge of Kulaura Police Station said that a team of police raided Paboi area of the upazila around 4:00am based on information that a gang of robbers was taking preparation to commit a robbery there. But the robbers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate which triggered the gun battle. Islam was hit by a bullet during the gunfight and died on the spot.

Name: Raju Ahmed
Location: Bhatar Amtala in Bagharpara upazila, Jashore
Description: In Jessore, Sub-Inspector Nasirul Haque Khan of Bagharpara Police Station, said that Raju Ahmed, 28, Dighalsingha under Chaugachha upazila in Jessore was killed in a reported 'gunfight' at Bhatar Amtala under Bagharpara upazila at about 2:00am. Rajus mother Kohinoor Begum at Jessore General Hospital, however, alleged that her son was called out from a local mosque after Tarabih prayers on 30 May over mobile phone identifying the caller as a police officer. My son was a garment worker in Chattogram and he came home two months ago. He was innocent, the mother claimed.

Name: Bacchu Khalifa
Description: In Madaripur, suspected drug peddler Bachchu Khalifa, son of Safar Khalifa, a resident of Khalifapotti area under Shibchar upazila in the district, was killed in a gunfight at Shambhuk area under the upazila at about 4:00am, claimed Shibchar police. According to police, acting on tip off several teams of police were patroling in the area to recover drugs. At one stage, police heard gunshots between two groups druge peddlers. When police reached the spot, at that time drug peddlers opened fire at police and police also fired back in retaliation, triggering a gunfight. During gunfight, Bachchu Khalifa was shot and wounded. When he was sent to Madaripur Sadar Hospital, the on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Belal Hossain
Identity: A day labour and an alleged drug dealer
Description: In Rajshahi, Rapid Action Battalion-5 Company Commander Major Ashraf Hossain said that two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with the battalion at Karamja under Karanhat Police Station at about 11:30pm. Belal's wife Amena Begum said her husband was a day labourer over a decade ago and was involved in fish farming. Amena said two plainclothes members of a law enforcement agency went to their house in Poba Upazila around 1:30pm on 30 May and asked her husband if he was involved in drug peddling. Within around half an hour after leaving the house, one of the two law enforcers phoned Belal and asked him to go to Nawhata area. He was confident that he would face no problem as he was no more involved in drug trade.

Name: Unidentified
Identity: A day labour and an alleged drug dealer
Description: In Rajshahi, Rapid Action Battalion-5 Company Commander Major Ashraf Hossain said that two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with the battalion at Karamja under Karanhat Police Station at about 11:30pm. Belal's wife Amena Begum said her husband was a day labourer over a decade ago and was involved in fish farming. Amena said two plainclothes members of a law enforcement agency went to their house in Poba Upazila around 1:30pm on 30 May and asked her husband if he was involved in drug peddling. Within around half an hour after leaving the house, one of the two law enforcers phoned Belal and asked him to go to Nawhata area. He was confident that he would face no problem as he was no more involved in drug trade.

Name: Kamrul Khan Kamu
Identity: Garment worker and alleged drug dealer
Description: Alleged drug dealer Kamrul Khan Kamu, 40, who was killed in a shootout with DB police in Gazipur on Friday, was picked up a day before from his home by plainclothes policemen, claimed Kamrul's wife Asma Begum. Asma said, "five to six plainclothes policemen came to our house around 5:00am on Thursday and took Kamrul with them". During the time, the policemen in name of searching the house took away some valuables, including a TV set, mobile phone, some cash, ornaments and documents, she claimed. Asma said she got married eight years ago and during these years, she never heard of any case filed against Kamrul. She said her husband used to work at a garment factory.

Name: Saddam Hossain
Description: In Cumilla, Saddam Hossain, 36, was killed in a gunfight with police in Chauddagram upazila around 2:40am.. Abul Faisal, Officer-in-Charge of Chauddagram Police Station, said a police team went to Koroibon on information that a gang of drug peddlers had gathered there. Sensing police presence, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate with gunshots triggering the gunfight. Police then found the bullet-riddled body of Saddam on the spot. Saddams brother-in-law Saiful Islam claimed that the victim was picked up by people identifying themselves as police from in front of their residence sometimes after 8:00pm. He claimed that Saddam was a drug-addict but was not a peddler.

Name: Shahjahan
Description: In Cox's Bazar, Shahjahan, who police said was the chief of a criminal gang Shahjahan Bahini, was killed in a gunfight in Chakaria upazila .Bakhtiar Uddin Chowdhury, Officer-in-Charge of Chakaria Police Station said recovered Shahjahan's body from the spot and sent it to the Sadar hospital morgue.

Name: Ruhul
Description: In Tangail, an alleged drug peddler, Ruhul was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Kalihati upazila. The 30-year-old man from Paschim Golora village of the upazila. According to a text sent by Maj Rabiul Islam, a Company Commander of RAB-12 in Tangail, a team of RAB-12 started an anti-drug drive in Golora area around 2:30am. Sensing presence of Rab personnel, the criminals opened fire, prompting them to retaliate. After the gunfight, the RAB team found Ruhul hit and took him to Tangail General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.However, Ruhul's wife Rashida Akter said, One Sumon Bhai of adjacent Taratia area called my husband out of the house around 11:00am on 31 May." "Sumon Bhai took Tk 6 lakh from my husband about one and a half months ago for dropping his name from the list of drug traders, said Rashida, mother of a six-month-old boy. "Ruhul was involved in drug trading previously but left the trade about six to seven months ago and started running a shop near Chhatihati Bazar," said his elder brother Bahadur.

Name: Rafiqul Islam Opi
Description: In Rangpur, police claimed to have recovered the bullet-hit body of alleged criminal Rafiqul Islam Opi  who was killed in a ' gunfight' in Kaunia upazila, said  Saifur Rahman, Additional Superintendent (circle A) of Rangpur police.

Name: Shahjahan Hossain alias Dabirul
Description: Rangpur Assistant Superintendent of Police Saiful Islam said that suspected drug peddler Shahjahan Hossain, also named in at 10 drugs related cases, was killed in a gunfight with police at Chotopur Banupara of Kawnia.

Name: Rigan alias Liton
Description: In Bogra, suspected drug peddler Rigan alias Liton,was killed in a gunfight with the police in Matidhali intersaction under the upazila at about 2:30am,said  Additional Superintendent of Police Sanatan Chakraborty.

Name: Yunus Miaji alias Sumon
Description: In Chandpur, suspected drug peddler Yunus, was killed in a gunfight with police at Purba Sriramdi in the district town around 1:45am, said Chandpur Police Officer-in-Charge Wali Ullah Oli.

Name: Manik Mia
Description: Gafargaon Police Station Officer-in-Charge Abdul Ahad said that suspected drug peddler Mani, also named in several cases, was found dead at Klibari Char of the upazila. The police officer said that they, being informed by the locals, recovered the body. He claimed that the drug peddler might have been killed in gunfight between two groups of drug peddlers. The victim's brother Rajab Ali, however, said that the police pickedup Manik from the local bazaar June 4 and since then he was missing.

Name: Munna
Description: In Mymensingh, police recovered the bullet-hit bodies of suspected drug peddlers Munna and Idris Ali of Charkalibari area under Sadar Dakhshin upazila from Brahmapurtra rail bridge area said  Kotwali Police Station Office-in-Charge Mahmudul Islam. Mymensingh district superintendent of police Syed Nurul Islam said that the two were killed in a gunfight over enmity among the drug peddlers. Families of two victims in Mymensingh alleged that they were picked up by some people in plainclothes identifying them as members of DB from Mashkanda Sheba Drug Rehabilitation Centre on June 1.

Name: Idris Ali
Description: In Mymensingh, police recovered the bullet-hit bodies of suspected drug peddlers Munna and Idris Ali of Charkalibari area under Sadar Dakhshin upazila from Brahmapurtra rail bridge area said  Kotwali Police Station Office-in-Charge Mahmudul Islam. Mymensingh district superintendent of police Syed Nurul Islam said that the two were killed in a gunfight over enmity among the drug peddlers. Families of two victims in Mymensingh alleged that they were picked up by some people in plainclothes identifying them as members of DB from Mashkanda Sheba Drug Rehabilitation Centre on June 1.

Name: Azad Kha
Description: Police claimed to have found the bullet-riddled body of a suspected drug dealer in Alalpur area of Faridpur, two days after he was allegedly picked up by several plainclothes DB police. AFM Nasim, Officer-in-Charge of Faridpur Sadar Police Station, said that  a  police team recovered Azad's body after receiving information from local people and recovered the body around 12:15pm and sent it to Faridpur Medical College Hospital for autopsy. Azad's sister Sahera Begum, said, several plainclothes men, identifying themselves as detectives, picked my brother up from his friend's house in Gazaria area around 2:00am on 2 June. My brother was missing since then.

Name: Abu Sayed alias Kalu
Location: Maidapesha canal near Kasiabad forest station in the Sunderban, Koyra, Khulna
Description: Three suspected forest robbers, including the gang leader of Kalu gang were killed in a gunfight between police and suspected forest robbers at Maidapesha canal near Kasiabad forest station in the Sunderbans, police claimed. Koyra Police Station  Officer-in-Charge Mohammad Enamul Haque said members of Kalu gang abducted four fishermen demanding ransom on June 5 and they, on secret information, raided a den of forest robbers at Maidapesha canal to rescue the abducted fishermen. Sensing presence of the police, the robbers fired on police, forcing them to fire back, said Enamul After the gunfight, police found the three forest robbers who sustained bullet injuries and took them to Koyra Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared the trio dead.

Name: Akbar Ali
Location: Maidapesha canal near Kasiabad forest station in the Sunderban, Koyra, Khulna
Description: Three suspected forest robbers, including the gang leader of Kalu gang were killed in a gunfight between police and suspected forest robbers at Maidapesha canal near Kasiabad forest station in the Sunderbans, police claimed. Koyra Police Station  Officer-in-Charge Mohammad Enamul Haque said members of Kalu gang abducted four fishermen demanding ransom on June 5 and they, on secret information, raided a den of forest robbers at Maidapesha canal to rescue the abducted fishermen. Sensing presence of the police, the robbers fired on police, forcing them to fire back, said Enamul After the gunfight, police found the three forest robbers who sustained bullet injuries and took them to Koyra Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared the trio dead.

Name: Shahidul Mallik
Location: Maidapesha canal near Kasiabad forest station in the Sunderban, Koyra, Khulna
Description: Three suspected forest robbers, including the gang leader of Kalu gang were killed in a gunfight between police and suspected forest robbers at Maidapesha canal near Kasiabad forest station in the Sunderbans, police claimed. Koyra Police Station  Officer-in-Charge Mohammad Enamul Haque said members of Kalu gang abducted four fishermen demanding ransom on June 5 and they, on secret information, raided a den of forest robbers at Maidapesha canal to rescue the abducted fishermen. Sensing presence of the police, the robbers fired on police, forcing them to fire back, said Enamul After the gunfight, police found the three forest robbers who sustained bullet injuries and took them to Koyra Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared the trio dead.

Name: Selim Mia
Description: In Kishoreganj, suspected drug peddler Selim Mia of Panchabati area under Bhairab upazila in the district, allegedly named in ten cases, was killed in a gunfight with police at Gachtalaghat area of Bhairab upazila, said Bhairab Police Station Officer-in-Charge Mokhlesur Rahman.

Name: Nusrat Jamil Nitul
Description: In Mymensingh, suspected woman drug trader Nitul, was killed in a gunfight with DB Police.

Name: Shamim Hossain
Description: In Thakurgaon, alleged drug peddler Shamim Hossain, 42, son of late Abdus Sattar of Bhabanandapur village, was killed in a reported gunfight with police in Ranishankoil upazila of the district. Abdul Mannan, Officer-in-Charge of Ranishankoil Police Station said that  on information that a group of traders were taking preparation to deal drugs on Bhradreswari-Jagdal road in Bhradreswari village of the upazila, police conducted a drive there around 1:30am. Sensing presence of police, the drug peddlers opened fire. The law enforcers then retaliated, triggering the gunfight. Shamim was hit by bullets while others fled the scene. Police took Shamim to Thakurgaon Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead, the OC said.

Name: Abu Musa
Description: In Rangpur, a suspected drug peddler, Abu Musa, 26, son of Abdul Kuddus, was killed in a gunfight with police in Rangpur city around 2.00am. The gunfight took place when a police team of Rangpur Sadar Police Station, on information, conducted a raid in Kukrulful area of the city to recover drugs and a group of drug peddlers attacked the law enforcers, said Saiful Islam, Additional Superintendent of police (ASP) in Rangpur.

Name: Abdur Razzak
Description: In Dinajpur, police recovered the bullet-hit body of an alleged criminal Abdur Razzak of village Danihari-Kanakpuri under Sadar upazila from Kharipara under the upazila who was killed in a ' gunfight',said Kotwali Police Station  Officer-in-charge Redwanur Rahim.

Name: Md. Sumon
Description: An alleged robber was killed in a 'gunfight' with police on Chandina- Debidwar road in Debidwar upazilla. Mizanur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Debidwar Police Station said that the deceased was Md Sumon, 35, son of Habibur Rahman of Kuroin in the upazila, also an accused in 15 cases. Informed that a gang was preparing to commit robbery in the area a police team raided there. The robbers opened fire, prompting police to retaliate. Sumon sustained bullet injuries and later died at Comilla Medical College Hospital.

Name: Sohagh
Description: In Comilla, Kotwali Police Station Officer-in-Charge Abu Salam Mia said  that suspected drug peddler Sohagh, 32, of South Chartha Thirura Pukurpar area under Sadar upazila in the district town succumbed to his injuries at Dhaka Medical College Hospital on June 8. The OC said that Sohagh was injured in a gunfight between members of Chawakbazar police outpost and suspected drug peddlers at Mellarkhil area under Sadar upazila on June 1 and he was rushed to Comilla Medical College Hospital. He said that he was later sent to DMCH where he died on June 8.

Name: Shahin Sheikh
Description: In Sirajganj Additional Superintendent of Police Yusuf Ali said that suspected drug peddler Shahin Sheikh, 35, of Mahmudpur of the district town was killed in a gunfight with DB police at about 2:15am.

Name: Shariful Islam
Description: A murder suspect was killed in what DB police claimed was a gunfight in Bhatara cattle market area. According to Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner (North) of Detective Branch of Police on information that a gang of hired killers gathered on 100-Foot Road in Bhatara to commit a target killing, a team of DB police launched a drive there. Sensing the presence of police, the gang opened fire on them, prompting the law enforcers to retaliatel. Following the gunfight, bullet-hit Shariful was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Rony Mia
Description: Suspected peddlers, Rony Mia, 30, of Krishtapur and Anwar Hossain alias Anar, 38, of Banshbari Colony, were killed in a gunfight with the Detective branch of Police at Kalibari Road, Mymensingh City at about 1.45AM said district DB Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman. According to him, DB seized 1,750 yaba tablets, a pistol and three empty cartridges from the spot. Family members however claimed Anwar was picked up by plainclothes police around a week ago and Rony had been traceless since June 11.

Name: Anwar Hossain alias Anar
Description: Suspected peddlers, Rony Mia, 30, of Krishtapur and Anwar Hossain alias Anar, 38, of Banshbari Colony, were killed in a gunfight with the Detective branch of Police at Kalibari Road, Mymensingh City at about 1.45AM said district DB Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman. According to him, DB seized 1,750 yaba tablets, a pistol and three empty cartridges from the spot. Family members however claimed Anwar was picked up by plainclothes police around a week ago and Rony had been traceless since June 11.

Name: Shahidul Islam
Location: Chengutia under Abhaynagar upazila in Jessore
Description: New Age correspondent in Jessore reported that two drug peddlers, who were picked up earlier, were killed in two separate gunfights at Chengutia under Abhaynagar upazila early Monday and near Kutcheymora Poultry Farm on Nabharan  Sathkhira Road under Sharsha upazila in Jessore early Friday. The deceased were Shahidul Islam, 34, of Nawapara industrial town and Montaz Ali, 40, son of Jabed Ali of Khedapara village under Monirampur police station. Montazs relatives said that Montaz was missing since June 12 since the Khedapara camp police picked him from Gangulia. Admitting the arrest of the victim, sub inspector Md Ainuddin, in-charge, Khedapara police camp told new Age that he was picked up from Monirampur Municipality area, not from Gangulia at around 8:30 pm on the day. He was produced in the court on the next day.

Name: Montaz Ali
Location: Kutcheymora Poultry Farm on Nabharan  Sathkhira Road under Sharsha upazila in Jessore
Description: New Age correspondent in Jessore reported that two drug peddlers, who were picked up earlier, were killed in two separate gunfights at Chengutia under Abhaynagar upazila early Monday and near Kutcheymora Poultry Farm on Nabharan  Sathkhira Road under Sharsha upazila in Jessore early Friday. The deceased were Shahidul Islam, 34, of Nawapara industrial town and Montaz Ali, 40, son of Jabed Ali of Khedapara village under Monirampur police station. Montazs relatives said that Montaz was missing since June 12 since the Khedapara camp police picked him from Gangulia. Admitting the arrest of the victim, sub inspector Md Ainuddin, in-charge, Khedapara police camp told new Age that he was picked up from Monirampur Municipality area, not from Gangulia at around 8:30 pm on the day. He was produced in the court on the next day.

Name: Rezaul Karim alias Dipjol
Description: In Bogra, alleged criminal Rezaul Karim alias Dipjol, 38, of Malgram Uttarpara in the district town was killed in a gunfight bat Shilimpur New Bypass area of the town early June 15, said Bogra additional superintendent of police Sanatan Chakrabarty.

Name: Ruhul Amin Bagha
Description: In Shariatpur, Ruhul Amin Bahga, 50, son of Moslem Bagha of Char Jushirgaon in Gosairhat upazila, was killed in a reported gunfight between his cohorts and DB police at Bhadrachand in the upazila around 1:30am on June 15, said the district Superintendent of Police Abdul Momen.

Name: Rehena Akhtar
Description: Police recovered the bullet-hit body of a listed woman drug peddler Rehena Akhtar, 35, wife of late Azizul Islam of Sankipara area in Mymensingh town from Gandhropa of the town on June 17. Kotwali Model Police Station Office-in-Charge Mahmudul Islam said Rehena, might have been killed in a clash between two groups of drug peddlers over sharing of drug money. However, Rehenas daughter Ajeda Begum alleged that her mother was picked up by police from in front of their residence around 4:00pm on June 16.

Name: Al Amin alias Fakir
Description: In Sherpur, Al Amin alias Fakir, 28, son of Sahibor Rahman of Balaichar village under Sadar upazila, was killed in the reported gunfight at Chunierchar at night. Being informed by locals on June 20 in the morning, the police recovered the body from the spot. Nazrul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Sherpur police said that the incident took place at night.  The battalion-14 Company Commander Razib Kumar Dey said that their team conducted an anti-drug drive in the area on June 19, at night and also exchanged gunshots with drug-traders. and he was killed.

Name: Hridoy
Location: Chuadanga-Darshana Road at Damurhuda in Chuadanga
Description: Police said that they recovered bullet hit body ofa suspected drug peddler near the railway crossing on the Chuadanga-Darshana Road at Damurhuda in Chuadanga on June 21. Hridoy, son of Bacchu Mia of Hatathpara, Darshana, Chuadanga district  was a listed drug peddler, Damurhuda police station officer-in-charge Sukumar Biswash said. The OC said that being informed by local that a bullet hit body was lying near the railway crossing, the police recovered it at about 11 AM. The OC  said that it was his suspicion that Hridoy was killed by rival drug peddlers. Hridoys family, however, said that  the police had picked up Hridoy from a shop on June 19 and since then he was missing.

Name: Ali Hossain
Description: Mymensingh district Detective Branch of Police Officer-in-Charge Ashiqur Rahman said that Ali Hossain was killed in gunfihgt with  DB Police near an auto-rice mill on Tarakanda-Phulpur road at about 2:45am.  Mujibur Rahman, memberWard no-2 of Kakni Union Parishad, quoting neighbours said Ali was picked up from his house on June 18 at night and remain traceless since then.

Name: Swapan Mia
Description: Mymensingh Trishal police Station Officer-in-Charge Zakiur Rahman said that suspected drug peddler Swapan was killed in a gunfight with police near Jatiya Kabi Kazi Nazrul Islam University under Trishal upazila around 4:00pm. He was picked by police from Trishal Bus Stand area on June 21 around 6:00pm when he was going to Trishal Bazar to buy meat and taken to the police station-said Rubel Mia, Swapan's younger brother who works in a local newspaper. Rubel claimed they had met Swapan at the police station, given him food and left around 2:00am, but in the morning they received the news that he was killed in a gunfight.

Name: Jakir Farazi
Location: Syadpur village, Kalcho union, Hajiganj, Chandpur
Description: Jakir, an alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police at Syadpur village under Hajiganj upazila. Police said that after  being informed that a gang was preparing to commit robbery in the area a police team raided there. The robbers opened fire, prompting police to retaliate, leaving Jakir died.

Name: Jahangir Hossain
Description: In Sirajganj, a suspected drug peddler Jahangir Hossain, 32, son of late Hatem Ali of Railway Colony Purbapara area, was killed in a 'gunfight' with drug dealers at Mahmudpur field area, police said. Acting on a tip-off, a police team raided the area around 3:00am, Mahmud Daud, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station, said. The criminals opened fire on the police forcing them retaliate. Afterwards police recovered Jahangir's body.

Name: Abdul Mannan
Description: Police recovered the bullet hit body of drug trader Abdul Mannan, 45, son of late Ali Hossain at Kandapara in Tangail municipal area. Police said they suspect Mannan may have been killed in a gunfight following a dispute between two groups of drug traders. However dceased's brothers Golam Rasul, Golam Maula and his son Nazmul Hasan Sumon said police picked up Mannan from his house at 2:00am on June 22. Sanjit Kumar Roy, Superintendent of Police (SP) in Tangail, at a press briefing said police discovered Mannan's body when they raided Charabari are at 7:00am after receiving information from locals.

Name: Mohammad Nizam Uddin Mondol
Identity: Regional leader of a faction of the Sarbahara Party
Description: In Pabna, Sabahara Party leader Md Nizam Uddin Mondol was killed allegedly in a gunfight with police. According to police, Nizam of Mirpur in Aminpur thana, Bera upazila in Pabna, was the regional leader of a faction of the Sarbahara Party. The police described Nizam as the key suspect of murdering three police officers at Dhalarchar police camp in 2010. Nizam was watching a World Cup soccer match on the TV at a neighbours house at 10.15 PM on June 23, when he was picked up by uniformed police, neighbours said.  Pabna Additional Superintendent of Police Goutam Kumar Bishwas said that a team of Amirpur thana police raided Dhaarchar Daspara following tip off that a group of dacoits were taking preparations to commit dacoity. He said the dacoits opened fire forcing the police to retaliate when Nizam was hit by a bullet and the police took him to Bera Upazila Health Complex where he succumbed to his injuries.

Name: Monirul Islam
Description: New Age Correspondent in Jessore, quoting Monirampur police station officer in-charge Mokarram Hossain, reported that police recovered bullet-hit bodies of two suspected miscreants from crop field at Chhatiantala under Monirampur upazila early June 24. The OC claimed that the duo was killed in a gunfight with a rival group. After the bodies were taken to Jessore General Hospital for post mortem examination, relatives identified 30-year old Monirul Islam of Ranagati, Abhaynagar, Jessore.  His brother Mehedi Hasan told reporters that plainclothes police picked up Monirul Islam from the Jessore Central Jails main gate in the afternoon of June 21 after he was released on bail in a murder case. The police, could not, however, identify the other victim.

Name: Unidentified
Description: New Age Correspondent in Jessore, quoting Monirampur police station officer in-charge Mokarram Hossain, reported that police recovered bullet-hit bodies of two suspected miscreants from crop field at Chhatiantala under Monirampur upazila early June 24. The OC claimed that the duo was killed in a gunfight with a rival group. After the bodies were taken to Jessore General Hospital for post mortem examination, relatives identified 30-year old Monirul Islam of Ranagati, Abhaynagar, Jessore.  His brother Mehedi Hasan told reporters that plainclothes police picked up Monirul Islam from the Jessore Central Jails main gate in the afternoon of June 21 after he was released on bail in a murder case. The police, could not, however, identify the other victim.

Name: Mohammad Kaiyum
Location: Chokha Monaksha village under Shibganj upazila, Chapainawabganj
Description: In Chapainawabganj, suspected drug peddler Md Kaiyum, 28, son of Abdul Kuddus of Chokha Monaksha village under Shibganj upazila was killed  in a gunfight with police at about 2:30am, said District Superintendent of Police TM Mozahidul Islam.

Name: Nayem Islam
Description: Rafiqul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Mirpur Police Station, said police arrested Nayem and Joyar on June 25, in connection with the abduction of Deb Dutta, 9, son of Pabitra Dutta, and a class III student of Chitlia Primary School. Based on information provided by the duo, police recovered Debs body from under the ground beside a toilet of Nayems house around 2pm on June 25. Later at night, police conducted a drive in the village along with the duo to arrest other criminals. When the team reached the village, their cohorts opened on law enforcers. Law enforcers retaliated, triggering a gunfight between them, police said. The murder accused sustained bullet wounds when they tried to flee the scene during the gunfight. They were taken to Mirpur Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Joyar Ali
Description: Rafiqul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Mirpur Police Station, said police arrested Nayem and Joyar on June 25, in connection with the abduction of Deb Dutta, 9, son of Pabitra Dutta, and a class III student of Chitlia Primary School. Based on information provided by the duo, police recovered Debs body from under the ground beside a toilet of Nayems house around 2pm on June 25. Later at night, police conducted a drive in the village along with the duo to arrest other criminals. When the team reached the village, their cohorts opened on law enforcers. Law enforcers retaliated, triggering a gunfight between them, police said. The murder accused sustained bullet wounds when they tried to flee the scene during the gunfight. They were taken to Mirpur Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Jakir
Description: Jakir, an alleged drug trader, was killed in a gunfight with DB police at Berirhart Bazar of Digholdi union under Bhola. DB police team raided Bagmara area after informed that some drug traders altercating in that area over drugs. The drug traders opened fire, prompting police to retaliate, leaving Jakir died.

Name: Manik Sheikh
Description: Two alleged drug peddlers were killed in what police claimed was a gunfight in Bagmara area in the city on June 27, hours after their arrest amid the ongoing anti-narcotics drive. Raju's family, however, claimed the police demanded Tk 10 lakh for his release and killed him as they failed to pay the sum. Humayun Kabir, Officer-in-Charge of Khulna Sadar police, said a team of law enforcers from Khulna arrested Raju and Manik in Dhaka on June 26 and brought them to the city as they were listed drug peddlers. After interrogation, the police took them to recover drugs in Bankers Lane area around 3:30am. Sensing the presence of police, their cohorts opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one stage, the police recovered the bodies of Raju and Manik, while their cohorts fled. Titli Begum, Raju's wife, said  that police picked up her husband from New Market area in Khulna on June 26. I met the police and requested them to free him, but they demanded Tk 10 lakh for that. We wanted to arrange a press conference at Khulna Press Club, but civil police did not allow us, she alleged.

Name: Raju
Description: Two alleged drug peddlers were killed in what police claimed was a gunfight in Bagmara area in the city on June 27, hours after their arrest amid the ongoing anti-narcotics drive. Raju's family, however, claimed the police demanded Tk 10 lakh for his release and killed him as they failed to pay the sum. Humayun Kabir, Officer-in-Charge of Khulna Sadar police, said a team of law enforcers from Khulna arrested Raju and Manik in Dhaka on June 26 and brought them to the city as they were listed drug peddlers. After interrogation, the police took them to recover drugs in Bankers Lane area around 3:30am. Titli Begum, Raju's wife, said  that police picked up her husband from New Market area in Khulna on June 26. I met the police and requested them to free him, but they demanded Tk 10 lakh for that.
