Name: Shamsul Alam Markin
Description: Coxs Bazar Police Station Officer-in-Charge Farid Uddin Khandaker said they, on information from the locals, recovered Shamsuls bullet-hit body from Kalatali Kata Pahar area in the district town on 29 September. Meanwhile Shamsul's brother Abdus Samad alleged that his brother went missing tow days ago on his way to Cox's Bazar.

Name: Ali Nur
Description: In Narayanganj  a suspected drug peddler Ali Nur, 50, of Bari Majlish under Sonargaon in the district was killed in a gunfight with the police at Chilarbag area of the upazila during an anti-drug drive at about 5:00am, said Narayanganj assistant superintendent of police Faruque Hossain.

Name: Mohammad Imran
Description: In Coxs Bazar, suspected drug peddler Mohammad Imran of Hnila in the district was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and the police at Dargabeel area under Teknaf upazila in the district at about 5:00am, said Teknaf Police Station Officer-in-Charge Ranjit Kumar Barua. OC Ranjit claimed that the gunfight between Imrans cohorts and the police occurred when the police raided Dargabeel area with Imran, arrested on 29 September night, to recover drugs and nab his cohorts.

Name: Mahmudul Karim
Description: Maheshkhali police station OC Pradip Kumar Das said that suspected drug peddler cum crimes suspect Mahmudul Karim, 37, of Dakhkhinkul under Maheshkhali upazila in Coxs Bazar was killed in a gunfight with the police during an anti-drug drive in Shaplar Doba area of the upazila at about 5:00am.

Name: Abul Hossain
Identity: District commander of Purbo Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-ML) Lal Pataka faction
Description: Abul Hossain, an outlawed party leader was killed in a gunfight with police. Goutam Kumar Biswas, Additional Superintendent of Pabna police, said acting on a tip-off, police arrested Abul from his village on 30 September. During interrogation, Abu informed police about their arms den. As per his statement, a police team took him to Dhopaghata area for recovering firearms and explosives around 3:00am on 1 October. When the team reached near the Dhopaghata bridge, Abul's associates opened fire. Police returned fire, triggering the gunfight. At one stage, Abul attempted to flee and was hit by bullets. The others managed to escape, the additional SP said, adding that Abul was taken to Pabna General Hospital where he died later.

Name: Alamgir Hossain
Location: Khidirpur Madhya Char area of Rajshahi
Description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with DB Police. Iftekhar Alam, Assistant Commissioner (AC) of Rajshahi Metropolitan Police said that the gunfight ensued around 1:45am when a team of DB police challenged a group of drug peddlers in the area and they opened fire on the law enforcers. Alamgir was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries. He was declared dead at Rajshahi Medical College Hospital.

Name: Asim Roy Babu
Description: Mimtanur Rahman, Senior Assistant Director of RAB-7 (Media wing), said a RAB team received a tip-off that drug peddlers would cross the Bibirhat Railway Gate area in Muradpur. As the team signalled a car to pull over at a temporary check post in the area, its passengers opened fire on the RAB men. Members of the elite force fired back, triggering the gunfight. The shooting ended after sometime and the RAB team found bullet-hit Asim lying injured on the spot. He was sent to Chittagong Medical College Hospital (CMCH) where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Sharif Ahmed
Description: Shah Kamal Akanda, Officer-in-Charge of Detective Branch of police in Mymensingh, said on information that a group of drug dealers were conducting business in Kalibari area, a DB team, led by him, went there around 1:00am. Sensing their presence, the group, opened fire and when they retaliated, Sharif received bullet wounds. He was declared dead at Mymensingh Medical College Hospital.  Sharif's mother Shirin Akhter said Sharif went out with some friends after Juma prayers on 12 October afternoon. She said, "my son was never involved in drug business. In the evening, locals informed that some people in plainclothes picked him up in a black microbus in front of Palika Shopping Centre in Station Road area. Sharmin Akhter, his elder sister, said they went to Kotwali Police Station and DB office right away to find his whereabouts. Sharif used to co-run a dry goods business with his elder brother. When asked, OC Shah Kamal Akanda of the DB police denied any incident of Sharif being picked up.

Name: Farhad Sharif
Identity: A leader of Purba Banglar Communist Party (Red Flag faction)
Location: Dainna Chowdhury Madhyapara in Tangail Sadar
Description: Acting on a tip off that a group of PBCP members had gathered for a secret meeting at Dainna Chowdhury Madhyapara, a RAB team raided the area around 2:00am, RAB-12 Crime Prevention Company-3 Commander Major Mohammed Robiul Islam claimed. When the PBCP members became alert of the presence of the elite force, Sharif and his cohorts opened fire on the RAB team and prompted them to retaliate. Farhad was shot in the gunfight that ensued while the other members of the party fled the scene. Major Robiul Islam said they took Fathad to Tangail General Hospital when the gunfight ended where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Payel
Description: Mymensingh Detective Branch of Police Officer-in-Charge Shah Kamal Akand said that following tip off that a group of five to six suspected drug peddlers had gathered at Akua, a team of DB police conducted a drive on the spot at about 1:15am. According to Akand, sensing presence of police the peddlers opened fire prompting retaliation by the DB and after the ensuing gunfight injured Payel was rescued from the spot and sent to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Jahid
Description: Kotwali Police Station OC said that the police recovered the bullet riddled body of Mohammad Jahid, son of Abdul Mamman after a gunfight at Mandalgati in Jashore at around 3:30am on 16 October. Jashore Kotwali Police Station Officer-in-Charge Apurba Hasan said that the police seized some drugs from the spot. Sohel, brother of the deceased said that his brother was picked up by plainclothes police from a business enterprise near the Jashore Railway Station at around 9:00pm on 15 October. The Kotwali OC, however, denied the allegation.

Name: Jahid Hassan
Description: The Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Police Station said they raided Mangalgati village Jahid Hassan, son of Hannan Mollah, was killed in a gunfight around 3:30am.

Name: Billu Parvez
Description: A suspected miscreant was killed in a gunfight at Bablatala of Shankarpur. Kotwali Police Officer-in-Charge Apurba Hasan said that the police recovered the bullet-hit body of Billu after a gunfight between two groups of miscreants around 3:45am. Acting on a tip-off the police went to the spot and recovered the victim and took him to Jashore General Hospital where doctors declared him dead. However, the victims family alleged that Billu was picked up from Sonaganda in Khulna town on 17 October night by some policemen in plainclothes. The police denied the allegation.

Name: Abu Bakka
Location: Choto Achra area of Benapole in Jessore
Description: In Jashore, police said Abu Bakka (35) was shot dead during an exchange of fire between two groups of drug dealers in Choto Achra area of Benapole. But his wife Safia Khatun said that Bakka was picked up from Jashore town on 17 October by a group of men in plainclothes claiming to be police. However, police said they did not detain him.

Name: Tipu Sheikh
Description: In Pabna, RAB said Tipu Sheikh, 45, who was killed during a gunfight with its officers, was accused in eight drug cases. Lt Commander Ruhul Amin, Company Commander of RAB-12, said the gunfight took place when a team of the elite force raided Rajapur Kaliko Cotton Mill area around 3:00am after being tipped off about the presence of drug dealers. He added that Tipu was shot when armed gang members began to shoot at RAB men and they retaliated. Tipu was pronounced dead at a local hospital.

Name: Mofiz Alam
Location: Maheshkhaliapara, Teknaf on the Marine Drive between Teknaf and Coxs Bazar
Description: A suspected drag peddler was killed allegedly in gunfight at Maheshkhaliapara. He was allegedly a yaba trader according to the list prepared by the police. Teknaf police station officer-in-charge Pradip Kumar Das said that on a tiff off from locals that a gunfight was taking place between two drug peddler groups on the Marine Drive, police rushed to the spot hearing gunfight. Police also fired back. Later a bullet-hit body was recovered and that the victim was identified by the locals as Mofiz Alam.

Name: Hamidul Islam
Location: Damdamia area under Teknaf upazila in Coxs Bazar
Description: Teknaf Police Station Officer-in-Charge Pradip Kumar Das, said that they, on informed from the locals about a gunfight between two groups of drug peddlers at Ulochamry under Teknaf, rushed to the spot at about 5:00am. He said that the groups, sensing the presence of police, opened fire on the police personnel and the cops also retaliated by firing that triggered a gunfight. As the suspected drug peddlers fled away, they found a bullet-hit body whom locals later identified as Hamidul.

Name: Hasan Ali
Description: Teknaf Police Station Officer-in-Charge Pradip Kumar Das said that the police got the tip off that gun fight broke out between local yaba peddlers and criminals over unloading yaba tablets at Sabrang Katabunia. He said that the police rushed to the spot at about 4:00am and sensing police presence, the peddlers opened fire and the police retaliated when Hasan and Kamal were injured but their cohorts fled away. He claimed that the police rescued both the bullet-hit peddlers and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where they died later.

Name: Hossain Prakash Kamal
Description: Teknaf Police Station Officer-in-Charge Pradip Kumar Das said that the police got the tip off that gun fight broke out between local yaba peddlers and criminals over unloading yaba tablets at Sabrang Katabunia. He said that the police rushed to the spot at about 4:00am and sensing police presence, the peddlers opened fire and the police retaliated when Hasan and Kamal were injured but their cohorts fled away. He claimed that the police rescued both the bullet-hit peddlers and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where they died later.

Name: Haidul Farazi
Location: Jamalpur border in Daulatpur Upazila, Kushtia
Description: Lt Col Rashed Khan, Commander of 47 BGB Battalion, said a patrol team of Joypur BGB camp asked for the identities of a gang of 14 to 15 people when they were returning home along with drugs from India around 3:30am. The gang then opened fire, forcing the BGB men to retaliate. After the gun battle, the BGB men found a body lying on the spot. The victim was later identified as Haidul.

Name: Mohammad Azam
Description: In Kushtia Sadar, suspected drug peddler Mohammad Azam, 45, was killed in a reported gunfight with police when the law enforcers carried out a raid in Kaburhat village around 2:30am on information that two drug peddling gangs had gathered there, said Officer-in-Charge of Kushtia Police Station Nasir Uddin. The drug peddlers opened fire at police, prompting a gunfight that left Azam dead, he claimed, adding that the man was earlier accused in 13 cases related to narcotics. Madon Ali, suspected drug peddler killed in a reported gunfight with police. A relative of Mohammad Azam, preferring anonymity, said police had arrested both Azam and Madon earlier on 29 October after a gunfight between drug peddlers and Border Guard Bangladesh at Jamalpur border in Daulatpur upazila.

Name: Madon Ali
Description: In Kushtia Sadar, suspected drug peddler Mohammad Azam, 45, was killed in a reported gunfight with police when the law enforcers carried out a raid in Kaburhat village around 2:30am on information that two drug peddling gangs had gathered there, said Officer-in-Charge of Kushtia Police Station Nasir Uddin. The drug peddlers opened fire at police, prompting a gunfight that left Azam dead, he claimed, adding that the man was earlier accused in 13 cases related to narcotics. Madon Ali, suspected drug peddler killed in a reported gunfight with police. A relative of Mohammad Azam, preferring anonymity, said police had arrested both Azam and Madon earlier on 29 October after a gunfight between drug peddlers and Border Guard Bangladesh at Jamalpur border in Daulatpur upazila.

Name: Anwar Hossain
Description: Anwar Hossain,  an alleged robber, was killed in an alleged gun battle with police. As a police team conducted a raid in Kadigrah area around 2:00am on information of a robbery attempt, the robbers opened fire on the law enforcers, who fired back. Anwar sustained bullet wounds and was taken to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Saddam Hossain
Description: Two young men were shot dead hours after they were arrested in Teknaf. Saddam Hossain and Saddam Hossain were arrested around 10:00pm on 2 October, said Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station in Cox's Bazar. He claimed that they were shot dead around 3:00am at Baharchara where a police team took them to recover arms and yaba pills. The shootout took place when armed gang members opened fire at police to snatch the arrestees away, the OC said, adding that police retaliated and the two arrestees were shot.

Name: Saddam Hossain
Description: Two young men were shot dead hours after they were arrested in Teknaf. Saddam Hossain and Saddam Hossain were arrested around 10:00pm on 2 October, said Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station in Cox's Bazar. He claimed that they were shot dead around 3:00am at Baharchara where a police team took them to recover arms and yaba pills. The shootout took place when armed gang members opened fire at police to snatch the arrestees away, the OC said, adding that police retaliated and the two arrestees were shot.

Name: Abdullahel Kafi
Identity: Suspected member of banned militant outfit Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
Location: Jhaloi Bridge area on Rasulpur-Kathalia road in Muktagacha, Mymensingh
Description: Kafi, a listed JMB member in Mymensingh, was killed when a gang of robbers were planning a robbery, in which Kafi was allegedly involved, in Jhaloi Bridge area on Rasulpur-Kathalia road in Muktagacha. After a tip-off, a DB team raided the area around 12:30am. The robbers fired at the police officials, forcing them to retaliate. Kafi sustained bullet wounds during the gunfight, OC Akanda said. Kafi was taken to MMCH where he was declared dead. Police claimed to have recovered a gun and two used bullets from the spot.

Name: Alamgir Hossain Gudu
Identity: An electrician and suspected drug peddler
Location: Shaheed Kachari Bazar area beside the Myemnsingh-Kishoreganj highway
Description: Alamgir, was killed in an alleged gunfight with police in Shaheed Kachari Bazar area beside the Myemnsingh-Kishoreganj highway. Shah Kamal Akanda, officer-in-charge (OC) of DB police in Mymensingh, said a team of detectives raided the area around 1:30am upon receiving information that a gang of drug peddlers had gone there. When police reached the spot, the drug peddlers fired at the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, leading to the gunfight. Alamgir sustained bullet wounds during the incident, he said. Alamgir was taken to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH) where he was declared dead.  Alamgir's family members alleged that he was killed three days after he had been picked up by plainclothes men. Police, however, denied the allegation. Meanwhile Alamgir's father Mohammad Ibrahim, said Alamgir came home on 30 October evening. Around 10:00pm, plainclothes men picked him up from our home, he said, adding that they searched for Alamgir at Kotwali Police Station and the DB office several times and asked about his whereabouts but police denied picking him up.

Name: Ratan Ali
Description: Ratan Ali, was killed in what police said was a gunfight. Khondokar Shamim Uddin, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Bheramara Police Station, said a police team rushed to the spot around 3:30am a found Ranat's dead body on the spot.

Name: Khorshed Alam alias Salim
Identity: The chief coordinator of banned militant outfit Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB)
Description: The chief coordinator of JMB was killed in a gunfight with police. Bogura police officials said that acting on a tip off that some militants were holding a secret meeting in Pirab Tatipukur area, a team from Shibganj Police Station raided the spot around 1:30am. Sensing the presence of police, the alleged JMB men opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to return fire, said Sonatan Chakraborty, Additional Superintendent of Police of Bogura Sadar circle. At one stage, the alleged militants retreated and the police found a bullet-hit man. They took him to Bogura Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Enamul Haq Ena
Location: Nishchintapur village in Meherpur Sadar Upazila
Description: Enamul Haq Ena, was killed in a 'gunfight' with members of Detective Branch (DB) of Police at Nishchintapur village. Being informed that two groups of drug peddlers were gathering at the village for an illegal drug deal, a team of plainclothes policemen conducted a raid there around 2:00am, Officer-in-Charge of Meherpur DB Police Obaidur Rahman said. As the police team reached the spot, the gang of drug peddlers opened fire on them, prompting them to retaliate. After 20 minutes of gunfight, police found Ena's bullet-riddled body on the spot. Deceased's elder brother Sobdel Ali said locals told the family that some plainclothes men picked up his brother from a local marker on 5 November.

Name: Salauddin
Description: Salauddin, a suspected leader of a robbery gang was killed in an alleged gunfight in Shariatpur. Abdul Momen, Superintendent of Police in Shariatpur, said a team from the Detective Branch (DB) of police arrested Salauddin from Kajirhat in Jajira upazila on 6 November. After obtaining information from the primary interrogation, a police team from Palong Model Police Station raided an orchard near a mosque in the village around 1:30am. The law enforcers had taken Salauddin along with them. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, his gang members opened fire, prompting the police officials to fire back. Salauddin was left with bullet injuries after the gunfight. He was taken to Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Ali Hossain alias Sona Miah
Description: Inspector (Investigation) of Teknaf Model Police Station ABMS Doha said, that upon hearing gunshots in Dhalarmukh on Hoaikkong-Baharchhora road. A team of law enforcers rushed to the spot, recovered Ali's body and sent it to Teknaf upazila Health Complex. Dr Mostafizur Rahman, of the emergency department, said there were two bullet wounds on Ali's chest and back. Officer-in-Charge (OC) of the Police Station Pradip Kumar Das said Ali was a listed yaba trader. The body was sent to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital morgue for an autopsy.

Name: Mohammad Ali Sheikh
Identity: A suspected leader of Red Flag faction  of the banned Purba Banglar Communist Party (PBCP)
Location: Kuthi Pachuria area in Rajbari Sadar
Description: Tipped off that a group of miscreants had gathered in Kuthi Pachuria area, a police team went to raid the place, said Officer-in-Charge of the Detective Branch in Rajbari Kamal Hossain Bhuiyan. When the cops reached the area at about 1:30am, the suspected miscreants opened fire on them, causing them to fire back. As the gunfight ended and the other miscreants escaped, the police rescued Mohammad Ali who had been shot and rushed him to Rajbari Sadar Hospital where duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Abul Bashar alias Pappu
Description: According to Officer-in-Charge of Chuadanga Sadar Police Station Delwar Hossain, the law enforcers had information that a group of drug traders carrying contraband phensidyl was entering Bangladesh territory from India through Uzalpur border. A police team was sent to the area. When they located a group of people at Uzalpur field, police asked them to stop. But the group responded by opening fire on police prompting them to retaliate. The gun-battle lasted an hour, the OC said. Police recovered Pappu's body after the gunfight, he claimed. The law enforcers also claimed to have recovered a shutter gun, four crude bombs and 170 bottles of phensidyl from the spot. The OC said Pappu was an accused in six cases -- one for murder, four for drugs-related offences and one for explosions -- filed with Chuadanga Sadar Police. His family members claimed that plainclothes men had picked up Pappu on 5 November near Chuadanga Judge Court soon after he appeared before the court in a narcotics case.

Name: Ziaul Bashir Shaheen
Description: According to the family members, Shaheen was picked up in a microbus by a group of people, who claimed to be law enforcers, from a local mosque where he went to pray Jum'a prayers on 9 November. Some locals said they saw Shaheen being picked up by plainclothes men. He had been missing since then. However, Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Teknaf police Station, said, "Shaheen was killed in a tripartite gun battle in Dorgapara area."  According to the OC, a police team rushed to the spot following a tip-off that said two groups of drug peddlers had been locked in a gunfight in Dorgapara area. Sensing police presence, the drug traders opened fire at the law enforcers. Shaheen died on the spot during the "gunfight".

Name: Mohammad Shamsuddin
Location: Dhaka-Chattogram highway in Sitakunda upazila of Chattogram
Description: Delwar Hossain, Officer-in-Charge of Sitakunda Police Station, said a group of robbers was preparing for a robbery in Nonachara area of Mandaritola village. Acting on a tip-off, police rushed to the spot. Sensing police presence, the group of robbers opened fire, which made the police retaliate with gunshot.

Name: Shamim Hossain
Description: According to Deepak Chandra Saha, Officer-in-Charge of Dhamrai Police Station, Shamim, from Jashore, was the ringleader of a notorious robbery gang in Savar. He said Shamim was arrested by a police team from Kalampur area of Savar on 11 November. Acting on Shamim's information, another police team conducted a drive in Ashulia's Tongabari area for arresting his cohorts. Sensing police presence, Shamim's cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate which triggered the "gunfight,". Shamim was killed on the spot when he was caught in the line of fire while trying to flee.

Name: Mohammad Masud Rana
Description: Rana, who was killed in Rangpur's Gangachara upazila, was preparing for a robbery along with his accomplices, said Saifur Rahman, Additional Superintendent of Police in Rangpur. Acting on a tip-off, a police team rushed to the spot. Sensing police presence, the robbers opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate with gunfire. . Police sent the body to Rangpur Medical College for autopsy.

Name: Robiul Alam
Description: Robiul was killed in a gunfight with the police. Police claimed that he was main accused of Jolla union chairman Bishwajit Ghosh Nantu murder case. He was arrested by police on 12 November. Acting on Robiul's information, police team conducted a drive in Pirerpar Fultola area to rescue drugs. Sensing police presence, Robuil's cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate which triggered the "gunfight". Robiul was bullet hit. Police rescued him and took him to Ujirpur Hospital where duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Sumon Mia
Description: Sumon Mia, was killed in a gunfight with police. On information that drug peddlers were selling drugs in Char Puliamari area, a team of Detective Branch of police raided the area around 12:45am, said Md Shah Kamal Akanda, Officer-in-Charge of DB, Mymensingh. Sensing the presence of police, the drug dealers opened fire on them, forcing the DB police to retaliate. During the gunfight Sumon sustained bullet wounds, said the OC, adding, he was rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.  Sumon's eldest daughter Sumi Akhter said someone called her father over cellphone around 8:30pm on 13 November. They did not have any information about his whereabouts anymore. Family members and relatives demanded a neutral investigation into the killing, but the police denied picking up Sumon.

Name: Mohammad Belal
Location: Borodhail area near Marine Drive Road of Teknaf in Coxs Bazar
Description: Mohammad Belal was killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Mohammad Tajel
Description: Tajel, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a gunfight with police. Tajel, was jailed for seven years in a robbery case. Yunus Ali, officer-in-charge of Sreenagar Police Station said that acting on a tip off, police arrested Tajel from Manirampur upazila in Jessore on 16 November. The law enforcers later took him to Pashchim Baroikhali in Sreenagar around 1:00 am to recover hidden firearms.

Name: Farid Alam
Description: Teknaf Police Station Officer-in-Charge Pradip Kumar Das said that they arrested Farid in Lengurbil area on 17 November noon. Based on the information extracted from Farid, a police team went to a house at Lengurbil along with him to recover yaba tablets which were brought to Bangladesh by the arrested and his gang a day ago. The OC said that when the team reached near the house at about 3:30am. Farids accomplices opened fire targeting them, prompting them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight. When the gunfight ended they rescued critically injured Farid and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Abul Hasan Manik
Description: Mehedi Hasan, Company Commander of RAB-7 in Cox's Bazar, said RAB conducted a raid in Sonadia mangrove forest around 4:00am after a tip-off about a gang of robbers planning a robbery on the Bay of Bengal. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the criminals opened fire at the RAB men, prompting them to retaliate. After a gunfight, Manik was found with severe bullet injuries and was taken to Moheshkhali Upazila Health Complex. He was declared dead around 8:15am.

Name: Didarul Islam
Location: North Amjakhali under Kutubdia in Coxs Bazar
Description: RAB-7 Coxs Bazar Company Commander Mehadi Hassan said on receiving secret information that 20 to 25 pirates gathered at North Amjakhali village before setting off to the Bay of Bengal for committing robbery, a team of RAB conducted a raid there. He claimed that as they reached the area, suspected pirates opened fire at RAB personnel who also retaliated by firing, triggering a gunfight. As the gunfight ended, they rescued bullet hit Didar from the spot. The RAB official said that they sent Didar to Kutubdia Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Ashik Jahangir Kudrat
Location: Keruntoli area under Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar
Description: Two alleged drug peddlers were killed in an exchange of fire with RAB-7 members. Major Mehedi said the criminals opened fire on them when the elite force members signaled a Cox's Bazar-bound truck to stop at a checkpoint in Teknaf's Keruntoli area. The two criminals came in the line of fire and died on the spot while the others managed to escape the scene, when the RAB members fired back.

Name: Arif Hossain
Location: Keruntoli area under Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar
Description: Two alleged drug peddlers were killed in an exchange of fire with RAB-7 members. Major Mehedi said the criminals opened fire on them when the elite force members signaled a Cox's Bazar-bound truck to stop at a checkpoint in Teknaf's Keruntoli area. The two criminals came in the line of fire and died on the spot while the others managed to escape the scene, when the RAB members fired back.

Name: Mobarak Hossain
Location: Nayanpur of Bhaluka Upazila in Mymensingh
Description: Mobarak Hossain, an alleged robber was killed in a shootout with DB police. Shah Kamal Akanda, officer-in-charge of Detective Branch of police in Mymensingh, said Mobarak Hossain was arrested on 21 November. Based on his information, police took him to Nayanpur to recover firearms around 1:00am. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, his cohorts opened fire. The policemen returned fire, triggering the gunfight. Mobarak was hit by bullets when he tried to flee. He was rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Nozir Ahmed Prakash and Abdul Amin
Location: Hariakhali Tourist Zone of Teknaf upazila in Cox's Bazar
Description: Nozir and Amin were killed in a gunfight with police. They were accused in several drug and robbery cases, police said. Pradip Kumar Das, OC of Teknaf Police Station, said they arrested Nozir in Sabrang area on 20 November. After gleaning information from Nozir, police brought him to Hariakhali to recover drugs. His associates, who were waiting there, fired bullets on them, forcing the policemen to retaliate. After the gun battle was over, police found Nozir and Amin bullet-hit. They were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Abdul Amin
Location: Hariakhali Tourist Zone of Teknaf upazila in Cox's Bazar
Description: Nozir and Amin were killed in a gunfight with police. They were accused in several drug and robbery cases, police said. Pradip Kumar Das, OC of Teknaf Police Station, said they arrested Nozir in Sabrang area on 20 November. After gleaning information from Nozir, police brought him to Hariakhali to recover drugs. His associates, who were waiting there, fired bullets on them, forcing the policemen to retaliate. After the gun battle was over, police found Nozir and Amin bullet-hit. They were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Shahidul Islam alias Shahid Miah
Description: Shahidul Islam, was killed with RAB at Moglabazar. The incident happened when RAB men raided the spot on information that some drug traders were holding a secret meeting there, said Main Uddin Chowdhury, Assistant Director of RAB-9. Shahid was declared dead after being taken to Sylhet MAG Osmani Medical College Hospital.

Name: Abul Hossain Sheikh
Description: Abul Hossain Sheikh, an alleged drug trader died in a shootout with the RAB. Major Ashik Billal, Deputy Commander of RAB-11 said that a RAB patrol team raided Deulbari village to detain Abul and his cohorts who were holding a secret meeting beside Tongibari main road around 1:00am. The gunfight took place when the gang opened fire on the RAB team.

Name: Khokon Ali
Description: In Kushtia, police claimed that Khokon, was killed in a gunfight at Sadar upazila. Nasir Uddin, OC of Kushtia Sadar police, said that Khokon's body was lying beside a road and they rushed to Mollahteghoria area around 3:00am. Deceased's father Subarek Ali said that his son Khokon had gone missing several days ago.

Name: Ziaur Rahman
Location: Marine Drive road area of Teknaf Upazila, Cox's Bazar
Description: Cox's Bazar police claimed Ziaur Rahman, was killed in the Marine Drive road area of Teknaf upazila as law enforcers conducted a raid there around 4:00am. Sensing the presence of police, criminals opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate. Ziaur was injured during the gunfight. He was taken to a local health complex where doctors declared him dead, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf police. Nur Kalam Nuru, Ziaur's uncle, said that his nephew left home on September 20 for three months to attend Tabligi Jamaat, a non-political Islamic missionary movement. Nuru alleged some plainclothes men identifying themselves as police picked him up from a mosque in Gopalganj's Tungipara on 23 November. He was missing since then.

Name: Emon Emu alias Sultan alias Yasin
Description: Emon, was killed in a gunfight with the Detective Branch of Police. Masudur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner (Media) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police said that acting on a tip-off, a team of DB police carried out a raid around 2:55am near Dhupkhola Math in Gandaria area where a group of armed criminals had gathered. Sensing presence of law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on police forcing them to retaliate and triggered a gunfight, leaving Emon critically injured. Emon was declared dead after being taken to Mitford Hospital while his associates managed to escape the scene.

Name: Selim
Location: Jashore-Chougaccha road in Dogachia Bazar area, Jessore
Description: Selim, was killed in a gunfight with police on Jashore-Chougaccha road. Tipped off that two groups of robbers were exchanging bullets among them, a team of Detective Brach of police conducted a drive in the area around 3:30am, said Maniruzzaman, Officer-in-Charge of DB police. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on them forcing the DB men to fire retaliatory shots. At one stage, police recovered Selim's bullet-hit body and took it to the morgue of Jashore Sadar Hospital for an autopsy.

Name: Babul Munshi
Description: Babul Munshi, a murder accused was killed in a gunfight with police in Ashulia. Acting on a tip-off, a police team raided Nischintapur area to arrest them around 2:30am, said Javed Mashud, Officer-in-Charge (Investigation) of Ashulia Police Station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, Babul and his accomplices opened fire, prompting police to retaliate which triggered a gunfight, the OC said, adding that Babul was hit by bullets. But his associates managed to flee. Babul was taken to Savar Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, the OC said, adding that the body was sent to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College morgue for an autopsy.

Name: Habib Ullah alias Habib
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Taknaf Model Police Station, said law enforcers picked Habib up on 30 November night as he was an enlisted yaba trader. Following Habib's statement, a police team took him to Shaplapur Puranpara area of Teknaf to recover yaba tablets. When the police team reached the area, Habib's cohorts opened "gunshots" at police officials, forcing them to retaliate. During the exchange of "gunshots" Habib escaped and his cohorts retreated. Later, police found Habib injured when they searched the area and he died later.

Name: Rabiul Hasan
Description: Rabiul Hasan, was killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB. RAB-11 Senior Assistant Director Alep Uddin said based on a tip-off, a RAB team raided a house at Shahidnagar around 4:30am. When a RAB official knocked on the door, someone inside the house began firing. When RAB men retaliated, a gunfight ensued. When RAB later entered the house, they found the bullet-hit body of Rabiul Hasan.  He was taken to Narayanganj General Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Moshiur Rahman Dhulo
Description: Two accused drug dealers were killed in a gunfight with police. Sukumar Biswas, Officer-in-Sharge of Damurhuda Model Police Station said that police, acting on a tip-off, rushed to Gobindhuda field where two groups of drug dealers were engaged in an exchange of fire over establishing supremacy in the area around 1:30am. When police asked the gangs to surrender, they opened fire on the law enforcers. Police retaliated and after a gunfight that went on for nearly an hour, officers found the bodies at the scene.

Name: Jhantu Rahman
Description: Two accused drug dealers were killed in a gunfight with police. Sukumar Biswas, Officer-in-Sharge of Damurhuda Model Police Station said that police, acting on a tip-off, rushed to Gobindhuda field where two groups of drug dealers were engaged in an exchange of fire over establishing supremacy in the area around 1:30am. When police asked the gangs to surrender, they opened fire on the law enforcers. Police retaliated and after a gunfight that went on for nearly an hour, officers found the bodies at the scene.

Name: Tarek
Location: Moghnama area in Pekua Upazila of Cox's Bazar
Description: Tarek, was killed in a "gunfight" with RAB. Cox's Bazar Camp Company Commander of RAB-7 Major Md Mehedi Hasan said that RAB had information that the robbers were coming to take ransom from the boat owners at Moghnama Ghat area. Upon receiving the information they raided the spot. Sensing their presence, robbers opened fire on them, and the law enforcers retaliated. Later, RAB members recovered the body of Md Tarek.

Name: Jalal Yusuf alias Bahadur
Description: Jalal Yusuf alias Bahadur, was killed in a gunfight with police. He was named in the list of yaba traders prepared by the Home Ministry. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station. said that police arrested Jalal from his house around 10:00pm on 6 December. Based on his information, police took him to Moulovipara village to recover yaba tablets around 4:00am. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, his associates opened fire. Police then returned fire, triggering the gunfight. Jalal was hit by bullets when he tried to flee from police custody, while the others escaped, the OC said, adding that Jalal was declared dead after being taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex.

Name: Khasru Miah
Description: Two suspected criminals were killed in a gunfight with RAB. RAB-11 SP Enayet Hossain Manna, who led the drive, said the two criminals went near Ballabari mosque in Munshiganj Sadar upazila around 1:45pm. On information, RAB conducted the drive. He claimed the criminals opened fire on RAB first forcing them to retaliate. During the gunfight, the two criminals were hit with bullet and died on the spot.

Name: Md Sumon
Description: Two suspected criminals were killed in a gunfight with RAB. RAB-11 SP Enayet Hossain Manna, who led the drive, said the two criminals went near Ballabari mosque in Munshiganj Sadar upazila around 1:45pm. On information, RAB conducted the drive. He claimed the criminals opened fire on RAB first forcing them to retaliate. During the gunfight, the two criminals were hit with bullet and died on the spot.

Name: Sahab Uddin Prokash Haque Saab
Description: Sahab Uddin was killed in a gunfight with police at Banchharampur. During gunfight between police and robbers, Sahab was hit by bullets. Firstly Sahab was taken to upazila health complex. Later, he was transferred to Noakhali General Hospital where he died.

Name: Asad
Location: Silonia Bazar area of Daganbhuiyan upazila, Feni
Description: Two suspected drug dealers were killed in a shootouts with RAB. The shootout occurred when a RAB team, on information that drugs were being smuggled, signaled a lorry to stop in Silonia Bazar area of Daganbhuiyan upazila around 12:30am, said Shafayet Jamil Fahim, commander of RAB-7 in Feni. Those inside the lorry began shooting at the Rab men while trying to escape, which forced the law enforcers to retaliate, triggering a gunfight in which Asad and Imamul sustained bullet injuries, he said. RAB recovered the bodies and seized the lorry.

Name: Imamul Akand
Location: Silonia Bazar area of Daganbhuiyan upazila, Feni
Description: Two suspected drug dealers were killed in a shootouts with RAB. The shootout occurred when a RAB team, on information that drugs were being smuggled, signaled a lorry to stop in Silonia Bazar area of Daganbhuiyan upazila around 12:30am, said Shafayet Jamil Fahim, commander of RAB-7 in Feni. Those inside the lorry began shooting at the Rab men while trying to escape, which forced the law enforcers to retaliate, triggering a gunfight in which Asad and Imamul sustained bullet injuries, he said. RAB recovered the bodies and seized the lorry.

Name: Saiful
Description: In Cumilla, an alleged drug peddler, Saiful, 24, was killed in a gunfight with police in Monagram area of the Sadar upazila. Abu Faysal Miah, officer-in-charge (OC) of Kotwali Model Police Station, said Saiful had been facing three cases filed under the narcotics act.

Name: Musaed Hossain
Location: Buripota village of Meherpur's Sadar upazila
Description: A man was killed in what police said was a gunfight between two groups of drug traders in Buripota village  According to police, Musaed was a listed drug dealer in the bordering areas of the district. Rabiul Islam, officer-in-charge of Meherpur Sadar Police Station, said hearing gunshots, a team of police went to the spot around 3:30am and found the bullet-hit body.

Name: Abdul Barek
Location: Muktapur Naldanga under Damurhuda upazila in Chuadanga
Description: Abdul Barek, was killed in a gunfight with police at Muktapur Naldanga. Damurhuda police station sub-inspector Rawson Ali said a team of Damurhuda police, acting on a tip that a group of drug peddlers took refuge at Muktapur Naldanga area, conducted a drive there at about 1:30am. Sensing the presence of the law enforces, the peddlers opened fire on the cops, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight. After the gunfight, police found wounded Barek and sent him to Chuadanga Sadar Hospital for treatment where on duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Zahid Miah
Description: Zahid Miah, a suspected drug peddler was allegedly beaten to death by police in Phultala area. Police picked up Zahid around 7:00pm from a local market and took him to his nearby rented flat. The law enforcers beat him up there, alleged Jahangir Alam, Zahid's brother. After two hours of detention, police took him to Kulaura Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, Jahangir added. However, Officer-in-Charge of Juri Police Station Zahangir Hossain Sardar denied the allegation.

Name: Hafizur Rahman
Description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with RAB at Teknaf. The gunfight took place on Cox's Bazar-Teknaf road in Damdamia area around 3:00am when the law enforcers signaled a lorry -- carrying Hafizur and Sabbir -- to slow down, claimed Shah Alam, company commander of Teknaf RAB-7 camp. Instead of slowing down, the duo opened fire at RAB members, forcing the RAB members to retaliate. The gunfight left the duo dead on the spot.

Name: Sabbir Hossain
Description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with RAB at Teknaf. The gunfight took place on Cox's Bazar-Teknaf road in Damdamia area around 3:00am when the law enforcers signaled a lorry -- carrying Hafizur and Sabbir -- to slow down, claimed Shah Alam, company commander of Teknaf RAB-7 camp. Instead of slowing down, the duo opened fire at RAB members, forcing the RAB members to retaliate. The gunfight left the duo dead on the spot.

Name: Billal Hossain
Identity: Prime suspect of an abduction case; a Class VIII student
Location: Satnal village, of Monirampur in Jashore
Description: Billal, who was the prime suspect in the abduction and killing of a Class III student, was killed in a reported gunfight with police. Monirampur police station officer-in-charge Shahidul Islam said they, as per information extracted from Billal, also recovered the body of the abducted victim Tarif Rahman, 8, from a field at Satnal. The OC said that Tarifs father lodged a case with the police on January 7 stating that his son was abducted by unidentified abductors while the boy was playing near their house and the abductors demanded Tk seven lakh in ransom. Later, he said, they as per their investigation arrested prime suspect Billal on 8 January at night. During primary interrogation, the suspect confessed that he and his associates abducted Tarif and that they had killed him and hid the body at a place in their village. Shahidul said that they along with Billal later went out of the police station to recover the body and as the police team reached village Satnal, suspected associates of Billal opened fire on cops who retaliated by firing, prompting a gunfight at about 2:45am. He claimed that Billal got shot and became critically injured and they rushed him to Jashore General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead

Name: Jahangirl Alam
Description: Faridul Alam, the deceased father said 8 January some unidentified people picked up Jahangir from ABC Ghona Chairmanghata area and from that time they couldn't not trace Jahangir. But police claimed  he  was killed in a gunfight between two groups of drug traders in Katapahar area in Cox's Bazar city. Police said  that he was killed over drugs money

Name: Abdur Rashid alias Dhaliya
Description: Two suspected traders were killed in a gunfight with police. The incident took place in Khurer Mukh area around 1:30am, when a team of police carried out a drive for recovering illegal firearms, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the presence of police, the drug traders opened fire on police and a gunfight ensued when the law enforcers fired back in retaliation, Pradip added.

Name: Abul Kalam
Description: Two suspected traders were killed in a gunfight with police. The incident took place in Khurer Mukh area around 1:30am, when a team of police carried out a drive for recovering illegal firearms, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the presence of police, the drug traders opened fire on police and a gunfight ensued when the law enforcers fired back in retaliation, Pradip added.

Name: Arshaf Uddin
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a gunfight with police. Shariful Islam, Additional Superintendent of Police in Kishoreganj, said one of their teams raided Bajitpur's Ujanchar Beelpar area around 2:30am on information that a drug dealing was taking place there. "Our team came under fire as soon as it reached the spot," he said, adding, "Arshaf was killed during a 'gunfight' that followed."

Name: Unidentified
Description:
Border Guard Bangladesh officers  said they shot dead two young Rohinyga  men in Teknaf while they were smuggling in yaba pills.
The Rohingya men carrying yaba stashes entered Bangladesh at Rongikhali in Hnila area around 3:00am, said Teknaf BGB Battalion 2 Director Lt Col Md Asad-uz Zaman. As BGB personnel patrolling the area asked them to stop, they jumped into the Naf river and tried to flee. The BGB men then shot them, he said, adding that Teknaf police was informed about the incident immediately.

Name: Unidentified
Description:
Border Guard Bangladesh officers  said they shot dead two young Rohinyga  men in Teknaf while they were smuggling in yaba pills.
The Rohingya men carrying yaba stashes entered Bangladesh at Rongikhali in Hnila area around 3:00am, said Teknaf BGB Battalion 2 Director Lt Col Md Asad-uz Zaman. As BGB personnel patrolling the area asked them to stop, they jumped into the Naf river and tried to flee. The BGB men then shot them, he said, adding that Teknaf police was informed about the incident immediately.

Name: Jahangir Akon
Description: Two suspected robbers who were arrested in Dhaka were killed in a gunfight with police. Police claimed that Jahangir was accused in four robbery cases while Russel had six cases filed against him. However, Surmani Begum, wife of Russel, said her husband, who was a vegetable trader, was innocent and they used to live in a rented house in Savar's Baliapur area. Palang police station inspector (investigation) Humayun Kabir said they with the help of Dhaka Metropolitan polices Detective Branch (North) arrested the suspects on 11 January and based on their information, arrested the another accused Sohel Gharami. He said that they, along with the duo, also launched drives at Mirpur in Dhaka on the day and in Bogra on 12 January. As per information extracted from them, he said, a joint team of DB police and Palang police along with the duo went to a garden at village Deobhog where the detainees accomplices opened fire on police and police also retaliated by firing at about 3:00am. He said that Jahangir and Rasel tried to flee the spot during gunfight and died on the spot after being shot.

Name: Rasel Hawlader
Description: Two suspected robbers who were arrested in Dhaka were killed in a gunfight with police. Police claimed that Jahangir was accused in four robbery cases while Russel had six cases filed against him. However, Surmani Begum, wife of Russel, said her husband, who was a vegetable trader, was innocent and they used to live in a rented house in Savar's Baliapur area. Palang police station inspector (investigation) Humayun Kabir said they with the help of Dhaka Metropolitan polices Detective Branch (North) arrested the suspects on 11 January and based on their information, arrested the another accused Sohel Gharami. He said that they, along with the duo, also launched drives at Mirpur in Dhaka on the day and in Bogra on 12 January. As per information extracted from them, he said, a joint team of DB police and Palang police along with the duo went to a garden at village Deobhog where the detainees accomplices opened fire on police and police also retaliated by firing at about 3:00am. He said that Jahangir and Rasel tried to flee the spot during gunfight and died on the spot after being shot.

Name: Rumman Hossain Romeo
Location: Karar Beel area of Narail Sadar
Description: Romeo, was killed in a gunfight between police and his accomplices in Karar Beel area. Romeo, was accused in 13 cases for murder, robbery and other crimes, police said. On the gunfight, Ilias Hossain, officer-in-charge (OC) of Narail Sadar police, said a team of law enforcers raided Karar Beel on information that a criminal group was hiding there. Sensing the presence of police, the criminals opened fire on the team, forcing them to retaliate. Romeo son of Mizanur Rahman of Madhurgati village under Sadar upazila, was shot during the shooting, he added. He was pronounced dead when he was rushed to Narail Sadar Hospital, the OC said.

Name: Mostak Ahmad alias Musu
Description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with members of Border Guard Bangladesh and police in Teknaf. Lt Col Asad-uz Zaman Chowdhury, commander of BGB Battalion-2 in Teknaf, claimed Mostak was an enlisted drug trader and had more than 10 cases against him with Teknaf Police Station. On information, BGB members, along with police officials, took Mostak to Uttar Jalaipara area around 4:00am to recover yaba tablets. But, his cohorts opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, the BGB official claimed. Musu's bullet-ridden body was recovered from the spot after the gunfight stopped. Later, he was taken to a Cox's Bazar hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Shamsul Alam
Location: Domdomia Flood Control Embankment, Teknaf, Coxs Bazar
Description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in gunfight with police on the Domdomia Flood Control Embankment. Police alleged that Shamsu was wanted in 10 drug related cases. Teknaf Police Station officer-in-charge Pradip Kumar Das said that a police squad arrested Shamsu at Lohagara, Chattogram on January 18. On the basis information allegedly provided by him a police team along with Shamsu raided Domdomia Flood Control Embankment at about 5AM to recover Yaba tablets and illegal firearms. When the police team arrived on the spot Shamsus accomplices opened fire snatch him away from the police prompting polices retaliation and in the ensuing gunfight Shamsu was critically injured hit by bullet fired by his own gang members who escaped, he said.OC said that they rushed Shamsu to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex but doctors referred him to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Habibur Rahman alias Hubba
Description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a gunfight between a team of police and a group of drug peddlers at Mollateghoria village. Habibur Rahman, was named in several cases and was on the list of suspected drug peddlers prepared by the home ministry, police said. Acting on a tip off, a team of Kushtia sadar police conducted a drive in the area around 3:00am while a group of drug peddlers took position there, Kushtia sadar police station officer-in-charge M Nasir Uddin said. Sensing the presence of the law-enforces, one of Hubbas associates opened fire on the police, prompting them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight. Following the gunfight, police recovered Hubbas bullet-ridden body and took him to Kushtia General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Helal Uddin
Description: In Moheshkhali, police said a suspected robber was killed in a gunfight with police in Shaplapur area. Helal Uddin, was accused in at least 10 criminal cases, said Suvash Chandra Dhar, officer-in-charge of Moheshkhali Police Station. He added that police were tipped off about Helal and his cohorts were preparing for a robbery in Matarbari area. A police team then went there and arrested him. Taking Helal along with them, the policemen then went to Shaplapur area to catch other gang members, the OC said. The police reached there, armed men started to shoot at them. Injured during the gunfight, Helal was taken to a local hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Mirza Mahtab Uddin, commander of RAB-7 camp in Teknaf, said they were tipped off about a consignment of yaba being smuggled through Marine Drive Road near the beach around 2:30am. He added that as RAB men went there, the drug traders sensed their presence and started shooting at them. The RAB men then retaliated in defence. As the shootout ended a few minutes later, two bullet-hit bodies were found at the scene, he said. The bodies were sent to Teknaf Upzila Government Hospital morgue for autopsy.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Mirza Mahtab Uddin, commander of RAB-7 camp in Teknaf, said they were tipped off about a consignment of yaba being smuggled through Marine Drive Road near the beach around 2:30am. He added that as RAB men went there, the drug traders sensed their presence and started shooting at them. The RAB men then retaliated in defence. As the shootout ended a few minutes later, two bullet-hit bodies were found at the scene, he said. The bodies were sent to Teknaf Upzila Government Hospital morgue for autopsy.

Name: Shahabuddin
Description: Police arrested Shyamol around 10:30 pm by identifying his car, which was used in the rape incident on 27 January, through CCTV footage. Based on his information, police went to arrest Shahabuddin in city's Fishery Ghat area. The gunfight ensued around 3:30am when Shahabuddin and his cohorts opened fire on police, forcing them to retaliate. Shahabuddin was shot and killed during the gunfight.

Name: Moizuddin Ahmed Tulu
Description: Police said he was killed in a gunfight between two groups of drug dealers. But his wife Rahima Begum said he was picked up  allegedly by DB police on 13 January  when he was  going to Satkhira with taka 20,000. They picked him up in a private car. The  incident  video   was  recorded by a CCTV camera  of a local  shop. As his phone was switched off, Rahima Begum filed  a GD in Satkhira sadar police station.

Name: Sohel Rana
Location: Keshabpur village of  Panchbibi upazila, Joypurhat
Description: A suspected drug dealer was killed in a gunfight with Rab members in Keshabpur village. Acting on a tip-off, a team of the elite force conducted a drive in Keshubpur village around 2:00am to prevent a drug deal, claimed RAB. Sensing their presence, a group of four to five drug dealers opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. RAB later rescued Sohel with bullet injuries and sent him to Panchbibi Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, he claimed.

Name: Nabab Uddin
Location: Baharampur village under Haripur upazila in Thakurgaon
Description: Three villagers, were killed and 16 others injured afterBGB personnel opened fire on agitating villagers at village Baharampur of Haripur in Thakurgaon on 12 February. The villagers alleged the BGB personnel opened fire on them as they tried to stop them from taking away cows they had reared for months on suspicion that they were smuggled from India. Villagers said Mahbub Ali, a resident of village Bahrampur, bought a cow six months ago and on 12 February he was taking it to the local Jadurani cattle market to sell it. On his way, a group of seven to eight BGB personnel of Betna camp attempted to seize the cow suspecting it to be a smuggled one, they said, adding that the BGB personnel also brought three other cows in a bid to take them away and took them on a BGB pick-up van about 11:00am. Hundreds of villagers of surrounding areas and those who had been going to the cattle market, meanwhile, gathered at the place and held protests against the BGB personnel, they said. The villagers then were locked in a scuffle with the BGB personnel and recovered the cattle from BGBs possession. They held demonstrations protesting at harassment by the BGB personnel in the name of seizing smuggled cows. On information, other BGB patrol teams arrived at the scene to rescue the confined ones. The villagers became more agitated and threw brick bats on them when the BGB personnel opened fire in the air to disperse the mob. At one stage, when the mob became more violent, the BGB personnel opened fire on the mob, leaving two dead on the spot and several others injured with bullets, they said. One of the injured died on way to Haripur Upazila Health Complex, officials at Haripur Police Station said.

Name: Sadeq Ali
Location: Baharampur village under Haripur upazila in Thakurgaon
Description: Three villagers, were killed and 16 others injured afterBGB personnel opened fire on agitating villagers at village Baharampur of Haripur in Thakurgaon on 12 February. The villagers alleged the BGB personnel opened fire on them as they tried to stop them from taking away cows they had reared for months on suspicion that they were smuggled from India. One of the injured died on way to Haripur Upazila Health Complex, officials at Haripur Police Station said.

Name: Zainul
Location: Baharampur village under Haripur upazila in Thakurgaon
Description: Three villagers, were killed and 16 others injured afterBGB personnel opened fire on agitating villagers at village Baharampur of Haripur in Thakurgaon on 12 February. The villagers alleged the BGB personnel opened fire on them as they tried to stop them from taking away cows they had reared for months on suspicion that they were smuggled from India. One of the injured died on way to Haripur Upazila Health Complex, officials at Haripur Police Station said.

Name: Shanto Chowdhury
Description: Nurul Amin, additional deputy commissioner of police (Wari Division) said police conducted a drive on information that a gang of robbers was taking preparation to commit a robbery in Gopibagh Rail Gate area. As policemen tried to arrest them, one of them started stabbing the law enforcers indiscriminately with a sharp weapon and tried to escape. When police chased them, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate that resulted in a gunfight, he said. Shanto had a bullet injury while the two police officials Raqibul and Shukanta suffered stab injuries during the incident, Nurul said, adding that Shanto was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where he died.

Name: Nazmul Hossain Malitha
Description: In Kushtia's Sadar upazila, a gunfight between two groups of drug peddlers left one dead, claimed Nasir Uddin, officer-in-charge of Kushtia Model Police Station. He was an enlisted drug peddler and accused in 11 drug related cases, police claimed. Hearing gunshots, a police team rushed to Shaldah village around 2:30am and recovered Nazmul's bullet-ridden body, the OC said. However, Nazmul's family members said he was picked up on 16.02.2019. Asked, the law enforcers denied the allegation.

Name: Mangal Miah
Description: Mangal Miah, a suspected drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with police in Cumilla's Chandina upazila. Acting on a tip-off, police raided the upazila's Pirerchar area to recover drug. Sensing their presence, Mangal and his cohorts opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. At one point, Mangal sustained bullet injuries. He died on the way to a hospital, the OC claimed. Police claimed to have recovered a gun, two round bullets, 500 yaba tablets and 50 bottles of Phensidyl from the spot.

Name: Humayun Bepari
Description: In Munshiganj's Sadar upazila, Humayun Bepari, an alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police. He was accused in six cases, claimed Alamgir Hossain, officer-in-charge of Munshiganj Sadar Police Station. The gunfight took place when police went in Taleshwar Bridge area of the upazila to recover firearms, the law enforcers claimed. Sensing their presence, Humayun and his cohorts opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, police officials claimed. At one point of the gunfight, he was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet wounds. Later, doctors declared him dead at Munshiganj General Hospital.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Sonaimukhi canal area in the Sunderbans under Dacope upazila in Khulna
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a gunfight with Coast Guard personnel at Sonaimukhi canal area in the Sunderbans. Dacope police station officer-in-charge Mokarrom Hossain said that they came to know that the suspect was a member of a robber gang named Asabur Bahini. Coast Guard west zone operation officer Mohammad Bayazid said that they, on information that the members of Asabur Bahini took position at Sonaimukhi Canal in the Sunderbans, raided the area. As the coast guard personnel reached the canal, the robbers opened gunfire on them, forcing them to retaliate by firing at about 2:00am, he said. As the gunfight ended, he claimed, they found the unidentified suspect and took him to Dacope Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mofazzal Hossain alias Mofa
Description: Nazrul Islam, officer-in-charge of Daulatpur police, said a team of law enforcers raided the Katdah field on information that robbers were holding a meeting there around 4:30am. Sensing the presence of police, the robbers opened fire on them, the OC said, adding that the gunfight ensued when police returned fire. At one stage, the alleged robbers fled the scene and the police found two bodies on the spot.

Name: Mohabul
Description: Nazrul Islam, officer-in-charge of Daulatpur police, said a team of law enforcers raided the Katdah field on information that robbers were holding a meeting there around 4:30am. Sensing the presence of police, the robbers opened fire on them, the OC said, adding that the gunfight ensued when police returned fire. At one stage, the alleged robbers fled the scene and the police found two bodies on the spot.

Name: Khairul Amin
Description: Bullet-ridden bodies of two Rohingyas were found on 5 January after being arrest by police at Mitapanirchara point of Cox's Bazar-Teknaf marine drive area. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Sattion cliamed that the duo were involved in drug peddling from Myanmar. However, a Rohingya leader confimred that bothe of them were detained beforehand. Meanwhile deceased Abdullah's son Mohammad Arakan said that his father was arrested by 6-7 policemen from their camp in Unchiprang on 4 January 2019 and since then he went missing. Khairul's bother Mohammad Rafiq alleged that police arrested his brother on 4 January from the house of a suspected drug peddler Shah Alam at Unchiprang camp.

Name: Abdullah
Description: Bullet-ridden bodies of two Rohingyas were found on 5 January after being arrest by police at Mitapanirchara point of Cox's Bazar-Teknaf marine drive area. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Sattion cliamed that the duo were involved in drug peddling from Myanmar. However, a Rohingya leader confimred that bothe of them were detained beforehand. Meanwhile deceased Abdullah's son Mohammad Arakan said that his father was arrested by 6-7 policemen from their camp in Unchiprang on 4 January 2019 and since then he went missing. Khairul's bother Mohammad Rafiq alleged that police arrested his brother on 4 January from the house of a suspected drug peddler Shah Alam at Unchiprang camp.

Name: Mehedi Hasan
Description: Mehedi was killed in the capital's Shyamoli area. Mohammad Mohiuddin Faruqui, Company Commander of RAB-2 camp in Mohammadpur, claimed Mehedi was accused in at least 17 drug related cases. Acting on a tip-off, they set up two checkpoints in Shyamoli and Kalyanpur areas to recover drugs. Tracing the peddlers, they approached to interrogate but the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. At one stage of the shootout, Mehedi's bullet-ridden body was found while others managed to flee. Mehedi was taken to Suhrawardy Medical College and Hospital where doctors declared him dead,

Name: Zafar Alam
Identity: Alleged drug peddler; a Rohingya man
Location: Sabrang-5 sluice gate area of Cox's Bazar
Description: Zafar was killed in Cox's Bazar with BGB. Lt Col Mohammad Asadud-Zaman Chowdhury, commanding officer of BGB battalion-2, said they detained Zafar on 19 February night. According to Zafar's statement, a consignment of yaba pills was supposed to be smuggled in the sluice gate area. On this information, a BGB team conducted a drive there, Lt Col Chowdhury claimed. Sensing BGB's presence, the smugglers opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. At one stage of the gunfight, BGB men recovered Zafar's body.

Name: Abdur Rashid
Description: In Mymensingh, Abdur Rashid, was killed in a gunfight between police and his cohorts at Trishal bus stand in the town. Officer-in-charge of district DB police Shah Kamal Akand said tipped of that a group of drug traders would gather in the area, a team of DB police conducted a drive. Sensing their presence, the drug traders opened fire on the police members, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight, leaving Rashid injured. Doctors declared him dead when he was taken to Mymensingh Medical College and Hospital.

Name: Masud Kamal Rana
Description: In Khulna, Masud Kamal Rana, was killed in a gunfight between police and his cohorts in Nirala area in the city. Deputy Police Commissioner Maniruzzaman Mithu said that when a patrol team of police chased a group of drug traders in the area around 4:00am they opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight. Masud, who sustained injuries during the gunfight, was declared dead when he was taken to Khulna Medical College and Hospital.

Name: Mohammad Al-Amin
Location: Darikandi area in Titas upazila, Cumilla
Description: In Cumilla, Al-Amin was killed in a gunfight with police in Darikandi area. Police said they arrested Al-Amin on 21 February afternoon along with Tk 15 lakh looted money after a case was filed alleging that a gang of robbers, including Al-Amin, looted Tk 58 lakh from five bkash agents intercepting their rickshaw in the area in the morning. After gleaning information from him, a team of Titas police and DB police jointly conducted a drive at the place with Al-Amin at around 3:45am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, a group of robbers tried to snatch Al-Amin from police and opened fire on them, forcing police to retaliate. Investigation officer of the case and DB police sub inspector Shahidul Islam said that Al-Amin sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight and doctors declared him dead when he was taken to Cumilla Medical College and Hospital.

Name: Ashiqur Rahman
Description: A garment worker named Ashiqur Rahman was killed in crossfire by police when police opened fire at a crowd protesting the arrest of two people from a restaurant at Modonpur bus stand area under Bandar Upazila in Narayanganj District.

Name: Hazrat Ali
Description: In Dhaka, Hazrat Ali, was killed in a gunfight with police at Dayaganj area under Jatrabari police station in the capital around 2:15am when police raided the place to nab suspected drug peddlers, Jatrabari police station officer-in-charge Kazi Wazed Ali said.

Name: Belal Hossain
Description: Belal Hossain, was killed in a gunfight with the members of Border Guard Bangladesh personnel at Katabania area under Teknaf upazila in the district at around 5:00am, said Lieutenant Colonel Asaduzzaman, commander of BGB-2. BGB seized 9,000 pieces of Yaba tablets from the spot, he said, adding that Belal was named in at least seven drug-related cases.

Name: Mohammad Palash Ahmed
Description: A man who allegedly tried to storm the cockpit of a Biman flight was killed in a commando operation at Shah Amanat International Airport in Chattogram after all passengers were evacuated safely.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Chandpai range of the forest in Satkhira
Description: Four alleged members of a Sundarban-based robber gang were killed in a gunfight with RAB in Chandpai range of the forest in Satkhira,RAB said. The dead include Arif, leader of the gang locally known as Arif Bahini, said Mufti Mahamud Khan, director of Rab's Legal and Media Wing, adding that the identities of others were yet to be confirmed. He said, The gunfight ensued early in the morning when the bandits of Arif Bahini opened fire on a team of RAB-8, prompting them to retaliate, in Jongra Canal area. The four were caught in the line of fire while the others managed to flee, he said, adding that the bodies were handed over to Dacope Police Station in Khulna.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Chandpai range of the forest in Satkhira
Description: Four alleged members of a Sundarban-based robber gang were killed in a gunfight with RAB in Chandpai range of the forest in Satkhira,RAB said. The dead include Arif, leader of the gang locally known as Arif Bahini, said Mufti Mahamud Khan, director of Rab's Legal and Media Wing, adding that the identities of others were yet to be confirmed. He said, The gunfight ensued early in the morning when the bandits of Arif Bahini opened fire on a team of RAB-8, prompting them to retaliate, in Jongra Canal area. The four were caught in the line of fire while the others managed to flee, he said, adding that the bodies were handed over to Dacope Police Station in Khulna.
