The four were caught in the line of fire while the others managed to flee, he said, adding that the bodies were handed over to Dacope Police Station in Khulna.

Name: Unidentified
Location: Chandpai range of the forest in Satkhira
Description: Four alleged members of a Sundarban-based robber gang were killed in a gunfight with RAB in Chandpai range of the forest in Satkhira,RAB said. The dead include Arif, leader of the gang locally known as Arif Bahini, said Mufti Mahamud Khan, director of Rab's Legal and Media Wing, adding that the identities of others were yet to be confirmed. He said, The gunfight ensued early in the morning when the bandits of Arif Bahini opened fire on a team of RAB-8, prompting them to retaliate, in Jongra Canal area. The four were caught in the line of fire while the others managed to flee, he said, adding that the bodies were handed over to Dacope Police Station in Khulna.

Name: Tofazzal Hossain
Description: In Joypurhat, an alleged drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with RABin Khetlal upazila. Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB-5 raided in Tausara village to arrest a group of drug peddlers around 1:45am, said ASP Azmal Hossain, Commanding Officer of Joypurhat RAB. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the miscreants opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, triggering a gunfight, the RAB official added. Tofazzal sustained a bullet injury during the shootout while the rest escaped. RAB members took him to Joypurhat Modern Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

Name: Emdad Khandokar
Location: Adabaria village of Kumarkhali upazila in Kushtia
Description: In Kushtia, an alleged drug dealer, Emdad Khandokar, was killed in a shootout with police Adabaria village of Kumarkhali upazila. AKM Mizanur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Kumarkhali Police Station, said a team of law enforcers raided Chechua Beel area on information that some drug traders were holding a secret meeting there around 3:30am. Sensing their presence, the drug traders opened fire, triggering a gunfight when police retaliated, the OC claimed. When the criminals fled, police found the body of Emdad, who stood accused in two narcotics cases filed with Islamic University Police Station, on the spot.

Name: Mamun Sarker
Description: In Barishal, Mamun Sarker, was killed in a gunfight with police. Abdul Khalek, OC (investigation) of Kazirhat Police Station in Mehendiganj upazila, said Mamun was a robber and accused in at least 26 cases, including murder, rape and robbery, with different police stations. Police arrested Mamun on 25 February night in Muladi Bailey Bridge area and went to a brick kiln in Kazirhut lake area to recover firearms around 2:00am, he added. Mamun's associates opened fire on the police team, triggering a gunfight. The OC said  Mamun was injured during the gunfight and taken to the local upazila health complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Kamal Hossain
Description: Kamal Hossain, was killed in a gunfight with police in Paltan area. He has several drug related cases against him with Paltan and Ramna police stations, claimed police. Acting on a tip-off, law enforcers raided the area around 2:00am to recover drugs. Sensing their presence, Kamal and his cohorts opened fire on the police officials, forcing them to retaliate, claimed Syed Ali, sub-inspector of Paltan Police Station. At one stage of the gunfight, Kamal's bullet-ridden body was found on the spot. When rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, doctors declared him dead. Victim's sister Johura Begum who identified her brother at DMCH claimed that her brother was a local activist of BNP, went missing on 25 February evening. '' My brother had a rent-a-car business and he was never been a drug peddler,'' she claimed .

Name: Shaheb Ali
Location: Kolagachhia area of Shyamnagar upazila, Satkhira
Description: According to Lt Commander AMM Zahidul Kabir of RAB-6, on information, they conducted a drive in Kolagachhia area of Satkhira's Shyamnagar upazila around 9:30am to detain the members of Shaheb Bahini, an infamous forest bandits' gang in the area. Sensing presence of RAB, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, he added. Although other members of the forest bandits managed to flee, two members -- Shaheb Ali, 35, chief of the gang, and Habibur Rahman, 28, second-in-command of the gang -- sustained bullet injuries during the hour-long gunfight, the RAB official claimed. Later, on duty doctors of Shyamnagar Health Complex declared the duo dead.

Name: Habibur Rahman
Location: Kolagachhia area of Shyamnagar upazila, Satkhira
Description: According to Lt Commander AMM Zahidul Kabir of RAB-6, on information, they conducted a drive in Kolagachhia area of Satkhira's Shyamnagar upazila around 9:30am to detain the members of Shaheb Bahini, an infamous forest bandits' gang in the area. Sensing presence of RAB, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, he added. Although other members of the forest bandits managed to flee, two members -- Shaheb Ali, 35, chief of the gang, and Habibur Rahman, 28, second-in-command of the gang -- sustained bullet injuries during the hour-long gunfight, the RAB official claimed. Later, on duty doctors of Shyamnagar Health Complex declared the duo dead.

Name: Billal Hossain
Description: Billal Hossain, was killed in a gunfight with members of Border Guard Bangladesh in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar. Lt Col Asadud Zaman, captain of BGB battalion in Teknaf, claimed that the members of the paramilitary force raided sluice gate-3 area in Hoaikong union of Teknaf on information that a huge number of yaba pills were about to be smuggled. As the BGB men reached the area, smugglers attacked them with sharp weapons and guns, forcing them to retaliate, Asadud claimed, adding that Billal sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight. Later, doctors declared Billal dead when he was taken to Teknaf Health Complex.

Name: Abdul Shukkur
Description: According to BGB Battalion-2 Commanding Officer Lt Col Asadud Zaman Chowdhury, Abdul Shukkur and Mohammad Ilias, engaged in a gunfight with BGB men in Teknaf's Sabrang area. The incident happened around 3:30am after BGB men took position in the area on information that a large consignment of yaba pills were about to be smuggled via Sabrang, he claimed. Sensing presence of the BGB men, the criminals attacked them, forcing them to retaliate, the Lt Col added. Shukkur and Ilias sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight. Later, doctors declared them dead after they were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex.

Name: Mohammad Ilias
Description: According to BGB Battalion-2 Commanding Officer Lt Col Asadud Zaman Chowdhury, Abdul Shukkur and Mohammad Ilias, engaged in a gunfight with BGB men in Teknaf's Sabrang area. The incident happened around 3:30am after BGB men took position in the area on information that a large consignment of yaba pills were about to be smuggled via Sabrang, he claimed. Sensing presence of the BGB men, the criminals attacked them, forcing them to retaliate, the Lt Col added. Shukkur and Ilias sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight. Later, doctors declared them dead after they were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex.

Name: Nazir Ahmed
Description: Two suspected robbers Nazir Ahmed, and Gias Uddin, were killed in a gunfight with Teknaf police. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, claimed they conducted a drive in Howaikang area of the upazila on information that a group of robbers was attempting to carry out the robbery in Nayapara Battali area. Sensing police presence, the suspected robbers opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, he added. On the other hand, family members of Gias alleged that police arrested him a few days ago. Asked, the OC denied the allegation.

Name: Gias Uddin
Description: Two suspected robbers Nazir Ahmed, and Gias Uddin, were killed in a gunfight with Teknaf police. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, claimed they conducted a drive in Howaikang area of the upazila on information that a group of robbers was attempting to carry out the robbery in Nayapara Battali area. Sensing police presence, the suspected robbers opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, he added. On the other hand, family members of Gias alleged that police arrested him a few days ago. Asked, the OC denied the allegation.

Name: Selim
Description: In Munshiganj's Sirajdikhan upazila, a suspected robber -- Selim, 42, of Sonakanda in Dhaka's Keraniganj -- was killed in a gunfight with police. Asaduzzaman, additional superintendent of Munshiganj police, claimed the incident happened around 11:00am on 1 March 2019 when police and a group of robber engaged in a gunfight.

Name: Lalu Mia
Description: Lalu Mia, was killed in a gunfight with police in Kalibari area. On information that a group of narcos was trading drugs in Kalibari Puratan Godaragaht area, a police team conducted a raid around 1:30am, said Shah Kamal Akanda, officer-in-charge of Detective Branch of Police in Mymensingh, who also led the team. Sensing police presence, the drug traders opened fire on the law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight, he added. Lalu sustained bullet wounds during the shootout and was rushed to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH) where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Shamim
Description: Shihabur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Puraton Kasba Police Outpost, claimed that they raided the Kholadanga area around 3:00am on information that two groups of drug dealers would meet there. When the law enforcers reached the spot, the drug dealers were already engaged in a gunfight, the OC said, adding that sensing police presence, the criminals escaped the scene, leaving Shamim behind with bullet injuries. Doctors declared Shamim dead after he was taken to Jashore General Hospital.

Name: Mirazul Islam Miraz
Location: Near Agriculture College in Khulna city
Description: Sheikh Moniruzzaman Mithu, Additional Deputy Commissioner of Khulna Metropolitan Police, said they had detained Miraz on 8 March. During primary interrogation, Miraz provided police with information that he and his cohorts stored robbed items in the city's Agriculture College area, he claimed. When police took him to the spot for recovering those items, his cohorts opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, he added. At one point of the gunfight, Miraz sustained bullet injuries. Doctors declared him dead after he was rushed to Khulna Medical College Hospital.

Name: Abdur Rahman
Description: Abdur Rahman was killed in gunfight with police

Name: Md. Nurul Islam
Description: Commandar in charge Teknaf 2 BGB, Major Shariful Islam Jomaddar told that BGB got information that a Yaba shipment can enter Bangladesh through Khankar Deil village of Teknaf municipalty. Then, a team of BGB reached there. The traffickers started firing at the BGB. In reply BGB also fired and the traffickers flew that place. BGB rescued Nurul Islam as wounded and sent him to Upazela Health Complex. Nurul Islam died on the way to hospital. Officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police Station, Pradip Kumar Das said that there was no case filed against Nurul Islam.

Name: Mustaq Ahmed
Description: Police claimed that two drug peddler brothers were killed in a gunfight with the two groups of drug dealers at Palongkhali in Ukhia under Cox's Bazar.  However, locals said that the deceased two brothers and another youth were picked up by men claiming to be members of law enforcement agency on 12 March. The bodies of two bothers were found on 15 March.

Name: Mokter Ahmed
Description: Police claimed that two drug peddler brothers were killed in a gunfight with the two groups of drug dealers at Palongkhali in Ukhia under Cox's Bazar.  However, locals said that the deceased two brothers and another youth were picked up by men claiming to be members of law enforcement agency on 12 March. The bodies of two bothers were found on 15 March.

Name: Unidentifid
Location: Bosila Garden City area of Mohammadpur, Dhaka
Description: GG Biswas, officer-in-charge of Mohammadpur Police Station, claimed a police team set up a checkpoint in the area around 2:30am on information that a mugging gang was supposed to gather there. Sensing police presence, the muggers who were riding a car sped up their vehicle in front of the police checkpoint. At one stage of chasing and counter chasing, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, he added. The duo was injured in the gunfight. Of the two, one was taken to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College and Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Yasin Arafat
Description: A suspected drug trader was killed in a gunfight with police in Teknaf upazila of Cox's Bazar, hours after he was picked up by the law enforcers. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they detained Yasin from Teknaf town on 18 March evening over his alleged involvement with various crimes, including yaba trade and attack on police. Based on his information, police conducted a drive in Mitha Panirchhara area around 2:00am to arrest his cohorts, the OC added. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the miscreants opened fire, prompting police to retaliate that triggered a shootout, he said. At one point, Yasin came in the line of fire and was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where duty doctors pronounced him dead.

Name: Jamal Haq alias Jambu Mia
Location: Dhanpur under Sadar Dakhkhin upazila in Cumilla
Description: Mamun-or-Rashid, officer-in-charge of Cumilla Sadar Dakkhin police station, said that a team of police raided Dhanpur on information that a group of suspected drug peddlers gathered in the area. Sensing the police, suspected pedlars opened fire on the law enforcers who also fired back, he said. Within a few minutes, the gunfight ended as the pedlars fled away, said the OC. Police found Jamal shot and wounded and took him to Cumilla Medical College Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Nur Mohammad
Description: Acting on information, police first arrested Nur Mohammad from Zero Point area of Teknaf town around 7:00pm on 21 March and detained Nurul Amin from the same area after gleaning information from Nur Mohammad, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. The two were interrogated at the police station. Based on their information, police along with them were going to Rajarchhara area to recover firearms and yaba pills around 3:00am, said the OC. Sensing law enforcers' presence, some drug peddlers opened fire to snatch the arrestees, forcing them to fire back in self-defence, the police official added. During the gunfight, Nur Mohammad  and Nuru Aminl were hit by bullets when they were trying to flee from police custody, he said. The injured were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Nurul Amin
Description: Acting on information, police first arrested Nur Mohammad from Zero Point area of Teknaf town around 7:00pm on 21 March and detained Nurul Amin from the same area after gleaning information from Nur Mohammad, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. The two were interrogated at the police station. Based on their information, police along with them were going to Rajarchhara area to recover firearms and yaba pills around 3:00am, said the OC. Sensing law enforcers' presence, some drug peddlers opened fire to snatch the arrestees, forcing them to fire back in self-defence, the police official added. During the gunfight, Nur Mohammad  and Nuru Aminl were hit by bullets when they were trying to flee from police custody, he said. The injured were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Korban
Identity: Main accused in Abu Taher Sagor murder case
Description: Korban, the main accused in Abu Taher Sagor murder case, was killed in a shootout with the Detective Branch of police in Khurushkul area of Cox's Bazar Sadar upazila around 3:00am, said Farid Uddin Khandakar, officer-in-charge of Sadar Model Police Station. Police claimed to have recovered a firearm and three bullets from the spot.

Name: Badar Uddin alias Budu
Location: Harabhanga village under Gangni upazila in Meherpur
Description: Budu,a suspected drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with poli

Name: Abu Taleb
Description: Major Mehedi Hasan, Deputy Director of RAB-7 said that  thegunfight took place at Chhoto Chonua area of Banshkhali upazila at around 4:00am. Acting on a tip-off, a patrol team of RAB raided the area where the robbers were preparing to commit robbery in the sea-bound fishing trawlers, Mehedi said. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, triggering a gunfight. Later, the RAB members recovered Taleb's body and handed it over to Banshkhali Police Station.

Name: Mohammad Ilias
Description: Shariful Islam Jamaddar, acting commanding officer of BGB-2 Battalion in Cox's Bazar, said a gunfight broke out between BGB and a group of drug traders in Teknaf's Kharangkhali area around 4:30am when a BGB team was conducting an anti-narcotic drive there. At one stage, the drug traders, who were entering Bangladesh crossing the Naf River, retreated, Shariful added. The BGB men found two bullet-hit men lying injured on the spot later. The two were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead. Police later identified the two as Mohammad Ilias, 18, of Kutupalong Rohingya camp and Faruk Mia of Balukhali camp.

Name: Faruk Mia
Description: Shariful Islam Jamaddar, acting commanding officer of BGB-2 Battalion in Cox's Bazar, said a gunfight broke out between BGB and a group of drug traders in Teknaf's Kharangkhali area around 4:30am when a BGB team was conducting an anti-narcotic drive there. At one stage, the drug traders, who were entering Bangladesh crossing the Naf River, retreated, Shariful added. The BGB men found two bullet-hit men lying injured on the spot later. The two were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead. Police later identified the two as Mohammad Ilias, 18, of Kutupalong Rohingya camp and Faruk Mia of Balukhali camp.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Two suspected robbers were killed in  gunfight with RAB in Magnama coastal area around 4:00am. The identities of the two could not be confirmed. Mehedi Hasan, Company Commander of RAB-7, said they were members of a robbery gang operating in the Bay of Bengal.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Two suspected robbers were killed in  gunfight with RAB in Magnama coastal area around 4:00am. The identities of the two could not be confirmed. Mehedi Hasan, Company Commander of RAB-7, said they were members of a robbery gang operating in the Bay of Bengal.

Name: Shafik
Description: An alleged top criminal from Narsingdi was killed in a shootout with RAB in Bhasantek area.  Lt Col Kazi Shamsher Uddin, Commanding Officer of RAB-11, said a RAB team raided a house in Bhasantek around midnight on 26 March to arrest Shafik. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, criminals opened fire on the Rab men. The law enforcers fired retaliatory shots, triggering the gunfight, the RAB official added. Shafik, accused in at least 12 cases, was injured by bullets. He was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead around 1:30am.

Name: Kawsar Mia
Description: In Gazipur, Kawsar Mia, was injured in a shootout with police in Tongi around 4:00am, hours after he was picked up by law enforcers from Gazipura area. Police took injured Kawsar Mia to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead. OC Kamal Hossain of Tongi East Police Station said they picked up Kawsar, accused in several criminal cases, on 26 March afternoon when he was preparing to commit mugging. Later, a police team took him to Tongi's Banshpatti area and conducted a drive to recover illegal arms. At one stage, Kawsar's associates fired bullets at police to snatch him away. Law enforcers fired retaliatory shots, forcing them to retreat. The OC claimed the arrestee was hit with bullets fired by his cohorts. Kawsar's family members said he was not facing any murder or robbery case. Police picked him up from near his home around 3:00pm on 26 March. They heard the news of his death 27 March morning.

Name: Tarzan Manir
Description: Acting on a tip-off, Detective Branch (DB) of Police intercepted a microbus around 4:30am in Aftabnagar area, said Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner of DB,. The miscreants opened fire on the policemen from inside the microbus, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight, the official said. The two were injured during the shootout and declared dead after being taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, he said.

Name: Shah Ali
Description: Acting on a tip-off, Detective Branch (DB) of Police intercepted a microbus around 4:30am in Aftabnagar area, said Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner of DB,. The miscreants opened fire on the policemen from inside the microbus, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight, the official said. The two were injured during the shootout and declared dead after being taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, he said.

Name: Mohammad Hossain
Location: Habirchara union of Teknaf upazila, Cox's Bazar
Description: Mohammad Hossain, was killed in a gunfight between a drug gang and law enforcers near Habirchara union of Teknaf upazila. On information that a gang of robbers was preparing for robbery in the hilly area near Habirchara, police raided the scene around 4:00am. Sensing the presence of police, the criminals opened fire on them, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police. The law enforcers returned fire in self-defence, he added. At one stage, the criminals retreated and the police recovered bullet-hit body of Mohammad Hossain. He was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead, said the police officer.

Name: Mahmudur Rahman
Description: Three alleged drug peddlers, including a Rohingya woman, were killed in gunfights with police and Border Guard Bangladesh in Teknaf. Police and BGB officials claimed that the three were involved in yaba trading. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said a police team went to Moulvibazar Bridge area around 4:00am on information that two groups of yaba peddlers were exchanging bullets. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the criminals opened fire. Police returned fire in self-defence, triggering the gun battle, the OC said. At one stage, the criminals escaped and the law enforcers found the bullet-hit bodies of Mahmudur and Absar on the spot. They were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex and later shifted to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital for better treatment. They died there around 8:00am, the OC said.  In another similar incident a female ' drug peddler' Rumana was killed by BGB.

Name: Mohammad Absar
Description: Three alleged drug peddlers, including a Rohingya woman, were killed in gunfights with police and Border Guard Bangladesh in Teknaf. Police and BGB officials claimed that the three were involved in yaba trading. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said a police team went to Moulvibazar Bridge area around 4:00am on information that two groups of yaba peddlers were exchanging bullets. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the criminals opened fire. Police returned fire in self-defence, triggering the gun battle, the OC said. At one stage, the criminals escaped and the law enforcers found the bullet-hit bodies of Mahmudur and Absar on the spot. They were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex and later shifted to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital for better treatment. They died there around 8:00am, the OC said.  In another similar incident a female ' drug peddler' Rumana was killed by BGB.

Name: Rumana Aktar
Description: Three alleged drug peddlers, including a Rohingya woman, were killed in gunfights with police and Border Guard Bangladesh in Teknaf. Police and BGB officials claimed that the three were involved in yaba trading. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said a police team went to Moulvibazar Bridge area around 4:00am on information that two groups of yaba peddlers were exchanging bullets. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the criminals opened fire. Police returned fire in self-defence, triggering the gun battle, the OC said. At one stage, the criminals escaped and the law enforcers found the bullet-hit bodies of Mahmudur and Absar on the spot. They were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex and later shifted to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital for better treatment. They died there around 8:00am, the OC said.  In another similar incident a female ' drug peddler' Rumana was killed by BGB.

Name: Jahangir Alam
Location: Bhabanipur intersection under Kashimpur police station in Gazipur city
Description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with DB police at Bhabanipur intersection under Kashimpur police station in Gazipur city. Gazipur Metropolitan Police detective branch Additional Deputy Commissioner Manzur Rahman said that, a team of DB police, on secret information that a group of drug peddlers were staying at an abandoned house near Bhabanipur intersection, raided the area. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the drug peddlers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered the gunfight, the police official said. After the gunfight, the DB team rescued Jahangir with bullet injuries and took him to Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Ghano Shankor Chakma
Identity: A suspect in the Rangamati seven-murder case
Description: Ghano Shankor Chakma, a suspect in the Rangamati seven-murder was killed in a gunfight with members of joint forces. He was a regional political party member, said Lt Col Miftah Uddin Ahmed, commanding officer of RAB-7. He stood accused in the murder case, the RAB official said. On the other hand, MA Manzur, officer-in-charge of Rangamati's Baghaichhari Police Station, said a case was filed against 40-50 unnamed assailants. Shankor's name was not mentioned in the case. But police were keeping watch on him, the OC said. Acting on a tip-off, a joint team of army and RAB raided remote Dochhari area in Naikhongchhari around 10:00am. Shankor was shot dead during the gunfight and nine to 10 others managed to flee, said the RAB official.

Name: Jamal
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with RAB members in the Tejgaon area. Mohiuddin Faruque, Company Commander of RAB-2 said that the RAB team set up a check-point in Tejgaon on information that the alleged robbers would make off with a stolen lorry through that area. When the RAB members signalled the vehicle to stop around 4:00am, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, Mohiuddin claimed. The two sustained bullet injuries during the shootout and were pronounced dead after being taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH).

Name: Nayeem
Description: Two alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight with RAB members in the Tejgaon area. Mohiuddin Faruque, Company Commander of RAB-2 said that the RAB team set up a check-point in Tejgaon on information that the alleged robbers would make off with a stolen lorry through that area. When the RAB members signalled the vehicle to stop around 4:00am, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, Mohiuddin claimed. The two sustained bullet injuries during the shootout and were pronounced dead after being taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH).

Name: Nur Alam
Location: Near Nayapara Refugee Camp in Teknaf, Cox's Bazar
Description: Three Rohingya men, suspected to be robbers, were killed in a gunfight with police near Nayapara Refugee Camp in Teknaf. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, claimed they conducted a raid near H-block of the camp on information that a gang of robbers was hiding their arms in the area. Sensing police presence, the gang members opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. At one point of the gunfight, the three sustained bullet injuries. They were then rushed to Teknaf Upazila Heath Complex where doctors declared them dead, the OC further claimed.

Name: Mohammad Jubayer
Location: Near Nayapara Refugee Camp in Teknaf, Cox's Bazar
Description: Three Rohingya men, suspected to be robbers, were killed in a gunfight with police near Nayapara Refugee Camp in Teknaf. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, claimed they conducted a raid near H-block of the camp on information that a gang of robbers was hiding their arms in the area. Sensing police presence, the gang members opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. At one point of the gunfight, the three sustained bullet injuries. They were then rushed to Teknaf Upazila Heath Complex where doctors declared them dead, the OC further claimed.

Name: Hamid Ullah
Location: Near Nayapara Refugee Camp in Teknaf, Cox's Bazar
Description: Three Rohingya men, suspected to be robbers, were killed in a gunfight with police near Nayapara Refugee Camp in Teknaf. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, claimed they conducted a raid near H-block of the camp on information that a gang of robbers was hiding their arms in the area. Sensing police presence, the gang members opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. At one point of the gunfight, the three sustained bullet injuries. They were then rushed to Teknaf Upazila Heath Complex where doctors declared them dead, the OC further claimed.

Name: Shariful Islam Sharif
Location: Soydabad-Belkuchi regional road at village Panchasartia of Sirajganj Sadar
Description: Sharif, a suspected robber was killed in a police firing during a robbery attempt at Soydabad-Belkuchi regional road. Being tipped-off that an organised group of robbers put up a tree on the road in a bid to commit robbery, a team of police conducted a drive in the area, said Rafiqul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Sirajganj Sadar police station. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, the robbers tried to attack them, forcing them to open fire, the police said. Shariful sustained bullets while his accomplices managed to flee the scene, said the OC. Later, he was taken to Sheikh Fazilatunnesa Mujib Memorial Hospital where he died from his injuries .

Name: Saiful
Description: Saiful, prime accused in local Juba League activist Lokman Rahman Rony murder case, was killed in a gunfight with police. Pranab Chowhdhury, officer-in-charge of Bakalia Police Station, said they arrested Saiful along with Zia, 25, another accused in the case, in Jafarnagar area of the district's Fatikchhari upazila on 9 April 2019. During primary interrogation Saiful informed police of the whereabouts of the murder weapon. Following the information, police conducted a raid in Bakalia area, with Saiful, to recover the murder weapon, he claimed. Sensing police presence, Saiful's cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. The gunfight left Saiful dead on the spot.

Name: Morom Ali
Description: Mukhlesur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Bhairab Police Station, said police raided Chandpur Bridge area around 1:30am on information that some robbers were preparing to commit a robbery. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the criminals started throwing brick chunks at them and they opened fire at one stage. Police then retaliated, triggering the gun battle, claimed the OC, who led the drive. Morom was hit by bullets during the gun battle, while the others fled. He was rushed to Bhairab Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Nabi Hossain
Description: Mohiuddin Faruque, company commander of RAB-2, claimed that Nabi used to sell yaba in the city. A team of RAB took position near Dhaka Udyan on information that Nabi was carrying yaba from Teknaf, Mohiuddin claimed. Nabi opened fire on the RAB men when they intercepted a CNG-run auto-rickshaw in the area that was carrying him, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. During the gunfight, Nabi sustained bullet injuries. Later, he was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Delwar Hossain
Description: Mashkur Rahman, an Assistant Director of RAB-7, said he was killed in a gunfight with RAB.

Name: Abul Kashem
Description: In Teknaf, Abul Kashem, was killed in a gunfight with police in Khoaikong Satgariapara. Police arrested Abul Kashem on 10 April and raided the area at around 3:00am on 11 April taking him with them to recover arms, said Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf model police station, adding that Kashems associates opened fire on them when they reached the spot. The police team then returned fire, triggering a gunfight in which Kashem was killed on the spot.

Name: Ruhul Amin
Description: Abu Jihad Md Fakrul Alam, officer-in-charge of Chuadanga Sadar police, said a team raided Ukta village on information that drug traders were holding a secret meeting there around 2:00am. Sensing the presence of police, the gang opened fire on the law enforcers, the OC said, adding, A gunfight ensued when the team retaliated. As the criminals retreated, the police found the body of Ruhul Amin.

Name: Habibur Rahman
Description: In Gazipur towns Salna area, a group of suspected arms dealers got involved into a gunfight with RAB. RAB conducted a drive in the area on information that arms were being smuggled. Sensing their presence, the arms dealers opened fire, forcing them to retaliate,said Lt Commander Abdullah Al-Mamun, Company Commander of RAB-1.

Name: Mostafa Kamal
Description: Kamal was killed in a gunfight with police at Ullapara.  Ullapara police station Inspector (investigation) Mohammad Golam Mostafa said they, on a tip off that a group of drug peddlers had been dealing drugs, raided Ghosgati area at about 2:00am. Sensing presence of police, the drug peddlers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, triggering the gunfight, leaving Kamal dead on the spot.

Name: Saiful Islam
Description: In Coxs Bazars Ukhia upazila, two Rohingyas, allegedly involved in drug trade, were killed during a gunfight with BGB in Keruntoli area, said BGB Battalion 34 Commander Ali Haidar Azad Ahmad. On information that a gang of peddlers was at Keruntoli, the BGB sent a team to raid the area. Sensing their presence, the criminals fired at the BGB men, who then retaliated, said Commander Ali, adding that BGB then informed police about the incident. Police later recovered the two bodies, along with 20,000 yaba pills and four sharp weapons from their possessions, from the spot, said Sub-Inspector (SI) Dipankar Roy of Whykong Police Outpost in Teknaf upazila.

Name: Faruq Hossain
Description: In Coxs Bazars Ukhia upazila, two Rohingyas, allegedly involved in drug trade, were killed during a gunfight with BGB in Keruntoli area, said BGB Battalion 34 Commander Ali Haidar Azad Ahmad. On information that a gang of peddlers was at Keruntoli, the BGB sent a team to raid the area. Sensing their presence, the criminals fired at the BGB men, who then retaliated, said Commander Ali, adding that BGB then informed police about the incident. Police later recovered the two bodies, along with 20,000 yaba pills and four sharp weapons from their possessions, from the spot, said Sub-Inspector (SI) Dipankar Roy of Whykong Police Outpost in Teknaf upazila.

Name: Mohiuddin
Description: Mohiuddin, was killed in gunfight with RAB-15 on the Marine Drive road. RAB-15 Wing Commander Azim Ahmed said the gunfight occurred when RAB was conducting an anti-narcotic drive in the area .

Name: Jabed Hossain
Identity: Alleged robber, an activist of Jubo League
Description: Ashikur Rahman,Assistant Commissioner of Chattogram Metropolitan Police, claimed they conducted a raid in the area around 12:30am on information that a group of robbers had gathered there. Sensing police presence, the robbers opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, he added. During the gunfight Jabed sustained bullet injuries. Later, police rushed him to Chattogram Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him deadrecovered four firearms, including a lost pistol of police, two magazines, 13 bullets, three cartridges and a folding knife from the spot.

Name: Malek
Description: Lt Col Abu Mohammad Mohiuddin, Commanding Officer of BGB Battalion-10, claimed they conducted an anti-drug operation in Jaluapara area around 4:30am. During the raid, BGB and smugglers exchanged gunshots. At one point of the gunfight Malek sustained bullet injuries. When BGB rushed him to Cumilla Medical College Hospital, doctors declared him dead.

Name: Alam
Description: Md Kamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1, said. A team of the elite force conducted a drive in the area around 2:00am on information that drugs were being smuggled there. Sensing the law enforcers presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, Kamruzzaman claimed. At one point of the gunfight, RAB found Alams bullet ridden body. Later, when he was rushed to Tongi Shaheed Ahsan Ullah Master General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Dil Mohammad
Description: Dil Mohammad, an alleged drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with police, hours after he was picked up by the law enforcers. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said police arrested Dil Mohammad from Teknaf around 5:00pm on 23 April. Around 12:15am on 24 April, a police team conducted raid near Marine Drive along with Dil Mohammad to recover firearms and yaba, he claimed. Sensing police presence, Dil Mohammads associates opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, Pradip added. Dil sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight. Later, he was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mostaq Ahmed
Description: Mostaq Ahmed, an alleged drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Mahamudul Karim
Location: Lemshikhali Darbar Ghat of Kutubdia in Coxs Bazar
Description: Kutubdia police station officer-in-charge Md Didarul Ferdous said that a team of cops, acting on information that two groups of robbers got into a gunfight at Lemshikhali Darbar Ghat area, rushed to the spot at about 3:30am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the suspected robbers opened fire on police, prompting them to retaliate by firing, triggering the gunfight, he claimed. Later, cops found the two persons shot and wounded and took them to the Kutubdia Upazila Health Complex where on duty doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Quayum Kalu
Location: Lemshikhali Darbar Ghat of Kutubdia in Coxs Bazar
Description: Kutubdia police station officer-in-charge Md Didarul Ferdous said that a team of cops, acting on information that two groups of robbers got into a gunfight at Lemshikhali Darbar Ghat area, rushed to the spot at about 3:30am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the suspected robbers opened fire on police, prompting them to retaliate by firing, triggering the gunfight, he claimed. Later, cops found the two persons shot and wounded and took them to the Kutubdia Upazila Health Complex where on duty doctors declared them dead.

Name: Rafiq Uddin
Location: Bhadalia Shawastipur area in Kushtia Sadar
Description: Rafiq Uddin, a suspected drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with police at Bhadalia Shawastipur area. Several cases against him on reported charge of drug abuse and dealing, said Nasir Uddin, officer-in-charge of Kushtia police stationsaid that, acting on a tip off, a team of Kushtia and Detective Branch of police jointly conducted a drive in the area at about 3:00am while two groups of drug peddlers were exchanging bullets there. Sensing the presence of the cops, the drug peddlers opened fired on police, forcing them to retaliate by firing that triggered the gunfight. After the gunfight, police found Rafiq shot and wounded, and took him to Kushtia General Hospital where on duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mujibur Rahman Jitu
Description: Jitu, a suspected drug trader was killed in a shootout with police. Alamgir Hossen, OC of Moulvibazar Police Station said that tipped off that a consignment of yaba pills would be smuggled through the village, a patrol team of Detective Branch (DB) of Police took position in the area, said Rashedul Islam, additional superintendent of police in Moulvibazar. When a gang of alleged drug traders was crossing the area with sacks full of yaba around noon, the DB team intercepted them. The gang members opened fire on police, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight. After an hour-long battle, when the drug traders fled the scene, police recovered injured Jitu and took him to Moulvibazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Saiful
Description: A team of RAB-7 conducted a raid in Uttar Amirabad area around 3:00am after tipped off about Saiful's location. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, Saiful and his cohorts opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight. Later, RAB recovered bullet-wound Saiful and sent him to Lohagara Upazila Health Complex where doctors pronounced him dead.

Name: Bagha alias Babu
Description: Ziaur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Sadar Police Station, said police arrested Bagha from his home in Chunakhali village around 4:00pm. Later, police, along with Bagha, conducted a drive to arrest his other accomplices in Pulpara area. At that time, Baghas accomplices attacked police with sharp weapons and also opened fire. Police then returned fire. Bagha was trying to flee police custody and was hit by bullets, while others fled, the OC said. Bagha was taken to Chapainawabganj Sadar Hospital. As his condition deteriorated, he was referred to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where he died .

Name: Jahirul Islam alias Jokka
Location: Char Airkandi in Kalkini upazila, Madaripur
Description: Debashish Karmakar,Company Commander of Madaripur Rab, said a team of RAB- 8 from Barishal went to Char Airkandi around 4am on information that two groups of drug dealers were exchanging bullets. Sensing the law enforcers presence, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members retaliated, triggering the gunfight. Jahirul was hit by bullets and his cohorts fled the scene. He was rushed to Madaripur Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead .

Name: Shafiur Rahman Jyoti
Identity: A leader of outlawed Purba Banglar Sarbahara Party
Description: Sonatan Chakraborty, Additional Superintendent of Police (Bogura sadar circle), said they went to Goalkandi Bridge area in Sherpur around 1:30am on 1 May acting on information that two groups of outlaws were trading bullets there. Sensing the law enforcers presence, the criminals fled leaving the bullet-hit body of Shafiur. He was rushed to Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, the police official added. However, quoting locals, Shafiurs wife Rawshan Ara, 60, said that some plainclothes men introduced themselves as police and picked up her husband from Koichar Beel area in Dhunat on 29 April.

Name: Abdullah Al Paleel
Location: Bablalpura Akashashi Garden under Sadar upazila in Cumilla
Description: Border Guard Bangladesh officialsreported that Abdullah Al Paleel, also a suspected drug vendor, was killed in a gunfight with BGB personnel at Bablalpura Akashashi Garden under Sadar upazila in Cumilla district on 3 May at about 3:00am.

Name: Hazrat Ali
Description: Mymensingh Detective Branch of Police Officer-in-Charge Shah Kamal said on information that a group of drug-peddlers gathered at Savar area under Nandail upazila, they along with cops from the local police station raided the area early 4 May. The suspected drug peddlers, sensing the presence of cops, opened fire on the police and they also retaliated with gunshots, triggering a gunfight in which Hazrat died.

Name: Unidentified
Description: In Khulna, a patrol team of Rapid Action Battalion, hearing screams of inmates of the house of Kamrul Islam Gazi of Shantinagar in Dumuria, advanced towards the house and found that  a group of robbers had been committing robbery, said Dumuria police station officer-in-charge Md Aminul Islam. The robbers, sensing the presence of RAB, opened fire on them and the RAB members also retaliated, triggering a gunfight, he said, adding that the RAB personnel rescued the bullet-hit unidentified robber from the house and took him to Dumuria upazila health complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Abdullah
Description: Lt Col Faisal Hasan Khan, commanding officer of BGB-2 Battalion, said a BGB team set up a checkpoint at Khonkarpara on marine drive road on information that drugs were being smuggled in. As the BGB men signalled a motorcycle to stop around 4:00am, the riders opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. Abdullah was hit by bullets. He was declared dead after being taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex.

Name: Solaiman Bahadur
Description: Mashkur Rahman, Assistant Director (media wing) at RAB-7, said the gun battle took place in Choto Chonuya village around 12:15am. A patrol team of RAB went there on information that some robbers gathered on the spot for committing a robbery. Sensing the RAB members presence, the criminals opened fire and the RAB personnel returned fire, triggering the gunfight, the Rab official claimed. Mashkur said after the gun battle, RAB members found the bullet-hit body of Bahadur on the spot and took him to Banshkhali Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Muhammad Alam
Description: In Coxs Bazar, a gunfight between the alleged drug traders and police left two Rohingya men dead in Leda camp area of Teknaf. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said Alam and Rafiq were detained by police at their respective camps on 5 May evening. Based on their information, police, along with Alam and Rafiq, conducted a drive to recover yaba and firearms from the area. Sensing their presence, cohorts of the criminals began firing, forcing police to retaliate. After the alleged gunfight, the criminals fled the scene. Police found Rafiq and Alam with bullet wounds and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead,

Name: Muhammad Rafiq
Description: In Coxs Bazar, a gunfight between the alleged drug traders and police left two Rohingya men dead in Leda camp area of Teknaf. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said Alam and Rafiq were detained by police at their respective camps on 5 May evening. Based on their information, police, along with Alam and Rafiq, conducted a drive to recover yaba and firearms from the area. Sensing their presence, cohorts of the criminals began firing, forcing police to retaliate. After the alleged gunfight, the criminals fled the scene. Police found Rafiq and Alam with bullet wounds and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead,

Name: Panna alias Rana
Description: In the Sundarbans, three robbery suspects were killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion at Chandpai Range. The gunfight took place in Khonta Kodail canal area near the Pashur River, where RAB conducted a raid around 6:00am, he said. The criminals tried to flee after opening fire on the RAB men, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he said. After the gunbattle subsided, the three suspected robbers were found lying on the spot. They were declared dead after being taken to Mongla Upazila Health Complex, the officer said.

Name: Julhas
Description: In the Sundarbans, three robbery suspects were killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion at Chandpai Range. The gunfight took place in Khonta Kodail canal area near the Pashur River, where RAB conducted a raid around 6:00am, he said. The criminals tried to flee after opening fire on the RAB men, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he said. After the gunbattle subsided, the three suspected robbers were found lying on the spot. They were declared dead after being taken to Mongla Upazila Health Complex, the officer said.

Name: Kamruzzaman
Description: In the Sundarbans, three robbery suspects were killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion at Chandpai Range. The gunfight took place in Khonta Kodail canal area near the Pashur River, where RAB conducted a raid around 6:00am, he said. The criminals tried to flee after opening fire on the RAB men, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he said. After the gunbattle subsided, the three suspected robbers were found lying on the spot. They were declared dead after being taken to Mongla Upazila Health Complex, the officer said.

Name: Mizanur Rahman Jewel
Description: Mizanur Rahman Jewel, got injured in a gun battle that broke out in Dumni, Khilkhet neighbourhood of the capital around 1am, said Md Kamruzzaman, Assistant Director, RAB-1. A team of the elite force raided the area on a tip-off that drug traders had gathered there. The criminals opened fire provoking retaliation from the RAB men. Jewel got shot and was declared dead after being taken to the Kurmitola General Hospital,  Jewel, was accused in 13 cases, he added. A firearm, ammunition and 1,950 pieces of yaba tablets were seized from the spot, the officer said.

Name: Sujan Mia
Description: The incident took place in the sadar upazila where Sujan Mia, who, according to RAB, was on the list of most wanted criminals prepared by the Home Ministry, died after being shot. Sujan Mia had been a top drug trader, said Enayet Mannan, superintendent of police at RAB-11.

Name: Shahidul Islam Sumon
Description: Shahidul Islam Sumon, was charged with rape and extortion in nine cases, said Saifur Rahman, additional superintendent of police (circle-a), Rangpur. Sumon and his cohorts were roaming around East Ichali village during the early hours of 7 May. A police team went there to net Sumon, who got shot while trying to flee. His cohorts managed to flee on motorcycles. Sumon died while being taken to the Rangpur Medical College Hospital. His body was sent to the morgue for autopsy, said SP Saifur.

Name: Ashraf Ali
Description: Ashraf Ali, a suspected drug dealer was killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion in the capitals Agargaon area. A team of RAB 2 had asked a group of people to stop at a check-post in Agargaon but they opened fire at them, triggering a skirmish, said RAB sources. The suspected drug dealer was killed during the gunfight, the sources added.

Name: Mohammad Masum
Description: Two men were killed in a gunfight between RAB and an alleged group of drug dealers in Jhauban area. Tipped off that a group of smugglers were trading drugs, a team of RAB-15 took position near the Diabetic Hospital Point around 2:0 0am, the RAB official said. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the smugglers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered a shootout, he added. Later, RAB members recovered the two with bullet injuries and took them to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Two men were killed in a gunfight between RAB and an alleged group of drug dealers in Jhauban area. Tipped off that a group of smugglers were trading drugs, a team of RAB-15 took position near the Diabetic Hospital Point around 2:0 0am, the RAB official said. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the smugglers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered a shootout, he added. Later, RAB members recovered the two with bullet injuries and took them to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Ziarul Islam alias Kalu
Description: Md Shahidullah, Rajshahi superintendent of police said that that being tipped off that two groups of drug trader were exchanging gunshots over establishing supremacy, a team of police rushed to the spot around 2:30am. As the police chased them, the drug peddlers started firing targeting at the police, forcing them to retaliate which triggered a gunfight. At one stage of the gunfight, the drug smuggling members fled the spot while Kalu sustained bullet injuries. Later, Kalu was rushed to Bagha Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.Meanwhile, the deceaseds wife, Isma Begum, claimed that four plainclothes men picked up her husband, Kalu, from Kishorpur area of Bagha while he along with his business partner were returning home by motorcycle on 8 May night.

Name: Shah Alam
Description: Shah Alam, accused of killing a woman, was killed in a gunfight with police in Bakalia area. Chattogram South Metropolitan Police Additional Deputy  Commissioner Shah Md Abdur Rouf said that Shah Alam had been at loggerhead with local criminal Hasan. He went to the residence of Hasans aunt in Bojroghona Madina Mosque area around 10:00pm on Saturday in search of Hasan. As he was not there, Shah Alam got furious and attempted to shoot Hasans cousin Rubel. Being obstructed by Rubels elder sister Bubli, Alam shot her, leaving her critically injured, he said adding that the injured was taken to Chattogram Medical College Hospital where doctors declared her dead. Later, a team of police raided Bolirhat area, adjacent to the River Karnaphuli, around 3:30am to arrest Shah Alam. When the police team reached there, Alams associates opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back, triggering a gunfight that left Alam dead on the spot.

Name: Yaqub Ali Kajal
Description: Kajal, was accused of raping a schoolgirl and committing acid attack on a housewife, Gangni police officer-in-charge Harendranath Sarkar said. Kajal threw acid on a housewife on 10 May and on information, police arrested him raiding village Dhola in Kathuli union on the same day. He confessed to the police about his involvement in the acid attack. Kajal also informed police of owning several weapons, the OC added. Later, police along with Kajal went to a bamboo orchard of Garadhob to recover the weapons at about 2:30am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, Kajals accomplices opened fire on the police, forcing them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight, added Harendranath. After the gunfight, police found Kajal with bullet injuries but his associates managed to flee. The police took him to Gangni Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Dudu Mia
Description: Dudu Mia, was a named in a list of narcos prepared by the home ministry, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. Tipped off, a police team arrested Dudu from a location nearby his house on 10 May night and conducted a raid in Moheshkhalipara area to recover a haul of hidden yaba pills and firearms taking him along with them, said the OC. As soon as the police team reached the spot, cohorts of Dudu opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate which triggered a shootout, the OC added. Dudu was caught in the line of fire when he tried to flee from police custody, he added. He was taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mostafa Hossain
Location: Harua of Ishwarganj upazila of Mymensingh
Description: Shah Kamal Akand,Oofficer-in-Charge of Detective Branch of police , said that acting on a tip-off, a joint team of DB and Ishwarganj police raided the area around 12:45am. Drug peddlers hurled brick chips and opened fire aiming at the team as soon as it reached the spot, triggering the gunfight, he claimed. After the gunfight, police found Mostafa at the spot with gunshot wounds. He was taken to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

Name: Azim Ullah
Description: Azim Ullah, was a resident of Rohingya camp no. 23 in Shamlapur area and Abdus Salam, was a resident of Rohingya camp no. 15 in Jamtoli area, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police Station. Tipped off that a gang of human traffickers had gathered some people in Shamlapur Marine Drive Road area in an attempt to smuggle them into different districts in the country, a police team conducted a raid around 4:00am, the OC said. Sensing their presence, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight. Later, police recovered the two with bullet injuries and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors pronounced them dead.

Name: Abdus Salam
Description: Azim Ullah, was a resident of Rohingya camp no. 23 in Shamlapur area and Abdus Salam, was a resident of Rohingya camp no. 15 in Jamtoli area, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police Station. Tipped off that a gang of human traffickers had gathered some people in Shamlapur Marine Drive Road area in an attempt to smuggle them into different districts in the country, a police team conducted a raid around 4:00am, the OC said. Sensing their presence, the gang members opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight. Later, police recovered the two with bullet injuries and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors pronounced them dead.

Name: Sayedul Mostafa alias Bhulu
Description: Bhulu, was killed in a shootout with police in Katapahar area. Police was about to conduct a drive to recover illegal firearms taking Mostafa along with them, said Farid Uddin Khandaker, OC of Coxs Bazar Sadar Model Police Station. As soon as they reached the spot, cohorts of Mostafa opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate, the OC said. Injured Mostafa was shot during the incident and taken to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Hafizur Rahman Titas
Description: Acting on a tip off, a police team raided a sugarcane field around 3:00am where the miscreants taking preparation for a robbery, said Bahauddin Faruki, OC of Ishwardi Police Station. Sensing polices presence, robbers opened fire on the cops, forcing them to fire back in retaliation which triggered a gunfight, said the OC.Later, police recovered Titas with a bullet injury and took him to Ishwardi Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Abul Kashem
Description: In Jashore, Abul Kashem, an alleged robber was killed in a gunfight with police.

Name: Shahidul Islam alias Kutu
Description: Mohammad Abu Salam Miah, Officer-in-Charge of Kotwali Model Police Station, said that they raided Shahiduls house early in the morning. Shahidul and his associates opened fire as soon as police reached the place, triggering a gunfight. After the skirmish, police arrested Shahidul with gunshot wounds from the spot. He was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

Name: Mohammad Ibrahim
Identity: Drug peddler and general secretary of youth wing of BNP of Shah Porir Dweep unit
Description: Teknaf police station officer-in-charge Prodip Kumar Das said that the associates of Ibrahim opened fire at the law enforcers during a drive to arrest him from the area. Police fired back in retaliation, injuring Ibrahim and his associates. While his associates fled the scene, Ibrahim was left behind, according to the OC. Ibrahim was declared dead after he was taken to the Teknaf Upazila Health Complex.

Name: Munir
Description: Two suspected hijackers were killed in an alleged gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion in Hazaribagh Beribadh area. According to RAB officials, a gang of hijackers hijacked a covered van carrying nine tonnes of tea of Ishpahani Tea Ltd from Srimangal five to six days ago. Acting on a tip-off, the RAB-2 set up a check-post in front of Madhu City under Hazaribagh police station in Old Dhaka and intercepted a van while it was crossing the check-post around 2:45am. Sensing the impending danger, the hijackers opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back. After a brief gunfight, the RAB recovered the bodies of van driver Munir and his assistant Gias from the spot, said RAB-2superintendent Mohiuddin Faruqi.

Name: Giasuddin
Description: Two suspected hijackers were killed in an alleged gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion in Hazaribagh Beribadh area. According to RAB officials, a gang of hijackers hijacked a covered van carrying nine tonnes of tea of Ishpahani Tea Ltd from Srimangal five to six days ago. Acting on a tip-off, the RAB-2 set up a check-post in front of Madhu City under Hazaribagh police station in Old Dhaka and intercepted a van while it was crossing the check-post around 2:45am. Sensing the impending danger, the hijackers opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back. After a brief gunfight, the RAB recovered the bodies of van driver Munir and his assistant Gias from the spot, said RAB-2superintendent Mohiuddin Faruqi.

Name: Mohammad Monsur
Description: Monsur, was killed in a gunfight with police. Mohammad Mohsin, Officer-in-Charge of the Kotwali police, said that a patrol team of police chased a gang of muggers when they snatched a bag from a woman in Tigerpass area at night. When, the auto-rickshaw carrying the hijackers reached Pologround area, they opened fire on police, forcing them to fire back, triggering the gunfight. After the gunfight, police rescued bullet-hit Monsur from the spot and took him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Selim Miah
Description: In Cumilla, a suspected drug peddler, Selim Miah, was killed in a gunfight with the Border Guard Bangladesh at Golabari. Lieutenant Colonel Abu Mohammad Mohiuddin, Commanding Officer of BGB 10-Battalion, said that a special team of BGB raided the border area. Sensing presence of the BGB, the drug peddlers opened fire on them, prompting them to fire back, triggering the gunfight. Selim sustained bullet wound during the gunfight and doctors declared him dead when he was taken to Cumilla Medical College Hospital.

Name: Nazmul Hossain
Location: Karamdi village, Gangni upazila in Meherpur
Description: Nazmul Hossain, a suspected drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with the Detective Branch of police in Meherpur. Obaidur Rahman, officer-in-charge of Meherpur DB, said one of their teams raided Gangni upazilas Karamdi village around 3:30am on information that a gang of drug peddlers was holding a meeting there. Sensing the presence of the DB personnel, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate with gunfire, he claimed. At one stage, the attackers fled but Nazmul's body was found on the spot.

Name: Mohammad Hanif
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said Hanif was arrested in Teknaf town on 22 May evening. Around 4:00am, police, along with him, raided Lombori Para along Marine Drive Road to recover firearms and yaba pills. Hanifs cohorts opened fire as soon as police reached the area, triggering a gunfight. Hanif was hit while trying to flee from police custody, the OC claimed. He was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Jakir Hossain alias Kala Jakir
Description: Kala Jakir, a suspected drug dealer was killed in a gunfight with police. He was killed in Palpara Bridge area of the city. Abu Salam Mia, officer-in-charge of Kotwali Model Police station said that a team from the police station raided the area after being tipped off about the presence of drug dealers. During the drive, the suspected drug dealers started shooting at policemen, who retaliated with gunfire. After the suspects fled the scene, the bullet-hit body of Jakir was found at the scene, the OC said.

Name: Abdul Hakim
Description: In the incident day, Halim along with some others playing cards at Jhaoil Technical college field. During the time, SI Abu Taher, ASI Ashraful Alam and some other policemen drive that field with a microbus by wearing plainclothes and detained four persons. They were Suruzzaman, Haradhon Chandra, Gourango Chandra and Ripon. At that time, they beat up Halim, leaving him sick. However, local people took him to Gopalpur Upazila Health COmplex, where duty doctor declared him dead. Abu Taher, Ashraful Alam and six other constabes were closed from their duty

Name: Mohammad Siraj alias Siru
Description: Mohammad Siraj, an alleged drug peddler, was killed in a 'gunfight' with police after being arrested by police. The incident took place at 8:30 pm on 15 May 2019 in a salt field near Naf river in Teknaf.

Name: Hasan
Location: Jongrakhal in the Sundarbans in Mongla upazila, Khulna
Description: Four alleged robbers, including the supposed ringleader of a robber gang, were killed in a shootout with members of RAB. Acting on a tip-off, a Rab team raided the Sundarbans area under Chandpai range at night, said Mufti Mahmud Khan, egal and media wing director of RAB.. Sensing the RAB members presence, the criminals opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the gunfight. Four robbers, including Hasan, were hit. They died on the spot, said a press release of RAB-8.

Name: Mustain
Location: Jongrakhal in the Sundarbans in Mongla upazila, Khulna
Description: Four alleged robbers, including the supposed ringleader of a robber gang, were killed in a shootout with members of RAB. Acting on a tip-off, a Rab team raided the Sundarbans area under Chandpai range at night, said Mufti Mahmud Khan, egal and media wing director of RAB.. Sensing the RAB members presence, the criminals opened fire. The law enforcers retaliated, triggering the gunfight. Four robbers, including Hasan, were hit. Description: Four alleged robbers, including the supposed ringleader of a robber gang, were killed in a shootout with members of RAB. Description: Four alleged robbers, including the supposed ringleader of a robber gang, were killed in a shootout with members of RAB. Name: Salimullah
Description: On information, a team of Border Guard Bangladesh conducted a drive in Noapara around 1:00am, said a press release issued by Lt Col Abu Mohammad Mohiuddin, commanding officer of BGB-10 Battalion. Sensing the BGB mens presence, the criminals opened fire. The BGB members returned fire, triggering the gun battle. The drug dealers were hit and they were taken to a local hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Rubel
Description: On information, a team of Border Guard Bangladesh conducted a drive in Noapara around 1:00am, said a press release issued by Lt Col Abu Mohammad Mohiuddin, commanding officer of BGB-10 Battalion. Sensing the BGB mens presence, the criminals opened fire. The BGB members returned fire, triggering the gun battle. The drug dealers were hit and they were taken to a local hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Nannu
Description: Kamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1, said police were looking for the two notorious youths as they have been committing crimes like extortion and mugging since long. A patrol team of RAB-1 raided the Tongi Bridge area on information that a gang of criminals were mugging people there. Sensing RAB's presence, the muggers tried to hide below the bridge. As RAB members approached them, they opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, Kamruzzaman claimed. At one point, the duo sustained bullet injures. RAB rushed them to Ahsanullah Master General Hospital where doctors declared them dead,

Name: Babu
Description: Kamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1, said police were looking for the two notorious youths as they have been committing crimes like extortion and mugging since long. A patrol team of RAB-1 raided the Tongi Bridge area on information that a gang of criminals were mugging people there. Sensing RAB's presence, the muggers tried to hide below the bridge. As RAB members approached them, they opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, Kamruzzaman claimed. At one point, the duo sustained bullet injures. RAB rushed them to Ahsanullah Master General Hospital where doctors declared them dead,

Name: Saiful Karim
Description: Saiful Karim, a listed yaba kingpin, was shot and killed when police exchanged fire with his associates in Coxs Bazar. Teknaf Police Station Officer-in-charge Pradip Kumar Das said they arrested him from the Marine Drive in the tourist town around 10:00pm on 30 May.  Saiful  was picked up by law enforcers from Dhaka airport on May 25 on his arrival from Myanmar. He had fled there after the government declared a war on drug in May last year. Pradip said that during interrogation Saiful revealed a big consignment of yaba was being smuggled into Bangladesh from Myanmar through the Naf river. Police then took Saiful along to raid the area around 4:00am to seize the pills. Sensing police presence, the yaba kingpins associates opened fire, prompting police to fire back, triggering a gunfight, said Pradip. Caught in the line of fire, Saiful as well as four policemen were injured, and were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, said the OC. Saiful was later shifted to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Delwar Hossain
Description: Delwar Hossain was killed in a gunfight with BGB members at Hakimpur border under Dinajpur district. During time, three BGB members were injured. They recovered 958 pieces yaba tablets and a mobile set

Name: Abdul Gafur
Description: Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, BGB Commanding Officer of Teknaf-2, said being tipped off over smuggling of a consignment of Yaba, a team of BGB conducted a drive in Kayukhkhali area. Sensing their presence, the yaba traders opened fire on the BGB men, prompting them to fire back that triggered the gunfight, he added. Later, the BGB men recovered the two with bullet injuries from the spot and sent them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Sadek
Description: Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, BGB Commanding Officer of Teknaf-2, said being tipped off over smuggling of a consignment of Yaba, a team of BGB conducted a drive in Kayukhkhali area. Sensing their presence, the yaba traders opened fire on the BGB men, prompting them to fire back that triggered the gunfight, he added. Later, the BGB men recovered the two with bullet injuries from the spot and sent them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mufizur Rahman
Description: Following information given by Mufizur, a police team raided a secret place to recover arms and drugs around 4:00am, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf police station. When the team reached the spot Mufizurs cohorts opened fire on the law enforcers forcing them to fire back in self-defence that triggered the gunfight. Pradip Kumar said that when the gunfight was over they rescued Mufizur with bullet injuries and took him to Sadar hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Ismail
Description: In Gazipur, an alleged drug peddler, Ismail, was killed in a shootout with the RAB. A RAB team was conducting an anti-narcotics raid in the river port area when drug peddlers opened fire on them, said Kamal Hossain, officer-in-charge of Tongi East Police Station. Ismail was killed during the gunfight, he said, adding that a fire arm, bullets and several thousands of Yaba pills were recovered from the spot.

Name: Md Arafat Bin Akhter Khan
Description: In Chattogram, two suspected robbers were killed in Sitakunda upazila. RAB-7 Assistant Director (Media) Masuqur Rahman said one of their teams went to the area to foil a robbery bid on the highway. The robbers opened fire as soon as our team reached Chhoto Kumira around 2:00am. After the skirmish, bodies of two robbers, firearms and bullets were recovered, he claimed.

Name: Md Al-Amin
Description: In Chattogram, two suspected robbers were killed in Sitakunda upazila. RAB-7 Assistant Director (Media) Masuqur Rahman said one of their teams went to the area to foil a robbery bid on the highway. The robbers opened fire as soon as our team reached Chhoto Kumira around 2:00am. After the skirmish, bodies of two robbers, firearms and bullets were recovered, he claimed.

Name: Helel Uddin
Description: In Cumilla, quoting BGB officials, reported that a team of Border Guard Bangladesh 10 Battalion, on secret information, conducted an anti-drug drive near Gilatali bordering area under Sadar upazila  and the suspected drug peddlers opened fire at BGB personnel. The BGB men fired back that triggered a gunfight. The officials said that as the gunfight ended, they found the body of Helal from the spot.

Name: Monirul Islam Babul
Description: In Thakurgaon, quoting Border Guard Bangladesh 42 commanding officer Lieutenant Colonel Gazi Nahid Uz Zaman, reported that suspected drug peddler Monirul was killed in a gunfight with BGB members at Fakirganj under Pirganj in Thakurgaon. He said that a BGB team arrested Babul on 5 June night. Later, the team along with Babul raided Fakirganj area to recover drugs. Sensing their presence, Babuls associates opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight, he claimed, adding that, at one stage, Babul was caught in the line of fire and died while his accomplices managed to escape.

Name: Shamsul Alam
Description: In Coxs Bazar, quoting Teknaf police station officer-in-charge, reported that the police arrested Shamsul, Noor and Habib from Leda area under Teknaf for their alleged involvement in abduction of a Rohingya child demanding Tk 5 lakh in ransom. Police rescued the child. Then the police raided Leda area at about 11:45 pm on 6 June along with the three accused to recover illegal firearms and arrest their accomplices. Sensing the presence of police, the accomplices opened fire and the police also fired back triggering a gunfight. The trio became critically injured falling in line of fire, the OC said. The injured were immediately rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

Name: Noor Alam
Description: In Coxs Bazar, quoting Teknaf police station officer-in-charge, reported that the police arrested Shamsul, Noor and Habib from Leda area under Teknaf for their alleged involvement in abduction of a Rohingya child demanding Tk 5 lakh in ransom. Police rescued the child. Then the police raided Leda area at about 11:45 pm on 6 June along with the three accused to recover illegal firearms and arrest their accomplices. Sensing the presence of police, the accomplices opened fire and the police also fired back triggering a gunfight. The trio became critically injured falling in line of fire, the OC said. The injured were immediately rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

Name: Habib Ullah
Description: In Coxs Bazar, quoting Teknaf police station officer-in-charge, reported that the police arrested Shamsul, Noor and Habib from Leda area under Teknaf for their alleged involvement in abduction of a Rohingya child demanding Tk 5 lakh in ransom. Police rescued the child. Then the police raided Leda area at about 11:45 pm on 6 June along with the three accused to recover illegal firearms and arrest their accomplices.
