Name: Mahabubul Hasan Rubel
Location: Fatehpur of Feni on Dhaka-Chattogram Highway
Description: RAB-7 Deputy Commander Shafayat Jamil Fahim said that a team of RAB, on information, took position at the Fatehpur level crossing on 9 June when a group of drug peddlers opened fire targeting RAB officials. RAB officials also retaliated with gunshots triggering a gunfight, Shafayat claimed. Later, RAB personnel found two critically injured drug peddlers and rushed them to Feni General Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Unidntified
Location: Fatehpur of Feni on Dhaka-Chattogram Highway
Description: RAB-7 Deputy Commander Shafayat Jamil Fahim said that a team of RAB, on information, took position at the Fatehpur level crossing on 9 June when a group of drug peddlers opened fire targeting RAB officials. RAB officials also retaliated with gunshots triggering a gunfight, Shafayat claimed. Later, RAB personnel found two critically injured drug peddlers and rushed them to Feni General Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Ripon
Description: Mostafa Kamal, officer-in-charge of Nawabganj Police Station, claimed they conducted a raid in the area on information that a group of criminals were preparing for robbery. Sensing the law enforcers presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, he said, adding Ripons body was recovered after the skirmish.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Based on the information that a group of smugglers were entering Bangladesh from Myanmar with a big consignment of yaba, a BGB team conducted a drive in Hnila area on the bank of Naf River, said Lt Col Faisal Hasan Khan, BGB Commanding Officer of Teknaf. Sensing presence of law enforcers, the drug traders opened fire on the BGB team forcing them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight, claimed the BGB official. Later, police recovered a bullet-hit body from the spot, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station.

Name: Bappy alias Rajib
Location: Uttar Bijoypur in Sadar South upazila, Cumilla
Description: Police said a team of Sadar south model police station conducted a drive at Bijoypur around 2:30am to recover drugs. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, Bappy and his associates opened fire on them forcing them to retaliate which triggered a gun battle, said inspector (Investigation) of the police station Kamal Krishna Dhar. Bullet-hit Bappy was found lying on the ground after the gunfight and he was taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Russel Mahmud
Description: Russel Mahmud, of Narayanganj, was shot during a police raid in Hoaikong area around 1:30am, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police Station. He was on his way to buy a haul of yaba pills from suspected local drug dealer Amir Hamaja when police were conducting a drive in the area, the OC added. Sensing police presence, the drug peddlers opened fire and the officers retaliated, he said. At one point, the drug peddlers fled the scene and the bullet-riddled body of Russel was found, he added. He was taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Dil Mohammad
Description: Lt Mirza Shahed Mahtab, camp commander of RAB-15 in Teknaf, said a RAB team conducted an anti-drug drive in Paharidhala area around 3:00am, acting on a tip-off that some drug peddlers would smuggle yaba pills there. Sensing the RAB members presence, the drug peddlers opened fire. The RAB team retaliated, triggering the gunfight, the RAB official said. After the gun battle, the RAB team found three drug peddlers bullet-hit. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead, the official added.  However, family members of Shahidul said Shahidul was a trader. They alleged that around 11:00 am on15 June four plainclothes men in a microbus came to his shop on IBP road in Coxs Bazar town and picked him up. Shahiduls father Abul Kashem was present there at that time. He said the plainclothes men had firearms with them. My son had been abroad for many years. He returned home six or seven months ago and started to run a grocery shop. He was not accused in any case, he said. Kashem said the plainclothes men came to the shop again after two hours and gave them a mobile number for contact. But he could not communicate with anybody as no one received his calls. After Shahidul was picked up, traders of Coxs Bazar towns Boro Bazar gave a memorandum to Coxs Bazar police superintendent, seeking trace of Shahidul. They also informed RAB of the matter. But all denied picking up Shahidul.

Description: Lt Mirza Shahed Mahtab, camp commander of RAB-15 in Teknaf, said a RAB team conducted an anti-drug drive in Paharidhala area around 3:00am, acting on a tip-off that some drug peddlers would smuggle yaba pills there. Name: Abul Hashem
Description: BGB-10 Commander Lt Col Abu Mohammad Mohiuddin said a team was conducting an anti-drug raid in Rajeshpur Eco Park area when some drug peddlers opened fire, prompting a gunfight. After the gunfight, the BGB team found Hashem bullet-wounded and took him to Cumilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Tanvir Ahmed Anik
Description: Tanvir Ahmed Anik, so-called ringleader of criminal gang Seven-Star Group, was killed in a gunfight with RAB. Tipped off that Tanvir and his associates would gather somewhere in Basila, a team of RAB conducted a drive to arrest them. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the miscreants opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered a shootout.Later, RAB members recovered Tanvir and rushed him to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Tofayel
Description: Abdullah Al Mamun, officer-in-charge of Cumilla Sadar South Model Police Station, said based on information, a team of police conducted an anti-drug drive in Rajapara Chowmohoni area around 2:15 am. Sensing police presence, the drug peddlers opened fired on them, the OC said, adding that the gunfight ensued when police fired back in retaliation. Later, police recovered Tofayel with bullet injuries and took him to Cumilla Medical College Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

Name: Lipu alias Boma Lipu
Description: DB police arrested Lipu on 19 June evening and went on a drive to recover firearms in the citys Dapa Balur Math area. When they reached the scene around 3:00am, Lipus associates opened fire on police forcing them to retaliate, said Kamrul Hasan, Sub-Inspector of DB police. Lipu came in line of the fire during the gunfight and was taken to Narayanganj General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Zafar Member
Description: In Chattogram, a gunfight took place around 12:30pm when a team from RAB 7 raided Banshkhali upazilas Saral area. They went there to arrest two robber brothers -- Zafar Member and his younger brother Khalil Ahmed, of the same area, according to RAB sources. As RAB members reached there, the robbers and their cohorts sensed their presence and opened fire on them. The RAB members retaliated by firing back, said Mashkur Rahman, Assistant Director of RAB-7 (media wing).  The other attackers managed to flee, he claimed.

Name: Khalil Ahmed
Description: In Chattogram, a gunfight took place around 12:30pm when a team from RAB 7 raided Banshkhali upazilas Saral area. They went there to arrest two robber brothers -- Zafar Member and his younger brother Khalil Ahmed, of the same area, according to RAB sources. As RAB members reached there, the robbers and their cohorts sensed their presence and opened fire on them. The RAB members retaliated by firing back, said Mashkur Rahman, Assistant Director of RAB-7 (media wing).  The other attackers managed to flee, he claimed.

Name: Babul Mia
Description: According to RAB's Assistant Police Superintendent Kamruzzaman, Babul was  killed in a gunfight when some RAB members were carrying out a raid in Dombari area of the upazila around 3:15am. After the gunfight, RAB personnel found the body. However, Babuls father Afaz Uddin said that his son had been arrested by RAB from a hospital in the capitals Khilkhet area on 20 June noon. Asked, Kamruzzaman rejected the allegation. This is not true, he said.

Name: Abdullah Al Zunaid
Description: Additional Superintendent of Police Sanatan Chakravarty said that two groups of criminals  were  getting ready for committing mugging, therefore a police team rushed to the spot . Sensing the presence of police the criminals opened fire forcing police to retaliate. After the gunfight police found bullet injured Abdullah Al Zunaid and sent him to Bogura  Shaheed Zia Medical College Hospital. However his situation was deteriorated and sent to Dhaka's  Orthaeopaedic Hospital where he died on 18.6.19

Name: Omar Faruk
Location: Katabunia of Teknaf upazila in Coxs Bazar
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Model Police Station, claimed Faruk and Rubel were accused in a case filed over trafficking of 49 Rohingyas. According to the OC, a police team conducted a raid in Katabunia Ghat area of Sabrang union in Teknaf to arrest the duo around 1:00am. Sensing their presence, the criminals and their cohorts opened fire on policemen, forcing them to retaliate, the OC claimed. The duo was injured during the gunfight. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammed Rubel
Location: Katabunia of Teknaf upazila in Coxs Bazar
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Model Police Station, claimed Faruk and Rubel were accused in a case filed over trafficking of 49 Rohingyas. According to the OC, a police team conducted a raid in Katabunia Ghat area of Sabrang union in Teknaf to arrest the duo around 1:00am. Sensing their presence, the criminals and their cohorts opened fire on policemen, forcing them to retaliate, the OC claimed. The duo was injured during the gunfight. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Kurban Ali
Description: Teknaf OC Pradip Kumar Das said a police team raided Maheskhaliapara boat terminal around 4:00am on a tip-off to arrest those named in a case over trafficking of 15 Rohingyas. Sensing their presence, the traffickers opened fire forcing the law enforcers to fire back in self-defence. This triggered a gun-battle and at one stage, most of the traffickers escaped, said the OC. Later, police found three men lying on the ground with bullet wounds and took them to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors pronounced them dead.

Name: Abdul Quader
Description: Teknaf OC Pradip Kumar Das said a police team raided Maheskhaliapara boat terminal around 4:00am on a tip-off to arrest those named in a case over trafficking of 15 Rohingyas. Sensing their presence, the traffickers opened fire forcing the law enforcers to fire back in self-defence. This triggered a gun-battle and at one stage, most of the traffickers escaped, said the OC. Later, police found three men lying on the ground with bullet wounds and took them to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors pronounced them dead.

Name: Abdur Rahman

Sensing their presence, the traffickers opened fire forcing the law enforcers to fire back in self-defence. This triggered a gun-battle and at one stage, most of the traffickers escaped, said the OC. Later, police found three men lying on the ground with bullet wounds and took them to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors pronounced them dead.

Name: Abdur Rahman
Description: ABS Doha, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Model Police Station, said that police arrested them on 27 June. Later, a team of police, along with the criminals, conducted a drive in Hinla Girls High School hill around 1:00am to recover arms, he claimed. As soon as they appeared in the hill area, a group of criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, the two siblings were caught in the line of fire, he added. They were rushed to a local hospital with bullet injuries where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Abdus Salam
Description: ABS Doha, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Model Police Station, said that police arrested them on 27 June. Later, a team of police, along with the criminals, conducted a drive in Hinla Girls High School hill around 1:00am to recover arms, he claimed. As soon as they appeared in the hill area, a group of criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, the two siblings were caught in the line of fire, he added. They were rushed to a local hospital with bullet injuries where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Proshanto Kumar Das
Description: Lt Col Abu Mohammad Mohiuddin, commanding officer (CO) of Rangpur BGB Battalion-10, said that Proshanto was detained from Mogoltuli area. Based on the information, during primary interrogation, a team of BGB men, along with Proshanto, conducted a raid in Bibirbazar area around 1:00am. Sensing their presence, criminals opened fire on the BGB team prompting a retaliation that triggered the gunfight, the BGB CO claimed. Proshanto was sustained bullet wounds and rushed to Cumilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Iqbal Hossain Rana
Description: Major Mehedi Hasan, Deputy Director (DD) of RAB-7, claimed that a patrol team of RAB-7 went to Amirabad area of Sitakunda on information that some criminals were gathering there. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. After the gunfight, RAB men found a bullet-riddled body of Rana on the spot. They rushed him to Sitakunda Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Nur
Identity: An alleged drug peddler; a Rohingya man
Location: Rahmat Bil area, Ukhia, Cox's Bazar
Description: Mohammad Nur, a suspected drug dealer was killed in a gunfight with BGB.

Name: Ramzan Mia
Description: Ramzan Mia, suspected key planner of Badda Awami League leader Farhad Hossain murder, was killed in a gunfight with police in Badda area. On information of Ramzans return to home, a team of Detective Branch of police conducted a drive in the capitals Satarkul area to arrest him. Sensing their presence, Ramzan and his cohorts opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. During the gunfight, Ramzan was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet wounds. He was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, the Deputy Commissioner (DB North) of Dhaka Metropolitan Police Mashiur Rahman said.

Name: Salim Ullah
Description: Salim Ullah was killed in a gunfight with RAB. Acting on a tip-off, a team of Rab-15 conducted a drive in Jhaubagan area of the town around 4:00am. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fired on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate.After the gunfight, Rab recovered Salims body from the spot.

Name: Leon Siddique
Description: Leon, an accused in at least 17 cases including murder, narcotic and extortion, was arrested by police in Konabari upazila of Gazipur on 1 July night, said Alamgir Hossain Majumdar, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Kailakair Police Station. The police official claimed that a team of policemen, along with Leon, conducted a raid in Shafipur area of Gazipurs Kaliakair upazila around 1:00am to recover firearms. Sensing their presence, Leons cohorts opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, Leon was caught on the line of fire and sustained bullet wounds, the OC added. Later, policemen rushed Leon to Kaliakair Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Hamid Prakash alias Hamid Member
Location: Moheshkhalipara bazar area of Teknaf, Cox's Bazar
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station said police arrested a top listed drug dealer Hamid around 4:00pm on 1 July in Moheshkhalipara bazar area of Teknaf. Based on his information, a team of policemen, along with Hamid, went to Moheshkhalipara area around 2:00am to recover firearms, the OC claimed. Sensing police presence, Hamids cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, Hamid was caught on the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries, he added. Police rushed Hamid to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, the OC further said.

Name: Sabbir Hossain Nayan alias Nayan Bond
Description: The prime accused in the Rifat murder case was killed in a gunfight between his accomplices and police in Barguna. A team of Barguna police rushed towards Purbo Burirchar area around 4:15am on information that Sabbir Hossain Nayan alias Nayan Bond who, along with another, hacked Barguna youth Rifat Sharif to death in broad daylight on June 26, was staying there. As the team reached near Purkata ferry ghat, around 10 kilometres from the district town, it came under fire from Nayans cohorts. Police returned fire in self-defence, Maruf Hossain, superintendent of police in Barguna, said at a press conference at his office.

Name: Mohammad Waliullah
Description: Shahed Mahamud, Officer-in-Charge of Bera Police Station said that acting on a tip-off, police arrested Waliullah from Bera municipality area on 3 July night, the OC said. Later, they conducted a raid in Jorda area to recover a batch of hidden drugs and firearms taking the arrestee along with them, he added. When they reached the spot, Waliullahs accomplices opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight. Waliullah was hit by a bullet during the incident and was taken to Bera Upazila Health Complex where he succumbed to his injuries.

Name: Anwar Hosen
Description: Anwar was killed in a gunfight with RAB in Dhakas Uttarkhan area around 2:00am. Kamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1, said that a team of RAB-1 raided Uttarkhan area on information that a group of drug peddlers gathered there. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, Anwar sustained bullet injuries. RAB rushed Anwar to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Saiful Islam
Description: Saiful Islam, was killed in a gunfight with law enforcers in Mymensinghs Bhaluka upazila around 1:15am. The police official claimed that they raided Hatiber area of Bhaluka on information that Saiful and his cohorts gathered there. Sensing police presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point, as the gunfight ended, police found bullet-hit body of Saiful. They rushed Saiful to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Saiful Islam Geda
Description: Saiful Islam Geda was killed in a gunfight with police. He was arrested a day before he was killed. Arbinda Sarkar, Officer-in-Charge of Sujanagar Police Station, claimed a police team, along with Saiful Islam Geda, conducted a raid in Hasampur field area around 2:30am to recover firearms. Sensing their presence Saiful's cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, Saiful  sustained bullet injuries. Police rushed him to Sujanagar Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Abdul Malek
Description: Abdul Malek, was killed in a gunfight with police. Abdul Malek, was the son of Mokbul Hossain from the districts Natun Pallanpara area, said Prodip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. Police arrested him. A team of police conducted a raid in Lengurbeel Mathchara area around 12:15am. Sensing their presence, a group of yaba traders opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight, the OC added. Later, police recovered bullet-injured Malek from the spot and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Sumon alias Manik
Description: Manik, was killed in a gunfight with police. Additional Superintendent of Police (Addl SP) in Natore Harun-or-Rashid told press that police had arrested Manik from Ishwardi on 12 July. He was held in another case filed on charge of shooting a college student before snatching his motorcycle on July 5 in Natores Baraigram upazila. Addl SP in Natore Akramul Islam said that a team of police was conducting drives to arrest Maniks accomplices taking him along with them. When they were crossing Gopalpur area around 2:00am, Maniks cohorts opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back.. Manik was caught in the line of fire when he tried to escape the prison van, he added. Later, police took him to Lalpur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mufid Alam
Description: Mufid Alam, was killed in a gunfight with police at Teknaf upazila.  Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they arrested Mufid around 8:30pm on 13 July. Gleaning information from him, a police team conducted a raid around 1:30am in Nayapara area along with Mufid. Sensing their presence, Mufids cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Mufid sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight. Later, he was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Biplob
Description: Biplob was killed during a raid led by the Detective Branch (DB) of police in Chandmari of Narayanganj around 3:00am, said Kamrul Hassan, a sub-inspector of Narayanganj DB. DB personnel led the anti-drug raid on a tip-off. Sensing their presence, the miscreants opened fire. The gunfight ensued as police retaliated.. Biplob was found lying on the ground with gunshot wounds after his accomplices managed to flee. He was taken to the Naryanganj General Hospital where doctors declared him dead

Name: Amin
Description: Amin, drowned in the Padma River during a gunfight between police and his cohorts at Kashiadanga, told local police. On a tip-off that a drug consignment was being carried, a police team raided Kashiadanga around 3:00am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the drug peddlers opened fire triggering a gunfight, said Monsur Ali Arif, Officer-in-Charge of Kashiadanga Police Station. Amins body was found floating in the river after other peddlers fled the scene, said the official, adding, police took Amin to the Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where he was pronounced dead.

Name: Asmaul Saudagar
Description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in an alleged gunfight with Border Guard Bangladesh officials. Lt Col Mohammad Foysal Khan, Commanding Officer of BGB-2 Battalion, said one of their teams conducted a drive in Jajimura Shikolpara area around 12:30am on information of drugs being smuggled through the Naf river. The criminals opened fire just as the border guards reached the spot. The BGB men retaliated for self-defence, leaving two with bullet wounds.They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where they were both declared dead.

Name: Zabed Mia
Description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in an alleged gunfight with Border Guard Bangladesh officials. Lt Col Mohammad Foysal Khan, Commanding Officer of BGB-2 Battalion, said one of their teams conducted a drive in Jajimura Shikolpara area around 12:30am on information of drugs being smuggled through the Naf river. The criminals opened fire just as the border guards reached the spot. The BGB men retaliated for self-defence, leaving two with bullet wounds.They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where they were both declared dead.

Name: Rafiqul Islam
Description: Rafiqul Islam, was killed in a gunfight with police.  Nasir Uddin, Officer-in-Charge of Kushtia Model Police Station, claimed they raided Harora field on information that two groups of drug peddlers were holding a secret meeting there. As soon as the police team reached the area, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one stage of the gunfight, police found the body of Rafiqul lying on the spot. Rest of the criminals managed to flee.The victim's wife alleged that he was picked up on 18 July from his in-laws house

Name: Mohammad Hossain
Description: Mohammad Hossain, was killed in a gunfight with police at Teknaf. He was arrested two hours before the gunfight, said police. Prodip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said that on information that a large consignment of yaba was stored in Whaikhyang, a police team, along with Mohammad, raided the area. As soon as they reached there, a group of drug peddlers opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, the OC claimed. During the gunfight, Mohammad sustained bullet injuries. He was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later, on duty doctors referred him to Coxs Bazar General Hospital where he died around 3:00am.

Name: Khalek
Location: Chandpai Range of the Sundarbans in Bagerhats Sarankhola upazila
Description: Khalek and Belal, members of a robber gang locally known as Khalek Bahini. They were killed as they got engaged in a gunfight with RAB members at Chandpai Range of the Sundarbans. Major Shajibul Islam, deputy commander of RAB-8, claimed a team was patrolling the area when Khalek Bahini opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, the duo sustained bullet injuries. Around 7:00am, RAB members rushed the two to Khulnas Dacope Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead..

Name: Belal
Location: Chandpai Range of the Sundarbans in Bagerhats Sarankhola upazila
Description: Khalek and Belal, members of a robber gang locally known as Khalek Bahini. They were killed as they got engaged in a gunfight with RAB members at Chandpai Range of the Sundarbans. Major Shajibul Islam, deputy commander of RAB-8, claimed a team was patrolling the area when Khalek Bahini opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, the duo sustained bullet injuries. Around 7:00am, RAB members rushed the two to Khulnas Dacope Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead..

Name: Maharaj Khalifa
Location: Satarkul area of Badda in Dhaka
Description: Senior ASP Kamruzzaman of Rab-1 said a RAB team conducted a raid in the area on information that Khalifa and his cohorts gathered there for a drug dealing. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, the criminals opened fire, forcing RAB members to retaliate. Khalifa was caught in the line of fire during the gunfight, he claimed, adding RAB members then rushed him to DMCH where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Najmul Hasan
Description: Babu was killed in Mirpurs Beribadh area around 3:15am, said Senior ASP Sajedul Islam of RAB-4. Babu, who had fled to India few years ago, recently returned to Dhaka to take part in a killing mission, reported UNB quoting Major Kazi Saifuddin Ahmed, second-in-command of RAB-4.

Name: Jaker
Description: Jaker, was killed in a gunfight with Rab in Chattograms Banshkhali. According to Major Mahedi Hasan, Deputy Director of RAB-7 (Chandgaon camp), a team of the elite force conducted a raid in Purba Chambals hilly areas on information that a robber gang was positioned there. As soon as they located the criminals and approached them, Jaker and his cohorts opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, he claimed. RAB later found Jakers bullet-hit body on the spot, adding Jakers cohorts managed to flee the scene.

Name: Mohammad Suman
Description: Lt Col Ashique Billah, Commanding Officer of RAB-2, claimed that Suman, an illegal arms trader was killed when a RAB team, acting on a tip-off, conducted a drive in the Hazaribagh area to recover firearms from him. He said when the team reached near Shikder Medical College around 4:30am, Sumon opened fired. The RAB members retaliated, triggering the gunfight. At one stage, Sumon was hit and died on the spot, he added.

Name: Omar Faruk
Identity: Suspected drug peddler; a Rohingya from Kutupalang Rohingya camp
Description: They were killed in shootout with members of RAB 2 in Teknaf upazila. Acting on a tip-off that a consignment of drug will be smuggled into the country through Marine Drive road, a RAB team took position at Baharchhara Uttar Shilkhani around 3:00am, said Mohiuddin Faruki, Company Commander of RAB-2. The team signalled a car to stop, but the drug peddlers in the vehicle opened fire, forcing the RAB members to return fire. After the gun battle, the team found the two bullet hit and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Abdur Rahman
Description: They were killed in shootout with members of RAB 2 in Teknaf upazila. Acting on a tip-off that a consignment of drug will be smuggled into the country through Marine Drive road, a RAB team took position at Baharchhara Uttar Shilkhani around 3:00am, said Mohiuddin Faruki, Company Commander of RAB-2. The team signalled a car to stop, but the drug peddlers in the vehicle opened fire, forcing the RAB members to return fire. After the gun battle, the team found the two bullet hit and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Arman
Description: Arman, was killed in a gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion. He was accused in a case filed over the rape of a grade-VIII student in the area earlier this month, said Mashkur Rahman, Assistant Director (AD) of RAB-7 (media wing). According to the RAB official, a team of the elite force conducted a raid in the upazilas Kusumpur union around 4:00am on information that the suspected criminal was hiding there. As soon as the RAB team reached the area, Arman and his cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate.

Name: Mohammad Ibrahim
Description: Ibrahim, was killed in a gunfight with BGB members in Teknaf. Lt Col Foysal Hasan Khan, Commanding Officer of BGB-2 Battalion in Teknaf, said a BGB team signalled a Coxs Bazar-bound auto-rickshaw to stop around 4:00am in Kurearmukh area near Marine Drive road. But the criminals ignored the signal and opened fire on the BGB team, triggering the gunfight, he said. The criminals then got down from the vehicle and continued firing. After the gun battle, the BGB members found the body of Ibrahim lying on the spot.

Name: Hamida Begum
Description: A press release issued by the Teknaf police said that a team of police, on information that two groups of drug peddlers had got into a gunfight raided the Jadimora area near the river Naff at about 4:45am. It claimed that the police opened fire to bring the situation under control, searched the areas after the peddler had fled away, found bullet-hit Hamida, took her to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where duty doctor declared her dead.

Name: Shipon Mia
Location: Dumurtala in Bakshiganj upazila of Jamalpur
Description: Shipon Mia, was killed in a reported gunfight with police. Tipped off, a team of police conducted a drive in the area, said AKM Mahbubul Alam, officer-in-charge of Bakshiganj police station. At one stage, Shipon and his associates opened fire on police, forcing them to fire back that triggered a gun battle. Shipon sustained bullet injuries while trying to flee the scene. He was taken to Bakshiganj Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Habibur Rahman
Description: Kamal and Habibur Rahman were killed in a gunfight with BGB members.

Name: Mohammad Kamal
Identity: Drug peddler; a Rohingya man who resides of 18 no. Balukhali camp under Ukhiya, E block-12
Description: Kamal and Habibur Rahman were killed in a gunfight with BGB members.

Name: Sujan
Description: Sujan was killed in a gunfight with BGB.

Name: Nazrul Islam Naju
Description: Nazrul Islam Naju, was killed in a gunfight with RAB. Kamruzzaman, Assistant Superintendent of RAB-1, said a team of the elite force conducted a raid the towns Pubail area around 2:30am on information that a group of six to seven drug traders gathered there. As soon as the RAB team reached the area, criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Nazrul sustained bullet injuries as he was caught in the line of fire but his cohorts managed to flee, the RAB official added. Later, Nazrul was taken to Shaheed Tajuddin Medical College and Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mehedi Hasan
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said a police team conducted a raid in Nurullaguna hill area around 3:30am on information that 10 to 15 robbers were preparing to commit robbery. As police reached the area, criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, police recovered bullet-hit bodies of Junayed, Mehedi and Ayub. The law enforcers rushed them to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Junayed
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said a police team conducted a raid in Nurullaguna hill area around 3:30am on information that 10 to 15 robbers were preparing to commit robbery. As police reached the area, criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, police recovered bullet-hit bodies of Junayed, Mehedi and Ayub. The law enforcers rushed them to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Ayub
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said a police team conducted a raid in Nurullaguna hill area around 3:30am on information that 10 to 15 robbers were preparing to commit robbery. As police reached the area, criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, police recovered bullet-hit bodies of Junayed, Mehedi and Ayub. The law enforcers rushed them to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Jahirul Islam
Identity: An accused in a case over the gang rape
Description: Shah Kamal Akanda, Officer-in-Charge of the Detective Branch of Mymensingh police, said acting on a tip-off they launched a drive in Phulbaria upazilas Kaladah Eidgah area around 2:30am to arrest Jahirul. Sensing the presence of police, criminals fired shots at the law enforcers, triggering the gunfight. At one stage, the criminals fled the scene. Police found bullet-hit Jahirul lying there and they took him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital (MMCH) where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Jony Mia
Description: Police conducted a drive in Char Puliamari area of Mymensingh around midnight on information that a group of alleged drug peddlers were gathering there. A gunfight broke out there around 12:30 am as the criminals opened fire at the law enforcers. The DB official said the incident left alleged drug peddler Jony Mia critically injured. He was sent to MMCH where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Delwar Hossain
Description: Police conducted a drive in Char Puliamari area of Mymensingh around midnight on information that a group of alleged drug peddlers were gathering there. A gunfight broke out there around 12:30 am as the criminals opened fire at the law enforcers. The DB official said the incident left alleged drug peddler Jony Mia critically injured. He was sent to MMCH where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Nurul Islam
Identity: Suspected drug peddler; a Rohingya man from Block-2 of Kutupalong Rohingya camp
Description: Lt Col Faisal Hasan Khan, captain of Teknaf BGB, said they launched a drive at Kharangkhali of Hoikang area near the Naf river around 3:30am. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the drug peddlers opened fire at BGB, triggering a gunfight, the BGB official said. Injured Nurul and Delwar were admitted to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later, they were shifted to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead, the BGB official added. The BGB said they seized 20,000 yaba pills, two arms, two sharp weapons and four bullets from the spot.

Name: Mohammad Aiyub
Identity: Suspected drug peddler; a Rohingya man from Kutupalong Rohingya camp
Description: Aiyub was killed in a gunfight with the BGB in Ruppati area. Anwar Hossain, Additional Director of 34 BGB Battalion in Coxs Bazar, said a BGB team was conducting a drive in the area around 4:00am. The team signaled a motorbike to pull over, but the bikers didnt comply and opened fire at the BGB men. The BGB personnel fired retaliatory shots. The gunfight lasted for about 10 minutes. Later, the BGB men informed the Inani Police Outpost about the incident. Police rushed to the spot and found Aiyub lying there with bullet wounds. Aiyub was taken to Ukhia Upazila Health Complex where doctors pronounced him dead, said the BGB official.

Name: Soleman
Description: Soleman was killed in a gunfight with police in Chunarughat upazilas Dewatali Kalinagar area. Nazmul Haque, OC of Chunarughat Police Station, said a team of police conducted a drive in Dewatali Kalinagar area around 3:00am on information that a gang of robbers was taking preparations to commit a robbery. Sensing police action, the robbers opened fired at the law enforcers, sparking the gun battle, the OC said. The incident left Soleman injured. He died on way to a hospital.

Name: Ashraful Islam
Description: Muhammed Mohiuddin Faruqe, superintendent of RAB-2, said they set up a check-post on Dhaka-Tangail highway in Kaliakoir upazila on information that a consignment of drugs was scheduled to pass by from Dhaka to Chuadanga. In the noon, a car tried to escape the check-post. Following the car, RAB officials reached an isolated area. At one point, the car got into a roadside Tamarisk bush. Finding no way out, Ashraful, who was driving the car, pointed a gun at the RAB officials, the superintendent claimed. In self defence, the RAB official shot a gunfire that injured Ashraful. In response, Ashraful fired back, forcing the RAB officials to retaliate with more gunshots. The man died on the spot, the RAB official claimed.

Name: Shishir Ghosh
Description: Shishir Ghosh, an  accused in multiple cases was killed  in a shootout with police. Shishirs family, however, have alleged that police picked up Shishir from in front of his house and killed him just hours later. Sunil Ghosh, Shishirs uncle and a local journalist, said a team of the Detective Branch (DB) of police picked Shishir up from on 6 August around 8:30pm. In the name of recovering arms, they took him near a brick kiln in Mahidia area and shot him dead. They then left his body at the hospital, Sunil said. I had called the DBs officer-in-charge [OC] over phone [after Shishir was taken] and he said nothing would happen to Shishir and that they just took him for questioning. But I later found his dead body at the hospital,

Name: Malek Fakir
Description: Malek Fakir, was killed in a gunfight with members of Rab. Raisuddin, Additional Superintendent of RAB-8, claimed a team of the elite force challenged a group of drug peddlers around 4:00am in Jagua-Choupashar Pole area of the city. At one point, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Fakir sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight. Later, RAB members rushed him to Sher-e-Bangla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Chinu Mia
Description: Chinu Mia,  was killed in a gunfight with police. AKM Mehdi Hasan, officer-in-charge of Gobindaganj Police Station, claimed they conducted a raid on the banks of the Karatoa on information of Chinu and his gangs whereabouts. Sensing police presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. During the gunfight, Chinu sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot.

Name: Chan Mia Hawlader
Description: Chan Mia Hawlader, was killed in a gunfight with police. Mostafizur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge of Patuakhali Police Station, said Chan was awarded with 10 years imprisonment in a robbery case but managed to stay in hiding. The OC claimed they conducted a raid in Karomjatala area of the upazila around 2:00am on information that a group of criminals gathered there for robbery. Sensing the police presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he further claimed. At one point, Chan sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot.

Name: Kamal Hossain Prokash
Description: Kamal Hossain Prokash, was killed in a gunfight with RAB at Pekua..RAB conducted a drive in Mognama Ghat area of Pekua on information that a group of robbers, led by Badsha, was preparing for robbery there, claimed Major Mehedi Hasan, Coxs Bazar Company Commander of RAB-7. Sensing RABs presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one stage of the gunfight, the criminals fled the scene leaving bullet-hit Prokash behind. RAB rescued Prokash and rushed to Pekua Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Nur Alam
Identity: Alleged Rohingya drug peddler; from Muchni Rohingya camp
Description: Two alleged Rohingya drug peddlers were killed in gunfights with members of Border Guard Bangladesh. A BGB-2 team conducted a raid at the Hoaikong Urubunia Katakhal area after a tip-off about a large amount of yaba being smuggled from there, said BGB-2 Deputy Commander Major Shariful Islam Jamaddar. The BGB members signalled a boat to stop on the Naf River. But the smugglers ignored the signal and opened fire, triggering a gunfight. Alam and Sarker were killed during the shootout, Maj Shariful said, adding that BGB members recovered the bodies and sent them to a local hospital for autopsy.

Name: Sarker
Identity: Alleged Rohingya drug peddler; from Kutupalong Rohingya camp
Description: Two alleged Rohingya drug peddlers were killed in gunfights with members of Border Guard Bangladesh. A BGB-2 team conducted a raid at the Hoaikong Urubunia Katakhal area after a tip-off about a large amount of yaba being smuggled from there, said BGB-2 Deputy Commander Major Shariful Islam Jamaddar. The BGB members signalled a boat to stop on the Naf River. But the smugglers ignored the signal and opened fire, triggering a gunfight. Alam and Sarker were killed during the shootout, Maj Shariful said, adding that BGB members recovered the bodies and sent them to a local hospital for autopsy.

Name: Ekhlas Uddin
Identity: An accused of murder; an Awami League activist
Description: Ekhlas Uddin, was killed in a reported gunfight with the Detective Branch (DB) of police at the Chakua Daria intersection in Mymensingh. The incident took place nearly two days after he was allegedly picked up by plainclothes men. Ekhlass father Nurul Islam, said Ekhlas was a ruling party activist and three young men, who he was familiar with, came to their house and asked him to go out with them. Ekhlas then went to Sadua Marker Bazar on his motorbike around 3:00pm on 20 August. Around 4:00pm, we were informed that plainclothes men picked him up. His mobile phone was switched off since then, said Nurul. I also asked the young men who took Ekhlas out about where he is but they could not say. Even the motorbike is yet to be recovered, he added. Police also denied picking him up. The family then decided to lodge a general diary with local police station yesterday but around 4:00am, they heard the news of Ekhlass death on television.

Name: Abdus Shukkur
Identity: Accused in a case filed over the murder of a Jubo League leader; resident of Teknafs Zadimura Rohingya refugee camp
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf police station, said a gunfight took place around 1:30am as one of their teams carried out a raid in Jadimura hill area, on information that some accused in the murder case had gathered there. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, resulting in the gunfight. After the criminals fled away, police found two bullet-hit men lying there. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Muhammad Shah
Identity: Accused in a case filed over the murder of a Jubo League leader; resident of Teknafs Zadimura Rohingya refugee camp
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf police station, said a gunfight took place around 1:30am as one of their teams carried out a raid in Jadimura hill area, on information that some accused in the murder case had gathered there. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, resulting in the gunfight. After the criminals fled away, police found two bullet-hit men lying there. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Abdus Sahid
Location: Maricha area of Zakiganj upazila, Sylhet
Description: On information that a group of robbers would rob a house of a Bangladeshi expatriate, police raided Maricha area around 1.15am, said Meer Md Abdul Naser, Officer-in-Charge of Zakiganj Police Station. Sensing police presence, the criminals at first hurled bricks and then opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate, he claimed. As we chased them, they fled. While searching the area after the gunfight, we found Shahid on the ground shot and injured. We rushed him to the upazila health complex where duty doctors declared him dead, the OC said. Police also claimed to have recovered one locally made firearm, five empty bullet shells and some sharp local weapons from the spot.

Name: Hasan
Identity: An Rohingya accused in a case filed over the murder of a Jubo League leader;  son of Hamid Ullah of Jadimura Rohingya camp
Description: Acting on information that Rohingya criminals were gathering beside Jadimura Hill, police led a drive around 1:30am, said Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station Pradip Kumar Das. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing the policemen to respond, he said, adding that police fired 10 bullets in self-defence. After the end of the gunfight, police rescued the injured Rohingya youth from the spot and admitted him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. He was later shifted to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead, the OC said.

Name: Al-Amin
Location: Rajapur flood protection embankment in Bhola
Description: Bhola sadar police station Officer-in-Charge Md Sagir Mia said that a team of police was on raids in Rajapur area to arrest robbers. Hearing gunshots nearby, they advanced towards place of occurrence at Rajapur flood protection embankment at about 2:30am. He said that two groups of pirates were trading gunshots over sharing their booty. The OC said that when police reached near the place, the suspected robbers opened fire on them, forcing the police personnel to retaliate with firing that triggered a gunfight. At one stage, the robbers fled away by trawlers and police searched the area and found two bullet-hit unidentified suspected robbers and rushed them to Bhola General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

Name: Manjur Alam
Location: Rajapur flood protection embankment in Bhola
Description: Bhola sadar police station Officer-in-Charge Md Sagir Mia said that a team of police was on raids in Rajapur area to arrest robbers. Hearing gunshots nearby, they advanced towards place of occurrence at Rajapur flood protection embankment at about 2:30am. He said that two groups of pirates were trading gunshots over sharing their booty. The OC said that when police reached near the place, the suspected robbers opened fire on them, forcing the police personnel to retaliate with firing that triggered a gunfight. At one stage, the robbers fled away by trawlers and police searched the area and found two bullet-hit unidentified suspected robbers and rushed them to Bhola General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Babul
Location: Burma colony, a hilly area of West Sikderpara, in Teknknaf of Coxs Bazar
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer in-Charge of Teknaf police station, said that a police team raided West Sikderpara village on 16 August to seize yaba tablets and arrest suspected drug peddlers. At that time, members of drug peddlers gang opened fire at the police who also retaliated with gunshots that triggered a gunfight. He said that police rescued a bullet-hit injured person and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex from where doctors sent him to Coxs Bazar General Hospital where he died.

Name: Unidentified
Description: In Chattogram, a patrol team of RAB encountered with a group of armed criminals around 3:00am, said Mashukur Rahman, Assistant Director of RAB-7 (media wing). Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire on RAB members, forcing them to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, the criminals fled the scene. Later, RAB members recovered the body.

Name: Rasel Mia
Description: Rasel was killed in a gunfight with Detective Branch of police in Cumilla Sadar upazila. Mainuddin Khan, Officer-in-Charge of DB police in Cumilla said that a team of DB police conducted a raid in Sreepur area on information that a group of drug peddlers gathered there. As soon as the law enforcers reached the spot, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, OC Mainuddin added. During the gunfight, Rasel sustained bullets injuries. Later, policemen rushed him to Cumilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Sujon Mia
Description: Sujon Mia, was killed in a gunfight with RAB-1. A RAB team conducted a raid in Salna area on information that some youths were selling firearms and illegal drugs there, said Quamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, criminals opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, Sujon sustained bullet injuries. RAB members then rushed him to Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Iran
Description: Iran, was killed in a gunfight with members of RAB around 8:00am. Major Mehedi Hasan, Deputy Director of RAB-7 said that a patrol team of RABraided East Chambal area of the district on information that a group of robbers gathered there. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate.. Iran sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight and died on the spot.

Name: Rokonuzzaman Siddiq
Description: Rokonuzzaman Siddiq, was killed in a gunfight with police. Sukumar Biswas, Officer-in-Charge of Damurhuda Police Station, said a police team raided Joyrampur village of the upazila around 2:30am on information that two groups of drug peddlers were distributing narcotics. Sensing police presence, the criminals opened fire on the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate. During the gunfight, Rokonuzzaman sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot.

Name: Awlad Hossain Mithun
Description: Mithun, was killed in a gunfight with police in Narsingdis Madhabdi area few hours after he was arrested..  Abdul Gaffar, Sub-Inspector of Narsingdi DB police, said that Mithun and his accomplice Sohel, 25, were held on 30 August afternoon. Based on their information, a police team, along with Mithun, conducted a raid in the area to recover firearms. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate.. At one point of the gunfight, Mithun was caught in the line of fire. He was then rushed to Narsingdi Genral Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Ruhul Amin Ripon
Identity: Former Joint Secretary of Student wing of AL (BCL)
Description: Ripon was killed in a gunfight with DB Police.

Name: Sumon Chakma
Identity: An activist of United Peoples Democratic Front
Description: Sumon Chakma was killed during a gunfight with army at Baghaihat under Baghaichari upazila in Rangamati. Sumon was an activist of Prachit Jyoti Khisha-led faction of UPDF and also a suspect in the murder of Nannerchar upazila chairman Shaktiman Chakma, police said. An army team conducted a drive at Dopata to arrest some hooligans. As they turned up at the spot a group of miscreants opened fire on them at about 10:30am and the soldiers retaliated by firing. The gunfight lasted for about five minutes until the attackers retreated. Sumon Chakma, however, was shot and killed during the gunfight.

Name: Abdullah Al Mamun
Description: A young man died under custody at Kishoreganj police station at Nilphamari on 10 August 2019. Law enforcers arrested Abdullah from his residence early 10 August on charge of stealing cattle and kept him in custody at the police station. Victims cousin Mohammad Rashid alleged that Abdullah was tortured to death in the custody.

Name: Nabin Jyoti Chakma
Description: In a press release, Inter Services Public Relations Directorate (ISPR) said the gunfight broke out after the team reached Boradam on information that seven to eight armed criminals of the UPDF (Prasit Group) had gathered there. Sensing the presence of the army personnel, the criminals opened fire on them, prompting the patrol team to fire back. The gunfight continued for 10 to 15 minutes. At one point, the criminals were forced to step back, it said, adding that the gunfight left three criminals of the UPDF (Prasit Group) dead.

Name: Bhujendra Chakma
Description: In a press release, Inter Services Public Relations Directorate (ISPR) said the gunfight broke out after the team reached Boradam on information that seven to eight armed criminals of the UPDF (Prasit Group) had gathered there. Sensing the presence of the army personnel, the criminals opened fire on them, prompting the patrol team to fire back. The gunfight continued for 10 to 15 minutes. At one point, the criminals were forced to step back, it said, adding that the gunfight left three criminals of the UPDF (Prasit Group) dead.

Name: Ruchil Chakma alias Russel
Description: In a press release, Inter Services Public Relations Directorate (ISPR) said the gunfight broke out after the team reached Boradam on information that seven to eight armed criminals of the UPDF (Prasit Group) had gathered there. Sensing the presence of the army personnel, the criminals opened fire on them, prompting the patrol team to fire back. The gunfight continued for 10 to 15 minutes. At one point, the criminals were forced to step back, it said, adding that the gunfight left three criminals of the UPDF (Prasit Group) dead.

Name: Misbah Uddin
Description: Bianibazar police Sub-Inspector Mizanur Rahman said that they arrested Misbah from Jaflong at Goainghat on 31 August night as he was wanted in a robbery case filed with the police station. As per information extracted from Misbah during interrogation, a team of police along with Misbah went to Shewla Bridge area of Bianibazar at around 3:15am to arrest his accomplices and seize arms from them. The police said that sensing their presence in the area, the associates of Misbah started to open fire on them and that forced them to retaliate with gunshots triggering a gunfight. Misbah sustained of bullet injuries as he tried to fled the scene during the gunfight

Name: Noor Mohammad
Identity: A Rohingya prime accused in a case filed over the murder of a Jubo League leader
Location: Jadimura in Teknaf of Coxs Bazar
Description: Teknaf police Officer-in-Charge Pradeep Kumar Das said that they arrested Noor Mohammad at Ulochamari hill of Hnila in Teknaf on 31 August afternoon. Later, on early in the incident day, a police team, along with Noor, went to Jadimura hilly area  in search of his accomplices. When the police reached the area, Noors accomplices opened fire on them to snatch their leader, prompting police to retaliate with gunshots that triggered the gunfight, the OC said. After the hour-long gunfight was over, the police rescued Noor Mohammad with bullet injures and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Nurul Kader Rana
Description: Nurul Kader Rana, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB. RAB 7 media officer Masokur Rahman said Rana was a member of Bay of Bengal based robber gang and was prime accused of MV Ma-Babar Dowa and MV Mahin robbery case on Bay of Bengal near Hatiya of Noakhali on August 26.

Name: Fazar Ali
Description: Fazar Ali, was killed in a gunfight between RAB and a group of suspected drugs smugglers. RAB-9 media officer Md Moniruzzaman said that acting on a tip-off, they conducted a raid at Mitrimahal area at Goainghat upazila in the district at around 3:00am to arrest some drugs smugglers. He said that sensing presence of the battalion members in the area, the suspected smugglers opened fire on them forcing them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight. At one stage of shootout, the attackers retreated and then Fazar Ali was found dead on the spot.

Name: Kahlilur Rahman
Description: Kahlilur Rahman was killed in a gunfight with Detective Branch of police. DB officer-in-charge Shah Kamal Hossain said that  a police team raided Kalpa area on information that a group of auto-rickshaw lifter were gathered in the area. As the cops turned up in the area, the suspects opened fire on them who retaliated by firing. Cops caught injured Khalil when the attackers were retreating from the spot. He died on his way to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital.

Name: Joynal Abedin
Location: Amin Coloni area, Bayezid Bostami Police Station, Chattogram
Description: Joynal Abedin was killed in a gunfight with police at Amin Colony area. Police arrested him on 1 September at 8:00pm from his house.  A team of police along with Joynal went to raid that sensing their presence in the area, the associates of Joynal started to open fire on them and that forced them to retaliate with gunshots triggering a gunfight. Joynal sustained of bullet injuries during the gunfight and took him to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Belal
Description: Belal, was killed in a reported gunfight with police.Khulshi police station Officer-in-Charge Pranab Chowdhury said that  during his surrender, Belal promised to give up criminal activities and informed that he had illegal firearms. According to his information, a police team went to Jalalbad Hill of Khulshi with Belal to retrieve the arms at about 1:00am on next day. As they turned up at the spot, a group of unidentified gunman attacked them to snatch Belal away, the OC said. Cops retaliated by firing which prompted a gunfight,. The police officer said that they, after the shootout, found Belal injured and took him to Chattogram Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Sajal Mia
Description: Sajal Mia, killed in a gunfight with members of Detective Branch of police at Nizam Nagar. Shah Kamal Akand, Officer-in-Charge of DB, said one of their teams raided the area around 1:30am after being tipped off that drug peddlers were selling drugs in the area. The drug peddlers opened fire as soon as the DB team reached the area, triggering a gunfight, the OC said. Sajal, who was shot during the gunfight, was arrested and taken to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Ali
Location: Kumla under Burichang upazila in Cumilla
Description: Burichang police station Officer in-Charge Akul Chandra Biswas said that they on information that a group of robbers had been preparing to commit robbery at night raided Kumla area at about 3:30am and the suspected robbers, sensing presence of police, opened fire on police, who retaliated by firing back, which triggered a gunfight. Later, police searched the area, found three critically injured people, took them to Cumilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Babul
Location: Kumla under Burichang upazila in Cumilla
Description: Burichang police station Officer in-Charge Akul Chandra Biswas said that they on information that a group of robbers had been preparing to commit robbery at night raided Kumla area at about 3:30am and the suspected robbers, sensing presence of police, opened fire on police, who retaliated by firing back, which triggered a gunfight. Later, police searched the area, found three critically injured people, took them to Cumilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Tajul Islam
Location: Kumla under Burichang upazila in Cumilla
Description: Burichang police station Officer in-Charge Akul Chandra Biswas said that they on information that a group of robbers had been preparing to commit robbery at night raided Kumla area at about 3:30am and the suspected robbers, sensing presence of police, opened fire on police, who retaliated by firing back, which triggered a gunfight. Later, police searched the area, found three critically injured people, took them to Cumilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Hridoy
Description: Hridoy, was killed in a gunfight with members of RAB. Additional Superintendent Jasim Uddin of RAB 11, said that a team of RAB, while routine patrol setting up a check post on Dhaka-Chattogram highway at Mridhakandi challenged a car for its suspicious movement. But, the driver of the car, without stopping tried to flee by opening fire targeting the RAB personnel.. He said that the RAB personnel retaliated with gunshots that ensued a gunfight at about 4:00am while Hridoy left bullet injured. Later, he was taken to hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Abdul Karim
Identity: Two accuseds in a case filed over the murder of a Jubo League leader Omar Faruque
Location: Jadimura in Teknaf of Coxs Bazar
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge, Teknaf police station said police raided Jadimura area on information that some killers of Omar Farook had gathered there at midnight, said the Rohingyas opened fire on police when they reached the spot, forcing them to retaliate with gunshots that triggered a gunfight minutes after midnight. After the gunfight, police searched the area and found two critically injured people on the spot. Pradip said they rescued the duo with the help of locals, rushed them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex but physicians there referred them to Coxs Bazar General Hospital and they died on the way.

Name: Nesar Ahmed
Identity: Two accuseds in a case filed over the murder of a Jubo League leader Omar Faruque
Location: Jadimura in Teknaf of Coxs Bazar
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge, Teknaf police station said police raided Jadimura area on information that some killers of Omar Farook had gathered there at midnight, said the Rohingyas opened fire on police when they reached the spot, forcing them to retaliate with gunshots that triggered a gunfight minutes after midnight. After the gunfight, police searched the area and found two critically injured people on the spot. Pradip said they rescued the duo with the help of locals, rushed them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex but physicians there referred them to Coxs Bazar General Hospital and they died on the way.

Name: Sujon Malitha
Description: Sujon Malitha, was killed in a gunfight with police. Kushtia Model Police Station's Officer-in-Charge Nasir Uddin said that  on information that a gunfight between two groups of drug peddlers was going on, a team, led by Sub-inspector Mustafizur Rahman, went to the banks of GK (Ganges-Kabodak) canal in Mollateghoria village around 2:30am. Sensing the police presence, the criminals started firing at the law enforcers, compelling them to return fire. Then a tripartite gunfight took place, the OC claimed. During the gun battle, Sujon was hit and he died on the spot.

Name: Rubel Mia
Description: Rubel was killed in a gunfight with Detective Branch of police at Habirbari in Bhaluka of Mymensingh. Mymensingh DB officer-in-charge Shah Kamal Akand said during an anti-drug drive by two teams of DB police, they came to know that a group was peddling drugs in Habirbari area. DB police then rushed to the spot at 2:30am when the suspected peddlers opened fire on them while fleeing the spot. Police also retaliated with gunshots that led to Rubels death..

Name: Tutul
Description: Tutul was killed in a gunfight with police at Moharajpur under the upazila, said Inspector (operations) of sadar police station Md Idris Ali.

Name: Habib Ullah
Identity: A suspected accused in a case filed over the murder of a Jubo League leader
Location: Muchani in Teknaf in Coxs Bazar
Description: Habib Ullah, was killed in a gunfight with police at Muchani in Teknaf. Teknaf police station Officer-in-Charge Pradip Kumar Das said that they arrested Habib at hilly area of Jadimura Salbagan Rohingya camp when a gang of Rohingya robbers were preparing for committing robbery on 14 September afternoon. Later, as per information extracted from him, Pradip said, a team of police raided hilly area of Nayapara Muchani Rohingya Camp for seizing illegal firearms at about 12:30am.

Name: Abdur Rahim
Description: Abdur Rahim, was killed in what police claimed was a gunfight between police and armed cohorts of suspected robber. said Swapan Kumar, Officer-in-Charge of Sadar Police Station.  A team of police arrested Rahim from Indronarayanpur village in the upazila on 15 September, the OC said. During primary interrogation, Rahim told them the location of some hidden firearms. According to his information, a team of police raided Kalibari area around 2:00am, taking Rahim with them. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, cohorts of Rahim, who had taken position near the spot, opened fire on police. Polive in retaliation fired back, triggering a gunfight which resulted Abdur rahim dead on the spot.

Name: Masud Parvez
Description: Md Kamruzzaman, Assistant Director of RAB-1 in Gazipur, said a team of Rapid Action Battalion raided Saatkhamair Bazar area in Gazipurs Sreepur upazila around 2:30 am on information that a group of robbers was taking preparations for  a robbery. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, they fired shots at the RAB men. The RAB returned shots. The criminals escaped after sometime. The Rab found a man lying on the ground injured. He was sent to Sreepur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead. Masuds mother Rani Begum said Around 4:00pm on Monday, one of Masuds friends went to his in-laws house and got him into a microbus saying that they would go to Gopalganj. But at night, Masud called me and said his friend handed him over to some unidentified people who blindfolded him. I may not return home. Please look after my daughter, Rani said, quoting her son.

Name: Tuhin Hossain
Description: Maj Talukdar Nazmus Sakib, Deputy Commander of RAB-11 in Narayanganj, said that a RAB team picked up Tuhin Hossain from Cumillas Rasulpur area around 1:00am on18 September. Gleaning information from him, the RAB team raided Syedpur area of Naryanganj around 4:00am to recover arms and arrest Tuhins associates. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, criminals opened fire at the RAB men, forcing them to return shots, said Talukdar. At one stage, Tuhin along with his associates tried to flee. He was hit by bullets, but his cohorts managed to escape, said the RAB official. Tuhin was declared dead by doctors after being taken to Narayanganj General Hospital.

Name: Mohammad Jamil
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they arrested the trio on 18 September. On their information police, along with the three, conducted a drive in Teknafs Baharchhara area to recover firearms. As soon as they reached the area, criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. During the gunfight the three tried to flee the scene. At one point they were caught in the line of fire. Police then rushed them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Asmat Ullah
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they arrested the trio on 18 September. On their information police, along with the three, conducted a drive in Teknafs Baharchhara area to recover firearms. As soon as they reached the area, criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. During the gunfight the three tried to flee the scene. At one point they were caught in the line of fire. Police then rushed them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Rafique
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they arrested the trio on 18 September. On their information police, along with the three, conducted a drive in Teknafs Baharchhara area to recover firearms. As soon as they reached the area, criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. During the gunfight the three tried to flee the scene. At one point they were caught in the line of fire. Police then rushed them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Russell
Identity: A prime accused of a murder case
Description: Abdur Rahim,Inspector (investigation) of Chandgaon Police Station, said, Russell was the prime accused of a murder case filed with the station over stabbing and killing 22-year-old Jiad Hossain. On information, a police team conducted a drive at Jele Para field in Chandgaon around 1:45am to arrest the criminals. Sensing our presence, the miscreants attacked police with firearms and locally made weapons. Police also opened fire in retaliation. At one point, the criminals fled the scene leaving Russell dead on the spot, Inspector Rahim claimed.

Name: Arif Hossain
Identity: An alleged robber; a CNG-run auto-rickshaw driver
Description: Arif Hossain,  was killed in a shootout with police for his alleged involvement with a robbery gang. However, Arifs relatives said he was a CNG-run auto-rickshaw driver who had been missing for the last four to five days. AKM Azizur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Laxmipur Sadar Police Station, said they had information that an armed gang was preparing for a robbery. When a team of patrol police went to the spot, the robbers opened fire. Police retaliated, which forced the robbers to flee, the OC said. Police recovered Arifs bullet-hit body from the spot and took him to Laxmipur Sadar Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Dil Mohammad
Description: A Rohingya couple was killed in a gunfight with police in Coxs Bazar, hours after they were detained by the law enforcers. The incident that claimed the duo happened at a refugee camp in Hnila union. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they detained the duo with a gun. On their information, a police team, along with the duo, conducted a raid in the camp to recover firearms, the OC claimed. As soon as they reached the area, a group of criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight the duo caught in the line of fire, he added. Police rushed them to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Zaheda Begum
Description: A Rohingya couple was killed in a gunfight with police in Coxs Bazar, hours after they were detained by the law enforcers. The incident that claimed the duo happened at a refugee camp in Hnila union. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they detained the duo with a gun. On their information, a police team, along with the duo, conducted a raid in the camp to recover firearms, the OC claimed. As soon as they reached the area, a group of criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight the duo caught in the line of fire, he added. Police rushed them to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Shoshan Mitra
Description: Superintendent Mohiuddin Faruki, Company Commander of RAB-2, said three muggers coming in a motorbike snatched a bag from a man in front of Lab Aid Hospital around 12:45am. On information, a patrol team of RAB chased the motorbike. When the motorbike reached Hatirpool area, the elite force members asked them to surrender but the muggers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back.Two muggers- Hasan and Shoshan- sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight while another managed to flee the scene. Later, they were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared Shoshan dead.

Name: Bikash Kumar Dey
Description: Samir Sarkar, Superintendent of Police and Assistant Director of Rab-6, said that after a tip-off about drug peddlers gathered at Dhanibunia village, a team of RAB conducted a drive there around 12:30am.  Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire, forcing RAB officials to retaliate, he said, adding that at one stage, the criminals managed to flee the scene, leaving behind Bikash with bullet wounds. He was taken to Dumuria Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Touhid
Description: Touhid, 35, hailed from Chattogram, was hit by a bullet during a gunfight with Detective Branch (DB) of police in Nagdarpara area of Khilgaon, said Mashiur Rahman, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Khilgaon Police Station. Touhid was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Dosto Mohammad
Location: Hnila union of Teknaf upazila, Cox's Bazar
Description: Two Rohingya yaba smugglers were killed in a shootout with BGB members in Hnila union of Teknaf upazila around 4:00am, said Lt Col Foysal Hasan Khan, commanding officer of BGB-2 Battalion in Teknaf. They were from Maungdaw in Myanmar, said BGB. A BGB team on patrol in Jaliapara village found that some four to five drug peddlers were entering Bangladesh territory after crossing the Naf river by a boat, the BGB official said. When the criminals were asked to stop, they started firing, prompting them to retaliate.  During the gun battle, two yaba peddlers were hurt, while others fled.. The two were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead, the BGB official said.

Name: Dil Mohammad
Location: Hnila union of Teknaf upazila, Cox's Bazar
Description: Two Rohingya yaba smugglers were killed in a shootout with BGB members in Hnila union of Teknaf upazila around 4:00am, said Lt Col Foysal Hasan Khan, commanding officer of BGB-2 Battalion in Teknaf. They were from Maungdaw in Myanmar, said BGB. A BGB team on patrol in Jaliapara village found that some four to five drug peddlers were entering Bangladesh territory after crossing the Naf river by a boat, the BGB official said. When the criminals were asked to stop, they started firing, prompting them to retaliate.  During the gun battle, two yaba peddlers were hurt, while others fled.. The two were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead, the BGB official said.

Name: Abdul Karim
Description: Abdul Karim, was killed in a gunfight with police. Acting on a tip-off, a DB team raided Mukamiakanda Rice Mill area when some criminals were trading drugs around 1:15am, the OC said. Sensing the law enforcers presence, the criminals opened fire, triggering a gunfight, the OC claimed. At one stage, Karim was hit, while others fled. Police took Karim to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Yunus
Location: Jaliapara area by the River Naf at Teknaf in Coxs Bazar
Description: Two suspected Rohingya drug traders were killed in a reported gunfight with the BGB in Jaliapara area. BGB Battalion commanding officer Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan in Teknaf said that on information that a group of drug pedlars was trespassing on Bangladesh with a big consignment of yaba tablets, a BGB team cordoned off Hinllha Unions Jaliapara area of Teknaf  and asked the drug traders to surrender. After the gunfight, the BGB soldiers recovered two bullet-hit people from the spot and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later they were shifted to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital in critical condition where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Jamal
Location: Jaliapara area by the River Naf at Teknaf in Coxs Bazar
Description: Two suspected Rohingya drug traders were killed in a reported gunfight with the BGB in Jaliapara area. BGB Battalion commanding officer Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan in Teknaf said that on information that a group of drug pedlars was trespassing on Bangladesh with a big consignment of yaba tablets, a BGB team cordoned off Hinllha Unions Jaliapara area of Teknaf  and asked the drug traders to surrender. After the gunfight, the BGB soldiers recovered two bullet-hit people from the spot and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later they were shifted to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital in critical condition where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Ayub
Description: Ayub, was killed in a shootout with police.  Abul Kalam Azad, OC of Chandgaon Police Station. said  that tipped off Ayub and his associates had gathered in Annanya Residential area of Quiash Road, a police team conducted a drive in the area around 2:30am, the OC said. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the muggers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that eventually triggered a gunfight. Police rescued bullet-injured Ayub from the spot and took him to Chattogram Medical College Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

Name: Sher Khan Mia
Location: In the custody of Narsingdi police
Description: Family members of an arrested suspect in Palash upazila of Narsingdi claimed that their relative was beaten in police custody and died in hospital undergoing treatment. The deceased was Sher Khan Mia ( 23).   According to Palash police station OC Sheikh Md Nasir Uddin on 22 September 2019 evening, police arrested Sher Khan from Borab market in the upazila. On the way to the police station, Sher Khan tried to jump off the police motorbike he was riding and injured himself. Following the accident, he was given first aid at the Upazila Health Complex and was brought to the police station. Soon after his condition deteriorated, he was taken to Narsingdi Sadar Hospital and later was transferred to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH). On 25 September morning, the duty-doctor of DMCH declared Sher Khan dead. However, Faruk Miya, older brother of Sher Khan, alleged that a six member police team, including Sub-Inspector Iftekhar, Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) Monjur, ASI Rubel, Constable Delwar, and Constable Manik, arrested his brother. Police beat him mercilessly when he tried to escape from the motorbike. When the familymembers visited the police station 22 September night, they found Sher Khan lying on the floor in lock up. The on-duty constable said a sedative injection was given to him as he was feeling unwell. When Sher Khan did not regain consciousness next morning, his family members started crying at the police station and only then did he receive medical attention, added Faruk Mia. Faruk Mia further said that Sher Khan was a fish trader and there is no case against him.  Faruk Miya claimed that his brother died because he was beaten by the police.

Name: Faruk Mia
Description: An accused, Faruk Mia, was allegedly tortured to death while in police custody in Habiganj Sadar. Mashuk Ali, the Officer-in-Charge at the Habiganj police station, denied the allegation, saying, "No one tortured Faruk Mia at the station. He had a heart attack shortly after he was brought to the station. "We, immediately, took him to the hospital, where the doctors declared him dead." Dr Mithun Roy, a doctor of the emergency unit at the Habiganj Sadar Hospital said that Faruk Mia had been unwell when he was brought here. He died early in the morning on 30 September 2019.The deceased's son, Masuk Mia, claimed that police tortured his father at the police station. They did not even let him to see his father.
