His father was tortured to death by the police. Masuk further said that his father borrowed Tk15 thousand a few months ago from Hannan Mia of their area. His father was returning the money in instalments through checks; recently Hannan filed a check dishonour case of Tk45 thousand with the court. The court, subsequently, issued an arrest warrant against Faruk Mia.  Faruk paid Tk5000 each to Hannan and the police to avoid the arrest. Nevertheless, the police came and arrested him later that night. Faruk's brother, Matin Mia, said that a while after Faruk was taken to the station, police called and informed us that he was sick and taken to hospital.
Sources: Jugantar and Nayadiganta 1/10/19 and The Business Standard, https://tbsnews.net/bangladesh/detainee-allegedly-tortured-death-police-custody-habiganj

Name: Mohammad Amin
Description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with police at Teknaf. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they conducted a drive along with the duo at Baharchora Shilkhali Hill area to recover yaba pills and firearms. As soon as they reached the area, a group of criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, Amin and Helaluddin sustained bullet injuries, the OC claimed. Police then rushed the duo to a hospital in Coxs Bazar where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Helaluddin Sumon
Description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with police at Teknaf. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they conducted a drive along with the duo at Baharchora Shilkhali Hill area to recover yaba pills and firearms. As soon as they reached the area, a group of criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, Amin and Helaluddin sustained bullet injuries, the OC claimed. Police then rushed the duo to a hospital in Coxs Bazar where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Saddam Hossain
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a gunfight with police at Mamarishpur. Mazharul Islam, Officer-in-Charge (Investigation) of Bhaluka Police Station, said they received a tip-off that some robbers were gathered at Mamarishpur to plan a robbery. A police team, led by sub-inspector Golam Mustafa, raided the area to arrest the gang members. Sensing police presence, the criminals began firing at the law enforcers, who retaliated, triggering a gunfight around 1:15am. The robbers fled the area at one point and police found bullet-hit Saddam there. They rushed him to Mymensingh Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Abdur Rahman
Description: Two suspected drug peddlers, including a Rohingya man, were killed in a gunfight with police in Coxs Bazar. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said the duo was arrested in Teknaf around 8:00pm on 11 October. On their information, a police team, along with the two criminals, conducted a drive in Hatiargona Malir Hill area of Teknaf around 1:00am to recover drugs and firearms. As soon as they reached the area, a group of criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Abdur and Ahmed sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight. Later, they were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. On duty doctors at the health complex referred the duo to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital as their condition was critical. When taken to the hospital, doctors declared them dead.

Name: Ahmed Hossain
Description: Two suspected drug peddlers, including a Rohingya man, were killed in a gunfight with police in Coxs Bazar. Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station, said the duo was arrested in Teknaf around 8:00pm on 11 October. On their information, a police team, along with the two criminals, conducted a drive in Hatiargona Malir Hill area of Teknaf around 1:00am to recover drugs and firearms. As soon as they reached the area, a group of criminals opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Abdur and Ahmed sustained bullet injuries during the gunfight. Later, they were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. On duty doctors at the health complex referred the duo to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital as their condition was critical. When taken to the hospital, doctors declared them dead.

Name: Zaynul Islam
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight between a group of robbers and RAB personnel at Srimangal. Contacted with RAB Srimangal camp commander AK Kamruzaman said that they detained some people in Sylhet on suspicion of their involvement in robbery two days ago. On information from the arrested, a drive was conducted at Cha-Kanya area at Satgaon under the Shrimangal at about 4:00am to catch some other suspects. As the RAB members showed up, robbers opened fire on them and they retaliated with firing back. Zaynul died on the spot after being shot during the gunfight while his associates fled the scene.

Name: Khorshed Alam
Identity: A Jubo League leader and an alleged robber
Description: Khorshed Alam was killed in a gunfight with RAB members at about 9:00 pm when RAB raided on the area to detain some suspected miscreants and to seize illegal firearms, said Md Mashkur Rahman, Operation Officer of RAB-7 in Chattogram. RAB-7 Assistant Superintendent of police Kazi Md Tarek Aziz said that they conducted the raid on information that a group of hooligans and extortionists gathered near World Trade Centre of Agrabad.

Name: Kudrat Ali
Description: Kudrat Ali, an alleged robber was killed during a gunfight with DB police in Shayestaganj upazila around 3:00am. Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Shayestaganj Police Station Mozammel Haque  said that after receiving information that some 10 to 12 criminals were preparing for committing a robbery in Purashudha area on the Dhaka-Sylhet highway, a team of DB police raided the area. At one stage, the robbers opened fire on law enforcers, prompting them to retaliate, which triggered a gunfight. Kudrat Ali was caught in the gunfight while his associates managed to flee.

Name: Aung Chaimung Tongchoyonga
Location: Fatrajhiri Polling Centre of 8 no. Ward, Ghumdhum union, Naikhonchchhari, Bandarban
Description: Followers of two member candidates Ajmot Ali and Babul Kanti Chakma locked a clash over fake vote casting at Fatrajhiri Polling Centre of 8 no. Ward of Ghumdhum union. During the time, BGB personnel fired bullets to bring the situation under control. Aung Chaimung died on the spot and Shwechcha Aung died later at Cox's Bazar Hospital.

Name: Shwechcha Aung Tongchoyonga
Location: Fatrajhiri Polling Centre of 8 no. Ward, Ghumdhum union, Naikhonchchhari, Bandarban
Description: Followers of two member candidates Ajmot Ali and Babul Kanti Chakma locked a clash over fake vote casting at Fatrajhiri Polling Centre of 8 no. Ward of Ghumdhum union. During the time, BGB personnel fired bullets to bring the situation under control. Aung Chaimung died on the spot and Shwechcha Aung died later at Cox's Bazar Hospital.

Name: Aminur Rahman
Description: Three suspected forest robbers were killed in a reported gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion in the Sunderbans. Tipped-off that some forest robbers took position in the Sunderbans, a team of RAB raided the deep forest in between 3:00am and 5:00am, said Lieutenant Colonel Syed Mohammad Nurus Salehin Yusuf, Commander of RAB 6. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, they opened fire on the team, forcing them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight, Salehin said. Later, the RAB members recovered three bullet-hit bodies and took them to Koyra Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared them dead, he added.

Name: Rafiqul Islam
Description: Three suspected forest robbers were killed in a reported gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion in the Sunderbans. Tipped-off that some forest robbers took position in the Sunderbans, a team of RAB raided the deep forest in between 3:00am and 5:00am, said Lieutenant Colonel Syed Mohammad Nurus Salehin Yusuf, Commander of RAB 6. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, they opened fire on the team, forcing them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight, Salehin said. Later, the RAB members recovered three bullet-hit bodies and took them to Koyra Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared them dead, he added.

Name: Akhtarul Islam
Description: Three suspected forest robbers were killed in a reported gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion in the Sunderbans. Tipped-off that some forest robbers took position in the Sunderbans, a team of RAB raided the deep forest in between 3:00am and 5:00am, said Lieutenant Colonel Syed Mohammad Nurus Salehin Yusuf, Commander of RAB 6. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, they opened fire on the team, forcing them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight, Salehin said. Later, the RAB members recovered three bullet-hit bodies and took them to Koyra Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared them dead, he added.

Name: Iqbal Hossain
Location: Saraitkandi village of Sonagazi upazila in Feni
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a gunfight with police. Moin Uddin, Officer-in-Charge of Sonagazi police station, said that Iqbal was a leader of an inter-district robber gang . Acting on a tip-off, a team of Feni DB police and Sonagazi police jointly raided the area around 3:00am, said Ranjit Barua, Officer-in-Charge of DB police. Robbers opened fire on the law enforcers as soon as the team reached the spot, forcing them to fire back that triggered the gunfight. Iqbal was injured during the skirmish. His accomplices fled the scene leaving him, the OC said. He was taken to a local hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

Name: Zia alias Babul
Location: Hoaikong Satgharia Para of Teknaf upazila in Cox's Bazar
Description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a reported gunfight with police at Hoaikong Satgharia Para. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf model police station, said that police arrested Babul at Hnila Bazar on 16 October afternoon. After interrogation, a team of police took him along with them while conducting a drive to recover firearms around 4:00am. As soon as police reached the spot, Babuls associates opened fire and tried to snatch him from the law enforcers, the OC said. Babul and Azim sustained gunshot wounds during the skirmish. They were taken to a local hospital where doctors pronounced them dead.

Name: Azim Ullah
Location: Hoaikong Satgharia Para of Teknaf upazila in Cox's Bazar
Description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a reported gunfight with police at Hoaikong Satgharia Para. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf model police station, said that police arrested Babul at Hnila Bazar on 16 October afternoon. After interrogation, a team of police took him along with them while conducting a drive to recover firearms around 4:00am. As soon as police reached the spot, Babuls associates opened fire and tried to snatch him from the law enforcers, the OC said. Babul and Azim sustained gunshot wounds during the skirmish. They were taken to a local hospital where doctors pronounced them dead.

Name: Abdul Motaleb
Description: Abdul Motaleb, named in at least seven cases, was killed in a gunfight with Detective  Branch of police at Rasulpur. Mymensingh Detective Branch Officer-in-Charge Shah Kamal Akond said they raided the area to nab suspected robbers when they opened fire on police forcing them to retaliate with gunshots that triggered the gunfight, leaving Motaleb injured. Later, he was taken to local hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Aminul Islam
Description: Aminul Islam, was killed in a gunfight with police at Bhutgari. Tipped off, a team of police raided the area where a kidnappers gang gathered and, sensing presence of police, they opened fire on police, forcing them to fire back. At one stage, Aminul was caught in the line of fire. Later, he was taken to hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Abul Hashem
Location: Lambabil near the river Naf in Teknaf, Cox's Bazar
Description: Hashem and Kamal, were killed in a gunfight with the BGBat Lambabil near the river Naf in Teknaf about 11:30pm. Commanding Officer of  BGB 2 Battalion at Teknaf Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan said acting on a tip off that a group of drug peddlers were entering Bangladesh from Myanmar crossing Naf river by a boat with a big consignment of Yaba tablets, a BGB team raided Lambabil area and asked the drug peddlers to surrender when their boat anchored on the river bank. `Ignoring BGBs call, two peddlers began to run and managed to flee but other peddlers opened fire on BGB personnel who also retaliated with gunshots triggering a gunfight, he said. After the gunfight, the BGB personnel found two bullet-hit people on the spot and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later they were shifted to Coxs Bazar General Hospital as critical condition where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Noor Kamal
Location: Lambabil near the river Naf in Teknaf, Cox's Bazar
Description: Hashem and Kamal, were killed in a gunfight with the BGBat Lambabil near the river Naf in Teknaf about 11:30pm. Commanding Officer of  BGB 2 Battalion at Teknaf Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan said acting on a tip off that a group of drug peddlers were entering Bangladesh from Myanmar crossing Naf river by a boat with a big consignment of Yaba tablets, a BGB team raided Lambabil area and asked the drug peddlers to surrender when their boat anchored on the river bank. `Ignoring BGBs call, two peddlers began to run and managed to flee but other peddlers opened fire on BGB personnel who also retaliated with gunshots triggering a gunfight, he said. After the gunfight, the BGB personnel found two bullet-hit people on the spot and took them to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later they were shifted to Coxs Bazar General Hospital as critical condition where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Aziz
Location: Moheskhaliapara along Coxs Bazar-Teknaf marine drive, Cox's Bazar
Description: Aziz, was killed in a reported gunfight with police at Moheskhaliapara. Pradeep Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf police station, said police arrested Mohammad Aziz at Teknaf  as he was absconding in many criminal cases. After interrogation, a team of police took him along with them to conduct a drive to recover firearms and drugs around 4:00 am at Moheskhaliapara, the OC said. As soon as police reached the spot, Azizs associates opened fire on them and tried to snatch him from the law enforcers. Police also took bullet-hit Aziz to a Teknaf hospital but the duty doctor the sent him to Coxs Bazar General Hospital as he was in critical condition. Doctor at Coxs Bazar General Hospital declared that he died before reaching the hospital.

Name: Mohammad Rahim Uddin alias Rafique
Identity: A suspected drug peddler; a Rohingya refugee
Location: Nayapara, middle of Kangharpara village, near the river Naff at Hinlahh union of Teknaf in Coxs Bazar
Description: Rafique, a drug trader, was killed in a reported gunfight with the BGB at Nayapara.  Commanding Officer of  BGB Battalion 2 at Teknaf Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, said on a tip off that a group of drug pedlars entered Bangladesh from Myanmar with a locally made wooden boat carrying a big consignment of Yaba pills, a BGB team cordoned off Madinar Jora on cyclone control embankment of Teknaf at about 1:30am and asked the suspects to surrender when they reached on bank of the river. Later they opened fire on the soldiers, who retaliated with firing back. After the gunfight, the BGB men found a man shot and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex. Later he was shifted to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital as his condition was critical. Doctors in the hospital, however, declared him dead.

Name: Mahfuzur Rahman
Identity: General people in the name of Touhidi Jonota banner
Description: Four people were killed and more than a hundred others injured as religious zealots clashed with police in Bholas Borhanuddin upazila over a hate conversation spread through Facebook and its messenger. At one stage of the clash that broke out around 10:30am, law enforcers had to fire shots to disperse the mob, who since 18 October had been demanding punishment of a Hindu youth they claimed was responsible for the hate conversation from his Facebook account, said police.

Name: Mahbub Patwari
Identity: General people in the name of Touhidi Jonota banner
Description: Four people were killed and more than a hundred others injured as religious zealots clashed with police in Bholas Borhanuddin upazila over a hate conversation spread through Facebook and its messenger. At one stage of the clash that broke out around 10:30am, law enforcers had to fire shots to disperse the mob, who since 18 October had been demanding punishment of a Hindu youth they claimed was responsible for the hate conversation from his Facebook account, said police.

Identity: General people in the name of Touhidi Jonota banner
Description: Four people were killed and more than a hundred others injured as religious zealots clashed with police in Bholas Borhanuddin upazila over a hate conversation spread through Facebook and its messenger. Name: Mizanur Rahman
Identity: General people in the name of Touhidi Jonota banner
Description: Four people were killed and more than a hundred others injured as religious zealots clashed with police in Bholas Borhanuddin upazila over a hate conversation spread through Facebook and its messenger. At one stage of the clash that broke out around 10:30am, law enforcers had to fire shots to disperse the mob, who since 18 October had been demanding punishment of a Hindu youth they claimed was responsible for the hate conversation from his Facebook account, said police.

Name: Najir Ahmed Sumon alias Kalu
Description: Sumon, a the leader of a notorious robber gang and the prime suspect in Chattogram child specialist Dr Shah Alam murder case, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB. Mahmudul Hasan Mamun, Assistant Director, (media) of RAB 7, said they arrested human hauler driver Omar Faruk, 19, in connection with Shah Alams murder on 22 October. He confessed to his role in the killing before the court and revealed names of several men, including that of Kalu, involved in it. A RAB 7 team raided Bashbaria around 4:30am to arrest Kalu. But criminals opened fire as soon as they reached the area. Kalu was killed on the spot in the ensuing skirmish, RAB sources said.

Name: Mehedi Hasan
Location: Lodipur Khari Bridge area of Patnitala upazila in Naogaon
Description: Mehedi was killed in a gunfight with police at Lodipur Khari Bridge area. Naogon Superintendent of Police Abdul Mannan said a team of law enforcement agencies conducted a drive in the area after being tipped off. Sensing the presence of the police, the drug dealers opened fire on law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate by firing. After the gunfight, Mehedi was found shot and killed, but others managed to flee, he added.

Name: Prakash Selim
Location: Chamarkul area of Whykang union in Teknaf Coxs Bazar
Description: Prakash Selim was killed in crossfire with police. The gunfight began when police detained and took him to recover drug and illegal arms after arresting him in the early hours of 22 October in Chamarkul area. Pradip Kumar Das, Office-in-Charge of Teknaf police station, claimed that they were acting on  a tip-off when they arrested Prakash on 21 October. Later, he was taken to Keruntoli Primary School area to recover arms and drugs as per his confession. But his cohorts, who were waiting in the area, opened fire on the police and the law enforcers retaliated. Selim was hit and taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Abu Sayed
Description: Abu Sayed, was killed in a gunfight between law enforcers and his cohorts in Araihazar. Araihazar police arrested Abu Sayed on 26 October evening. Officer-in-Charge Nazrul Islam of Araihazar Police Station said that as per the information given by him, police took him on a drive in Ilumadi area around 3:00 am to arrest his accomplices. As soon as they reached the spot, cohorts of Sayed started firing on the team, forcing the police to retaliate. After the gunfight, Sayed was found shot and lying on the ground. He was taken to Araihazar Health Complex where doctors declared him dead on arrival.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Three men were killed in what RAB said was a gunfight with their members. Being tipped off that a group of robbers gathered in Chhoto Kumira area to conduct a robbery, a team of RAB-7 raided the spot around 2:00am, said Mahmudul Hasan Mamun, Assistant Director of RAB-7 Media Wing. Sensing presence of the Rab personnel, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate which eventually triggered a gunfight. Later, RAB members found three bullet-hit bodies on the spot and handed them over to police.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Three men were killed in what RAB said was a gunfight with their members. Being tipped off that a group of robbers gathered in Chhoto Kumira area to conduct a robbery, a team of RAB-7 raided the spot around 2:00am, said Mahmudul Hasan Mamun, Assistant Director of RAB-7 Media Wing. Sensing presence of the Rab personnel, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate which eventually triggered a gunfight. Later, RAB members found three bullet-hit bodies on the spot and handed them over to police.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Three men were killed in what RAB said was a gunfight with their members. Being tipped off that a group of robbers gathered in Chhoto Kumira area to conduct a robbery, a team of RAB-7 raided the spot around 2:00am, said Mahmudul Hasan Mamun, Assistant Director of RAB-7 Media Wing. Sensing presence of the Rab personnel, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate which eventually triggered a gunfight. Later, RAB members found three bullet-hit bodies on the spot and handed them over to police.

Name: Unidentified
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a reported gunfight with police at Shahapur in Faridganj. Tipped-off that a gang of robbers was preparing to commit robbery, a team of police went to Cherag Alir Bagan area around 2:00am, said Abdur Rakib, Officer-in-Charge of Faridganj Police Station. Sensing their presence, the robbers opened fire towards police prompting them to fire back in self-defense, Rakib claimed. After the gunfight, police took a bullet-hit person and and took him to Faridganj Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Samsul Alam
Location: Bhendamari police investigation centre, Pirganj, Rangpur
Description: Shamsuls daughter Satana said her father was a cattle trader and never peddled liquor. She also said after detaining her father, the police personnel demanded Tk one lakh and he refused to pay it. They tortured him whole the night to death at the investigation centre, she alleged. Local people said police detained Samsul Alam, 55, of Shantipur in Mithapukur from Baradaroga Bazar in Pirganj. His body was found hanging from the grill of a window at Bhendamari police investigation centre. Pirganj police  station Officer-in- Charge Saresh Chandra said police detained a drug peddler Samsul Alam with 25 litres of locally made liquor on 15 October night and he committed suicide on 16 October morning at the police investigation centre.
Actions Taken: Five cops were withdrawn from to a police investigation centre including inspector Aminul Islam

Name: Lavlu
Description: Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner of DB (north), said that police arrested some people posing as RAB and DB members at different parts of the city. During interrogation, they told police that some robbers would gather in the area. Later, a team of DB raided the area around 1:00am and stopped a microbus. Four people on the vehicle opened fire while trying to escape. During the skirmish, three were injured but another managed to flee the scene. They were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where Lavlu, 50, died from injuries around 4:00am.  Bullet wounded Kamal Hossain succumbed to his injuries at National Institute of Traumatology & Orthopaedic Rehabilitaion (NITOR), Shyamoli, Dhaka on 12 November 2019.

Name: Kamal Hossain
Description: Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner of DB (north), said that police arrested some people posing as RAB and DB members at different parts of the city. During interrogation, they told police that some robbers would gather in the area. Later, a team of DB raided the area around 1:00am and stopped a microbus. Four people on the vehicle opened fire while trying to escape. During the skirmish, three were injured but another managed to flee the scene. They were taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where Lavlu, 50, died from injuries around 4:00am.  Bullet wounded Kamal Hossain succumbed to his injuries at National Institute of Traumatology & Orthopaedic Rehabilitaion (NITOR), Shyamoli, Dhaka on 12 November 2019.

Name: Saddam Hossain
Location: Jatrapur Chaporbari in Ashuganj upazila in Brahmanbaria
Description: Jabed Mahmud, Officer-in-Charge of Ashuganj police station, said that they raided the area around 1:15am acting on a tip-off that a gang of robbers was there. The miscreants opened fire on the police team as soon as they reached the spot, triggering a skirmish. At one stage, Saddam was caught in the line of fire while trying to flee the scene and died on the spot.

Name: Mahmudul Hasan
Identity: A suspected robber; A Rohingya man
Description: A Rohingya man, accused in several criminal cases, was killed in a gunfight with police. Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said they arrested Mahmudul on 13 Novembernoon over possessing firearms. After interrogation, a team of police, led by Additional Superintendent Redwan Ahmed, conducted a drive near the Rohingya camp around 1:00am to recover firearms. As police reached the area, Mahmuduls associates opened fire at them, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, Mahmudul was shot while others managed to flee. He died of his injuries while being taken to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital.

Name: Noor Kabir
Identity: An alleged drug peddler; A Rohingya man name
Description: In Hnila union of Coxs Bazar, Noor Kabir, of Leda Rohingya camp in Teknaf, was killed  in a gunfight between drug dealers and a patrolling team of BGB. While patrolling in Chhurikhal area, a BGB team approached four people who were digging out a plastic bag from the ground, said Lt Col Faisal Hasan Khan, Commander of BGB Battalion-2. The men started shooting at the team, forcing the BGB personnel to retaliate, said Faisal, adding that the men fled the scene after about 10 minutes. Later, the team found bullet riddled body of Noor on the ground. He was taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him  dead.

Name: Razzaq Mia
Description: In Narsingdis Shibpur upazila, Razzaq Mia, was killed during a gunfight with police. Police arrested Razzaq, an accused in 16 criminal cases, at his home on 14 November midnight and took him on a drive to Telia Shashan Ghat area, said Inspector (Investigation) Mominul Haque of Shibpur Police Station. As soon as they reached the spot, the associates of Razzaq started shooting at them, said Mominul, adding that, the law enforcers were forced to fire back to defend themselves. After the gunfight, police found that Razzaq was lying dead on the ground.

Name: Yasin
Description: Two alleged Rohingya criminals were killed in a gunfight with BGB. Yasin, 30, and Hossain, 22, of Kutupalong Rohingya Camp-1 were accused of attacking a BGB patrol team on November 11, said BGB officials. Following information that Rohingya men and other members of the drug gang were in Tumbru Notun Bridge area, a BGB team went there around 3:00am, said Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, Commander of 34 Battalion. Sensing their presence, the gang started shooting at the team forcing them to retaliate, he said, adding that the bullet-hit body of Yasin and Hossain were found on the ground after the gunfight. They were taken to Ukhiya Health Complex where doctors declared them dead  on arrival.

Name: Hossain
Description: Two alleged Rohingya criminals were killed in a gunfight with BGB. Yasin, 30, and Hossain, 22, of Kutupalong Rohingya Camp-1 were accused of attacking a BGB patrol team on November 11, said BGB officials. Following information that Rohingya men and other members of the drug gang were in Tumbru Notun Bridge area, a BGB team went there around 3:00am, said Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, Commander of 34 Battalion. Sensing their presence, the gang started shooting at the team forcing them to retaliate, he said, adding that the bullet-hit body of Yasin and Hossain were found on the ground after the gunfight. They were taken to Ukhiya Health Complex where doctors declared them dead  on arrival.

Name: Badsha Sheikh
Identity: A regional leader of outlawed Jonojuddho, a faction of Purba Banglar Communist Party (PBCP)
Description: In Jhenidah, the dead Badsha Sheikh, was an accused in seven murder and two arms cases, said police. On information that some activists of the faction gathered at a Mahogany orchard in Jorapukuria village, police raided the area around 2:00am, said Ashaduzzaman, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of Harinakunda Police Station. As soon as the law enforcers reached there, the PBCP men started firing. on them forcing them to retaliate, he said, adding that they found Badsha dead on the ground after the gunfight.

Name: Abdul Aziz
Description: In Chattogram citys Khulshi area, Abdul Aziz, an alleged robber,was killed by police during a gunfight. Police said Aziz came out of prison about three months ago after serving a 12-year sentence in a case filed under the Public Safety Act. OC Pranab Chowdhury of Khulshi Police Station said Azizs name came up in the primary investigation of a robbery incident at Garibullah Shah Housing Society in the city on November 15. A team of law enforcers conducted a drive at his home at Nasirabad area in the city to arrest him, said the OC, adding that sensing their presence, Aziz and his cohorts opened fire on the team forcing them to retaliate. At one point, the criminals fled the scene and police spotted injured Aziz on the ground.. He was taken to Chattogram Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead on arrival.

Name: Nadim
Description: Tipped-off, a team of RAB-2 conducted a drive in the area to find drugs around 4:00am, said Dhaka Medical College Hospital police outpost in-charge Bachchu Mia. A group of people opened fire as soon as the elite force reached the area, triggering a skirmish. Nadim was caught in the line of fire and suffered gunshot wounds. Later, he was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

Name: Mizanur Rahman Mintu alias Megha Mintu
Description: The man who was killed in Dhaka is Mizanur Rahman Mintu.  Md Kamruzzaman, an Assistant Director of RAB-1 said that  on information that some drug dealers gathered in Swadesh Property area of the capitals Khilkhet, a RAB patrol team rushed to the area around 1:15am. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire. The law enforcers then retaliated. After the gun battle, RAB found Mintu bullet-hit. He was rushed to Kurmitola General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Laxmindar Ali
Location: Bokarbhanga area of Chhatak upazila, Sunamganj
Description: Laxmindar Ali, was killed in a shootout with police in Bokarbhanga area. Mostafa Kamal, Officer-in-Charge of Chhatak Police Station, said police arrested Laxmindar on 22 November. Police took him to Bokarbhanga area one next dayto recover firearms, but he tried to flee. A gunfight ensued when his associates opened fire, the OC said. Later, police found the body of Laxmindar.

Name: Ibrahim Khalil Rubel
Description: Rubel, was killed in a gunfight with members of Detective Branch of Police. He was named in at least 16 criminal cases. Noakhali Detective Branch Officer-in-Charge Kamruzzaman Shikdar said that they arrested Ibrahim in a raid at Purba Mahduri on 27 November evening with 60 yaba tablets and later, as per information extracted from him, they took him with them during a raid at Paschim Mahduri for recovering firearms. He claimed that Ibrahims associates opened fire on the raiding police personnel as soon as they reached the spot at about 4:00am and police also retaliated by firing that triggered a gunfight. During the gunfight, the OC claimed, Ibrahim was caught in the line of fire but his associates fled the scene. He said they took Ibrahim to Noakhali General Hospital where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mamunur Islam alias Dwip
Location: Kamalnagar area near the Bypass road in Satkhira
Description: Mohammad Mostafizur Rahman, Superintendent of Police, said they arrested Dwip and Saiful on 29 November over snatching of Tk 26 lakh from a Bkash company agent in Kaliganj upazila. Police took them to recover the money. When they reached Kamalnagar area around 3:00am, associates of the miscreants open fired on police to snatch them, leading to a gunfight, the SP added. They were caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

Name: Saiful Islam
Location: Kamalnagar area near the Bypass road in Satkhira
Description: Mohammad Mostafizur Rahman, Superintendent of Police, said they arrested Dwip and Saiful on 29 November over snatching of Tk 26 lakh from a Bkash company agent in Kaliganj upazila. Police took them to recover the money. When they reached Kamalnagar area around 3:00am, associates of the miscreants open fired on police to snatch them, leading to a gunfight, the SP added. They were caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

Name: Delwar Hossain Delu
Description: Delwar Hossain Delu was killed in a gunfight with police. Acting on a secret information that a gang of robbers were meeting in Karaitola area in a bid to commit robbery, police raided Tulatoli village, said SI Gias. Sensing their presence, the robbers started firing at the law enforcers, forcing them to retaliate with gunshots triggering a gunfight, the police official added. At one stage, Delwar was shot while his cohorts managed to flee the scene. Delwar was rushed to Cumilla Medial College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Ali
Description: Mohammad Ali was killed in a gunfight with police. Mohammad Basiruddin, Additional Superintendent of Jamalpur police, said one of their teams conducted raid in Prajapati Char and arrested Ali from a boat on 2 December. Police, along with Ali, conducted a raid at Kutilarchar to recover arms around 3:00am on 3 December. Sensing police presence, Alis cohorts opened fire, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Ali was caught in the line of fire and suffered bullet wounds while others managed to flee, he added. Later Ali was taken to Islampur Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Imam Hossain
Description: Imam Hossain, a suspected yaba peddler was killed in a gunfight with BGB. The gunfight took place in Keora Bagan area near Zadimura border with Myanmar.

Name: Abdur Rashid
Description: Abdur Rashid, was killed in a gunfight between Detectives  branch of police and suspected drug peddlers during an anti-drug drive, Mymensingh polices Detective Branch Officer-in-Charge Shah Kamal Hossain said.

Name: Noor Alam alias Noor Hafiz
Location: Rongikhali under Hinllah union of Teknaf upazila, Cox's Bazar
Description: Two suspected Rohingya drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with the Teknaf police in the hilly areas of Rongikhali. Teknaf police Officer-in-Charge Prodeep Kumar Das said that they recovered huge quantity of illegal fire arms and yaba raiding the spot. The OC said that the Rapid Action Battalion held four people, including the Nur and Sohel, on 13 December. Later, the RAB handed the arrested people over to the Teknaf police. The Teknaf police OC said that a team of the department went to Ronghikhali hilly area along with Noor Alam and Mohammad Sohel to recover arms and drugs. When they reached the spot, associates of Nur and Sohel opened fire at the police triggering the gunfight ,adding that, when the gunfight was over, police recovered the bullet-hit bodies of the duo.

Name: Mohammad Sohel
Location: Rongikhali under Hinllah union of Teknaf upazila, Cox's Bazar
Description: Two suspected Rohingya drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with the Teknaf police in the hilly areas of Rongikhali. Teknaf police Officer-in-Charge Prodeep Kumar Das said that they recovered huge quantity of illegal fire arms and yaba raiding the spot. The OC said that the Rapid Action Battalion held four people, including the Nur and Sohel, on 13 December. Later, the RAB handed the arrested people over to the Teknaf police. The Teknaf police OC said that a team of the department went to Ronghikhali hilly area along with Noor Alam and Mohammad Sohel to recover arms and drugs. When they reached the spot, associates of Nur and Sohel opened fire at the police triggering the gunfight ,adding that, when the gunfight was over, police recovered the bullet-hit bodies of the duo.

Name: Shahrul Islam alias Khokon Hossain
Description: Maheshpur police station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Rashedul Alam said the robbers, who were preparing for robbery on the Kaliganj-Jibannagar route, opened fire on a patrolling police team. The police fired several rounds in retaliation, triggering the gunfight. Police found the injured Khokon  while  other robbers managed to flee the scene at one point of the gunfight. Police took Khokon to Maheshpur Upazila Health Complex where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Nurunnabi
Location: Catapahar area in the Coxs Bazar
Description: Nurunnabi, was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Catapahar area. . Mohammad Iqbal Hossen, one of the Additional Superintendents at the Coxs Bazar police, said Sub-Inspector Mohammad Taimur Islam and Sub-Inspector Abul Kalam caught Nurunnabi with illegal fire arms at Kalordokan area of the Coxs Bazar town. Later, they took him to Katapahar area, but the team came under the attack of an armed gang that opened fire on cops, who retaliated with firing back. The attackers managed to ran away, but Nurunnabi was shot. They took him to Coxs Bazar general hospital but doctors declared him dead.

Name: Yasin Mia
Description: Yasin Mia, an accused of rape and murder of a 14-year-old girl, was killed in a shootout with police. Police arrested Yasin Mia, in Wireless-para area of the town on 15 December, on charges of raping and murdering Fatema Begum, mentally challenged daughter of Elahi Sharif of Rajendrapur College area, on December 12. Zamal Pasha, Additional Superintendent of police in Faridpur, said they recovered the girls body with stab wounds in several parts of her body, from the boundaries of BTCL office around 6:00pm on December 13, a day after she had gone missing. Following a case filed by the victims father with Kotwali Police Station, police identified Yasin upon analyzing the CCTV camera footage in the area. As soon as they had reached Double Bridge Rahakhola Launch Ghat area around 2:30am, Yasin snatched a gun from a policeman and tried to flee forcing the law enforcers to open fire, he claimed. Yasin suffered bullet injuries in the shootout. He was taken to Faridpur Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead on arrival. Meanwhile, his sister Rahima Begum said that he came out of jail on December 4 on a bail and went to Dhaka the same day. Upon his return on 15 December, police arrested him.

Name: Joynal
Description: Joynal, was killed in a gunfight with members of RAB. Tipped off, a team of RAB 15 raided the area and challenged some robbers, said Deputy Commander of RAB 15 Major Rabiul Islam. At one stage, they opened fire on the RAB team, forcing them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight. After a brief gunfight, they recovered the bullet-hit body of Joynal. One gun and three bullets were recovered from the spot.

Name: Abdul Karim
Identity: A suspected robber; son of Abdus Salam of Block-D, Ledha Rohingya Camp, 38
Description: Abdul Karim, was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB on the bank of the river Naff near Teknaf land port. RAB-15 crimes prevention Company-1 Commander Mirza Sahed Mahatab said that a team of RAB raided on hilly area near Teknaf land port after getting information that some robbers gathered there for committing robbery. Sensing presence of RAB personnel, he claimed, the robbers open fire on RAB members who retaliated by firing that triggered a gunfight at about 2:30am. Later, RAB members caught one wounded in gunshots from the spot and took him to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Siddiq
Description: Siddiq and Shahjahan, suspected of being drug peddlers, were killed in a gunfight with members of BGB in Ukhia. Lt Col Ali Haider Azad, Commanding Officer of 34th BGB Battalion, said one of their patrol teams encountered a group of drug peddlers. Sensing their presence, the group of criminals opened fire, forcing the BGB men to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, the duo was found lying on the ground with bullet wounds. They were then sent to Ukhia Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead, the BGB official claimed.

Name: Shahjahan
Description: Siddiq and Shahjahan, suspected of being drug peddlers, were killed in a gunfight with members of BGB in Ukhia. Lt Col Ali Haider Azad, Commanding Officer of 34th BGB Battalion, said one of their patrol teams encountered a group of drug peddlers. Sensing their presence, the group of criminals opened fire, forcing the BGB men to retaliate. At one point of the gunfight, the duo was found lying on the ground with bullet wounds. They were then sent to Ukhia Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead, the BGB official claimed.

Name: Monir Hossain
Location: Goni Miar Doroja area of Chatkhil upazila in Noakhali
Description: Monir Hossain, was killed in a gunfight with the police in Goni Miar Doroja area. Anwarul Islam, Officer-in-Charge of Chatkhil Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off, they arrested Monir. A police team later raided the area along with Monir to recover firearms and Yaba. When the team reached the area, his cohorts opened fire and tried to snatch him. In the ensuing skirmish, Monir sustained gunshot injuries. He was taken to Noakhali General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mokhlesur Rahman
Description: Mokhlesur, was killed in a reported gunfight with police at Nateswar of Sonaimuri. Sonaimuri Police Station Officer-in-Charge Abdus Samad said when a patrol team of police challenged a gang of robbers around 12:45am they opened fire on the police officials, forcing them to fire back in self-defence that triggered the gunfight. After the robbers fled the scene, the law enforcers took bullet-wounded Mokhlesur from the spot. He was pronounced dead after being taken to Noakhali General Hospital.

Name: Rony Miah
Description: Assistant Superintendent of Police Kamruzzaman, Company Commander of RAB-1, said the drug trader was killed in the gunfight between members of RAB-1 and a gang of drug traders.

Name: Shahadat Hossain Swapan
Description: Swapan, was killed in a reported gunfight with police. Companyganj Police Station Officer-in-Charge Arifur Rahman said that  a team of police led by inspector (investigation) Mostafizur Rahman arrested Shahadat from Chowmuhani in Begumganj on 29 December evening. During interrogation, he revealed that his gang members would wait at the village to commit robbery at night. When a police team reached the spot around 3:00am to arrest other members of the gang, the alleged robbers opened fire on police, triggering a gunfight. Shahadat sustained gunshot wounds during the gunfight. Later, he was taken to Companiganj Health Complex where doctors pronounced him dead.

Name: Rubel
Description: Mirza Shahed Mahtab, Company Commander of RAB-15 in Teknaf talked to journalists after the gunfights. According to the officials, members of the elite force conducted raids in the two districts on information. In both the cases, criminals opened fire on RAB members first, forcing them to retaliate. During the gunfights, both the criminals sustained bullet injuries and died. In Coxs bazar,RAB members rushed Rubel to Coxs Bazar General Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Amin Sheikh
Description: Aminul Kabir Tarafder, Commanding Officer of RAB-12 in Pabna, talked to journalists after the gunfight. According to the officials, members of the elite force conducted raids in the two districts on information. Criminals opened fire on RAB members first, forcing them to retaliate. During the gunfights, both the criminals sustained bullet injuries and died. In Coxs bazar,RAB members rushed Rubel to Coxs Bazar General Hospital where doctors declared him dead. In Pabna, Amin died on the spot of the gunfight.

Name: Alamgir Hossain
Description: Alamgir died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital on 19 December. Alamgir, a father of two children, who lived in Phulbaria area under Uttara- 10 sector with his family members.Relatives of Alamgir said that Alamgir was returning home after finished his duty on 13 December night. When he reached near at his home Uttara West Police picked him up. Hearing this news Alamgir's wife Alo Begum rushed to the police station. But police didn't allow to meet with her husband. On next day police took him to the court but Alamgir was sick. Abdur Razzak, brother of Alamgir alleged that police tortured his brother after took him to police station. His brother died due to police torture. Tapan Chandra Saha, Officer-in-Charge of the police station said that they they  didn't torture Alamgair in thier custody.

Name: Ratan
Description: Ratan, an alleged drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with police at Amishapara union in Noakhali. Police arrested him from his residence on 21 December 2019. Later, police drive an operation with Ratan to rescue arms. Sensing their presence Ratan's cohorts fired to them. Retaliated police fired. At one stage Ratan bullet wounded. Police took him to Noakhali General Hospital, where duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Anwar Sadek
Identity: Alleged robber; a Rohingya from Nayapara Mochoni Rohingya camp
Description: Anwar Sadek, was killed in a gunfight with members of Rapid Action Battalion at a Rohingya camp in Teknaf upazila. Shaha Alam, Company Commander of RAB-15 (Whykong camp), claimed that they raided Nayapara Mochoni Rohingya camp to recover drugs. A gang of robbers opened fire on RAB members while they were conducting the anti-narcotics drive, forcing them to retaliate, he added. Sadek sustained bullet injuries and died on the spot.

Name: Zakir Hossain Gazi
Description: Zakir Hossain Gazi, was killed in a gunfight with police. He was an accused in 13 cases with different police stations, said Mirza Salahuddin Ahmed, additional superintendent of Satkhira (Sadar circle) police. He was found dead after a gunfight between police and robbers at Damarpota area, he said, adding that they seized a firearm and two bullets from the spot.

Name: Emdad
Description: Emdad, was an accused in hawkers leader Ripon murder case, said police. Officer-in-Charge Pritom Sarker of Bayejid Bostami Police Station said the law enforcers conducted a drive at Majhir Ghona area around 2:30am to arrest Emdad. As soon as had the police reached there, Emdads cohorts opened fire on the team forcing them to retaliate, said the OC, adding that the miscreants fled at one point.  After the gunfight, police found the bullet-hit body of Emdad on the ground. He was declared dead on arrival by doctors at Chattogram Medical College Hospital.

Name: Samuda Begum
Description: Samuda Begum, an alleged drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with police. On information that some drug peddlers had gathered in Laboner Math area in Whykong union, a Teknaf police team conducted a drive there around 4:00am. Sensing their presence, the criminals at the spot opened fire on the team forcing them to retaliate, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge of Teknaf Police Station. After the gunfight, police found the bullet-hit body of Samuda lying on the ground. She was taken to the upazila health complex and was later moved to Coxs Bazar Medical College Hospital where on duty doctors declared her dead on arrival, said the OC. Police claimed to have recovered 10,000 yaba pills from the spot.

Name: Mohamamd Ismail
Location: Palongkhali area, Ukhiya upazila, Cox's Bazar
Description: Two Rohingya men, suspected of being drug peddlers, were killed in a gunfight with members of BGB. Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, commanding officer of 34th BGB battalion, claimed they conducted a raid in Palongkhali area of the districts Ukhiya upazila around 5:00am on information that a consignment of drugs would be smuggled through the area. Sensing BGB members presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, he added. At one stage of the gunfight, two drug peddlers sustained bullet injuries. They were rushed to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where on-duty doctors declared them dead, he further added. BGB also claimed to have recovered 20,000 pieces of yaba pills, a locally-made firearm and two cartridges from the spot.

Name: Helal Uddin
Location: Palongkhali area, Ukhiya upazila, Cox's Bazar
Description: Two Rohingya men, suspected of being drug peddlers, were killed in a gunfight with members of BGB. Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, commanding officer of 34th BGB battalion, claimed they conducted a raid in Palongkhali area of the districts Ukhiya upazila around 5:00am on information that a consignment of drugs would be smuggled through the area. Sensing BGB members presence, the criminals opened fire, forcing them to retaliate, he added. At one stage of the gunfight, two drug peddlers sustained bullet injuries. They were rushed to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where on-duty doctors declared them dead, he further added. BGB also claimed to have recovered 20,000 pieces of yaba pills, a locally-made firearm and two cartridges from the spot.

Name: Hafizur Rahman
Description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with Rab at Teknaf. The gunfight took place on Cox's Bazar-Teknaf road in Damdamia area around 3:00am when the law enforcers signaled a lorry -- carrying Hafizur and Sabbir -- to slow down, claimed Shah Alam, company commander of Teknaf Rab-7 camp. Instead of slowing down, the duo opened fire at Rab members, forcing the Rab members to retaliate. The gunfight left the duo dead on the spot, he added. Two firearms, 11 bullets and 40,000 pieces of yaba tablets were recovered and the lorry was seized from the spot, the law enforcer claimed.

Name: Sabbir Hossain
Description: Two suspected drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with Rab at Teknaf. The gunfight took place on Cox's Bazar-Teknaf road in Damdamia area around 3:00am when the law enforcers signaled a lorry -- carrying Hafizur and Sabbir -- to slow down, claimed Shah Alam, company commander of Teknaf Rab-7 camp. Instead of slowing down, the duo opened fire at Rab members, forcing the Rab members to retaliate. The gunfight left the duo dead on the spot, he added. Two firearms, 11 bullets and 40,000 pieces of yaba tablets were recovered and the lorry was seized from the spot, the law enforcer claimed.

Name: Billal Hossain
Description: Billal Hossain, who allegedly abducted and killed a fourth grader, was killed in a gunfight with police in Monirampur.  Police picked up Billal from Keshabpur upazila on 7.1.2020.Sensing the presence of law enforcers, Billal's associates opened fire at police. Cops fired retaliatory shots in self-defense. At one stage, Billal was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot, accoring to police.

Name: Iqbal Ahmed
Description: Iqbal Ahmed, who was shot dead, used to bring yaba pills to the city from Coxs Bazar, claimed RAB-2 Company Commander Mohammed Mohiuddin Faruqe. The incident happened around 7:00am near the ticket sales centre of an intercity bus operator. The area is covered by CCTV cameras of different nearby shops and businesses. Employees of these shops told that RAB officials had deleted the footage and didnt let anyone see what had been recorded.

Name: Abul Kashem Kaisha
Description: Two alleged drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with DB Police in Ramsagar Tajpur area. Both were residents of Sipahipara and accused in cases filed under the Narcotics Control Act, said ATM Golam Rasul, officer-in-charge of Dinajpur DB police. A police team took position near a road in the area around 1:30am to intercept a gang of drug peddlers. When the DB team stopped a gang passing through the area, the criminals opened fire on them,

Name: Laskar Ali alias Rahmat Ali
Description: Two alleged drug peddlers were killed in a gunfight with DB Police in Ramsagar Tajpur area. Both were residents of Sipahipara and accused in cases filed under the Narcotics Control Act, said ATM Golam Rasul, officer-in-charge of Dinajpur DB police. A police team took position near a road in the area around 1:30am to intercept a gang of drug peddlers. When the DB team stopped a gang passing through the area, the criminals opened fire on them,

Name: Abul Hasim
Description: Two Rohingya men, suspected of being drug dealers, were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB on the Coxs Bazar-Teknaf Marine Drive road. Mohammad Shah Alam, assistant superintendent of police (ASP), also the in-charge of CPC-2 Hoaikyang Camp of RAB-15, said a RAB team conducted a drive in Shamlapur area on the marine drive road after a tip-off that a large amount of yaba was being smuggled. As soon as the RAB team reached the spot, the criminals opened fire, which led to a gunfight, he claimed. Hasim and Ayub suffered bullet wounds in the gunfight, he said, adding that the two were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Ayub
Description: Two Rohingya men, suspected of being drug dealers, were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB on the Coxs Bazar-Teknaf Marine Drive road. Mohammad Shah Alam, assistant superintendent of police (ASP), also the in-charge of CPC-2 Hoaikyang Camp of RAB-15, said a RAB team conducted a drive in Shamlapur area on the marine drive road after a tip-off that a large amount of yaba was being smuggled. As soon as the RAB team reached the spot, the criminals opened fire, which led to a gunfight, he claimed. Hasim and Ayub suffered bullet wounds in the gunfight, he said, adding that the two were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Aiyas
Identity: Alleged drug peddler; a resident of Kutupalong Rohingya Camp in Ukhia
Description: A Rohingya man, Aiyas, who was allegedly involved in drug smuggling, was killed in gunfight with the BGB. Being informed that a big consignment of yaba would smuggle into Bangladesh from Myanmar, a BGB team took position in Jadimora- Shikholghera area under TeknafsHnila union, said Lt Colonel Mohammad Foysal Hasan Khan, commanding officer (CO) of BGB Battalion-2. Around 3:00am, the team noticed that a boat carrying a group of people  entering Bangladesh.  Sensing presence of the BGB men, the alleged smugglers started firing on the BGB team members when they came closer to the shore, BGB official said adding that they also retaliated with gunshots in self-defence triggering a gun-battle that lasted for 5/6 minutes. At one stage, the three drug traders jumped into the river and swam away toward the Myanmar border, CO Foysal said. Later, the BGB men found a bullet-hit yaba smuggler on the boat, he said. After providing primary treatment at TeknafUpazila Health Complex, he was sent to Coxs Bazar General Hospital, where doctors declared him dead, the BGB official added.

Name: Anwar Hossain
Description: Anowar Hossain, an alleged drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with the RAB. RAB-1 officials claimed that he was a notorious drug peddler.

Name: Unidentified
Identity: Alleged drug peddler; A Rohingya man from Kutupalong camp
Location: Hnila union of Teknaf, Cox's Bazar
Description: In Coxs Bazar, a suspected drug smuggler was killed in a gunfight with BGB, said Lt Col Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, commanding officer (CO) of BGB 2 Battalion. He could not confirm the identity of the victim. The incident took place near Jadimura mosque in the union on the bank of Naf River when a BGB special patrol team noticed some people carrying sacks on their head,.As the BGB team challenged them, they opened fire on the law enforcers in response, triggering the gun battle, the CO said. BGB later found the victim caught a bullet and took him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex and later to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors pronounced him dead.

Name: Abu Hanif Bepari
Description: In Natore, a murder accused was killed in a gunfight with police in Gurudaspur. Deceased Abu Hanif Bepari was accused of murder and several other cases, including robbery, said Akramul Hossain, additional superintendent of police in Natore. Police detained Hanif from Dhakas Badda area on 22.1.2020 SP Akramul said. The gunfight took place when a team of police, along with Hanif, went to Pargurudaspur area and raided a banana orchard to detain his associates.

Name: Nasir Uddin Munna
Description: In Coxs Bazar, a suspected drug pedlar was killed in a reported gunfight with the police at Hoykong union near the river Naf in Teknaf. Police detained him on 25.1.2020

Name: Jumar Uddin
Description: Jumar Uddin, was shot to death by police firing. In the incident day, stone workers and traders blocked the highway demanding illegal lifting of the underground stone. Police went there to normalize the situation. At one stage police and blockaders locked in a clash. During the time, blockaders vandalised four police cars. Police fired tear shell gas and rubber bullets to bring the situation under control. Bullet wounded Jumar Uddin died on the way to the hospital.

Name: Anwar Hossain Yusuf
Description: Anwar HossainYusuf, was killed and three police personnel were injured in a reported gunfight with police at Bircourt in Senbagh. He was a member of an inter-district robber gang and wanted in 12 criminal cases, said the police sources. Tipped off, a team of police raided at Jamidarhat in Begumganj uapzila on 27.1.2020 night and arrested Yusuf around 9:30pm, said assistant superintendent of Noakhali police Alamgir Hossain. Later, police along with Yusuf conducted another drive to recover arms around 2:45am in Bircourt area of Senbagh upazila. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the associates of Yusuf opened fire on police, forcing them to fire back in self-defense. Yusuf was caught in the line of fire and sustained bullet injuries. Later, he was taken to Noakhali General Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Jewel Hossain
Description: Jewel Hossain, detained from Coxs Bazar was killed in gunfight with DB police. He was one of the main accused of Ansar member Hossain Ali murder case, said Tauhidul Islam, additional superintendent police (ASP) in Jashore. A team of Jashore Detective Branch (DB) arrested Jewel from Coxs Bazar on 28.1.2020, the ASP said. Following his statement, DB members along with Jewel conducted a raid at Hasimpur village around 4am to detain Munna, he said. Munna, main accused and his cohorts opened fire on the DB team forcing the law enforcers to retaliate triggering a gunfight. During the gunfight, Jewel sustained bullet wounds and was rushed to Jashore General Hospital, where duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Abu Bakar Siddique Babu
Identity: A floor in-charge of Bangladesh Film Development Corporation (BFDC)
Location: Tejgaon Industrial Area police station, Dhaka
Description: According to the police, Babu was detained on 18.1.2020 evening after a case was filed against him under the Digital Security Act. Inspector Iftekhar Islam took Babu to Dhaka Medical College Hospital in an unconscious state after he tried to commit suicide. Later, the duty doctor declared him dead. One of his relatives said AC Moinul and Inspector Iftekhar are responsible for this mysterious death.

Name: Abdul Nasir
Identity: An alleged Rohingya drug peddler from Balukhali refugee camp
Location: Marine Drive Road at Montalia Puranpara, Cox's Bazar
Description: Abdul Nasir, was killed in a gunfight on Marine Drive Road at Montalia Puranpara after 1:15am, with Rab said Company Commander Sha Alam of RAB-15. Responding to a tip-off about drug trafficking, a RAB team set up a check-post there, he said. The officers stopped several men who were carrying some sacks. But the men started shooting at officers, forcing the latter to retaliate, Alam added. At one stage, Nasir got shot while the others managed to flee the scene, he said, adding that Nasir was taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mozaffar Hossain
Description: Abdul Wahab, father of Mozaffar, quoting eye witnesses said that a drug smuggler hired Mozaffar's auto rickhaw. At one stage police chased that smuggler but he managed to flee. Police later detained Mozaffar with smuggler's shawl, three and half kilogram ganja and his auto rickshaw and took him to police station. Abdul Wahab alleged that his son died due to police torture in their custody.

Name: Mohammad Ilias
Identity: Alleged robber; a Rohingya man who was a resident of Block-D, Camp Number 26, Jadimura refugee camp
Location: Hinllah union of Teknaf, Cox's Bazar
Description: A Rohingya refugee, who was a suspected robber, was killed in a reported gunfight with the members of RAB at Jadimura refugee camp. RAB 15 company commander Mirza Sahed Mahatab said that a group of RAB raided Jadimura Rohingya Refugees camp to arrest suspected Rohingya robbers and to seize illegal firearms. When they turned up at the camp, suspected robbers opened fire on them and they retaliated by firing back. Later, RAB members found a Rohingya shot and wounded and seized some illegal firearms from him.

Name: Shahid Hossain
Description: Shahid, was killed in a gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion in Beribadh area. A team of RAB 1 conducted a drive in the area at night, said sources at the RAB headquarters. The robbers opened fire as soon as the team approached the area, triggering a skirmish. At one stage, Shahid was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while the others managed to flee the scene, RAB sources said.

Name: Kashidul Islam
Description: On information that some robbers were preparing to rob a house in Kashidanga village in the upazila, a police team, led by Akhiul Islam, additional SP of (Hakimpur circle), went to the spot around 2:00am, said AbdurRazzak, officer-in-charge of Hakimpur Police Station. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire. Police returned fire, triggering a gun battle. At one stage, Kashidul, leader of the robber gang, was shot dead. Others fled the spot, the OC said.

Name: Nurul Amin
Identity: Alleged robber, a resident in Leda Rohingya camp
Description: Nurul Amin, was killed in a shootout between robbers and Rapid Action Battalion members at Pashchim Leda Nurai para in Teknaf upazila, said Lt Mirza Shahed Mahtab, camp commander of Rab-15 in Teknaf. Nurul used to live in Leda Rohingya camp, he said. The robbers opened fire when a RAB team, acting on a tip-off, conducted a raid at their den in a hill, said the camp commander. The RAB members retaliated, triggering the gunfight, he added. After the gun battle, the Rab members found bullet-hit Nurul lying on the spot and sent him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, where he died later.

Name: Mazarul Islam
Location: Paschim Singho in Burichang upazila, Cumilla
Description: Mazarul Islam, was killed in a gunfight with police at Paschim Singho in Burichang upazila said Mozammel Haq, officer-in-charge of Burichang Police Station. Mazarul was a highway robber who was involved in the killings of two businessmen that took place on Cumilla-Sylhet highway at Kangsonagar in Burichang and on Dhaka-Chattogram highway in Chandina recently, the OC said. The gunfight took place when Burichang police raided Pashchim Singho area on information that some robbers were preparing for committing a robbery, the police official added. At one stage, Mazarul was hit. He was rushed to Cumilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead, he added.

Name: Aurangajeb Jebu
Location: Bankapur of Manda upazila in Naogaon
Description: Jebu was killed in a reported gunfight with the members of Detective Branch at Bankapur of Manda upazila. Mozaffar Hossain, officer-in-charge of Manda police station, said Jebu was a listed drug trader in the area and wanted in 20 criminal cases. Superintendent of Naogaon police Abdul Mannan said that a team of DB police arrested Jebu from Deluabari Bazar on 10 February night. After getting information from Jebu, a team of DB police conducted a drive in the area. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the suspected drug dealers opened fire on police, forcing them to fire back in self-defence that triggered a gunfight. At one stage, Jebu was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while the others managed to flee the scene.

Name: Mong Kiyu Tong Chonga
Location: Panbazar area of Balukhali, Palangkhali union, Ukhiya, Cox's Bazar
Description: Lt. Col. Ali Haider Azad Ahmad of 34 Battalion captain said that on information they took position in the early morning in the incident day. At one stage they have seen some five to six suspected persons were coming from Myanmar side. The BGB members instructed them to stop. The suspects opened fire to BGB members. BGB members also opened fire in self-defense. The suspected Yaba smugglers then fled to Myanmar.  He  said, "the BGB members rescued bullet wounded Tong Chonga and brought him to Ukhia Upazila Health Complex. The duty doctor of the hospital declared him dead.

Name: Rafiqul Islam
Description: Police arrested the duo from Nawabganj on 19.2.2020. Gleaning information from the two, a police team took the duo with them and raided ChhotoMagura village to recover firearms around 3:00am, said Ashok Kumar Chauhan, officer-in-charge of Nawabganj Police Station. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, other members of the gang opened fire. Police retaliated, claimed the OC. Rafiqul and Wazed were shot dead when they were trying to escape from police custody. Rafiqul was accused in three robbery cases and Wazed in two robbery cases, said police.

Name: Wazed Ali
Description: Police arrested the duo from Nawabganj on 19.2.2020. Gleaning information from the two, a police team took the duo with them and raided ChhotoMagura village to recover firearms around 3:00am, said Ashok Kumar Chauhan, officer-in-charge of Nawabganj Police Station. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, other members of the gang opened fire. Police retaliated, claimed the OC. Rafiqul and Wazed were shot dead when they were trying to escape from police custody. Rafiqul was accused in three robbery cases and Wazed in two robbery cases, said police.

Name: Habban Ali Sheikh
Location: Char Shibrampur area of Pabna Sadar
Description: Acting on a tip-off, a police team conducted a drive in Char Shibrampur area of Pabna Sadar upazila around 2:00am, said Rafiqul Islam, superintendent of Pabna police. When police reached the spot, the criminals fired on police. The law enforcers returned fire. After the "gun battle", police found bullet-hit Habban lying on the spot, he said. Habban was declared dead after being taken to Pabna Sadar Hospital, the SP said.

Name: Torikul Islam alias Saddam
Identity: Prime suspect in a seven-year-old girl murder after being rape
Description: In Chapainawabganj, the key suspect in a seven-year-old girl murder was killed in a "gunfight" with police at Horishpur in Sadar upazila. Torikul Islam alias Saddam, 32, of Manik Hajir Tola village under the same upazila, was accused of killing the girl after rape.

Name: Jahangir
Location: Loharpool Bridge in Palpara area of Cumilla Sadar
Description: In Comilla, two suspected robbers were killed in a gunfight with the police at Loharpool Bridge in Palpara area. Kotwali model police station and district intelligence police conducted joint operations in the area. The robbers opened fire at the team sensing their presence.  For self-defence, the police retaliated, said police sources. Three police personnel and two robbers were injured at the time.  They were rescued and taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared two robbers dead.

Name: Arifuzzaman Emon
Location: Loharpool Bridge in Palpara area of Cumilla Sadar
Description: In Comilla, two suspected robbers were killed in a gunfight with the police at Loharpool Bridge in Palpara area. Kotwali model police station and district intelligence police conducted joint operations in the area. The robbers opened fire at the team sensing their presence.  For self-defence, the police retaliated, said police sources. Three police personnel and two robbers were injured at the time.  They were rescued and taken to Comilla Medical College Hospital where doctors declared two robbers dead.

Name: Unidentified
Description: In Narayanganj, a RAB team installed a check-post on the Asian Highway in Kalni area after learning that a private car carrying a drug consignment was heading towards Gazipur, said Major Abdullah Al Mehdi, camp commander of RAB-1 in Gazipur. "As we signalled to stop the car, its passengers started firing on us that forced us fire back in self-defence," he said. Later, the RAB personnel found a person with bullet-injury inside the car as the three others fled the scene. Later, they took him to a nearby hospital where doctors pronounced him dead

Name: Yasmin Begum
Location: Detective Branch of police in Gazipur
Description: Yasmin Begum, died several hours after she was picked up from home by Detective Branch of police in Gazipur. Her 17-year-old-son Yasin Arafat Jisan said about 4-5 men in plain clothes, who introduced themselves as DB officers, showed up at their home in Bhawal in the evening and said they were looking for his father Abdul Hai over allegations of drug dealing . When he and his mother told the men that Abdul was not at home, they started beating her up and took her into custody. Around 11:00pm, Jisan received a phone call from someone who told him that his mother had fallen ill and had been taken to Gazipur Shaheed Tajuddin Ahmed Medical College Hospital. Due to difficulties in finding transport, he reached the hospital around 1:00am and saw that her mother had died. There were injury marks on her legs, arms and some other parts of the body, Jisan said. Meanwhile, Deputy Commissioner Manjur Rahman of DB in Gazipur told that Yasmin was arrested with 120 yaba pills and taken to the DB office in the city. She later fell sick and was taken to hospital. Jisan said his father was a drug addict and only came home once or twice a week, but he was not accused in any case. He added that the officers did not find yaba pills in his mother's possession. .

Name: Mojaher
Description: Mojaher was killed in a gunfight with police at Teknaf upazila.  Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf police station Pradip Kumar Das told that on information a police team drive an operation that area. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire. Police returned fire, triggering a gun battle. At one stage, police recovered Mojaher's bullet wounded body. Police took him to upazila health complex. Later, they took him to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where the duty doctor declared him to dead.

Name: Ali Hossain
Description: Ali Hossain, was killed in what RAB said was a "gunfight" with them. Ali Hossain, 40, from Kodupur village in the upazila said SamiulAlam, media officer of RAB-9 said. "During a drive to arrest Ali, he and his associates open fire to RAB members which eventually led to a gunfight," the RAB official said, adding that five people were arrested from the spot.

Name: Undentified
Description: In Narayanganj, an unidentified youth was found dead in a car with drugs after a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion near a checkpoint at Colony area of Rupganj in Narayanganj.

Name: Abdus Salam
Description: Abdus Salam, an accused in three human trafficking cases was killed in an alleged gunfight with police. He was one of the main accused in a human trafficking case filed after a trawler capsized near St Martin's Island. The "gunfight" took place at the foot of a hill near Salam's house around 4:00am, said Pradip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf Police Station. Acting on a tip off, a team of police went to the area to arrest Salam and his cohorts, who were holding a meeting there, the OC said. Sensing police presence, Salam's men opened fire on the law enforcers and injured three cops, he said. In self-defence, police retaliated with gunshots. Salam's men fled at one point, the official said, adding that police found bullet-hit Salam and rushed him to the upazila health complex. Later, he was shifted to Cox's Bazar General Hospital, where doctors declared him dead, the OC added.

Name: Shahidul Islam
Location: Bagowan village of Daulatpur upazila in Kushtia
Description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a gunfight between two gangs of drug peddlers and a joint team of police at Bagowan village. Acting on tip-off a joint team of Daulatpur police and Detective Branch of police conducted a drive at about 3:00am while two gangs of drug peddlers were selling and buying drugs in a betel leaf orchard, Daulatpur police station officer-in-charge SM Arifur Rahman said. Sensing the presence of the law enforces, Shahids associate opened fire on police, forcing them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight. After the gunfight, police recovered Shahids bullet injured body while his associates managed to flee. They took Shahid to Daulatpur Upazila Health Complex where on duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Arpon Chakma
Identity: An activist of United Peoples' Democratic Front (UPDF)
Location: Mohishbhanga Banaschhari, Bandukbhanga union, Rangamati Sadar
Description: Arpon Chakma was killed in a gunfight with Army at Mohishbhanga Banaschhari. An Army petrol team of Shuvolong camp going by boat. Sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire to them. In self-defence, Army retaliated with gunshots. After 15 to 20 minutes, the armed criminals were forced to fall back and the Army members took control of the area At one point, they found Arpon Chakma's dead body.

Name: Nurul Haque Keru
Description: A suspected robber was killed in a gunfight with the police in Begaritala area. Jasim Uddin, officer in-charge of Monirampur police station, said that police raided the area along with Nurul Haque, arrested on charge of lifting an easy bike, to recover arms. He died during the gunfight between the police and his cohorts that took place around 3:00am.

Name: Shariful Islam
Description: In Feni reported that Nishan and Shariful appeared before a Feni court over a robbery case on 27 February. The families said they were accused in the case filed in 2019 over enmity with a local political leader. They were in bail and appeared in the court hearing. After hearing, Shamsul went to Feni Bara Bazar for shopping for his sisters weeding, said his uncle Delowar Hossain. Shamsul was called in to some place by one Sujon, who also appeared the court hearing in the case, over phone. The family failed to trace him since 1:00pm of 27 February. He said that Shamsul was never involved with robbery but he was made accused in the imaginary case last year over enmity with local political leaders. Shariful Islams father Obaidul Haque said that his son earned living by driving human hauler but was accused in the case over enmity with the local political leaders. On 27 February he appeared before the court and did not return home. Later on 28 February they identified his body at the hospital. My son was killed after being picked up by police, Obaidul alleged, He was never involved in robbery. Sonagazi police officer-in-charge Moin Uddin Ahmed denied the allegations. He said that Shamsul and Shariful were robbers and were killed in internal fight near Bismillah Brickfield in Mangalkandi village on 27 February night. Two locally made guns and eight cartridges were found at the spot, he said, as evidence of firing among the robbers.

Name: Shamsul Huda Nishan
Description: In Feni reported that Nishan and Shariful appeared before a Feni court over a robbery case on 27 February. The families said they were accused in the case filed in 2019 over enmity with a local political leader. They were in bail and appeared in the court hearing. After hearing, Shamsul went to Feni Bara Bazar for shopping for his sisters weeding, said his uncle Delowar Hossain.
