He said that Shamsul and Shariful were robbers and were killed in internal fight near Bismillah Brickfield in Mangalkandi village on 27 February night. Two locally made guns and eight cartridges were found at the spot, he said, as evidence of firing among the robbers.

Name: Bulu Mia
Description: A gang of 10-12 robbers was fleeing the area after committing robbery at a house in the area, said Alamgir Hossain, officer-in-charge of Sadar police station. The robbers opened fire when a patrol team of police signaled the auto-rickshaw carrying the robbers to stop, forcing police to fire back that triggered the gunfight. At one stage, Bulu was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

Name: Shahin Bishwas alias Hanif Mia
Location: In front of the National Institute of Kidney Diseases and Urology, Shyamoli, Dhaka
Description: Shahin Bishwas was killed in a reported gunfight with RAB members in the capital's Shyamoli area. The incident took place when a RAB team signalled a CNG-run autorickshaw to stop at a checkpoint in front of the National Institute of Kidney Diseases and Urology around 12:15am, said Mohammad Mohiuddin Faruqui, company commander of RAB-2. As the RAB men asked the three passengers and the driver to get off the vehicle, all but Shahin followed the instruction, the RAB official said. When the RAB men were forcing Shahin to come out, the others suddenly fired blank shots and tried to escape by crossing the adjacent boundary walls of National Institute of Mental Health and Hospital. RAB members were forced to fire back when Shahin also started firing on them from inside the autorickshaw, triggering a "gunfight", Faruqui said.  Hanif caught a bullet injury during the incident and was taken to Dhaka Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Seven suspected Rohingya robbers were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB. Wing Commander Azim Ahmed, Commanding Officer of RAB-15, said acting on a tip-off that a group of robbers was hiding in Shalbagan Lalporirjum Hill, adjacent to Jadimura-Nayapara 26 and 27 Rohingya Refugee Camps, a RAB team raided the area around 2:00am. First, the RAB members cordoned off the area and then using a megaphone asked the robbers to surrender. But at this, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing the law enforcers to fire retaliatory shots, he claimed at a press briefing at his office in Cox's Bazar . The "gunfight" continued for nearly four hours. After it ended, the RAB members searched the area and recovered seven bullet-hit bodies.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Seven suspected Rohingya robbers were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB. Wing Commander Azim Ahmed, Commanding Officer of RAB-15, said acting on a tip-off that a group of robbers was hiding in Shalbagan Lalporirjum Hill, adjacent to Jadimura-Nayapara 26 and 27 Rohingya Refugee Camps, a RAB team raided the area around 2:00am. Name: Mohammad Faruk
Description: Seven suspected Rohingya robbers were killed in an alleged gunfight with RAB. Wing Commander Azim Ahmed, Commanding Officer of RAB-15, said acting on a tip-off that a group of robbers was hiding in Shalbagan Lalporirjum Hill, adjacent to Jadimura-Nayapara 26 and 27 Rohingya Refugee Camps, a RAB team raided the area around 2:00am. The "gunfight" continued for nearly four hours. After it ended, the RAB members searched the area and recovered seven bullet-hit bodies.

Name: Nur Alam
Description: Nur Alam, was killed in a gunfight with BGB said Lt Col Md Faysal Hasan Khan, commander of BGB's Teknaf-2 unit.

Name: Hafez Nazrul Islam
Identity: Activist of Student wing of Jamaat-E-Islami  who is the accused of a murder case of Student wing of AL leader
Description: Nazrul Islam, was killed in a gunfight with police in Amanullahpur village in Begumganj. He was an accussed of student wing of AL leader Rakib Hossain murder case. He was the second-in-command of student wing of Jamaats Pias Bahini, police said. Harun-ur-Rashid Chowdhury, officer-in-charge of Begumganj police station, said that the thana and Detective Branch of police jointly raided Jonokollyan High School field around 3:45am. Members of Pias Bahini locked in a gunfight with them. Nazrul sustained gunshot wounds during the skirmish  at the spot. Police took him to Noakhali General Hospital where the doctors pronounced him dead, said the OC.

Name: Mohon Ali
Description: Mohon Ali was killed in a gunfight with police at Golapnagar Moni park of Bheramara upazila. Acting on a tip-off, a team of Bheramara police conducted a drive in the area near Kushtia-Ishwardi Highway while a gang of robbers were taking position there to commit robbery, Bheramara police officer-in-charge Mohammad Shahjalal said. Sensing presence of the police, the robbers open fired on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered the gunfight.

Name: Musa Miah
Location: Gazinagar Bazar of Matiranga Upazilla, Khagrachari
Description: Four persons were shot dead and a few others injured after a BGB team opened fire on villagers in Matiranga upazila during an altercation over the seizure of tree logs. The BGB headquarters in a press statement titled unwanted incident created during smuggling of wood log. Dulu Mia, one of the witnesses to the shooting, told that BGB commander Ishaque, along with his team, was trying to seize four jackfruit tree logs from Amir Hamza, triggering an altercation near Gazinagar Bazar. He said that they came to know that Amir Hamza cut his trees on instruction from the local power supply authorities. The BGB team wanted to take way the logs in a pickup van, but there was a commotion as villagers tried to resist the team, he affirmed. Ahammad Ali was filming the scene with his mobile phone but BGB members took away it and got into a scuffle. At one stage of the scuffle, soldier Shaon and villager Ali Akbar fell on the ground, said Dulu Mia said that Ishaque opened fire targeting them.The DC formed a three-member committee, headed by additional district magistrate Khandker Muhammad Rizaul Karim, to carry out an inquiry into the killings.

Name: Ali Akbar
Location: Gazinagar Bazar of Matiranga Upazilla, Khagrachari
Description: Four persons were shot dead and a few others injured after a BGB team opened fire on villagers in Matiranga upazila during an altercation over the seizure of tree logs. The BGB headquarters in a press statement titled unwanted incident created during smuggling of wood log. Dulu Mia, one of the witnesses to the shooting, told that BGB commander Ishaque, along with his team, was trying to seize four jackfruit tree logs from Amir Hamza, triggering an altercation near Gazinagar Bazar. He said that they came to know that Amir Hamza cut his trees on instruction from the local power supply authorities. The BGB team wanted to take way the logs in a pickup van, but there was a commotion as villagers tried to resist the team, he affirmed. Ahammad Ali was filming the scene with his mobile phone but BGB members took away it and got into a scuffle. At one stage of the scuffle, soldier Shaon and villager Ali Akbar fell on the ground, said Dulu Mia said that Ishaque opened fire targeting them.The DC formed a three-member committee, headed by additional district magistrate Khandker Muhammad Rizaul Karim, to carry out an inquiry into the killings.

Name: Ahammad Ali
Location: Gazinagar Bazar of Matiranga Upazilla, Khagrachari
Description: Four persons were shot dead and a few others injured after a BGB team opened fire on villagers in Matiranga upazila during an altercation over the seizure of tree logs. The BGB headquarters in a press statement titled unwanted incident created during smuggling of wood log. Dulu Mia, one of the witnesses to the shooting, told that BGB commander Ishaque, along with his team, was trying to seize four jackfruit tree logs from Amir Hamza, triggering an altercation near Gazinagar Bazar. The BGB headquarters in a press statement titled unwanted incident created during smuggling of wood log. Name: Oziullah
Identity: Alleged robber; a Rohingya man who was a resident of Nayapara camp
Description: Oziullah, was killed in a gunfight with police at Matichhira Pahar area. During that time, three policemen were injured. Police told that he was an associate of robber Joki group.

Name: Jubair Mia
Identity: Alleged drug peddler; a Rohingya man who was a resident of Leda camp, A-block
Description: Jubair Mia, was killed in a gunfight with BGB members.

Name: Altaf Hossain
Description: Altaf Hossain's family members said he was picked up from Jaamgara village in Muktagacha on February 28, 2020. A Mymensingh court sent him to jail on March 1. He was released on bail on March 7. His 12-year-old son Arif Hossain said he was home on February 28. "I came home from my madrasa around 2:00pm and heard from neighbours that police chased my father, caught him and then beat him up with tree branches," said Arif. "Later, police demanded Tk 85,000 from us. Since we didn't have the money, they took my father to Muktagacha Police Station where he was tortured mercilessly." After Altaf was released on bail on March 7, he lost his appetite and couldn't sleep.But the family couldn't afford to take him to a hospital, said Sirajul Islam, brother-in-law of Altaf. "As his condition deteriorated, we were taking him to Muktagacha Upazila Health Complex but he died on the way," said Sirajul. Refuting the allegations of torture, the Officer-in-charge (Investigation) of Muktagacha Police Station Jahangir Alam said the court or the jail authorities wouldn't have accepted him if he was sick or injured and added that the allegation was baseless.

Name: Nur Kamal
Identity: Members of alleged robbery gang, Jokhi Robbers Gang; a Rohingya
Location: Shaplapur Marine Drive road, Teknaf, Coxs Bazar
Description: Acting on a tip off, a team of RAB15 conducted a drive in the area around 1:00am where a group of robbers were preparing to commit a robbery, said Company Commander of RAB-15 in Teknaf Shahed Mahtab. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire, forcing RAB men to fire back. At one stage, Saiful and Nur were caught in the line of fire, while the others managed to flee the scene.

Name: Saiful Islam
Identity: Members of alleged robbery gang, Jokhi Robbers Gang; a Rohingya
Location: Shaplapur Marine Drive road, Teknaf, Coxs Bazar
Description: Acting on a tip off, a team of RAB15 conducted a drive in the area around 1:00am where a group of robbers were preparing to commit a robbery, said Company Commander of RAB-15 in Teknaf Shahed Mahtab. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire, forcing RAB men to fire back. At one stage, Saiful and Nur were caught in the line of fire, while the others managed to flee the scene.

Name: Mohammad Khokon
Location: Dhaka-Chottogram Highway in Cumilla Chandina Upazilla
Description: Being tipped off that a gang was preparing for a robbery, two teams of police and DB raided the spot around 1:50am, said Porimal Das, sub-inspector of detective branch (DB) of police in Cumilla.Sensing police presence, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to fire back that triggered a "gunfight", he continued. Police recovered a firearm, two bullets and several sharp weapons from the spot.

Name: Johurul Islam
Description: Johurul Islam, accussed in 10 cases, was killed in a gunfight with police at Gabtola area. Drug peddlers opened fire on the police during a drive near Ballabpur School at night, said Rifat Khan Rajib, officer-in-charge of Chougachha police station. Jahirul was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot.

Name: Jahidul Islam
Identity: Former vice-president of Student wing of AL of Chuadanga district unit
Description: Liti Khatun, wife of Jahidul Islam told that on 14 March 2020 at around 5:00pm suddenly some poliicemen came to their house. They picked and beating up Jahidul. At around 7:00pm they got information that Jahidul was passed away. She claimed that police beaten to kill her husband.

Name: Abdul Mannan alias Mona
Description: Asaduzzaman, Deputy Commissioner (east division) of the Detective Branch of Dhaka Metropolitan Police, said that the dead -- Abdul Mannan alias Mona, 35, -- was the allege leader of the mugging gang that was responsible for the death of a woman who fell from a rickshaw after muggers snatched her bag. Earlier, police arrested four muggers from the Mugda Stadium area and told media that they were looking for their gang leader Mona. Later, based on the arrestees' information, police raided Khilgaon's Nagdarpar area around 3:00am to arrest other members of the gang, the DC said. "Sensing the presence of police, the muggers opened fire. This prompted the law enforcers to fire back, triggering the gunfight during which Mona was shot," the DB official claimed.

Name: Abdul Alim
Description: Abdul Alim, was killed in a "shootout" with police in Pabna's Santhia upazila, said Goutam Kumar, additional superintendent of police in Pabna. Acting on a tip-off that a group of drug peddlers had taken shelter somewhere in Khoyerbagan area, a police team raided the area around 2:00am, he said. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate that eventually triggered a gunfight. Later, police found Alim with a bullet injury and took him to Pabna Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Moniruzzaman Monir
Description: Monir, was allegedly beaten to death by the police. Monirs family members complained that several cops some in plainclothes raided the building at Chamarkhan of Uttarkhan. The victims brother Zakir Hawlader told that cops from Uttarkhan police station raided their building at about 5.30am and dragged his brother onto the rooftop. Police locked the door and beaten his brother. Police then rushed Monir to a local hospital at about 9:30am claiming that he had a stroke and doctors there declared him dead.

Name: Sohel Hawlader alias Juna
Description: Sohel Hawlader was killed in an alleged gunfight with police at Khilgaon area, hours after he was arrested from Airport Road area. Mashiure Rahman, officer-in-charge of Khilgaon Police Station, said a police team, in association with Airport Armed Police Battalion, arrested Sohel from the Airport area on 22 March 2020 evening after he reached Dhaka from Cox's Bazar. Later, based on his information, police took him to Nagdarpar area in Khilgaon around 3:00am to recover hidden firearms and drugs, the OC said. Sensing their presence, Sohel's associates opened fire, prompting law enforcers to fire back in "self-defence".. At one stage, Sohel fell in the line of fire, while his cohorts managed to flee the scene. He was rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) where doctors declared him dead, the OC added. Sohel's elder brother Jamal Hawlader alleged that they went to Khilgaon Police Station on Saturday night hearing that police picked up Sohel who was returning form Cox's Bazar. Police then told them to go to the court, he would be produced before it. "But they killed my brother," he claimed.

Name: Parvez Khan
Description: Golam Mostafa, officer-in-charge (OC) of Kushtia Model Police Station, said they arrested Parvez on 24 March 2020 afternoon and got information on his firearm storage. On information, police along with Parvez went to Shalda village in the upazila to recover the firearms. On their way, Parvez's cohorts opened fire on police around 3:30am, forcing the law enforcers to retaliate, he added. At one point of the "gunfight", Parvez sustained bullet wounds and died on the spot,.

Name: Shanu Hawlader
Description: Shanu Hawlader, died three days after he was arrested. A doctor said there were multiple injury marks on his body. Police arrested Shanu on 23 March 2020 from his home in Kalagachia village of Amtali upazila on suspicion of being involved with a murder last year. He was not an accused in the murder case, family members and locals said. His wife Jhahanara Begum and son Shakib Hossain alleged that police demanded tk three lakh in return for releasing him. As they could not arrange the money on such short notice, officer-in-charge Abul Bashar and Manoranjan Mistry tortured Shanu to death.. Shakib said he offered tk 10000 to the Abul Bashar on 24 March 2020, but he refused to take the money and asked for the full amount. On 25 March 2020 Shakib and his mother Jhahanara went to the police station to meet Shanu but they were refused by the police officials. Jhahanara's brother Rakibul Islam said I heard Shanu's scream in agony while I was waiting at the police station to meet him in the same day. Shanu was found hanging from the ceiling fan in Inspector Manoranjan's room on 26 March 2020 morning, according to Bashar. He added that Shanu was taken to the bathroom by a constable around 6:30am. But he sneaked out of the bathroom moments later and hung himself. Manoranjan and Arifur were suspended for the allegations of Shanu's death. A three member committee headed by Additional SP also formed and asked to submit report in three days.

Name: Surat Ali
Location: Rupali Bangla Jute Mills, Biral,  Dinajpur
Description: Surat Ali was killed and five others were injured in a clash between jute mill workers and police in Biral. Amir Ali, a workers' leader of Rupali Bangla Jute Mills, said the mill authorities announced to shut down the mills without any prior notice amid corona virus outbreak. The workers demonstrated in and around the mill demanding their three weeks arrears, he added. At one point, the director of the mill tried to pacify the workers with police, resulting in the clash, he added. Sheikh Mohammad Nasim Habib, officer-in-charge of Biral Police Station, said they had to fire rubber bullets, tear shells and charge baton to take the situation under control. Surat suffered injuries during the clash and later died. Meanwhile, Abdul Kader, sub inspector of that police station, filed a case accusing 1100 unnamed people in connection with the incident.

Name: Unidentified
Description: BGB-2 commanding officer Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan said that acting on a tip-off, a BGB team raided the flood control embankment in the River Naf. They challenged a small boat coming from Myanmar. The gunfight took place as the miscreants opened fire on the law enforcers while trying to escape the scene. When the gunfight was over, three bullet-hit drug peddlers were seen lying on the ground, the BGB official said. They were sent to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where duty doctors declared them dead. The bodies were handed over to the Teknaf police.

Name: Unidentified
Description: BGB-2 commanding officer Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan said that acting on a tip-off, a BGB team raided the flood control embankment in the River Naf. They challenged a small boat coming from Myanmar. The gunfight took place as the miscreants opened fire on the law enforcers while trying to escape the scene. When the gunfight was over, three bullet-hit drug peddlers were seen lying on the ground, the BGB official said. They were sent to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where duty doctors declared them dead. The bodies were handed over to the Teknaf police.

Name: Unidentified
Description: BGB-2 commanding officer Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan said that acting on a tip-off, a BGB team raided the flood control embankment in the River Naf. They challenged a small boat coming from Myanmar. The gunfight took place as the miscreants opened fire on the law enforcers while trying to escape the scene. When the gunfight was over, three bullet-hit drug peddlers were seen lying on the ground, the BGB official said. They were sent to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where duty doctors declared them dead. The bodies were handed over to the Teknaf police.

Name: Musa Akbar
Description: Musa, a suspected drug peddler was killed in a gunfight with the Teknaf police. Teknaf police officer in-charge Prodeep Kumar Das said that acting on a tip-off, a police team raided village Tolatoli under Hoykong union at about 4:00am. Sensing presence of the police, miscreants opened fire them that triggered the gunfight. When the gunfight was over, the police recovered bullet hit body of Musa from the spot.

Name: Sarwar Salo Alias Shahin Alam
Location: Shamukjani Bazar in Santhia Upazilla, Pabna
Description: Goutam Kumar Biswas, additional superintendent of police, said acting on a tip-off, police and Detective Branch members jointly raided Shamukjani Bazar in Santhia upazila at about 2:00am. As soon as the law enforcers reached the area, the robbers opened fire, triggering a skirmish, the ASP added. Sarwar, injured in the gunfight, was arrested from the spot and taken to Pabna General Hospital where the doctor pronounced him dead.

Name: Mohammad Ferdous Fahim
Description: Moniruzzaman Monir, officer-in-charge of Birampur Police Station, said tipped-off that drug traders were bringing drugs from bordering area, police took position beside Mirpur field. The drug traders fired at police and Fahim was killed in the gunfight.

Name: Faruk Moral
Location: Kodalia canal area under Sundarbans East Zone of Mongla upazila, Bagerhat
Description: Lieutenant Colonel Rawshanul Firoz of RAB-6 said they conducted a drive in the area at about 7:00am. As soon as they reached the area, robbers fired at them triggering a skirmish that lasted for about 40 minutes. Later, RAB arrested Faruk from the spot and took him to Mongla Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, he said.

Name: Rofiqul Islam
Description: It is alleged that police and Rofiqul were locked into tussling about drug and then police beaten him greviously  so that he died at one point.

Name: Minhajul Islam alias Mintu alias Shikdar
Description: Police arrested Minhajul from his residence on 1 April 2020 . Later, police took him with them to recover firearms at Tilabaduri village . As soon as police reached the spot, Minhajuls cohorts opened fire. Minhajul was killed during the skirmish.

Name: Zahidul Islam
Description: Parimal Kumar Chakrabarty, Officer-in-Charge of Patnitala Police Station said that Zahidul was  arrested  on 1 April 2020 .. Police took him to Bakrail village to recover drugs. When police reached the spot, Zahiduls associates opened fire. He was killed in the ensuing gunfight.

Name: Mohammad Mizan
Description: Two suspected yaba traders were killed in a "gunfight" with police in Cox's Bazar's Taknaf upazila. Searching a microbus, police recovered five thousand yaba pills and arrested its driver Mahmudullah on 5 April 2020 around 9:00am, Prodip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf Police Station, said. Based on his confessional statement, a police team conducted a raid at Jhimongkhali area near the Naf river to recover arms and yaba, said the OC. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the cohorts of the arrestee opened fire on police, forcing them to retaliate triggering a gunfight. Mahmudullah and another attacker sustained bullet wounds during the gunfight and were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, OC Prodip said. Doctors at the health complex referred them to Cox's Bazar General Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mahmud Ullah
Description: Two suspected yaba traders were killed in a "gunfight" with police in Cox's Bazar's Taknaf upazila. Searching a microbus, police recovered five thousand yaba pills and arrested its driver Mahmudullah on 5 April 2020 around 9:00am, Prodip Kumar Das, officer-in-charge (OC) of Teknaf Police Station, said. Based on his confessional statement, a police team conducted a raid at Jhimongkhali area near the Naf river to recover arms and yaba, said the OC. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the cohorts of the arrestee opened fire on police, forcing them to retaliate triggering a gunfight. Mahmudullah and another attacker sustained bullet wounds during the gunfight and were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex, OC Prodip said. Doctors at the health complex referred them to Cox's Bazar General Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Hassan
Description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with Rapid Action Battalion in Bejgaon bus terminal area. Enayet Hossain Mannan, superintendent of police of RAB-11 in Munshiganj, said the duo committed a robbery in Shariatpur's Gosairhat upazila a few days ago. The "gunfight" broke out on the Dhaka-Mawa Highway around noon when members of RAB-2 were pursuing the robbers, he added. Hedayetul Islam Bhuiyan, officer-in-charge of Sreenagar Police Station, said the two men were going to Dhaka on a battery-run auto rickshaw. They opened fire on the approaching Rab team, triggering the "gunfight" which left the two dead, the OC said.

Name: Masud Hawlader
Description: Two suspected robbers were killed in a "gunfight" with Rapid Action Battalion in Bejgaon bus terminal area. Enayet Hossain Mannan, superintendent of police of RAB-11 in Munshiganj, said the duo committed a robbery in Shariatpur's Gosairhat upazila a few days ago. The "gunfight" broke out on the Dhaka-Mawa Highway around noon when members of RAB-2 were pursuing the robbers, he added. Hedayetul Islam Bhuiyan, officer-in-charge of Sreenagar Police Station, said the two men were going to Dhaka on a battery-run auto rickshaw. They opened fire on the approaching Rab team, triggering the "gunfight" which left the two dead, the OC said.

Name: Ali Hossain Titu
Description: The metropolitan polices west zone Additional Deputy Commissioner Anis Uddin said that they arrested five people at different places of the city for their suspected involvement in robberies on the nights following April 1 and April 5 and the arrestees informed them that Ali Hossain led their gang. He said that they detected Ali Hossains location at Mohammadpur on 13 April night and a team, on secret information, went to Bochhila area to nab him  and Ali Hossain was killed in a gunfight with DB police.

Name: Jafar Alam alias Gofur Alam
Description: Jafar Alam, was killed in a gunfight with members of Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) at Golarchar in Teknaf. BGB said that Jafar Alam was a drug peddler and they seized 2 lakh Yaba tablets from him. Lieutenant Colonel Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan, commanding officer of 2 BGB Battalion at Teknaf, said that BGB members were patrolling along shore at about 1:30am. At one stage, they saw a small wooden fishing boat coming towards Bangladesh from Myanmar side crossing the river Naf at about 2:00am.. The boat anchored at Golarchar near Shahparidwip.  As the BGB members challenged the boat, the people aboard it opened fire on them. The BGB members also retaliated with gunshots, said Faisal Hasan. After the gunfight the BGB members found one bullet-hit person and 2 lakh pieces Yaba tablets on the boat. The bullet-hit man was immediately taken Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where on-duty doctor declared him dead.

Name: Jashim Mondol
Description: Jashim Mondol, was killed in a reported gunfight between the members of Border Guard Bangladesh and a gang of pedlars at Natunpara border area. Quoting BGB-58, Jibannagar police station officer-in-charge Saiful Islam said that BGB arrested Jashim with phensedyl from border area in the upazila around 3:00am. Later, Jashim was killed in a gunfight during a drive conducted to recover more drugs as per the information of Jashim, BGB claimed.

Name: Ekramul Hossain alias Arif
Description: Shot in an altercation with RAB at Shoshanghat. Victim and his crew started firing as soon as RAB entered the area acting on a tip off. The gunfight between the two sides lasted almost 10 minutes. Victim was declared dead by the doctor at Joypurhat Modern Hospital after being found lying at the scene of raid at the end of gunfight and being taken to the hospital by RAB.

Name: Robiul Islam Robu
Description: ASP Kamruzzaman confirmed that a group of drug peddlers were dealing drugs around 1:00am. Acting on a tip-off they went to raid the place. Robu was shot in the altercation with RAB and died on his way to the hospital.

Name: Abdur Rashid Khorshed
Identity: Drug peddler, a Rohingya man who lived in C-2 block of Kutupalang camp
Location: C2 Block of Rohingya Camp, Ukhiya, Kutupalong, Ramu, Cox's Bazar
Description: Police started chasing the bike and the rider when it didnt stop after the police signaled it to stop while they were at Coxsbazar-Chittagong Highway.  A group started actively firing at the police when they reached Jowariyanala, Ramu to which DB police backfired for self defence. Police claimed that they found a dead body (victim), 20k Yaba pills, a motorcycle and an LG from the spot.

Name: Mannan
Description: Milon, younger brother of Mannan alleged that Mannan was driving his CNG back to Kaliganj when 2 police officers stopped his vehicle and started beating him as he was driving during  lockdown and picked him up. Police replied that the CNG driver had heart attack when he was questioned and died in the hospital as he had a severe heart attack. Victim's brother said they saw their brother's dead body lying at Police Lines.

Name: Giridhari Chowdhury
Description: CMP Deputy Commissioner (DC, South) Md Mehedi Hasan said Giridhari and a colleague of his were loading clothes from their shop onto a rickshaw after iftar, despite the market being closed. A security guard of Teri Bazar confronted them and asked why they were there amid the lockdown. The two staffers acted suspiciously during questioning, and the guard informed a police patrol team that was passing by. Police then took the duo to the outpost, the DC said. DC Mehedi said that at the outpost, officers asked Giridhari to call his shop owner, but he suddenly fell sick. Police rushed him to Chattogram Medical College Hospital (CMCH), where on-duty doctors declared him dead. Colleagues of the victim alleged that police beat him up and that lead to his death. Police denied the allegation. ASI Kamrul Islam and his two constables were closed for alleged involved in this incident.

Name: Mohammad Abdur Rashid
Identity: Members of Rohingya Jokey robber gang; resident of Jadimura Rohingya camp
Description: CPC-1 Camp Company Commander Biman Karmokar confirmed that the Ronhingya dacoit gang were preparing for a raid at the west side of the mountain, particularly at the hilly area of Shalbagan. Acting on this tip-off a team of RAB went to the spot when the gang started firing at them to which RAB fired back.  After a few moments of gunfight, they recovered the dead bodies of the  victims.

Name: Mohammad Abdul Hakim
Identity: Members of Rohingya Jokey robber gang
Description: CPC-1 Camp Company Commander Biman Karmokar confirmed that the Ronhingya dacoit gang were preparing for a raid at the west side of the mountain, particularly at the hilly area of Shalbagan. Acting on this tip-off a team of RAB went to the spot when the gang started firing at them to which RAB fired back.  After a few moments of gunfight, they recovered the dead bodies of the  victims.

Name: Mohammad Sayem Firoz
Identity: Alleged Drug Peddler, Son of Khorshed Alam
Location: Infront of BRAC Office, Chatkhil, Noakhali
Description: Offier-in-Charge Anwarul Islam confirmed that they raided Khilpara Bazar on a tip-off  and the drug peddler gang started firing at the police when they reached the place to which the police fired back in self defence. The doctors announced him dead when he was taken to Upazilla Health Complex after the gunfight.  Dead body was sent to Noakhali General Hospital for post mortem.

Name: Juwel Ahmed Shobuj
Identity: Accused of a murder of a Child
Location: Kashimpur Jail Road, Horinchala, Konabari, Gazipur City Corporation
Description: Wing Commander Abdullah Al Mamun confirmed that Shobuj kidnapped a 5year old kid named Alif on 29th April. Earlier RAB arrested Sagor who  confessed that Shobuj was the mastermind behind the killing. RAB recovered a decomposed body of Alif wrapped in a plastic bag. Based on this information a team of RAB went to the spot to arrest Shobuj. Sensing the presence of RAB, the gang started firing and in self defence, RAB started firing back and saw a dead body lying which was later confirmed as Shobuj's.

Name: Syed Alam
Description: Teknaf police said that the deceased formed a crime ring in the area and were preparing to commit robbery. On information police went to Rangikhali hills at about 4:00am to arrest them. As police reached there, the suspects opened fire on police forcing them to retaliate with gunshots, said Teknaf police station officer-in-charge Prodeep Kumar Das. After the gunfight police found the bodies of the three along with 18 local weapons, 200 cartridges and 55,000 pieces of Yaba tablets, he said. Prodeep said that five police personnel, including a sub-inspector, also sustained injuries during the gunfight. Three cases will be filed in connection with the incident. The bodies were sent to CoxsBazar General Hospital for autopsies.

Name: Abdul Monaf
Description: Teknaf police said that the deceased formed a crime ring in the area and were preparing to commit robbery. On information police went to Rangikhali hills at about 4:00am to arrest them. As police reached there, the suspects opened fire on police forcing them to retaliate with gunshots, said Teknaf police station officer-in-charge Prodeep Kumar Das. After the gunfight police found the bodies of the three along with 18 local weapons, 200 cartridges and 55,000 pieces of Yaba tablets, he said. Prodeep said that five police personnel, including a sub-inspector, also sustained injuries during the gunfight. Three cases will be filed in connection with the incident. The bodies were sent to CoxsBazar General Hospital for autopsies.

Name: Nurul Alam
Description: Teknaf police said that the deceased formed a crime ring in the area and were preparing to commit robbery. On information police went to Rangikhali hills at about 4:00am to arrest them. As police reached there, the suspects opened fire on police forcing them to retaliate with gunshots, said Teknaf police station officer-in-charge Prodeep Kumar Das. After the gunfight police found the bodies of the three along with 18 local weapons, 200 cartridges and 55,000 pieces of Yaba tablets, he said. Prodeep said that five police personnel, including a sub-inspector, also sustained injuries during the gunfight. Three cases will be filed in connection with the incident. The bodies were sent to CoxsBazar General Hospital for autopsies.

Name: Mohammad Sadek
Description: Suspected Rohingya drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with BGB. Tipped off, a team of BGB conducted a drive at Rahmetorbill border area around 4am confirmed by Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed. Sensing presence of the guards, criminals opened fire on BGB men, forcing them to fire back in self defence that triggered the gunfight. Later BGB men recovered the body of the drug peddler from the spot. They also seized 30,000 Yaba Pils, a firearm and three round bullets from the spot.

Name: Maruf Mollah
Identity: Suspected Drug Dealer, Son of Moslem Mollah of Driverpara under Nawapara Industrial Town
Description: Lt Col Rowshanul Firoz, Commanding Officer of RAB-6 said that Maruf died in a gunfight where two RAB personnel were also wounded. OC Tazul Islam confirmed that a team of the RAB raided the area while 7-8 drug peddlers were dealing with drug at a field at the place around 5.55pm. Gunfight ensued as the suspected drug dealers opened fire at the RAB personel and youth was killed. The youth was brought dead to the hospital.

Name: Mohammad Rafique
Identity: Suspected Rohingya Drug Peddler; resident of Kutupalang Rohingya Camp
Description: It was alleged that the victims were involved in a Yaba trade. Acting on a tip-off poice raided and detained the victims. Police took them to look for more consigment of drug. As they reached the spot, cohorts of the detainees opened fire on them forcing them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight.

Name: Noor Mohammad
Description: It was alleged that the victims were involved in a Yaba trade. Acting on a tip-off poice raided and detained the victims. Police took them to look for more consigment of drug. As they reached the spot, cohorts of the detainees opened fire on them forcing them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight.

Name: Shawkat Ali
Identity: Alleged Rohingya Drug Peddler; resident in Balukhali Rohingya camp
Description: A police team raided Moragachtola area around 2am to reover a consignment of Yaba. Sensing the law enforcers' presence, the drug peddlers opened fire to which police fired back in self defence. At one stage Shawkat was hit, but his cohorts managed to flee.  Three policemen including ASP Nihad were hurt. He was taken to Ukhia Upazilla Health Complex where he was declared dead by the doctos.

Name: Sazzad Hossain
Identity: Prime accused in a murder-rape case
Description: Villagers caught Sazzad as his name surfaced as rapist and killer of a teenage housewife in a moving auto rickshaw on May 6 following RAB's arrest of the auto rickshaw driver who was another alleged rapist of the housewife. Villagers handed Sazzad to the police and along with Sazzad, police went to Moaranghona area to seize firearms when his cohorts started firing at police who retaliated by firing triggered gunfight where Sazzad was shot and killed on the spot.

Name: Mohammad Babu
Description: Sheikh Tasmim Alam, officer-in-charge of Kotwali police station  reported that Babu, a suspected drug dealer and wanted in at least one dozen of cases, was declared dead at Jashore General Hospital  following a gunfight between police and suspected criminals at Sarapole area under the upazila at about 1:15am. Jashore General Hospitals doctor Mohammad Swapan said that Babu, who was shot in his head, was taken dead at the hospital.

Name: Billal Hossain
Identity: Accused in 16 cases for robbery, mugging and murder
Description: Billal, who had more than 16 cases filed against him, was picked up by Police from Goran area  and the "gunfight" took place when they took him in Shekher Jaiga area to arrest his accomplices around 11:30pm on Thursday.

Name: Abdul Jalil
Identity: Suspected Drug peddler and accused in at least 16 cases
Description: Jalil was killed at Banani, who had 16 cases filed against him previously. According to RAB, the gunfight lasted for 10 minutes when the members seized firing and backed off leaving Jalil behind who was taken to DMCH and declared dead.

Name: Ariful islam
Identity: Alleged Criminal, Son of Nurul Islam of Moheshkhali para
Description: Police raided the local Fishmarket on a tip-off that Ariful and his crew are gathering. Upon sensing police's presence a gunfight was triggered and Ariful was shot. OC Pradip Kumar Das confirmed that Ariful was taken to CoxsBazar Sadar hospital where he was declared dead. He had 6 cases filed against him previously.

Name: Nurul Ansar
Identity: Accused of case of a double murder
Description: Police confirmed that they received a tip that a few armed local terrorists were in the local brickfield. Gunfight was triggered when the police went to retreive the arms. A dead body was recovered after the gunfight and was taken to Health Complex where he was decalared dead.

Name: Mohammad Saker
Identity: Alleged Rohingya Drug Peddler from Balukhali refugee camp
Location: Near River Naff, Nayapara, Teknaf, CoxsBazar
Description: Commanding officer Muhammad Faisal Hasan Khan said that a team of BGB patrol team challenged a group of Rohingyas crossing Naff carrying bags from Myanmar at about 3:00am , the suspects opened fire at BGB members, who retaliated by shooting back, which ensued a gunfight.After the attackers pulled out, BGB members found Saker shot and wounded. They took him to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared him dead, Faisal Hasan added.

Name: Sawkat Hossain
Identity: Youth Wing of AL Leader Naser Murder Accused
Description: Sawkat died within 24 hours of the murder of Nasir, where he was the main accused. OC Abdul Karim confirmed Sawkat was arrested by the police because of the murder case. He was taken on an expedition by the police to recover arms where his confidants started firing at the police to which police retaliated and back fired. Shot and injured Sakwar was taken to health complex where he was declared dead while being treated.

Name: Mohammad Sujan Miah
Description: Suspected criminal, Sujan is accused of murdering his cousin, was killed in a gunfight between his cohorts and police. A team of police raided Bhelangar area to arrest Sujan and his accomplices around 2.30am. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, criminals opened fire on police prompting them to fire back that triggered a gunfight. Sujan caught in line of fire while other managed to flee. Sujan was declared dead at the health complex after being taken rescued by the police. His body was sent to Brahmanbaria Sadar hospital for autopsy.

Name: Kabir
Description: Kabir was from Gazipur, confirmed by Commander Mohiuddin Faruqe. Kabir was accused in atleast 13 cases including drug cases. RAB signalled Kabir to stop his motorcycle at a checkpoint set up in Agargaon Link Road area around 5.30am. Kabir opened fire on them from the moving bike forcing the law enforcers to retaliate. Kabir caught multiple gunshots during the incident and was rushed to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Abu Sufian
Identity: Serial Rapist, Accused of Murder Case
Description: On information that a gorup of terrorists were staying infront of Modhumita rail track, RAB conducted a drive around 12.30am to arrest them. Sensing presence of RAB, terrorists opened fire on the elite force, prompting them to retaliate. Officer claimed Abu died on the spot. Abu's associates managed to escape. It is to be reported that Abu and Niloy took a 7 year old girl behind a brick heap luring her with chocolate and raped her on May 15. When the child lost sense, they strangled her to death.

Name: Hassan
Identity: Alleged Drug Peddler, Son of Late Ruhul Amin
Description: RAB-1 captain Shafi Ullah Bulbul confirmed that they went on a raid acting on a tip-off at Majabosti area. Hassan and his associates started firing at RAB to which they retaliated by firing back. They later recovered the dead body of Hassan who is also accused in 14 cases.

Name: Mohammad Helal Uddin
Identity: Prime accsued in a Gang rape case
Description: Helal was a resident of Pashchim Bhujpur and wanted in several cases. OC Sheikh Mohammad Abdullah confirmed that a group of miscreats led by Helal, picked up two girls while the victims were returning their houses from Kazirhat Bazaar and raped them taking them to a nearby forest of Galachiopartek. A case was lodged in this connection with police and subsecuently arrested. Along with Helal, police went to arrest others but as soon as they reached the spot, Helal's accomplices opened fire on the police promting them to retaliate that triggered a gunfight where he died.

Name: Mohammad Ishaq
Description: Assistant Director (Media) Abdullah Mohammad Sheikh Sadi confirmed that they went to arrest Ishaq after they received a tip-off. Reaching the spot, perpetrators started firing shots at RAB which they retaliated with firing back. Dead body of Ishaqwas recovered from the spot. Body was later sent for autopsy at Coxsbazar zilla sadar Hospital. He had several cases filed against him.
Actions Taken: A case has been filed as of this incident at Teknaf police station

Name: Rubel Hossain Shaon
Identity: Reident of Buinkara, Nawapara, Wanted in three cases
Description: RAB-6 commanding officer Lt Col Rowshanul Firoj said that a RAB team went to the spot as part of its anti-drug drive and was attacked by miscreants which triggered the gunfight at about 3.30pm. He claimed RAB rescued Shaon with bullet injuries and took him Health Complex where the doctos declared him dead.

Name: Kanak Chowhdhury
Description: Kanak's aunt Rokeya Begum alleged that Kanak died in Rajpara Police custody after being taken two days remands in a murder case.She also alleged that it was preplanned murder due to take possession of property. Sub-Inspector Jamal Uddin of Rajpara Police Station refuted that allegation.
Actions Taken: Aunty of victim Rokeya Begum filed a case against 11 person including SI Jamal Uddin as the lead accused and rest are in laws.

Name: Noresh Chandra Dash
Identity: Drug Case Accused, Son of Nimai Chandra Das of Munsipara
Location: Beisde Dr Shahida Chamber, Noagaon Sadar
Description: Diceased's son Poresh confirmed that SI Masud called his father 3 times but Noresh did not answer. Then around evening, 2-3 persons came in the house and took his father. Screams were coming from the place of incident. So someone torched a light at the scream and saw Noresh lying on the floor and SI Masud and others were running towards the police station. He was a previous heart patient and declared dead at the Sadar Hospital. Police confirmed the calls but denied torturing. He had several drug cases filed against him.

Name: Abdur Rahman
Identity: Alleged Rohingya Drug Peddler; A Resident of KutuPalong Rohingya Camp
Description: The victim was killed in a gunfight with BGB when they went on a raid. As soon as they reached the spot, drug peddlers started firing shots at them when they retaliated by firing back. While others managed to flee, Abdur was shot dead at the spot confirmed by Captain Lt Col Ali Haider Azad. Dead body was recovered confirmed by local OC Anwar Hossain.
Actions Taken: A Case is being prepared

Name: Nurul Haque
Identity: Suspected Drug Peddler; Resident of Rajpalon of Ukhia, Cox's Bazar
Description: Company Commander Abdullah Al Mamun confirmed that a checkpost was installed to catch a shipment of Yaba Pills from teknaf to Dhaka. As soon as the truck was going to be checked, they fired shots at RAB member to which they fired back that hit Nurul.

Name: Rubel Islam Shaon
Description: Police station confirmed that victim was accused of several cases filed against him previously. Patrolling team was on patrol in the morning when they were tipped off about a drug peddling. As soon as they reached the spot, they were being fired shots at to which they fired back and retalited to which Rubel was shot. Police rescued Rubel and took him to hospital where he was announced  dead.
Actions Taken: RAB has filed a case as of this incident

Name: Nikhil Talukder
Description: Victim and his friends were playing cards at the spot when source along with his van driver came along the path. Everyone managed to flee except Nikhil who got severly  beaten by the police especially at his knee and head. They broke his spine. He was taken to Barisal Medical College by his relatives after this but had to transfer him to Dhaka Pangu Hospital when his health got worse and died while being treated.
Actions Taken: Perpetrators were produced before court in a murder case and sent to prison 08/06/2020, on a case filed by victims brother on 07/06/2020 confirmed by OC Sheikh Lutfur Rahman.

Name: Mohammad Sharif
Identity: Active Member of Zakir Group of Robbers; A resident of Resident of 26 Camp of Shalbagan
Location: Shalbagan Rohingya Camp, Hnila, Teknaf, CoxsBazar
Description: OC Pradip Kumar confirmed that on information a police team conducted a drive in the area to arrest robbers of Zakir group around 9.30pm, Sensing Police presence, robbers opened fire, forcing police to retaliate. Police found the body of Sharif lying on the ground while rest of the group managed to flee. Victim was rushed to local health complex and then to Coxsbazar Sadar Hospital where the doctors decalred him dead.
Actions Taken: Dead body was sent to morgue for autopsy

Name: Mohammad Shafiqul Islam Shofi
Description: OC Enayet said, two group were involved in a gunfight near East Meghna area. Reaching the spot, pirates started firing at the police and the police fired back. They could not arrest anyone except finding Shafiquls dead body on the floor. Victim's wife claimed that police  took Shafiqul from his residence and shot him dead which ASP Sharker Mohammad Kaysar denied. Victim had several cases filed against him at the local police station.

Name: Delwar Hossain Dukhu
Description: When arrested, Victim informed the police about a drug trade taking place that very night around 12am. Police went on a raid taking him with them. Sensing presence, drug traders started firing at the police for which a gunfight was ensued. Delwar was a victim of this gunfight. He was declared dead by the doctos of local health complex after being taken there.
Actions Taken: Case is being prepared at the police station

Name: Unidentified
Description: RAB Media Wing Assistant Superintendent of Police Mahmudul Hasan Mamun said the incident took place at Boro Takia on Dhaka-Chittagong highway. Gunfight took place between a group of robbers who gathered to commit robbery. Victim was hit by bullet while other criminals managed to escape. He was declared dead after being rushed to Upazilla Health Complex.
Actions Taken: Body was sent to CMCH for autopsy

Name: Mizanur Rahman
Description: Mizan was killed by an alleged gunfight.  Police arrested himbecause of alleged rape. Police took him to Sonakandi to recover illegal arms that Mizan confessed of having in his possession. When law enforcers arrived the area, Mizan's cohorts opened fire on police and wounded Mizan. He was rushed to Noakhali General Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Abdul Mazid
Description: ASP of RAB-7 Mahmudul Hasan Mamun said that the gunfight took place at midnight after a patroling team went there to arrest the accused. Sensing the presence  of the law enforcers, cohorts of the accused opened fire to which RAB retaliated. Mazid was found bullet hit while his cohorts fled the scene. He was rushed to upazilla health complex where he was declared dead.

Name: Abu Hanif
Description: Hanif had at least 8 cases filed against him previously with different charges including drug peddling and robbing. Acting on a tip-off, a team of police raided the area along with Hanif for seizing drugs and arms. During the raid, associates of Abu Hanif opened fire at the law enforcers. When the police retaliated, assailants fled the spot and the police rescued Abu Hanif who sustained gunshot wounds during the gunfight. He was taken to a nearby hospital where attending doctors declared him dead.

Name: Hedayet Ullah Badsha
Description: Senior Assistant Director Sohel Mahmud confirmed that their team went to the area on information that a consignment of yaba was being smuggled there.They spotted five youths getting up from the sea and asked them to stop. Sensing RAB presence, youths opened fire, forcing law enforcers to retaliate. A body was found lying around after the gunfight. Body and evidences were later handed over to the police.

Name: Abdus Subhan
Description: SP Sheikh Rafiqul Islam confirmed that their team went to near a graveyard as a part of their anti-drug drive at about 2.30am and was attacked by a group of miscreants which triggered the gunfight. Police rescued Subhan with bullet injuries and took him to Bera Upazilla Health Complex where he succumbed to his injuries at about 4.15am.
Actions Taken: Body was sent to Pabna Medical College Hospital Morgue for autopsy.

Name: Rayhan Sarker
Description: Acting on a tip-off RAB went to a rented flat as Rayhan was present there at the moment. They raided the house and went inside Rayhan's room when Rayhan fired 3 shots at the law enforcers. RAB retaliated by firing shots to which victim died.
Actions Taken: Sent to Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital for autopsy

Name: Jahangir Hossain Pinku
Identity: Suspected Drug Peddler, Wanted in 14 Cases
Description: Senior Assistant Police Super Mohammad Kamruzzaman confirmed that they received a tip-off that suspects were present at TNT Bazar area. RAB raided the area and suspects opened fire at RAB sensing their presence to which RAB retaliated. Pinku was shot while other managed to flee. He was declared dead after he was taken to AhsanUllah Master General Hospital.

Name: Imam Hossain
Description: Police received a tip-off that a Yaba trade-off was going to get smuffled in a vehicle.Police signalled the autorickshaw to stop and seeing this Imran and his friends started firing at the police to which police retaliated back by firing shots. Rest of them (5 persons) managed to flee from the scene while Imam was left lying beside the vehicle. He was later taken to local health complex and then to Cox's Bazar sadar hospital where he was announced dead by the doctor.
Actions Taken: OC Pradip Kumar Dash confirmed that the dead body was sent for autopsy at hospital morgue.

Name: Robiul Islam
Identity: Suspected Drug Peddler, Son of Abdul Jalil
Description: ASP AM Mohaiminur Rashid confirmed that they went on an anti-drug raid to arrest the drug peddlers in the scene.Sensing the presence of RAB members, armed drug peddlers started shooting at RAB to which they retaliated  which hit Robiul where he died on the spot.  Robiull's mother claimed that her other son was killed by law enforcement agencies by the same way.

Name: Mohammad Rasel
Description: When police went on a raid to arrest Rasel, he and his accomplices started firing at police to which police fired back and the gunfight lasted around 20minutes. Police recovered Rasel's dead body from the spot.

Name: Babul Molla
Description: The team of robbers killed the night guard Abdul Mannan by strangling him. A truck carrying a group of robbers reached a shop named B Shariat and Brother on Feni-Noakhali road at Bakerbazar. Soon after they reached, they broke the shop's lock and started to loot on a truck when the night guard started screaming. In the meantime law enforcers reached the spot and a gunfight took place between them. During the gunfight one of the robbers died on the spot while three others received bullet wounds. One died on the way to Daganbhuiyan upaziila health complex while another died on way to Feni 250 bed general hospital. However , no information from the victims' families was reported.

Name: Mohammad Bidyut
Description: The team of robbers killed the night guard Abdul Mannan by strangling him. A truck carrying a group of robbers reached a shop named B Shariat and Brother on Feni-Noakhali road at Bakerbazar. Soon after they reached, they broke the shop's lock and started to loot on a truck when the night guard started screaming. In the meantime law enforcers reached the spot and a gunfight took place between them. During the gunfight one of the robbers died on the spot while three others received bullet wounds. One died on the way to Daganbhuiyan upaziila health complex while another died on way to Feni 250 bed general hospital. However , no information from the victims' families was reported.

Name: Dulal Matobbar
Description: The team of robbers killed the night guard Abdul Mannan by strangling him. A truck carrying a group of robbers reached a shop named B Shariat and Brother on Feni-Noakhali road at Bakerbazar. Soon after they reached, they broke the shop's lock and started to loot on a truck when the night guard started screaming. In the meantime law enforcers reached the spot and a gunfight took place between them. During the gunfight one of the robbers died on the spot while three others received bullet wounds. One died on the way to Daganbhuiyan upaziila health complex while another died on way to Feni 250 bed general hospital. However , no information from the victims' families was reported.
Actions Taken: OC Aslam Sikder confirmed that a case is being filed in this regard. Bodies were sent to morgue for autopsy.

Name: Hamid Hossain
Identity: Suspected Member of Robber Gang 'Hakim Bahini' Rohingya
Description: SI ABM Masud Hossain confirmed a joint team conducted a drive to nab the robbers on information that the members of Hakim robber's gang had taken shelter at Chakmapara of Hoyakong Hilly area at the bordering area. SP said that as they reached the spot robbers began to flee by opening fire at the police to which they retaliated by firing and chasing the robbers. After the gunfight police found the four critically injured ones and took them to a hospital where the on duty doctos declared them dead.

Name: Unidentified
Identity: Suspected Member of Robber Gang 'Hakim Bahini' Rohingya
Description: SI ABM Masud Hossain confirmed a joint team conducted a drive to nab the robbers on information that the members of Hakim robber's gang had taken shelter at Chakmapara of Hoyakong Hilly area at the bordering area. SP said that as they reached the spot robbers began to flee by opening fire at the police to which they retaliated by firing and chasing the robbers. After the gunfight police found the four critically injured ones and took them to a hospital where the on duty doctos declared them dead.

Name: Mohammaed Rafiq
Identity: Suspected Member of Robber Gang 'Hakim Bahini' Rohingya
Description: SI ABM Masud Hossain confirmed a joint team conducted a drive to nab the robbers on information that the members of Hakim robber's gang had taken shelter at Chakmapara of Hoyakong Hilly area at the bordering area. SP said that as they reached the spot robbers began to flee by opening fire at the police to which they retaliated by firing and chasing the robbers. After the gunfight police found the four critically injured ones and took them to a hospital where the on duty doctos declared them dead.

Name: Bashir Ahmed
Description: SI ABM Masud Hossain confirmed a joint team conducted a drive to nab the robbers on information that the members of Hakim robber's gang had taken shelter at Chakmapara of Hoyakong Hilly area at the bordering area. SP said that as they reached the spot robbers began to flee by opening fire at the police to which they retaliated by firing and chasing the robbers. After the gunfight police found the four critically injured ones and took them to a hospital where the on duty doctos declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Somrat Sohel
Identity: Prime Accused of Ruling party Youth Wing leader Mosaddekur Rahman murder case
Description: OC Safiul Kabir said that after arresting Sohel they conducted a drive along with him in Kutub Dighir par area at about 2.30am to seize the knife which was used to kill Mosaddekur. When the police approached the area, a gang of drug peddlers opened fire on police from their hideout, forcing them to fire back that triggered the skirmish. Sohel received bullet injuries and died on the spot.

Name: Habibur Rahman
Description: The RAB team was conducting a drive in Satkhira range of west Sundarbans. Three of the alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight..

Name: Shariful islam
Description: The RAB team was conducting a drive in Satkhira range of west Sundarbans. Three of the alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight..

Name: Unidentified
Description: The RAB team was conducting a drive in Satkhira range of west Sundarbans. Three of the alleged robbers were killed in a gunfight..

Name: Abul Kashem
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf police station said that a police team raided the area around 12.30am on secret information. A group of suspected drug peddlers opened fire on the team that triggered the gunfight. Abul Kashem sustained bullet injuries while his cohorts managed to escape from the spot. Later, he was taken to Teknaf Upazilla Health Complex where on-duty doctor declared him dead. The police also seized 10,000 pieces of Yaba Pills, a locally made gun and six cartridges from Kashem's possesion, said Pradip.

Name: Billal Hossain
Identity: Local Youth Related to AL Politics
Description: Due to an ongoing feud for a long time in the locality, a confrontation between the two groups emerged. Police fired rubber bullets to stop the conflict in which Billal died. Billal had rubber bullet marks on his body.

Name: Mosharrof
Description: Deceased were allegedly members of a ring who used to mug people in the guise of taxi drivers and passengers. Khilkhet inspector for investigation Aminul Islam said that the gunfight took place between the police and alleged muggers around 2.30 am early in the morning at 300ft area. On information that a ring in auto rickshaw was mugging in the Khilkhet area,police team signalled a speeding auto-rickshaw to stop near Shewra bus stand area, but it refused to slow down. Police team chased the auto-rickshaw and informed another team ahead who put a barricade on the road. Suddenly, two men jumped out of the rickshaw and opened fire at the chasing police, trying to make their way to a nearby waterbody, claimed Mashiur. police also retaliated with firing, leaving two hit with bullets. They were rushed to Dhaka Medical College where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Nannu
Description: Deceased were allegedly members of a ring who used to mug people in the guise of taxi drivers and passengers. Khilkhet inspector for investigation Aminul Islam said that the gunfight took place between the police and alleged muggers around 2.30 am early in the morning at 300ft area. On information that a ring in auto rickshaw was mugging in the Khilkhet area,police team signalled a speeding auto-rickshaw to stop near Shewra bus stand area, but it refused to slow down. Police team chased the auto-rickshaw and informed another team ahead who put a barricade on the road. Suddenly, two men jumped out of the rickshaw and opened fire at the chasing police, trying to make their way to a nearby waterbody, claimed Mashiur. police also retaliated with firing, leaving two hit with bullets. They were rushed to Dhaka Medical College where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Yasin
Identity: Alleged Drug Peddler; Resident of Balukhali Rohingya Camp
Location: Bank of River Naf, Howabrong point, Hinllah Union, Teknaf, CoxsBazar
Description: Deputy Commander of BGB-2, Major Rubayat Kabir told New Age that a BGB patrol team on the coast around 2.30 am that three people were swimming. Suspecting them as Yaba smuggler, BGB members attempted to detain them for interrogation . But they opened fire at the BGB men, forcing them to fire back resulting in a gunfight. Gunfight lasted for four to five minutes and BGB members recovered two bullet-hit youths. Rushed to CoxsBazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Alam
Identity: Alleged Drug Peddler, Resident of Kutupalong refugee camp
Location: Bank of River Naf, Howabrong point, Hinllah Union, Teknaf, CoxsBazar
Description: Deputy Commander of BGB-2, Major Rubayat Kabir told New Age that a BGB patrol team on the coast around 2.30 am that three people were swimming. Suspecting them as Yaba smuggler, BGB members attempted to detain them for interrogation . But they opened fire at the BGB men, forcing them to fire back resulting in a gunfight. Gunfight lasted for four to five minutes and BGB members recovered two bullet-hit youths. Rushed to CoxsBazar Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Abdul Jalil
Location: Whykong West, Maheshkhalia Para, Teknaf, CoxsBazar
Description: SubInspector Moinuddin said that both of them were shot and killed during a gunfight with the cops. The gunfight ensued when the suspects opened fire on police who went there to conduct an anti-drug drive. When the attackers retreated and the gunfight ended, they were taken to Teknaf Upazilla Health Complex, but the doctos reffered them to CoxsBazar Sadar Hospital for better treatement but upon arrival the doctors decalared them dead. The bodies were sent to the morgue of CoxsBazar Sadar Hospital for autopsy. Saddam's father Sultan ahmed was also killed in a gunfight with law enforcement agencies two years back.

Name: Saddam Hossain
Location: Whykong West, Maheshkhalia Para, Teknaf, CoxsBazar
Description: SubInspector Moinuddin said that both of them were shot and killed during a gunfight with the cops. The gunfight ensued when the suspects opened fire on police who went there to conduct an anti-drug drive. When the attackers retreated and the gunfight ended, they were taken to Teknaf Upazilla Health Complex, but the doctos reffered them to CoxsBazar Sadar Hospital for better treatement but upon arrival the doctors decalared them dead. The bodies were sent to the morgue of CoxsBazar Sadar Hospital for autopsy. Saddam's father Sultan ahmed was also killed in a gunfight with law enforcement agencies two years back.

Name: Jashim Uddin Raju
Identity: Accused in Child Murder Case & previously in 2008 & 2014- Khorshed Murder Case and Police Murder Case
Location: Dobar Par, Jharna Para Jor, Dobolmuring, Chittagong
Description: The gunfight ensued when police went on a raid to arrest him but his cohorts started firing and the police to which the police retaliated by firing back. Jashim was found lying on the ground after the gunfight ended. He was taken to Chittagong Medical College Hospital where he was declared dead.

Name: Hamid
Identity: Suspected Drug Peddler; Resident of Balukhali refugee camp
Description: Commander Ali Haider Azad Ahmed conducted the raid. Being tipped-off, they went on a raid when the victims started to open fire to which BGB men retaliated by opening fire as well killing three of the people. They are said to be yaba traders.

Name: Nazir Hossain
Identity: Suspected Drug Peddler; Resident of Kutupalong Rohingya Camp
Description: Commander Ali Haider Azad Ahmed conducted the raid. Being tipped-off, they went on a raid when the victims started to open fire to which BGB men retaliated by opening fire as well killing three of the people. They are said to be yaba traders.

Name: Nur Alam
Identity: Suspected Drug Peddler; Resident of  Konarpara refugee camp
Description: Commander Ali Haider Azad Ahmed conducted the raid. Being tipped-off, they went on a raid when the victims started to open fire to which BGB men retaliated by opening fire as well killing three of the people. They are said to be yaba traders.

Name: Tanjib Hossain
Identity: Accused in Several cases of Drug Pedlding, Extortion and Arms Dealer
Description: Tanjib was arrested from Library Bazar and later on after extracting information, police took him to Banglabazar to recover weapon at around 2.30am. When the police reached the Shibarampur Embankment's Battala area, his accomplices started firing at the police to snatch him and police also retaliated by firing back. At one stage Tanjib sustained bullet injuries and his associates fled from the scene, the SP said adding that they took him to Pabna General Hospital where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Afsor Ali
Identity: Rickshaw Driver, Son of Mohsin Ali
Description: The victim was taken into remand by police. Victim's wife said  police murdered her husband. She  added that he was beaten infront of  his wife being handcuffed.  Addtional Police Super Mahbub Alam Khan said he committed suicide inside the police station while Ward coucillor vouched for Afsor saying he was an honest and hardworking man.

Name: Akram
Identity: Alleged Rapist, Son of Abdul Gafur
Description: Acting on a tip-off, a team of police raided the area to arrest Akram. Sensing their presence, Akram and his accomplices opened fire on the team, forcing them to retaliate. After the gunfight was over, police found bullet-hit Akram while other manged to escape, confirmed by the Officer in Charge. Akram was sent to Noakhali General Hospital where on-duty doctors pronounced him dead.

Name: Syed Alam
Description: In information that a large consignment of yaba pills would be smuggled into Bangladesh from Myanmar, a BGB team took position around the area. Lt Col Foysal Hasan Khan confirmed that the team noticed two men roaming the area and another crossing the Naf river into Bangladesh from Myanmar. Seeing this, the troops asked the three to stop but they opened fire, defying the instruction, injuring two of the BGB members. In self defence, the BGB men retaliated triggered the gunfight. After the gun battle the BGB team found a man with bullet wounds. The injured was taken to Teknaf Upazilla health Complex that referred him to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital. He was declared dead after being taken to the hospital.

Name: Mohammad Bahar Uddin
Location: Shurjamukhi Ghat, Shunner Char, Burichar, Hatia
Description: Deceased was a  resident of Burichar Union under Hatia. Additional Superintendent of Police Jashim Uddin Chowdhury of RAB said that they also arrested four associates of Bahar from the spot after the gunfight, namely Mohammad Yusuf (35), Alauddin (40), Mohammad Murad (30) and Mohammad Sheikh (20). Tipped off that Bahar and his gang were preparing for a robbery at Shurjamukhi Ghat area. Sensing the presence of the law enforcers, members of the Bahar gang opened fire, promting RAB to fire back in self defence. Bahar was killed at one point during the gunfight.

Name: Azidul Haque
Identity: Suspected drug peddler, son of Abdul Haque of Chandanize upazilla
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off that a yaba consignment from Myanmar would arrive, police conducted a raid around the area at 2am. As the police team reached the village, drug peddlers fired at them triggering a gunfight that lasted for five minutes. Most of the peddlers managed to flee the spot. Police then rescued the two brothers who sustained bullet injuries and rushed them to Teknaf Health Complex, where doctors decelared them dead, the law enforcer claimed. Teknaf police sent those bodies to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy.

Name: Aminul Islam alias Faruk
Identity: Suspected drug peddler, son of Abdul Haque of Chandanize upazilla
Description: Pradip Kumar Das, Officer-in-Charge of Teknaf Police Station, said that acting on a tip-off that a yaba consignment from Myanmar would arrive, police conducted a raid around the area at 2am. As the police team reached the village, drug peddlers fired at them triggering a gunfight that lasted for five minutes. Most of the peddlers managed to flee the spot. Police then rescued the two brothers who sustained bullet injuries and rushed them to Teknaf Health Complex, where doctors decelared them dead, the law enforcer claimed. Teknaf police sent those bodies to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital morgue for autopsy.
Actions Taken: A case has been filed with teknaf police station in this connection.

Name: Unidentified
Description: The gunfight took place around 3am when a team of Mohammadpur Police went to apprehend a criminal, said the police station sub-inspector Sajedul Islam. Sensing police presence, the criminal gang opened fire at police who were forced to retaliate in self-defence. SI Sajedul prepared the FIR of the incident where he said a man sustained bullet injuries and other criminal fled the scene leaving him. He was later rushed to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mizan
Identity: Drug Peddler, Son of Gola Mawla Bablu of Paschim Tekpara in 4No ward of coxsbazar municipality
Description: Officer in charge of CoxsBazar Model Police Station Abu Mohammad Shahjahan Kabir said that a case was filed in connection with Yaba looting. Mizan was the prime accused and was in hiding. Benapole immigration police arrested Mizan on 17/07/2020 and handed him over to CoxsBazar police. Following Mizan's information, a team of police conducted a drive in the bridge area in the morning and as soon as the team approached the area, Mizan's associates attacked the the police and opened fire forcing them to retaliate, triggering a gunfight. Police rescued Mizan's bullet hit body and took him to the hospital but the the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mamun Mia
Identity: Suspected killer of Brahmanbaria Sadar Model Police Station Assistant Sub-Inspector Amir Hossain.
Description: Mamun had four cases filed against him for murder, robbery and arms carrying. Chandan Debnath, Assistant Director of RAB-14, said the, on secret informationa team of RAB raided the area to arrest Mamun but Mamun opened fire on RAB members who fired back that triggered a gunfight. Mamun was shot dead on the spot.

Name: Mohammad Rajib alias Koshain Rajib
Identity: Suspected Drug Peddler, Accused in 25 cases including arms dealing
Description: Adittional Deputy Commissioner Shahidur Rahman said that acting on a tip-off, a DB team conducted a raid at 2.35am. As the DB team reached the area, suspected drug peddlers oepned fire on them who retaliated by shooting back. As the attackers retreated, DB police found Rajib shot and wounded. He was taken to DMCH where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Ekhlas Uddin
Description: RAB officials said the the deceesead was involved in drug dealing and died during a gunfight but victim's relative however claim that Ekhlas was picked up from Narayanganj on 04/07/2020 and killed in a staged gunfight.  RAB officials refuted the allegation.

Name: Ripon Howlader
Identity: Alleged Drug Peddler, Accused in 16 cases
Description: Senior Assistant Superintendent of Police MD Salauddin said on a tip-off about drug dealings, a team of RAB conducted a drive and as soon as they reached the spot, the drug traders opened fire forcing RAB members to retaliate intitiating a gunfight. Ripon succumbed to his injuries after he was rushed to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital.

Name: Al Amin alias Guru Rabbi
Location: Eucaluptus Garden on Nishindara Chakorpara Zahid Metal near Nurani Junction, Bagura Sadar
Description: Inspector (Investigation) of Bagura Sadar Police Station said that they went to the spot after receiving information of gunfight between two armed gangs. Sensing police presence, the gang fled the scene and police rescued Rabbi's bullet-ridedled body and took him to Bagura Shaheed Ziaur Rahman Medical College and Hospital where the duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Rasid Ullah
Identity: Suspected Robber, Son of Safique Ullah; Resident of Ledha Rohingya Camp of Hinlha Union
Description: Biman Chandra Karmakar, Assistant police super and operation commander of RAB that a team of Battalion was waiting about 2.30am that a robber gang was preparing for robbery. RAB officials said that robber group opened fire at RAB members once they surroounded the gang. RAB members opened fire in counter for their safety. Robbers stopped firing a few minutes later and rescued one bullet hit person from the spot. He was sent to Teknaf Hospital for treatment but duty doctors declared hat the person died earlier..

Name: Mohammad Belal Hossain Dofadar
Identity: CNG Run Auto-rickshaw Driver from Patuakhali
Description: Deputy Police Commission (North) Ashikur Rahman said that the deceased was acused in 10 cases filed over rape and molestation. He added that the gunfight took place at Shanti Nagar Samabay Resident area when police went there to arrest the culprit. Sensing the presence of police his cohorts oepned fire and police retaliated, triggering a gunfight. Police found his bullet-hit body on the spot after the gunfight and recovered a gun and 500 yaba pills.

Name: Ibrahim Khalil
Description: Assistant Superintendent of police Kamruzzaman said that the incident took place at about 2.30am when a team of RAB made a check-post on a tip-off suspecting a huge drug trade. In the meantime about 2.15am a motorbike came and RAB signalled it to stop, but the rider did not. The rider oepned fire at the officials and RAB also fired back in self defence, resulting in a gunfight. After the gunfight Ibrahim Khalil found dead.

Name: Mohammad Taher
Identity: Alleged Drug Trader, Rohingya Refugee; Resident of Kutupalang Refugee Camp
Description: Officer in Charge Prodeep Kumar Das said that a team of police arrested one Mohammad Yunus with 10,000 yaba tablets. Based on his statement they later arrested Boktear and Taher from their respective houses on the same night. At one point, the cohorts started firing at the police and the law enforcers retaliated triggering a gunfight. Their bullet riddled body was later taken to Teknaf Hospital where duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Boktear Uddin
Identity: Alleged Drug Trader, Boktear- Member of Rajapalong Union Parishad; Member of Rajapalong Union Parishad
Description: Officer in Charge Prodeep Kumar Das said that a team of police arrested one Mohammad Yunus with 10,000 yaba tablets. Based on his statement they later arrested Boktear and Taher from their respective houses on the same night. At one point, the cohorts started firing at the police and the law enforcers retaliated triggering a gunfight. Their bullet riddled body was later taken to Teknaf Hospital where duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Kudrat Ali Mondol
Identity: Suspected Drug Peddler, Son of Niyamot Ali Mondol, Resident of Ramakrishnapur Union
Description: Officer in Charge of Daulatpur Police Station SM Arifur Rahman said that acting on a tip-off, a team conducted a drive in the area while a gang of drug peddlers was sellings drugs at 1am. Sensing the presence of the police, the drug peddlers opened fire on the law enforcers forcing them to fire back that triggered the gunfight. After the gunfight, police recovered bullet-hit Kudrat while his associates managed to flee the scene. They took him to Daulatpur Upazilla Health Complex where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Sher Ali
Description: Assistant Director (Media) Mohammad Mahmudul Hasan Mamun said that Sher was a notorious robber. Tipped off, RAB conducted a drive while a group of pirates were preparing for robbery. Sensing presence of the law enforcers, they opened fire forcing the RAB to retaliate which triggered the gunfight. RAB recovered the bullet hit dead body of Ali, along with three arms from the spot.

Name: Mohammad Abdus Salam
Identity: Drug Smuggler; Resident of Block H of Balukhali Rohingya Camp
Location: Mochoni Lobon Math, Ukhiya, Teknaf, CoxsBazar
Description: A BGB patrol team took position on receiving information that a large consignment of yaba will enter Bangladesh through the Naaf River, said Lt Col of BGB-2 Battalion Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan. Soon they saw two or three persons swimming ashore and they were asked to surrender. Drug peddlers opened fire at them and the gunfight ensued when the BGB men retaliated in self-defence. At one stage, drug traders fled the scene leaving behind bullet-hit Ferdous and Salam. Duo were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex and then to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where the doctors declared them dead.

Name: Mohammad Ferous
Identity: Drug Smuggler; Resident of Block H of Balukhali Rohingya Camp
Location: Mochoni Lobon Math, Ukhiya, Teknaf, CoxsBazar
Description: A BGB patrol team took position on receiving information that a large consignment of yaba will enter Bangladesh through the Naaf River, said Lt Col of BGB-2 Battalion Mohammad Faisal Hasan Khan. Soon they saw two or three persons swimming ashore and they were asked to surrender. Drug peddlers opened fire at them and the gunfight ensued when the BGB men retaliated in self-defence. At one stage, drug traders fled the scene leaving behind bullet-hit Ferdous and Salam. Duo were taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex and then to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where the doctors declared them dead.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Lt Commander Abdullah Al Mamun confirmed that they went on raid around the area. As soon as they reached the spot, miscreants opened fire to which they fired back at around 2.30am. 2 were hit by the bullets while others fled.T

Name: Unidentified
