Description: Lt Commander Abdullah Al Mamun confirmed that they went on raid around the area. As soon as they reached the spot, miscreants opened fire to which they fired back at around 2.30am. 2 were hit by the bullets while others fled.T

Name: Mohammad Anwar
Description: On information, a police team rushed to Nayapara where two groups of drug peddlers were involved in a gunfight over yaba trade around 4am said Pradip Kumar Das, Officer in Charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the law enforcers presence, the criminals opened fire to flee the spot while the police fired back in self defence and found four of them lying on the spot. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.
Actions Taken: Police filed 3 cases in connection with this incident. OC Pradip said the peddlers smuggled in the drugs from Myanmar

Name: Mohammad Ismail
Description: On information, a police team rushed to Nayapara where two groups of drug peddlers were involved in a gunfight over yaba trade around 4am said Pradip Kumar Das, Officer in Charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the law enforcers presence, the criminals opened fire to flee the spot while the police fired back in self defence and found four of them lying on the spot. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.
Actions Taken: Police filed 3 cases in connection with this incident. OC Pradip said the peddlers smuggled in the drugs from Myanmar

Name: Anwar Hossain
Description: On information, a police team rushed to Nayapara where two groups of drug peddlers were involved in a gunfight over yaba trade around 4am said Pradip Kumar Das, Officer in Charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the law enforcers presence, the criminals opened fire to flee the spot while the police fired back in self defence and found four of them lying on the spot. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.
Actions Taken: Police filed 3 cases in connection with this incident. OC Pradip said the peddlers smuggled in the drugs from Myanmar

Name: Nasir Uddin
Description: On information, a police team rushed to Nayapara where two groups of drug peddlers were involved in a gunfight over yaba trade around 4am said Pradip Kumar Das, Officer in Charge of Teknaf Police Station. Sensing the law enforcers presence, the criminals opened fire to flee the spot while the police fired back in self defence and found four of them lying on the spot. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.
Actions Taken: Police filed 3 cases in connection with this incident. OC Pradip said the peddlers smuggled in the drugs from Myanmar

Name: Shah Alam
Description: Officer in Charge Mohammad Alamgir Hossain confirmed that they arrested Alam and went on a raid with him to find the supplies of yaba. As soon as they reached the spot, other drug peddlers were waiting for the police to come and fired as soon as they did. Police fired back in self defence which led to the killing of Alam. He died while being taken to the hospital.

Name: Mohammad Badrul Mia
Description: A press release issued by BGB public relations officer Md Shariful Islam said that a team of BGB personnel of Alinagar border outpost seized eight sacks of Nasir brand of Indian bidi, smuggled into Bangladesh, at about 4:15am. It said that a group of 30 to 40 suspected smugglers, armed with sharp weapons and sticks, attacked the BGB personnel on way to BOP, and snatched two sacks of the seized bidi. Though the BGB personnel warned the attackers, the attackers went violent and tried to snatch the remaining bidi forcing the BGB men to open fire in the air, the release said. It claimed that the suspected smugglers then tried to snatch the BGB personnels firearms when the BGB personnel, to save their lives and government properties, opened a fire that killed Badrul.

Name: Mohammad Mohsin
Description: Operation Officer Ziaur Rahman said that a team of RAB, on secret information, raided Eastern Housing area and sensing the presence of law enforcers, Mohsin opened fire on them forcing RAB to retaliate by firing that triggered a gunfight at about 2.45am. He added that they found critically injured Mohsin and took him to a hospital where on duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Mohammad Hasan
Description: Police conducted a drive in the area around 2:30am. But sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire. Police retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". After the "gun battle", police found the three bullet-hit bodies lying on the spot, he added.  On the other hand Zafar's family claims Zafor was picked from his resident at Vaiyar Dighir Par, Kochua when police officer-in-charge Habibur Rahman and SI Aminul Islam. After taking Zafor, the police officers called Zafor's wife and asked for a ransom of 50 Lakh bdt saying that Zafar is a drug dealer and he will be put under the list of crossfire if the family does not comply. This incident took place on 29/07/2020 and 2 days after this incident, a police officer called the UP chairman and confirmed the death of Zafar by crossfire. The family of the victim found the dead body at CoxsBazar Medical College Morgue.

Name: Mohammad Zafar
Description: Police conducted a drive in the area around 2:30am. But sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire. Police retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". After the "gun battle", police found the three bullet-hit bodies lying on the spot, he added.  On the other hand Zafar's family claims Zafor was picked from his resident at Vaiyar Dighir Par, Kochua when police officer-in-charge Habibur Rahman and SI Aminul Islam. After taking Zafor, the police officers called Zafor's wife and asked for a ransom of 50 Lakh bdt saying that Zafar is a drug dealer and he will be put under the list of crossfire if the family does not comply. This incident took place on 29/07/2020 and 2 days after this incident, a police officer called the UP chairman and confirmed the death of Zafar by crossfire. The family of the victim found the dead body at CoxsBazar Medical College Morgue.

Name: Jahir Ahmed
Description: Police conducted a drive in the area around 2:30am. But sensing their presence, the criminals opened fire. Police retaliated, triggering the "gunfight". After the "gun battle", police found the three bullet-hit bodies lying on the spot, he added.  On the other hand Zafar's family claims Zafor was picked from his resident at Vaiyar Dighir Par, Kochua when police officer-in-charge Habibur Rahman and SI Aminul Islam. After taking Zafor, the police officers called Zafor's wife and asked for a ransom of 50 Lakh bdt saying that Zafar is a drug dealer and he will be put under the list of crossfire if the family does not comply. This incident took place on 29/07/2020 and 2 days after this incident, a police officer called the UP chairman and confirmed the death of Zafar by crossfire. The family of the victim found the dead body at CoxsBazar Medical College Morgue.

Name: Mostofa Kamal alias Mina Kamal
Identity: Alleged Drug DealerFormer Chairman of Naihati UP
Description: Lt Col Raushanul Firoz, a commander, said they went to Babu Bari area near Rampal Thermal Power Plant on information that a secret meeting of drug dealers was going on there. Sensing the presence of RAB members, criminals opened fire and RAB members retaliated, triggering the 'gun battle', adding that at one stage, Mostofa was caught in line of fire while others fled. He was taken to Jhanjhania Hospital in Rampal where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Rashed Mohammad Sinha
Description: Killed in police firing at a check post, said the sources at Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where he was declared dead. Cox's Bazar Superintendent of Police ABM Masud  Hossain told New Age that police personnel at the checkpoint stopped a private car and a man locked in an altercation with them. At one stage, the man showed his firearm and attempted to open fire at the police personnel at about 10.30pm. The police personnel in self defence, retaliated and later took the injured man to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital where duty doctors declared the victim dead. The SP claimed that they later had come to know that the man was a retired army official. He said that they also arrested two other people but declined to give their identity. Cox'sBazar Deputy Commissioner Kamal Hossain said that an inquiry committee was formed with a Deputy Secretary as its head and one each representative from the Bangladesh Army and the Police to probe the incident.
Follow-up: Investigators have found the murder to be pre-planned and RAB pressed charges against 15 people.
Actions Taken: A total of 14 peoplw ere arrested between August and September in this case.

Name: Abdul Mannan Munna
Description: Officer in Charge of Jakiganj Police Station, Mir Mohammad Abdun Naser said that they arrested Mannan and extracted information that he had yaba pills and firearms at his home. The OC claimed that they started for his home from the police station and on the way his accomplices opened fire on the police team prompting them to fire back in retaliation. Police said they later rescued Mannan and took him to Jokiganj Health Complex where on-duty doctors declared him dead.

Name: Anowar Hossain
Identity: Drug Dealer under UP Member of 8No Ward- Tajuddin
Description: Victim was picked up from his residence on 02/08/2020 and the next day he was  killed by police.  Police later on held a press conference saying that Anowar was arrested and taken on a anti-drug drive to revive the drugs where upon reaching the spot, his confidants started firing shots which hit Anowar and to which he died as well.
Follow-up: Victims mother filed a written complaint against the police and administrative officers, IGP and Human Rights Organisations and Home Ministry.

Name: Mohammad Akram
Description: Family of the victim has accused RAB members of torturing him to death in custody. RAB however, refuted the allegation and claimed that the man was a mugger and he had been beaten up by a mod during a mugging attempt. But witnesses say that he was not beaten up by a mob. The documents of the unnatural death case, filed by RAB, also doesn't mention anything about mob beating. Seeking anonimity, a top official of the Chittagong Metropolitan Police (CMP) said they have no information on any incident of mob beating in Muradpur area. Akram's family said he was never involved in any criminal activities. After Akram's arrest and on Akram's information, RAB took him with them and conducted drives in different areas of the city. At one stage in Shershah Area, Akram fell sick and complained of chest pain. He was admitted to CMCH's medicine Ward where he died. Police declined to disclose contents of the inquest report.
Follow-up: Autopsy report mentions injury marks on the left buttock, left thigh and foot. Similar bruises on the right buttock. Considering post-mortem report, in the doctors opinion, the death was due to combined effect of hemorrhagic and neurogenic shock as a result of massive blunt force trauma (bruises) which were ante mortem in nature.

Name: Raja Fakir
Description: Raja's family alleged that police tortured him to death while PBI turned down the allegation. PBI said Raja has been on the run since he was accused of murder and was arrested at one of his relative's house in Patuakhali, brought to Bagerhat. Raja's father Babu Fakir said that PBI officer tortured his son to death. After death, police took the body to the hospital and did not allow family members to have a look at the body. However PBI turned down the allegations.

Name: Masud Rana
Identity: Steel Mill Worker & Father of 2 daughters
Description: Victim's wife complains that her husband died in custody due to torture. Dead body has been sent to DMCH for autopsy. Masud went to work at 8 am  as usual and had a conversation over the phone with his wife at 10am but no contact has been made between them after that time. At 10 pm, Masud's younger brother Saiful confirmed that his brother has been picked up by the police. After 1am, a call from the police station confirmed that Masud is feeling sick in the police station. The wife went to the police station and confirmed that Masud died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. Rehana, the wife also confirmed that there is a video footage available that police and Masud were scuffling and hurt his head on the wall. Police tried to influence and threaten Rehana  not to file a case in this matter as she has two daughters to feed.

Name: Rayhan Ahmed
Description: Rayhan's family members sad that he died in police custody and further alleged that the law enforcers had demanded Tk 10,000 for his release. Jyotirmoy Sarkar, Additional Deputy Commissioner (media) of Sylhet Metropolitan Police said that the matter is complicated and they are investigating into it. Rayhan had left his home around 10:00pm  and after a while his mobile was found switched off,said his  his cousin Tanvir Ahmed.It is to be reported  "Around 4:23am, Rayhan called his mother from an unknown number and told her that police had picked him up and were holding him at Bandarbazar Police Outpost. He asked to send someone with Tk 4,000 so that police will free him," his cousin said. "Hearing that, Rayhan's stepfather went to the police outpost with the money. There a policeman in civil uniform told him that Rayhan was injured in an accident and was sleeping at the time, and asked him to come again around 10:00am with Tk 10,000," Tanvir said. "Uncle then went to the police outpost around 10:00am when policemen at the outpost told him to go to Sylhet MAG Osmani Medical College Hospital, as Rayhan was admitted there since his condition had deteriorated," he also said. "Reaching the hospital, he came to know that Rayhan died and the police members on duty there told him that Rayhan was beaten by a mob." Rayhan's stepfather Habib Ullah echoed the same and said, "We believe that Rayhan was tortured to death at the police outpost."
Actions Taken: 4 police officers has been suspended. Officer in Charge Akbor has been arrested after a month of the incident.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Both of the victims died in gunfight with the Army. Locals and police confirmed gunfight took place at Rouf tilla and after an hour of exchange of bullets, 2 dead bodies along with an AK-22 rifle was recovered from the spot.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Both of the victims died in gunfight with the Army. Locals and police confirmed gunfight took place at Rouf tilla and after an hour of exchange of bullets, 2 dead bodies along with an AK-22 rifle was recovered from the spot.

Name: Mohammad Adham
Description: The gunfight took place near the 35No Pillar. 34 BGB Captain Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed confirmed that they took position getting tipped off about a yaba consignment coming from Myanmar. When the BGB saw 10-12 men coming from Myanmar, BGB challenged them to which they retaliated by firing shots and the patrol team shot back in self defence. Adham was shot and injured and rescued by the BGB to the upzailla health complex, later declared dead.

Name: Hazrat Matubbar
Description: Matubbar was beaten inside the prison and died while being treated at the Zilla sadar Hospital. He was accused in two cases and on 27.09.2020 he was ordered to be sent to prison by the court. Wife of Matubbar complained that the police killed him.

Name: Syed Alam
Description: A suspected yaba trader was killed in a so-called gunfight with BGB. The identity of the deceased could not be known immediately. Tipped off, a team of BGB-2 challenged a boat carrying three people along suice gate- 1 of Naf river. Sensing danger, the criminals opened fire on BGB men, forcing them to fire back that trigerred a gunfight. At one stage all the criminals jumped into the river to flee. BGB members found a man with bullet injuries and took him to a local hospital where doctors decalred him dead.

Name: Noyon Chakma alias Sajek
Description: Police confirmed that UPDF attacked on a patrol team of Army and they retaliated to which Sajek was shot dead on the spot. Officer in Charge of the local police station confirmed that the gunfight took place between UPDF members and Army. Dead body has been sent to General Hospital for autopsy. UPDF claimed that the killing was premeditated.

Name: Liton Kha
Description: According to Liton's family, Liton had a longstanding land-related dispute with the authorities of a local madrasa. Following the dispute, Madrasa authority recently filed a complaint with the police and upazilla nirbahi officer (UNO) mentioning Liton killed their fishes and constructed house on the Madrasa Land. Liton's brother in law Mofizur Rahman Gazi said the police held Liton around 4pm on the basis of that complaint. Hearing the news he rushed to local police station and saw Liton was sick. Some policemen were taking him to a local health complex. After providing primary treatment, on-duty doctors there sent Liton to Sher-e-Bangla Medical College Hospital in Barishal where he died around 1:00am..Contacted. Liton's wife Mazeda Begum said Liton was completely well when police held him. He fell sick being tortured by police. "I want justice," she said. The victim's father-in-law Matlab Gazi said, "Liton was tortured to death."

Name: Unidentified
Description: Assistant Superintendent of Police Shah Alam of RAB-15, said a team found some people running away while patrolling Baharchhara area. The team chased them. The criminals opened fire. RAB members also fired back, forcing the criminals to flee the scene, he said. After the "gunfight", the RAB members found the bullet-hit body of a man, the official said, adding that he was rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead. The body was kept at Teknaf Police Station.

Name: Nazmul
Description: Police Constable Hasan Ali used to own 8 autorickshaw of which 1 was run by Nazmul. After that rickshaw were stolen, Hasan Ali thought it was stolen by Nazmul so he went to Nazmul's house and tortured him with scissors and hammer. Nazmul was sick after this incident and died.

Name: Khorshed Alam
Description: A man was killed and three police injured in a shoot-out at Teknaf. Officer-in-charge of Teknaf Model Police Station Hafizur Rahman said, Police arrested one fugitive Samsul Alam around 10:30pm. Suddenly, his associates attacked police in Habirchara area and tried to snatch him. At one stage, the criminals opened fire targeting the police, which prompted to retaliate, triggering a gunfight that left some people with bullet injuries, the OC added. Later, we came to know that a youth named Khorshed Alam, brother of Samsul Alam, died on way to hospital, Hafizur Rahman continued. The body was kept at the mortuary of Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital.

Name: Mohammad Abdur Rahim
Identity: Resident of Kutupalong Rohingya Camp- 1; Rohingya
Location: Bashfari Border, Dhumdhum Union, Naikhongchari, Bandarban
Description: 34 BGB Captain Lt Col Ali Haider confirmed that a group of men challenged a BGB team and started firing at them. BGB retaliated and fired shots back at them to which Abdur was shot. Rest of them fled away. Abdur was taken to Ukhiya Health complex where he was pronounced dead.

Name: Rezaul Karim Reza
Identity: Probationary Lawyer of Barisal District Court
Location: Barisal Central Jail, Sher-e-Bangla Medical College Hospital Prison Cell
Description: A probationary lawyer in Barishal district court, arrested by police on December 29, 2020, died at Sher-e-Bangla Medical College Hospital prison cell Saturday night due to excessive bleeding. The deceased was identified as Rezaul Karim Reza, 30, of Abdul Karim Khan Road in Barishal city. The victims family members alleged that Reza died due to torture by police after his arrest on false allegation. Hearing the news of the death, locals staged demonstration in the area and threw brick bats on the house of a cop in the area who allegedly picked up Reza on December 29 night. Rezas father Md Yunus Mia alleged that Detective Branch sub-inspector Mohiuddin, also their neighbour, picked up his son alleging that he was a drug addict and tortured him at DB office. On January 1, he said, they received a phone call from the hospital and the caller told them that his son was admitted to the prison cell as there was excessive bleeding through his urinary system. Barishal Central Jail superintendent Prashanta Kumar Banik said that they received Reza with wounds in his groin and he was sent to SBMCH.

Name: Dil Mohammad
Identity: Rohingya; Resident of Kutupalong Rohingya Camp
Description: Acting on a tip off, a team of BGB-34 Battalion conducted a drive at Garjanbania Chakmapara in Naikkhangchhari upazila, said Yar Hossain, Assistant Director of the Battalion. The BGB personnel confronted a group of "yaba dealers" who opened fire on the border guards, forcing them to retaliate in self-defence, he said. Later, the BGB men found two persons lying on the ground with bullet wounds and took them to Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead. The accomplices of the two, however, escaped.

Name: Mohammad Zobair
Identity: Rohingya; Resident of Kutupalong Rohingya Camp
Description: Acting on a tip off, a team of BGB-34 Battalion conducted a drive at Garjanbania Chakmapara in Naikkhangchhari upazila, said Yar Hossain, Assistant Director of the Battalion. The BGB personnel confronted a group of "yaba dealers" who opened fire on the border guards, forcing them to retaliate in self-defence, he said. Later, the BGB men found two persons lying on the ground with bullet wounds and took them to Sadar Hospital where doctors declared them dead. The accomplices of the two, however, escaped.

Name: Unidentified
Description: A suspected drug peddler was killed in a reported gunfight with Border Guard Bangladesh members at Shah Parir Dwip in Teknaf upazila of Coxs Bazar. BGB 2 commander Lieutenant Colonel Md Faisal Khan said that a BGB team challenged two people in the Naf River at Golarchar point of Shahporir Dwip. They opened fire on the guards forcing them to retaliate in self-defence, triggering a gunfight. At one stage, one of them fell into the river after sustaining bullet wounds while another managed to flee, he said. The body was sent to hospital morgue.

Name: Shafiq Sheikh
Description: A man, who was killed in an alleged gunfight with Rab-10 in Dhaka's Keraniganj was a truck driver that ran over and killed a RAB member in Mymensingh's Bhaluka on February 14. Four days after the so-called gunfight, family members of the deceased identified  the body at the Dhaka Medical College morgue. Shafiq's brother-in-law Manik said Shafiq worked as a technician at the Tongi truck stand and was behind the wheels of the truck that killed the RAB man in Bhaluka. Manik claimed that Shafiq had been missing since the accident on February 14. "Shafiq was not a drug peddler. He had been traceless since the accident." Throughout the rest of the day, RAB officials did not disclose how the man died or who he was. In the evening, they finally spoke and claimed that the deceased was a drug dealer, who was killed in a gunfight with RAB-10 earlier in the day in Keraniganj's Swapnadhara area. The officials did not give any further details of the deceased.

Name: Abdul Hamid
Description: Three Rohingya youths were killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion personnel at Teknaf in Coxs Bazar. RAB said that the youths were involved in robbery, abduction, ransom, human trafficking and Yaba smuggling. RAB-15 Deputy Director Mehedi Hasan said that Jokir was the leader of Jokir Group and he had at least 17 cases filed against him with Teknaf Police Station for robbery, kidnapping, human trafficking and Yaba smuggling in past one and half a year. RAB had information that the group was planning to kidnap a Bangladeshi NGO worker. Based on that information, RAB raided a hill, where Jokir and his accomplices had allegedly took position, near Rohingya camp number 26 in the afternoon. Sensing the presence of RAB members, the suspected robbers opened fire, forcing the RAB team to retaliate, claimed RAB-15 deputy director Mehedi Hasan. After over an hour of gunfight, the group fled the scene and the RAB team found three people shot and killed in the hill, said Mehedi. Earlier this month, at least two Rohingyas were killed in reported gunfights with the Border Guard Bangladesh at Naikhyangchari upazila in Bandarban.

Name: Johir Ahmed
Description: Three Rohingya youths were killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion personnel at Teknaf in Coxs Bazar. RAB said that the youths were involved in robbery, abduction, ransom, human trafficking and Yaba smuggling. RAB-15 Deputy Director Mehedi Hasan said that Jokir was the leader of Jokir Group and he had at least 17 cases filed against him with Teknaf Police Station for robbery, kidnapping, human trafficking and Yaba smuggling in past one and half a year. Description: Three Rohingya youths were killed in a reported gunfight with the Rapid Action Battalion personnel at Teknaf in Coxs Bazar. RAB said that the youths were involved in robbery, abduction, ransom, human trafficking and Yaba smuggling. RAB-15 Deputy Director Mehedi Hasan said that Jokir was the leader of Jokir Group and he had at least 17 cases filed against him with Teknaf Police Station for robbery, kidnapping, human trafficking and Yaba smuggling in past one and half a year. Name: Delowar Hossain
Description: RAB said it seized four lakh pieces of contraband Yaba, one pistol, four bullets and a bullet shell from his possession. Acting on a tip-off, a team of RAB-7 raided the garden in Ramu upazila, said Lieutenant Colonel Mahbubur Rahman, commanding officer of Rapid Action Battalion-RAB, Coxs Bazar. As soon as Delwar and his men spotted RAB near Valley of Hill, they opened fire, forcing RAB to retaliate in self-defence. While Delwar died on the spot, others managed to flee, Mahbubur said. KM Amiruzzaman, officer-in-charge of Ramu police station said, the dead body was sent to Coxs Bazar Sadar hospital morgue for autopsy. No information has been found from the family in this connection.

Name: Kamal Miah
Description: BGB claimed that a group of cattle tradders were coming near 1215 Pillar of Bongao when the BGB patrol team tried to arrest them but the 30-35 people team of  cattle traders attacked on BGB and hit Lans Nayek Tui Hola Mong who was greviously injured and fired back to self defence which hit Kamal. Kamal was then taken to Sunamganj Sadar Hospital and then he died on his way being transferred to Sylhet. .

Name: Mohammad Rubel
Description: Two suspected drug dealers were killed in a reported gunfight with the Border Guard Bangladesh at Teknaf. BGB commander Lieutenant Colonel Faisal Hasan Khan said they had recovered 360,000 Yaba pills and a locally-made firearm from the site. BGB are yet to confirm the identities of the deceased. Khan said one of their teams took position at Nazirpara point. The Yaba traders fired at the BGB team, triggering a skirmish, he said. The bodies were recovered from the site after the gunfight and had been sent to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital for an autopsy.

Name: Younus Alam
Description: Two suspected drug dealers were killed in a reported gunfight with the Border Guard Bangladesh at Teknaf. BGB commander Lieutenant Colonel Faisal Hasan Khan said they had recovered 360,000 Yaba pills and a locally-made firearm from the site. BGB are yet to confirm the identities of the deceased. Khan said one of their teams took position at Nazirpara point. The Yaba traders fired at the BGB team, triggering a skirmish, he said. The bodies were recovered from the site after the gunfight and had been sent to Coxs Bazar Sadar Hospital for an autopsy.

Name: Masud
Description: A man, who sustained bullet wounds when police opened fire during a clash with a group of fishermen in the Meghna river in Matlab North upazila, died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. The clash took place when a team of River Police was conducting a regular drive against jatka netting. Mohammad Kamruzzaman, a member of Chandpur River Police, said while patrolling in the Meghna river they chased a group of fishermen, who were catching jatka. Being chased by the law enforcers, the fishermen threw brick chips on them, prompting the police team to fire shotguns in self-defence, adding that Masud was hit by a bullet in his left thigh. After the clash, police detained bullet-hit Masud and two other fishermen from the spot. Later, Masud was taken to Matlab North Upazila Health Complex, from where he was shifted to DMCH as his condition deteriorated.

Name: Mohammad Ashik
Description: 19 people of Hefazat-e-Islami Bangladesh were killed and over 500 were injured during protests against the recent Bangladesh visit of Narendra Modi, the prime minister of India.

Name: Badal Mia
Description: 19 people of Hefazat-e-Islami Bangladesh were killed and over 500 were injured during protests against the recent Bangladesh visit of Narendra Modi, the prime minister of India.

Name: Rubel Shah
Description: When the police went to arrest him at his residence, it is alleged that he came with sharp weapons to attack the police. Police shot him in self defence. He was greviously injured and taken to a private hospital in Shyamoli where he died while being treated.

Name: Mohammad Jubayer Hossain
Description: Jubayer was shot dead by police during an altercation between the people and police. The altercation started previously in a incident where the police was enforcing around imposition of lockdown.

Name: Rony
Description: Workers of the S Alam group owned coal-based power plant SS Power Plant alleged that police opened fire on them while they were peacefully demonstrating for their five-point demand, including payment of their overdue salary. Police and workers said that the incident took place inside the power plant project area. Seven vehicles -- six cement mixers and a microbus -- were set ablaze during the incident. Besides, a cement godown was torched. Deputy Inspector General (DIG) of Chattogram Range Anwar Hossain said that workers of the coal-based power plant of Gandamara at Banshkhali had been demonstrating over several points of demands. However, a meeting had been held between them and the authority but the agitating workers in the morning started demonstrations and at one point they attacked the plant and on-duty police personnel of the project area.
Follow-up: Shimul Ahmed, 23, from Janahura of Srimangal died at the ICU of CMCH and Rajiur Rahman, 22 of Jamadani, Phulbari, Dinajpur died at the hospital. [21.04.2021 NewAgeBD]

Name: Mohammad Rahad
Description: Workers of the S Alam group owned coal-based power plant SS Power Plant alleged that police opened fire on them while they were peacefully demonstrating for their five-point demand, including payment of their overdue salary. Name: Mohammad Ibrahim
Description: A Rohingya man suspected to be a yaba dealer was killed in a "gunfight" with Border Guard Bangladesh in Bandarban's Naikhongchhari upazila. Mohammad Ibrahim was from Kutupalong Lambashia Rohingya camp in Cox's Bazar Ukhia upazila. Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, commanding officer of BGB-34 Battalion said that the "gunfight" took place in Aambagan area near Baishfari border around 12:30am. A BGB patrol team took position in Aambagan area on information that a consignment of yaba tablets would be smuggled to Bangladesh through the border. When the BGB men challenged a group of five-six people, they opened fire, triggering the "gunfight". At one stage, the criminals fled. Later, the BGB team found a body lying on the spot which was sent to Cox's Bazar Sadar Hospital morgue for an autopsy.

Name: Hamidur Rahman
Description: Hamidur's family had an internal clash between husband and wife where the both of the son took their mother's side and beaten their father to which Hamidur filed a written complaint to the police. Police wanted to fix the family issue but Hamidur denied taking his wife back in the family again. Police being agitated, kicked Hamidur in the gut and punched him in the chest. He was kept detained for a certain period of time but later freed. This incident took place on 25.04.2021. Hamidur's mother claimed that the police took bribe from his wife and beaten Hamidur to death.

Name: Sanaul Haque Biswas
Description: Sanauls' younger brother Masud Rana Biswas said that police arrested Sanaul from in front of Sadar hospital when he went out to buy eggs. Masud said his brother was tortured by police and died due to torture. His brother left behind his wife and four daughters, he said. Masud added that his brother was a drug addict, but was not involved in any drug trading. AHM Abdur Rakib, superintendent of police of the district, said Sanaul was wanted in a narcotics case. The SP denied allegations of torture and said they primarily suspect Sanaul died of a heart attack. After the case, he fled the area. Later, on information, a team of Detective Branch (DB) of police conducted a drive in Chanshikari village. Sensing the presence of DB officials, Sanaul tried to run away but police managed to arrest him. After the arrest, the accused complained of chest pain. Police then took him to Bholahat Upazila Health Complex.

Name: Abul Hossain Molla
Description: Abul was arrested when his name came up in the investigation by the Detective Branch of Police. He was not named in the Ejahar. He was still arrested and remanded for 5 days. He had his pre-fast dinner and went to the toilet. After a while since no sound came out, the door was opened and the guards saw him lying on the floor. He was taken to Faridpur General Hospital quickly where he was announced dead. His family claimed that their loved one died due to police torture at the police station.

Name: Unidentified
Description: Police said that the gunfight took place between the police and a gang of dacoits when a youth was hit by bullet and taken for treatment where the doctors declared him dead. The incident took place near Ratan Khamar, Korergao, Dokkhin Keraniganj. Police sent the dead body to Solimullah Medical College Hospital for autopsy.

Name: Mohammad Rasel
Description: Two alleged muggers were killed in a "gunfight" with Detective Branch of Police in Dhaka's Khilkhet area. When a team of the Detective Branch of Police, along with local police, chased a group of muggers who were on an auto-rickshaw, said Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner of (DB-Gulshan) of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police. Around 2:15am, as law enforcers signalled an auto-rickshaw at a check post to stop, its driver refused and tried to speed his way towards Purbachal area. The DB team then informed another one of their teams ahead who intercepted the auto-rickshaw, he said. Then, two of the muggers came out of the auto-rickshaw and started firing at the law enforcers, who fired back in self-defence, leaving the men bullet hit, claimed the DC. They were rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Enamul
Description: Two alleged muggers were killed in a "gunfight" with Detective Branch of Police in Dhaka's Khilkhet area. When a team of the Detective Branch of Police, along with local police, chased a group of muggers who were on an auto-rickshaw, said Mashiur Rahman, Deputy Commissioner of (DB-Gulshan) of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police. Around 2:15am, as law enforcers signalled an auto-rickshaw at a check post to stop, its driver refused and tried to speed his way towards Purbachal area. The DB team then informed another one of their teams ahead who intercepted the auto-rickshaw, he said. Then, two of the muggers came out of the auto-rickshaw and started firing at the law enforcers, who fired back in self-defence, leaving the men bullet hit, claimed the DC. They were rushed to Dhaka Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared them dead.

Name: Manik
Description: A suspect of Shahin Uddin murder at Pallabi in Dhaka was shot dead during a 'gunfight' between Rapid Action Battalion and a group of thugs at Eastern Housing area of Mirpur in Dhaka. RAB-4 Director Mozammel Haque said that they raided Eastern Housing area on a tip-off about a group of thugs. Sensing RAB presence, the thugs opened fire and RAB personnel retaliate with shooting back. After, the attackers retreated, the personnel found one of the thugs shot and killed. The body was sent to Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital and identified the dead as Manik.

Name: Mohammad Monir Uddin
Identity: 6th Suspect of Shahinuddin Murder at Pallabi
Description: Monir was killed in the gunfight with the zonal branch of Detective Branch of Police who was first greviously hurt in the gunfight and later the doctors declared him dead at the Suhrawardy Medical College Hospital.

Name: Rokon Mia
Description: Assistant Police Superintendent of RAB, Emran Khan, said that a patrol team of RAB, on a tip-off that a group of youths were peddling drugs near the Tongi bridge, went to the spot. Sensing presence of the RAB members, the drug peddlers opened fire targeting them prompting RAB to retaliate by opening fire that triggered a gunfight, the RAB official said. The drug peddler died on the spot after receiving bullet injuries, but his cohorts managed to flee the scene, he added.

Name: Mohammad Shamim
Identity: Suspected Accused of a Child Rape and Murder Case
Description: Iftekhayer Alam, spokesperson of Rajshahi district police said that a group of assailants opened fire on police while a team of law enforcers from Kakonhat police outpost was patrolling at Lalitanagar, forcing the later to retaliate which resulted in a gunfight. After the gunfight, they found Shamim injured while the others managed to flee the spot. Later, he was rushed to Rajshahi Medical College Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Lutfur Rahman alias Lutua
Identity: Alleged robber & drug peddler; son of  Jalal Ahmed of  Nalbania village of Palangkhali Union of Ukhia
Description: Lt. Col Ali Haider, Commander of BGB said that  thery went to Nalbania Shrimp farm to petrol the area. During this time  they gave signal to some suspected persons. However, they fired towards them which caused them to fire back. Then  the suspected persons fled away. After that  they found  bullet wound Lutfor who was taken to hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Hashimullah
Identity: Rohingya robber; son of Bashir Ahmed and lived in C block of  27  number Rohingya camp of  Jadimora of Hnila Union
Location: Number 14 bridge of Teknaf Cox's Bazar  regional road area
Description: According to RAB  Wing Commander  Azim Ahmed , when a group of RAB  from Teknaf camp  reached in  number 14 bridge of Teknaf Cox's Bazar  regional road area, a group of robbers fired towards them , so they fired back, During this time Hashimullah was killed.However no information from victim family/ locals was not reported.

Name: Ashraf Ali
Identity: An accused of a double-murder case
Description: In the predawn hours, the RAB carried out an operation based on their information but the criminals sensing their presence opened fire on them.The RAB claimed that it retaliated in self-defence and later found Ashraf shot and killed.RAB-15 Deputy Commander Tanvir Hasan said that dead Ashraf Ali was an accused of a double-murder case at Rumaliyarchhara area in the district. However no information from victim family/locals was reported.

Name: Karimullah alias Kalimullah
Identity: Alleged Rohingya robber; resident of Lambashia camp under the Ukhiya police station
Description:
He said that RAB members launched a drive in the area being informed that a group of robbers were staying there.
Sensing the presence of the elite force, the robbers opened fire on them, forcing them to retaliate that triggered the gunfight, said the RAB officer. When the gunfight was over, RAB recovered the body of Karim and two firearms from the spot.

Name: Asadul
Identity: Alleged robber; son of Nurul Haq from Dhopaghat
Description:
A Rab team raided Bharoil area acting on information that some robbers were planning to commit a robbery in the area, said Lt Col Abu Nayeem Md Talat, commanding officer of Rab-14.
Sensing the presence of Rab members, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members retaliated, triggering a "gunfight", said the Rab official. After the "gun battle", the RAB members found two bullet-hit persons on the spot and they were taken to Gafargaon Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.
Sources: The Daily Star,  20 July, 2021 ; Manabzamin,  20  July 2021

Name: Sumon Mia
Identity: Alleged robber;  son of  late Jamal Uddin
Description:
A Rab team raided Bharoil area acting on information that some robbers were planning to commit a robbery in the area, said Lt Col Abu Nayeem Md Talat, commanding officer of Rab-14.
Sensing the presence of Rab members, the criminals opened fire. The RAB members retaliated, triggering a "gunfight", said the Rab official. After the "gun battle", the RAB members found two bullet-hit persons on the spot and they were taken to Gafargaon Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead.
Sources: The Daily Star,  20 July, 2021 ; Manabzamin,  20  July 2021

Name: Parvez Ahmed
Location: Satchungipar in Sripur upazila of Gazipur
Description:
The deceased is Parvez Ahmed, ringleader of inter-district robber gang. Tipped off, a team of RAB-1 conducted an anti-narcotics drive in the area at about 1:00am.Sensing the presence of the RAB personnel, Parvez and his two associates opened fire on the RAB men, forcing them to fire back.At one stage, Pervez was caught in the line of fire and died on the spot while the two others managed to flee the scene.
 However, information from family or other source is unknown.

Name: Mohammad Liton
Description: Truck workers obstructed  roads in Bogura and demanded justice of Liton's death. They said under police remand Liton was tortured  and died. However police claimed he committed suicide.

Name: Nurul Alam Nuru
Location: Rohingya camp in Damdamia Nature Park  in Cox's Bazar
Description: Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire at them, who retaliated -- leaving Nuru critically injured, said  Lt Commander Mahbub Hasan, a company commander of Rab-15

Name: Md Kajol
Description: Sitakunda Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC), Abul Kalam Azad said, "Following information on robbery preparations in the middle of the night, a Rab team went to the link road area." "Rab later got into a gunfight with a gang of robbers," said the OC, adding that "after the brief gunfight, Kajol's body was recovered from the spot, along with few firearms and sharp weapons."

Name: Tajul Hossain
Description: Bacchu Mia of DMCH police outpost said that the two youths were admitted to the hospital on 16/08/2021 with bullet wounds. They died at around 10:00 am on 17/08/2021, he added. RAB said that the "gunfight" took place between RAB and a local gang in the Jhilmil residential area of Keraniganj on 16/8/2021 night. While most of the gang members managed to escape, these two youths were found dead and were brought to DMCH by RAB personnel, the sources added. However  Sajeeb's wife said on 23 July 2021 from Abdullahpur Bazar of Keraniganj  RAB picked  him up, Tajul's wife told the same.

Name: Sajeeb Hosaain
Description: Bacchu Mia of DMCH police outpost said that the two youths were admitted to the hospital on 16/08/2021 with bullet wounds. They died at around 10:00 am on 17/08/2021, he added. RAB said that the "gunfight" took place between RAB and a local gang in the Jhilmil residential area of Keraniganj on 16/8/2021 night. While most of the gang members managed to escape, these two youths were found dead and were brought to DMCH by RAB personnel, the sources added. However  Sajeeb's wife said on 23 July 2021 from Abdullahpur Bazar of Keraniganj  RAB picked  him up, Tajul's wife told the same.

Name: Mohammad Shahjahan
Location: Tulatui Jaliler Goda bridge area of Ukhiya Ukhiya, Cox's Bazar
Description: BGB men took position on information that a big consignment of yaba tablets from Myanmar will enter Bangladesh, said Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed, commander of BGB Battalion-34 in Cox's Bazar.When a gang of four to five was entering Bangladesh through the border around 4:00am, the BGB men signalled them to stop. But they opened fire, forcing BGB personnel to retaliate and triggering a "gunfight". Shahjahan was hit, he claimed.Doctors declared him dead after being taken to Ukhiya Upazila Health Complex. However, no other information is reported from family/ locals.

Name: Unidentified
Description: The BGB official said three drug peddlers were crossing the Naf river. Following the "shootout", one of them was declared dead after being taken to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex with bullet wounds, while two others fled to Myanmar.

Name: Jahangir Alam
Description:
The incident took place behind Jaliapalong Forest Beat Office at around 8:30pm.The RAB official said a group of drug dealers started firing at Rab personnel when they were on a drug recovery operation there.
Rab fired back in retaliation and later they found the body of Jahangir on the ground.

Name: Sujan Howlader
Location: Dhosh Union of  Baliatoli of Kalapara of Patuakhali
Description: On  20 September, ASI of the River police on the leadership of ASI Mamunur Rashid, four River Police went to Dhosh and  chased traller of Sujan Howlader. At one point police caught Sujan and beat & kicked him up  caused him to death

Name: Unidentified
Location: Karibunia area of Ratnapalang union under Ukhia , Cox's Bazar
Description:
Lt Col Ali Haider Azad Ahmed,Cox's Bazar BGB-34 Battalion Commander stated"A BGB team took position in Karibunia area after receiving information that a consignment of yaba tablets was being transported to Bangladesh from Myanmar via Ukhia area." "At the time, BGB members saw a group of 4-5 people approaching from Myanmar and ordered them to stop," he said.
"Sensing the presence of BGB, the group split up and started firing at BGB members. In self-defense, BGB members also fired back. At one point, the attackers retreated and fled through the hills towards Myanmar," he said.
Later, BGB members searched the spot and found an unidentified person lying on the ground with a bullet wound. When he was taken to Ukhia Upazila Health Complex, the doctor on-duty declared him dead.

Name: Md Alamgir alias Alam Dakat
Description:
Nurul Absar, media officer of Rab-7 said that RAB had information that a group of 10-12 people gathered on 13th October at Gondamara union of the upazila to prepare for a robbery.
When Rab members went to the spot, the criminals opened fire on them, forcing Rab to retaliate,.After a brief gunfight, Rab members found a bullet-hit body on the spot, later identified as Alamgir. It is to be reported that no other information from another sources found to verify the aforementioned information.

Name: Al Amin
Description: Four people were shot death by police during a clash erupted centering around demeaning the Holy Quran in Comilla.Shamim's brother Ripon said that his brother was selling banana in a van. At that time due to police indiscrimate firing he was bullet shot and died in the hospital.

Name: Shamim
Description: Four people were shot death by police during a clash erupted centering around demeaning the Holy Quran in Comilla.Shamim's brother Ripon said that his brother was selling banana in a van. At that time due to police indiscrimate firing he was bullet shot and died in the hospital.

Name: Yasin Hossain
Description: Four people were shot death by police during a clash erupted centering around demeaning the Holy Quran in Comilla.Shamim's brother Ripon said that his brother was selling banana in a van. At that time due to police indiscrimate firing he was bullet shot and died in the hospital.

Name: Bablu
Description: Four people were shot death by police during a clash erupted centering around demeaning the Holy Quran in Comilla.Shamim's brother Ripon said that his brother was selling banana in a van. At that time due to police indiscrimate firing he was bullet shot and died in the hospital.

Name: Sagar
Description: Sagar was shot when he was in Hajiganj bazar. Later he died in hospital on 19th October. The police fired bullet centering unrest about disrespecting Quaran in Cumilla.

Name: Unidentified
Description: An unknown youth was shot in a gunfight with RAB-1 in Rupgangj under Narayanganj District during an operation to nab robbers. He was later taken to Rupganj Upazila Health Complex where the doctors declared him dead.

Name: Tofayel Mia
Description: Basu Dutta Chakma, Commander of RAB-9 (Sreemangal Battalion), said, "A group of people started shooting on a RAB vehicle in the morning inside the Mirtinga tea garden area."In self-defense, RAB members retaliated, leaving two of the group members injured with bullets, he added. After the "gunfight", the bullet-riddled bodies were recovered from the spot, he said, adding that they later handed the bodies over to Sreemangal police.

Name: Shahid Mia
Description: Basu Dutta Chakma, Commander of RAB-9 (Sreemangal Battalion), said, "A group of people started shooting on a RAB vehicle in the morning inside the Mirtinga tea garden area."In self-defense, RAB members retaliated, leaving two of the group members injured with bullets, he added. After the "gunfight", the bullet-riddled bodies were recovered from the spot, he said, adding that they later handed the bodies over to Sreemangal police.

Name: Mohammad Mamun
Identity: Drug smuggler; son of Abu Siddique of Meena Bazar
Description: After the gunfight, BGB team found Mamun with bullet wounds and sent him to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, the BGB official BGB Battalion-2 Commander Lt Col Mohammad Foysal Hasan Khan.said.
Sources: The Daily Star, 14 November, 2021, Prothom Alo, 15 November 2021

Name: Hamidul Haque
Location: Dakkhin Dhanghora Government Primary School centre,  Bollomjhar union, Gaibandha
Description: 11 November, Hamidul Haque received bullet shots from police when police fired rubber bullets to disperse supporters of defeated member candidate when they were tried to stop the election officials with ballot boxes and other election equipments. On 13 November bullet wounded Hamidul was succumbed to his injuries at Rangpur Medical College Hospital

Name: Jahangir Alam
Identity: Suspected drug peddler; a resident of Jamidarpara village under Balukhali union, Cox's Bazar
Location: Kakra bridge of Balukhali union under Ukhiya upazila in Coxs Bazar district
Description: Flight Lieutenant Niaz Mohammad Chapal, Senior Assistant Director (Media), RAB 7, said that RAB members raided Kakra bridge of Balukhali area on 21 November morning. At that time, a group of Yaba peddling suspects opened fire on RAB members who retaliated instantly. Later they recovered the body of the suspected drug peddler on the spot.

Name: Kefayet Ullah
Location: Hilly region of Damdamiya adjacent to the Rohingya camp in Nhilla union, reports our Cox's Bazar
Description: RAB-15 Senior Assistant Director, Additional Superintendent of Police Abu Salam Chowdhury said the "gunfight" took place in the hilly region of Damdamiya adjacent to the Rohingya camp in Nhilla union. A Rab team raided the hills after receiving information that a group of Rohingya robbers and drug traffickers were positioning there. Sensing RAB presence, drug traffickers and the criminals started firing. Rab retaliated in defence. After the firing stopped, RAB officials searched spot and rescued the Rohingya duo. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctors declared them dead. Information from other sources was known.

Name: Korban Ali alias Shafiq
Location: Hilly region of Damdamiya adjacent to the Rohingya camp in Nhilla union, reports our Cox's Bazar
Description: RAB-15 Senior Assistant Director, Additional Superintendent of Police Abu Salam Chowdhury said the "gunfight" took place in the hilly region of Damdamiya adjacent to the Rohingya camp in Nhilla union. A Rab team raided the hills after receiving information that a group of Rohingya robbers and drug traffickers were positioning there. Sensing RAB presence, drug traffickers and the criminals started firing. Rab retaliated in defence. After the firing stopped, RAB officials searched spot and rescued the Rohingya duo. They were rushed to Teknaf Upazila Health Complex where the on-duty doctors declared them dead. Information from other sources was known.

Name: Farid Mia
Location: Daierpar Government Primary School centre, Chanderkandi union, Raipura, Narsingdi
Description: After vote counting at least 50 supporters of a defeated member candidate with lethal weapons attacked on police's cars. That time police fired 16 rounds blank shot to protect government goods and ballot boxes and bring the situation under control. During the time, chase-counter chase and random bullet shots exchanges between them, leaving Arif, an autorickshaw driver shot and dead.

Name: Arif
Location: Daierpar Government Primary School centre, Chanderkandi union, Raipura, Narsingdi
Description: After vote counting at least 50 supporters of a defeated member candidate with lethal weapons attacked on police's cars. That time police fired 16 rounds blank shot to protect government goods and ballot boxes and bring the situation under control. During the time, chase-counter chase and random bullet shots exchanges between them, leaving Arif, an autorickshaw driver shot and dead.

Name: Aditya Kumar Roy
Location: Ghidhob Government Primary School polling centre at Khangaon Union in Pirganj Upazila of Thakurgaon
Description: The incident happened when supporters of independent chairman candidate Nuruzzaman vandalised the polling centre. Village Police Sagendranath Roy who was on duty at the centre said that when announcement of Khangaon UP election result was made, supporters of Nuruzzaman rushed to the centre, besieged law enforcers and polling officials, and demanded the result sheets of the UP election. After half an hour, a team of BGB members led by Pirganj Upazila Nirbahi Officer (UNO) Rezaul Islam rushed to the spot to control the situation. Nuruzzaman's supporters started vandalising of the polling station and attacked the law enforcers, said Sagendranath. Then, the BGB members opened fire, leaving three people dead.
Sources: The Daily Star and Prothom Alo, 29 November 2021

Name: Mozaharul Islam
Location: Ghidhob Government Primary School polling centre at Khangaon Union in Pirganj Upazila of Thakurgaon
Description: The incident happened when supporters of independent chairman candidate Nuruzzaman vandalised the polling centre. Village Police Sagendranath Roy who was on duty at the centre said that when announcement of Khangaon UP election result was made, supporters of Nuruzzaman rushed to the centre, besieged law enforcers and polling officials, and demanded the result sheets of the UP election. After half an hour, a team of BGB members led by Pirganj Upazila Nirbahi Officer (UNO) Rezaul Islam rushed to the spot to control the situation. Nuruzzaman's supporters started vandalising of the polling station and attacked the law enforcers, said Sagendranath. Then, the BGB members opened fire, leaving three people dead.
Sources: The Daily Star and Prothom Alo, 29 November 2021

Name: Mohammad Shahaboli
Location: Ghidhob Government Primary School polling centre at Khangaon Union in Pirganj Upazila of Thakurgaon
Description: The incident happened when supporters of independent chairman candidate Nuruzzaman vandalised the polling centre. Village Police Sagendranath Roy who was on duty at the centre said that when announcement of Khangaon UP election result was made, supporters of Nuruzzaman rushed to the centre, besieged law enforcers and polling officials, and demanded the result sheets of the UP election. After half an hour, a team of BGB members led by Pirganj Upazila Nirbahi Officer (UNO) Rezaul Islam rushed to the spot to control the situation. Nuruzzaman's supporters started vandalising of the polling station and attacked the law enforcers, said Sagendranath. Then, the BGB members opened fire, leaving three people dead.
Sources: The Daily Star and Prothom Alo, 29 November 2021

Name: Md Sabbir Hossain
Identity: Third accused of Cumilla Councillor murder
Description: Two accused of the murder of Cumilla ward councillor Syed Mohammad Sohel and his aide, were killed in a reported gunfight in the city with law enforcers on 30th November  2021.Kamal Krishna Das, inspector (Investigation) of Cumilla's Kotwali Police Station, said that several teams of Detective Branch and Kotwali Model Police Station conducted a raid in Shangraish and Nabagram areas around 12:15am based on a tip-off. "The accused started firing at the law enforcers as they reached Shangraish Beribadh area, forcing retaliation," the police official claimed adding that once the firing stopped, police recovered the bullet-hit bodies of Sabbir and Sajon from the spot.

Name: Sajon
Identity: Fifth accused of Cumilla Councillor murder
Description: Two accused of the murder of Cumilla ward councillor Syed Mohammad Sohel and his aide, were killed in a reported gunfight in the city with law enforcers on 30th November  2021.Kamal Krishna Das, inspector (Investigation) of Cumilla's Kotwali Police Station, said that several teams of Detective Branch and Kotwali Model Police Station conducted a raid in Shangraish and Nabagram areas around 12:15am based on a tip-off. "The accused started firing at the law enforcers as they reached Shangraish Beribadh area, forcing retaliation," the police official claimed adding that once the firing stopped, police recovered the bullet-hit bodies of Sabbir and Sajon from the spot.

Name: Tajul Islam
Description: Tajul was allegedly tortured to death. After the news spread that a man was tortured to death by police, a mob reportedly threw brickbats at Haragach Police Station and vandalised a few police vehicles on 01 November 2021.The High Court on November 03  sought a probe report on the alleged custodial death of Tajul Islam in Rangpur, as a four-member committee has been formed by the police administration in order to conduct an inquiry into the incident.

Name: Sujan Saha
Identity: Used to work in a clothing store in Shekherchar area of Narsingdi.
Description: His family alleged that he was beaten to death and thrown into the river. The body of a youth in handcuffs was found floating in the Haridoa river of Narsingdi Sadar upazila on 09 November, hours after his arrest. Sujan's sister Pinky Saha said police arrested her brother from Brahmandi area of the district town and took him to Hajipur area. There, police asked the workers of a factory to beat him and then police threw him into the river.

Name: Mohammad Sabbir Hossain
Identity: Both accused in a case filed over the murder of then councillor Syed Mohammad Sohel
Description: Mohammad Sabbir Hossain, 28, and Sajon, 32, both accused in a case filed over the murder of then councillor Syed Mohammad Sohel.Sabbir and Sujon had been on the run ever since the slain councillor's brother filed the case..On information, police conducted a raid in Cumilla city's Shangraish and Nabagram areas around 12:15am, he further added.Kamal Krishna Das, inspector (investigation) of the police station, claimed, "A group of criminals opened fire on police as they reached Shangraish Beribadh area around 12:45am, forcing the policemen to retaliate."Once the firing stopped, police found two bullet-hit bodies on the spot. The law enforcers also recovered guns and ammunition from the spot."

Name: Sajon
Identity: Both accused in a case filed over the murder of then councillor Syed Mohammad Sohel
Description: Mohammad Sabbir Hossain, 28, and Sajon, 32, both accused in a case filed over the murder of then councillor Syed Mohammad Sohel.Sabbir and Sujon had been on the run ever since the slain councillor's brother filed the case..On information, police conducted a raid in Cumilla city's Shangraish and Nabagram areas around 12:15am, he further added.Kamal Krishna Das, inspector (investigation) of the police station, claimed, "A group of criminals opened fire on police as they reached Shangraish Beribadh area around 12:45am, forcing the policemen to retaliate."Once the firing stopped, police found two bullet-hit bodies on the spot. The law enforcers also recovered guns and ammunition from the spot."

Name: Shah Alam
Identity: The prime accused in the Cumilla ward councillor Syed Mohammad Sohel murder case; son of Janu Mia
Description: According to police,, acting on a tip-off, a local police team along with some detectives conducted a raid in Chanpur Ratnabati Gumti Beribadh area of Sadar upazila at about 1:30am, said Anwarul Azim, officer-in-charge of Kotwali model police station. Spotting the cops, Alam and his accomplices opened fire, forcing the cops to retaliate. Alam sustained bullet wounds in the exchange of fire, while the others managed to escape. Alam was rushed to Cumilla Medical College Hospital, where doctors declared him dead on arrival, police said.. However no information from the family was reported.

Name: Unidentidied
Location: Kukri Mukri of Chaar fashion, Bhola
Description: Two suspected pirates were killed in a reported gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion at Char Kukri Mukri of Charfashion upazila in Bhola. A team of RAB conducted a drive at Jalia canal in the morning on information that a group of pirates had taken position there, said Dakkhin Aicha Police Station inspector (investigation) Milon Kumar Gosh.Sensing the presence of RAB members, pirates opened fire forcing RAB personnel to retaliate by shooting back, the officer said. When the suspects retreated, two of them were found dead on the spot. However no information from the family was reported.

Name: Unidentidied
Location: Kukri Mukri of Chaar fashion, Bhola
Description: Two suspected pirates were killed in a reported gunfight with members of the Rapid Action Battalion at Char Kukri Mukri of Charfashion upazila in Bhola. A team of RAB conducted a drive at Jalia canal in the morning on information that a group of pirates had taken position there, said Dakkhin Aicha Police Station inspector (investigation) Milon Kumar Gosh.Sensing the presence of RAB members, pirates opened fire forcing RAB personnel to retaliate by shooting back, the officer said. When the suspects retreated, two of them were found dead on the spot. However no information from the family was reported.

Name: Unidentidied
Description: The gunfight took place around 4:00am when a team of Rab carried out a raid after a tip-off that a group of robbers gathered at Purba Boro Bhewla area, said Maj Sheikh Yusuf Ahmed, a company commander of Rab-15. The robbers opened fire at the Rab men, who retaliated, leaving two of them with bullet wounds, he claimed adding others managed to flee. The injured were taken to Chakaria Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead. However, no information from the family was reported.

Name: Babul Das
Description: The gunfight took place around 4:00am when a team of Rab carried out a raid after a tip-off that a group of robbers gathered at Purba Boro Bhewla area, said Maj Sheikh Yusuf Ahmed, a company commander of Rab-15. The robbers opened fire at the Rab men, who retaliated, leaving two of them with bullet wounds, he claimed adding others managed to flee. The injured were taken to Chakaria Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared them dead. However, no information from the family was reported.

Name: Unidentidied
Description: According to RAB-8, a team of RAB-8 took position on the bank of the Bishkhali River in Badurtola area at about 2:00am. Sensing the presence of law enforcers, the robbers opened fire at the RAB members forcing them to fire back that triggered a gunfight.After the gunfight, RAB found a robber lying on the ground with bullet wounds. Later, police went to the spot and sent the injured robber to Patharghata Upazila Health Complex where doctors declared him dead, said Abul Bashar, officer-in-charge of the Patharghata police station.

Name: Babul Sarder
Description: Police said he committed suicide, however his family claimed he was tortured to death under the custody of the DB police. His daughter Munni said he was completely healthy and police started beating him.

Name: Porag Ali
Description: Porag Ali (22), shot in BGB firing on 28 November during an election violence and he was succumbed to his injuries on 1 December while under treatment at Thakurgaon Sadar Hospital.

Name: Hamidul Islam
Description: During vote counting two groups were involved in clashes and then police used bullet instead of unleathel weapen, which caused  Hamidul Islam dead.

Name: Abdul Khalek
Description: Abdul Khalek wad shot dead when police fire during a clash at Char Montaj Union during the 4th stage of UP election. His family demanded justice

Name: Abdus Salam
Description: According to local people, the supporters of independent chairman candidate Emran Hossain blocked Sylhet-Zakiganj road in Boitikar Bazar over the poll results of two centers in wards 8 and 9 in Fulbari Union at 8:00pm..A clash ensued between the villagers and police when police tried to disperse the supporters of Emran Hossain, forcing police to open fire, they said..Abdus Salam, who suffered bullet injures during the clash, was taken to MAG Osmani Medical College and Hospital where doctors declared him dead.

Name: Kulsum Begum
Location: Kalaihata High School Polling Centre of   Gabtoli of Bagura
Description: They were killed by BGB firing during vote counting  at Gabtali of Bogra . The supporters of Awami League ( candidate Yunus) resist vote counting caused  clash between police and BGB.  Then BGB opened fire , which caused 4 people dead

Name: Khorshed Ali
Location: Kalaihata High School Polling Centre of   Gabtoli of Bagura
Description: They were killed by BGB firing during vote counting  at Gabtali of Bogra . The supporters of Awami League ( candidate Yunus) resist vote counting caused  clash between police and BGB.  Then BGB opened fire , which caused 4 people dead

Name: Abdur Rashid Pramanik
Location: Kalaihata High School Polling Centre of   Gabtoli of Bagura
Description: They were killed by BGB firing during vote counting  at Gabtali of Bogra . The supporters of Awami League ( candidate Yunus) resist vote counting caused  clash between police and BGB.  Then BGB opened fire , which caused 4 people dead

Name: Alamgir
Location: Kalaihata High School Polling Centre of   Gabtoli of Bagura
Description: They were killed by BGB firing during vote counting  at Gabtali of Bogra . The supporters of Awami League ( candidate Yunus) resist vote counting caused  clash between police and BGB.  Then BGB opened fire , which caused 4 people dead

Name: Asad Sheikh
Identity: Mechanic and worked in a vehicle repair shop; a resident of Ershadngar area in Tongi
Description: His family alleged that RAB members tortured Asad to death in custody. RAB officials arrested Asad in his house on 01 January and took to RAB custody in the afternoon. RAB said a scuffle broke out among Asad and RAB members as he tried to flee.Tongi East Police Station sub-inspector Sajal prepared the inquest report.He said that there were marks of wounds at Asads right knee and left part of chest.

Name: Himangshu Chandra
Description: Himangshurs father Biswasar Roy alleged that the police tortured his son to death in custody.Hatibandha police officer-in-charge Ershadul Alam said Himangshu tried to commit suicide when he was kept in a room after interrogation. When he was taken to the hospital, the doctor declared him dead.

Name: Wazir Mia
Description: Grieving family members said he died because police tortured him at Shantiganj Police Station after arresting him in the early hours of February 10.His brother Dalim Mia said, "He was severely tortured. He was released on bail the next day, but fell ill. We took him to the hospital in critical conditionVillagers later blocked Sunamganj-Sylhet road at Pagla Bazar for three hours, demanding justice for Wazir.Superintendent of Police in Sunamganj Mizanur Rahman said there will be an autopsy and actions will be taken if evidence of torture is found. He was arrested allegledly for  stealing. SI of police , Debasish Sutradhar has been transferred due to this incidence.
Sources: The Daiily Star, 22.02.22; Jugantor 22.02.22 Prothom Alo,, 23.02.22

Name: Jahirul Hawlader
Description: His family claimed that he was tortured to death by police. His elder brother  Ali Akbar said that  his brother was not involved in  murder, however PBI arrested him and beaten him up severely, 4/5 days  before his death he was forcefully injected  in the jail. HIs family beleived he was tortured to death

Name: Mohammad Sahed Hossain
Description: Shahed, an undertrial prisoner was arrested from Raipur of Laxmipur. Police demanded  taka two lac as bribe to release him, unless police said they ptoduce him to court of a drug case. But his family said they cant pay more than taka 45 thousand. As the family can't pay as per demand by police,  he was severely beaten in police  custody. Later he was sent in Laxmipur District jail, but died there. He was arrested on 6 March 2022.

Name: Amir Hossain
Description: Amir Hossain, a fisherman of Bandarpur Prokash-Kutubpur in Bhola Sadar upazila  was killed when police opened fire during a clash with fishermen in the Meghna River at Sadar upazila of Lakshmipur .Shotgun pellets were found in his head and back, said DMC morgue source.

Name: Rabiul Islam
Description: Rabiul Islam was picked up by the police from a Pahela Baishakh fair at Mahendranagar Bangla Bazar under Sadar upaziula in Lalmonirhat district , allegedly died by  police  torture while in  custody.Robiul and another man were arrested by the police on charges of gambling at a fair in the Mahendranagar Bangla Bazar area on the occasion of Pahela Boishakh, according to his family members.Robiul had an altercation with some cops while being dragged into a police van as he insisted that he was innocent, they claimed.He was badly beaten up by the cops for refusing to enter the police van. He had sustained injuries, which eventually led to his death, said a family member of the deceased.The two people were arrested by a police team from the fair on tip-off. But Robiul fell sick on the way to the local police station and he was soon rushed to Sadar Hospital. He died while being shifted to Rangpur Medical College and Hospital, he said.As the news of the death spread, the agitated locals blocked the Lalmonirhat-Rangpur highway in the early hours of 15 April and demanded the punishment of a sub-Inspector of Sadar police station.Sub-inspector Halimur Rahman of Lalmonirhat Sadar Police Station was closed following allegations of Rabiul's death due to torture in custody.

Name: Mohammad Raju
Identity: The prime accused in a journalist murder case; son of Sadek Mia of village Bishnupur
Description: Raju was killed in a gunfight with Rapid Action Battalion in the Golabari area of Burichang upazila in Cumilla.Local police claimed that he was involved in drug peddling and smuggling and was the prime accused in the murder case of journalist Mohiuddin Sarkar Naeem.This is the first death in a reported gunfight with RAB since the United States slapped sanctions on the force and seven of its current and former officials on December 10, 2021

Name: Kawsar
Description: He was killed in "gunfight" by RAB.Razu Ahmed, the only son of Kawser and a second year HSC student, said his father visited them after seven months. "No matter what, nobody wants such death of their dear ones. My mother broke down heavily as it's hard to accept such a demise."

Name: Najir Ahmed
Description: Najir Ahmed was allegedly tortured to death in police custody in Brahmanbaria, his family complained..Police denied the allegation and claimed that he died of a heart attack.Victims brother Hossain Ahmed Tafsir said that his younger brother Najir bought a house in the area.
